translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rajagriha on the Vulture Peak mountain together with a great assembly of twelve hundred monks, all of them arhats whose defilements were exhausted, who were free from defilements, who had attained self-mastery, whose minds were well liberated, whose wisdom was well liberated, who were great elephants, who had done their duties, who had accomplished their tasks, who had cast off the burden, who had attained their own welfare, who had severed the bonds of existence, whose minds were well liberated by right knowledge, who had attained the utmost perfection of all mental control, and who were great disciples with higher knowledge.

translated: Namely, the Venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya, the Venerable Asvajit, the Venerable Bāṣpa, the Venerable Mahāstaṃpṛṣṭha, the Venerable Bhadrika, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa, the Venerable Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, the Venerable Gayā-Kāśyapa, the Venerable Śāriputra, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Venerable Mahākātyāyana, the Venerable Aniruddha, the Venerable Revata, the Venerable Kaṃthaka, the Venerable Gavāṃpati, the Venerable Pilindavatsa, the Venerable Bakkula, the Venerable Mahākoṣṭhila, the Venerable Bharadvāja, the Venerable Mahānanda, the Venerable Upananda, the Venerable Sundarananda, the Venerable Pūrṇa, the Venerable Subhūti, and the Venerable Rāhula.

analyzed: evam pramukhaiḥ ca anekaiḥ mahā śrākaiḥ āyuṣmatā ca ānandena śaikṣeṇa

analyzed: anyābhyām bhikṣu sahasrābhyām śaikṣa aśaikṣābhyām

analyzed: mahāprajāpatī pramukhaiḥ ca ṣaṣ bhikṣuṇī sahasraiḥ
translated: and with six thousand nuns headed by Mahāprajāpatī,

original: yaśodharayā ca bhikṣuṇyā rāhulamātrā saparivārayā /🔽aśītibhiśca bodhisattvasahasraiḥ sarvairavaivartikairekajātipratibaddhairyadutānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃboddhau dhāraṇīpratilabdhairmahāpratibhānapratiṣṭhitairavaivartyadharmacakrapravartakairbahubuddhaśatasahasraparyupāsitair
analyzed: yaśodharayā ca bhikṣuṇyā rāhula mātrā sa parivārayā  aśītibhiḥ ca bodhisattva sahasraiḥ sarvaiḥ avaivartikaiḥ eka jāti pratibaddhaiḥ yat uta anuttarāyām samyaksaṃboddhau dhāraṇī pratilabdhaiḥ mahā pratibhāna pratiṣṭhitaiḥ avaivartya dharmacakra pravartakaiḥ bahu buddha śata sahasra paryupāsitaiḥ
translated: and with the nun Yaśodharā, the mother of Rāhula, together with her retinue,🔽and with eighty thousand bodhisattvas, all of whom were irreversible, bound to one birth, namely to the highest complete enlightenment, who had attained the dhāraṇīs, were established in great eloquence, had turned the irreversible wheel of the Dharma, had attended many hundreds of thousands of buddhas,

analyzed: bahu buddha śata sahasra avaropita kuśala mūlaiḥ bahu buddha śata sahasra saṃstutaiḥ maitrī paribhāvita kāya cittaiḥ tathāgata jñāna avatāraṇa kuśalaiḥ mahā prajñaiḥ prajñāpāramitā gatiṃgataiḥ bahu lokadhātu śata sahasra viśrutaiḥ bahu prāṇa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra saṃpālakaiḥ
translated: had planted roots of merit under many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, had been praised by many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, had cultivated loving-kindness with their bodies and minds, were skilled in introducing the knowledge of the Tathāgatas, had great wisdom, had reached the perfection of wisdom, were renowned in many hundreds of thousands of world systems, and were the protectors of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings.

original: tadyathā / mañjuśriyā ca kumārabhūtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena avalokiteśvareṇa ca mahāsthāmaprāptena ca sarvārthanāmnā ca nityodyuktena ca anikṣiptadhureṇa ca ratnapāṇinā ca bhaiṣajyarājena ca bhaiṣajyasamudgatena ca vyūharājena ca pradānaśūreṇa ca ratnacandreṇa ca pūrṇacandreṇa ca mahāvikramiṇā ca anantavikramiṇā ca trailokyavikramiṇā ca mahāpratibhānena ca satatasamitābhiyuktena ca dharaṇiṃdhareṇa ca akṣayamatinā ca mahāmatinā ca śāntamatinā ca nakṣatrarājena ca ratnavairocanena ca maitreyeṇa ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena siṃhena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bhadrapālapūrvaṃgamaiśca ṣoḍaśabhiḥ satpuruṣaiḥ sārdhaṃ /

translated: namely, with the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Manjushri Kumara, with Avalokiteshvara, with Mahastamaprapta, with Sarvarthanam, with Nityodyukta, with Anikshiptadhura, with Ratnapāni, with Bhaisajyarāja, with Bhaisajyasamudgata, with Vyuharāja, with Pradānasūra, with Ratnacandra, with Pūrṇacandra, with Mahavikramin, with Anantakramin, with Trailokyavikramin, with Mahapratibhan, with Satatasamitābhiyukta, with Dharanidhara, with Akṣayamati, with Mahamati, with Śāntamati, with Nakṣatrarāja, with Ratnavairocana, with Maitreya, and with the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Siṃha, together with the sixteen good men headed by Bhadrapāla.

original: tadyathā / bhadrapālena ca ratnākareṇa ca susārthavāhena ca naradattena ca guhaguptena ca varuṇadattena ca indradattena ca uttaramatinā ca viśeṣamatinā ca vardhamānamatinā ca amoghadarśinā ca susaṃprasthitena ca suvikrāntavikramiṇā ca anupamamatinā ca sūryagarbheṇa ca dharaṇiṃdhareṇa ca /
analyzed: tat yathā bhadrapālena ca ratnākareṇa ca susārthavāhena ca naradattena ca guhaguptena ca varuṇadattena ca indradattena ca uttaramatinā ca viśeṣamatinā ca vardhamānamatinā ca amoghadarśinā ca susaṃprasthitena ca suvikrāntavikramiṇā ca anupamamatinā ca sūryagarbheṇa ca dharaṇiṃdhareṇa ca
translated: Namely, Bhadrapāla, Ratnākara, Susārthavāha, Naradatta, Guhagupta, Varuṇadatta, Indradatta, Uttamati, Viśeṣamati, Vardhamānamati, Amoghadarśin, Susamprasthita, Suvikrāntavikrāmin, Anupamamati, Sūryagarbha, and Dharaṇīdhara.

analyzed: evam pramukhaiḥ aśītibhiḥ bodhisattva sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: With these and other eighty thousand leading bodhisattvas.

analyzed: śakreṇa ca devānām indreṇa viṃśati devaputra sahasra parivāreṇa
translated: And with Śakra, Lord of the Gods, surrounded by a retinue of twenty thousand gods.

original: tadyathā / candreṇa ca devaputreṇa sūryeṇa ca samantagandhena ca ratnaprabheṇa ca avabhāsaprabheṇa ca /
analyzed: tat yathā candreṇa ca devaputreṇa sūryeṇa ca samantagandhena ca ratnaprabheṇa ca avabhāsaprabheṇa ca
translated: Namely, the gods Candra, Sūrya, Samantagandha, Ratnaprabha, Avabhāsaprabha,

analyzed: evam pramukhaiḥ ca anyaiḥ deva putraiḥ
translated: And with these and other leading gods.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca mahārājaiḥ sārdham sa parivāraiḥ
translated: And with the four great kings, together with their retinues.

original: brahmaṇā ca sahāpatinā sārdhaṃ dvādaśabrahmakāyikāsahasreṇa śikhinā ca brahmaṇā jyotiḥprabheṇa ca brahmanā /

translated: And with Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, together with twelve thousand gods from the Brahmakāyika realm, and with the Brahmās Śikhin, Jyotiṣprabha, and Brahmā.

analyzed: evam pramukhaiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ ca brahmakāyika devaputra sahasraiḥ
translated: In the same way, with twelve thousand foremost Brahmakayika gods,

analyzed: aṣṭābhiḥ ca nāga rājaiḥ sārdham bahu nāga koṭī śata sahasra parivāraiḥ
translated: with eight Naga kings, together with retinues of many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of Nāgas,

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca kinnara rājaiḥ sārdham bahu kinnara koṭī śata sahasra parivāraiḥ
translated: with four Kinnara kings, together with retinues of many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of Kinnaras,

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca gandharva kāyikaiḥ devaputraiḥ sārdham bahu gandharva śata sahasra parivāraiḥ
translated: with four Gandharva gods, together with retinues of many hundreds of thousands of Gandharvas,

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca asura indraiḥ sārdham bahu asura koṭī śata sahasra parivāraiḥ
translated: with four Asura kings, together with retinues of many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of Asuras,

analyzed: caturbhiḥ ca garuḍa indraiḥ sārdham bahu garuḍa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra parivāraiḥ
translated: with four Garuḍa kings, together with retinues of many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of Garuḍas,

analyzed: rājñā ca ajātaśatruṇā māgadhena vaidehī putreṇa sārdham bahu manuṣya rāja sa amātya paura jānapada parivāraiḥ
translated: and with King Ajātaśatru of Magadha, the son of Vaidehī, together with a retinue of many human kings, ministers, citizens, and country people.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bhagavāṃścatasṛbhiḥ parṣadbhiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito'rcito'pacāyitaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bhagavān catasṛbhiḥ parṣadbhiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjita ūrcita upacāyitaḥ
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was surrounded and revered by the four assemblies, honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and praised.

original: tadā bodhisattvaviṣayasaṃdarśanapraṇidhānavyūhasamādhiviṣayadhāraṇīmukhavyūhaṃ samādhānamukhanirdeśaṃ caryāvaiśāradyaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ sūtrāntaṃ mahāvaipulyaṃ bodhisattvānugataṃ sarvabuddhaparigrahaṃ bhāṣitumārabdhavān /
analyzed: tadā bodhisattva viṣaya saṃdarśana praṇidhāna vyūha samādhi viṣaya dhāraṇī mukha vyūham samādhāna mukha nirdeśam caryā vaiśāradyam nāma dharmaparyāyam sūtrāntam mahā vaipulyam bodhisattva anugatam sarva buddha parigraham bhāṣitum ārabdhavān
translated: Then he began to teach the Dharma discourse called The Dharma Discourse on the Bodhisattva's Domain, the Display of Vows, the Display of the Doorway of Dhāraṇīs in the Domain of Samādhi, the Doorway of Instructions in Samādhi, and the Fearlessness of Conduct, a sūtra, a great vaipulya, followed by bodhisattvas, accepted by all buddhas.

original: tadā nānāvarṇaraśmayo niścaritā yatprabhābhirayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhāturmahatāvabhāsena sphuṭo'bhūt /🔽tena cāvabhāsena lokāntarikā aghā aghasphuṭā andhakāratamisrāḥ /
analyzed: tadā nānā varṇa raśmayaḥ niścaritāḥ yad prabhābhiḥ ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ mahatā avabhāsena sphuṭaḥ abhūt  tena ca avabhāsena loka āntarikāḥ aghāḥ agha sphuṭāḥ andhakāra tamisrāḥ
translated: At that time, various colored light rays emerged, and the trichiliocosm was filled with a great light.🔽By that light, the dark and extremely dark regions between worlds, where even these two, the moon and sun of great power, great influence, and great authority, do not reach or shine, were illuminated.

original: yatremau candrasūryau eva maharddhikau mahānubhāvau maheśākhyau nābhipatato na virocatastatra ye sattvā upapannāste svakasvakamapi bāhuprasāritaṃ na paśyanti sma /
analyzed: yatra imau candra sūryau eva maharddhikau mahā anubhāvau maheśākhyau na abhipatataḥ na virocataḥ tatra ye sattvāḥ upapannāḥ te svaka svakam api bāhu prasāritam na paśyanti sma
translated: Even there, the beings who were born there, not seeing even the outstretched arm of their own body,

original: tatrāpi tenāvabhāsena parisphuṭāḥ samānā anyonyaṃ paśyanti smānyonyaṃ saṃjānante sma /
analyzed: tatra api tena avabhāsena parisphuṭāḥ samānāḥ anyonyam paśyanti sma anyonyam saṃjānante sma
translated: were completely illuminated by that light, and seeing each other, they recognized each other.

original: sarvāṇi buddhakṣetrāṇi ca parisphuṭāni saṃdṛśyante sma yāvad avīcirmahānirayo yāvadbrahmalokaṃ parisphuṭaṃ dṛśyate sma /
analyzed: sarvāṇi buddhakṣetrāṇi ca parisphuṭāni saṃdṛśyante sma yāvat avīciḥ mahānirayaḥ yāvat brahmalokam parisphuṭam dṛśyate sma
translated: All the buddha-fields were seen to be completely illuminated, from the great Avīci hell up to the peak of existence.

original: ye ca teṣu sarveṣu kṣetreṣu ṣaṭsu gatiṣu sattvāste sarve saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu sarveṣu kṣetreṣu ṣaṭsu gatiṣu sattvāḥ te sarve saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: All the beings in all those six realms in all those buddha-fields were seen.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanto dhriyanto yāpayanto yaṃ dharmaṃ bhāṣante sma sa ca sarvo nikhilena śrūyate sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ dhriyantaḥ yāpayantaḥ yam dharmam bhāṣante sma sa ca sarvaḥ nikhilena śrūyate sma
translated: And all the Dharma that the Blessed Buddhas in those buddha-fields were teaching, while abiding and remaining, was heard completely.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā yogino yogācārāḥ prāptaphalāścāprāptaphalāśca te'pi sarve saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ yoginaḥ yoga ācārāḥ prāpta phalāḥ ca a prāpta phalāḥ ca te api sarve saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: All the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, yogis, and practitioners in those buddha-fields, whether they had attained the fruits or not, were seen.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anekavividhāśravaṇārambaṇādhimuktihetukāraṇopāyakauśalyairbodhicaryācāriṇaste'pi sarve saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ aneka vividha ā śravaṇa ārambaṇa adhimukti hetu kāraṇa upāya kauśalyaiḥ bodhi caryā cāriṇaḥ te api sarve saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: All the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in those buddha-fields who were practicing the conduct of awakening through various kinds of hearing, mental supports, and motivations, skillful means, and causes were seen.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhā bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāste'pi sarve saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāḥ te api sarve saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And all the Blessed Buddhas who had attained final nirvāṇa in those buddha-fields were seen.

original: ye ca teṣu parinirvṛtānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ ratnamayadhātustūpāste'pi sarve saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu parinirvṛtānām buddhānām bhagavatām ratna maya dhātu stūpāḥ te api sarve saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And all the stūpas made of precious materials for the buddhas who had passed into parinirvāṇa were seen.

analyzed: antarīkṣāt ca puṣpa varṣam abhiprāvarṣat
translated: And a rain of flowers fell from the sky.

analyzed: manojña śabdāḥ amāradundubhyaḥ prasasvanuḥ
translated: And the drums of the gods sounded with a pleasant sound.

original: sarvaścāyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāram aṣṭādaśamahānimittam akampat prākampat saṃprākampat /
analyzed: sarvaḥ ca ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram aṣṭādaśa mahā nimittam akampat prākampat saṃprākampat
translated: And this entire world realm of a billion worlds shook in six ways, trembled, quivered, and shook violently in eighteen ways.

original: avedhat prāvedhat saṃprāvedhat /🔽acalat prācalat saṃprācalat /🔽akṣubhyat prākṣubhyat saṃprākṣubhyat /
analyzed: avedhat prāvedhat saṃprāvedhat  acalat prācalat saṃprācalat  akṣubhyat prākṣubhyat saṃprākṣubhyat
translated: It quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.🔽It trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.

analyzed: araṇat prāraṇat saṃprāraṇat
translated: It quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely.🔽It shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely.

analyzed: agarjat prāgarjat saṃprāgarjat
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.

original: tasmin kṣaṇe sarvato lokeṣu harṣaṇīyāstoṣaṇīyāḥ prasādanīyā avalokanīyāḥ prahlādanīyā manojñāḥ śabdāḥ śrūyante sma /
analyzed: tasmin kṣaṇe sarvatas lokeṣu harṣaṇīyāḥ toṣaṇīyāḥ prasādanīyāḥ avalokanīyāḥ prahlādanīyāḥ manojñāḥ śabdāḥ śrūyante sma
translated: At that moment, in all the worlds, pleasant, delightful, inspiring, captivating, delightful, and charming sounds were heard.

original: na ca kasyacit sattvasya viheṭhā vā trāso vā bhayaṃ vā stambhitatvaṃ vā /
analyzed: na ca kasyacid sattvasya viheṭhā vā trāsaḥ vā bhayam vā stambhita tvam vā
translated: And no being was harmed, frightened, afraid, or paralyzed.

analyzed: na ca anya deva lokānām prabhāḥ prajñāyante
translated: And the light of the other gods' worlds was not perceived.

analyzed: sarva naraka tiryagyoni yama loka upapannāḥ sattvāḥ vigata duḥkhāḥ sarva sukha samarpitāḥ ca abhuvān
translated: All beings born in the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama, were free from suffering and endowed with all happiness.

original: na ca kasyacit sattvasya rāgo vā dveṣo vā moho vā mātsaryo vā īrṣyā vā māno vā mrakṣo vā mado vā krodho vā vyāpādo vā paridāho vā bādhate /
analyzed: na ca kasyacid sattvasya rāgaḥ vā dveṣaḥ vā mohaḥ vā mātsaryaḥ vā īrṣyā vā mānaḥ vā mrakṣaḥ vā madaḥ vā krodhaḥ vā vyāpādaḥ vā paridāhaḥ vā bādhate
translated: And for no being was there any affliction of passion, hatred, delusion, stinginess, envy, pride, conceit, anger, malice, or distress.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca paraspara mitra cittāḥ hita cittāḥ mātṛ pitṛ saṃjñinaḥ bhūvan
translated: And all beings became friends to each other, with thoughts of benefit and the perception of mother and father.

original: atha ratnavairocano nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ mahānimittaprātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā sahasotthāyaikāṃśamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇajānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat /
analyzed: atha ratnavairocanaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam mahā nimitta prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā sahasā utthāya eka aṃśam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇa jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Ratnārcis, having seen that great miraculous sign, suddenly rose, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms in the direction of the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: parama āścarya adbhuta prāptā uham bhagavan
translated: Blessed One, I have attained the highest wonder and marvel.

analyzed: kutas ime raśmayaḥ āgatāḥ
translated: From where have these light rays come?

analyzed: kasya eṣa prabhāvaḥ
translated: Whose power is this?

analyzed: kaḥ nu atra bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause here?

analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: What will be the condition?

original: atha khalu bhagavān ratnavairocanaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat śṛṇu kulaputra sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣye'haṃ te /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān ratnavairocanam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat śṛṇu kula putra sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣya iham te
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnasaṃbhava, Listen, son of noble family, and keep it well in mind. I will tell you.

original: sādhu sādhu bhagavan niti ratnavairocano bhagavataḥ pratyaśroṣīt /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhagavat niti ratnavairocanaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśroṣīt
translated: Very well, Blessed One, Ratnasaṃbhava replied to the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān ratnavairocanam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ratnasaṃbhava,

analyzed: asti kula putra pūrvadakṣiṇasyām diśi
translated: Son of noble family, there is, in the southeast direction,

original: ito buddhakṣetrakoṭīśatasahasragaṅgānadīvālukāsamān buddhakṣetrān atikramya padmā nāma lokadhāturnānāguṇavibhūṣitā nānāpuṣpasamīritā nānāgandhaiśca sphuṭā ratnavṛkṣairalaṅkṛtā ratnaparvatairākīrṇā /
analyzed: itas buddhakṣetra koṭī śata sahasra gaṅgā nadī vālukā samān buddhakṣetrān atikramya padmā nāma lokadhātuḥ nānā guṇa vibhūṣitā nānā puṣpa samīritā nānā gandhaiḥ ca sphuṭā ratna vṛkṣaiḥ alaṅkṛtā ratna parvataiḥ ākīrṇā
translated: beyond a hundred thousand koṭis of buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, a world-system called Padma, adorned with various qualities, perfumed with various flowers, filled with various fragrances, adorned with jeweled trees, and strewn with jeweled mountains.

analyzed: nīla vaiḍūrya mayī tatra bhūmiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ ākīrṇā dharma śabdena sphuṭā
translated: The ground there is made of blue lapis lazuli, covered with bodhisattvas, and filled with the sound of the Dharma.

analyzed: sā ca punar vaiḍūrya mayī bhūmiḥ mṛdu kācalindika sukha saṃsparśa
translated: Moreover, that ground made of lapis lazuli is soft, like kācalindika cloth to the touch.

analyzed: nikṣipte ca caraṇe catur aṅgulam avanamati
translated: When one places one's foot on it, it sinks down four finger-widths,

analyzed: utkṣipte ca caraṇe catur aṅgulam unnamati
translated: And when a foot is lifted, it rises four inches.

analyzed: nānā padmaiḥ ca ākīrṇā
translated: And it is strewn with various lotuses.

analyzed: tatra ca sapta ratna mayāḥ vṛkṣāḥ sapta yojanāni ucca tvena
translated: And there are trees made of the seven precious substances, seven yojanas high.

analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣeṣu divya kāṣāya vastrāṇi pralambante
translated: And on those trees hang divine robes of fine cloth.

analyzed: divyāni ca vādyāni manojñāni saṃpravādyante
translated: And divine musical instruments sound pleasantly.

original: teṣu ca vṛkṣeṣu nānāśakuntā indriyabalabodhyaṅgamanojñāṃ śabdāṃ pravyāharanti /
analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣeṣu nānā śakuntāḥ indriya bala bodhyaṅga manojñām śabdām pravyāharanti
translated: And on those trees various birds utter the pleasant sounds of the faculties, powers, and factors of awakening.

original: teṣāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ patrāṇi parasparaṃ spṛśya divyātikrāntaṃ pañcāṅgikatūryaśabdaṃ niścārayanti /
analyzed: teṣām vṛkṣāṇām patrāṇi parasparam spṛśya divya atikrāntam pañcāṅgika tūrya śabdam niścārayanti
translated: The leaves of those trees touch each other and emit a sound surpassing the divine, the sound of the five-part orchestra.

original: ekaikasya ca vṛkṣasya divyātikrāntenodāreṇa gandhena yojanasahasraṃ sphurati /
analyzed: ekaikasya ca vṛkṣasya divya atikrāntena udāreṇa gandhena yojana sahasram sphurati
translated: The scent of each tree, surpassing the divine, spreads for a thousand yojanas.

analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣeṣu divyāni alaṅkārāṇi abhipralambante sma
translated: And on those trees hang divine ornaments.

analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣa antareṣu sapta ratna mayāḥ kūṭāgārāḥ
translated: And between those trees are towers made of the seven precious substances,

analyzed: pañca yojana śatam ucca tvena sa pāda śata yojanam vistāreṇa
translated: five hundred yojanas high and one hundred and twenty-five yojanas wide.

analyzed: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu samantāt caturdiśam toraṇāḥ
translated: And in those towers, all around in the four directions, there are arches,

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca toraṇa agrebhyaḥ bahirdhā kūṭāgārebhyaḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ
translated: And outside the archways, in the pavilions, there are lotus ponds,

original: aśītiyojanāni dīrghatvena pañcāśadyojanāni vistāreṇa /🔽tābhyaśca puṣkariṇībhyaḥ samantāccaturdiśaṃ sopānāḥ saptaratnamayāḥ /
analyzed: aśīti yojanāni dīrgha tvena pañcāśat yojanāni vistāreṇa  tābhyaḥ ca puṣkariṇībhyaḥ samantāt caturdiśam sopānāḥ sapta ratna mayāḥ
translated: eighty yojanas long and fifty yojanas wide.🔽And from those lotus ponds, on all sides in the four directions, there are staircases made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: sāmantakāḥ ca puṣkariṇyaḥ sapta ratna mayaiḥ padmaiḥ pūrṇāḥ
translated: And the surrounding lotus ponds are filled with lotuses made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: ekaikam ca padmam yojanam vistāreṇa
translated: Each lotus is one yojana in diameter.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca puṣpakeśarebhyaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajāyanti
translated: And from those lotus anthers, bodhisattva mahāsattvas are born.

original: te rātryāḥ prathame yāme teṣu padmakeśareṣupapadyante /
analyzed: te rātryāḥ prathame yāme teṣu padma keśareṣu upapadyante
translated: They are born on those lotus anthers in the first watch of the night.

analyzed: tām ca rātrim paryaṅkena atināmayanti
translated: And they spend the night lying on their right sides.

analyzed: vimukti prīti sukham ca pratisaṃvedayanti
translated: And they experience the bliss of joy in liberation.

original: tatra ca rātryāḥ pratyūṣakālasamaye śītalā vāyavaḥ sugandhikā mṛdukāḥ sukhasaṃsparśacalitāḥ pravāyante /
analyzed: tatra ca rātryāḥ pratyūṣa kāla samaye śītalāḥ vāyavaḥ sugandhikāḥ mṛdukāḥ sukha saṃsparśa calitāḥ pravāyante
translated: And at dawn, cool, fragrant, gentle, and pleasant breezes blow.

analyzed: te ca saṃkucitāni puṣpāṇi rohayanti
translated: And they open the closed flowers.

original: te ca bodhisattvāḥ samādhito vyutthāya vimuktiprītisukhaṃ pratiprasrabhya padmakeśareṣvavatīryā /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ samādhitaḥ vyutthāya vimukti prīti sukham pratiprasrabhya padma keśareṣu avatīrya
translated: And those bodhisattvas, having arisen from concentration, having calmed the joy and happiness of liberation, descended onto the lotus anthers.

original: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu praviśya saptaratnamayeṣvāsaneṣu paryaṅkeṇa niṣaṇṇā dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu praviśya sapta ratna mayeṣu āsaneṣu paryaṅkeṇa niṣaṇṇāḥ dharmam śṛṇvanti sma
translated: And having entered those kūṭāgāras made of the seven precious substances, they sat down cross-legged on the seats to listen to the Dharma.

original: teṣu ca vṛkṣakūṭāgārāntariteṣu ca caturdiśaṃ jāmbunadamayāḥ parvatā /
analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣa kūṭāgāra antariteṣu ca caturdiśam jāmbunada mayāḥ parvatāḥ
translated: And in those trees, between the kūṭāgāras, there were mountains of Jāmbūnada gold in the four directions.

analyzed: viṃśati yojanāni uccatvena trīṇi yojanāni vistāreṇa
translated: Twenty yojanas high and three yojanas wide.

original: teṣu ca parvateṣu anekaśatasahasrāṇi sūryakāntacandrakāntendranīlajyotīrasāśca maṇayo'ntarāntare dṛśyanti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca parvateṣu aneka śata sahasrāṇi sūryakānta candrakānta indranīla jyotīrasāḥ ca maṇayaḥ ntarā antare dṛśyanti sma
translated: And on those mountains, many hundreds of thousands of sun-crystals, moon-crystals, sapphires, and luminous gems were seen here and there.

original: padmottarasya buddhasyābhā teṣu parvatemaṇiṣu nipatyā tayā ca buddhābhayā ca maṇiprabhayā sarvā sā padmā lokadhāturnityodāreṇāvabhāsena sphuṭā
analyzed: padmā uttarasya buddhasya ābhā teṣu parvatemaṇiṣu nipatyā tayā ca buddha ābhayā ca maṇi prabhayā sarvā sā padmā lokadhātuḥ nitya udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭā
translated: The light of the Buddha Padmottara, falling on those mountain gems and with that Buddha light and gem radiance, the entire lotus world was filled with a constant, vast illumination.

original: na ca tatra candrasūryayoḥ prabhā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra candra sūryayoḥ prabhā prajñāyate
translated: And there the light of the sun and moon was not known.

original: nānyatra yadā padmāḥ saṃkucanti pakṣiṇaścālpaśabdā bhavanti tadā rātrīti saṃjñā bhavati /
analyzed: na anyatra yadā padmāḥ saṃkucanti pakṣiṇaḥ ca alpa śabdāḥ bhavanti tadā rātrī iti saṃjñā bhavati
translated: When the lotuses close and the birds become quiet, then the name night arises.

analyzed: viparyayāt divasam
translated: The opposite is day.

original: teṣāṃ ca parvatānāmupari nīlavaiḍūryamayāḥ kūṭāgārāḥ ṣaṣṭiyojanānyuccatvena viṃśatiyojanāni vistāreṇa /
analyzed: teṣām ca parvatānām upari nīla vaiḍūrya mayāḥ kūṭāgārāḥ ṣaṣṭi yojanāni uccatvena viṃśati yojanāni vistāreṇa
translated: And on top of those mountains there are multi-storied towers made of blue lapis lazuli, sixty yojanas high and twenty yojanas wide.

original: tebhyaśca kūṭāgārebhyaścaturdiśaṃ saptaratnamayāstoraṇāstebhyaḥ kūṭāgārebhyaśca saptaratnamayāḥ paryaṅkā yatraikajātipratibaddhā bodhisattvā dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca kūṭāgārebhyaḥ caturdiśam sapta ratna mayāḥ toraṇāḥ tebhyaḥ kūṭāgārebhyaḥ ca sapta ratna mayāḥ paryaṅkāḥ yatra eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: And from those multi-storied towers, in the four directions, there are triumphal archways made of the seven precious substances. And from those multi-storied towers, there are couches made of the seven precious substances, where Bodhisattvas bound to one birth listen to the Dharma.

original: padmāyāṃ kulaputra lokadhātau indro nāma bodhivṛkṣastrīṇi yojanasahasrāṇyudvedhena pañcayojanaśatāni vistāreṇa /
analyzed: padmāyām kula putra lokadhātau indraḥ nāma bodhivṛkṣaḥ trīṇi yojana sahasrāṇi udvedhena pañca yojana śatāni vistāreṇa
translated: In the world system Padmā, noble sir, there is a Bodhi tree named Indra, three thousand yojanas high and five hundred yojanas wide.

analyzed: yojana sahasram śākhā patra palāśam su saṃsthitam
translated: One thousand yojanas of branches, leaves, and foliage are well-arranged.

original: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya mūle padmo raupyamayo nālaḥ pañcayojanaśatānyudvedhena /
analyzed: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya mūle padmaḥ raupya mayaḥ nālaḥ pañca yojana śatāni udvedhena
translated: And at the foot of that Bodhi tree, there is a lotus with a silver stalk, five hundred yojanas high.

analyzed: tasya koṭī śata sahasra suvarṇa mayāni patrāṇi pañcadaśa yojanāni udvedhena
translated: It has petals made of a hundred thousand myriads of koṭis of gold, fifteen yojanas high.

analyzed: sarveṣu ca keśareṣu aśma garbha mayāni kiñjalkāni
translated: And in all the filaments, there are pistils made of diamond.

analyzed: sapta ratna mayāḥ keśarāḥ daśa yojanāni udvedhena sapta yojanāni vistāreṇa
translated: The filaments are made of the seven precious substances, ten yojanas in height and seven yojanas in width.

analyzed: tatra ādya rātrau padmottareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: There, on the first night, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tasya buddhāsanapadmasya samantataḥ padmā yatra bodhisattvā niṣaṇṇāḥ padmottarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya prātihāryāṇi paśyanti sma /
analyzed: tasya buddha āsana padmasya samantataḥ padmāḥ yatra bodhisattvāḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ padmottarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya prātihāryāṇi paśyanti sma
translated: All around that lotus seat of the Buddha, there were lotuses where the bodhisattvas were seated, and they beheld the marvelous displays of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara.

original: evamukte / ratnavairocano bodhisattvo bhagavantametadavocat kiyadrūpāṇi bhagavān padmottarastathāgato mahāprātihāryāṇi kṛtavān / /
analyzed: evam ukte ratnavairocanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kiyat rūpāṇi bhagavān padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ mahā prātihāryāṇi kṛtavān
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Ratnārcis said this to the Blessed One: What kind of great marvelous displays did the Tathāgata Padmottara perform, Blessed One?

original: evamukte / bhagavān ratnavairocanaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat adyarātryāḥ paścime yāme padmottareṇa tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhenānuttarā
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān ratnavairocanam bodhisattvam etat avocat adya rātryāḥ paścime yāme padmottareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the bodhisattva Ratnārcis: Tonight, in the last watch, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara will attain final nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder.

analyzed: rātryāḥ pratyuśa kāla samaye tad rupam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
translated: At the end of the night, he manifested that form and miraculous transformation.

analyzed: yāvat brahma lokam ātmānam abhinirmāya uṣṇīṣa mūrdhnaḥ ṣaṣṭi raśmi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi pramucyate
translated: Up to transforming himself into the Brahma world, and emitting from the crown of his head sixty hundred thousand koṭi nayuta hundred thousand light rays.

analyzed: raśmibhiḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn avabhāsayati
translated: The light rays illuminated the worlds in the upward direction, as many as the atoms in a buddha-field.

original: ye punastasmin samaye ūrdhvāyāṃ diśi sthitā bodhisattvā adhodiśam avalokayanti /
analyzed: ye punar tasmin samaye ūrdhvāyām diśi sthitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ adhodiśam avalokayanti
translated: Moreover, at that time, the bodhisattvas who were in the upward direction looked down into the downward direction.

analyzed: teṣām na sumeruḥ avabhāsam āgacchati
translated: For them, Mount Sumeru did not appear,

analyzed: na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na kālaparvatāḥ
translated: nor did the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, nor the Kāla mountains.

original: ye ca bodhisattvāstebhyo lokadhātubhyo vyākṛtā ye samādhipratilabdhā ye dhāraṇīpratilabdhā ye kṣāntipratilabdhā ye ca bhūmyatikrāntā ye caikajātipratibaddhā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāste'pi tenāvabhāsena sphuṭā /
analyzed: ye ca bodhisattvāḥ tebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ vyākṛtāḥ ye samādhi pratilabdhāḥ ye dhāraṇī pratilabdhāḥ ye kṣānti pratilabdhāḥ ye ca bhūmi atikrāntāḥ ye ca eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ te api tena avabhāsena sphuṭā
translated: However, those bodhisattvas who were in those worlds, those who had been prophesied, those who had attained samādhi, those who had attained dhāraṇī, those who had attained acceptance, those who had transcended the stages, and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who were bound to one birth, they were illuminated by that light.

original: añjaliṃ pragṛhya padmottarasya tathāgatasyātmabhāvaṃ vyavalokayitvā dvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtagātraṃ aśītibhiścānuvyañjanairdṛṣṭvā ca tāṃ bodhisattvaparṣadaṃ padmāṃ ca lokadhātuṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃśca dṛṣṭvā paramaprītisaumanasyajātāste ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvā buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamebhyo lokadhātubhyo gaṇanāsamatikrāntā bodhisattvāstāṃstāṃ lokadhātūnapahāya ṛddhibalena padmāṃ lokadhātumanuprāptāḥ padmottarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pūjanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: añjalim pragṛhya padmottarasya tathāgatasya ātmabhāvam vyavalokayitvā dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛta gātram aśītibhiḥ ca anuvyañjanaiḥ dṛṣṭvā ca tām bodhisattva parṣadam padmām ca lokadhātum buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān ca dṛṣṭvā parama prīti saumanasya jātāḥ te ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ bodhisattvāḥ tān tām lokadhātūn apah
translated: They joined their palms together, looked at the body of the Tathāgata Padma-uttarā, which was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor characteristics, and saw the assembly of bodhisattvas and the world system Padma and the array of qualities of the Buddha-field. Having seen this, they were filled with supreme joy and mental satisfaction. Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, as numerous as the atoms in a buddha-field, from world systems beyond number, abandoned those world systems and, by the power of their spiritual accomplishments, arrived in the world system Padma in order to worship, pay homage, and serve the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Padma-uttarā.

original: sa ca kulaputra padmottarastathāgato jihvendriyaṃ mukhānnirnāmayitvā sarvāvatīmimāṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ lokadhātuṃ niṣaṇṇāḥ sthitāścaṅkramanto jihvendriyeṇa paricchāditavān /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ jihvā indriyam mukhāt nirnāmayitvā sarvāvatīm imām cāturdvīpikām lokadhātum niṣaṇṇāḥ sthitāḥ caṅkramantaḥ jihvā indriyeṇa paricchāditavān
translated: And that Padma-uttarā, O son of noble family, the Tathāgata, extended his tongue from his mouth and covered the entire four-continent world system with his tongue, with those seated, standing, and walking.

original: ye cātra bodhisattvāḥ samāpannāste samādhibhyo vyutthāya sarvāvatī sā parṣat padmottarasya tathāgatasya pūjākarmaṇe udyuktā /
analyzed: ye ca atra bodhisattvāḥ samāpannāḥ te samādhibhyaḥ vyutthāya sarvāvatī sā parṣad padmottarasya tathāgatasya pūjā karmaṇe udyuktā
translated: And those bodhisattvas who had entered here, having arisen from their meditative absorptions, the entire assembly was dedicated to the task of making offerings to the Tathagata Padmottara.

analyzed: atha kula putra padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ jihvā indriyam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāreṇa pratiprasrambhayitvā
translated: Then, son of noble family, the Tathagata Padmottara, having expanded his tongue faculty through the transformation of his miraculous powers,

original: punaraparaṃ padmottarastathāgataḥ sarvāvantātkāyāt sarvaromakūpebhya ekaikasmād romakūpavivarāt ṣaṣṭiraśmikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi niścārayitvā daśasu dikṣvekaikasyāṃ diśi buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃ lokadhātūn udāreṇāvabhāsena sphuritvā /
analyzed: punar aparam padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ sarvāvantāt kāyāt sarva romakūpebhyaḥ ekaikasmāt romakūpa vivarāt ṣaṣṭi raśmi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi niścārayitvā daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samām lokadhātūn udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuritvā
translated: furthermore, the Tathagata Padmottara, having emitted from all his body, from all his pores, from each pore, sixty hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of light rays, having illuminated with that vast light the world systems equal to the atoms in the Buddha-fields in each of the ten directions,

original: bodhisattvā mahāsattvāstebhyo lokadhātubhyo vyākṛtā ye samādhipratilabdhā iti te'pi bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ svakasvakabuddhakṣetrābhayā ṛddhibalena padmāṃ lokadhātuṃ saṃprāptāḥ padmottarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya pūjanāya paryupāsanāya /🔽atha khalu kulaputra padmottarastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho ṛddhyabhisaṃskāraṃ pratiprasrabhya sarvāvatyāṃ bodhisattvaparṣadi avaivartikacakraṃ nāma dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartitavān bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ vyākṛtāḥ ye samādhi pratilabdhāḥ iti te api bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ svaka svaka buddhakṣetra ābhayā ṛddhi balena padmām lokadhātum saṃprāptāḥ padmottarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya pūjanāya paryupāsanāya  atha khalu kula putra padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram pratiprasrabhya sarvāvatyām bodhisattva parṣadi avaivartikacakram nāma dhārmikam dharmacakram pravartitavān bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have attained samādhi from those world systems, they too, by the power of their own buddha-fields, have arrived in the world system Padmā in order to see, pay homage to, worship, and attend to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara.🔽Then, noble sir, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara, having relaxed his miraculous power, turned the wheel of Dharma named The Unrevertible Wheel of Dharma in the entire assembly of bodhisattvas, for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods, humans, and the multitude of beings, in order to complete the Great Vehicle.

original: arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca mahāyānasya paripūraṇārthaṃ //🔽iti śrīkaruṇāpuṇḍarīke mahāyānasūtre dharmacakrapravartano nāma prathamaḥ parivartaḥ // //

translated: Thus have I heard. translated: And those bodhisattvas who have been reborn or will be reborn in that lotus world realm have meditation as their food. Those bodhisattvas have the Dharma as their food, and fragrant food, just like the devas of the Brahma world.

analyzed: atha khalu ratnavairocanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kiyat mahatī bhagavan sā padmā lokadhātuḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Ratnārcis asked the Blessed One, Blessed One, how vast is that lotus world realm?

original: kiyacciramasau padmottarastathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmaṃ ca deśayati yenādyarātrāvanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiracirābhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: kiyat ciram asau padmottaraḥ tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmam ca deśayati yena adya rātrau anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ acira abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: How long did that Tathāgata Padmottara remain, live, and endure, teaching the Dharma, by whom the highest complete enlightenment was realized this very night?

analyzed: kiyat ciram ca parinirvṛtasya saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: And for how long will the true Dharma remain after his parinirvāṇa?

original: kiyaccirasthāyinaste bodhisattvā ye padmāyāṃ lokadhātau buddhakṣetre pratyājātāḥ pratyājāyiṣyanti vā /
analyzed: kiyat cira sthāyinaḥ te bodhisattvāḥ ye padmāyām lokadhātau buddhakṣetre pratyājātāḥ pratyājāyiṣyanti vā
translated: For how long will those bodhisattvas who have been reborn in the buddha-field of the world-system Padma remain?

original: kin te bodhisattvā virahitā buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena saṅghopasthānena utāhosvinneti /
analyzed: kim te bodhisattvāḥ virahitāḥ buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena saṅgha upasthānena uta āhosvit na iti
translated: Are those bodhisattvas deprived of seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, and serving the Saṅgha, or not?

original: kiṃ nāma cāsītpūrve sā padmā lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: kim nāma ca āsīt pūrve sā padmā lokadhātuḥ
translated: What was the name of the world-system Padma in the past?

original: kiyaccireṇa vā tatra jinasūryāstaṃgataḥ yasyānantareṇa padmottarena tathāgatenānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: kiyat cireṇa vā tatra jina sūrya astaṃgataḥ yasya anantareṇa padmottarena tathāgatena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: After how long did the sun of the Victor set there, by which the Tathāgata Padmottara immediately after him realized the highest complete enlightenment?

original: kiṃ pratyayamapyekatyā buddhavikurvāṇān buddhaprātihāryān paśyanti ye daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhā bhagavantaḥ prātihāryān kurvanti /
analyzed: kim pratyayam api ekatyāḥ buddha vikurvāṇān buddha prātihāryān paśyanti ye daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ prātihāryān kurvanti
translated: By what condition do some see the miracles of the Buddha, the marvels of the Buddha, which the Blessed Buddhas in other buddha-fields in the ten directions perform?

analyzed: ekatyāḥ na paśyanti
translated: Some do not see it.

original: bhagavān āha tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra sumeruḥ parvatarājā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat yathā api nāma kula putra sumeruḥ parvata rājā
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, it is like this: Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains,

analyzed: aṣṭaṣaṣṭhi yojana sahasrāṇi udvedhena caturaśīti yojana sahasrāṇi vistāreṇa
translated: is eighty-four thousand yojanas high and one hundred and sixty-eight thousand yojanas wide.

original: kaścid eva puruṣa āgacchet vīryavān balavān /
analyzed: kaścid eva puruṣaḥ āgacchet vīryavān balavān
translated: Suppose a certain man came, vigorous and strong.

original: samādhibalena vā taṃ sumeruṃ parvatarājaṃ sarṣapamātrapramāṇaṃ bhindyāt /
analyzed: samādhi balena vā tam sumerum parvata rājam sarṣapa mātra pramāṇam bhindyāt
translated: By the power of concentration, he would reduce that Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, to the size of a mustard seed.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ te sarṣapāḥ bhavanti
translated: Those mustard seeds would be beyond counting.

original: na śakyaṃ te sarṣapāḥ kenacid gaṇayituṃ sthāpya sarvajñajñānena /
analyzed: na śakyam te sarṣapāḥ kenacid gaṇayitum sthāpya sarvajña jñānena
translated: Those mustard seeds could not be counted by anyone except by the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ te sarṣapa phalāḥ bhavanti tāvantaḥ cāturdvīpikā pramāṇā
translated: As many mustard seeds as there are, so many four-continent worlds

original: padmā buddhakṣetramevākīrṇā bodhisattvaiḥ tadyathā sukhāvatī lokadhāturbodhisattvairākīrṇā /
analyzed: padmāḥ buddhakṣetram eva ākīrṇāḥ bodhisattvaiḥ tat yathā sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ bodhisattvaiḥ ākīrṇā
translated: are filled with bodhisattvas in the buddha-field of Padmottama, just as the world system Sukhāvatī is filled with bodhisattvas.

original: padmottarasya kulaputra tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya triṃśadantarakalpānyāyuḥpramāṇaṃ tiṣṭhato dhriyato yāpayato dharmaṃ ca deśayataḥ
analyzed: padmottarasya kula putra tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya triṃśat antara kalpāni āyuḥ pramāṇam tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyataḥ yāpayataḥ dharmam ca deśayataḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the lifespan of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Padmottara is thirty intermediate eons. He remains, endures, and continues to teach the Dharma.

original: padmottarasya kulaputra tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya daśāntarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: padmottarasya kula putra tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya daśa antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: “Noble one, after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Padmottara, the holy Dharma will remain for ten intermediate eons.

original: teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ye padmāyāṃ lokadhātau pratyājātāḥ pratyājāyiṣyanti vā teṣāṃ catvāriṃśadantarakalpāyuḥpramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām ca bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ye padmāyām lokadhātau pratyājātāḥ pratyājāyiṣyanti vā teṣām catvāriṃśat antara kalpa āyuḥ pramāṇam
translated: And the lifespan of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have been born or will be born in the world system Padma will be forty intermediate eons.

original: pūrvaṃ ca kulaputra sā padmā lokadhātuścandanā nāma babhūva /
analyzed: pūrvam ca kula putra sā padmā lokadhātuḥ candanā nāma babhūva
translated: Moreover, noble one, that world system Padma was previously called Candanā.

original: na tvevaṃ pariśuddhābhūnna tvevam ākīrṇā śuddhasattvairbabhūva yathaitarhi padmā lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: na tu evam pariśuddhā abhūt na tu evam ākīrṇā śuddha sattvaiḥ babhūva yathā etarhi padmā lokadhātuḥ
translated: It was not as pure and not as filled with pure beings as the world system Padma is now.

original: candanāyāṃ kulaputra lokadhātau candrottamo nāmābhūt tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasampannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: candanāyām kula putra lokadhātau candrottamaḥ nāma abhūt tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: In the world system Candanā, noble one, there was a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Bhagavat named Candrottama.

analyzed: sa ca api viṃśati antara kalpān dharmam deśitavān
translated: He also taught the Dharma for twenty intermediate eons.

analyzed: parinirvāṇa kāla samaye ca api ekatyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ praṇidhāna vaśitayā anyat buddhakṣetram saṃkrāntāḥ
translated: And at the time of his parinirvāṇa, some bodhisattvas, by the power of their vows, went to other buddha-fields.

original: ye cāvaśiṣṭā bodhisattvāsteṣām etadavocan adyarātrau madhyame yāme candrottamastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: ye ca avaśiṣṭāḥ bodhisattvāḥ teṣām etat avocan adya rātrau madhyame yāme candrottamaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ parinirvāsyati
translated: And those bodhisattvas who remained, they said this: 'Tonight, in the middle watch, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Candrottama will enter parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya bhagavataḥ daśa antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: For ten intermediate eons, the true Dharma will remain after the Blessed One's parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: kaḥ saddharma antardhānasya anantaram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Who will attain supreme perfect awakening immediately after the true Dharma disappears?'

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena gaganamudro nāma bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena gaganamudraḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Then at that time, there was a bodhisattva named Gagana-mudra.

original: sa pūrvapraṇidhānena candrottamena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vyākṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sa pūrva praṇidhānena candrottamena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vyākṛtaḥ
translated: He was prophesied by the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Candrottama through a previous vow:

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ kulaputra mama parinirvṛtasya daśābhyantarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam kula putra mama parinirvṛtasya daśa abhyantara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: Son of noble family, after my parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma will remain for ten intermediate eons.

analyzed: rātryāḥ prathame yāme mama saddharmaḥ untarahāsyati
translated: In the first watch of the night, my true Dharma will disappear.

original: tatraiva rātryāḥ paścime yāme tvamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: tatra eva rātryāḥ paścime yāme tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In the last watch of the night, you will attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: padmottaro nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasampanno yāvadbuddho bhagavāṃs /
analyzed: padmottaraḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the thus-gone, worthy, perfectly awakened one with perfect knowledge and conduct, the blissful one, the knower of the world, the guide of people who need to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened buddha called Padma-uttama.

original: tatkālaṃ te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā yena candrottamastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhagavāṃstenopajagmuḥ /
analyzed: tad kālam te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ yena candrottamaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhagavān tena upajagmuḥ
translated: At that time, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas went to the thus-gone, worthy, perfectly awakened, perfect buddha, the blissful one, the knower of the world, the guide of people who need to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened buddha called Padma-uttama.

original: upetya candrottamasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samādhānabalena nānāprakārairbodhisattvavikurvaiścandrottamasya tathāgatasya pūjāṃ kṛtvā triskṛtvaśca pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavantametadavocan icchāmo vayam bhadanta bhagavan nime daśābhyantarakalpā nirodhamavahitena cittenātināmayituṃ /
analyzed: upetya candrottamasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samādhāna balena nānā prakāraiḥ bodhisattva vikurvaiḥ candrottamasya tathāgatasya pūjām kṛtvā triskṛtvas ca pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavantam etat avocan icchāmaḥ vayam bhadanta bhagavat nime daśa abhyantara kalpāḥ nirodham avahitena cittena atināmayitum
translated: Having gone to the thus-gone, worthy, perfectly awakened Padma-uttama, all those bodhisattvas, through the power of concentration, made offerings to the thus-gone Padma-uttama with various kinds of bodhisattva miracles, circumambulated him three times, and said this to the Blessed One: Venerable Blessed One, we wish to spend the next ten intermediate eons with our minds focused on cessation.

original: tatra khalu kulaputra candrottamastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho gaganamudraṃ bodhisattvam mahāsattvamāmantryaitadavocat udgṛhṇa tvaṃ kulaputremaṃ sarvajñātākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ sarvātītānāgataistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairyauvarājyābhiṣiktānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ deśitaṃ /
analyzed: tatra khalu kula putra candrottamaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ gaganamudram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrya etat avocat udgṛhṇa tvam kula putra imam sarvajñāta ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam sarva atīta anāgataiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ yauvarājya abhiṣiktānām bodhisattvānām deśitam
translated: There, noble son, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Candrottamas addressed the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Gagana-mudra and said this: Noble son, you should uphold this entrance to the gateway of the aspect of omniscience, which has been taught by all the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past and future, to the Bodhisattvas consecrated as princes.

original: ye caitarhi daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te'pi buddho bhagavanto yauvarājyābhiṣiktānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: ye ca etarhi daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te api buddhaḥ bhagavantaḥ yauvarājya abhiṣiktānām bodhisattvānām
translated: And those Blessed Buddhas who are present in the ten directions, in all the world systems, and who abide, and endure, and maintain themselves, they too, Blessed Buddhas, to the Bodhisattvas consecrated as princes,

original: ye'pi te bhaviṣyantyanāgate'dhvani buddhā bhagavantaste'pi yauvarājyābhiṣiktānāṃ bodhisattvānāmimaṃ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ deśayiṣyanti / tadyathā /
analyzed: ye api te bhaviṣyanti anāgata idhvani buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te api yauvarājya abhiṣiktānām bodhisattvānām imam sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam deśayiṣyanti tat yathā
translated: and those who will be the Blessed Buddhas in the future, they too will teach this entrance to the gateway of the aspect of omniscience, the dhâraṇī, to the Bodhisattvas consecrated as princes. It is as follows.

original: jalijalini mahājalini phutke butke sammade mahāsammade devāṃ aṭi caṭi ṭake ṭharaṭhakke amimakasi hilicilitili ruruke mahāruruke jaye durjaye jayamati śānte śāntanirghoṣaṇi amūle ale amūlaparichinne mārasainya vitrāsane mukte muktapariśuddhe abhīte bhayamocane bhāradroharaṇā dānta vidyāvidyā varuttame /
analyzed: jali jalini mahā jalini phutke butke sammade mahāsammade devāṃ aṭi caṭi ṭake ṭharaṭhakke amimakasi hili cili tili ruruke mahāruruke jaye durjaye jayamati śānte śānta nirghoṣaṇi amūle ale amūla parichinne māra sainya vitrāsane mukte mukta pariśuddhe abhīte bhaya mocane bhāra droha raṇā vidyā avidyā var uttame
translated: Jali jalinimāhajalinim phutke butke sammade mahāsammade devāṃ aṭi caṭi ṭake ṭharathakkhe amimasi hilicilitili rurike mahārurike jaya durjaya jaya mati śānte śānta nirghoshi amūle ale amūla pari chinne māra sainye vitrāsa ne mukte mukta pari śuddhe abhīte bhaya mochane bhāra droha haraṇa dānta vidyā avidyā varuttamā.

original: nigrahaṃ paravādināṃ dharmavādināmanugrahaṃ ārakṣā dharmavādināṃ caturṇāṃ smṛtyupasthānānām adhimuktipadaprakāśanapadamidaṃ /
analyzed: nigraham paravādinām dharmavādinām anugraham ārakṣā dharmavādinām caturṇām smṛti upasthānānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: The subjugation of opponents' arguments and the favor of those who speak Dharma, the protection of those who speak Dharma, this is the teaching of the words of faith in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: buddhakāśaye amama nimama avevi arthe arthani stīraṇe lokādhimukte sandadha paribhāvane /
analyzed: buddhaka āśaye amama nimama avevi arthe stīraṇe loka adhimukte paribhāvane
translated: In the Buddha's light, in the selfless, in the desireless, in the meaning, in the discernment of meaning, in the faith in the world, in the binding, in the contemplation.

analyzed: caturṇām ārya vaṃśānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padā
translated: This is the teaching of the words of faith in the four noble lineages.

original: bhāṣīthe bhāṣaṇe dhāre dhārayati gupte śubhe śubhaprade tatphale agraphale'niṣphale nilaha samukta amukta nirmukte atravita vimuktavati vilaphala ayukta iviti diviti ratitula tulamaṃ ahiṃsāma ititāva atvānatvāna sarvaloka anaka livindha abhūsare hatamatte veśāgravate aphala kaphala /
analyzed: bhāṣīthe bhāṣaṇe dhāre dhārayati gupte śubhe śubha prade tad phale agra phale niṣphale nilaha samukta amukta nirmukte vimuktavati ayukta iv iti div iti vimuktavati ayukta ahiṃsāmaḥ iti tāva ahiṃsāmaḥ sarvaloka anaka livindha abhūsare hata matte veśa agravate aphala kaphala
translated: In speech, in retention, in guarding, in auspiciousness, in bestowing auspiciousness, in that fruit, in the supreme fruit, in the fruitless, in liberation, in the liberated, in the released, in the absence of this, in the liberated, in the fruitless, in the unattached, in the divine, in the delight, in the comparison, in the non-violence, in the truth, in the non-existence, in the non-existence of all worlds, in the non-existence, in the non-existence of the elements, in the destruction of pride, in the supreme abode, in the fruitless, in the fruitful.

analyzed: trayāṇām ārakṣitānām adhimukti padam idam
translated: This is the stage of resolute faith in the three well-guarded ones.

original: jaḍataḥ aniharavavatavyo idaṃ phalaṃ niyomaphalaṃ samudānāya vibhuṣa paśya sāmantra anumanto akumanto chedāvane mantrastā daśabala vigrahasthā isusthita sunikhama tīkṣṇamati āloko atitṛṣṇā adimati /
analyzed: idam phalam samudānāya vibhuṣa paśya sāmantra anumanto akumanto chedāvane mantrastā daśabala vigrahastha sunikhama tīkṣṇamati ālokaḥ atitṛṣṇāḥ adimati
translated: From dullness, from the unwholesome, from the unobtainable, this is the fruit, the fruit of the yoke, for the sake of accumulation, see the power, the follower, the non-follower, the non-follower, the mantra-cutter, the ten powers, the abode of the body, the well-established, the well-subdued, the sharp-minded, the light, the excessive craving, the non-mind.

analyzed: pratyutpanna buddha pūrva prahāre caturṇām samyakprahāṇānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the stage of the manifestation of the stage of resolute faith in the four right efforts, in the present Buddha, and in the past Buddha.

original: anye manye mane mamane vire virate śame śamitā viśānte mukte nirakṣame same samasame kṣaye akṣaye ajiti śānte samiṣṭhe dhāraṇī ālokāvabhāse ratnavrate raśmyavate jñānavate meruvate kṣayanidarśane lokapradīpanidarśane /
analyzed: anye manye mane mamane vire virate śame śamitā viśānte mukte nirakṣame same samasame kṣaye akṣaye ajiti śānte samiṣṭhe dhāraṇī āloka avabhāse ratnavrate raśmyavate jñānavate meruvate kṣaya nidarśane loka pradīpa nidarśane
translated: Other, I think, mind, my mind, move, move away, peace, pacified, completely pacified, released, without attachment, equal, completely equal, destroyed, indestructible, unconquered, peaceful, well-pacified, retention, illumination, light, jewel vow, radiant, knowledge, Meru, showing destruction, showing the world lamp.

analyzed: caturṇām pratisaṃvidām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the illuminating phrase for the four analytical knowledges.

original: cakṣa ābhāsanidarśane jñānālokanidarśanaṃ ca prabhāsane sarvendriya bhūmātikrante sarvasarve vamāṃ sarve prāthavā kṣayaṃ kare gokāha vadane lokānudarśana vibhū /
analyzed: cakṣaḥ ābhāsa nidarśane jñāna āloka nidarśanam ca prabhāsane sarva indriya bhūma atikrante sarva sarve kṣayam kare vadane loka anudarśana vibhū
translated: Eye, showing illumination, and showing the light of knowledge, and illuminating, surpassing all faculties, all, all, all, all, destroying, cow's voice, showing the world, splendor.

analyzed: caturṇām ṛddhipādānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the illuminating phrase for the four bases of supernatural power.

original: acale buddhe dṛhapracale sattve gṛhna siddhi kaṃpati nisiddha smahiddhe parekasire some caṇḍe datve acale acale apare vicivale nipare pracacale prasare anayan prabhyāse kaṃkame prabhāvini same nijase grakrame nayute /
analyzed: acale buddhe sattve gṛhna siddhi kaṃpati nisiddha smahiddhe parekasire some caṇḍe acale acale apare vicivale nipare pracacale prasare anayan prabhyāse kaṃkame prabhāvini same nijase grakrame nayute
translated: In the immovable Buddha, the firm, the moving being, grasp, success trembles, in the accomplished, the accomplished, in the single-minded, in the angry, in the given, in the immovable, the immovable, in the other, the moving, the fallen, the greatly moving, the extended, the led by the practice, in the goose, in the powerful, in the equal, in the own-series, in the ten-million.

analyzed: indriyāṇām balānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the stage of revealing the stage of the roots of the senses and powers.

original: puṣpe supuṣpe drumaparihāre abhayarucire cekaratke akṣayamastu ninile mamale pañcaśiśire lokasya vijñāne nayasaṃgṛhīte ca yukte succendena /
analyzed: puṣpe su puṣpe druma parihāre abhaya rucire cekaratke akṣayam astu ninile mamale pañca śiśire lokasya vijñāne naya saṃgṛhīte ca yukte succendena
translated: In the flower, the good flower, in the avoidance of trees, in the delightful fearlessness, in the single jewel, may there be no decay, in the five cool ones, in the world's knowledge, in the included conduct, in the well-conceived moon.

analyzed: saptānām bodhyaṅgānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the stage of revealing the stage of the roots of the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: cakravajre maitra samāpade krānte kete karuṇa rudīkṣayi prītirūpe kṣamasaṃpanne arake varate kharo khare amūle mūle sādhane /
analyzed: cakra vajre maitra sama āpade krānte kete karuṇa prīti rūpe kṣama saṃpanne arake varate amūle mūle sādhane
translated: In the vajra wheel, in the friendly, in the perfected, in the traversed, in the compassion, in the seen, in the joy-form, in the accomplished patience, in the unattached, in the vow, in the harsh, in the harsh, in the rootless, in the root, in the accomplishment.

analyzed: caturṇām vaiśāradyānām adhimukti pada prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the stage of revealing the stage of the roots of the four forms of fearlessness.

original: vartte cakre cakradhare varacakre vare prare hile hile dhare ārūpāvate huhure yathā jibhaṃga niṃbare yathāgne yathāparaṃ cariniśe yathā bhayaririśi satyanirhāra jaracavila vīryanirhāra cure mārganirhāra samādhinirhāra prajñānirhāra vimuktinirhāra vimuktijñānadarśananirhāra nakṣatranirhāra candranirhāra sūryanirhāra padāścaturuttaratathāgatena adbhutaṃ niradbhutaṃ saṃbuddhaṃ abuddha ihabuddhaṃ tatrabuddhaṃ nihaṃgamapare alaha dalaha paṇḍare paṇḍare tatrāntalu māṃgagharaṇi pūṭani saṃpūṭani gatapraṃgamanuniruva nāśani nāśabandhani cicchini cicchidra mayova hidiṃgamā vare mare hanane bharaṃ bhare bhinde bhire bhire ruṣare śaraṇe darane pravartte varaṇāḍaye vidranvumā varakhumā brahmacāriṇa indravani dhidhirāyani maheśvaralalani mamasume alamini ekākṣaraci vaṃcani carasti ābhicaṇḍāla sūre sarvasurā āvarasurā punakanitāṃ paṇḍitāṃ āyinakaṇḍi jabhāme gandhare atra runimakare bhirohiṇī siddhamatte vilokamate /
analyzed: varte cakre cakradhare varacakre vare hile hile dhare ārūpāvate huhure yathā niṃbare yathā agne yathā aparam cariniśe yathā bhayaririśi satya nirhāra jara cavila vīrya nirhāra cure mārga nirhāra samādhi nirhāra prajñā nirhāra vimukti nirhāra vimukti jñāna darśana nirhāra nakṣatra nirhāra candra nirhāra sūrya nirhāra padāḥ caturuttara tathāgatena adbhutam niradbhutam saṃbuddham abuddhaḥ ihabuddham tatrabuddham nihaṃgam apare alaha dalaha paṇḍare paṇḍare pa
translated: In the wheel, in the wheel-holder, in the excellent wheel, in the excellent wheel, in the mountain, in the mountain, in the holder, in the formless, in the huhu, as the tongue is bent, as the nimba is, as the fire is, as the other is, in the night of conduct, as the fear is, in the fulfillment of truth, in the fulfillment of diligence, in the fulfillment of the path, in the fulfillment of concentration, in the fulfillment of wisdom, in the fulfillment of liberation, in the fulfillment of the vision of liberation and knowledge, in the fulfillment of the stars, in the fulfillment of the moon, in the fulfillment of the sun, in the four-hundred-footed, by the Tathagata, the wonderful, the non-wonderful, the fully enlightened, the non-enlightened, the enlightened here, the enlightened there, the non-flying, the other, the not-obtained, the obtained, the white, the white, there within, the nose-cutting, the full, the fully full, the gone, the forward, the backward, the obstruction, the destruction, the binding of destruction, the cut, the hole, the bent, the excellent, the dead, the killing, the burden, the borne, the split, the split, the split, the red, the refuge, the crushing, the turning, the varanadaya, the vidranvuma, the excellent, the soft, the celibate, the Indra,

analyzed: buddha adhiṣṭhite dhāraṇī mukhe daśānām balānām adhimukti prakāśana padam idam
translated: This is the teaching that illuminates the faith in the ten powers, in the gateway of the dhāraṇī that is empowered by the Buddha.”

original: samanantarārabdhe khalu punarbhagavatā asmin sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśe atha tāvadiyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāraṃ kaṃpitā prakaṃpitā saṃprakaṃpitā calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kṣubhitā prakṣubhitā saṃprakṣubhitā garjitā pragarjitā saṃpragarjitā /
analyzed: samanantara ārabdhe khalu punar bhagavatā asmin sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśe atha tāvat iyam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram kaṃpitā prakaṃpitā saṃprakaṃpitā calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kṣubhitā prakṣubhitā saṃprakṣubhitā garjitā pragarjitā saṃpragarjitā
translated: As soon as the Blessed One had begun this introduction to the gateway of the dhāraṇī door of omniscience, this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways: it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely; it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely; it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely; it shuddered, shuddered strongly, and shuddered intensely; it quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.

analyzed: unnamati praṇamati saṃpraṇamati
translated: It rose up, rose up strongly, and rose up intensely; it fell down, fell down strongly, and fell down intensely; it moved, moved strongly, and moved intensely; it swayed, swayed strongly, and swayed intensely.

original: tathārūpaścāvabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ yaddaśasu dikṣu gaṇanāsamatikrāntā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavaḥ udāreṇāvabhāsena sphuṭā babhūva /
analyzed: tathārūpaḥ ca avabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ yat daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭā babhūva
translated: And such a light appeared that the worlds in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, beyond calculation, were filled with a great light.

original: naiva tasmin samaye sumerucakravāḍamahācakravāḍaḥ cakṣuṣa ābhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: na eva tasmin samaye sumeru cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: At that time, Sumeru, Cakravāḍa, and Mahācakravāḍa did not appear to the eyes.

original: daśasu dikṣu gaṇanāsamātikrāntā lokadhātavaḥ samāpāṇitalajātā saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā samātikrāntāḥ lokadhātavaḥ samā pāṇitala jātā saṃdṛśyante
translated: The worlds in the ten directions, beyond calculation, were seen to be as level as the palm of a hand.

original: ye'pi te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā daśasu dikṣu gaṇanāsamatikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu prativasanti /
analyzed: ye api te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā samatikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu prativasanti
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who dwell in the worlds beyond counting in the ten directions,

analyzed: ye samādhi dhāraṇī kṣānti pratilabdhāḥ
translated: who have attained concentration, retention, and patience,

original: te tathāgatabalena svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣvantarhitā imāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātumāgatvā gṛdhrakūṭe parvate bhagavataḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntā /
analyzed: te tathāgata balena svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu antarhitāḥ imām sahām lokadhātum āgatvā gṛdhrakūṭe parvate bhagavataḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntā
translated: they, by the power of the Tathāgata, disappeared from their own buddha-fields and came to this Sahā world-system, to Vulture Peak Mountain, to the presence of the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā nānāprakārairvividhairbodhisattvavikurvitairbhagavataḥ pūjāṃ kṛtvā tatraiva niṣeduḥ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaśravaṇārthaṃ
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā nānā prakāraiḥ vividhaiḥ bodhisattva vikurvitaiḥ bhagavataḥ pūjām kṛtvā tatra eva niṣeduḥ sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśa śravaṇa artham
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and made offerings to the Blessed One with various kinds of manifold bodhisattva transformations, and sat there, for the sake of hearing the entry into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspect of omniscience.

original: gaṇanāsamatikrāntāśca devanāgayakṣāsurakumbhāṇḍapiśācā yena gṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvato yena ca bhagavāṃstenopajagmuḥ /
analyzed: gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa asura kumbhāṇḍa piśācāḥ yena gṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvataḥ yena ca bhagavān tena upajagmuḥ
translated: And those who are beyond counting, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, kumbhāṇḍas, and piśācas, they approached Vulture Peak Mountain and the Blessed One.

analyzed: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhiḥ abhivandya
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One,

analyzed: ekānte niṣeduḥ imam ca sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam śravaṇa arthām
translated: and sat to one side, for the sake of hearing this entry into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspect of omniscience.

original: ye cātra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sannipatitāste sarve padmāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: ye ca atra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ te sarve padmām buddhakṣetram paśyanti sma
translated: And all the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had assembled there saw the buddha field of Padma and

original: padmottaraṃ ca tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ mahatā bodhisattvagaṇena parivṛtaṃ /
analyzed: padmottaram ca tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham mahatā bodhisattva gaṇena parivṛtam
translated: the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Padma-uttaras surrounded by a great assembly of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: samanantara udāhṛtasya ca asya bhagavatā sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśasya dvāsaptabhiḥ gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ iyam dhāraṇī
translated: Immediately after the Blessed One had spoken this dhāraṇī gateway to omniscience, it was attained by bodhisattva mahāsattvas equal to the sands of seventy-two Ganges Rivers.

original: dhāraṇīpratilabdhāśca te bodhisattvā daśasu dikṣu gaṇanāsamatikrāntān lokadhātusthān buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhāḥ ca te bodhisattvāḥ daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā samatikrāntān lokadhātu sthān buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyanti sma
translated: And those bodhisattvas, having attained the dhāraṇī, saw the buddhas, the blessed ones, dwelling in world systems beyond counting in the ten directions.

analyzed: sarvān ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti sma
translated: And they saw all the arrays of qualities in the buddha fields.

original: āścaryaprāptāste samādhibalena bodhisattvavikurvitena ca buddhapūjāṃ kṛtvā tasthuḥ /
analyzed: āścarya prāptāḥ te samādhi balena bodhisattva vikurvitena ca buddha pūjām kṛtvā tasthuḥ
translated: Having made offerings to the buddhas through the power of samādhi and the transformations of the bodhisattvas, they were amazed.

original: bhagavāṃstān evam āha imaṃ kulaputra sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhāvayamānaścaturaśītidhāraṇīmukhaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: bhagavān tān evam āha imam kula putra sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhāvayamānaḥ caturaśīti dhāraṇī mukha śata sahasrāṇi
translated: The Blessed One said to them, Son of noble family, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva cultivates this entrance to the gateway of retention of the aspects of omniscience, he attains 8,400,000 gateways of retention,

analyzed: dvāsaptatiḥ ca dhāraṇīmukha sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: and 72,000 gateways of retention.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭim ca samādhi mukha sahasrāṇi pratilabhate
translated: He attains 60,000 gateways of samādhi.

original: imāṃ ca dhāraṇīṃ pratilabdho bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāmaitrīṃ pratilabhate mahākaruṇāṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: imām ca dhāraṇīm pratilabdhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahā maitrīm pratilabhate mahā karuṇām pratilabhate
translated: Having attained this retention, the bodhisattva mahāsattva attains great loving-kindness and great compassion.

original: kevalamasya samādheḥ pratilābhāya bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣān dharmān avabudhyate sarvajñajñānaṃ ca pratilabhate /
analyzed: kevalam asya samādheḥ pratilābhāya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān avabudhyate sarvajña jñānam ca pratilabhate
translated: For the sake of attaining just this samādhi, the bodhisattva mahāsattva realizes the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and attains omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: iha ca sakala buddha dharmāṇām parigrahaḥ
translated: Herein is the complete embracing of the Buddha's teachings.

original: imāṃ ca dhāraṇīṃ svabhāvena buddhvā buddhā bhagavantaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmāṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: imām ca dhāraṇīm svabhāvena buddhvā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sattvānām dharmām deśayanti
translated: Having understood this retention by its nature, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma to beings.

analyzed: na ca atikṣipram parinirvāyanti
translated: And they do not attain final nirvāṇa too quickly.

original: paśyata kulaputrāsyāḥ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśāyā dhāraṇyā anubhāvenāyaṃ mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya prādurbhūtaḥ /
analyzed: paśyata kula putra asyāḥ sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ anubhāvena ayam mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: Look, son of noble family! By the power of this dhāraṇī gateway to the aspects of omniscience, this great earthquake has occurred.

analyzed: mahān ca ābhāsaḥ yena avabhāsena ananta aparyantāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭā
translated: And a great light has appeared, by which infinite and limitless buddha-fields have been illuminated with a vast light.

analyzed: yena avabhāsena anantā paryantebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ imenantā paryantāḥ bodhisattvāḥ abhyāgatāḥ
translated: And by this light, infinite and limitless bodhisattvas have come from infinite and limitless buddha-fields.

analyzed: imam sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam śravaṇa artham
translated: In order to hear this entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway to the aspects of omniscience.

original: ye ceha sahāyāṃ lokadhātāvanantāparyantā devāḥ kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarā nāgā yakṣāsuramanuṣyāmanuṣyā vā imāṃ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ
analyzed: ye ca iha sahāyām lokadhātau ananta aparyantāḥ devāḥ kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣa asura manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ vā imām sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam
translated: And those infinite and limitless gods who dwell in the desire and form realms, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, humans and non-humans in this Sahā world-system, who hear

analyzed: te saha śravaṇena sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśasya a vaivartinaḥ bhavanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: this entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway to the aspects of omniscience, they become irreversible from the highest complete enlightenment upon merely hearing it.

original: likhamānaścāvirahito bhavati buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena saṅghopasthānena yāvadanuttareṇa parinirvāṇena /
analyzed: likhamānaḥ ca avirahitaḥ bhavati buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena saṅgha upasthānena yāvat anuttareṇa parinirvāṇena
translated: And while writing it, they become inseparable from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, serving the Saṅgha, up to the highest complete nirvāṇa.

original: svādhyāyamānaśca bodhisattva imaṃ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ sarvāṇi gāḍhakarmāṇi niravaśeṣaṃ kṣapayati /
analyzed: su ādhyāyamānaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ imam sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam sarvāṇi gāḍha karmāṇi niravaśeṣam kṣapayati
translated: And the bodhisattva who is reciting this entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience will completely exhaust all his deep karmas without exception.

analyzed: janma parivartena ca prathamām bhūmim ākrāmati
translated: And by changing births, he will enter the first ground.

analyzed: bhāvayamānaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam
translated: And the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is contemplating this entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience,

original: yadi tasya bodhisattvasya pañcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāṇi syurupacitāṇi tānyapyasya parikṣayaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: yadi tasya bodhisattvasya pañca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāṇi syuḥ upacitāṇi tāni api asya parikṣayam gacchanti
translated: if that bodhisattva has committed and accumulated the five acts of immediate retribution, they will be completely exhausted for him.

analyzed: yena janma parivartena ca prathamām bhūmim avakrāmati
translated: And by changing births, he will enter the first ground.

original: yasya nāstyanantaryāṇi tasya tena janmanā sarvāṇyanyāni karmāṇi niravaśeṣaṃ parikṣayaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: yasya tasya tena janmanā sarvāṇi anyāni karmāṇi niravaśeṣam parikṣayam gacchanti
translated: For one who does not have the acts of immediate retribution, all his other karmas will be completely exhausted without exception by that birth.

analyzed: janma parivartena ca prathamām bhūmim avakrāmati
translated: And by changing births, he will enter the first ground.

original: yo'pi na bhāvayati na svādhyāyati śṛṇvanaśca dharmabhāṇakasya paṭṭaṃ bandhati /
analyzed: yaḥ api na bhāvayati na su ādhyāyati śṛṇvanaḥ ca dharma bhāṇakasya paṭṭam bandhati
translated: Even one who neither contemplates nor recites, but listens and ties a turban for the Dharma teacher,

original: tasya gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanto dhriyanto yāpayantaḥ anyalokadhātusthāḥ sādhukāramanupradāsyanti /
analyzed: tasya gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ dhriyantaḥ yāpayantaḥ anya lokadhātu sthāḥ sādhukāram anupradāsyanti
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges and who abide, sustain, and live in other world systems, will give their approval.

analyzed: te api buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākariṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will prophesy [their attainment of] unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na cireṇa cāsau bodhisattvaḥ paṭṭaparityāgena yauvarājye'bhiṣicyate /
analyzed: na cireṇa ca asau bodhisattvaḥ paṭṭa parityāgena yauvarājye abhiṣicyate
translated: And that Bodhisattva will soon be anointed as prince regent with the anointment of the turban.

analyzed: eka jāti pratibaddhaḥ ca bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He will be bound to one birth [before full enlightenment].

original: evameva yaḥ kaścid gandhena pūjāṃ karoti so'pi na cireṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhigandhasya lābhī bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ kaścid gandhena pūjām karoti saḥ api na cireṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhi gandhasya lābhī bhavati
translated: In the same way, whoever makes an offering with perfume will soon obtain the perfume of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: puṣpeṇa pūjāṃ kṛtvā dharmabhāṇakasyānuttarāṇi jñānapuṣpāṇi pratilabhate /
analyzed: puṣpeṇa pūjām kṛtvā dharmabhāṇakasya anuttarāṇi jñāna puṣpāṇi pratilabhate
translated: By making an offering with flowers, one obtains the unsurpassed flowers of knowledge of a Dharma teacher.

original: bhakṣyānnapānaṃ dattvā dharmabhāṇakasyānuttarasya tathāgatāhārasya lābhī bhavati bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣya anna pānam dattvā dharma bhāṇakasya anuttarasya tathāgata āhārasya lābhī bhavati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: By giving food and drink, a Bodhisattva obtains the unsurpassed food of a Tathagata, which is the food of a Dharma teacher.

analyzed: vastreṇa ācchādya dharma bhāṇakam anuttara tathāgata varṇa lābhī bhavati
translated: By covering a Dharma teacher with a robe, one obtains the unsurpassed complexion of a Tathagata.

original: yaśca dharmabhāṇakaṃ ratnairācchādayati so'pyacirāt saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipākṣikadharmaratnāṇāṃ lābhī bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dharma bhāṇakam ratnaiḥ ācchādayati saḥ upi acirāt saptatriṃśatām bodhi pākṣika dharma ratnāṇām lābhī bhavati
translated: And whoever covers the Dharma teacher with jewels will soon become a recipient of the thirty-seven jewels of factors of awakening.

original: tadevaṃ mahārthikaḥ kulaputra bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ayaṃ sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaḥ /
analyzed: tat evam mahārthikaḥ kula putra bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ayam sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśaḥ
translated: Thus, noble sir, this entry into the dhāraṇī gateway of the aspects of omniscience is of great benefit to bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?
