analyzed: yat tvayā brāhmaṇa adhatrikāyām varṣa śatām jambudvīpam āhiṇḍatā
translated: Brahmin, when you wandered in Jambudvipa for a hundred years on foot,

original: tena tvayā gaṇanātikrāntāḥ sattvāstriṣu puṇyakriyāvastuṣu niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāśca /
analyzed: tena tvayā gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ triṣu puṇya kriyā vastuṣu niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ ca
translated: by that you established and settled beings beyond count in the three bases of meritorious action.

original: gaṇanātikrāntāśca sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ ca sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And you inspired, settled, and established beings beyond count in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yacca tvayā sarvasattvārthaṃ mahāyajñasyārambhaḥ kṛtastena tvaṃ brāhmaṇa buddhā bhagavanto vyākariṣyantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yat ca tvayā sarva sattva artham mahā yajñasya ārambhaḥ kṛtaḥ tena tvam brāhmaṇa buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākariṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And because you undertook a great sacrifice for the sake of all beings, by that, brahmin, the Blessed Buddhas will prophesy your unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ye daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /
analyzed: ye daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: Those who are in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who abide, endure, and teach the Dharma.

original: yaiśca tava padmāni visarjitāni suvarṇapatrāṇi rūpyadaṇḍāni vaiḍūryakarṇikāni asmagarbhakeśarāṇi /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tava padmāni visarjitāni suvarṇa patrāṇi rūpya daṇḍāni vaiḍūrya karṇikāni asmagarbha keśarāṇi
translated: And by whom golden lotuses were sent, with silver stalks, vaiḍūrya pericarp, and asmagarbha filaments.

original: teṣu ca sarveṣu padmeṣu sūryavigrahā dṛśyante /
analyzed: teṣu ca sarveṣu padmeṣu sūrya vigrahāḥ dṛśyante
translated: And in all those lotuses, the forms of the sun were seen.

analyzed: idam tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: This is the prior sign of that dream.

original: yattvaṃ brāhmaṇādrākṣīt svapne ye daśausu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca
analyzed: yat tvam brāhmaṇa adrākṣīt svapne ye daśausu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca
translated: That you, Brahmin, saw in a dream the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who abide, endure, and teach the Dharma.

analyzed: taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ sapta ratna mayāni chatrāṇi visarjitāni
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, sent forth parasols made of the seven precious substances.

original: yāni chatrāṇi copari cākāśe yāvad brahmalokaparyantaṃ saṃtiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: yāni chatrāṇi ca upari ca ākāśe yāvat brahma loka paryantam saṃtiṣṭhanti
translated: Which parasols remain in the sky above, up to the limit of the Brahma world.

original: yasyāṃ eva rātrau tvaṃ brāhmaṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase tasyāṃ eva rātrau daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣūdāraḥ
analyzed: yasyām eva rātrau tvam brāhmaṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase tasyām eva rātrau daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu udāraḥ
translated: On that very night, Brahmin, when you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment, on that very night in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, a great

original: upari ca yāvad brahmalokaparyantaṃ kṛtvā na śakyante tava mūrdhānaṃ vyavalokayituṃ brahmādibhirdevalokairapi /
analyzed: upari ca yāvat brahmaloka paryantam kṛtvā na śakyante tava mūrdhānam vyavalokayitum brahma ādibhiḥ deva lokaiḥ api
translated: And above, up to the limit of the Brahma world, they are not able to look at the crown of your head, even the gods of the Brahma world and above.

analyzed: idam tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: This is a previous sign of that dream.

original: yattvaṃ brāhmaṇādrākṣit mahāntamātmabhāvaṃ yāvad brahmalokaṃ yacca sūryamaṇḍalānāṃ mālā śīrasi baddhā /
analyzed: yat tvam brāhmaṇa adrākṣit mahāntam ātmabhāvam yāvat brahmalokam yat ca sūrya maṇḍalānām mālā śīrasi baddhā
translated: That you, Brahmin, saw a great body up to the Brahma world, and a garland of sun-discs bound on your head.

original: tadye tvayā gaṇanātikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ samādāpitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tat ye tvayā gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ samādāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those beings beyond count whom you inspired towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: te ca tavābhisaṃbuddhabodherbrāhmaṇa buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu deśasu dikṣu sthitā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante
analyzed: te ca tava abhisaṃbuddha bodheḥ brāhmaṇa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu deśasu dikṣu sthitāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: and they, Brahmin, when you have fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in world systems as numerous as the atoms in a buddha-field in the ten directions,

original: sarve ye tvayā bodhau samādāpitā te tavābhīkṣṇaṃ varṇaṃ udāhariṣyanti /🔽anena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vayaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā /
analyzed: sarve ye tvayā bodhau samādāpitā te tava abhīkṣṇam varṇam udāhariṣyanti  anena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vayam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā
translated: all those whom you inspired towards enlightenment will constantly proclaim your praise.🔽By this Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, we were first inspired towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yena asmai tarhi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: By whom we have now fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: eṣa ca asmākam kalyāṇa mitram
translated: And he is our spiritual friend.

original: te buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvān visarjayiṣyanti tava pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvān visarjayiṣyanti tava pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will send forth the Bodhisattvas to perform worship for you.

original: tataste bodhisattvā mahāsattvā vividhairbodhisattvavikurvitaistava pūjāṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: tatas te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vividhaiḥ bodhisattva vikurvitaiḥ tava pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Then those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, having performed worship for you through various Bodhisattva transformations,

original: tatra tava sakāśāddharmaṃ śrutvā nānāvidhāḥ samādhirdhāraṇīḥ kṣāntiśca pratilapsyante /
analyzed: tatra tava sakāśāt dharmam śrutvā nānāvidhāḥ samādhiḥ dhāraṇīḥ kṣāntiḥ ca pratilapsyante
translated: having heard the Dharma from you, will attain various kinds of samadhis, dharanis, and patience.

original: te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā tava varṇaṃ uccārayiṣyanti ghoṣamanuśrāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā tava varṇam uccārayiṣyanti ghoṣam anuśrāvayiṣyanti
translated: Those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, having gone to their own Buddha-fields, will proclaim your praises and make your fame resound.

analyzed: idam brāhmaṇa tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: Brahman, this is the previous sign of that dream.

original: yattvayā brāhmaṇa svapne dṛṣṭā bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi tāni tava kukṣau praviśya padmeṣu paryaṅkopaviṣṭā dhyāyanti /
analyzed: yat tvayā brāhmaṇa svapne dṛṣṭāḥ bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi tāni tava kukṣau praviśya padmeṣu paryaṅka upaviṣṭāḥ dhyāyanti
translated: Brahman, in your dream you saw hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Bodhisattvas entering your womb and meditating cross-legged on lotuses.

original: abhisaṃbuddhabodhiśca tvaṃ brāhmaṇa bahuprāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi yānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayiṣyasi avaivartikāni sthāpayiṣyasyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddha bodhiḥ ca tvam brāhmaṇa bahu prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi yāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayiṣyasi a vaivartikāni sthāpayiṣyasi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: You will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect awakening, Brahmin, and you will inspire many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings to the unsurpassed and perfect awakening, and you will establish them in irreversibility from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: te tava parinirvṛtasya brāhmaṇānuttareṇa parinirvāṇena buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu kalpeṣu paścāddaśāsu dikṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu te buddhā bhagavanto dharmeṇa rājyaṃ kārayantastava varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyanti /
analyzed: te tava parinirvṛtasya brāhmaṇa anuttareṇa parinirvāṇena buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu kalpeṣu paścāt daśāsu dikṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmeṇa rājyam kārayantaḥ tava varṇam bhāṣiṣyanti
translated: After your parinirvāṇa, Brahmin, in the future, in the ten directions, in other buddha-fields, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, ruling their kingdoms through the Dharma, will speak your praises.

original: evam asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣvatikrānteṣu evaṃnāmā tathāgato abhūd arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: evam asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu atikrānteṣu evaṃnāmā tathāgataḥ abhūt arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: In this way, after countless eons have passed, 'Such and such a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One appeared.'

original: tena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vayamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃboddhau samādāpitā vinītā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā avaivartikāśca sthāpitā /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena vayam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃboddhau samādāpitāḥ vinītāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ a vaivartikāḥ ca sthāpitāḥ
translated: By that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, we were inspired, trained, introduced, established, and placed in irreversibility in unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

analyzed: yena vayam etarhi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: By whom we have now fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

analyzed: dharma rājyam ca pratilabdhāḥ
translated: And we have attained the kingdom of the Dharma.

analyzed: idam brāhmaṇa tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: Brahmin, this is the previous sign of that dream.

original: yattvaṃ brāhmaṇa svapne dṛṣṭavān sūkaramukhena yāvacchvamukhena rudhiramrakṣitena gātreṇānekavidhāṃ prāṇino bhakṣayitvā hīna eraṇḍamūle niṣaṇṇāste'pyanye vividhaiḥ prāṇibhirbhakṣyante yāvadasthiśaṅkalāvaśeṣā utsṛjyante /
analyzed: yat tvam brāhmaṇa svapne dṛṣṭavān sūkara mukhena yāvat śva mukhena rudhira mrakṣitena gātreṇa anekavidhām prāṇinaḥ bhakṣayitvā hīne eraṇḍa mūle niṣaṇṇāḥ te api anye vividhaiḥ prāṇibhiḥ bhakṣyante yāvat asthiśaṅkalā avaśeṣāḥ utsṛjyante
translated: What you saw in the dream, Brahmin, with a pig's face up to a dog's face, with a body smeared with blood, having eaten many kinds of living beings, and sitting at the foot of a castor-oil plant, and those others being eaten by various kinds of living beings until only a skeleton remains, and then being abandoned,

original: punarapyāpyāyitakāyā rudhirābhyaktena kāyena yāvacchvamukhena bahuvidhāṃ prāṇino bhakṣayitvā punarhīnasyairaṇḍavṛkṣasya mūle niṣaṇṇā vividhaiśca prāṇibhiḥ khādyante /
analyzed: punar api āpyāyita kāyāḥ rudhira abhyaktena kāyena yāvat śvamukhena bahuvidhām prāṇinaḥ bhakṣayitvā punar hīnasya eraṇḍa vṛkṣasya mūle niṣaṇṇāḥ vividhaiḥ ca prāṇibhiḥ khādyante
translated: and again with a body that has grown, with a body smeared with blood, up to a dog's face, having eaten many kinds of living beings, and again sitting at the foot of a low castor-oil plant, and being eaten by various kinds of living beings,

original: te tvayā mohapuruṣāstrividhe puṇyakriyāvastuni samādāpitā prātiṣṭhāpitā dāne yame saṃyame ca /
analyzed: te tvayā moha puruṣāḥ trividhe puṇya kriyā vastuni samādāpitā prātiṣṭhāpitā dāne yame saṃyame ca
translated: those deluded people were encouraged and established by you in the three types of meritorious deeds, in giving, in restraint, and in self-control.

analyzed: te deveṣu cyavana duḥkham abhilaṣanti
translated: They desire the suffering of falling from the gods.

analyzed: manuṣyeṣu jarā vyādhi maraṇa apriya saṃprayoga priya vinābhāva duḥkhām preteṣu kṣudh pipāsa duḥkham tiryakṣu anyonya bhakṣaṇa duḥkham nārakeṣu dāha cheda vadha bandhana nānāvidha kāraṇa ādi duḥkham abhilaṣanti
translated: Among humans, they desire the suffering of old age, disease, death, association with the unpleasant, separation from the pleasant, and suffering. Among pretas, they desire the suffering of hunger and thirst. Among animals, they desire the suffering of devouring each other. Among hell beings, they desire the suffering of burning, cutting, killing, binding, and various other causes.

original: trividhe ca puṇyakriyāvastuni pratiṣṭhāpitā deveṣu devarājyamabhilaṣanti manuṣyeṣu caikadvīpaiśvaryamākāṅkṣante /
analyzed: trividhe ca puṇya kriyā vastuni pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ deveṣu deva rājyam abhilaṣanti manuṣyeṣu ca eka dvīpa aiśvaryam ākāṅkṣante
translated: And having been established in the three types of meritorious deeds, they desire the sovereignty of the gods among the gods, and the prosperity of one continent among humans.

analyzed: teṣām tatra sarva sattvāḥ paribhogam gacchanti
translated: And all beings there become objects of enjoyment for them.

analyzed: te api ca sarva sattvānām āhāra paribhogam gacchanti
translated: And all beings become objects of food and enjoyment for them.

original: evaṃ te mohapuruṣāḥ sarve tvayā trividhe puṇyakriyāvastuni pratiṣṭhāpitāstavopāsakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: evam te moha puruṣāḥ sarve tvayā trividhe puṇya kriyā vastuni pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ tava upāsakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Thus, all those deluded men, having been established by you in the three types of meritorious deeds, will become your lay disciples.

analyzed: idam brāhmaṇa tasya svapnasya pūrva nimittam
translated: Brahmin, this is the previous sign of that dream.

original: yattvaṃ brāhmaṇa svapnamadrākṣīt apare manuṣyā mahiṣarathābhirūdhāḥ sumanāmālālāṅkṛtaśirasaḥ apathena dakṣiṇābhimukhaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: yat tvam brāhmaṇa svapnam adrākṣīt apare manuṣyāḥ mahiṣa ratha abhirūdhāḥ sumanā mālā lāṅkṛta śirasaḥ apathena dakṣiṇa abhimukham gacchanti
translated: Brahmin, you saw in the dream other men mounted on buffalo chariots, their heads adorned with garlands and necklaces, going by an untraveled path facing south.

original: te'pi tvayā brāhmaṇa kulaputrāḥ triṣu puṇyakriyāvastuṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ kevalamātmadamanārthaṃ ātmaśamanārthaṃ śrāvakayānasaṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: te api tvayā brāhmaṇa kula putrāḥ triṣu puṇya kriyā vastuṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ kevalam ātma damana artham ātma śamana artham śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Those sons of good family whom you have established in the three bases of meritorious action, O Brahmin, are only intent on self-control and the pacification of the self, and have set out in the vehicle of the disciples.

analyzed: teṣām śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitānām brāhmaṇa pudgalānām idam
translated: This is a previous sign, O Brahmin, for those individuals who have set out in the vehicle of the disciples.

original: atha khalu kulaputra brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇū rājānamāraṇeminametadavocat durlabhaṃ mahārāja manuṣyatvaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ rājānam āraṇeminam etat avocat durlabham mahā rāja manuṣya tvam
translated: Then, O son of good family, the Brahmin Samudrarenu said this to King Aranemin: O great king, human birth is rare.

analyzed: durlabhā kṣaṇa saṃpad
translated: The perfection of a moment is rare.

analyzed: durlabham udumbara puṣpa sadṛśānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām prādurbhāvaḥ loke
translated: The appearance in the world of Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones, who are like the Uḍumbara flower, is rare.

analyzed: durlabhaḥ kuśala dharme chandaḥ
translated: Desire for wholesome dharmas is rare.

analyzed: durlabham samyak praṇidhānam
translated: Right aspiration is rare.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam mahā rāja deva rāja tvam
translated: O great king, the state of being a king of the gods is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam mahā rāja manuṣyeṣu ca eka dvīpa aiśvarya rāja tvam
translated: O great king, the state of being a king of humans in one of the continents is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: duḥkha utpatti bhūtam dvis tris cāturdvīpika rāja tvam
translated: The state of being a king of two, three, or four continents is the origin of suffering.

analyzed: ciram mahā rāja saṃsāra duḥkham anubhavitavyam
translated: O great king, you will experience the suffering of cyclic existence for a long time.

analyzed: anavasthitāḥ mahā rāja vāyu vega capalāḥ deva manuṣya saṃpattayaḥ
translated: O great king, the prosperity of gods and humans is unstable, fickle as the wind.

original: dakacandropamā bālāḥ pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇairatṛptā viṣayeṣu mattā devamāṇuṣāṃ śriyamabhilaṣanti /
analyzed: daka candra upamāḥ bālāḥ pañcabhiḥ kāma guṇaiḥ atṛptāḥ viṣayeṣu mattāḥ deva māṇuṣām śriyam abhilaṣanti
translated: The foolish, like the moon reflected in water, are not satisfied with the five sense pleasures. Intoxicated by objects, they desire the prosperity of gods and humans.

original: te bālāḥ punaḥ punarnarakeṣu kāraṇāduḥkhamanubhavanti tiryakṣu saṃmohaduḥkhaṃ preteṣu kṣutpipāsāduḥkhaṃ manuṣyeṣu priyaviprayogaduḥkhaṃ deveṣu cyavanaduḥkhaṃ punargarbhavāsaduḥkhaṃ parasparaśīrṣaprapātanaduḥkhaṃ anyonyabhakṣaṇaduḥkhaṃ /
analyzed: te bālāḥ punar punar narakeṣu kāraṇā duḥkham anubhavanti tiryakṣu saṃmoha duḥkham preteṣu kṣudh pipāsā duḥkham manuṣyeṣu priya viprayoga duḥkham deveṣu cyavana duḥkham punar garbha vāsa duḥkham paraspara śīrṣa prapātana duḥkham anyonya bhakṣaṇa duḥkham
translated: Those fools again and again experience the suffering of burning in the hells, the suffering of confusion among animals, the suffering of hunger and thirst among hungry ghosts, the suffering of separation from the beloved among humans, the suffering of falling from heaven among gods, the suffering of being in the womb again, the suffering of falling on each other's heads, the suffering of devouring each other.

analyzed: evam bhramamāṇāḥ bālāḥ duḥkham anubhavanti
translated: Thus wandering, the foolish experience suffering.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: kalyāṇamitravirahitāḥ samyakpraṇidhānaṃ na kurvanti na vyāyamanti aprāptasya prāptaye'nadhigatasyādhigamāyāsākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai /
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra virahitāḥ samyak praṇidhānam na kurvanti na vyāyamanti a prāptasya prāptaye an adhigatasya adhigamāya a sākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai
translated: Separated from spiritual friends, they do not make correct aspirations, do not strive for the attainment of what has not been attained, for the realization of what has not been realized, for the direct realization of what has not been directly realized.

original: evaṃ mūrkhā bālāḥ khidyante bodhicittena yatra sarvaduḥkhakṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: evam mūrkhāḥ bālāḥ khidyante bodhi cittena yatra sarva duḥkha kṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus fools and the ignorant tire themselves with the Awakening Mind, where all suffering is extinguished.

original: saṃsāreṇa ca na khidyante nodvijanti yatra punaḥ punarduḥkhotpattirbhavati /
analyzed: saṃsāreṇa ca na khidyante na udvijanti yatra punar punar duḥkha utpattiḥ bhavati
translated: And they are not weary of saṃsāra, they do not become disgusted, since suffering arises again and again.

original: parīkṣasva mahārāja yathā saṃsāraḥ sarvaduḥkhānāṃ bhājanabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: parīkṣasva mahā rāja yathā saṃsāraḥ sarva duḥkhānām bhājana bhūtaḥ
translated: Examine, great king, how saṃsāra is the vessel of all sufferings.

original: tasmāttarhi tvaṃ mahārāja kṛtādhikāro bhagavataḥ śāsane'varopitakuśalamūlastriṣu ratneṣu labdhaprasādaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi tvam mahā rāja kṛta adhikāraḥ bhagavataḥ śāsanā iva aropita kuśala mūlaḥ triṣu ratneṣu labdha prasādaḥ
translated: Therefore, great king, you who have rendered service to the Blessed One's teaching, planted the roots of virtue, gained faith in the Three Jewels,

original: bhagavato dattadāno mahābhogatāyai rakṣitaśīlaḥ svargopapattipratilābhāya śruto bhagavato'ntikāddharmaṃ prajñāmahādharmapratilābhāya te saṃpatsyante
analyzed: bhagavataḥ datta dānaḥ mahā bhoga tāyai rakṣita śīlaḥ svarga upapatti pratilābhāya śrutaḥ bhagavataḥ untikāt dharmam prajñā mahā dharma pratilābhāya te saṃpatsyante
translated: given gifts to the Blessed One for the sake of great wealth, guarded morality for the sake of rebirth in heaven, heard the Dharma from the Blessed One for the sake of great wisdom, those [roots of virtue] will be fulfilled for you.

analyzed: yaṣṭa yajñaḥ tvam mahā rāja utpādāya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: You have performed sacrifices, great king, for the sake of generating the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: āha alam brāhmaṇa
translated: He said: Enough, brahmin.

analyzed: na aham brāhmaṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhilaṣāmi saṃsāra abhirataḥ
translated: I do not desire unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, brahmin, I delight in saṃsāra.

original: yanmahābrāhmaṇa mayā dānaṃ dattaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ dharmaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: yat mahā brāhmaṇa mayā dānam dattam śīlam rakṣitam dharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: Whatever gifts I have given, brahmin, whatever morality I have guarded, whatever Dharma I have heard,

analyzed: durlabhā hi brāhmaṇa anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain, brahmin.

original: dvirapi samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo rājānamāha śuddho mahārāja bodhimārgaḥ /
analyzed: dvis api samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājānam āha  śuddhaḥ mahā rāja bodhi mārgaḥ
translated: The brahmin Samudrarenu said to the king for a second time: The path to enlightenment is pure, great king, by intention.

analyzed: āśayena praṇidhānam kartavyam
translated: A vow should be made.

analyzed: paripūrya abhiprasannaḥ sa mārga udhyā āśayena viśuddhaḥ
translated: That path is fulfilled and clear, purified by superior intention.

analyzed: ṛjuḥ sa mārgaḥ aśaṭhaḥ
translated: That path is straight, not crooked.

analyzed: śuddhaḥ sa mārgaḥ kleśa pravāhaka tvāt
translated: That path is pure, free from the flow of afflictions.

analyzed: vipulā usau mārgaḥ an āvarṇa tvāt
translated: That path is vast, free from dispraise.

analyzed: samavasaraṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ cintanāya
translated: That path is inclusive, to be contemplated.

original: nirbhayaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvapāpākaraṇatayā /🔽sumṛduḥ sa mārgaḥ dānapāramitayā /
analyzed: nirbhayaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva pāpa ākaraṇa tayā  su mṛduḥ sa mārgaḥ dānapāramitayā
translated: That path is fearless, due to not committing any evil.🔽That path is very gentle, due to the perfection of generosity.

original: śītalaḥ sa mārgaḥ śīlapāramitayā /🔽nirāśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ kṣāntipāramitayā /
analyzed: śītalaḥ sa mārgaḥ śīla pāramitayā  nirāśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ kṣānti pāramitayā
translated: That path is cool, due to the perfection of morality.🔽That path is without support, due to the perfection of patience.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna āśrayaḥ sa mārgaḥ vīrya pāramitayā
translated: That path is based on support, due to the perfection of effort.

analyzed: anāvilaḥ sa mārgaḥ dhyānapāramitayā
translated: That path is untroubled, due to the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: su viditaḥ sa mārgaḥ prajñāpāramitayā
translated: That path is well-known, due to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: su prasannaḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā maitryā
translated: That path is very clear, due to great loving-kindness.

analyzed: svabhāva jñāna anugataḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā karuṇayā
translated: That path is endowed with the knowledge of intrinsic nature, due to great compassion.

analyzed: sadā ānanditaḥ sa mārgaḥ mahā muditayā
translated: That path is always joyful, due to great sympathetic joy.

analyzed: akliṣṭaḥ sa mārgaḥ upekṣayā
translated: That path is unafflicted, due to equanimity.

analyzed: apagata kaṇṭakaḥ sa mārgaḥ kāma vyāpāda vihiṃsā vitarkaiḥ
translated: That path is free from thorns, because of thoughts of desire, malice, and harm.

original: kṣemaṃgamanaḥ sa mārgo'pratihatacittatayā /🔽dhūrtavirahitaḥ sa mārgaḥ rūpaśabdagandharasasparśaviditatvāt /
analyzed: kṣemaṃgamanaḥ sa mārga upratihata citta tayā  dhūrta virahitaḥ sa mārgaḥ rūpa śabda gandha rasa sparśa vidita tvāt
translated: That path is safe to travel, because of unobstructed mind.🔽That path is free from rogues, because of knowing form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

analyzed: nihata māra pratyarthikaḥ sa mārgaḥ dhātu āyatana su vimṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: That path has defeated the enemy of the aggregates, because of well-examined elements and sense bases.

analyzed: su prabodhaḥ sa mārgaḥ avidyā andhakāra nirāvaraṇa tvāt
translated: That path is well-awakened, because of the absence of the darkness of ignorance.

analyzed: dṛḍha vīrya sattva citta gamanaḥ sa mārgaḥ apagata śrāvaka pratyekabuddha manasikāra tvāt
translated: That path goes with a firm mind of diligence, because of the absence of thoughts of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: utsoḍhaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva tathāgata dhiṣṭhita tvāt
translated: That path is well-endured, because of being empowered by all tathāgatas.

analyzed: mahā ratna niṣpādakaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvajña tā ratna anukūla tvāt
translated: That path produces great jewels, because it is favorable to the jewel of omniscience.

analyzed: sadā prakāśitaḥ sa mārgaḥ asaṅga jñānasya bhagavataḥ
translated: That path is always illuminated, because of the Blessed One's unobstructed knowledge.

original: kuśalamūladeśakānucīrṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarvatathāgatānugṛhītatvāt /🔽duṣṭakleśānukūlavigataḥ sa mārgaḥ anunayapratighaprahīṇatvāt /
analyzed: kuśala mūla deśaka anucīrṇaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva tathāgata anugṛhīta tvāt  duṣṭa kleśa anukūla vigataḥ sa mārgaḥ anunaya pratigha prahīṇa tvāt
translated: That path is practiced by those who teach the roots of virtue, because it is favored by all tathāgatas.🔽That path is free from the defilements that are favorable to the evil afflictions, because of the abandonment of attachment and aversion.

analyzed: nihata rajaḥ sa mārgaḥ vyāpāda khila krodha apagata tvāt
translated: That path has defeated the dust, because of the absence of malice, resentment, and anger.

analyzed: sugati gamanīyaḥ sa mārgaḥ sarva akuśala virahita tvāt
translated: That path leads to a good rebirth because it is free from all non-virtue.

analyzed: kṣemaṃgamaḥ mahā rāja saṃbodhi mārgaḥ nirvāṇa paryavasānaḥ
translated: Great King, the path to complete enlightenment is safe because it ends in nirvana.

analyzed: utpādaya mahā rāja bodhi cittam
translated: Great King, generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: rājā prāha ayaṃ brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ aśītivarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ loka utpanno /
analyzed: rājā prāha ayam brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām loke utpannaḥ
translated: The king said, Brahmin, the Tathagata has appeared in the world when the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years.

analyzed: na śakyam tathāgatena sarva ipāyaḥ śamayitum
translated: It is not possible for the Tathagata to pacify all lower realms.

original: ye sattvā avaruptakuśalamūlaste sattvāḥ phale sthitāḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlaḥ te sattvāḥ phale sthitāḥ
translated: Those beings who have planted the roots of virtue are beings who have attained the fruits.

analyzed: kecid samādhi dhāraṇī kṣāntiṣu niṣpannāḥ
translated: Some have perfected concentration, dharani, and patience.

original: utkṛṣṭakuśalamūlāstu ye sattvāste bodhau avaivartyāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: utkṛṣṭa kuśala mūlāḥ tu ye sattvāḥ te bodhau a vaivartyāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: Those beings with excellent roots of virtue have become irreversible from enlightenment.

analyzed: kecid avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ deva manuṣya śriyam anubhavanti
translated: Some who have planted the roots of virtue experience the glory of gods and humans.

analyzed: svaka svakaiḥ sattvāḥ kuśala akuśalaiḥ karmabhiḥ bhramanti
translated: Beings wander due to their own virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: katame sattvā bhagavatā vinītāḥ sadekasattvasyāpi duḥkhaṃ na praśāntaṃ /
analyzed: katame sattvāḥ bhagavatā vinītāḥ sat eka sattvasya api duḥkham na praśāntam
translated: Which beings have been guided by the Blessed One? The suffering of not even a single being has not been pacified.

analyzed: kṣetra bhūtaḥ kevalam bhagavataḥ āśrayaḥ
translated: The Blessed One's body is merely a field.

analyzed: na an avarupta kuśala mūlānām sattvānām duḥkha mocanam karoti
translated: He does not liberate beings who have not planted the roots of virtue from suffering.

analyzed: utpādayāmi aham bodhi cittam
translated: I generate the mind of awakening.

original: bodhisattvacaryāṃ caraṃstenāhaṃ mahājñānasamucchrayeṇa acintyenodāreṇa dharmamukhapraveśena sattvān vinayeyaṃ buddhakāryaṃ ca kuryāṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva caryām caran tena aham mahā jñāna samucchrayeṇa acintyena udāreṇa dharma mukha praveśena sattvān vinayeyam buddha kāryam ca kuryām
translated: Practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, through that great accumulation of wisdom, with an inconceivable, vast entrance into the Dharma gates, I will discipline beings and perform the activities of a Buddha.

original: na kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhāya cittaṃ pariṇāmayeyaṃ /
analyzed: na kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhāya cittam pariṇāmayeyam
translated: I will not only direct my mind towards awakening in this defiled Buddha field.

analyzed: yadi aham tādṛśam buddhakṣetram labheyam utpādayeyam aham bodhi cittam
translated: If I obtain such a Buddha field, I will generate the mind of awakening.

original: tadāhaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yadāhamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ ca spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: tadā aham bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi yadā aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ca spṛśeyam
translated: Then I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva until I attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvaṃ ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ duḥkhaṃ praśamayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sarvam ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām duḥkham praśamayeyam
translated: And I will completely pacify all suffering for beings in that Buddha field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastādṛśamṛddhyabhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskṛtavān tadādarśavyūhaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tādṛśam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān tat ādarśavyūham nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, performed a miracle of supernormal power, and entered the samadhi called Array of Mirrors.

original: tathā samāhitena bhagavatā ādarśavyūhe samādhau tathārūpāvabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāhitena bhagavatā ādarśa vyūhe samādhau tathārūpa avabhāsaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, with his mind thus concentrated, manifested a radiance in the Adarśavyuha concentration.

original: yenāvabhāsena daśasu dikṣvekaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaḥ sarvaguṇavyūhā dṛṣyante /
analyzed: yena avabhāsena daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ sarva guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣyante
translated: By that radiance, in the ten directions, in each direction, worlds as numerous as the particles in a thousand buddha-fields were seen, all adorned with good qualities.

analyzed: keṣucid buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: In some, the Blessed Buddhas had passed into parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: keṣucid parinirvāṇāya saṃsthitāḥ
translated: In some, they were present, about to pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: yatra ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bodhivṛkṣamūle niṣaṇṇā māraṃ parājayanti /
analyzed: yatra ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bodhivṛkṣa mūle niṣaṇṇāḥ māram parājayanti
translated: In some, the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas were seated at the foot of the Bodhi tree, conquering Māra.

analyzed: yatra ca acira abhisaṃbuddhāḥ dharmacakram pravartayanti
translated: In some, they had just attained enlightenment and were turning the wheel of the Dharma.

analyzed: yatra ca acira pravṛtta dharmacakram dharmam deśayanti
translated: In some, they were teaching the Dharma, having just set the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

original: yatra ca buddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sphuṭāṃ buddhakṣetrāṃ /
analyzed: yatra ca buddhānām bodhisattvānām sphuṭām buddhakṣetrām
translated: In some, the buddha-fields were filled with Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yatra śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām utpādaḥ na asti
translated: In some, there was no arising of śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: yatra ca śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ utpadyante
translated: In some, śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas were arising.

original: yatra ca śūnyaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ buddhebhyo bodhisattvebhyaḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yatra ca śūnyam buddhakṣetram buddhebhyaḥ bodhisattvebhyaḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ
translated: In some, the buddha-fields were empty of Buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: kvacid kliṣṭam buddhakṣetram pañca kaṣāyam
translated: In some places, the Buddha-field is defiled with the five degenerations.

analyzed: kvacid pariśuddham apagata pañca kaṣāyam
translated: In some places, it is pure, free from the five degenerations.

analyzed: kvacid utkṛṣṭāḥ sattvāḥ  kvacid hīnāḥ  kvacid dīrgha āyuṣkāḥ
translated: In some places, the beings are excellent.🔽In some places, they are inferior.🔽In some places, they have long lives.

analyzed: kvacid alpa āyuṣkāḥ
translated: In some places, they have short lives.

analyzed: kānicid buddhakṣetrāni agninā saṃvartante
translated: Some Buddha-fields are destroyed by fire.

analyzed: kānicid udakena  kānicid vāyunā  kvacid vivartante
translated: Some by water.🔽Some by wind.🔽Some are in the process of formation.

analyzed: kvacid vivṛttāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: Some, having been formed, remain.

analyzed: te sarve udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: All of them are seen filled with a vast light.

original: sarvāvatī sā parṣattāṃ dṛṣṭvā buddhakṣetre guṇavyūhān /
analyzed: sarvāvatī sā parṣad tām dṛṣṭvā buddhakṣetre guṇa vyūhān
translated: The entire assembly, having seen the array of qualities in the Buddha-field,

original: samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ punā rājānametadavocat paśya mahārājaitān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān /
analyzed: samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ punar rājānam etat avocat paśya mahā rāja etān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān
translated: the brahmin Samudrarenu again said to the king, Your Majesty, behold these arrays of qualities in the Buddha-field.

analyzed: utpādaya mahā rājan uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Generate the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment, Your Majesty.

analyzed: gṛhāṇa mahā rāja buddhakṣetram yādṛśam ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Take up the Buddha-field, Your Majesty, as you wish.

original: athāraṇemī rājā yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat kena bhagavan karmaṇā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ
analyzed: atha araṇemī rājā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat kena bhagavan karmaṇā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddham buddhakṣetram
translated: Then King Aranemi, having bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands, said this to the Blessed One: By what karma, Blessed One, does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva obtain a pure buddha-field?

analyzed: kena karmaṇā a pariśuddham
translated: By what karma is it impure?

analyzed: utkṛṣṭāḥ sattvāḥ kena karmaṇā
translated: By what karma are the beings excellent?

analyzed: yāvat dīrgha āyuṣkāḥ sattvāḥ vistaraḥ
translated: Up to: how do beings become long-lived? Please explain this in detail.

original: bhagavān āha praṇidhānavaśena mahārāja bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti apagatapañcakaṣāyaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha praṇidhāna vaśena mahā rāja bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pariśuddham buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇāti apagata pañca kaṣāyam
translated: The Blessed One said: Great King, by the power of his vow, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva obtains a pure buddha-field, free from the five degenerations.

analyzed: praṇidhānena a pariśuddham
translated: By vow, an impure [field].

original: rājā prāha ahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan nagaraṃ praviśyaikāgre niṣadya praṇidhānaṃ cintayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: rājā prāha aham bhadanta bhagavat nagaram praviśya ekāgre niṣadya praṇidhānam cintayiṣyāmi
translated: The king said: Venerable Blessed One, having entered the city, sitting in seclusion, I will contemplate the vow.

original: tathārūpaṃ me buddhakṣetramapagatapañcakaṣāyaṃ rocate tatremā subhavacaryā pariṇāmayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tathārūpam me buddhakṣetram apagata pañca kaṣāyam rocate tatra imā su bhava caryā pariṇāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I desire such a buddha-field, free from the five degenerations, and there I will dedicate the practice of good conduct.

original: bhagavān āha yasyedānīṃ mahārāja kālaṃ manyase /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yasya idānīm mahā rāja kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said: Great King, if you think the time is right.

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavato'ntikāt prakāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhikṣu saṅgham ca triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ antikāt prakāntaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, King Arṇemī bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and the community of monks, circumambulated them three times, and departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: nagaraṃ praviśya svake gṛha ekāgraḥ pratisaṃlīno niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: nagaram praviśya svake gṛhe ekāgraḥ pratisaṃlīnaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having entered the city, he sat alone in his own house, absorbed in concentration.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam vyūham cintayati
translated: He contemplated the adornment of the vow for a Buddha-field.

analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jyeṣṭham rāja putram animiṣam āmantrayati
translated: Then, the brāhmaṇa Sāgara­meghas addressed his eldest prince, Animiṣa:

analyzed: utpādaya tvam animiṣa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: You, Animiṣa, should arouse the mind for highest genuine full Awakening.

original: yacca tvayā tribhiḥ puṇyakriyāvastubhiḥ śubhaṃ caratā puṇyamārjitaṃ tatsarvamanuttarayāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayā /
analyzed: yat ca tvayā tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ śubham caratā puṇyam ārjitam tat sarvam anuttarayām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayā
translated: And whatever merit you have acquired by performing the three kinds of meritorious deeds, you should dedicate it all to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: sa prāha ahamapyupādhyāya svagṛhaṃ gatvaikākī rahogato niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃścintayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: sa prāha aham api upādhyāya sva gṛham gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān cintayiṣyāmi
translated: He said, Teacher, I too will go to my own house, sit alone in private, and contemplate the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field.

analyzed: yadi bodhāya cittam utpatsyate
translated: If the mind for Awakening arises,

analyzed: punar āgamya bhagavataḥ sakāśam bodhi cittam pariṇāmayiṣyāmi
translated: I will return to the Blessed One and dedicate the Awakening Mind.

original: ataḥ so'pi rājaputro bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavato'ntikāt prakāntaḥ /
analyzed: atas saḥ api rāja putraḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavataḥ antikāt prakāntaḥ
translated: Therefore, that prince also bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and circumambulated the assembly of monks three times, and departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: svakaṃ niveśanaṃ gatvā ekākī rahogato niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ cintayati /
analyzed: svakam niveśanam gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayati
translated: Having gone to his own house, he sat alone in private and contemplated the array of qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohito dvitīyaṃ rājaputraṃ nimantrayitvovāca /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ dvitīyam rāja putram nimantrayitvā uvāca
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, invited the second prince and said:

analyzed: utpādaya tvam kumāra bodhi cittam
translated: You, prince, should generate the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: vistareṇa peyālam yāvat
translated: In detail, as before.

analyzed: sarva rāja putra sahasram bodhau samādāpayati
translated: He inspired a thousand princes to enlightenment.

analyzed: caturaśītiḥ koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi
translated: Eighty-four thousand provincial kings,

original: anyāni ca navatiḥ koṭyaḥ sattvānāṃ bodhau samādāpayati /
analyzed: anyāni ca navatiḥ koṭyaḥ sattvānām bodhau samādāpayati
translated: and another ninety koṭis of beings, he inspired to enlightenment.

analyzed: te api sarve evam āhuḥ
translated: They all said:

original: vayamapi svasvagṛhaṃ gatvaikākino niṣadya buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ cintayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api sva sva gṛham gatvā ekākinaḥ niṣadya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too, having gone to our own homes, sitting alone, will contemplate the array of qualities of the Buddha-field.

original: evamuktvā sarva eva svagṛhāṇi gatvaikākino niṣaṇṇāḥ saptavarṣāṇi buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānāni cintayanti //
analyzed: evam uktvā sarve eva sva gṛhāṇi gatvā ekākinaḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ sapta varṣāṇi buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānāni cintayanti
translated: Having said this, they all went to their own houses and sat alone, contemplating the vows for the adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-field for seven years.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyaivaṃ apareṇa samayena cetasaḥ parivitarka udāpādi /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya evam apareṇa samayena cetasaḥ parivitarkaḥ udāpādi
translated: Then, noble son, at another time, the thought arose in the mind of the brahmin Samudrareṇu:

analyzed: mayā khalu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bahu prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi samādāpitāni
translated: I have indeed inspired many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings towards the highest, complete enlightenment,

original: ayaṃ ca mayā buddho bhagavān saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakarṇairupanimantritaḥ sārdhamaparimitena bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: ayam ca mayā buddhaḥ bhagavān sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakarṇaiḥ upanimantritaḥ sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: and I have invited this Buddha, the Blessed One, for seven years with all the requisites, together with an immeasurable assembly of monks.

original: yadi ca mamānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryate tathā cāyaṃ praṇidhānaṃ saṃpadyate yad ahaṃ devāsuragandharvayakṣarākṣasakumbhāṇḍān asmin mahāyajñe samādāpayāmi /
analyzed: yadi ca mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryate tathā ca ayam praṇidhānam saṃpadyate yat aham deva asura gandharva yakṣa rākṣasa kumbhāṇḍān asmin mahā yajñe samādāpayāmi
translated: If my hope for the highest, complete enlightenment is to be fulfilled, and if this vow is to be accomplished, then I will inspire the gods, asuras, gandharvas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, and kumbhāṇḍas in this great sacrifice.

original: atha kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ purohito vaiśravaṇamākāṅkṣate darśanāya /
analyzed: atha kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ purohitaḥ vaiśravaṇam ākāṅkṣate darśanāya
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, the priest, desired to see Vaiśravaṇa.

original: atha khalu vaiśravaṇo mahārājānekairyakṣaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto yena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastenopajagāmopetya samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyāgrataḥ sthitvaitadavocat kiṃ brāhmaṇa matto hyākāṅkṣase /
analyzed: atha khalu vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rāja anekaiḥ yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ yena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upajagāma upetya samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya agratas sthitvā etat avocat kim brāhmaṇa mattaḥ hi ākāṅkṣase
translated: Then the great king Vaiśravaṇa, surrounded and attended by many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, approached the brahmin Samudrareṇu. Having approached, he stood in front of the brahmin Samudrareṇu and said this: What do you desire from me, brahmin?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha kaḥ bhavān
translated: The brahmin said: Who are you?

original: vaiśrāvaṇaḥ prāha śrutaṃ tvayā brāhmaṇāsti vaiśravaṇo nāma yakṣādhipatiḥ /
analyzed: vaiśrāvaṇaḥ prāha śrutam tvayā brāhmaṇa asti vaiśravaṇaḥ nāma yakṣa adhipatiḥ
translated: Vaiśravaṇa said: Brahmin, have you heard that there is a lord of the yakṣas named Vaiśravaṇa?

original: so ahaṃ / brāhmaṇa kim ājñāpayasi kiṃ karavāṇi / /
analyzed: saḥ u aham brāhmaṇa kim ājñāpayasi kim karavāṇi
translated: That is me. Brahmin, what do you command? What can I do for you?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha
translated: The brahmin said:

analyzed: śṛṇu yakṣa adhipate iham bhagavat pūjām kariṣye
translated: Listen, lord of the yakṣas! I will make offerings to the Blessed One.

analyzed: tvam atra autsukyam āpadyasva
translated: You should take interest in this.

original: sa prāha tathāstu yathā tvaṃ brāhmaṇākāṅkṣase /
analyzed: sa prāha tathā astu yathā tvam brāhmaṇa ākāṅkṣase
translated: He said, So be it! As you desire, brahmin.

original: tena hi tvaṃ mahārāja yākṣān asmākaṃ vacanenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpaya /
analyzed: tena hi tvam mahā rāja yākṣān asmākam vacanena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpaya
translated: Therefore, great king, you should encourage the yakṣas in our words to generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam ca punar samādāpaya
translated: And you should encourage them like this:

analyzed: saced yūyam yakṣāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau arthikāḥ gacchata
translated: If you yakṣas are interested in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, go to the Blessed One.

analyzed: yūyam pārāt samudrasya gośīrṣam uraga sāra candanam ānayantu
translated: You bring from the other side of the ocean the sandalwood called gośīrṣa and uragasāra.

analyzed: apare bhagavataḥ ūrthe gandham apare vividhām puṣpān
translated: Others for the sake of the Blessed One, others various flowers.

analyzed: yena aham divase divase bhagavataḥ pūjām kariṣyāmi
translated: So that I can make offerings to the Blessed One day by day.

analyzed: evam astu brāhmaṇa
translated: The Blessed One said, Let it be so, brahmin.

original: vaiśravaṇo mahārājā tasya brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya tatraivāntarhitaḥ bherīmāhatya yakṣarākṣasāṃ sannipātyaitadavocat yat khalu mārṣā jānīyuḥ /
analyzed: vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājā tasya brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya tatra eva antarhitaḥ bherīm āhatya yakṣa rākṣasām sannipātya etat avocat yat khalu mārṣāḥ jānīyuḥ
translated: The great king Vaiśravaṇa, having promised the brahmin, disappeared right there and, having beaten the drum, having assembled the yakṣas and rākṣasas, said this: Whatever you know, sirs,

analyzed: ayam jambudvīpe samudrareṇuḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: in this Jambudvīpa, the brahmin named Samudrarenu, the chief priest of King Araṇemi,

original: taṃ ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṅghena saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakaraṇairupasthāsyati /
analyzed: tam ratnagarbham tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham sārdham bhikṣu saṅghena sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upasthāsyati
translated: will serve the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with the Saṅgha of monks, for seven years with all requisites.

analyzed: tat yuṣmābhiḥ tat kuśalam anumoditavyam
translated: You should rejoice in that wholesome action.

original: tena ca yūyaṃ kuśalamūlenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayatā /
analyzed: tena ca yūyam kuśala mūlena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayatā
translated: And you should generate the mind of enlightenment in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through that wholesome root.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahuyakṣarākṣasakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi añjaliṃ kṛtvocuḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bahu yakṣa rākṣasa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi añjalim kṛtvā ūcuḥ
translated: At that time, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of yakshas and rakshasas, with palms joined, said:

original: yaḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya puṇyābhisyandaḥ kuśalābhiṣyando ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakaraṇairupatiṣṭhati sārdhamaparimitena bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: yaḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya puṇya abhisyandaḥ kuśala abhiṣyandaḥ ratnagarbham tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upatiṣṭhati sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: The merit and wholesome accumulation of Samudrarena the brahmin, who for seven years served the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, together with an immeasurable assembly of monks with all requisites,

original: tatsarvaṃ vayaṃ puṇyaskandhamanumodāmastena ca kuśalamūlenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyemahi /
analyzed: tat sarvam vayam puṇya skandham anumodāmaḥ tena ca kuśala mūlena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyemahi
translated: we rejoice in all that accumulation of merit, and through that root of merit, may we attain perfect supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ prāha śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ
translated: The great king Vaishravana said, Listen, sirs.

original: yaḥ kaścid yuṣmākaṃ kuśalamūlenārthikaḥ puṇyārthī sa saptavarṣān pārāt samudrasya gośīrṣoragasāracandanamānayatu /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid yuṣmākam kuśala mūlena arthikaḥ puṇya arthī sa sapta varṣān pārāt samudrasya gośīrṣa uraga sāra candanam ānayatu
translated: Whoever among you desires merit and wholesome roots, let him bring from the other side of the ocean sandalwood from the Gośīrṣa and Aśoka trees for seven years.

original: yena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo bhagavato bhikṣusaṅghasya cāhāraṃ sajjīkuryāt /
analyzed: yena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ bhikṣu saṅghasya ca āhāram sajjīkuryāt
translated: With which the brahmin Samudrarena can prepare food for the Blessed One and the assembly of monks.

analyzed: tatas dvānavati yakṣa sahasrāṇi eka kaṇṭhena udāhṛtavantaḥ
translated: Then ninety-two thousand yakshas spoke with one voice:

analyzed: vayam mārṣāḥ imān sapta varṣān gośīrṣam uragasāracandanam ānayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We, friends, will bring the sandalwood ointment for seven years,

original: yena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo bhagavato'rthāyāhāraṃ sajjīkariṣyati bhikṣusaṅghasya ca /
analyzed: yena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ ūrthāya āhāram sajjīkariṣyati bhikṣu saṅghasya ca
translated: so that the brahmin Samudrareṇu can prepare food for the Blessed One and the community of monks.

analyzed: ṣaṭcatvāriṃśat yakṣa sahasrāṇi kathayanti
translated: Forty-six thousand yakṣas said:

analyzed: vayam gandham ānayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring the incense.

analyzed: dvāpañcāśat yakṣa sahasrāṇi kathayanti
translated: Fifty-two thousand yakṣas said:

analyzed: vayam vicitrān puṣpān ānayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring various flowers.

analyzed: viṃśat yakṣa sahasrāṇi kathayanti
translated: Twenty thousand yakṣas said:

original: vayaṃ vividharasāyanānāmojāṃ gṛhnīmo bhagavato'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca /
analyzed: vayam vividha rasāyanānām ojām gṛhnīmaḥ bhagavataḥ ūrthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca
translated: We will take the essence of various elixirs for the Blessed One and the community of monks.

analyzed: yat anna pāna sajjīkṛtam bhaviṣyati tatra ojām prakṣepsyāmaḥ
translated: We will infuse the essence into the food and drink that is prepared.

analyzed: sapta tisraḥ yakṣa sahasrāṇi kathayanti
translated: Seventy thousand yakṣas said:

original: vayaṃ mārṣā bhagavato'rthāyāhāraṃ sajjīkariṣyāmo bhikṣusaṅghasya ca /
analyzed: vayam mārṣāḥ bhagavataḥ ūrthāya āhāram sajjīkariṣyāmaḥ bhikṣu saṅghasya ca
translated: We, friends, will prepare food for the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo viruḍhakasya mahārājasyākāṅkṣati darśanaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ viruḍhakasya mahā rājasya ākāṅkṣati darśanam
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrareṇu desired to see the great king Virūḍhaka.

original: tato virūḍhako mahārājā yena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastenopajagāmopetya yāvad anekakumbhāṇḍakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādayanti /
analyzed: tatas virūḍhakaḥ mahā rājā yena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upajagāma upetya yāvat aneka kumbhāṇḍa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: Then the great king Virūḍhaka went to the brahmin Sāgara­rendra. Having approached, he caused many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of niyutas of kumbhāṇḍas to generate the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam virūpākṣaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ bahu nāga gandharva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: In the same way, Virūpākṣa and Dhṛtarāṣṭra caused many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of niyutas of nāgas and gandharvas to generate the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu dvitīyikāyāścāturdvīpikāyā lokapālā buddhānubhāvenāgatāḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya sakāśat /
analyzed: atha khalu dvitīyikāyāḥ cāturdvīpikāyāḥ lokapālāḥ buddha anubhāvena āgatāḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya sakāśat
translated: Then, by the Buddha's power, the guardians of the world from the second four-continent world system came into the presence of the brahmin Sāgara­rendra.

analyzed: tān api brāhmaṇaḥ samādāpayati
translated: The brahmin inspired them as well.

original: te'pi gatvā svakaṃ svakaṃ parṣadamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti /
analyzed: te api gatvā svakam svakam parṣadam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti
translated: They, having gone, inspired their own assemblies in the unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: yāvat trisāhasramahāsāhasrāt koṭīśataṃ vaiśravaṇānām saparṣatkānāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti /
analyzed: yāvat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāt koṭī śatam vaiśravaṇānām sa parṣatkānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti
translated: Up to a hundred koṭis of Vaiśravaṇas with their assemblies from the great trichiliocosm inspired them in the unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: koṭīśataṃ vīrūḍhakānām koṭiśataṃ virūpākṣāṇāṃ koṭiśataṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ sapārṣadyānāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti /
analyzed: koṭī śatam vīrūḍhakānām koṭi śatam virūpākṣāṇām koṭi śatam dhṛtarāṣṭrāṇām sa pārṣadyānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti
translated: One hundred koṭis of Vairūḍhakas, one hundred koṭis of Virūpākṣas, and one hundred koṭis of Dhṛtarāṣṭras with their retinues, they are causing to aspire to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya etat abhavat
translated: Then, noble sir, this occurred to the brahmin Sāgaraṇḍa:

original: yadyahamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyeyaṃ āśā ca samṛdhyeta yadi ca me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyeta /
analyzed: yadi aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya iyam āśā ca samṛdhyeta yadi ca me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyeta
translated: If I were to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and if my hope were to be fulfilled, and if my aspiration were to be fulfilled,

analyzed: virūḍhakānām tat aham kārayeyam kāram
translated: I would perform a rite for the Vairūḍhakas.

analyzed: asmin mahā yajñe tat sattvānām saṃvibhajeyam
translated: In this great sacrifice, I would share with those beings.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyam
translated: I would cause them to aspire to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sacedahamanena puṇyenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyeyañchakro mamādya devānāmindro darśanāyopasaṃkrāmatu /
analyzed: saced aham anena puṇyena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya iyan śakraḥ mama adya devānām indraḥ darśanāya upasaṃkrāmatu
translated: If by this merit I were to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, may Śakra, lord of the gods, come to see me today.

original: suyamo devaputraḥ saṃtuṣito devaputraḥ sunirmito devaputraḥ paranirmitavaśavartī ca devaputraḥ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmatu /
analyzed: suyamaḥ devaputraḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ devaputraḥ sunirmitaḥ devaputraḥ paranirmitavaśavartī ca devaputraḥ darśanāya upasaṃkrāmatu
translated: May the god Suyāma, the god Santuṣita, the god Sunirmita, and the god Paranirmitavaśavartin come to see me.

original: sahacittotpādādeva kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya śakro devānāmindro darśanāyopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: saha citta utpādāt eva kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya śakraḥ devānām indraḥ darśanāya upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: As soon as the thought arose, noble sir, Śakra, lord of the gods, approached the brahmin Samudrareṇu to see him,

original: suyāmaśca devaputraḥ saṃtuṣitaśca devaputraḥ sunirmitaśca devaputraḥ paranirmitavaśavartī ca devaputraḥ taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāntaḥ
analyzed: suyāmaḥ ca deva putraḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ ca deva putraḥ sunirmitaḥ ca deva putraḥ paranirmitavaśavartī ca deva putraḥ tam brāhmaṇam darśanāya upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: and the god Suyāma, the god Santuṣita, the god Sunirmita, and the god Paranirmitavaśavartin also approached the brahmin to see him.

analyzed: tām samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pṛcchati
translated: The brahmin Samudrareṇu asked them,

analyzed: ke bhadantaḥ
translated: Who are you, venerable sirs?

analyzed: pañca devarājānaḥ svaka svakāḥ nāma gotrāṇi anuśrāvayanti
translated: The five kings of the gods proclaimed their own names and clans,

analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ
translated: and said,

analyzed: kim bhoḥ brāhmaṇa asmākam ājñāpayasi
translated: What do you command us, brahmin?

analyzed: kāni asmābhiḥ asmin mahāyajñe upakaraṇāni upasthāpayitavyāni
translated: What requisites should we provide for this great sacrifice?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha
translated: The brahmin said,🔽 🔽I do not need any requisites for the sacrifice.

original: yāni yuṣmākaṃ devaloke sarvaviśiṣṭāni ratnamayāni kūṭāgārāṇi ratnavṛkṣā vā kalpavṛkṣā vā gandhavṛkṣā vā puṣpavṛkṣā vā phalavṛkṣā divyāni cīvarāṇi divyāsanāni divyāni prajñapanāni divyāni ratnabhājanāni divyānyalaṅkāracchatradhvajapatākābharaṇāni divyāni ca vādyāni tairvastubhiḥ sarvajambūdvīpamalaṅkuruta bhagavato'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca /
analyzed: yāni yuṣmākam deva loke sarva viśiṣṭāni ratna mayāni kūṭāgārāṇi ratna vṛkṣāḥ vā kalpavṛkṣāḥ vā gandha vṛkṣāḥ vā puṣpa vṛkṣāḥ vā phala vṛkṣāḥ divyāni cīvarāṇi divya āsanāni divyāni prajñapanāni divyāni ratna bhājanāni divyāni alaṅkāra chatra dhvaja patākā ābharaṇāni divyāni ca vādyāni taiḥ vastubhiḥ sarva jambūdvīpam alaṅkuruta bhagavataḥ ṛthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca sarva anupūrva anupūrva anupūrva anup
translated: Those jeweled palaces, jeweled trees, wish-fulfilling trees, fragrant trees, flower trees, fruit trees, divine robes, divine seats, divine furnishings, divine jeweled vessels, divine ornaments, parasols, banners, flags, adornments, and divine musical instruments that are the most excellent in your deva world - with those things, adorn the entire Jambudvīpa for the sake of the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks.

original: evam astu mārṣāste pañcadevarājāno brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya brāhmaṇasyāntikāt prākāntā devalokaṃ gatā gatvā veṭakaṃ devaputramāveṭukaṃ devaputraṃ rohiṇaṃ devaputraṃ korabhanandaṃ devaputramāmantrayitvaivamāhuḥ /
analyzed: evam astu mārṣāḥ te pañca deva rājānaḥ brāhmaṇasya pratiśrutya brāhmaṇasya antikāt prākāntāḥ deva lokam gatāḥ gatvā veṭakam deva putram āveṭukam deva putram rohiṇam deva putram korabhanandam deva putram āmantrayitvā evam āhuḥ
translated: So be it, friends, the five deva kings promised the brāhmaṇa. Having promised the brāhmaṇa, they departed from the presence of the brāhmaṇa and went to the deva world. Having gone, they addressed the deva sons Vṛtra, Āvṛtra, Rohiṇa, and Korabha-nandī, and said this:

original: gacchata yūyaṃ mārṣā jambūdvīpamavatīrya jambūvanaṃ udyānamevaṃvidhenālaṅkāraviśeṣenaivaṃvidhairāsanaiḥ saṃstatairalaṅkuruta yathaivāyaṃ devaloko'laṅkṛtaḥ
analyzed: gacchata yūyam mārṣāḥ jambūdvīpam avatīrya jambu vanam udyānam evaṃvidhena alaṅkāra viśeṣena evaṃvidhaiḥ āsanaiḥ saṃstataiḥ alaṅkuruta yathā eva ayam deva lokaḥ ulaṅkṛtaḥ
translated: 'Go, sirs, descend to Jambudvīpa and, having entered the grove, adorn it with such special ornaments and such seats as this divine world is adorned.

original: evaṃvidhameva bhagavato'rthāya ratnamayaṃ kūṭāgāraṃ kārayata yādṛśo'yaṃ ratnaniryūhaḥ kūṭāgāra īdṛśaṃ mārṣā kūṭāgāraṃ kārayata /
analyzed: evaṃvidham eva bhagavataḥ ūrthāya ratna mayam kūṭāgāram kārayata yādṛśaḥ yam ratna niryūhaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ īdṛśam mārṣāḥ kūṭāgāram kārayata
translated: And, sirs, for the Blessed One's sake, build a jeweled multi-storied building like this jeweled pinnacle multi-storied building. Build such a multi-storied building, sirs.'

original: te pañcadevaputrā devarājñaḥ pratiśrutya jambūdvīpamavatīrya ekarātryā sarvaṃ jambūvanamudyānamevaṃrūpeṇālaṅkāreṇa ratnavṛkṣairyāvaddhvajairalaṅkṛtaṃ
analyzed: te pañca deva putrāḥ devarājñaḥ pratiśrutya jambūdvīpam avatīrya eka rātryā sarvam jambū vanam udyānam evaṃrūpeṇa alaṅkāreṇa ratna vṛkṣaiḥ yāvat dhvajaiḥ alaṅkṛtam
translated: Those five deva-sons, having promised the deva-kings, descended to Jambudvīpa and, in one night, adorned the entire grove with such ornaments, jeweled trees, and so on up to banners.

original: evaṃrūpaḥ kūṭāgāro bhagavato'rthāya kṛtastadyathā śakrasya devānāmindrasya ratnaniryūhaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ sarvākārapariniṣṭhitaṃ kṛtsnaṃ ca jambūvanaṃ divyenālaṅkāreṇālaṅkṛtya devarājānāṃ saṃkramyārocayanti /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ bhagavataḥ ṛthāya kṛtaḥ tat yathā śakrasya devānām indrasya ratna niryūhaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ sarva ākāra pariniṣṭhitam kṛtsnam ca jambū vanam divyena alaṅkāreṇa alaṅkṛtya devarājānām saṃkramya ārocayanti
translated: And for the Blessed One's sake, they built a multi-storied building like this jeweled pinnacle multi-storied building of Śakra, lord of the devas, complete in every aspect. Having adorned the entire grove with divine ornaments, they returned to the deva-kings and informed them:

original: yat khalu mārṣā jānīyuryathaivāyaṃ devalokaḥ svabhyalaṅkṛtaḥ tathaiva jambūvanodyānaṃ divyairalaṅkāraviśeṣaiḥ svalaṅkṛtaṃ sarvākārapariniṣṭhitaṃ /
analyzed: yat khalu mārṣāḥ jānīyuḥ yathā eva ayam deva lokaḥ su abhyalaṅkṛtaḥ tathā eva jambu vana udyānam divyaiḥ alaṅkāra viśeṣaiḥ su alaṅkṛtam sarva ākāra pariniṣṭhitam
translated: Gentlemen, know that just as this divine world is well-adorned, so too is the Jambuvana Grove well-adorned with divine special ornaments, perfected in every way.

original: evaṃrūpaśca sarvaratnamayaḥ kūṭāgāro bhagavato'rthāya kṛtaḥ tadyathā śakrasya devānāmindrasya ratnaniryūhaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ ca sarva ratna mayaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ bhagavataḥ ṛthāya kṛtaḥ tat yathā śakrasya devānām indrasya ratna niryūhaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ
translated: And such is the jeweled mansion made of all jewels for the Blessed One, just like Shakra, lord of the gods, has the jeweled mansion with a pinnacle.

original: na hi mārṣā devalokasya jambudvīpe ca jambūvanasyodyānasya kiṃcidapyasti nānākaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: na hi mārṣāḥ deva lokasya jambudvīpe ca jambu vanasya udyānasya kiṃcid api asti nānākaraṇam
translated: Gentlemen, there is no difference at all between the divine world and the Jambuvana Grove in Jambudvipa.

original: atha te pañcadevarājānaḥ śakrasuyāmasaṃtuṣitāḥ sunirmitaparanirmitavaśavartī jambūdvīpamavatīrya samudrareṇuṃ brāhmaṇamupasaṃkramyaivamāhuḥ
analyzed: atha te pañca deva rājānaḥ śakra suyāma saṃtuṣitāḥ sunirmita paranirmita vaśavartī jambūdvīpam avatīrya samudrareṇum brāhmaṇam upasaṃkramya evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those five kings of the gods, Shakra, Suyama, Santushita, Sunirmita, and Paranirmitavashavartin, descended to Jambudvipa, approached the brahmin Samudrarena, and said this:

original: alaṅkṛtaṃ brāhmaṇa bhagavato'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca jambūvanaṃ /
analyzed: alaṅkṛtam brāhmaṇa bhagavatā ūrthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca jambū vanam
translated: Brahmin, the Jambuvana Grove is adorned for the Blessed One and the Sangha of monks.

analyzed: kim asmābhiḥ bhūyas karaṇīyam
translated: What else should we do?

original: evamukte samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ pañcadevaputānetadavocat yūyaṃ khalu pañcadevarājānaḥ pṛthagdevanikāye rājyaṃ kārayata tatra yuṣmākaṃ vaśo🔽gacchata rājānaḥ svakasvakāṃ devaparṣadāṃ /
analyzed: evam ukte samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pañca deva putān etat avocat yūyam khalu pañca deva rājānaḥ pṛthak devanikāye rājyam kārayata tatra yuṣmākam vaśo  gacchata rājānaḥ svaka svakām deva parṣadām
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Samudrareṇu said to the five celestial princes, You five celestial kings rule your respective celestial realms, where you have power

analyzed: sannipātayata jambūdvīpe
translated: Go, kings, and assemble your own celestial assemblies in Jambudvīpa.

original: bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmata vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhiksusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmata vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhiksu saṅgham ca
translated: Approach the Blessed One to see him, to pay homage to him, and to attend on him, and also the community of monks.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca antikāt dharmam śṛṇvata
translated: And listen to the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: atha te pañcadevarājānaḥ svakasvakeṣu sthānāntareṣu gatvā śakro devānāmindro devāṃstrayastriṃśān sannipātyaivamāhuḥ yut khalu mārṣā jānīyurjambudvīpe'raṇemino rājñaḥ samudrareṇurnāma brāhmaṇaḥ agrapurohitaḥ /
analyzed: atha te pañca deva rājānaḥ svaka svakeṣu sthāna antareṣu gatvā śakraḥ devānām indraḥ devān trayastriṃśān sannipātya evam āhuḥ khalu mārṣāḥ jānīyuḥ jambudvīpeḥ aṇeminaḥ rājñaḥ samudrareṇuḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ agra purohitaḥ
translated: Then those five celestial kings went to their respective abodes, and Śakra, lord of the gods, having assembled the Thirty-Three Gods, said to them, Friends, you should know that in Jambudvīpa, King Arcimat has a chief priest named Samudrareṇu, a brahmin.

original: sa ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ saptavarṣāṇi sarvopakaraṇairupanimantrya pratimānayati sārdhamaparimitena bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: sa ratnagarbham tathāgatam sapta varṣāṇi sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upanimantrya pratimānayati sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: He has invited the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha for seven years with all requisites, and is honoring him together with an immeasurable community of monks.

original: asmābhiśca bhagavato'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca sarva ārāmo'laṅkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ ca bhagavatā ṛthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca sarvaḥ ārāmaḥ ulaṅkṛtaḥ
translated: And we have adorned the entire park for the sake of the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: tadyūyaṃ kuśalamūlamanumodyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayata samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya samādāpanayā /
analyzed: tat yūyam kuśala mūlam anumodya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayata samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya samādāpanayā
translated: Therefore, rejoice in that wholesome root and generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through the exhortation of the brahmin Samudrareṇu.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahavastrayastriṃśaddevakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrā añjaliṃ pragṛhya vācamudīrayanti /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bahavaḥ trayastriṃśat deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāḥ añjalim pragṛhya vācam udīrayanti
translated: At that time, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, with palms joined, spoke these words:

original: anumodāmo mārṣā evaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ tayā cānumodanayā yatpuṇyamasmākaṃ syāttatsarvaṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmaḥ /
analyzed: anumodāmaḥ mārṣāḥ evam puṇya skandham tayā ca anumodanayā yat puṇyam asmākam syāt tat sarvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmaḥ
translated: We rejoice, friends, in this accumulation of merit. Through that rejoicing, whatever merit we have, we dedicate it all to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: suyāmo devaputro yāmān devān sannipātya vistareṇa peyālaṃ tuṣitanirmāṇaratidevaputraḥ paranirmito devaputraḥ paranirmitavaśavartino devān sannipātya yāvad bahūni devaputrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyañjaliṃ pragṛhya vācaṃ bhāṣante sma /
analyzed: suyāmaḥ deva putraḥ yāmān devān sannipātya vistareṇa peyālam tuṣitanirmāṇarati deva putraḥ paranirmitaḥ deva putraḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devān sannipātya yāvat bahūni deva putra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi añjalim pragṛhya vācam bhāṣante sma
translated: The god Suyāma, having assembled the Yāma gods in detail, the god Tuṣita, the god Nirmāṇarati, the god Paranirmitavaśavartin, having assembled the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others' Emanations, up to many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods with palms joined, spoke these words:

original: anumodāmo vayaṃ mārṣā yat kuśalamūlaṃ tasmācca kuśalamūlatyatpuṇyaṃ tatsarvamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmaḥ /
analyzed: anumodāmaḥ vayam mārṣāḥ yat kuśala mūlam tasmāt ca tat sarvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmaḥ
translated: We rejoice, friends, in that wholesome root, and whatever merit there is from that wholesome root, we dedicate it all to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tena hi mārṣā gacchāmo jambudvīpamavatarāmaḥ bhagavato darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: tena hi mārṣāḥ gacchāmaḥ jambudvīpam avatarāmaḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: Then, friends, let us go down to Jambudvīpa to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to attend on him, and to hear the Dharma, and also to see the Saṅgha of monks.

original: te pañcadevarājāno rātrāvekaiko devarājñaḥ strīpuruṣadārakadārikābhirbahuprāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ jambudvīpamavatīrya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca bhagavato'ntikād dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: te pañca deva rājānaḥ rātrau ekaikaḥ deva rājñaḥ strī puruṣa dāraka dārikābhiḥ bahu prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham jambudvīpam avatīrya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhikṣu saṅgham ca bhagavataḥ ntikāt dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: Those five kings of gods, each one at night, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings, men, women, boys, and girls, descend to Jambudvīpa, bow their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and the Saṅgha of monks, and listen to the Dharma from the Blessed One.

analyzed: devāḥ gagana tala sthāḥ bhagavantam divyaiḥ kusuma utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka sumanā vārṣika atimuktaka campaka māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa vṛṣṭyā avakiranti
translated: The gods in the sky scatter a rain of divine flowers, such as blue lotuses, red lotuses, night lotuses, white lotuses, champakas, and great champakas, on the Blessed One.

analyzed: divyāni ca vādyāni pravādayanti
translated: They play divine musical instruments.

original: punaraparaṃ kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya evaṃ cetasi cetaḥparivitarka udapādi /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya evam cetasi cetaḥ parivitarkaḥ udapādi
translated: Furthermore, noble sir, this thought occurred to the brahmin Sāgara­rendra:

analyzed: yadi mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryate
translated: ‘If my hope for highest genuine full Awakening is fulfilled,

original: tadayaṃ mama praṇidhiḥ saṃpadyate yadidamasurāṃ bodhau samādāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tat ayam mama praṇidhiḥ saṃpadyate yat idam asurām bodhau samādāpayeyam
translated: then may this aspiration of mine be fulfilled: that I may inspire the asuras to Awakening.’

analyzed: saha citta utpādena kula putra pañca asura indraḥ yena asau brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntā
translated: As soon as he had this thought, noble sir, the five lords of the asuras went to the brahmin.

original: upasaṃkramya yāvadbahvasurakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi brāhmaṇasya vacanena sastrīpuruṣadārakadārikā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpādayanti /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya yāvat bahu asura koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi brāhmaṇasya vacanena sa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: Having approached, up to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of asuras, both male and female, and boys and girls, generated the intention for highest genuine full Awakening by the word of the brahmin.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca sakāśam upagamya dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: And having approached the Blessed One, they listened to the Dharma.

analyzed: vistareṇa peyālam
translated: In detail, it is to be expanded.

analyzed: evam sa brāhmaṇaḥ māram ākāṅkṣate
translated: Thus that brahmin desired Māra.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena pūrṇo nāma māra āgatya yāvadanekairmārakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairmārakāyikairdevaputrasiḥ sastrīpuruṣadārakadārikairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpāditāni yāvadupasaṃkrāntā dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena pūrṇaḥ nāma māraḥ āgatya yāvat anekaiḥ māra koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ māra kāyikaiḥ deva putra siḥ sa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditāni yāvat upasaṃkrāntāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: At that time, a Mara named Pūrṇa came, and together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Maras, male and female Maras, and male and female children, generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and approached to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ ketapuriṃ nāma mahābrahmāṇamākāṅkṣate upasaṃkramaṇāya /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ketapurim nāma mahābrahmāṇam ākāṅkṣate upasaṃkramaṇāya
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Samudrarenu desired to go to the great Brahma named Ketupuri.

analyzed: yāvat brāhmaṇasya sakāśāt pratiśrutya brahma lokāt
translated: Having promised the brahmin, he descended from the Brahma world.

analyzed: yāvat bahu prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: There, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of living beings generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tataścāvataranti bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca /
analyzed: tatas ca avataranti bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca
translated: Then they descended to see, pay homage to, and serve the Blessed One and the assembly of monks.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca antikāt dharma aśravaṇāya
translated: And to listen to the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo dvitīyāyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ śakramākāṅkṣate suyāmaṃ saṃtuṣitaṃ sunirmitaṃ paranirmitavaśavartinaṃ ca devaputramākāṅkṣate darśanāya /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ dvitīyāyām cāturdvīpikāyām śakram ākāṅkṣate suyāmam saṃtuṣitam sunirmitam paranirmitavaśavartinam ca devaputram ākāṅkṣate darśanāya
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu desired to see Shakra in the second four-continent world system, and also desired to see the gods Suyama, Santushita, Sunirmitha, and Paranirmitavashavartin.

original: te'pi pañcadevarājāno bhagavato'nubhāvena brāhmaṇasya sakāśamupasaṃkrāntastān brāhmaṇaḥ samanuśiṣṭavān /
analyzed: te api pañca deva rājānaḥ bhagavataḥ anubhāvena brāhmaṇasya sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ tān brāhmaṇaḥ samanuśiṣṭavān
translated: Those five kings of the gods, by the power of the Blessed One, approached the brahmin, and the brahmin instructed them.

original: te'pi svakāni bhavanāni gatvā svakāṃ parṣadaṃ brāhmaṇahastena samādāpayanti /
analyzed: te api svakāni bhavanāni gatvā svakām parṣadam brāhmaṇa hastena samādāpayanti
translated: They, having gone to their own abodes, through the brahmin's request, inspired their own retinues.

original: evaṃ bahubhistrayastriṃśaddevaniyutaśatasahasrairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpāditāni sastrīpuruṣadārakadārikaiste ca sahaśakreṇemāṃ cāturdvīpikāmāgatā bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: evam bahubhiḥ trayastriṃśat deva niyuta śata sahasraiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditāni sa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikaiḥ te ca saha śakreṇa imām cāturdvīpikām āgatāḥ bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: In this way, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of gods from the Thirty-Three, together with women, men, boys, and girls, generated the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment. They, together with Shakra, came to this four-continent world system to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to attend on him, and to the community of monks.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca antikāt dharmam śrotum
translated: And to hear the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: evaṃ suyāmaḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ sunirmitaḥ paranirmitavaśavartī devaputraḥ yāvat paranirmitavaśavartikān devān bodhāya samādāpayitvā bahubhiḥ paranirmitavaśavartidevakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sastrīpuruṣadārakadārikairanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau kṛtacittotpādaiścāturdvīpikāmāgatā bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: evam suyāmaḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ sunirmitaḥ paranirmitavaśavartī deva putraḥ yāvat paranirmitavaśavartikān devān bodhāya samādāpayitvā bahubhiḥ paranirmita vaśavarti deva koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikaiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau kṛta citta utpādaiḥ cāturdvīpikām āgatāḥ bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: In the same way, the gods Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, and Paranirmitavaśavartin, up to the gods of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin realm, having inspired the gods of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin realm for enlightenment, with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of gods of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin realm, both men and women, boys and girls, who had generated the thought of highest complete enlightenment, came to the four continents to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to attend on him, and to the community of monks.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca antikāt dharmam śrotum
translated: And to hear the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: evaṃ dvitīyāyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ asurendrā mārā brahmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: evam dvitīyāyām cāturdvīpikāyām asura indrāḥ mārāḥ brahmāṇaḥ
translated: In the same way, the lords of the asuras, Māras, and Brahmās of the second four-continent world system,

original: evaṃ tṛtīyāyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ caturthyāṃ pañcamyāṃ śakrasuyāmasaṃtuṣitanirmāṇaparanirmitāsurendra mārā brahmāṇaḥ buddhānubhāvenemāṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ āgatāḥ sapariṣaṭkā yāvan te dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: evam tṛtīyāyām cāturdvīpikāyām caturthyām pañcamyām śakrasuyāma saṃtuṣita nirmāṇa para nirmita asura indra mārāḥ brahmāṇaḥ buddha anubhāvena imām cāturdvīpikām āgatāḥ sa pariṣaṭkāḥ yāvat te dharma śravaṇāya
translated: and in the same way, the lords of the asuras, Māras, and Brahmās of the third, fourth, fifth, Śakra, Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, and Paranirmitavaśavartin four-continent world systems, by the Buddha's power came to this four-continent world system with their retinues, up to them, to hear the Dharma.

original: evaṃ yāvattrisāhasramahāsāhasrādbuddhakṣetrāt koṭīśataṃ śakrāṇāṃ koṭiśataṃ suyāmānāṃ koṭīśataṃ saṃtuṣitānāṃ koṭīśataṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ koṭīśataṃ paranirmitavaśavartīnāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ /
analyzed: evam yāvat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāt buddhakṣetrāt koṭī śatam śakrāṇām koṭi śatam suyāmānām koṭī śatam saṃtuṣitānām koṭī śatam nirmāṇaratīnām koṭī śatam paranirmitavaśavartīnām devaputrāṇām
