translated: Similarly, up to a hundred koṭis of Śakras, a hundred koṭis of Suyāmas, a hundred koṭis of Santuṣitas, a hundred koṭis of Nirmāṇaratīs, and a hundred koṭis of Paranirmitavaśavartins, the sons of gods, from the Buddha-field of the great trichiliocosm.

original: koṭīśatamasurendrāṇāṃ koṭīśataṃ mārāṇāṃ koṭīśataṃ mahābrahmaṇāṃ ekaiko mahābrahmānekaiḥ koṭīniyutaśatasahasrairbrahmakāyikānāṃ devānāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau kṛtacittotpādānāṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto bhagavadanubhāvenemāṃ cāturdvīpikāmāgato bhagavato darśanāyopasaṃkramaṇāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca bhagavataścāntikāddharmaṃ śrotuṃ /
analyzed: koṭī śatam asura indrāṇām koṭī śatam mārāṇām koṭī śatam mahābrahmaṇām ekaikaḥ mahābrahmā anekaiḥ koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ brahmakāyikānām devānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau kṛta citta utpādānām parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ bhagavat anubhāvena imām cāturdvīpikām āgataḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya upasaṃkramaṇāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca bhagavataḥ ca antikāt dharmam śrotum
translated: In the same way, there were a hundred koṭis of Śakras, a hundred koṭis of Suyāmas, a hundred koṭis of Santuṣitas, a hundred koṭis of Nirmāṇaratis, a hundred koṭis of Paranirmitavaśavartins, a hundred koṭis of lords of the asuras, a hundred koṭis of Māras, and a hundred koṭis of great Brahmās. Each great Brahmā was surrounded and attended by many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Brahmakāyika devas who had generated the thought of highest, complete enlightenment. Through the power of the Buddha, they had come to this four-continent world from a buddha-field in the great trichiliocosm, in order to see the Buddha, to approach him, to pay homage to him, to attend on him, and to hear the Dharma from the Buddha and the assembly of monks.

original: tadā ca trisāhasramahāsāhasrayāṃ lokadhātau nāsti sa kāścit pṛthivīpradeśo yo na sphuṭo'bhūt //🔽atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyaitadabhavat /
analyzed: tadā ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrayām lokadhātau na asti sa kāścid pṛthivī pradeśaḥ yaḥ na 🔽atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya etat abhavat
translated: At that time, there was no part of the great trichiliocosm that was not filled.

original: yadi mamānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvāśāparipūrirbhavati tadyathaivaṃ koṭīśataṃ vaiśravaṇānāṃ yāvat koṭīśataṃ mahābrahmaṇāṃ māmanuvartanti tathaivaṃ me bhagavān anuvartate /
analyzed: yadi mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūriḥ bhavati tat yathā evam koṭī śatam vaiśravaṇānām yāvat koṭī śatam mahābrahmaṇām mām anuvartanti tathā evam me bhagavān anuvartate
translated: If my wish is fulfilled for the highest complete enlightenment, then may hundreds of koṭis of Vaiśravaṇas, up to hundreds of koṭis of Mahā-Brahmas, follow me, and in the same way may the Blessed One follow me.

original: yadevaṃrūpaṃ mahāprātihāryaṃ kuryāt yāvattrisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ tiryāñco yāmalokikā nairayikāsteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ duḥkhāvedanā praśāmyeta sukhāvedanotpadyeta /
analyzed: yat evaṃrūpam mahā prātihāryam kuryāt yāvat tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ tiryāñcaḥ yāmalokikāḥ nairayikāḥ teṣām sarveṣām duḥkha āvedanā praśāmyeta sukha āvedanā utpadyeta
translated: May he perform such a great miracle as this, up to in the great trichiliocosm, for humans, animals, and those in the Yama world, and those in the hells, may all their suffering sensations be pacified and the sensation of happiness arise.

original: teṣāṃ caikaikakasyāgrato buddhanirmitaṃ tiṣṭhet yastāṃ sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayet /
analyzed: teṣām ca ekaikakasya agratas buddha nirmitam tiṣṭhet yaḥ tām sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayet
translated: And may a Buddha emanation stand before each of them, who would encourage those beings towards the highest complete enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya cetasā cittamājñāya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ pratāpaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya cetasā cittam ājñāya tasyām velāyām pratāpam nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Ratna-garbha, knowing the thought of the brāhmaṇa Samudra-renu, at that time entered the samādhi called 'Blazing'.

original: yathā samāhitena cittena bhagavān pratāpe samādhau bhagavataḥ kāyādaikaikasmād romakūpād gaṇanāsamatikrāntā raśmaya udgatāstaiśca raśmibhirayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ sphuṭo'bhut /
analyzed: yathā samāhitena cittena bhagavān pratāpe samādhau bhagavataḥ kāyāt ā ekaikasmāt romakūpāt gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ raśmayaḥ udgatāḥ taiḥ ca raśmibhiḥ ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ sphuṭaḥ bhuj
translated: Just as the Blessed One, with a concentrated mind, in the Pratāpana hell, from each pore of his body, emitted more than a count of rays, and those rays illuminated this trichiliocosm.

original: sa tatra kecid raśmayo narakaṃ gatvā śītanarakopapannānāṃ sattvānāmuṣṇā vāyavo vānti /
analyzed: sa tatra kecid raśmayaḥ narakam gatvā śīta naraka upapannānām sattvānām uṣṇāḥ vāyavaḥ vānti
translated: Some of those rays went to the hells and to the beings born in the cold hells, warm winds blew.

original: ye uṣṇanarakopapannāḥ sattvāsteṣāṃ śītalā vāyavo vānti yena teṣāṃ nairayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ sarvaṃ kṣuttarṣaśramaduḥkhaṃ praśāmyati sukhāvedanotpadyate
analyzed: ye uṣṇa naraka upapannāḥ sattvāḥ teṣām śītalāḥ vāyavaḥ vānti yena teṣām nairayikānām sattvānām sarvam kṣudh tarṣa śrama duḥkham praśāmyati sukhā vedanā utpadyate
translated: For those beings born in the hot hells, cool winds blew, by which all the suffering of hunger, thirst, and fatigue of those hell beings was pacified, and the experience of happiness arose.

original: ekaikasya ca nairayikasya nirmito buddhavigraho'gratastiṣṭhati dvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇairalaṅkṛtagātraḥ aśītibhiranuvyañjanaiḥ samalaṅkṛtaśarīraḥ
analyzed: ekaikasya ca nairayikasya nirmitaḥ buddha vigraha ugrataḥ tiṣṭhati dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛta gātraḥ aśītibhiḥ anuvyañjanaiḥ samalaṅkṛta śarīraḥ
translated: And for each hell being, an illusory Buddha form stood in front, with a body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, and a body adorned with the eighty minor characteristics.

analyzed: atha teṣām nairayikānām sukha samarpitānām etat abhūt
translated: Then it occurred to those hell beings, filled with happiness:

original: kiṃ pratyayamasmākaṃ duḥkhapraśāntaṃ sukhaṃ ca prādurbhūtaṃ / /
analyzed: kim pratyayam asmākam duḥkha praśāntam sukham ca prādurbhūtam
translated: What is the condition by which our suffering is pacified and happiness has arisen?

analyzed: te tam bhagavantam paśyanti dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛtam aśīti anuvyañjana virājita gātram
translated: They see that Blessed One adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, his body radiant with the eighty minor marks.

analyzed: te tam dṛṣṭvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Having seen him, they say this:

original: asya mahākāruṇikasya mahātmano'nubhāvena vayamevaṃ sukhinaḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: asya mahā kāruṇikasya mahātmanaḥ nubhāvena vayam evam sukhinaḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: By the power of this compassionate great being, we have become so happy.

analyzed: te prīti saumanasya jātaḥ prasanna manasaḥ bhagavantam prekṣante
translated: With joy and gladness, their minds clear, they look at the Blessed One.

original: teṣāṃ bhagavānāha sādhu yūyaṃ sattvā namo buddhāyeti vācaṃ bhāṣatāṃ /
analyzed: teṣām bhagavān āha sādhu yūyam sattvāḥ namaḥ buddhāya iti vācam bhāṣatām
translated: The Blessed One says to them, Good, good! You beings, speak these words: 'Homage to the Buddha!'

analyzed: anuttarāyām ca samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayata
translated: And arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ yuṣmākaṃ duḥkhāvedanā na bhūya utpadyate /
analyzed: evam yuṣmākam duḥkha avedanā na bhūyas utpadyate
translated: In this way, your experience of suffering will not arise again.

original: nityaṃ ca sukhāyā vedanāyā lābhino bhaviṣyatha /
analyzed: nityam ca sukhāyāḥ vedanāyāḥ lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: And you will always obtain the experience of happiness.

analyzed: te evam āhuḥ
translated: They say this:

analyzed: namaḥ buddhāya utpādayāmaḥ vayam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Homage to the Buddha! We arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat ca asmākam kuśala mūlam karma āvaraṇa a kṣayāya saṃvartatu
translated: And may that wholesome root of ours lead to the exhaustion of karmic obscurations.

analyzed: tatas ca kecid cyutvā manuṣyāṇām sabhā gatāyām upapadyante
translated: Then some of them, having passed away, are reborn in the human realm.

original: ye nairayikāḥ sattvā agninā dahyante teṣāṃ te raśmayaḥ śītalān vāyūn pramuñcanti /
analyzed: ye nairayikāḥ sattvāḥ agninā dahyante teṣām te raśmayaḥ śītalān vāyūn pramuñcanti
translated: The light rays that burn sentient beings in the hells emit cool breezes.

analyzed: te taiḥ spṛṣṭāḥ praśānta kṣudh tarṣāḥ ca aduḥkhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Those touched by them have their hunger and thirst pacified and become free from suffering.

original: yāvat kecit tataścyāvitvā manuṣyāṇāṃ sabhāgatāyāṃ upapadyante /
analyzed: yāvat kecid tatas cyāvitvā manuṣyāṇām sabhā gatāyām upapadyante
translated: Some, having been expelled from there, are reborn in the human realm.

original: evaṃ tiryagyonirvaktavyā evaṃ yāvan manuṣyā vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam tiryagyoniḥ vaktavyā evam yāvat manuṣyāḥ vaktavyāḥ
translated: The animal realm should be described in the same way, and so on up to the human realm.

original: sā ca prabhā pratinivṛtyā bhagavantaṃ triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavata uṣṇīṣe'ntarhitā /
analyzed: sā ca prabhā pratinivṛtya ā bhagavantam triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā bhagavataḥ uṣṇīṣentarhitā
translated: And that light, having returned, circumambulated the Blessed One three times and disappeared into the top of his head.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca gaṇanātikrāntā devamanuṣyā yakṣarākṣasanāgāsurā avaivartikāḥ sthāpitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ deva manuṣyāḥ yakṣa rākṣasa nāga asurāḥ a vaivartikāḥ sthāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And having seen that, countless gods, humans, yakshas, rakshasas, nagas, and asuras were established in irreversibility toward supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntaḥ ca sattvāḥ samādhi kṣānti dhāraṇī pratilabdhavantaḥ
translated: And countless beings attained concentration, patience, and retention.

original: yairjambūdvīpakairmanuṣyaiḥ śrutamañjure nagare rājadhānyāṃ jambūvanodyānaṃ bhagavato'rthāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca devairdivyairalaṅkāravibhūṣaṇairalaṅkṛtaṃ
analyzed: yaiḥ jambūdvīpakaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ śrutamañjure nagare rājadhānyām jambū vana udyānam bhagavataḥ ūrthāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca devaiḥ divyaiḥ alaṅkāra vibhūṣaṇaiḥ alaṅkṛtam
translated: Those human beings of Jambudvipa who heard that in the capital city of Amrapali, the grove of Amrapali was adorned for the Blessed One and the assembly of monks with divine ornaments and adornments,

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam gatvā paśyemaḥ
translated: Let us go and see.

original: tatra ca ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ paśyema bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: tatra ca ratnagarbham tathāgatam paśyema bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: And there we will see the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and the assembly of monks.

original: tatra gatvā bhagavataḥ sakāśād dharmaṃ śṛṇuyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra gatvā bhagavataḥ sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyāmaḥ
translated: Having gone there, we will hear the Dharma from the Blessed One.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena divasedivase'nekāni devamanuṣyebhyaḥ strīpuruṣadārakadārikākoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi mañjurakaṃ nagaramāgacchanti bhagavato darśanāyopasaṃkramaṇāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena divase divasena ekāni deva manuṣyebhyaḥ strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi mañjurakam nagaram āgacchanti bhagavataḥ darśanāya upasaṃkramaṇāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: At that time, day after day, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of men, women, boys, and girls from the gods and humans were coming to the city of Mañjūka in order to see the Blessed One, to approach him, to attend on him, and the assembly of monks,

analyzed: tam codyānām didṛkṣavaḥ
translated: and to see that park.

analyzed: tasya ca udyānasya viṃśat dvāra sahasrāṇi sapta ratna mayāni abhūvan
translated: That park had twenty thousand gates made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: ekaikasmin udyāna dvāre pañca pañca śatāni ratna pīṭhānām prajñaptāni
translated: At each gate of the park, five hundred jeweled thrones were arranged.

analyzed: teṣu ca pañca pañca māṇavaka śatāni upaviṣṭāni
translated: And on those thrones, five hundred young brahmins were seated.

original: ye te sattvā gatāstamudyānaṃ praviśanti tāṃste māṇavakā buddhasāraṇaṃ gamayanti dharmaśaraṇaṃ gamayanti saṅghaśaraṇaṃ gamayanti /
analyzed: ye te sattvāḥ gatāḥ tam udyānam praviśanti tān te māṇavakāḥ buddha sāraṇam gamayanti dharma śaraṇam gamayanti saṅgha śaraṇam gamayanti
translated: Those beings who had gone and entered the park, the young brahmins led them to take refuge in the Buddha, to take refuge in the Dharma, and to take refuge in the Saṅgha.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayanti cittam ca utpādayanti
translated: They encourage others to generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: āsanasthā ye dūrasthāyinaḥ paścāttamudyānaṃ praviśanti bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca darśanāya /
analyzed: āsana sthāḥ ye dūra sthāyinaḥ paścāt tam udyānam praviśanti bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca darśanāya
translated: Those who are seated or standing far away enter that garden later to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, to attend upon him, and to see the community of monks.

original: evaṃ samudrareṇumā brāhmaṇenāgrapurohitena tāni saptavarṣāṇi gaṇanātikrāntā devā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā vinītā niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: evam samudrareṇumān brāhmaṇena agra purohitena tāni sapta varṣāṇi gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ devāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ vinītāḥ niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: In the same way, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, the chief priest, for those seven years encouraged, instructed, inspired, and established more than counted gods in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: gaṇanātikrāntā nāgāḥ asurā yakṣarākṣasāḥ kumbhāṇḍā gandharvāḥ pretāḥ piśācā nairayikā gaṇanātikrāntāḥ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā vinītā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ nāgāḥ asurāḥ yakṣa rākṣasāḥ kumbhāṇḍāḥ gandharvāḥ pretāḥ piśācāḥ nairayikāḥ gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ vinītāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: More than counted nāgas, asuras, yakṣas, rākṣasas, kumbhāṇḍas, gandharvas, pretas, piśācas, and hell beings were encouraged, instructed, inspired, and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat tiryagyoni gatāḥ iti
translated: Up to those born as animals.

original: sa teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāmatyayena samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturaśītiścakrasahasrāṇi sthāpayitvā divyaṃ cakraratnaṃ /
analyzed: sa teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām atyayena samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturaśītiḥ cakra sahasrāṇi sthāpayitvā divyam cakra ratnam
translated: When those seven years had passed, the brahmin Samudrareṇu, having set aside eighty-four thousand wheels, except for the divine wheel-gem,

analyzed: caturaśīti hasti sahasrāṇi sapta ratna alaṅkāra vibhūṣitāni sthāpayitvā hasti ratnam
translated: He offered eighty-four thousand elephants adorned with the ornaments of the seven precious substances, except for the elephant treasure.

analyzed: yāvat caturaśīti ratha sahasrāṇi niryātayati
translated: He offered eighty-four thousand chariots.

original: teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ atyayena rājño'raṇeminaḥ na rāgacchanda utpadyate /
analyzed: teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām atyayena rājñoḥ aṇeminaḥ na rāga chandaḥ utpadyate
translated: After the passing of those seven years, King Arṇe-miṇa did not give rise to desire for passion,

original: na dveṣacchandaḥ na mohacchandaḥ na rājacchandaḥ na dhanacchandaḥ na putracchandaḥ na devīcchandaḥ nāhāracchandaḥ na pānacchandaḥ na vastracchandaḥ na gandhacchandaḥ na yānacchandaḥ na nidracchandaḥ nātmacchandaḥ /
analyzed: na dveṣa chandaḥ na moha chandaḥ na rāja chandaḥ na dhana chandaḥ na putra chandaḥ na devī chandaḥ na āhāra chandaḥ na pāna chandaḥ na vastra chandaḥ na gandha chandaḥ na yāna chandaḥ na nidrā chandaḥ na ātma chandaḥ
translated: did not give rise to desire for hatred, did not give rise to desire for delusion, did not give rise to desire for kingship, did not give rise to desire for wealth, did not give rise to desire for sons, did not give rise to desire for queens, did not give rise to desire for food, did not give rise to desire for drink, did not give rise to desire for clothes, did not give rise to desire for scents, did not give rise to desire for vehicles, did not give rise to desire for sleep, did not give rise to desire for self,

analyzed: na para chandam kṛtavān
translated: and did not give rise to desire for others.

analyzed: sapta varṣāṇi na pārśvam nikṣiptavān
translated: For seven years he did not lay his side down.

analyzed: na ca asya rātri saṃjñā utpannā
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of night.

analyzed: na divasa saṃjñā utpannā
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of day.

original: na rūpasaṃjñāṃ na śabdasaṃjñāṃ na rasasaṃjñāṃ na gandhasaṃjñāṃ na sparśāsaṃjñāṃ utpāditavān /
analyzed: na rūpa saṃjñām na śabda saṃjñām na rasa saṃjñām na gandha saṃjñām na sparśa asaṃjñām utpāditavān
translated: He did not give rise to the notion of form, the notion of sound, the notion of smell, the notion of taste, or the notion of touch.

analyzed: taiḥ ca saptabhiḥ varṣaiḥ kāya śramaḥ na utpannaḥ
translated: For those seven years, he did not give rise to physical fatigue.

original: nityaṃ satatasamitaṃ daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyāṃ diśi sahasraṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paramāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: nityam satata samitam daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasram buddhakṣetram paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām paśyati
translated: He always, continuously, in the ten directions, in each direction, sees the array of qualities of a buddha-field in world systems equal to the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields.

analyzed: na ca sumeruḥ cakṣuṣā uvabhāsam āgacchati
translated: And Mount Sumeru does not come within the range of his vision.

original: nānye parvatāḥ na cakravāḍamahācakravāḍāḥ na lokāntarikā na candrādityau na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣo'vabhāsaṃ āgacchanti /🔽yathā tāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: na anye parvatāḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na loka āntarikāḥ na candra ādityau na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣā uvabhāsam āgacchanti  yathā tām buddhakṣetram pariśuddhām paśyati
translated: Other mountains, the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, the intervening spaces, the moon and sun, and the celestial palaces do not come within the range of his vision.🔽As he sees the perfectly pure buddha-field,

analyzed: tathā eva pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyan praṇidhānam cintayati
translated: in the same way, seeing the array of qualities of a perfectly pure buddha-field, he contemplates his vow.

original: yathāraṇemī rājā īdṛśena sukhaguṇavihāreṇa saptavarṣāṇi viharati /
analyzed: yathā araṇemī rājā īdṛśena sukha guṇa vihāreṇa sapta varṣāṇi viharati
translated: Just as King Araṇemi dwells for seven years in such a pleasurable and virtuous dwelling,

analyzed: īdṛśān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhān paśyati
translated: he sees such arrays of qualities of a buddha-field.

analyzed: pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham praṇidhānam cintayan niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Seated, contemplating his vow for a perfectly pure buddha-field and its qualities,

analyzed: evam animiṣaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ rāja putraḥ
translated: in the same way, Aniriṇa, the eldest prince,

analyzed: nimuḥ
translated: Nimir,

analyzed: indra gaṇaḥ
translated: the Indra group,

original: evaṃ tadrājñaḥ sarvaṃ putrasahastaṃ ca caturaśītikoṭṭarājasahasrāṇi aparāṇi ca dvānavatiprāṇakoṭyaḥ sarvāṇyevameva saptavarṣāṇi ekākino rahogatāḥ
analyzed: evam tat rājñaḥ sarvam putra sahastam ca caturaśīti koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi aparāṇi ca dvānavati prāṇa koṭyaḥ sarvāṇi evam eva sapta varṣāṇi ekākinaḥ rahaḥ gatāḥ
translated: Thus, the king, all his thousand sons, the eighty-four thousand minor kings, and the other nine hundred and twenty million beings, all in the same way, for seven years, alone and in seclusion,

original: daśasu dikṣvaikaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān lokadhātūn paśyanti /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn paśyanti
translated: they see in the ten directions, in each direction, world systems equal to the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields.

original: na ca teṣāṃ saptānāṃ varṣāṇāṃ antareṇa rāgacchanda utpanno na dveṣacchando na mohacchandaḥ /
analyzed: na ca teṣām saptānām varṣāṇām antareṇa rāga chandaḥ utpannaḥ na dveṣa chandaḥ na moha chandaḥ
translated: And during those seven years, not even a desire for passion, hatred, or delusion arose in them.

analyzed: yāvat na teṣām śrama sthānam utpannam abhūt
translated: Until not even a thought of weariness arose in them.

original: satatasamitaṃ ca daśasu dikṣvaikaikasyāṃ diśi sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyanti /
analyzed: satata samitam ca daśasu dikṣu aikaikasyām diśi sahasra buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti
translated: And constantly, in the ten directions, in each direction, they see the arrays of qualities of buddha-fields equal to the atoms in a thousand buddha-fields.

analyzed: na ca teṣām sumeruḥ cakṣusā uvabhāsam āgacchati
translated: And Mount Sumeru does not appear to their eyes,

original: na cānye parvatā yāvanna divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣo'vabhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: na ca anye parvatāḥ yāvat na divyāni vimānāni cakṣuṣā uvabhāsam āgacchanti
translated: nor do other mountains, up to the celestial palaces, appear to their eyes.

original: yathaiva te buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ tathaiva pariśuddhabuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānaṃ cintayanti /
analyzed: yathā eva te buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ tathā eva pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam cintayanti
translated: Just as they have seen the arrays of qualities in the Buddha-field, they conceive the vow for the arrays of qualities in the perfectly pure Buddha-field.

original: sarva evamīdṛśena guṇavihāreṇa saptavarṣān viharanti /🔽kecit pariśuddhabuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ cintayanti /
analyzed: sarve evam īdṛśena guṇa vihāreṇa sapta varṣān viharanti  kecid pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām cintayanti
translated: In this way, they all dwell for seven years with such a practice of qualities.🔽Some conceive the arrays of qualities in the perfectly pure Buddha-field,

analyzed: kecid a pariśuddha buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham cintayanti
translated: while some conceive the arrays of qualities in the impure Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastāni saptavarṣāṇi nirgatāni niṣṭhitāni viditvā saptaratnaṃ niryātayati /
analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tāni sapta varṣāṇi nirgatāni niṣṭhitāni viditvā sapta ratnam niryātayati
translated: Then, the brahmin Samudrareņu, knowing that those seven years had passed and were completed, offered the seven jewels.

original: yena ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat mayā bhadanta bhagavan rājāraṇemī anutarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: yena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat mayā bhadanta bhagavan rājā araṇemī anutarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Having bowed with folded hands to the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, he said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I have inspired King Aranemi in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa gṛhaṃ gatvaikākī rahogataḥ pratisaṃlīno niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa gṛham gatvā ekākī rahaḥ gataḥ pratisaṃlīnaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: He went home, sat alone in private, and remained seated.

original: na cātra kasyacin manuṣyasya praveśo dīyate /
analyzed: na ca atra kasyacid manuṣyasya praveśaḥ dīyate
translated: And no human was allowed to enter there.

original: evaṃ tatsahasraṃ rājaputrāṇāṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitaṃ /
analyzed: evam tat sahasram rāja putrāṇām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitam
translated: In this way, he inspired a thousand princes in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evameva pratiprati svagṛhāṇi gatvā ekākinaḥ pratisaṃlayananiṣaṇṇaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva prati prati sva gṛhāṇi gatvā ekākinaḥ pratisaṃlayana niṣaṇṇam
translated: In the same way, each one went to their own house and sat down in solitude and meditation.

analyzed: na ca atra kasyacid praveśaḥ dīyate
translated: And no one was allowed to enter there.

original: evaṃ yāvaccaturaśītiḥ koṭṭarājasahasrāṇi evamapare dvānavatiḥ prāṇakoṭyo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat caturaśītiḥ koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi evam apare dvānavatiḥ prāṇa koṭyaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: In the same way, the eighty-four thousand vassal kings, and the other ninety-two million beings who were inspired, introduced, and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: sarve svakasvakāni gṛhāṇi gatvā hyekākino rahasi gatā niṣadya pratisaṃlīnā /
analyzed: sarve svaka svakāni gṛhāṇi gatvā hi ekākinaḥ rahasi gatāḥ niṣadya pratisaṃlīnā
translated: all went to their own homes, and having gone alone into seclusion, they sat down and meditated.

analyzed: na ca atra kasyacid praveśaḥ dīyate
translated: And no one was allowed to enter there.

original: bhagavāṃścaināṃ samanvāharatu yāvad rājāraṇemī tasmāt pratisaṃlayanād vyutthāyehāgacchet /
analyzed: bhagavān ca enām samanvāharatu yāvat rājā araṇemī tasmāt pratisaṃlayanāt vyutthāya iha āgacchet
translated: And may the Blessed One pay attention to them, so that King Arṇemi may arise from that meditation and come here.

original: te'pi sarva ihagaccheyuḥ ye mayā sarve bodhau samādāpitāḥ acalāṃ ca buddhimanugṛhṇeyuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: te api sarve iha gaccheyuḥ ye mayā sarve bodhau samādāpitāḥ acalām ca buddhim anugṛhṇeyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may all those whom I have inspired in enlightenment come here, and may they attain unshakable understanding of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bhagavataścāntikādvyākaraṇaṃ prāpnuyurgotraṃ ca nāma ca buddhakṣetraṃ ca pratigṛhṇīyuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca antikāt vyākaraṇam prāpnuyuḥ gotram ca nāma ca buddhakṣetram ca pratigṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: And may they receive predictions from the Blessed One, and may they receive lineages, names, and buddha-fields.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho nirhārapatiṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ nirhāra patim nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, entered the samadhi called Lord of Accomplishment.

analyzed: yathā samāpannasya mukhāt nīla pīta lohita avadāta mañjiṣṭhā sphaṭika varṇāḥ arciṣaḥ niścaranti
translated: As he entered, rays of blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, and crystal colors issued forth from his mouth.

original: yāṃ niśṛtya teṣāṃ pratisaṃlīnānāṃ viharatāmagrato brahmanirmitaḥ sthita evamāha /
analyzed: yām niśṛtya teṣām pratisaṃlīnānām viharatām agratas brahmanirmitaḥ sthitaḥ evam āha
translated: Relying on those, while they were dwelling in seclusion, Brahma's emanation stood before them and said this:

original: uttiṣṭhata mārṣā bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkramata vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhata mārṣāḥ bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkramata vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: Rise, sirs, and approach the Blessed One to see him, to pay homage to him, and to attend on him, as well as the assembly of monks.

analyzed: parisamāptā mārṣā samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya sapta vārṣikaḥ yajñaḥ
translated: Sirs, the seven-year sacrifice of the Brahmin Samudrarenu has been completed.

analyzed: bhagavān punar anyena caryām prakramiṣyati
translated: The Blessed One will now proceed on his journey elsewhere.

analyzed: tatas te sarve raśmibhiḥ saṃcoditāḥ
translated: Then all of them were urged by the rays.

analyzed: utthāya rājānam araṇeminam codayanti
translated: Having risen, they urged King Aranemi.

analyzed: sa taiḥ saṃcoditaḥ vyutthitaḥ prasthitaḥ ca
translated: Urged by them, he rose and set out.

original: prasthitasya ca tasya rājño devatā gaganatale bherīmṛdaṃgapaṭahādīn vādyāni pravādayanti /
analyzed: prasthitasya ca tasya rājñaḥ devatāḥ gagana tale bherī mṛdaṃga paṭaha ādīn vādyāni pravādayanti
translated: And as he set out, the gods in the sky played musical instruments such as drums, kettledrums, and cymbals.

original: atha khalu rājāraṇemī rathābhirūḍhaḥ tena putrasahasreṇa caturaśītibhiśca koṭṭarājasahasrairdvānavatibhiśca prāṇakoṭibhiḥ parivṛto nagarānniryāti bhagavato'ntikaṃ bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /🔽sa yāvad yānasya bhūmistāvadyānena yātvā yānād avatarati /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā araṇemī ratha abhirūḍhaḥ tena putra sahasreṇa caturaśītibhiḥ ca koṭṭarāja sahasraiḥ dvānavatibhiḥ ca prāṇa koṭibhiḥ parivṛtaḥ nagarāt niryāti bhagavataḥ ntikam bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya  sa yāvat yānasya bhūmiḥ tāvat yānena yātvā yānāt avatarati
translated: Then King Arṇemi, mounted on a chariot, together with his thousand sons, eighty-four thousand vassal kings, and ninety-two million people, set out from the city to the Blessed One, in order to see, pay homage to, and serve the Blessed One.🔽He went as far as the ground allowed for a vehicle, and then descended from the chariot.

analyzed: yānāt avatīrya padbhyām eva jambū vanam praviveśa
translated: Having descended from the chariot, he entered the Rose Apple Grove on foot.

analyzed: praviśya ca yena bhagavān tena upajagāma
translated: Having entered, he approached where the Blessed One was.

original: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śīrasābhivandya bhikṣusaṅghasya caikānte nyaṣīdat sārdham anekaiḥ prāṇakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śīrasā abhivandya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca ekānte nyaṣīdat sārdham anekaiḥ prāṇa koṭibhiḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and the community of monks, and sat down to one side together with many millions of living beings.

original: atha samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo rājānamaraṇeminaṃ prāha anumodatu mahārājemaṃ yacca tvayā māstrayaṃ bhagavataḥ upasthānaṃ kṛtaṃ sarvopakaraṇaiḥ aparimitasya bhikṣusaṅghasya ca nānāvicitrāṇi ca ratnāni niryātitāni caturaśītiśca nagarasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: atha samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājānam araṇeminam prāha anumodatu mahā rāja imam yat ca tvayā bhagavataḥ upasthānam kṛtam sarva upakaraṇaiḥ aparimitasya bhikṣu saṅghasya ca nānā vicitrāṇi ca ratnāni niryātitāni caturaśītiḥ ca nagara sahasrāṇi
translated: Then the brahmin Samudrarenu said to King Aranemin: May the great king rejoice in this, that for three months you have served the Blessed One and the assembly of monks with all requisites, and have offered various precious things, and eighty-four thousand cities.

original: tadevānumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ yacca parityāgasahagataṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ sarvaṃ pariṇāmayānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tat eva anumodanā sahagatam puṇya skandham yat ca parityāga sahagatam puṇya skandham sarvam pariṇāmaya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May you dedicate all that heap of merit associated with rejoicing and the heap of merit associated with renunciation to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ tad rājñaḥ putrasahasraṃ samādāpayati tathaiva caturaśītiḥ koṭṭarājasahasrāṇi aparāśca bahuprāṇakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: evam tat rājñaḥ putra sahasram samādāpayati tathā eva caturaśītiḥ koṭṭarāja sahasrāṇi aparāḥ ca bahu prāṇa koṭyaḥ
translated: Thus he inspired the king's thousand sons, and likewise the eighty-four thousand vassal kings, and many other millions of beings.

analyzed: tena anumodanā sahagatena puṇya skandhena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: By that heap of merit associated with rejoicing, they were inspired and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ cāha anumodata yūyamiha dakṣiṇāṃ niryātayata /
analyzed: evam ca āha anumodata yūyam iha dakṣiṇām niryātayata
translated: And he said: 'Rejoice here and dedicate your offerings.'

analyzed: kathayati ca
translated: And he said:

analyzed: dānena aham anena na indra bhavanam
translated: 'By this generosity, I do not seek Indra's abode,

analyzed: na brahma loke phalam
translated: nor the fruit of Brahma's world,

analyzed: kāṅkṣāmi druta vāyu vega capalām
translated: I long for the swiftness of the wind,

analyzed: na tu eva rājya śriyam
translated: Not for the glory of a kingdom.

analyzed: dānasya asya phalam tu
translated: But by the fruit of this giving, with great devotion,

analyzed: yat me ha tena āpnuyām
translated: May I attain what I have.

analyzed: citta aiśvarya karim hi bodhim atulām
translated: For I shall attain unsurpassed enlightenment, which brings mastery of mind,

analyzed: sattvān ca santāraye
translated: And deliver beings.

analyzed: iti śrī karuṇāpuṇḍarīke dāna visargaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter on generosity in the White Lotus of Compassion.

analyzed: bodhisattva vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ caturthaḥ
translated: Chapter IV: The Prediction for the Bodhisattvas

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya etat abhavat
translated: Then, noble sir, this thought occurred to the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One:

original: bahyo'nena samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena prāṇakoṭyo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā avaivartikabhūmau sthāpitāste ca mayā vyākartavyā buddhakṣetrāśca darśayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: bahyā unena samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena prāṇa koṭyaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ a vaivartika bhūmau sthāpitāḥ te ca mayā vyākartavyāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ ca darśayitavyāḥ
translated: Many millions of living beings have been inspired, introduced, and established by this Brahmana Samudrarenu in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and they have been established in the stage of nonretrogression. They must be predicted by me, and their Buddha-fields must be shown.

original: atha khalu bhagavān bodhicittāsaṃpramoṣaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bodhi cittāsaṃpramoṣam nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the samadhi called Not Forgetting the Thought of Enlightenment,

analyzed: smitam ca prāviṣkṛtavān
translated: and he smiled.

original: yena smitāviṣkaraṇenānantā paryantā buddhakṣetrā udareṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsya rājño'raṇemino'nyeṣāṃ ca bahūnāṃ prāṇakoṭināṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ ādarśayati /
analyzed: yena smita āviṣkaraṇena anantā paryantāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ udareṇa avabhāsena avabhāsya ca bahūnām prāṇa koṭinām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham ādarśayati
translated: By that smile, the infinite and boundless buddha-fields were illuminated with light, and the array of qualities of the buddha-field was shown to King Arṇe-miṇa and to many other millions of living beings.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena daśasu dikṣu gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ tamavabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvā buddhānubhāvenemāṃ lokadhātuṃ samāgatā bhagavato darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣusaṅghaṃ ca /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā buddha anubhāvena imām lokadhātum samāgatāḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya bhikṣu saṅgham ca
translated: Then, at that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the buddha-fields beyond count in the ten directions, having seen that light, assembled in this world-realm through the power of the Buddha in order to see the Blessed One, to pay homage to him, and to attend on him, as well as on the community of monks.

original: te ca vividhairbodhisattvavikurvitairbhagavataḥ pūjāṃ kṛtvā pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ paryupāsya purato niṣaṇṇā bodhisattvapraṇidhānaṃ śrotukāmāḥ /
analyzed: te ca vividhaiḥ bodhisattva vikurvitaiḥ bhagavataḥ pūjām kṛtvā pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam paryupāsya puratas niṣaṇṇāḥ bodhisattva praṇidhānam śrotu kāmāḥ
translated: And they, having made offerings to the Blessed One with various bodhisattva transformations, having bowed their heads at his feet, having attended on the Blessed One, seated in front, were desirous of hearing the bodhisattva vow.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohitaḥ rājānamaraṇeminamāha tvaṃ tāvan mahārāja prathamaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ pratigṛhṇīṣva
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ rājānam araṇeminam āha  tvam tāvat mahā rāja prathamam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham pratigṛhṇīṣva
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudra-reṇu, the chief priest, said to King Arṇe-miṇa: You, great king, first accept the array of qualities of the buddha-field,

original: atha rājānaṇemī yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat ahaṃ bhagavan bodhyarthikaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā anaṇemī yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat aham bhagavan bodhyarthikaḥ
translated: Then King Aṇemi, bowing with folded hands to the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I am one who seeks enlightenment.

original: yanmayā māsatrayaṃ bhagavato nānāvidhairupakaraṇairupasthānaṃ kṛtamaprameyasya ca bhikṣusaṅghasya tanmayā kuśalamūlamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmitaṃ /
analyzed: yat mayā māsa trayam bhagavataḥ nānāvidhaiḥ upakaraṇaiḥ upasthānam kṛtam aprameyasya ca bhikṣu saṅghasya tat mayā kuśala mūlam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmitam
translated: The roots of virtue that I have dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by serving the Blessed One and the immeasurable assembly of monks with various requisites for three months,

original: imāni ca bhagavan mayā saptavarṣāṇi buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāścintitā /
analyzed: imāni ca bhagavat mayā sapta varṣāṇi buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ cintitā
translated: and, Blessed One, I have contemplated the arrays of qualities of the Buddha-field for seven years.

original: yatrāhaṃ bhagavan buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho yatra na nirayā syurna tiryagyonirna yamalokāḥ /
analyzed: yatra aham bhagavan buddhakṣetre in uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ yatra na syuḥ na tiryagyoniḥ na yama lokāḥ
translated: In that Buddha-field, Blessed One, where I will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, may there be no hells, no animal realms, no realms of Yama.

analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ cyavayuḥ te mā durgatau upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And may the beings who die there not be reborn in unfortunate realms.

analyzed: sarve tatra sattvāḥ suvarṇa varṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: May all beings there have golden complexions.

original: sarveṣāṃ tatra devamanuṣyāṇāṃ nānātvaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: sarveṣām tatra deva manuṣyāṇām nānātvam na syāt
translated: May there be no distinction at all between the gods and humans there.

analyzed: sarve tatra sattvāḥ jāti smarāḥ
translated: May all beings there remember their past lives.

original: sarvasattvāścaivaṃrūpeṇa divyena cakṣuṣā samanvāgatāḥ syuryad buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhato yāpayato dharmaṃ ca deśayataḥ paśyeyuḥ /🔽sarvasattvāścaivaṃrupeṇa divyena śrotreṇa samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa divyena cakṣuṣā samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ yat buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ dharmam ca deśayataḥ paśyeyuḥ  sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrupeṇa divyena śrotreṇa samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ
translated: And may all sentient beings be endowed with such divine vision that they see the many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas in other world systems who are present there, living there, and teaching the Dharma.

original: yad buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayamānaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /🔽sarvasattvāścaivaṃrūpeṇa paracittajñānena samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: yat buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām dharmam deśayamānam śṛṇuyuḥ  sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa para citta jñānena samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ
translated: And may all sentient beings be endowed with such divine hearing that they hear the Dharma being taught by the many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas.

analyzed: teṣām bahu buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasra sthitānām sattvānām citta caritāni ājāneyuḥ
translated: And may all sentient beings be endowed with such knowledge of the minds of others that they know the mental activities of sentient beings who are present in many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhafields.

original: sarvasattvāḥ tathāvidhenarddhikauśalyena samanvāgatāḥ syuryadekacittotpādena buddhakṣetrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi atikrameyuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ tathāvidhena ṛddhi kauśalyena samanvāgatāḥ syuḥ yat eka citta utpādena buddhakṣetra koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi atikrameyuḥ
translated: And may all sentient beings be endowed with such skill in miraculous powers that with a single thought they can travel to many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhafields.

original: mā ca tatra sattvā bhaveyuḥ parigrahavanto'ntataḥ svaśarīre'pyanāgṛhītamānasāḥ /
analyzed: mā ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ sva śarīre ipi an āgṛhīta mānasāḥ
translated: And may the sentient beings there not be attached to possessions, not even to their own bodies or minds.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all beings would be irreversible from highest genuine full Awakening.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca upapādukāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings would be spontaneously born.

analyzed: na tatra mātṛgrāmasya prajñaptiḥ bhavet
translated: There would be no designation of women there.

original: na tatra sattvānāṃ āyuḥ pramāṇaparyantaḥ syād /
analyzed: na tatra sattvānām āyuḥ pramāṇa paryantaḥ syāt
translated: There would be no limit to the lifespans of beings there,

analyzed: anyatra praṇidhāna vaśena
translated: except through the power of a vow.

analyzed: na tatra sattvānām akuśalasya nāma api syāt
translated: There would be no such thing as non-virtue there.

analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre durgandham syāt
translated: There would be no bad smells in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: divya atikrāntena bhagavat gandhena tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam syāt
translated: That Buddha-field would be filled with a divine fragrance that surpasses the divine.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtāḥ syuḥ
translated: All beings would be adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great person.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ syuḥ
translated: All beings there would be bound to one more birth,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā praṇidhānam
translated: except through a vow.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ tatra eka pūrvāhṇena buddha anubhāvena gaṇanā atikrāntān buddhān paryupāsīran
translated: In one morning, through the power of the Buddha, all beings there would attend to more than can be counted Buddhas.

original: yāvad vividhena bodhisattvavikurvitenākāṅkṣeyuḥ buddhānāṃ pūjāṃ kartuṃ tathaiva teṣāṃ siddhyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vividhena bodhisattva vikurvitena ākāṅkṣeyuḥ buddhānām pūjām kartum tathā eva teṣām siddhyeyuḥ
translated: And as much as they would wish to make offerings to the Buddhas through various kinds of bodhisattva transformations, it would be accomplished just like that.

analyzed: tena eva pūrva bhaktena vivarteyuḥ
translated: They would be able to live on that very same food from the past.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca buddha piṭakam kathayeyuḥ
translated: All beings would recite the Buddha's canon.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca nārāyaṇa bala samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: All beings would be endowed with the strength of Narayana.

original: na kaścit sattvo buddhakṣetraguṇālaṅkārasya varṇaparyantaṃ śaktaḥ syādgṛhītumantaśo divyenāpi cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: na kaścid sattvaḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṅkārasya varṇa paryantam śaktaḥ syāt gṛhītum antaśas divyena api cakṣuṣā
translated: No being would be able to describe the adornments of the Buddha-field, not even up to a mere fraction, with even a divine eye.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ tatra pratisaṃvid prāptāḥ syuḥ
translated: All beings there would attain the analytical knowledges.

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya pratibhānāḥ
translated: They would have innumerable insights.

analyzed: ekaikasya ca bodhisattvasya yojana sahasra pramāṇam syāt
translated: Each bodhisattva would be a thousand leagues tall.

analyzed: prabhāsvaram ca tat buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: That Buddha-field would be radiant.

analyzed: samantena ca gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhāḥ tatra dṛśyeyuḥ
translated: And all around, beyond count, the adornments of the Buddha-fields would be seen there.

original: ye cātra sattvā upapadyeyuryāvadbodhiparyantena brahmacāriṇaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca atra sattvāḥ upapadyeyuḥ yāvat bodhi paryantena brahmacāriṇaḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings born there, up to the end of enlightenment, would be celibate.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ sa devakasya lokasya namasyanīyāḥ syuḥ
translated: All beings would be worthy of homage from the world with its gods.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na indriya vikalāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, they would not have deficient faculties.

analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ divya atikrāntam ārya prīti sukham pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And beings born there would attain divine, transcendent, noble joy and happiness.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca tatra kuśala mūla samavadhānāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings there would be united in the roots of virtue.

original: sarvasattvāśca tatra navāni vastrāṇi kāśāyāṇi dhārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca tatra navāni vastrāṇi kāśāyāṇi dhārayeyuḥ
translated: And all beings there would wear new saffron-colored robes.

original: sahopapannāśca tatra sattvāḥ suvibhaktivatīṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ suvibhaktivatīm samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And beings born there would attain the samādhi called 'endowed with clear discrimination.'

original: yasya samādheḥ pratilābhādgaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā buddhān paryupasīran yāvad bodhiparyantenānupaśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: yasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā buddhān paryupasīran yāvat bodhi paryantena anupaśyeyuḥ
translated: By attaining that samādhi, they would go to buddha-fields beyond count and attend on the buddhas, and would see them until the end of enlightenment.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvā upapadyeyuḥ te yādṛgjātīyāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛgjātīyān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ teṣu ratnavṛkṣeṣu paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ upapadyeyuḥ te yādṛś jātīyām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛś jātīyān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ teṣu ratna vṛkṣeṣu paśyeyuḥ
translated: And the bodhisattvas born there would see in those jeweled trees the arrays of qualities of buddha-fields of whatever kind they would wish for.

original: sahopapannāśca sattvāḥ samādhiṃ pratilabheyuryasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt daśasu dikṣu gaṇanātikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāstiṣṭhato yāpayato nityaṃ paśyeyurye tatra sattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ te sarva evaṃrūpeṇa cīvaravimānālaṅkārābharaṇavarṇarūpeṇa syuryathā paranirmitavaśavartino devāḥ /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca sattvāḥ samādhim pratilabheyuḥ yasya samādheḥ pratilābhāt daśasu dikṣu gaṇanā atikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ nityam paśyeyuḥ ye tatra sattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ te sarve evaṃrūpeṇa cīvara vimāna alaṅkāra ābharaṇa varṇa rūpeṇa syuḥ yathā paranirmita vaśavartinaḥ devāḥ
translated: And the beings who are reborn there would attain concentration, by the attainment of which they would always see the Buddhas who abide and maintain themselves in the Buddha-fields beyond reckoning in the ten directions. And all those beings who are reborn there would have such a form, such garments, such palaces, such ornaments, and such complexions, that they would be like the devas of the class of the Nirmita-vaśavartin gods.

original: na tatra buddhakṣetre pāṃśuśilā kālaparvatā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre pāṃśuśilā kālaparvatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: In that Buddha-field there would be no dust, no pebbles, no black mountains.

analyzed: na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na sumeruḥ na mahā samudrāḥ
translated: There would be no Cakravāḍa or Mahācakravāḍa mountains, no Sumeru, no great oceans.

analyzed: na tatra avareṇa nivaraṇa kleśa śabdāḥ sarveṇa sarvam sarvatas ca
translated: There would be no words of the lower obscurations or afflictions, in any way, at all, or from anywhere.

original: tatra narakatiryagyoniyamalokaśabdo na syānnākṣaṇaśabdo na duḥkhaśabdaḥ /🔽evaṃrūpeṇāhaṃ bhagavan buddhakṣetreṇārthī /
analyzed: tatra naraka tiryagyoni yama loka śabdaḥ na syāt na akṣaṇa śabdaḥ na duḥkha śabdaḥ  evaṃrūpeṇa aham bhagavan buddhakṣetreṇa arthī
translated: There would be no words of the hells, animals, or Yama's realm, no words of misfortune, no words of suffering.🔽In such a Buddha-field, Blessed One, I aspire.

original: tāvadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvaduṣkaracaryāṃ cariṣye yāvannaivaṃrūpairguṇairbuddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣye /
analyzed: tāvat aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva duṣkara caryām cariṣye yāvat na evaṃrūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣye
translated: For so long, Venerable Blessed One, I will practice the difficult practices of a bodhisattva until I have purified a Buddha-field with such qualities.

analyzed: evam aham bhadanta bhagavan puruṣakāram kariṣye
translated: In this way, Venerable Blessed One, I will perform manly action.

analyzed: tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye
translated: Then afterwards I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: daśa yojana sāhasrikaḥ ca me bodhivṛkṣaḥ bhavet
translated: And may my Bodhi tree be ten thousand leagues high.

analyzed: tatra niṣaṇṇaḥ ca aham eka kṣaṇena citta utpādena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeya
translated: And sitting there, in a single moment of thought, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: apramāṇā ca me prabhā syāt buddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ avabhāsayanti /
analyzed: apramāṇā ca me prabhā syāt buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām avabhāsayanti
translated: And may my radiance be immeasurable, illuminating many quintillions of Buddha-fields.

original: aparimāṇā ca mamāyurbhavedaprameyakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ na śakyaṃ kenacid gaṇayitumanyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: aparimāṇā ca mama āyuḥ bhavet aprameya kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām na śakyam kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: And may my lifespan be immeasurable, many quintillions of incalculable eons, not able to be counted by anyone except through omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: aprameyaḥ ca me bodhisattva saṅghaḥ syāt śrāvaka pratyekabuddha varjitaḥ
translated: And may my assembly of Bodhisattvas be immeasurable, free from Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: yanna śakyaṃ gaṇayituṃ anyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: yat na śakyam gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: not able to be counted by anyone except through omniscient knowledge.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mamāprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhā bhagavanto varṇabhāṣaṇaṃ kuryurghoṣaṃ cānuśrāvayeyuryaśa udīrayeyuḥ
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ varṇa bhāṣaṇam kuryuḥ ghoṣam ca anuśrāvayeyuḥ yaśaḥ udīrayeyuḥ
translated: And may the Blessed Buddhas in immeasurable, incalculable other Buddha-fields, upon attaining enlightenment, speak praise, proclaim my fame, and utter my name.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mamāprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye sattvā nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuste sarve buddhakṣetre kuśalamūlapariṇāmanaṃ kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ye sattvāḥ nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ te sarve buddhakṣetre kuśala mūla pariṇāmanam kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may all those beings in immeasurable, incalculable other buddha-fields who hear my name plant the roots of virtue for rebirth in my buddha-field.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā ānantarya kārakān sattvān saddharma pratikṣepakān
translated: Except for those who commit the crimes with immediate retribution and those who reject the true Dharma.

original: bodhiprāptasya me'nyāsu gaṇanātikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu sattvā bodhicittotpādaṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya menyāsu gaṇanā atikrāntāsu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ bodhi citta utpādam kuryuḥ
translated: And may beings in other world systems beyond calculation, when I have attained enlightenment, arouse the mind set on enlightenment.

analyzed: mama buddhakṣetre upapattim ākāṅkṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Desiring rebirth in my buddha-field.

analyzed: tatra ca kuśala mūla pariṇāmanam kuryuḥ
translated: And there plant the roots of virtue.

analyzed: teṣām ca aham maraṇa kāla samayeṣu agratas tiṣṭheya bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ
translated: And may I stand before them at the time of their death, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: te ca māṃ dṛṣṭvā prītiṃ prasādaṃ ca mamāntika utpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca mām dṛṣṭvā prītim prasādam ca mama antike utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may they, seeing me, arouse joy and serene confidence in me.

analyzed: sarva āvaraṇa tām ca nivartayeyuḥ
translated: And may they turn away from all obscurations.

analyzed: kālam ca kṛtvā asmākam buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And having died, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāste'smākaṃ sakāśādaśrutapūrvāṃ dharmadeśanāmākāṅkṣeyuḥ śrotuṃ te yādṛśīmākāṅkṣeyustādṛśīṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ te smākam sakāśāt aśruta pūrvām dharma deśanām ākāṅkṣeyuḥ śrotum te yādṛśīm ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas there who wish to hear a Dharma teaching that they have not heard before from me, may they hear whatever they wish.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca mama gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvā nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ te'vaivartikāḥ syuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca mama gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvāḥ nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ te vaivartikāḥ syuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may bodhisattvas in buddha-fields beyond count hear my name, and may they become irreversible from highest genuine full Awakening.

analyzed: prathamām kṣāntim pratilabheyuḥ tathā dvitīyām
translated: May they attain the first forbearance, and likewise the second.

original: yādṛśīṃ samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ cākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīṃ samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ ca pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśīm samādhim dhāraṇīm ca ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm samādhim dhāraṇīm ca pratilabheyuḥ
translated: May they attain whatever meditative stabilization and dhāraṇī they wish.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca mama gaṇanātikrānteṣu kalpeṣu paścād gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvā mama nāmadheyaṃ śrutvā paramāṃ prītiṃ prasādaṃ prāmodyaṃ ca prāpnuyurmāmeva namasyamānā āścaryaprāptā yaśakīrtiṃ ca varṇayeyuḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca mama gaṇanā atikrānteṣu kalpeṣu paścāt gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvāḥ mama nāmadheyam śrutvā paramām prītim prasādam prāmodyam ca prāpnuyuḥ mām eva namasyamānāḥ āścarya prāptāḥ yaśa kīrtim ca varṇayeyuḥ
translated: And after incalculable eons have passed since my parinirvāṇa, may bodhisattvas in buddha-fields beyond count, having heard my name, attain the highest joy, faith, and delight, and may they pay homage to me alone, and, having attained the marvelous, may they proclaim my fame, renown, and praise.

original: bodhisattvabhūtena ca yadā mayā buddhakāryaṃ abhiniṣpāditaṃ tataḥ paścādanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtena ca yadā mayā buddha kāryam abhiniṣpāditam tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya iyam
translated: And when I have accomplished the Buddha's work as a Bodhisattva, then afterwards I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbuddhasya ca mama paramaprasādapratilabdhā bodhisattvāḥ prathamāyāḥ kṣāntyā lābhinaḥ syurdvitīyāyāḥ tṛtīyāyāḥ /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhasya ca mama parama prasāda pratilabdhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ prathamāyāḥ kṣāntyāḥ lābhinaḥ syuḥ dvitīyāyāḥ tṛtīyāyāḥ
translated: And for those who have attained supreme faith in me, the fully awakened one, the Bodhisattvas will attain the first forbearance, the second, and the third.

original: yādṛśīṃ ca samādhiṃ dhāraṇīṃ ākāṅkṣeyustādṛśīṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśīm ca samādhim dhāraṇīm ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśīm pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And whatever kind of concentration and retention they desire, they will attain that.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena anupaśyeyuḥ
translated: And they will see up to the end of enlightenment.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me gaṇanātikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāḥ striyo mama nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyustāḥ paramaprītiprāmodyaṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāḥ striyaḥ mama nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ parama prīti prāmodyam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And for those women in Buddha-fields beyond number who hear my name, they will attain supreme joy and gladness.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And they will generate the mind of enlightenment for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyaḥ strī tvam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And up to the end of enlightenment, they will no longer attain womanhood.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca me gaṇanātikrānteṣu kalpeṣu gaṇanātikrāntā yāḥ striyo mama nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ paramaprītiprāmodyaṃ prasādaṃ ca prāpnuyuḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu kalpeṣu gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ yāḥ striyaḥ mama nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ tāḥ parama prīti prāmodyam prasādam ca prāpnuyuḥ
translated: And after my parinirvāṇa, may those women who hear my name for incalculably many eons, may they attain supreme joy, delight, and faith.

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: May they generate the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyaḥ strī tvam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: Until the end of enlightenment, may they not again obtain a female body.

analyzed: īdṛśam aham bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetram ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: Bhadant, Blessed One, I aspire to such a buddha-field.

analyzed: īdṛśāḥ ca pariśuddha āśayāḥ sattvā
translated: Such are the beings with pure intentions.

analyzed: īdṛśā uham bhagavan buddhakṣetre in uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Blessed One, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment in such a buddha-field.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho rājño'raṇeminaḥ sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājñaḥ uraṇeminaḥ sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, gave his approval to King Arṇeminda:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā rāja
translated: Good, good, great king!

original: gambhīraste mahārāja praṇidhānaṃ pariśuddhaṃ te buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: gambhīraḥ te mahā rāja praṇidhānam pariśuddham te buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: Your aspiration, great king, is profound. You have accepted a pure buddha-field.

original: paśya mahārāja paścimāyāṃ diśi koṭīśatasahasrabuddhakṣetrāṇāṃ atikramya indrasuvirājitā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: paśya mahā rāja paścimāyām diśi koṭī śata sahasra buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramyaḥ indrasuvirājitā nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: Great King, look in the western direction, beyond a hundred thousand koṭis of buddha-fields, to the world-system called Indra's Splendor,

original: tatrendraghoṣeśvararājo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati pariśuddhānāṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tatra indraghoṣa īśvara rājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati pariśuddhānām sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: where the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Indra's Voice and King of Sovereignty resides, lives, and endures, teaching the Dharma to pure beings.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ prajñaptirapyasti /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām prajñaptiḥ api asti
translated: And in that buddha-field, there is not even the designation of śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: utpādāya na tatra śrāvaka pratyekabuddha kathā kriyate
translated: For the sake of birth there, the discourse of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is not performed.

analyzed: śuddhā ca tatra mahāyāna kathā
translated: And there, the discourse of the Great Vehicle is pure.

analyzed: sarve eva upapādukāḥ sattvā
translated: All beings are born spontaneously.

original: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāmāpi jñāyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāma api jñāyate
translated: And there, the name of a woman is not even known.

original: sarva ete guṇāstatra buddhakṣetre yathā mahārājenāparimitaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānam kṛtamamitāśayāḥ sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāstena tvaṃ mahārāja indraghoṣeśvararājatathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya tasmin saddharme'ntarhite ṣaṣṭīnāmantarakalpānāmatyayena sā lokadhāturmeruprabhā nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarve ete guṇāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre yathā mahā rājena aparimitam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam kṛtam amita āśayāḥ sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ tena tvam mahā rāja indraghoṣa īśvara rāja tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya tasmin saddharme antarhite ṣaṣṭīnām antara kalpānām atyayena sā lokadhātuḥ meruprabhā nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: All these qualities will be in that buddha field, just as the great king has made the vow for the immeasurable array of qualities of the buddha field. Since beings with immeasurable aspirations have been accepted as disciples, you, great king, after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata Indraghoṣeśvararāja, when sixty intermediate eons have passed and the true Dharma has disappeared, that world realm will be called Meruprabhā.

analyzed: tatra acintyamatiguṇarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There, the Tathāgata named Acintyamatisūryagarbha will appear, a Worthy One, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: yathaivendraghoṣeśvararājasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya indrasuvirājitāyāṃ lokadhātau buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaḥ tathaivācintyamatiguṇarājasya tathāgatasya meruprabhāyāṃ lokadhātau guṇavyūho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathā eva indraghoṣa īśvara rājasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya indrasuvirājitāyām lokadhātau buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ tathā eva acintyamatiguṇarājasya tathāgatasya meruprabhāyām lokadhātau guṇa vyūhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Just as the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One Indraghoṣeśvararāja has the array of qualities of the buddha field in the world realm Indrasurāvijitā, in the same way, the Tathāgata Acintyamatisūryagarbha will have the array of qualities in the world realm Meruprabhā.

analyzed: tasya ca acintyamatiguṇarājasya tathāgatasya ṣaṣṭi antara kalpāṇi āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: And the lifespan of that Tathāgata Acintyamatisūryagarbha will be sixty intermediate eons.

original: yadācintyamatiguṇarājastathāgataḥ parinirvāsyati tasya ṣoḍaśāntarakalpāḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: yadā acintyamatiguṇarājaḥ tathāgataḥ parinirvāsyati tasya ṣoḍaśa antara kalpāḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: When the Tathagata Acintyamatisugunanaraja passes into parinirvana, his true Dharma will remain for sixteen intermediate kalpas.

original: tasya saddharme'ntarhite sahasrāntarakalpātyayena viratirnāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya saddharme antarhite sahasra antara kalpa atyayena viratiḥ nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When his true Dharma has disappeared, after a thousand intermediate kalpas have passed, that world realm will be called Vira.

analyzed: tatra raśmiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There, a Tathagata named Rasmi, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, will appear.

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: The rest is the same as before.

analyzed: samāḥ ca eṣām āyuḥ samāḥ lokadhātuḥ
translated: Their lifespans will be the same, and the world realm will be the same.

original: evaṃ parinirvṛtānāṃ saddharme'ntarhite aparā nāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam parinirvṛtānām saddharme antarhite aparā nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, when they have passed into parinirvana and the true Dharma has disappeared, that world realm will be called Aparaa.

original: tara ratneśvaraghoṣo nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha utpatsyate /
analyzed: tara ratneśvaraghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ utpatsyate
translated: There, a Tathagata named Ratnesvaraghoṣa, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, will appear.

original: samo buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaḥ samaṃ cāntarakalpā sthāsyati yāpayiṣyati dharmaṃ ca deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: samaḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ samam ca antara kalpā sthāsyati yāpayiṣyati dharmam ca deśayiṣyati
translated: The adornments of the Buddha-field will be the same, and he will remain for the same number of intermediate kalpas, sustaining and teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: tasya parinirvṛtasya sapta antara kalpām saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: After his parinirvana, the true Dharma will remain for seven intermediate kalpas.

analyzed: tasmin ca saddharme antarhite
translated: And when the true Dharma has disappeared there,

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: the rest is the same as before.

original: evaṃ cāprameyāparimāṇān tathāgatāṃstatra buddhakṣetra upapannān paśyāmi parinirvṛtāṃśca /
analyzed: evam ca aprameya aparimāṇān tathāgatān tatra buddhakṣetre upapannān paśyāmi parinirvṛtān ca
translated: And I see that immeasurable and innumerable Tathāgatas have been born and have attained final nirvāṇa in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: na eva asau lokadhātuḥ saṃvartate na nivartate
translated: That world-system neither evolves nor devolves.

original: tatrānāgate'dhvani atikrānta ekasmin gaṅgāvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye nadīgaṅgāvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatra anāgata idhvani atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye nadī gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye sā lokadhātuḥ sukhāvatī nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, after one incalculable eon has passed and the second incalculable eon of the Ganges river sands has been completed, that world-system will be called Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: tatra tvam mahā rājan uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, great king, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: amitāyuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ urhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Amitāyus.

original: rājāraṇemyāha kutra te bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye'smākaṃ prathamataraṃ tatra buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: rājā araṇemī āha kutra te bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye smākam prathamataram tatra buddhakṣetre inuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: King Arṇema said, Bhagavān, where are those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that Buddha-field before us?

original: bhagavān āha ime te mahārāja bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye'prameyairasaṃkhyeyairatulyairaparimāṇairdaśabhyo digbhyaḥ tābhyastābhyo lokadhātubhya āgatā maṃ vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ime te mahā rāja bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye prameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atulyaiḥ aparimāṇaiḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ tābhyaḥ tābhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ āgatāḥ mam vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: The Blessed One said, Great King, these are the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have come from immeasurable, countless, incomparable, and limitless worlds in the ten directions to pay homage to me, to attend on me, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: ye mama purato niṣaṇṇā ete'tītairbuddhairvyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye mama puratas niṣaṇṇāḥ ete iti itaiḥ buddhaiḥ vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those who are seated in front of me have been predicted by the Buddhas of the past to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: pratyutpannairapi buddhairbhagavadbhirete kulaputrā vyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: pratyutpannaiḥ api buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ ete kula putrāḥ vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: These noble sons have also been predicted by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the present, to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ye tatra buddhakṣetre prathamataram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: They will first attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in that Buddha-field.

original: ekaikaścaiṣa mahārāja bodhisattvo'nekeṣāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ antike kṛtādhikāro'varuptakuśalamūlo bhāvitaprajñaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca eṣa mahā rāja bodhisattvaḥ ūnekeṣām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām antike kṛta adhikāraḥ avarupta kuśala mūlaḥ bhāvita prajñaḥ
translated: Great King, each of these bodhisattvas has served many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddhas, has planted the roots of virtue, and has cultivated wisdom.

original: ta ete mahārāja kulaputrā ye tatra prathamataraṃ buddhakṣetre buddhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te ete mahā rāja kula putrāḥ ye tatra prathamataram buddhakṣetre buddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Great King, those noble sons will first become Buddhas in that Buddha-field.

original: rājāraṇemyāha ayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo yenāhaṃ sapariṣatko'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ sa kiyatā kālenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate / /
analyzed: rājā araṇemī āha ayam bhadanta bhagavan samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena aham sa pariṣatkonuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ sa kiyatā kālena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate  /
translated: King Arṇemī said, Venerable Blessed One, this brahmin Sāgara­reṇu has inspired me and my assembly to the highest, complete enlightenment. In how much time will he attain the highest, complete enlightenment?

original: bhagavān āha mahākāruṇika eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha mahā kāruṇikaḥ eṣa brāhmaṇaḥ samudrareṇuḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, This brahmin Sāgara­reṇu is greatly compassionate.

analyzed: śroṣyasi tvam yathā eṣa siṃhanādam nadiṣyati
translated: You will hear how he will roar the lion's roar.

original: rājā āha yadyeṣa me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati yathāhaṃ bhagavatā vyākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: rājā āha yadi eṣa me praṇidhiḥ samṛdhyati yathā aham bhagavatā vyākṛtāḥ
translated: The king said, If this aspiration of mine is fulfilled, as I have been prophesied by the Blessed One,

original: tadyathāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pādavandanaṃ kuryāṃ pañcamaṇḍalena tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavaḥ prakampantu pracalantu /
analyzed: tat yathā aham bhagavataḥ pāda vandanam kuryām pañca maṇḍalena tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ prakampantu pracalantu
translated: then when I pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One with the five-point prostration, may as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river be shaken and stirred.

original: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti te ca māṃ vyākuryuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti te ca mām vyākuryuḥ
translated: And may the Buddhas who abide, are present, and live in those Buddha-fields prophesy me.

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalakena pādayornipatitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalakena pādayoḥ nipatitaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, King Arṇemī prostrated at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with the five-point prostration.

original: yadaiva rājñaḥ śirasā pṛthivī spṛṣṭā tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhakṣetrāḥ kampitāḥ calitāḥ pracalitāḥ kṣubhitāḥ saṃprakṣubhitāḥ /
analyzed: yadā eva rājñaḥ śirasā pṛthivī spṛṣṭā tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ kampitāḥ calitāḥ pracalitāḥ kṣubhitāḥ saṃprakṣubhitāḥ
translated: As soon as the king touched the earth with his head, at that time buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river were shaken, moved, greatly shaken, and greatly moved.

analyzed: gāṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhāḥ vyākurvanti
translated: Buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river gave prophecies.

original: santīraṇe buddhakṣetre dhāraṇe kalpe'śītivarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho rājānamaraṇeminaṃ vyākaroti
analyzed: santi īraṇe buddhakṣetre dhāraṇe kalpa aśīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājānam araṇeminam vyākaroti
translated: In the buddha-field of Sāntīraṇa, in the eon of Dhāraṇa, when the lifespan of beings was eighty thousand years, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, prophesied to King Aṇemadeva:

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamanāgate'dhvani atikrānte gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye praviṣṭe dvitīye'saṃkhyeye sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvamitaśuddhāyāṃ amitāyurnāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgata idhvani atikrānte gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye praviṣṭe dvitīye saṃkhyeye sukhāvatyām lokadhātau amita śuddhāyām amitāyuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: In the future, after an asaṃkhyeya kalpa as numerous as the sands of the Ganges has passed, and when the second asaṃkhyeya kalpa has begun, in the world system Sukhāvatī, of immeasurable purity, you will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, named Amitāyus.

original: samantato daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamān lokadhātūn avabhāsayiṣyasi /
analyzed: samantataḥ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān lokadhātūn avabhāsayiṣyasi
translated: You will illuminate world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara sattvā vidhi jña
translated: Rise, O supreme being, who knows the rules,

analyzed: vyākṛtaḥ tvam daśa balaiḥ
translated: you have been prophesied by the Ten Powers.
The earth with its mountains and wealth has been shaken like the Ganges.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi nara vara damya sārathiḥ
translated: You will become a charioteer for the best of men to be tamed.

original: atha khalu kulaputra rājāraṇemī tuṣṭa udagraḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra rājā araṇemī tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ
translated: Then, noble son, King Arṇemi was satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, and happy.

analyzed: atikramya na atidūre ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: He sat down to one side, not too far away, in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo rājño'raṇemino jyeṣṭhaputramanimiṣaṃ nāma rājakumāramāmantrayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājñoraṇeminaḥ jyeṣṭha putram animiṣam nāma rāja kumāram āmantrayati sma
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the eldest son of King Arṇemi, the prince named Aniṃsa, saying:

analyzed: animiṣā uvocat
translated: Aniṃsa said:

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: The same as before.

original: avalokitā mayāpāyā ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāḥ pracaṇḍaghoraṃ duḥkhaṃ anubhavanti /
analyzed: avalokitāḥ mayā apāyāḥ ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ pracaṇḍa ghoram duḥkham anubhavanti
translated: I have looked at the lower realms and the beings who have been born there, experiencing extremely fierce and terrible suffering.

original: avalokitā mayā svargā ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāḥ saṃkliṣṭacittāḥ punarapyapāyeṣu prapatanti /🔽sarvasattvāśca mayāvalokitā akalyāṇamitrasaṃsṛṣṭā viharanti /
analyzed: avalokitāḥ mayā svargāḥ ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ saṃkliṣṭa cittāḥ punar api apāyeṣu prapatanti  sarva sattvāḥ ca mayā avalokitāḥ akalyāṇa mitra saṃsṛṣṭāḥ viharanti
translated: I have looked at the heavens and the beings who have been born there, with defiled minds, falling back into the lower realms.

analyzed: dharma durbhikṣa andhakāre kuśala mūla parikṣīṇāḥ dṛṣṭi grāha grastāḥ ku mārgaiḥ vihanyate
translated: I have looked at all beings, associating with unfavorable friends, living in darkness, with the famine of the Dharma, their roots of virtue exhausted, seized by the crocodiles of views, hindered by bad paths.

analyzed: svareṇa aham bhagavan tān sattvān vijñapayāmi
translated: With my voice, Blessed One, I make those beings understand.

original: sarvaṃ ca kuśalaṃ pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarvam ca kuśalam pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: I dedicate all that is wholesome to unsurpassed, perfect, full awakening.

original: yad ahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ careyaṃ ye kecanasattvā duḥkhotpīḍā bhayatarjitā dharmadurbhikṣāndhakāre praviṣṭā līnā dīnā atrāṇā aśaraṇā aparāyaṇā
analyzed: yat aham bodhisattva caryām careyam ye kecana sattvāḥ duḥkha utpīḍāḥ bhaya tarjitāḥ dharma durbhikṣa andhakāre praviṣṭāḥ līnā dīnā atrāṇā aśaraṇā aparāyaṇā
translated: If I were to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, whatever beings are oppressed by suffering, terrified, entered into a famine of the Dharma, sunken, miserable, without protection, without refuge, without support,

analyzed: nāma ca parikīrtayeyuḥ
translated: and were to proclaim my name,

original: yadyahaṃ divyena śrotreṇa śṛṇuyāṃ divyena cakṣuṣā paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi aham divyena śrotreṇa śṛṇuyām divyena cakṣuṣā paśyeyam
translated: if I were to hear them with the divine ear and see them with the divine eye,

original: na ca tāṃ sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tām sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyam
translated: and if I were not to liberate those beings from their misfortunes,

analyzed: na aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then I would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, full awakening.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sattvahetościrapraṇidhānaviśeṣeṇa ciraṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi tadā me āśāparipūrirbhavatu /
analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavan sattva hetoḥ cira praṇidhāna viśeṣeṇa ciram bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi tadā me āśā paripūriḥ bhavatu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, for the sake of beings and through the power of my long-standing aspirations, I were to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva for a long time, then may my hopes be fulfilled.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan mahārājāraṇemī atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /
