analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavat mahā rāja araṇemī atikrānte ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā samesaṃkhyeye pratiṣṭhe dvitīye sukhāvatyām lokadhātau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, when I am the great king Arṇemi, after one asaṃkhyeya eon has passed and I am established in the second, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, full awakening in the Sukhāvatī world system,

analyzed: amitāyuḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: He will be named Amitāyus, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: pariśuddhe buddhakṣetre pariśuddhānāṃ sattvānāṃ buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: pariśuddhe buddhakṣetre pariśuddhānām sattvānām buddha kāryam kariṣyati
translated: He will perform the Buddha's work in a pure Buddha-field for pure beings.

original: yāvatyāmitāyustathāgataḥ aparimāṇān kalpān buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā pariniṣṭhitabuddhakāryo'nupadhiśeṣanirvāṇadhātau pravekṣyate /
analyzed: yāvatyā amita āyuḥ tathāgataḥ aparimāṇān kalpān buddha kāryam kṛtvā pariniṣṭhita buddha kāryaḥ ūna upadhi śeṣa nirvāṇa dhātau pravekṣyate
translated: For as long as the Tathāgata Amitāyus performs the Buddha's work for immeasurable eons, and after completing the Buddha's work, enters the nirvāṇa-realm without remainder,

original: tasya praviṣṭasya yāvat saddharmaḥ sthāsyati tāvacciramahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tasya praviṣṭasya yāvat saddharmaḥ sthāsyati tāvat ciram aham bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi
translated: for that long I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtaḥ uham buddha kāryam kariṣyāmi
translated: As a bodhisattva, I will perform the Buddha's work.

original: yadāmitāyuṣastathāgatasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya rātryāḥ prathame yāme saddharmo'ntardhāsyati tasyāmeva rātryāṃ paścime yāme'hamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ
analyzed: yadā amitāyuṣaḥ tathāgatasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya rātryāḥ prathame yāme saddharmaḥ ntardhāsyati tasyām eva rātryām paścime yāmā iham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: When the true Dharma of the Tathāgata Amitāyus, the Perfectly Enlightened One, disappears in the first watch of the night, in the last watch of that very night, I will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: vyākarotu mām bhagavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May the Blessed One prophesy my supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: evamevāhaṃ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu lokadhātuṣu ye buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti tān api buddhān bhagavataḥ svareṇa vijñapayāmi vyākurvantu māṃ te buddhā bhagavanto'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: evam eva aham daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu lokadhātuṣu ye buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti tān api buddhān bhagavataḥ svareṇa vijñapayāmi vyākurvantu mām te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: In the same way, I will inform with my voice those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, that are abiding, bearing, and living. May those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, prophesy me for supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: vyākṛtaḥ kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena animiṣaḥ rāja putraḥ
translated: The prince Animesha was prophesied by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha,

original: evaṃ cāha yattvayā kulaputrāvalokitā apāyāḥ avalokitāḥ svargā avalokitaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃjanitaṃ kāruṇyacittaṃ sattvānāṃ duḥkhamocanārthaṃ
analyzed: evam ca āha yat tvayā kula putra avalokitāḥ apāyāḥ avalokitāḥ svargāḥ avalokitam sarva sattvānām duḥkham saṃjanitam kāruṇya cittam sattvānām duḥkha mocana artham
translated: and he said, Since you, noble son, have looked upon the lower realms, looked upon the heavens, and looked upon the suffering of all beings, and have generated the mind of compassion for the sake of liberating beings from suffering,

analyzed: tasmāt tvam kulaputra avalokiteśvaraḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi
translated: therefore, noble son, you will be named Avalokiteshvara.

analyzed: tvam avalokiteśvara bahūnām sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām duḥkha mocakaḥ
translated: Avalokiteshvara, you are the liberator of many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings from suffering.

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtaḥ tvam kula putra buddha kāryam kariṣyasi
translated: As a bodhisattva, noble son, you will perform the deeds of a Buddha.

analyzed: parinivṛte ca amitābhe tathāgata iva śiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā samesaṃkhyeye
translated: And when the Tathagata Amitabha has passed into parinirvana, and only two Ganges Rivers of eons remain in the second incalculably long eon,

original: yasyāmeva rātryāṃ prathame yāme saddharmo'ntardhāsyati tasyāmeva rātryāṃ paścime yāme tvaṃ kulaputrānekavyūhe bodhivṛkṣamūle vajrāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: yasyām eva rātryām prathame yāme saddharmaḥ ntardhāsyati tasyām eva rātryām paścime yāme tvam kula putra aneka vyūhe bodhivṛkṣa mūle vajrāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: On the very night when the true Dharma will disappear in the first watch, on that very night in the last watch, O son of noble family, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment, sitting on the adamantine seat at the foot of the Bodhi tree adorned with many arrays.

analyzed: samantaraśmi abhyudgata śrīkūṭarājaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: You will be called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Glorious Peak of Emitted Light.

analyzed: ṣaṇṇavati kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi tava āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Your lifespan will be ninety-six quintillion eons.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya te triṣaṣṭi kalpa koṭyaḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: After your parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma will remain for sixty-three quintillion eons.

original: avalokiteśvara āha yadi bhagavan nimā mamāśā paripūryate tadyadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ karomi tadā ye buddhā bhagavanto daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te vyākurvantu māṃ /
analyzed: avalokiteśvaraḥ āha yadi bhagavat mama āśā paripūryate tat yadā aham bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam karomi tadā ye buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te vyākurvantu mām
translated: Avalokiteśvara said, If, Blessed One, this hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then when I pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One, may all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide, sustain, and keep alive in the world systems of the ten directions numerous as the sands of the Ganges, proclaim me.

original: calatu ca dharaṇī sarvagaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu /
analyzed: calatu ca dharaṇī sarva gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu
translated: And may the earth tremble in all the world systems of the ten directions numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

analyzed: sarva parvata pāṣāṇa śikhara vṛkṣebhyaḥ pañcāṅgikānām tūryāṇām śabdaḥ niścaratu
translated: May the sound of five-part music resound from all mountain rocks, peaks, trees,

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca virāga cittam pratilabhantu
translated: and may all beings attain a mind of detachment.

original: yadā cāvalokiteśvareṇa bodhisattvena ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ pañcamaṇḍalakena vanditastadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dharaṇī pracalitā /
analyzed: yadā ca avalokiteśvareṇa bodhisattvena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ pañca maṇḍalakena vanditaḥ tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dharaṇī pracalitā
translated: When Avalokiteshvara bowed to Tathagata Ratnagarbha with his five limbs, the earth shook in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: te ca buddhā bhagavanto vyākurvanti peyālaṃ pūrvavat /
analyzed: te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākurvanti peyālam pūrvavat
translated: Those Buddha-Bhagavans prophesied, and so on as before.

analyzed: sarva parvata pāṣāṇa śikharebhyaḥ pañcāṅgikasya tūryasya śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: The sound of five-part music resounded from all mountain rocks and peaks.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca virāga cittena sthitāḥ
translated: All beings remained with a mind of detachment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha kāruṇya puṇyasu hṛṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: Rise, with a compassionate and joyful mind,

analyzed: vyākṛtaḥ tvam daśa diśi vara deha dhārī
translated: you have been prophesied, O bearer of the supreme body in the ten directions.

analyzed: prakampitā
translated: The earth and the field have shaken in six ways,

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi jina agra pugalaḥ mahā ṛṣī
translated: you will become a great sage, the foremost of victorious ones.

original: atha khalu samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohito dvitīyaṃ rājaputraṃ nimirnāmāmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ dvitīyam rāja putram nimiḥ nāma āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, addressed the second prince named Nimi:

analyzed: evam ca anumoda tvam kula putra imam mahā parityāgam
translated: And thus, noble son, rejoice in this great renunciation.

original: yacca tvayā śubhamupārjitaṃ tatsarvaṃ sattvahetoḥ sarvajñatāyāṃ pariṇāmaya /
analyzed: yat ca tvayā śubham upārjitam tat sarvam sattva hetoḥ sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmaya
translated: And whatever merit you have accumulated, all of that, for the sake of beings, dedicate it to omniscience.

analyzed: utpādaya cittam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha nimī rājakumāro bhagavataḥ purastānniṣadyedamavocat yat mayā bhagavān upasthitaḥ sarvopakaraṇaiḥ sārdhamaparimitena bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: atha nimiḥ rāja kumāraḥ bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣadya idam avocat yat mayā bhagavān upasthitaḥ sarva upakaraṇaiḥ sārdham aparimitena bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: Then Prince Nimi, sitting in front of the Blessed One, said this: Whatever I have attended to the Blessed One with all requisites, together with the immeasurable assembly of monks,

analyzed: yaḥ ca anumodanā udgataḥ puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: and the mass of merit arisen from rejoicing,

original: yacca kāyavāṅmanaḥ sucaritaṃ puṇyaṃ pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yat ca kāya vāc manaḥ su caritam puṇyam pariṇāmayāmi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and whatever merit there is from good conduct of body, speech, and mind, I dedicate it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na kevalamasmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhimahaṃ spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: na kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre bodhim aham spṛśeyam
translated: Not only will I attain enlightenment in this defiled buddha-field,

original: yatrāvalokiteśvaraḥ kumāraḥ sarvaratnasannicayāyāṃ lokadhātāvanekaratnavyūhe bodhivṛkṣe niṣaṇṇo'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate samantaraśmyabhudgataśrīkūṭarājo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra avalokiteśvaraḥ kumāraḥ sarva ratna sannicayāyām lokadhātau aneka ratna vyūhe bodhivṛkṣe niṣaṇṇaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate samantaraśmyabhudgataśrīkūṭarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: where the divine youth Avalokiteśvara, seated under the bodhi tree of many jewel arrays in the world system of all jewels, will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and will be known as the Tathāgata Samantaraśmī Abhudgataśrīkūṭarāja.

original: tamahaṃ adhyeṣayeyaṃ dharmadeśanāyāṃ yāvaccāsau tathāgato dharmaṃ deśayet tāvadahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ careyaṃ /
analyzed: tam aham adhyeṣayeyam dharma deśanāyām yāvat ca asau tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayet tāvat aham bodhisattva caryām careyam
translated: I would request him to teach the Dharma, and for as long as that Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, for that long I would practice the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: tasya tathāgatasya astaṃgatasya saddharme antarhite tasya anantareṇa aham samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: After that Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa and the true Dharma has disappeared, I would attain perfect enlightenment in the immediately following eon.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam me buddhakṣetram bhavet guṇa vyūhena
translated: My buddha field would be like this in terms of its array of qualities.

analyzed: evam eva aham buddha kāryam kuryām
translated: I would perform the activities of a buddha in this way.

analyzed: evam eva parinirvāpayeyam
translated: I would bring about nirvāṇa in this way.

analyzed: evam eva parinirvṛtasya saddharmaḥ ciram tiṣṭhet
translated: The true Dharma would remain for a long time after my parinirvāṇa in this way.

original: sarva eva guṇavyūhaḥ yathā samantaraśmyabhyudgataśrīkūṭarājasya tathāgatasya /
analyzed: sarvaḥ eva guṇa vyūhaḥ yathā samantaraśmi abhyudgata śrīkūṭarājasya tathāgatasya
translated: The entire array of qualities would be just like that of the Tathāgata Rājan of the Peak of the Glory of Arisen Rays.

analyzed: bhagavān āha mahā sthāmante kula putra prārthitam
translated: The Blessed One said, Mahāsthāmaprāpta, son of noble family, you have requested.

original: prāpsyasi tvaṃ kulaputraivaṃrūpaṃ sthānaṃ yathā svayaṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: prāpsyasi tvam kula putra evaṃrūpam sthānam yathā svayam parigṛhītam
translated: Son of noble family, you will attain such a state as you have taken up yourself.

original: prāpsyasi tvaṃ kulaputra tasmin buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ /
analyzed: prāpsyasi tvam kula putra tasmin buddhakṣetre in uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Son of noble family, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that buddha field.

analyzed: supratiṣṭhitaguṇamaṇikūṭarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be the Tathāgata named Supratiṣṭhita-guṇa-maṇi-kūṭa-rāja.

analyzed: yathā sthāmante kula putra mahā sthānam parigṛhītam
translated: Just as, noble son, you have taken up the great abode,

analyzed: tena tvam kula putra mahā sthāma prāptaḥ bhavasva
translated: therefore, noble son, you will become Mahāsthāmaprāpta.

original: sa prāha yadi me bhagavanneṣāśā paripūryate /
analyzed: sa prāha yadi me bhagavan eṣā āśā paripūryate
translated: He said, If, Blessed One, this hope of mine is fulfilled,

original: tadyadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalakena kāyena pādau vandāmi tadā me daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhā bhagavanto vyākurvantu /
analyzed: tat yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalakena kāyena pādau vandāmi tadā me daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākurvantu
translated: then when I pay homage to the Blessed One with my body in the five-point prostration, may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, equal to the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, proclaim it.

analyzed: sumanā varṣaḥ ca pravarṣatu
translated: And may a rain of coral trees fall.

original: yadā kulaputra mahāsthāmaprāptena satpuruṣeṇa ratnagarbhasya pañcamaṇḍalakena pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtaṃ tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu daśasu dikṣu
analyzed: yadā kula putra mahā sthāma prāptena sat puruṣeṇa ratnagarbhasya pañca maṇḍalakena pāda abhivandanam kṛtam tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu daśasu dikṣu
translated: When the good man Mahāsthāmaprāpta paid homage to the feet of Ratna-garbha with his five-point prostration, at that time in the ten directions, equal to the sands of the Ganges,🔽the great earth shook in six ways.

analyzed: ṣaṣ vikāram ca mahā pṛthivī pracalitā  sumanā vṛṣṭiḥ ca prapatitā
translated: And a rain of coral trees fell.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha dṛḍha sthāma vega puṇya
translated: Rise up, you of firm strength and vigor, merit,

analyzed: vyākṛta daśa diśi lokanāthaiḥ
translated: proclaimed by the lords of the world in the ten directions.

analyzed: calitā mahā pṛthivī vṛṣṭiḥ vṛṣṭā su manāḥ
translated: The great earth shook, a rain of coral trees fell,

analyzed: varṣaiḥ bhaviṣyasi tvam sura nara brahma bhūtaḥ
translated: and you will become one who is like a god, a human, or Brahmā.

analyzed: atha samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tṛtīyam rāja putram indra gaṇam nāma āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the brahmin Samudrarenu advised the third prince, named Indragarbha.

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: The same as before.

original: pratigṛhyāñjaliṃ ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatametadavocat yanmayā bhagavān sarvopakaraṇairupasthitaḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṅghena /
analyzed: pratigṛhya añjalim ratnagarbham tathāgatam etat avocat yat mayā bhagavān sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upasthitaḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṅghena
translated: Having accepted the palms together, he said this to the Tathagata Ratnagarbha: Whatever I have attended to the Blessed One with all requisites, together with the assembly of monks,

analyzed: yat ca me kāya vāc manaḥ su caritam
translated: and whatever good conduct I have done with body, speech, and mind,

analyzed: idam ca anumodanā sahagatam puṇya skandham
translated: and this heap of merit associated with rejoicing,

analyzed: etat sarvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayāmi
translated: I dedicate all of this towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: na tu kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre id uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: But I will not attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in a defiled buddha-field.

analyzed: na ca atikṣipram prāpnuyām
translated: And I will not attain it too quickly.

analyzed: na yāvat ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam tāvat bodhi caryām caran
translated: As long as I have not attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, for that long, while practicing the conduct leading to enlightenment,

original: daśasu dikṣvanantāparyanteṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu anantā paryanteṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyam
translated: I will see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the endless and limitless other world systems in the ten directions.

original: ye mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitā yeṣāṃ mayā tatprathamaṃ bodhicittamutpāditaṃ bodhicitte pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitāḥ yeṣām mayā tat prathamam bodhi cittam utpāditam bodhi citte pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Those whom I first inspired towards enlightenment, for whom I first generated the mind of enlightenment, and who were established in the mind of enlightenment by me,🔽and those who are established in the conduct leading to enlightenment by me,

original: pāramitāsu ca ye mayā samādāpitā niveśitā pratiṣṭhāpitā bodhicaryāṃ caratā /
analyzed: pāramitāsu ca ye mayā samādāpitāḥ niveśitā pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bodhi caryām caratā
translated: And those whom I have inspired, settled, and established in the perfections while practicing the conduct of enlightenment,

original: tān ahaṃ divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgānadīvālikāsame buddhakṣetre paramāṇurajaḥsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhān bhagavato dharman deśayataḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: tān aham divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgā nadī vālikā same buddhakṣetre paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu buddhān bhagavataḥ dharman deśayataḥ paśyeyam
translated: may I see with my divine eye those beings in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, in buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms of the buddha-fields, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teaching the Dharma,

analyzed: ye mayā bodhāya samādāpitāḥ
translated: those whom I have inspired towards enlightenment.

analyzed: evam aham bodhisattva caryām caran buddha kāryam kuryām
translated: Thus may I, practicing the conduct of enlightenment, perform the work of a Buddha.

original: tāvadahaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ careyaṃ sattvānāmāśayapariśodhayamānaḥ yāvantaḥ kecit sattvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeran ta evaṃvidhāḥ syuḥ tadyathā brahmakāyikā devāḥ /
analyzed: tāvat aham bodhisattva caryām careyam sattvānām āśaya pariśodhayamānaḥ yāvantaḥ kecid sattvāḥ mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeran te evaṃvidhāḥ syuḥ tat yathā brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ
translated: May I practice the conduct of enlightenment for so long as I purify the intentions of beings, as many beings as are reborn in my buddha-field, may they be of such a kind as the Brahmakayika gods.

original: tathā ca buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ pariśodhayeyaṃ yathā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ ekaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham pariśodhayeyam yathā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram ekam buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: And may I purify the array of qualities of the buddha-field in such a way that the three-thousand great-thousand worlds, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, would be one buddha-field.

original: tasya ca buddhakṣetrasya bhavāgraparyantāni prākārāṇi anekaratnasaṃsthitāni nānāratnapratyuptāni ca syuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca buddhakṣetrasya bhavāgra paryantāni prākārāṇi aneka ratna saṃsthitāni nānā ratna pratyuptāni ca syuḥ
translated: And may the walls of that buddha-field, reaching up to the peak of existence, be made of various jewels and inlaid with various gems.

original: sarvā ca tatra buddhakṣetre śuddhavaiḍūryamayī pṛthivī syāt /
analyzed: sarvā ca tatra buddhakṣetre śuddha vaiḍūrya mayī pṛthivī syāt
translated: And there, in that buddha-field, the earth would be made of pure beryl.

analyzed: apagata rajaḥ pāṣāṇa śarkarā apagata kaluṣa saṃsparśā dharaṇī syāt
translated: The ground would be free from dust, stones, and gravel, and free from contact with impurities.

analyzed: na tatra mātṛgrāmasya nāma prajñaptiḥ syāt
translated: There would be no designation of the name 'woman' there.

original: sarvasattvāścopapādukāḥ syurna tatra sattvāḥ kavadīkārāhārāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca upapādukāḥ syuḥ na tatra sattvāḥ kavadīkāra āhārāḥ syuḥ
translated: And all beings would be spontaneously born, not those beings who eat solid food there.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā prītyāhārā dharmāhārāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra prīti āhārāḥ dharma āhārāḥ syuḥ
translated: And there, all beings would be nourished by joy and by the Dharma.

original: na tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ prajñaptiḥ syāt /
analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām prajñaptiḥ syāt
translated: In that buddha-field, there would be no designation of śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: śuddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāmapagatakhilamaladveṣamrakṣāṇāṃ śuddhānāṃ brahmacāriṇāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ syāt /
analyzed: śuddhānām bodhisattvānām apagata khila mala dveṣa mrakṣāṇām śuddhānām brahmacāriṇām buddhakṣetram pariśuddham syāt
translated: The buddha-field would be pure, with pure bodhisattvas free from deceit, impurities, hatred, and jealousy, pure celibate practitioners.

original: sarve tatra bodhisattvā muṇḍāḥ kāṣāyavastradhāriṇaḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve tatra bodhisattvāḥ muṇḍāḥ kāṣāya vastra dhāriṇaḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: There, all the bodhisattvas would appear with shaven heads and wearing saffron robes.

analyzed: samanantara prādurbhūtānām mahā avabhāsam bhavet
translated: As soon as they are born, there would be a great radiance.

original: teṣāṃ dakṣiṇe haste ratnapātrī nānārasapūrṇā prādurbhavet /
analyzed: teṣām dakṣiṇe haste ratna pātrī nānā rasa pūrṇā prādurbhavet
translated: In their right hands, a jeweled bowl filled with various delicacies would appear.

original: samanantaraprādurbhūtānāṃ evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyurnāsmākaṃ pratirūpaṃ ye vayaṃ kavaḍīkārāhāramāharema /
analyzed: samanantara prādurbhūtānām evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ na asmākam pratirūpam ye vayam kavaḍīkāra āhāram āharema
translated: As soon as they appear, they attain such mindfulness, thinking, 'It is not fitting for us to consume solid food.

original: yannūnaṃ vayamanyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā buddhān bhagavatastiṣṭhato yāpayato'nenāhāreṇa pratimānayāmo buddhaśrāvakāṃśca duḥkhitaṃ ca janaṃ pratimānayāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat nūnam vayam anyāsu lokadhātuṣu gatvā buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ unena āhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ buddha śrāvakān ca duḥkhitam ca janam pratimānayāmaḥ
translated: Let us go to other world systems and offer this food to the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are present there, and to the Buddha's disciples, and to suffering beings.

original: pretabhavaneṣu ca gatvā kṣuttarṣaprajvalitagātrān sattvān anenāhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ /
analyzed: preta bhavaneṣu ca gatvā kṣudh tarṣa prajvalita gātrān sattvān anena āhāreṇa pratimānayāmaḥ
translated: And let us go to the abodes of hungry ghosts and offer this food to beings whose bodies are ablaze with hunger and thirst.'

original: sahacittotpādena te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā acintyacāritravatīṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: saha citta utpādena te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ acintyacāritravatīm nāma samādhim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: As soon as they think this, those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas attain the samadhi called 'Having Inconceivable Conduct.'

original: tasya ca samādheḥ pratilābhādasajjanā daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca samādheḥ pratilābhāt asat janāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gaccheyuḥ
translated: By attaining that samadhi, they go to immeasurable other Buddha-fields in the ten directions, where the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, are present, living, and continuing the teachings.

original: tiṣṭhato yāpayato buddhān bhagavata āhāreṇa pratimānayeyuḥ śrāvakāṃścānyāṃśca sattvāṃ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ āhāreṇa pratimānayeyuḥ śrāvakān ca anyān ca sattvān
translated: They offer food to the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and to the disciples and other beings.

original: prītyā pratimānya dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtvā tenaiva pūrvabhaktena svabuddhakṣetraṃ āgaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: prītyā pratimānya dharma deśanām kṛtvā tena eva pūrva bhaktena sva buddhakṣetram āgaccheyuḥ
translated: Having respectfully accepted the Dharma teaching with joy, they would return to their own buddha-fields with that very morning meal.

analyzed: evam cīvara ratnāni
translated: In the same way, with the jewels of robes.

original: yāvat tenaiva pūrvabhaktena svakaṃ buddhakṣetramāgatyānyonyaṃ cīvareṇa prāvarayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat tena eva pūrva bhaktena svakam buddhakṣetram āgatya anyonyam cīvareṇa prāvarayeyuḥ
translated: Up to returning to their own buddha-fields with that very morning meal, and covering each other with robes.

original: yāvanti ca tatra buddhakṣetre teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāmupabhogaḥ paribhogā bhaveyustaiḥ sarvairbuddhaiḥ śrāvakaiścānyaiśca sattvaiḥ sahasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā paścādātmanā paribhuñjeyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvanti ca tatra buddhakṣetre teṣām bodhisattvānām upabhogaḥ paribhogāḥ bhaveyuḥ taiḥ sarvaiḥ buddhaiḥ śrāvakaiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ saha sādhāraṇam kṛtvā paścāt ātmanā paribhuñjeyuḥ
translated: And whatever enjoyments and possessions there would be for those bodhisattvas in that buddha-field, having made them common to all those buddhas, śrāvakas, and other beings, they would afterwards enjoy them themselves.

analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaṇa varjitam ca buddhakṣetram bhavet
translated: And that buddha-field would be free from the eight unfavorable conditions.

analyzed: na ca tatra duḥkha śabdaḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no word for suffering.

analyzed: na śikṣā grahaṇa śabdaḥ
translated: There would be no word for taking up the precepts.

analyzed: āpatti vyutthāna śabdaḥ api na bhavet
translated: There would be no word for rising from offenses.

analyzed: aneka ratna śata sahasra upacitam tat buddhakṣetram syāt
translated: That buddha-field would be filled with many hundreds of thousands of jewels.

analyzed: aneka ratna pratyuptam maṇi sandarśana sadṛśam bhavet
translated: It would be adorned with many jewels, like the Jewel-Array.

original: yāni maṇiratnāni daśasu dikṣvadṛṣṭapūrvāṇi tāni aśrutapūrvāṇi tāni maṇiratnāni pracareyuḥ /
analyzed: yāni maṇi ratnāni daśasu dikṣu a dṛṣṭa pūrvāṇi tāni a śruta pūrvāṇi tāni maṇi ratnāni pracareyuḥ
translated: Those jewel-gems that had not been seen before in the ten directions, those jewel-gems that had not been heard of before, those jewel-gems would appear.

original: yeṣāṃ maṇiratnānāṃ nāmadheye nirdiśyamāne varṣakoṭyo'pi kṣayaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām maṇi ratnānām nāmadheye nirdiśyamāne varṣa koṭyā api kṣayam gaccheyuḥ
translated: The names of whose jewel-gems would be mentioned for millions of years.

original: yaśca bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣeta svarṇamayaṃ eva buddhakṣetraṃ paśyeyaṃ tasya svarṇamayaṃ eva tiṣṭheta /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣeta svarṇa mayam eva buddhakṣetram paśyeyam tasya svarṇa mayam eva tiṣṭheta
translated: And the bodhisattva who would wish to see the Buddha-field as made of gold, for him it would stand as made of gold.

analyzed: yaḥ rūpya mayam ākāṅkṣeta sa rūpya mayam paśyet
translated: He who would wish to see it as made of silver, he would see it as made of silver.

analyzed: na ca asya suvarṇa mayam parihāyeyam
translated: And it would not be lost for him as made of gold.

analyzed: peyālam pūrvavat
translated: The same as before.

original: ya ākāṅkṣeta sphatikamayaṃ vaiḍūryamayaṃ aśmagarbhamayaṃ lohitamuktāmayaṃ musālagalvamayaṃ evaṃvidhaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ paśyema /
analyzed: yaḥ ākāṅkṣeta sphatika mayam vaiḍūrya mayam aśmagarbha mayam lohita muktā mayam musālagalva mayam evaṃvidham tat buddhakṣetram paśyema
translated: He who would wish to see that Buddha-field as made of crystal, beryl, agate, red pearl, coral,

analyzed: iti ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: in such a way, they would wish.

original: agarumayaṃ tagaramayaṃ tamālapatramayaṃ yo bodhisattva ākāṅkṣeduragasāracandanamayaṃ goṣīrṣacandanamayaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ draṣṭuṃ tasya tathaiva syāt /
analyzed: agaru mayam tagara mayam tamāla patra mayam yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣet uragasāra candana mayam goṣīrṣa candana mayam tat buddhakṣetram draṣṭum tasya tathā eva syāt
translated: He who, the bodhisattva, would wish to see the Buddha-field as made of aloes, tagara, tamala leaves, as made of uragasāra sandalwood, gośīrṣa sandalwood, for him it would be just so.

original: yathā yathā yādṛśamākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathā tathā tādṛśaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yathā yathā yādṛśam ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tathā tathā tādṛśam syāt
translated: As they would wish, in such a way, it would be just so.

analyzed: na ca ekaḥ dvitīyasya praṇidhiḥ syāt
translated: And the vow of one would not be the vow of another.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva praṇidhiḥ paripūryate
translated: The vow of all would be fulfilled.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sūryacandramasau prajñāyeyātāṃ /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sūrya candramasau prajñāyeyātām
translated: And in that buddha-field, the sun and moon would not be known.

analyzed: svayam prabhāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: The bodhisattvas would be born there with their own light.

analyzed: anyām yādṛśīm prabhām ākāṅkṣeran tādṛśīm utsṛjeyuḥ
translated: They would emit whatever kind of light they desired,

analyzed: antatas buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu api
translated: even up to hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddha-fields.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre rātridivasānāṃ nāmadheyamapi prajñāyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre rātri divasānām nāmadheyam api prajñāyate
translated: And in that buddha-field, the names of day and night would not be known,

analyzed: anyatra kusuma vikasana tayā
translated: except for the opening and closing of flowers.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śītoṣṇaṃ prajñāyate na vyādhirna glānyaṃ na jarāmaraṇamanyatra yo bodhisattva ākāṅkṣedbodhimabhisaṃboddhuṃ so'nyatra lokadhātāvuṣitvā āyuḥ kṣapayitvā bodhimabhisaṃbudhyeta /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre śīta uṣṇam prajñāyate na vyādhiḥ na glānyam na jarā maraṇam anyatra yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ākāṅkṣet bodhim abhisaṃboddhum saḥ anyatra lokadhātau uṣitvā āyuḥ kṣapayitvā bodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: And in that buddha-field, cold and heat would not be known, nor sickness, nor sorrow, nor old age and death, except for a bodhisattva who might wish to attain enlightenment and fully awaken to it, he would go to another world-system, spend his life there, and then fully awaken to enlightenment.

analyzed: na tatra buddhakṣetre maraṇam bhaveyuḥ
translated: There would be no death in that buddha-field.

analyzed: anuttara parinirvāṇena upari antarīkṣe tathāgata parinirvāṇam syāt
translated: The parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata would be in the sky above, by means of the unsurpassed parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: yādṛś jātrīyān ca bodhisattve upabhoga paribhogām ākāṅkṣeran tādṛś jātīyāḥ abhinirvarteyuḥ
translated: And whatever kind of enjoyments and possessions the bodhisattvas might desire, they would be produced in that very kind.

original: sarvatra ca buddhakṣetre gaganatale tūryakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrā vādyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca buddhakṣetre gagana tale tūrya koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāḥ vādyeyuḥ
translated: And in all the Buddha-fields, in the sky, hundreds of thousands of quintillions of musical instruments would play.

original: na ca tebhyastūryebhyaḥ kāmopasaṃhitāḥ śabdā niścareyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tebhyaḥ tūryebhyaḥ kāma upasaṃhitāḥ śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ
translated: But from those musical instruments would not come sounds related to desire.

analyzed: anyatra pāramitā śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ
translated: Rather, the sounds of the perfections would come forth.

analyzed: buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ bodhisattva piṭaka dharmaparyāya śabdaḥ niścaret
translated: The sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the Dharma discourse of the Bodhisattva canon would come forth.

analyzed: yathā adhimuktāḥ bodhisattvāḥ tādṛś jātīyām śabdām śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: The bodhisattvas, according to their inclinations, would hear sounds of that kind.

original: bodhisattvacārikāmahaṃ bhagavaṃścaramāṇo yāvan mayāprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhā dṛṣṭāste vyūhāste'laṅkārāstāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tāni sthānāni tāni praṇidhānāni sarva eva mama buddhakṣetre praviśeyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva cārikām aham bhagavan caramāṇaḥ yāvat mayā aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ te vyūhāḥ telaṅkārāḥ tāni liṅgāni tāni nimittāni tāni sthānāni tāni praṇidhānāni sarve eva mama buddhakṣetre praviśeyuḥ
translated: Blessed One, while I was practicing the bodhisattva conduct, I saw the arrays of qualities in the Buddha-fields of countless, immeasurable hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas. May all those arrays, those adornments, those signs, those indications, those places, those aspirations enter into my Buddha-field.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vyūhām pañca kaṣāyikān ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām
translated: Except for the arrays of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and the arrays of the qualities of the Buddha-fields with the five degenerations.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre narakatiryakpretāḥ prajñāyeyurna sumerurna cakravāḍamahācakravāḍā na śīlāpāṃśuparvatāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre naraka tiryak pretāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na śīla apāṃśu parvatāḥ prajñāyeyuḥ
translated: And in that buddha-field, the hells, animals, and ghosts should not be known, nor should Mount Sumeru, the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains, or the Śīla, Apāṃśu, and Parvata mountains be known.

analyzed: na mahā samudrā  na ca anye kāṣṭha vṛkṣāḥ bhaveyuḥ divya atikrāntaiḥ nānā vṛkṣaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam syāt
translated: Nor the great oceans.🔽And there should be no other wooden trees, but that buddha-field should be filled with various divine trees surpassing the divine.

original: anyatra divyaiḥ kusumairmāndāravamahāmāndāravairna ca tatra durgandhaṃ syānnānāgandhairudārodāraistadbuddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: anyatra divyaiḥ kusumaiḥ māndārava mahāmāndāravaiḥ na ca tatra durgandham syāt nānā gandhaiḥ udāra udāraiḥ tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam syāt
translated: And there should be no foul smell, but that buddha-field should be filled with various excellent fragrances.

analyzed: sarve tatra eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ bodhisattvāḥ utpadyeran
translated: And all the bodhisattvas there should be born as those bound to one more birth.

analyzed: na tatra eka sattvaḥ syāt yaḥ tatas cyavitvā anyatra pratyājāyeta
translated: And there should not be a single being who, having passed away from there, would be reborn elsewhere.

analyzed: anyatra tuṣitebhyaḥ tatas cyutaḥ unuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: Except from the Tuṣita heaven, having passed away from there, he should attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tāvadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattvacaryāṃ cariṣyāmi yāvannaivaṃvidhaṃ mahāpuruṣakāramabhiniṣpādayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tāvat aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhisattva caryām cariṣyāmi yāvat na evaṃvidham mahā puruṣakāram abhiniṣpādayiṣyāmi
translated: Reverend Lord! I shall practice the conduct of a bodhisattva for so long as I have not accomplished such a great deed.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam buddhakṣetram sthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I shall establish a buddha-field like this.

original: evaṃrūpaiḥ śuddhāśayaiḥ sattvairekajātipratibaddhairbodhisattvaiḥ sārdhaṃ tadbuddhakṣetramākīrṇaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaiḥ śuddha āśayaiḥ sattvaiḥ eka jāti pratibaddhaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ sārdham tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmi
translated: I will establish that Buddha-field as filled with such beings of pure intent, Bodhisattvas bound to one birth only.

original: na tatra bodhisattvaḥ syād yo na mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na tatra bodhisattvaḥ syāt yaḥ na mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitaḥ syāt
translated: There will be no Bodhisattva there whom I have not first inspired to seek enlightenment.

original: sarve te tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ ye mayā prathamaṃ bodhāya samādāpitāḥ pāramitāsu niveśitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te tatra bodhisattvāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ ye mayā prathamam bodhāya samādāpitāḥ pāramitāsu niveśitāḥ
translated: All those Bodhisattvas whom I have first inspired to seek enlightenment, whom I have established in the perfections, will be reborn there.

original: tatraivedaṃ buddhakṣetramantargataṃ kuryāṃ sarve cāmī duḥkhā praśamayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra eva idam buddhakṣetram antargatam kuryām sarve ca amī praśamayeyam
translated: I will make this very Buddha-field appear there, and I will put an end to all their sufferings.

original: bodhisattvabhūto'haṃ bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpaṃ puruṣakāraṃ niṣpādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtā uham bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpam puruṣakāram niṣpādayeyam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, as a Bodhisattva, I will accomplish such deeds.

analyzed: tatas paścāt tatra buddhakṣetre inuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Only then will I fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: daśa cāturdvīpika sahasra pramāṇaḥ me bodhivṛkṣaḥ pariṇāhena syāt
translated: My Bodhi tree will be ten thousand leagues high and ten thousand leagues in circumference.

analyzed: saptaratnavicitrasandarśanaḥ nāma bhavet
translated: It will be called 'The Display of the Seven Jewels'.

analyzed: daśa tri sāhasraḥ samanta pariṇāhena
translated: It will be ten thousand leagues in circumference.

original: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya gandhenābhayā ca kṛtsanaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tasya ca bodhivṛkṣasya gandhena ābhayā ca kṛtsanam buddhakṣetram sphuṭam syāt
translated: And the entire buddha field would be filled with the fragrance and radiance of that Bodhi tree.

original: tasya mūle pañcacāturdvīpikapramāṇaṃ me nānāratnavicitraṃ vajrāsanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tasya mūle pañca cāturdvīpika pramāṇam me nānā ratna vicitram vajrāsanam syāt
translated: At its base would be a vajra seat, five times the size of the four continents, adorned with various jewels.

analyzed: praśama kṣama su vicitra jñāna gandha samavasaraṇam nāma bhavet caturaśīti yojanāni ucca tvena
translated: It would be called The Gathering of the Fragrance of Peace, Patience, and Various Knowledges, and would be eighty-four yojanas high.

analyzed: tasya aham bodhi vṛkṣasya mūle vajrāsane niṣīdeyam
translated: I would sit on that vajra seat at the base of the Bodhi tree.

original: paryaṅkamābhujya tenaiva muhūrtenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ yāvat parinirvāṇakālaṃ tatparyaṅkaṃ na bhindyāṃ na muceyaṃ na tasmād bodhivṛkṣamūlāduttiṣṭheyaṃ /
analyzed: paryaṅkam ābhujya tena eva muhūrtena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam yāvat parinirvāṇa kālam tad paryaṅkam na bhindyām na muceyam na tasmāt bodhivṛkṣa mūlāt uttiṣṭheyam
translated: Having sat cross-legged, in that very moment I would attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and until the time of parinirvana I would not break or loosen that cross-legged posture, nor would I rise from the base of that Bodhi tree.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūlastha evāhaṃ vajrāsane niṣaṇṇo'haṃ nirmitān buddhān bodhisattvāṃśca gaṇanātikrānteṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣa mūla sthaḥ eva aham vajrāsane niṣaṇṇā uham nirmitān buddhān bodhisattvān ca gaṇanā atikrānteṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyam
translated: While remaining at the base of the Bodhi tree, seated on the vajra seat, I would send forth emanated Buddhas and Bodhisattvas to buddha fields beyond count.

original: ekaiko buddha ekapūrvabhaktena sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ buddhaḥ eka pūrva bhaktena sattvānām dharmam deśayet
translated: Each Buddha would teach the Dharma to beings for one meal.

original: tenaiva pūrvabhaktena gaṇanātikrāntān sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ avaivartikāṃ sthāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tena eva pūrva bhaktena gaṇanā atikrāntān sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ a vaivartikām sthāpayeyuḥ
translated: With that very previous meal, they would inspire and establish countless beings in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and establish them as irreversible.

analyzed: evam nirmitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bodhisattva kāryam kuryuḥ
translated: Thus, the emanated bodhisattvas would perform the activities of bodhisattvas.

original: bodhiprāptasya me gaṇanātikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣvanyāsu lokadhātuṣu mama kāyo dṛṣyet /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya me gaṇanā atikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣu anyāsu lokadhātuṣu mama kāyaḥ dṛṣyet
translated: When I attain enlightenment, my body would be seen in other world systems in the ten directions beyond count.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ mama kāyo lakṣaṇālaṅkṛtaścakṣurindriyasyābhāsamāgacchet sarve te sattvā niyatā bhaveyuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām mama kāyaḥ lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtaḥ cakṣuḥ indriyasya ābhāsam āgacchet sarve te sattvāḥ niyatāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And for all those beings whose eyes would behold my body adorned with the marks, all those beings would be destined for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yāvad bodhiparinirvāṇena te sattvā avirahitā bhaveyurbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi parinirvāṇena te sattvāḥ avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ
translated: Until the final nirvāṇa of that enlightenment, those beings would be inseparable from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: na tatrendriyavikalā bhaveyurye ca tatra bodhisattvā māṃ draṣṭuṃ iccheyuste yena yenaiva gaccheyuḥ parivarteyuḥ caṃkrameyurniṣīdeyuḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ /
analyzed: na tatra indriya vikalāḥ bhaveyuḥ ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ mām draṣṭum iccheyuḥ te yena yena eva gaccheyuḥ parivarteyuḥ caṃkrameyuḥ niṣīdeyuḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: There would be no one with deficient faculties there. And those bodhisattvas who would wish to see me there, wherever they would go, wherever they would turn, wherever they would walk, wherever they would sit, wherever they would stand,

original: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samanantarotpāditena buddhanamaskāracittena māṃ bodhivṛkṣaniṣaṇṇaṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve te bodhisattvāḥ samanantara utpāditena buddha namaskāra cittena mām bodhivṛkṣa niṣaṇṇam paśyeyuḥ
translated: May all those bodhisattvas, as soon as they have generated the thought of paying homage to the Buddha, see me seated at the Bodhi tree.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca yasya dharmasaṃśayaḥ syāt so'sya sahadarśanena vigacchettīrṇavacikitsāḥ syādanupadiṣṭasya dharmapadasyārthamājāneyuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca yasya dharma saṃśayaḥ syāt saḥ usya saha darśanena vigacchet syāt anupadiṣṭasya dharma padasya artham ājāneyuḥ
translated: And having seen, may whoever has doubts about the Dharma have them dispelled upon seeing me, may they cross over doubt, and may they understand the meaning of the Dharma teaching that has not been taught.

original: apramāṇaṃ me āyurbhavet na śakyate kenacid gaṇayituṃ anyatra sārvajñena jñānena /
analyzed: apramāṇam me āyuḥ bhavet na śakyate kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra sārvajñena jñānena
translated: May my lifespan be immeasurable, not able to be counted by anyone except for omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: apramānāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And may the bodhisattvas there be immeasurable.

original: yasmiṃśca kṣaṇe'haṃ tatra buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ tasmin kṣaṇe tatra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvā muṇḍāḥ kāṣāyavastrāḥ
analyzed: yasmin ca kṣaṇe iham tatra buddhakṣetre in uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam tasmin kṣaṇe tatra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvāḥ muṇḍāḥ kāṣāya vastrāḥ
translated: And in whatever moment I attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that buddha-field, in that moment the bodhisattvas there will have shaven heads and wear red robes.

original: yāvan mama parinirvāṇānna cātra buddhakṣetra ekasattvo'pi dīrghakeśaḥ syāt śuklaprāvaraṇo vā /
analyzed: yāvat mama parinirvāṇāt na ca atra buddhakṣetre eka sattvaḥ api dīrgha keśaḥ syāt śukla prāvaraṇaḥ vā
translated: Until my parinirvana, not a single being in that buddha-field will have long hair or wear white clothes.

analyzed: sarve eva śramaṇa varṇāḥ syuḥ śramaṇa pratirūpāḥ tiṣṭheyuḥ
translated: They will all be of the appearance of ascetics, and will remain as proper ascetics.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said: Excellent, excellent, good man!

original: tvamapi paṇḍito vyakto medhāvī atīvaśobhanaṃ te praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tvam api paṇḍitaḥ vyaktaḥ medhāvī atīva śobhanam te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You are also clearly wise, intelligent, and extremely well-endowed with excellent aspirations.

analyzed: atīva guṇavāstvam atīva jñānavān
translated: You are endowed with supreme qualities and supreme knowledge.

original: yatastvaṃ kulaputra sarvasattvānāmarthāyaivaṃrūpāṃ pravarāṃ praśastāṃ matiṃ kṛtavān pravaro buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: yatas tvam kula putra sarva sattvānām arthāya evaṃrūpām pravarām praśastām matim kṛtavān pravaraḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: Since, noble son, you have formed such an excellent and praiseworthy intention for the sake of all beings, you have chosen an excellent array of qualities for your buddha field.

analyzed: tatas te kula putra mañjuśrīḥ nāma bhavatu
translated: Therefore, noble son, your name will be Mañjuśrī.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ mañjuśrīranāgate'dhvani atikrāntayordvayornadīvālikāsamayorasaṃkhyeyayoḥ praviṣṭe ca tṛtīye'saṃkhyeye dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi śuddhavirajaḥsannicayo nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam mañjuśrīḥ anāgata idhvani atikrāntayoḥ dvayoḥ nadīvālikā samayoḥ asaṃkhyeyayoḥ praviṣṭe ca tṛtīye saṃkhyeye dakṣiṇasyām diśi śuddhavirajaḥsannicayaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the future, after two Ganges river sands of eons have passed and the third countless eon has begun, in the southern direction there will be a world system called Pure and Stainless Accumulation.

analyzed: tatra ca sahā lokadhātuḥ antargatā bhaviṣyati
translated: And the Sahā world system will be included within it.

analyzed: anupraviṣṭaḥ ca evaṃrūpayā guṇa vyūhayā tat buddhakṣetram prādurbhaviṣyati
translated: And that buddha field will appear with such an array of qualities.

analyzed: tatra tvam mañjuśrīḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, Mañjuśrī, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: samantadarśī nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: samantadarśī nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: You will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Samantadarśin.

original: evaṃrūpā ca te bodhisattvaparṣadbhaviṣyati sarve caite praṇidhānāstvayi saṃpatsyante yathā tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpā ca te bodhisattva parṣad bhaviṣyati sarve ca ete praṇidhānāḥ tvayi saṃpatsyante yathā tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Your assembly of bodhisattvas will be like this, and all these aspirations will be fulfilled in you, as you have made the aspiration.

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtena tatas tvam bahu buddha koṭīṣu avarupta kuśala mūlaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: As a bodhisattva, you will then plant roots of virtue in many millions of buddhas.

analyzed: āśaya pariśodhakaḥ ca kleśa pramardakaḥ
translated: You will purify your intentions and crush the afflictions.

original: ye ca te mañjuśrīssattvā nāmaṃ śroṣyanti teṣāṃ sarvakarmāvaraṇakṣayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ye ca te mañjuśrīḥ sattvāḥ nāmam śroṣyanti teṣām sarva karma āvaraṇa kṣayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And, Mañjuśrī, those beings who hear your name will have all their karmic obscurations destroyed.

analyzed: kuśala vivardhakaḥ ca bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will increase their virtue.

original: mañjuśrīrāha yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśāparipūrirbhavediti yathā me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tathā caiva māṃ buddhā bhagavanto vyākurvantu ye daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūriḥ bhavet iti yathā me praṇidhānam kṛtam tathā ca eva mām buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ vyākurvantu ye daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānām ca dharmam deśayanti
translated: Mañjuśrī said, Blessed One, if my hopes are to be fulfilled in this way, as I have made the aspiration, may the blessed buddhas dwelling, remaining, and living in the immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions prophesy my enlightenment.

analyzed: tathā aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpantu
translated: May immeasurable and incalculable buddha-fields quake.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ bhavantu
translated: May all beings be filled with such happiness.

analyzed: tat yathā dvitīya dhyāna krīḍā vyūha samāpannasya bodhisattvasya
translated: Just as when a bodhisattva who has attained the play-array concentration of the second dhyāna.

analyzed: tathā aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ divya māndārava puṣpāṇi abhipravarṣantu
translated: In the same way, let divine and human flowers rain down from immeasurable and incalculable buddha-fields.

original: tebhyaśca māndāravebhya evaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścaratu yaduta buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ pāramitāśabdaḥ balavaiśāradyaśabdaśca niścaratu
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca māndāravebhyaḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścaratu yat uta buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ pāramitā śabdaḥ bala vaiśāradya śabdaḥ ca niścaratu
translated: And from those coral trees, let sounds such as the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the perfections, the sound of the powers and fearlessnesses, issue forth.

original: yadā cāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandeya tadā caivaṃrūpaṃ nimittaṃ prādurbhavet /
analyzed: yadā ca aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandeya tadā ca evaṃrūpam nimittam prādurbhavet
translated: And when I pay homage to the Blessed One with my five points touching the ground, let such signs appear.

original: yadā ca mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtaṃ tadā tatkṣaṇādevamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpitā /
analyzed: yadā ca mañjuśriyā kumāra bhūtena bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtam tadā tad kṣaṇāt evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ prakaṃpitāḥ
translated: When Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, paid homage at the feet of the Blessed One, at that very moment immeasurable and incalculable buddha-fields trembled.

analyzed: divyāni ca māndāravāṇi abhipravarṣitāni
translated: And divine coral trees rained down.

original: sarvasattvāścaivaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitā abhavanyathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ abhavan yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And all beings were filled with such bliss as had been vowed.

original: ye ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāsteṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti te tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti /
analyzed: ye ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām dharmam śṛṇvanti te tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti
translated: And those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who listen to the Dharma of those Buddhas, they ask those Buddhas:

original: ko'tra hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ evaṃrūpāṇāṃ nimittānāṃ prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ tra hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ evaṃrūpāṇām nimittānām prādurbhāvāya
translated: What is the cause here, what is the condition, for the appearance of such forms of omens?

original: te ca buddhā bhagavanto mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ vyākurvanti anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam vyākurvanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, declare Mañjuśrī, the Youth, to be irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara mati viśāla buddhe
translated: Rise, O best of minds, of vast intelligence,

analyzed: vyākṛtaḥ tvam daśa diśi lokanāthaiḥ
translated: You are prophesied by the Lords of the world in the ten directions.

analyzed: calitā kṣitiḥ tarpitāḥ sattvāḥ saukhyaiḥ
translated: The earth has trembled, beings have been satisfied with happiness,

original: puṣpāḥ pravṛṣṭā bheṣyase buddha loka // iti //
analyzed: puṣpāḥ pravṛṣṭāḥ bheṣyase buddha loke iti
translated: Flowers have rained down, you will become a Buddha in the world.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturthaṃ rājaputramānaṅgaṇaṃ nāmāmantrayati /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturtham rājaputram ānaṅgaṇam nāma āmantrayati
translated: Then, son of noble family, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the fourth prince, named Anangana:

analyzed: peyālam yathā mañjuśriyā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Just as Mañjuśrī made his vow.

analyzed: tasya bhagavān sādhukāram anuprādāsīt
translated: The Blessed One expressed his approval to him:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Excellent, excellent, son of noble family!

analyzed: bodhisattva bhūtaḥ tvam kula putra aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām kleśa parvatām bhetsyasi
translated: You will be a bodhisattva, noble sir, and will shatter the mountain peaks of the afflictions of immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings.

analyzed: buddha kāryam ca kariṣyasi
translated: You will perform the deeds of a Buddha.

analyzed: tatas paścāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: Then, afterwards, you will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tena tvaṃ kulaputra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaśrīrnāma bodhisattvo bhavasva /
analyzed: tena tvam kula putra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaśrīḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ bhavasva
translated: Therefore, noble sir, you should be called the bodhisattva Vajracchedikāprajñāprabhāsaśrī.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsānāgate'dhvanyatikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikānāmasaṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsaṃkhyeye purimāyāṃ diśi daśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamān buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāllokadhātūnatikramya tatrānimiṣā nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vajra cheda prajñā avabhāsa anāgata idhvani atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikānām asaṃkhyeye inupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā saṃkhyeye purimāyām diśi daśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātūn atikramya tatra animiṣā nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, after an incalculable number of eons equal to the sands of the Ganges have passed, and you have entered the second incalculable number of eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, in the east, beyond Buddha-fields equal to the number of particles in ten Buddha-fields, there will be a world system called Animiṣā.

analyzed: tatra tvam kula putra bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyasi
translated: There, noble sir, you will fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: samantabhadro nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasampanno bhaviṣyasi yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: samantabhadraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Samantabhadra, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: evaṃrūpaṃ ca te buddhakṣetramanekaguṇavyūhitaṃ bhaviṣyati yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam ca te buddhakṣetram aneka guṇa vyūhitam bhaviṣyati yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Your buddha realm will be endowed with many qualities, just as you have prayed.”

original: samanantaravyākṛtaśca kulaputra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vajracchedaprajñāvabhāso bodhisattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samanantara vyākṛtaḥ ca kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vajra cheda prajñā avabhāsaḥ bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: “Noble one, as soon as the Tathāgata Ratnasaṃbhava had prophesied the enlightenment of the bodhisattva Vajracchedaprajñāloka,

analyzed: gagana tala gatāni anekāni deva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi sādhukāram aduḥ gośīrṣa uraga sāra candana agaru tamāla cūrṇam ca pravārṣuḥ
translated: many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of devas in the sky shouted ‘Excellent!’ and rained down the finest sandalwood powder of gośīrṣa, uragasāra, and tamāla leaves.

original: sa āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tadyadāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ pañcamaṇḍalena vandeyaṃ tadā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāllokadhātavo divyātikrāntenodāreṇa gandhena sphuṭā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat yadā aham bhagavantam pañca maṇḍalena vandeyam tadā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāt lokadhātavaḥ divya atikrāntena udāreṇa gandhena sphuṭāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: He said, ‘Reverend Lord, if my wish is to be fulfilled in this way, then when I pay homage to the Lord with my five points, may as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river be filled with a divine, extraordinary fragrance.’

original: ye ca tatra lokadhātuṣu sattvā upapannā bhaveyuḥ nairayikā vā tairyagyonikā vā yāmalaukikā vā devā vā manuṣyā vā te sarve taṃ gandhaṃ ghrāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ upapannāḥ bhaveyuḥ nairayikāḥ vā tairyagyonikāḥ vā yāmalaukikāḥ vā devāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā te sarve tam gandham ghrāyeyuḥ
translated: May all the beings who are born in those world systems, whether in the hells, as animals, as pretas, as devas, or as humans, smell that fragrance.

original: teṣāṃ kāyavyādhiḥ kāyaduḥkhaṃ cittavyādhiḥ cittaduḥkhaṃ ca tāvacciraṃ praśāntaṃ bhavedyāvadahaṃ śīrṣeṇa pṛthivīṃ spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām kāya vyādhiḥ kāya duḥkham citta vyādhiḥ citta duḥkham ca tāvat ciram praśāntam bhavet yāvat aham śīrṣeṇa pṛthivīm spṛśeyam
translated: Their bodily illness and bodily suffering, and their mental illness and mental suffering, would be pacified for a long time, as long as I touch the earth with my head.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāso bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandate /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vajracchedaprajñāvabhāsaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandate
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Diamond Flame of Wisdom bowed at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha with his five limbs.

original: atha tavadeva gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavo divyātikrāntenodāreṇa gandhena sphuṭā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: atha tavat eva gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ divya atikrāntena udāreṇa gandhena sphuṭāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Then at that very moment, world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges were filled with a fragrance surpassing that of the gods.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ kāyavyādhiścittavyādhiḥ kāyaduḥkhaṃ cittaduḥkhaṃ ca praśāntaṃ pratiprasrabdhaṃ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca sattvānām kāya vyādhiḥ citta vyādhiḥ kāya duḥkham citta duḥkham ca praśāntam pratiprasrabdham
translated: And the bodily illness, mental illness, bodily suffering, and mental suffering of all beings were pacified and calmed.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha vajrabheda kara
translated: Rise, O Diamond Splitter,

analyzed: gandhena sphuṭā
translated: Many fields are filled with fragrance.
You will bring joy and happiness to beings,

analyzed: bheṣyasi vara loka pitā
translated: And become the supreme father of the world.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ pañcamaṃ rājaputramabhayaṃ nāmāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pañcamam rājaputram abhayam nāma āmantrayate sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrareņu addressed the fifth prince, named Abhaya:

original: peyālaṃ / na ca kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre /
analyzed: peyālam na ca kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre
translated: And so on, not only in this afflicted buddha field.

original: tatrāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ yatra na narakā bhaveyurna tiryagyonirna yamalokāḥ /
analyzed: tatra aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam yatra na narakāḥ bhaveyuḥ na tiryagyoniḥ na yama lokāḥ
translated: There, Blessed One, I would awaken to perfect and complete awakening, where there would be no hells, no animal realms, no realms of Yama,

original: yatra nīlavaiḍūryamayī bhūmirvistareṇa yathā padmāyāṃ lokadhātau buddhakṣetre guṇavyūhā tathā vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: yatra nīla vaiḍūrya mayī bhūmiḥ vistareṇa yathā padmāyām lokadhātau buddhakṣetre guṇa vyūhā tathā vaktavyāḥ
translated: where the ground would be of blue beryl, and the adornments of qualities in the Buddha-field would be described in detail as in the world-system Padma, the Buddha-field.

original: abhayaśca rājaputro ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyāgrataḥ padmaṃ sthāpayitvāha /
analyzed: abhayaḥ ca rāja putraḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya agratas padmam sthāpayitvā āha
translated: And Prince Abhaya, in the presence of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, having placed a lotus in front, said:

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadahaṃ bhagavato'nubhāvena darśanavyūhaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat aham bhagavataḥ unubhāvena darśana vyūham samādhim pratilabheyam
translated: If, Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then by the Blessed One's power I would obtain the samadhi called 'Array of Vision.'

original: yenāhaṃ bhagavato'grato daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsaṃkhyai rathacakrapramāṇamātraiḥ padmaiḥ puṣpavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣet vayaṃ ca paśyema /
analyzed: yena aham bhagavatā ugratas daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ saṃkhyaiḥ ratha cakra pramāṇa mātraiḥ padmaiḥ puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣet vayam ca paśyema
translated: By which, in front of the Blessed One, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, in Buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms, with lotuses the size of chariot wheels, a rain of flowers would fall, and we would see it.

original: sahodīrate vākye buddhānubhāvena darśanavyūhaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabdhavān /
analyzed: saha udīrate vākye buddha anubhāvena darśana vyūham samādhim pratilabdhavān
translated: As soon as the words were spoken, by the Buddha's power he obtained the samadhi called 'Array of Vision.'

original: daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamai rathacakrapramāṇāmātraiḥ padmaiḥ padmavarṣaṃ pravarṣitaṃ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ ratha cakra pramāṇā mātraiḥ padmaiḥ padma varṣam pravarṣitam
translated: In the ten directions, in world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges River, a rain of lotuses was caused to fall, with lotuses the size of chariot wheels, equal to the atoms in a buddha-field.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā abhayaḥ rāja kumāraḥ parama prīti saumanasya jātaḥ babhūva
translated: Seeing this, Prince Abhaya became filled with supreme joy and happiness.

original: bhagavān āha atīva kulaputra śobhanaṃ tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha atīva kula putra śobhanam tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, you have made a most excellent aspiration.

analyzed: śobhanam ca buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: And you have accepted a most excellent buddha-field.

analyzed: ati śīghram ca te samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: You have attained the samādhi very quickly.

analyzed: satya vacanena padma vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitāḥ
translated: By the truth of your words, a rain of lotuses has been caused to fall.

original: sa āha yadi mamānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvāśāparipūrirbhaveta tadete padmā gagane tiṣṭhantu tathaiva gagane sthitā varṣantu /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi mama anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūriḥ bhaveta tat ete padmāḥ gagane tiṣṭhantu tathā eva gagane sthitāḥ varṣantu
translated: He said, If my wish for the highest perfect enlightenment is to be fulfilled, then may these lotuses remain in the sky and rain down from the sky just as they are.

original: bhagavān āha atikṣipraṃ kulaputra gaganatalaṃ padmairmudritaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ati kṣipram kula putra gagana talam padmaiḥ mudritam
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, the sky is quickly sealed with lotuses.

original: tena hi tvaṃ kulaputra gaganamudro nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: tena hi tvam kula putra gaganamudraḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, noble son, you should be named Gaganamudra.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ gaganamudro'nāgate'dhvani atikrānte ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye pūrvadakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi koṭīśatasahasraṃ gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni buddhakṣetrāṇyatikrāmayitvā tatra padmā nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam gagana mudrā unāgata idhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā sama isaṃkhyeya anupraviṣṭe dvitīye pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi koṭī śata sahasram gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi atikrāmayitvā tatra padmā nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, beyond a countless, immeasurable, incalculable eon, in the southeast direction, passing a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, there will be a world system called Padma.

analyzed: tatra tvam bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There you will attain enlightenment.

original: padmottaraśca nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasyarhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno yāvadbuddho bhagavān aprameyena śuddhena bodhisattvasaṅghena /
analyzed: padmottaraḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān aprameyena śuddhena bodhisattva saṅghena
translated: And you will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Bhagavat named Padmottara, together with an immeasurable assembly of pure bodhisattvas.

analyzed: aparimāṇā ca te āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And your lifespan will be immeasurable.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ ca etaiḥ guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam lapsyasi tat etat praṇidhāṇam kṛtam
translated: You will attain all these qualities, as you have made this aspiration.

original: gaganamudro bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā nipapāta /
analyzed: gaganamudraḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā nipapāta
translated: The bodhisattva Gaganamudra bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: tat bhagavān āha
translated: Then the Blessed One said:

analyzed: bhaviṣyase jagati hita karaḥ
translated: You will become a benefactor for the world,
pacifying the turbid afflictions.

analyzed: kṣetra rajaḥ sama guṇa dharaḥ
translated: Bearing qualities equal to the dust of the fields,

analyzed: bodhim prāpsyasi yathā pūrva jinaiḥ
translated: You will attain enlightenment as the previous victors did.”

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ ṣaṣṭhaṃ rājaputramambaraṃ nāmāntrayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṣaṣṭham rājaputram ambaram nāma āntrayati sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrareņu addressed the sixth prince, Ambara,

original: peyālaṃ / na ca kevalamasmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre /
analyzed: peyālam na ca kevalam asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre
translated: as before, not only in this afflicted buddha realm,

original: yāvad yathā gaganamudreṇa bodhisattvena praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat yathā gaganamudreṇa bodhisattvena praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: but also as far as the bodhisattva Gagana­mukhāgra­dhara had made his vow.

original: yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tad daśadiśī gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāsu lokadhātuṣu sarvagaganeṣu saptaratnamayāḥ chatrāḥ prādurbhavantu hemajālapraticchannāḥ saptaratnamayābhirghaṇṭābhiralaṅkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat daśa diśī gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāsu lokadhātuṣu sarva gaganeṣu sapta ratna mayāḥ chatrāḥ prādurbhavantu hema jāla praticchannāḥ sapta ratna mayābhiḥ ghaṇṭābhiḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ
translated: “Blessed One, if my aspiration is to be fulfilled in this way, then may parasols made of the seven precious substances appear in all the sky-spaces of world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, covered with nets of gold, adorned with bells made of the seven precious substances.

original: tatra chatraghaṇṭājālairevaṃrūpaḥ śabdo niścaret yaduta buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ pāramitāśabdo balaśabdo'bhijñāśabdo vaiśāradyaśabdaḥ /
analyzed: tatra chatra ghaṇṭā jālaiḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śabdaḥ niścaret yat uta buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ pāramitā śabdaḥ bala śabda ubhijñā śabdaḥ vaiśāradya śabdaḥ
translated: And may a sound like this come forth from those parasols, bells, and nets: namely, the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the perfections, the sound of the powers, the sound of the superknowledges, the sound of the fearlessnesses.

original: sarve ca te sattvā evaṃrūpaṃ śabdaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ te śrutvā sarve'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ evaṃrūpam śabdam śṛṇuyuḥ te śrutvā sarven uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may all those beings hear such a sound, and having heard it, may all of them arouse the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ye cātra sattvāḥ pūrvamutpāditabodhicittāste'vaivartikā bhaveyuranuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ye ca atra sattvāḥ pūrvam utpādita bodhi cittāḥ te vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may all beings here who have previously given rise to the mind of enlightenment become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: samanantaravyāhṛte'smiṃ vyāhāre atha daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvagaganatalāt peyālaṃ evaṃrūpāḥ śabdā niścaranti /
analyzed: samanantara vyāhṛte smin vyāhāre atha daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva gagana talāt peyālam evaṃrūpāḥ śabdāḥ niścaranti
translated: Immediately after this utterance, then from the entire sky in the worlds in the ten directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, sounds like this were heard:

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca anubhāvāt svayam eva adrākṣīt
translated: And by the Buddha's power, he saw it himself.🔽Again he said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of wish of mine is fulfilled as I have made the vow, then I will in front of the Blessed One

original: punarevaṃ āha sacenme bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tadahaṃ bhagavataḥ purato jñānavairocanaṃ samādhiṃ
analyzed: punar evam āha saced me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānam kṛtam tat aham bhagavataḥ puratas jñāna vairocanam samādhim
translated: know the samādhi called 'Vairocana of Wisdom,'

analyzed: yena mama kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ nivarteyuḥ
translated: by which my wholesome dharmas will be accomplished.

original: pratilabdhe ca samādhau māṃ bhagavāṃ vyākuryāt /
analyzed: pratilabdhe ca samādhau mām bhagavām vyākuryāt
translated: And when I have attained the samādhi, may the Blessed One prophesy for me.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca anubhāvena jñāna vairocana samādhiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: And by the Buddha's power, he attained the samādhi called 'Vairocana of Wisdom.'

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, good man!

analyzed: udāram te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have made a great vow.

original: tena tvaṃ puṇyābhisyandena daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhakṣetrā bahavaścaikapramāṇāḥ /
analyzed: tena tvam puṇya abhisyandena daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ bahavaḥ ca eka pramāṇāḥ
translated: By that merit, in the ten directions, in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, and in many of the same measure,

analyzed: śata sahasra manojña śabda saṃcoditaḥ buddhakṣetraḥ
translated: the buddha-field will be inspired with a hundred thousand pleasant sounds.

analyzed: tatas tvam kula putra vegavairocanaḥ nāma bhagasva
translated: Therefore, noble one, you will be called Vairocana of Speed.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vegavairocanātikrānte'nāgate'dhvanyekanadīgaṅgāvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavo'tikramitvā ādityasomā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra tvaṃ bodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vegavairocana atikrāntena āgata idhvani eka nadī gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeya inupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ atikramitvā ādityasomāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra tvam bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In the future, after the passing of Vairocana of Speed, in the second incalculably long eon, in the east, having surpassed world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, there will be a world system called Aditya-Soma. There you will attain enlightenment.

original: dharmavaśavartīśvararājo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasyarhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno yāvad buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: dharmavaśavartī īśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will become the Tathagata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-Gone, Knower of the Secular World, Unsurpassed Trainer of Those to be Trained, Teacher of Gods and Men, the World-Honored Buddha named Dharmesvara-Raj.

original: sa ca vegavairocano bodhisattvastaṃ bhagavantaṃ pañcamaṇḍalena vandati ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ /
analyzed: sa ca vegavairocanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tam bhagavantam pañca maṇḍalena vandati ratnagarbham tathāgatam
translated: And that bodhisattva Vairocana of Speed will pay homage to that Blessed One, the Tathagata Ratna-Garbha, with the five parts of the body.

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha suvrata surata dānta citta
translated: Arise, O one of good vows, O one of controlled mind, O one of good conduct,

analyzed: sattvebhyaḥ tīvra karuṇā mahatī pravṛttā
translated: And he had a great and intense compassion for beings.

analyzed: tāre hi sattvān duḥkha arṇava tīram saṃsthā
translated: O Tara! Until I establish beings across the ocean of suffering,

analyzed: yāvat na budhyasi anuttara buddha bodhim
translated: And attain the unsurpassed enlightenment of Buddhahood,

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ saptamaṃ rājaputramaṅgajamāmantrayāṃ āsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ saptamam rāja putram aṅgajam āmantrayāṃ āsa
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrareņu addressed the seventh prince, Angaja:

original: peyālaṃ / na cāsmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre tatrāhaṃ bodhimabhisaṃbuddheyaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam na ca asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre tatra aham bodhim abhisaṃbuddhā iyam
translated: The same as before. I will not attain enlightenment in this defiled buddha-field.

original: yatra ca na narakā na tiryagyoniḥ na yamalokaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: yatra ca na narakāḥ na tiryagyoniḥ na yama lokaḥ prajñāyate
translated: Where there are no hells, no animal realm, and no world of Yama are known.

original: na mātṛgrāmo na ca sattvānāṃ garbhavāsaḥ /
analyzed: na mātṛgrāmaḥ na ca sattvānām garbha vāsaḥ
translated: No women, and no beings are conceived in the womb.

original: na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍamahācakravāḍā na pāṃśuśailaparvatā notsadaśarkarakaṭhallakaṇṭakagahanā na kāṣṭhavṛkṣā na mahāsamudrā /
analyzed: na sumeruḥ na cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍāḥ na pāṃśu śaila parvatāḥ na utsada śarkara kaṭhalla kaṇṭaka gahanāḥ na kāṣṭhavṛkṣāḥ na mahā samudrāḥ
translated: No Mount Sumeru, no Cakravāḍa or Mahācakravāḍa, no mountains of sand or rocks, no dense forests of thorns and sharp stones, no wooden trees, and no great oceans.

original: na ca tatrādityacandrā na tārakarūpā na rātridivasā na tamaskandhā /
analyzed: na ca tatra āditya candrāḥ na tāraka rūpāḥ na rātri divasāḥ na tamaḥ skandhāḥ
translated: There the sun and moon, the stars, the day and night, and the darkness do not exist.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāmuccāraprasrāvakheṭasiṅghāṇakaṃ na kāyakhedadurgandhaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām uccāra prasrāva kheṭa siṅghāṇakam na kāya kheda durgandham
translated: There the excrement, urine, phlegm, and snot of beings, and the foul smell of the body do not exist.

original: na ca sattvānāṃ kāyaklamatā bhavet na cittaklamatā /
analyzed: na ca sattvānām kāya klama tā bhavet na citta klama tā
translated: And there would be no physical fatigue or mental fatigue for sentient beings.

analyzed: na ca tatra pāṃśu bhūmiḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no dusty ground there.

original: sarvā ca tatra bhūmiraśmagarbhamayī bhavet anekaratnaśatasahasrālaṅkṛtā bhavet /
analyzed: sarvā ca tatra bhūmiḥ aśma garbha mayī bhavet aneka ratna śata sahasra alaṅkṛtā bhavet
translated: And all the ground there would be made of precious stones, adorned with many hundreds of thousands of jewels.

original: māndāravamahāmāndāravapuṣpāvakīrṇaṃ ca tad buddhakṣetraṃ nānāratnavṛkṣālaṅkṛtaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa avakīrṇam ca tat buddhakṣetram nānā ratna vṛkṣa alaṅkṛtam bhavet
translated: And that buddha-field would be strewn with coral tree and great coral tree flowers, and adorned with jeweled trees of various kinds.

analyzed: te ca ratna vṛkṣāḥ nānā ratna jāla alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those jeweled trees would be adorned with nets of various jewels.

original: nānāratnaduṣyā nānāratnavastrā nānāratnamālā nānāratnābharaṇālaṅkārālaṅkṛtā nānāmālyebhyo nānāvādyairnānāratnabhājanairnānāpuṣpaiśca te ratnavṛkṣālaṅkṛtā
analyzed: nānā ratna duṣyāḥ nānā ratna vastrāḥ nānā ratna mālāḥ nānā ratna ābharaṇa alaṅkāra alaṅkṛtāḥ nānā mālyebhyaḥ nānā vādyaiḥ nānā ratna bhājanaiḥ nānā puṣpaiḥ ca te ratna vṛkṣāḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ
translated: Adorned with various jeweled canopies, various jeweled garments, various jeweled garlands, various jeweled ornaments and decorations, various flower garlands, various musical instruments, various jeweled vessels, and various flowers, those jeweled trees would be adorned.

analyzed: na tatra rātriḥ prajñāyeta
translated: There would be no night known there,

analyzed: anyatra yadā puṣpāḥ saṃkuceyuḥ vādyāḥ ca vādyeyuḥ
