translated: Another thousand will be named Visruta-Dharma-Raja-Naga-Indra-Vimukti-Buddha-Lokasagara-Locana-Shaila. They will be Tathagatas, Arhats, Samyaksambuddhas.

analyzed: eka kāle eka divasena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyanti
translated: At one time, on one day, they will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: anyonyāsu lokadhātuṣu daśa antara kalpa āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: In other worlds, their lifespan will be ten intermediate kalpas.

original: te'pi daśaprāṇasahasrā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipetuḥ /
analyzed: te api daśa prāṇa sahasrāḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipetuḥ
translated: Those ten thousand beings also bowed their heads to the feet of Tathagata Ratnagarbha with the five parts of the body.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: Tathagata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭhata ca dṛḍha nāga nardatā
translated: Arise, roar like a firm elephant,

analyzed: kriyatā śubha dravya saṃcayam
translated: Gather the auspicious substance.

analyzed: udyujitaḥ pāramitāsu vega tā
translated: Be diligent, be swift in the perfections,

analyzed: bhaviṣyatha asura nara loka nāyakāḥ
translated: You will become guides for the worlds of gods and humans.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo navamaṃ rājaputramāmantrayate sma amighaṃ nāma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ navamam rāja putram āmantrayate sma amigham nāma
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrareņu addressed the ninth prince named Amiघ,

original: peyālaṃ / sa prāha tathārūpamahaṃ bodhisattvacārikāṃ cariṣyāmi yathā me daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamāstiṣṭhanto yāpayantaḥ buddhā bhagavanto bodhicārikāṃ carataḥ sākṣibhūtā bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ /
analyzed: peyālam sa prāha tathārūpam aham bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi yathā me daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ yāpayantaḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhi cārikām carataḥ sākṣi bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti bodhisattva caryāyām
translated: repeating the same as before. He said, I will practice the conduct of the bodhisattvas in such a way that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are present and living in the worlds of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, will be witnesses to my conduct of the bodhisattva conduct.

original: yadahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan tvatpurato bodhāya cittamutpādayāmi /
analyzed: yat aham bhadanta bhagavan tvad puratas bodhāya cittam utpādayāmi
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when I generate the mind of enlightenment in front of you,

analyzed: yāvat ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye
translated: And as long as I have not attained supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: atrāntareṇa me bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇasya na vipratisāracittamutpadyeta /
analyzed: atrā antareṇa me bodhisattva caryām caramāṇasya na vipratisāra cittam utpadyeta
translated: in the meantime, while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, may I not give rise to regretful thoughts.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya dṛḍha pratijñaḥ bhaveyam yathāvādī tathākārī
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, may I be one of firm vows, acting as I speak.

analyzed: na ca anyasya sattvasya citta saṃkṣobhaḥ bhaveyam
translated: And may there be no disturbance of mind for any other being.

analyzed: na ca me śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāne cittam utpadyeta
translated: And may there not arise in me thoughts of the Śrāvaka or Pratyekabuddha vehicles.

analyzed: mā ca kāma rāga citta caitasikāḥ utpadyeran
translated: And may thoughts and mental states of lustful desire not arise.

original: mā styānamiddhasahagatā mauddhatyasahagatā mā kaukṛtyasahagatā na vicikitsāsahagatā na prāṇātipātaṃ nādattādānaṃ nābrahmacaryaṃ na mṛsāvādaṃ na paiśunyaṃ na pāruṣyaṃ nābhidhyā na vyāpādaṃ na mithyādṛṣṭiḥ na saṃbhinnapralāpaṃ na mātsaryasahagataṃ na dharme'gauravacittatā na visaṃvādanacittatā yāvadbodhiparyantān mama bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇasya ime dharmā na saṃvidyeyuḥ /
analyzed: mā styānam iddha sahagatāḥ mā auddhatya sahagatāḥ mā kaukṛtya sahagatāḥ na vicikitsā sahagatāḥ na prāṇa atipātam na adatta ādānam na abrahmacaryam na mṛsāvādam na paiśunyam na pāruṣyam na abhidhyā na vyāpādam na mithyādṛṣṭiḥ na saṃbhinnapralāpam na mātsarya sahagatam na dharmegaurava citta tā na visaṃvādana citta tā yāvat bodhi paryantāt mama bodhisattva caryām caramāṇasya ime dharmāḥ na saṃvidyeyuḥ
translated: May I not be accompanied by drowsiness and sleep, restlessness and remorse, doubt, killing living beings, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, ill will, wrong view, or frivolous chatter. May I not be accompanied by stinginess, nor have a mind lacking respect for the Dharma, nor a mind of deception, up to the end of enlightenment. May these qualities not be absent for me while practicing the bodhisattva conduct.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya padavī iti hārakam api buddha anusmṛtiḥ nityam citta caitasikāḥ pravarteran
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, may the recollection of the Buddha, which removes obstacles, always occur in my mind and mental factors.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantena nāhaṃ buddhadarśanena virahito bhaveyaṃ na dharmaśravaṇena na saṅghopasthānena /🔽sarvatra ca jātiṣu pravrajyāṃ pratilabheyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena na aham buddha darśanena virahitaḥ bhaveyam na dharma śravaṇena na saṅgha upasthānena  sarvatra ca jātiṣu pravrajyām pratilabheyam
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, may I not be separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, or serving the Saṅgha.🔽In all births, may I obtain going forth.

analyzed: sarvāsu jātiṣu pāṃśukūlikaḥ bhaveyam
translated: In all births, may I be a wearer of rags.

original: traicīvarikaḥ vṛkṣamūlikaḥ naiṣadyikaḥ āraṇyakaḥ piṇḍapātikaḥ alpecchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ dharmadeśakaḥ ādeyavākyaḥ aparimāṇapratibhānasaṃpanno bhaveyaṃ
analyzed: traicīvarikaḥ vṛkṣamūlikaḥ naiṣadyikaḥ āraṇyakaḥ piṇḍapātikaḥ alpa icchaḥ saṃtuṣṭaḥ dharma deśakaḥ ādeya vākyaḥ aparimāṇa pratibhāna saṃpannaḥ bhaveyam
translated: I would be one who wears the three robes, one who sits at the foot of a tree, one who does not lie down, one who lives in the forest, one who begs for alms, one with few desires, one who is content, one who teaches the Dharma, one whose speech is accepted, one who is endowed with immeasurable eloquence.

analyzed: na ca mūla āpattim āpadyeyam
translated: I would not commit a root downfall.

analyzed: na mṛṣāvāda sahagataiḥ mantraiḥ parapravādinaḥ
translated: I would not debate with opponents using words accompanied by false speech.

analyzed: śūnyatā pratisaṃyuktam ca mātṛgrāmasya dharmam deśayeyam
translated: I would teach the Dharma to women connected with emptiness.

original: śūnyatāmanaskāreṇa ca mātṛgrāmasya na dantavidarśanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: śūnyatā manaskāreṇa ca mātṛgrāmasya na danta vidarśanam kuryāt
translated: I would not show my teeth to women with thoughts of emptiness.

analyzed: na hasta vikāreṇa dharmam deśayeyam
translated: I would not teach the Dharma with gestures of the hands.

analyzed: nityam ca aham mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām śāstṛ saṃjñām utpādayeyam
translated: I would always generate the notion of teacher towards bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: yasya cāhaṃ dharmabhāṇakasya sakāśāddharmaṃ śṛṇuyāṃ śāstṛsaṃjñān tasyāntike utpādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yasya ca aham dharma bhāṇakasya sakāśāt dharmam śṛṇuyām śāstṛ saṃjñān tasya antike utpādayeyam
translated: And I would generate the notion of teacher towards that Dharma teacher from whom I would hear the Dharma.

original: satkṛtya cāhaṃ taṃ dharmabhāṇakaṃ yathā tathāgataṃ tathā satkuryāṃ gurukuryāṃ mānayeyaṃ pūjayeyaṃ yāvadātmamāṃsairapi dharmabhāṇakamupasthiteyaṃ
analyzed: satkṛtya ca aham tam dharma bhāṇakam yathā tathāgatam tathā satkuryām gurukuryām mānayeyam pūjayeyam yāvat ātma māṃsaiḥ api dharma bhāṇakam upasthitā iyam
translated: And I would honor that Dharma teacher as I would the Tathāgata, I would respect, revere, and worship him with my own flesh, and I would attend to the Dharma teacher.

original: na cāhaṃ pātramapātraṃ cāvekṣya dānaṃ dadyāṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham pātram apātram ca avekṣya dānam dadyām
translated: I would not give a gift while discriminating between worthy and unworthy recipients.

analyzed: na mama dharma dāna mātsarikā citta caitasikāḥ utpadyeyuḥ
translated: I would not have stingy thoughts or mental states regarding the gift of Dharma.

analyzed: sva jīvita dānena aham bodhyarthikān sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: I would protect those beings who seek enlightenment by giving up even my own life.

original: svavīryabalapraṇidhānopārjitena cāhaṃ dravyena vyasanagatān sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sva vīrya bala praṇidhāna upārjitena ca aham dravyena vyasana gatān sattvān vyasanebhyaḥ parimocayeyam
translated: I would liberate beings who are in distress from their distresses with wealth that I have acquired through my own effort, strength, and resolve.

original: na cāhaṃ pravrajitaliṅginaṃ vā gṛhasthaliṅginaṃ vā āpattyānāpattyā vā codayeyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham pravrajita liṅginam vā gṛhastha liṅginam vā āpattyā anāpattyā vā codayeyam
translated: I would not accuse anyone who has the appearance of a renunciant or the appearance of a householder, whether they have faults or not.

analyzed: nityam ca aham lābha satkāra śloka igni viṣa śastra saṃjñām utpādayeyam
translated: I would always regard gain, honor, and fame as like fire, poison, or a weapon.

original: yadi ca me bhadanta bhagavannime praṇidhānā yāvadbodhiparyantamupādāya saṃṛdhyeyuḥ yathā bhagavataḥ purataḥ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadi ca me bhadanta bhagavan ime praṇidhānāḥ yāvat bodhi paryantam upādāya saṃṛdhyeyuḥ yathā bhagavataḥ puratas praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, these aspirations of mine were to be fulfilled up to the end of enlightenment, as I have made the aspiration in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: tadubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ divyāścakraratnāḥ prādurbhavantu sahasrārāḥ sanābhikāḥ sanemikāḥ ādityavarṇaprabhāsvarāḥ /
analyzed: tat ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām divyāḥ cakra ratnāḥ prādurbhavantu sahasra arāḥ sa nābhikāḥ sa nemikāḥ āditya varṇa prabhāsvarāḥ
translated: then may these divine wheels with a thousand spokes, hubs, and rims, shining with the radiance of the color of gold, appear in both of my hands.

original: sahabhāṣitāyāṃ asyāṃ vāci amighena rājaputreṇobhāyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ tathārūpāṇi cakrāṇi prādurbhūtāni yathāyācitāḥ /
analyzed: saha bhāṣitāyām asyām vāci amighena rāja putreṇa ubhāyām pāṇibhyām tathārūpāṇi cakrāṇi prādurbhūtāni yathā yācitāḥ
translated: When this speech was spoken, two such wheels appeared in the hands of Prince Amiघa as were requested.

original: punarāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yāvadbodhiparyantena tadime cakrāḥ śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gacchantu /
analyzed: punar āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yāvat bodhi paryantena tat ime cakrāḥ śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gacchantu
translated: He said again, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope is fulfilled for me until enlightenment, then let these wheels go to the empty five-defiled Buddha-fields.

original: evaṃrūpeṇoccaśabdena yathā nandopanandā nāgarājā gacchanti tathā sarvāvantaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ svareṇa vijñāpayantu bodhisattvavyākaraṇasmṛtyasaṃpramoṣajñānadarśanaśūnyatābhāvanāpracārabuddhaviṣayaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ cārayituṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa ucca śabdena yathā nanda upanandāḥ nāga rājāḥ gacchanti tathā sarvāvantam buddhakṣetram svareṇa vijñāpayantu bodhisattva vyākaraṇa smṛti a saṃpramoṣa jñāna darśana śūnyatā bhāvanā pracāra buddha viṣayam dharmaparyāyam cārayitum
translated: Let them make known by such a loud sound as the Nandin and Upanandin Nagas go, let them make known by their voice the entire Buddha-field, in order to turn the Dharma discourse on the sphere of the Buddhas, the cultivation of emptiness, the knowledge and insight of the irreversible prediction of the Bodhisattvas.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā upapannāsteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ śrotrendriyeṣvayaṃ dharmaparyāyamābhāsamāgacchatu /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ upapannāḥ teṣām sarveṣām śrotra indriyeṣu ayam dharmaparyāyam ābhāsam āgacchatu
translated: And let this Dharma discourse appear in the ears of all those beings who have been reborn there.

original: nipatitamātre ca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ rāgaḥ praśamatu /
analyzed: nipatita mātre ca teṣām sattvānām rāgaḥ praśamatu
translated: And as soon as they fall, let the passion of those beings be calmed.

analyzed: dveṣaḥ mohaḥ māna īrṣyā mātsaryaḥ praśamatu
translated: Let hatred, delusion, pride, envy, and stinginess be calmed.

analyzed: sarva buddha anusmṛti manasikāreṇa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayantu
translated: They should arouse the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment with the mental attention of recollecting all the Buddhas.

original: preṣitau ca kulaputrāmighena rājaputreṇa tau dvau cakraratnau tau caivaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchatastadyathā buddhā bhagavanto buddhajavena gacchanti /
analyzed: preṣitau ca kulaputra amighena rāja putreṇa tau dvau cakra ratnau tau ca evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchataḥ tat yathā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ buddha javena gacchanti
translated: And, noble sons, having been sent by Prince Amiṭa, those two wheel-jewels went with such speed as the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, go with the speed of the Buddhas.

original: evameva tau dvau cakraratnau gacchataḥ daśasu diśāsvaprameyeśvasaṃkhyeyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā sattvānāṃ bodhisattvavyākaraṇasmṛtyasaṃpramoṣajñānāntargatābhāvanāpracārabuddhadharmaparyāyaṃ cārayanti /
analyzed: evam eva tau dvau cakra ratnau gacchataḥ daśasu diśāsu aprameya īśu asaṃkhyeyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā sattvānām bodhisattva vyākaraṇa smṛti asaṃpramoṣa jñāna antargata a bhāvanā pracāra buddha dharmaparyāyam cārayanti
translated: In the same way, those two wheel-jewels went to the five-turbidities Buddha-fields in the ten directions, which are immeasurable, incalculable, and innumerable, and having gone there, they caused the teaching of the Buddha-dharma, which is the practice of the meditation that is included in the knowledge of the non-forgetfulness of the prediction of enlightenment for beings, to be turned.

analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām ayam dharmaparyāyam śrotra indriyasya ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: And for those beings, this Dharma teaching came within the range of the ear faculty.

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ rāgo yāvan mātsaryacittacaitasikāḥ praśāntāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām rāgaḥ yāvat mātsarya citta caitasikāḥ praśāntāḥ
translated: For all of them, the mental states of passion up to miserliness were pacified.

original: sarve ca buddhajñānaviṣayaṃ manaskāreṇānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittānyutpāditavanto /
analyzed: sarve ca buddha jñāna viṣayam manaskāreṇa anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditavantaḥ
translated: And all of them aroused the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment with the mental attention of the sphere of the knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: muhūrtamātreṇa ca te cakrāḥ pratinivṛtyāmighasya rājaputrasya purataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: muhūrta mātreṇa ca te cakrāḥ pratinivṛtya amighasya rāja putrasya puratas sthitāḥ
translated: In just a moment, those wheels turned back and stood before Prince Amitābha.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ amighasya rājaputrasya sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ amighasya rāja putrasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave his approval to Prince Amitābha, saying:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Excellent, excellent, noble son!

analyzed: tvayā atīva śobhanaḥ praṇidhiḥ kṛta
translated: You have made an extremely beautiful aspiration.

original: ime ca divyāścakraratnāḥ śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣitā /
analyzed: ime ca divyāḥ cakra ratnāḥ śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣitāḥ
translated: And these divine wheel-jewels have been sent to the empty buddha-fields of the five degenerations.

analyzed: bahūni ca prāṇa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi akaluṣa cittāni avasthāpitāni
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings have been established with untainted minds.

analyzed: bodhau ca samādāpitāni
translated: And they have been inspired towards enlightenment.

analyzed: tena tvam kula putra akṣobhyaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, noble son, you should be called Akṣobhya.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam akṣobhyaḥ lokasya pariṇāyakaḥ
translated: You will be the guide of the world, Akṣobhya.

analyzed: gṛhṇa tvam akṣobhya buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāni yādṛṣāni ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Akṣobhya, take the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field as you wish.

original: akṣobhya āha tādṛśamahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhamākāṅkṣāmi yathā sarvalokasvarṇabhūrbhavet /
analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ āha tādṛśam aham bhadanta bhagavan buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham ākāṅkṣāmi yathā sarva loka svarṇa bhūḥ bhavet
translated: Akṣobhya said, Blessed One, I wish for a buddha-field with adornments like this: The entire world would be made of gold.

original: samāpāṇitalopamā divyamaṇiratnavyavakīrṇā apagataśarkarakaṭhallā apagataśilāstaṃbhapāṣāṇaparvatā mṛdukā kācalindikasukhasaṃsparṣā /
analyzed: sama apāṇi tala upamā divya maṇi ratna vyavakīrṇā apagata śarkara kaṭhallā apagata śilā staṃbha pāṣāṇa parvatā mṛdukā kāca lindika sukha saṃsparṣā
translated: It would be like the palm of a hand, strewn with divine precious jewels, free from gravel and pebbles, free from rocks, stumps, and rocky mountains, soft, with the pleasant touch of kācalindika.

analyzed: nikṣipte pāda tale iva namet utkṣipte pāda tale punar unnamet
translated: When the foot is placed down, it would sink in and when the foot is lifted up, it would rise again.

analyzed: na ca atra naraka tiryagyoni yama loka preta viṣayām prajñāyeyuḥ
translated: And there would be no realms of hell, animals, hungry ghosts, or the world of Yama to be known there.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre durgandhā bhāvā bhaveyuḥ /🔽divyātikrāntena gandhena tadbuddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre durgandhāḥ bhāvāḥ bhaveyuḥ  divya atikrāntena gandhena tat buddhakṣetram sphuṭam bhavet
translated: And in that buddha-field, there would be no foul odors.🔽That buddha-field would be filled with a fragrance surpassing that of the gods.

analyzed: divyaiḥ ca māndārava mahā māndāravaiḥ puṣpaiḥ tat buddhakṣetram ākīrṇam
translated: That buddha-field would be strewn with divine coral tree and great coral tree flowers.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ jarāvyādhimaraṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām jarā vyādhi maraṇam bhavet
translated: And there would be no old age, sickness, or death for the beings there.

original: na ca parasparabhayaṃ na ca parasparaviheṭhā na ca sattvānāmakālamaraṇaṃ vipratisāramaraṇaṃ nāsamāhitamaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: na ca paraspara bhayam na ca paraspara viheṭhā na ca sattvānām akāla maraṇam vipratisāra maraṇam na asamāhita maraṇam
translated: There would be no fear of each other, no mutual animosity, and the beings would not die an untimely death, a death filled with regret, or a death in a state of distraction.

analyzed: buddha anusmṛti manaskāreṇa tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: The beings there would be mindful of the Buddha.

analyzed: na ca durgatiṣu upapadyeyuḥ
translated: They would not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: na pañcakaṣāyeṣu śūnyesu buddhakṣetreṣūpapadyeyuryāvadbodhiparinirvāṇāt buddhadarśanāvirahitā bhaveyurdharmaśravaṇena saṅghopasthānenāvirahitā
analyzed: na pañca kaṣāyeṣu śūnyesu buddhakṣetreṣu upapadyeyuḥ yāvat bodhi parinirvāṇāt buddha darśana avirahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ dharma śravaṇena saṅgha upasthānena avirahitāḥ
translated: They would not be reborn in the five impure buddha-fields until the end of cyclic existence, until enlightenment and nirvana. They would never be separated from seeing the Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, from serving the Sangha.

analyzed: alpa rāgāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ alpa dveṣāḥ alpa mohāḥ
translated: The beings there would have little desire, little anger, and little ignorance.

original: sarve ca tatra daśakuśalāṃ karmapathān samādāya varteyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra daśa kuśalām karma pathān samādāya varteyuḥ
translated: All of them would take up and follow the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānāṃ śīlpagrahaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre sattvānām śīlpa grahaṇam bhavet
translated: In that buddha-field, beings would not have to learn crafts.

analyzed: na nāma nimittam
translated: There would be no names or signs.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ mārāvatāraṃ mārgena /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām māra avatāram mārgena
translated: There would be no way for beings there to be tempted by Mara.

original: na ca tatra sattvā durvarṇā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvāḥ durvarṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: The beings there would not have bad complexions.

original: na ca tatra sattvā vaimātra bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvāḥ vaimātra bhaveyuḥ
translated: The beings there would not be of different social classes,

analyzed: yat uta āryaḥ vā dāsaḥ vā
translated: such as noble, brahmin, merchant, or servant.

analyzed: amamāḥ aparigrahāḥ ca tatra sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: The beings there would be without possessions, without belongings.

original: na ca tatra śrāvakānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ vā śuklamokṣaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra śrāvakānām bodhisattvānām vā śukla mokṣaṇam bhavet
translated: There would be no expelling of shravakas or bodhisattvas there,

analyzed: antatas svapna antara gatānām api
translated: even if they were in a dream.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā dharmakāmā dharmaparyeṣṭiparā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ dharma kāmāḥ dharma paryeṣṭi parāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: All the beings there would be devoted to the Dharma and intent on seeking the Dharma.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetra ekasattvo'pi viparītadṛṣṭiko bhavet na cānyatīrthiko /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre eka sattvaḥ api viparīta dṛṣṭikaḥ bhavet na ca anya tīrthikaḥ
translated: And in that Buddha-field, not even one being would have wrong views, nor would there be any other non-Buddhist [views].

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ kāyaklamatā bhavet cittaklamatā vā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām kāya klama tā bhavet citta klama tā vā bhavet
translated: And there, the beings would not have any bodily fatigue or mental fatigue.

original: sarve ca te tatra sattvāḥ pañcābhijñā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te tatra sattvāḥ pañca abhijñāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all those beings there would have the five higher knowledges.

original: na ca tatra sattvānāṃ tṛṣṇā vā bhukṣā vā viheṭhayet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sattvānām tṛṣṇā vā bhukṣā vā viheṭhayet
translated: And there, the craving or hunger of the beings would not cause any harm.

original: yādṛśaṃ cāhāramākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśaṃ ratnabhājaneṣu purataḥ prādurbhavet yathā kāmāvacarāṇāṃ devānāṃ /
analyzed: yādṛśam ca āhāram ākāṅkṣeyuḥ tādṛśam ratna bhājaneṣu puratas prādurbhavet yathā kāmāvacarāṇām devānām
translated: Whatever kind of food they would desire, that would appear in front of them in jeweled vessels, just like for the gods in the desire realm.

original: na coccāraprasrāvakheṭasiṅghāṇamaśru vā kāye svedo vā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca uccāra prasrāva kheṭa siṅghāṇam aśru vā kāye svedaḥ vā bhavet
translated: And there would be no excrement, urine, mucus, phlegm, tears, or sweat in the body.

original: na ca tatra śītaṃ noṣṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra śītam na uṣṇam bhavet
translated: And there, it would not be cold or hot.

analyzed: sugandham ramaṇīyam bhavet
translated: It would be fragrant and delightful.

analyzed: mṛdu saṃsparśāḥ ca vāyavaḥ
translated: Gentle breezes would blow,

original: te ca tatra devamanuṣyāṇāṃ gandhakṛtyaṃ kurvīranyadākāṅkṣeyuḥ yādṛśamākāṅkṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca tatra deva manuṣyāṇām gandha kṛtyam kurvīran yat ākāṅkṣeyuḥ yādṛśam ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: and they would perform the function of fragrance for the gods and humans there, whenever they desired, whatever they desired.

analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ śītalam vāyum ākāṅkṣet
translated: If one desired a cool breeze,

analyzed: dvitīye uṣṇa
translated: a second one hot,

analyzed: apare utpala gandham vāyum ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: and another one a fragrant breeze,

analyzed: apare uraga sāra candana gandham vāyum
translated: Others [wish for] a breeze scented with uragasāra sandalwood.

analyzed: apare kālānusāri gandham  apare tagara gandham  aparegaru gandham
translated: Others [wish for] a breeze scented with kālānusārin.🔽Others [wish for] a breeze scented with tagara.🔽Others [wish for] a breeze scented with agaru.

analyzed: apare sarveṇa sarvam vāyunā ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: Others [wish for] a breeze scented with all fragrances.

analyzed: teṣām yathā citta utpādena ākṣiptam tathā saṃpadyet
translated: For them, it would be accomplished just as it was projected by the arising of the mind.

analyzed: evam apagata pañca kaṣāyā lokadhātuḥ bhavet
translated: In this way, the world-system would be free from the five degenerations.

original: tatra ca sattvānāṃ saptaratnamayāḥ kūṭāgārā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca sattvānām sapta ratna mayāḥ kūṭāgārāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And there, the multi-storied mansions of the seven precious substances would appear for the beings.

original: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu saptaratnamayāḥ paryaṅkāḥ stritāḥ tūlikopadhānairmṛdukācalindikasaṃsparśāḥ prādurbhaveyuryatra manuṣyā vihareyuḥ /
analyzed: teṣu ca kūṭāgāreṣu sapta ratna mayāḥ paryaṅkāḥ stritāḥ tūlikā upadhānaiḥ mṛduka acalindika saṃsparśāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ yatra manuṣyāḥ vihareyuḥ
translated: And in those multi-storied mansions, the couches made of the seven precious substances, with cushions of cotton, soft and smooth to the touch, would appear, where humans would dwell.

analyzed: samantataḥ ca kūṭāgāreṣu puṣkariṇī paripūrṇa aṣṭa aṅga upetena udakena prādurbhavet
translated: And all around the multi-storied mansions, lotus ponds filled with water endowed with the eight qualities would appear.

analyzed: yatra te sattvāḥ udakena udaka kāryam kuryuḥ
translated: Where those beings would perform their water-related activities with water.

analyzed: sumanā tālavṛkṣāṇām vā vṛkṣa āvalīḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Or rows of trees made of Sumana and Tāla trees would appear, adorned.

analyzed: nānā puṣpaiḥ nānā phalaiḥ nānā gandhaiḥ nānā vastraiḥ nānā chatraiḥ nānā muktikā āhāraiḥ nānā ābharaṇaiḥ te vṛkṣāḥ alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Those trees would be adorned with various flowers, various fruits, various fragrances, various garments, various parasols, various pearl necklaces, and various ornaments.

original: yathārūpā ca tatra sattvā vastrābharaṇaṃ ākāṅkṣeyuḥ te tān tebhyaḥ kalpavṛkṣebhyo gṛhītvā prāvareyuḥ /
analyzed: yathārūpā ca tatra sattvāḥ vastra ābharaṇam ākāṅkṣeyuḥ te tān tebhyaḥ kalpavṛkṣebhyaḥ gṛhītvā prāvareyuḥ
translated: And whatever form of clothing and ornaments the beings there would desire, they would take them from those wish-fulfilling trees and put them on.

analyzed: evam puṣpaiḥ yāvat ābharaṇām gṛhītvā bandheyuḥ
translated: In the same way, they would take flowers up to ornaments and put them on.

analyzed: sapta ratna mayaḥ ca me bodhivṛkṣaḥ bhavet
translated: And my Bodhi tree would be made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: yojana sahasram ucca tvena yojanam skandha pariṇāhena yojana sahasram śākhā pariṇāhena
translated: It would be one thousand yojanas high, with a circumference of one yojana, and one thousand yojanas in the spread of its branches.

original: vāyusamīritaśca tato bodhivṛkṣāddivyātikrāntaḥ snigdho manojñaḥ pāramitā abhijñendriyabalabodhyaṅgaśabdo niścaret /
analyzed: vāyu samīritaḥ ca tatas bodhivṛkṣāt divya atikrāntaḥ snigdhaḥ manojñaḥ pāramitā abhijñā indriya bala bodhyaṅga śabdaḥ niścaret
translated: And from that Bodhi tree, stirred by the wind, a sound surpassing that of the gods would come forth, pleasant to the mind, the sound of the perfections, the superknowledges, the faculties, the powers, and the factors of awakening.

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ śabdaṃ śṛṇuyuste virāgacittāḥ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam śabdam śṛṇuyuḥ te virāga cittāḥ smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And those beings who would hear that sound would attain non-attachment and mindfulness.

original: sarvaguṇopetaśca tatra buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmo bhavet tadyathā tuṣitadevanikāye'psarāḥ /
analyzed: sarva guṇa upetaḥ ca tatra buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmaḥ bhavet tat yathā tuṣita devanikāya ipsarāḥ
translated: And in that Buddha-field, the women would be endowed with all virtues, like the celestial nymphs in the Tuṣita host of gods.

original: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmo durgandho bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra mātṛgrāmaḥ durgandhaḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no foul smell from women there.

analyzed: na dvi jihve na īrṣyā mātsarya paricite
translated: Not in a double-tongued one, not in one familiar with envy and stinginess.

original: na ca tatra manuṣyā mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdhaṃ maithunakāyasaṃsargamāpadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra manuṣyāḥ mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdham maithuna kāya saṃsargam āpadyeyuḥ
translated: And there, humans should not engage in sexual intercourse with women.

analyzed: yasya ca tatra puruṣasya sa rāga cittam utpadyeta
translated: And for any man there, if a mind of passion arises,

original: gatvā mātṛgrāmaṃ sarāgena cittena prekṣate muhūrtena puruṣasya rāgaḥ praśāmyeta /
analyzed: gatvā mātṛgrāmam sa rāgena cittena prekṣate muhūrtena puruṣasya rāgaḥ praśāmyeta
translated: having gone to a woman, if he looks with a mind of passion, in an instant the man's passion would be pacified.

analyzed: mahatā udvegena ca prakramet
translated: And he would proceed with great anxiety.

analyzed: śubhavirajam ca samādhim pratilabheta
translated: And he would attain the pure and stainless concentration.

analyzed: tena ca samādhinā māra pāśebhyaḥ parimucyeyuḥ
translated: And by that concentration, they would be freed from the bonds of Māra.

analyzed: na ca bhūyas rakta cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And they would no longer give rise to a mind of passion.

original: yā ca tatra strī puruṣaṃ sarāgaṃ nirīkṣeta gurviṇī bhavet /
analyzed: yā ca tatra strī puruṣam sa rāgam nirīkṣeta gurviṇī bhavet
translated: And any woman there who would look with passion at a man, she would become pregnant.

original: nirīkṣitamātreṇa cobhayo rāgaḥ praśamet /🔽ye garbhavāsairdārakadārikā evaṃ kāyacaitasikaṃ sukhaṃ pratisaṃvedayeyuḥ /
analyzed: nirīkṣita mātreṇa ca ubhayoḥ rāgaḥ praśamet  ye garbha vāsaiḥ dāraka dārikāḥ evam kāya caitasikam sukham pratisaṃvedayeyuḥ
translated: And by merely being looked at, the passion of both would be pacified.🔽And those who are in the womb, boys and girls, would experience such physical and mental bliss.

original: tadyathā devāstrayastriṃśā nandanti pramodanti kāyacaitasikaṃ sukhaṃ pratisaṃvedayanti /
analyzed: tat yathā devāḥ trayastriṃśāḥ nandanti pramodanti kāya caitasikam sukham pratisaṃvedayanti
translated: Just as the Thirty-Three Gods rejoice and delight, experiencing physical and mental bliss.

original: evaṃrūpaśca tatra buddhakṣetre garbhavāsā dārakadārikāḥ saptarātriṃdivasāni sukhaṃ saṃvedayeyuḥ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ ca tatra buddhakṣetre garbha vāsāḥ dāraka dārikāḥ sapta rātriṃdivasāni sukham saṃvedayeyuḥ
translated: In that Buddha-field, boys and girls in the womb would experience happiness for seven nights and days.

original: tāśca striyo garbhiṇyaḥ evaṃrūpaṃ sukhaṃ pratisaṃvedayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca striyaḥ garbhiṇyaḥ evaṃrūpam sukham pratisaṃvedayeyuḥ
translated: And those pregnant women would experience such happiness.

analyzed: tat yathā dvitīya dhyāna saṃpannaḥ bhikṣuḥ
translated: Just as a monk endowed with the second dhyāna.

original: na ca te sattvā aśucinā garbhamalena kliśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca te sattvāḥ aśucinā garbha malena kliśyeyuḥ
translated: And those beings would not be afflicted by impure womb filth.

original: saptame ca divase paramasugandhena parameṇa ca sukhopadhānena samarpitāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: saptame ca divase parama sugandhena parameṇa ca sukha upadhānena samarpitāḥ pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: And on the seventh day, they would be born, endowed with the highest fragrance and the highest blissful touch.

original: na caiva sā strī duḥkhāṃ pratyanubhaved /
analyzed: na ca eva sā strī duḥkhām pratyanubhavet
translated: And that woman would not experience any suffering.

original: ubhau ca puṣkariṇīmavataritvā snātvā ca sā strī evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabheta /
analyzed: ubhau ca puṣkariṇīm avataritvā snātvā ca sā strī evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabheta
translated: Both of them would enter a lotus pond, bathe, and that woman would attain such mindfulness.

analyzed: yayā virāga śubham samādhim pratilabheta
translated: By which she would attain the concentration of passionless beauty.

analyzed: tena ca samādhinā māra karmaṇā parimucyeta
translated: And by that concentration, she would be liberated from the deeds of Māra.

analyzed: satata samāhitā bhavet
translated: She would always be in meditative concentration.

original: yacca pūrvajanmani tathārūpaṃ karmakṛtamupacitaṃ bhavedyena ca bahukalpakoṭīstrībhāvamanubhavitavyaṃ tena samādhinābhinirvṛtena strībhāvaṃ ca sarveṇa sarvaṃ parikṣayaṃ gacched /
analyzed: yat ca pūrva janmani tathārūpam karma kṛtam upacitam bhavet yena ca bahu kalpa koṭī strī bhāvam anubhavitavyam tena samādhinā abhinirvṛtena strī bhāvam ca sarveṇa sarvam parikṣayam gacchet
translated: And whatever karma in the form of deeds and accumulations there may be from previous births, by which one would experience the female state for many millions of eons, by the attainment of that samādhi, the female state would be completely exhausted,

original: yāvat parinirvāṇaṃ na bhūyaḥ strībhāvaṃ pratilabhet /
analyzed: yāvat parinirvāṇam na bhūyas strī bhāvam pratilabhet
translated: and one would not again obtain the female state until parinirvāṇa.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ tathārūpaṃ karmakṛtamupacitaṃ bhavet yad gaṇanātikrāntān kalpān nityagarbhavāsena pratyājāyeyurduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavitavyaṃ
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām tathārūpam karma kṛtam upacitam bhavet yat gaṇanā atikrāntān kalpān nitya garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ duḥkham pratyanubhavitavyam
translated: And for those beings who have created and accumulated karma such that they would be reborn in the womb for more than countless eons and experience suffering,

original: te bodhiprāptasya me nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ prasādaṃ ca pratilabheyuste tataścyavitvā mama buddhakṣetra upapadyeyurgarbhavāsena ca pratyājāyeyustatra sarveṇa sarvaṃ tatkarmaparikṣayaṃ gaccheyuryāvadbodhiparyantena na bhūyaste sattvā garbhavāsena pratyājāyeyurye sattvā avaruptakuśalamūlāste padmeṣu pratyājāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: te bodhi prāptasya me nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ prasādam ca pratilabheyuḥ te tatas cyavitvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ garbha vāsena ca pratyājāyeyuḥ tatra sarveṇa sarvam tad karma parikṣayam gaccheyuḥ yāvat bodhi paryantena na bhūyas te sattvāḥ garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ ye sattvāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ te padmeṣu pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: if they hear the name of me who has attained enlightenment and obtain faith, after passing away from there they would be reborn in my buddha field and be reborn in the womb. There, all that karma would be completely exhausted up to the end of enlightenment, and those beings would not again be reborn in the womb. Those beings who have planted the roots of virtue would be reborn in lotuses.

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ an avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ te garbha vāsena pratyājāyeyuḥ
translated: Those beings who have not planted the roots of virtue would be reborn in the womb.

original: karmaparikṣayena mama buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmo vā garbhavāso vā prajñāyeta ekāntasukhasamarpitāste sattvāstatra buddhakṣetre bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: karma parikṣayena mama buddhakṣetre mātṛgrāmaḥ vā garbha vāsaḥ vā prajñāyeta ekānta sukha samarpitāḥ te sattvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre bhaveyuḥ
translated: By the exhaustion of karma, in my Buddha-field, neither women nor the womb would be known. Those beings would be endowed with one-sided happiness in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: sumanā tālavṛkṣaiḥ vāyu samīritaiḥ evaṃrūpaḥ ramaṇīyaḥ nirghoṣaḥ niścaret duḥkham anityam anātma śūnya śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ
translated: From the trees of the Sumana flowers, when stirred by the wind, such a delightful sound would issue forth: the words 'suffering', 'impermanence', 'selflessness', and 'emptiness' would resound.

original: tena ca śabdena tatra manuṣyā ulkāvatīṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabheyustena ca samādhinā te sattvāḥ śūnyatāvabhāsāṃ gambhīrān dharmān avabudhyeyuḥ
analyzed: tena ca śabdena tatra manuṣyāḥ ulkāvatīm nāma samādhim pratilabheyuḥ tena ca samādhinā te sattvāḥ śūnyatā avabhāsām gambhīrān dharmān avabudhyeyuḥ
translated: By that sound, the humans there would attain the samadhi called 'full of stars'. By that samadhi, those beings would understand the profound dharmas that appear as emptiness.

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre kāmopasaṃhitaḥ śabdo bhavet /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre kāma upasaṃhitaḥ śabdaḥ bhavet
translated: And in that Buddha-field, there would be no sound connected with desire.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūlaniṣaṇṇaścāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan muhūrtenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ prāpnūyāṃ /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣa mūla niṣaṇṇaḥ ca aham bhadanta bhagavat muhūrtena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prāpnūyām
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, as soon as I sit at the foot of the Bodhi tree, I would attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me tatra buddhakṣetre na bhūyaścandrasūryāṇāṃ prabhā prajñāyeta /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me tatra buddhakṣetre na bhūyas candra sūryāṇām prabhā prajñāyeta
translated: And when I attain enlightenment, the light of the sun and moon would no longer be known in that Buddha-field.

analyzed: anyatra kusuma saṃkocanena
translated: Except for the closing of flowers.

original: evaṃrūpāṃ cāhaṃ prabhāṃ pramuñceyaṃ yena divyena cakṣuṣāprameyāsaṃkhyeyairanyairbuddhakṣetraistiṣṭhato buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpām ca aham prabhām pramuñceyam yena divyena cakṣuṣā aprameya asaṃkhyeyaiḥ anyaiḥ buddhakṣetraiḥ tiṣṭhataḥ buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyam
translated: And may I emit such radiance that with that divine eye I may see the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in immeasurable and incalculable other Buddha-fields.

original: bodhiprāptaścāhamevaṃrūpeṇa svareṇa dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ yena svareṇa trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ buddhakṣetramāpūrayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham evaṃrūpeṇa svareṇa dharmam deśayeyam yena svareṇa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram buddhakṣetram āpūrayeyam
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may I teach the Dharma with such a voice that it fills the Buddha-field of a thousand million worlds.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ syuḥ te sarve buddhānusmṛtiṃ pratilabheyuste yena yena gaccheyuḥ caṃkrameyurniṣīdeyurvā parivarteyurvā /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ syuḥ te sarve buddha anusmṛtim pratilabheyuḥ te yena yena gaccheyuḥ caṃkrameyuḥ niṣīdeyuḥ vā parivarteyuḥ vā
translated: And all the beings there may attain the recollection of the Buddha, and wherever they go, whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down,

original: te satatasamitaṃ māṃ paśyeyuryathārūpeṣu dharmeṣu dharmasaṃśayā bhaveyuḥ teṣāṃ mama darśanamātreṇa vyavalokanamātreṇa ca teṣāṃ saṃśayā vigaccheyuḥ
analyzed: te satata samitam mām paśyeyuḥ yathārūpeṣu dharmeṣu dharma saṃśayāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām mama darśana mātreṇa vyavalokana mātreṇa ca teṣām saṃśayāḥ vigaccheyuḥ
translated: may they always see me, and whatever doubts they may have regarding the Dharma, by merely seeing me and merely beholding me, may their doubts be removed.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me ye sattvā daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vānuttarayānikā vā mama nāmaṃ vā varṇaṃ va śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me ye sattvāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā anuttara yānikāḥ vā mama nāmam vā varṇam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, may those beings in the immeasurable and incalculable buddha-fields in the ten directions who are in the Śrāvakayāna, Pratyekabuddhayāna, or unsurpassed vehicle hear my name or praise,

analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: and after passing away from there, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

original: te tatra mama dharmaṃ śrutvā ye śrāvakayānikāste'ṣṭavimokṣadhyāyino'rhanto bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te tatra mama dharmam śrutvā ye śrāvaka yānikāḥ teṣṭa vimokṣa dhyāyinoḥ hantaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: There, having heard my Dharma, those in the Śrāvakayāna may become arhats who meditate on the eight liberations.

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhayānikāḥ te pratyekāṃ bodhimabhigaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ te pratyekām bodhim abhigaccheyuḥ
translated: And those in the Pratyekabuddhayāna may attain individual enlightenment.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvā mahāyānikāste mat sakāśāddharmaṃ śrutvā gambhīrāṃ samādhikṣāntidhāraṇīṃ ca pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ mahāyānikāḥ te mat sakāśāt dharmam śrutvā gambhīrām samādhi kṣānti dhāraṇīm ca pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas in the Mahāyāna, having heard the Dharma from me, may attain the profound meditative absorption, patience, and dhāraṇīs.

analyzed: te tatra eva a vaivartikāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: There, they may become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: aprameyaśca me śrāvakasaṅgho bhaved yo na śakyaṃ kenacidgaṇayituṃ anyatra svayaṃ tathāgatena /
analyzed: aprameyaḥ ca me śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet yaḥ na śakyam kenacid gaṇayitum anyatra svayam tathāgatena
translated: And may my assembly of śrāvakas be immeasurable, such that no one can count them except the Tathāgata himself.

original: bodhiprāptaścāhaṃ yena yena gaccheyaṃ yatra yatra ca pādatalena pṛthivīṃ spṛśeyaṃ tatra tatra sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni suvarṇāvabhāsāni prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham yena yena gaccheyam yatra yatra ca pāda talena pṛthivīm spṛśeyam tatra tatra sahasra patrāṇi padmāni suvarṇa avabhāsāni prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, wherever I go and wherever I touch the ground with the soles of my feet, there may lotuses with thousand-petals appear, shining with gold.

original: te ca padmāḥ śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā mama varṇaśabdaṃ ghoṣaṃ niścārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca padmāḥ śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā mama varṇa śabdam ghoṣam niścārayeyuḥ
translated: And may those lotuses go to empty buddha-fields and emit the sound of my name and praise.

original: te ca sattvā mama nāma varṇaṃ yaśaśca śrutvā prītiprasādaprāmodyamutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ mama nāma varṇam yaśaḥ ca śrutvā prīti prasāda prāmodyam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And may those beings, having heard the sound of my name and praise, generate joy, faith, and delight.

analyzed: te prasāda jātāḥ mama buddhakṣetre upapattim ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: Having generated faith, may they aspire to be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: tatra ca tāni kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayeyuḥ
translated: And may they dedicate those roots of virtue there.

analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā mama buddhakṣetre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: Having passed away from there, may they be reborn in my buddha-field.

analyzed: apagata śramaṇa malaḥ ca me śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: And may my assembly of disciples be free from the impurities of ascetics,

original: apagataśramaṇavākyāpagataśramaṇakauṭilyāpagataśramaṇaśāṭhyā apagataparṣā bhaveddharmagurukā na pariṣkāragurukā na lābhasatkāragurukā /
analyzed: apagata śramaṇa vākya apagata śramaṇa kauṭilya apagata śramaṇa śāṭhyā apagata parṣā bhavet dharma gurukā na pariṣkāra gurukā na lābha satkāra gurukā
translated: free from the words of ascetics, free from the crookedness and deceit of ascetics, and free from the assemblies, taking the Dharma as their teacher, not taking material things as their teacher, not taking gain and honor as their teacher.

original: anityaduḥkhānātmaśūnyatābhiratā ārabdhavīryā ca sā parṣadbhaveddharmaśravaṇā saṅghaprāgbhārā /
analyzed: anitya duḥkha anātma śūnyatā abhiratāḥ ārabdha vīryā ca sā parṣad bhavet dharma śravaṇā saṅgha prāgbhārā
translated: The assembly would delight in the emptiness of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and be energetic, and would listen to the Dharma, with the Saṅgha at the forefront.

original: ye ca tatrāvaivartikā bodhisattvā bhaveyuste'nāgatapraviṣṭāḥ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyuste jātivyativṛttā prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāṃ kathāṃ kathayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra avaivartikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ tena āgata praviṣṭāḥ smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ te jāti vyativṛttā prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktām kathām kathayeyuḥ
translated: And those irreversible bodhisattvas there, having entered the future, would attain mindfulness. Having passed beyond birth, they would speak a discourse connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantena te dharmā na saṃpramoṣaṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhi paryantena te dharmāḥ na saṃpramoṣam gaccheyuḥ
translated: Up to the end of enlightenment, those dharmas would not be forgotten.

analyzed: yāvat bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham daśa mahā kalpa sahasrāṇi tiṣṭheyam
translated: And I would remain for ten thousand great eons, up to the attainment of enlightenment.

analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me kalpa sahasram saddharmaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for a thousand eons after my parinirvāṇa, the true Dharma would remain.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, good man!

analyzed: pariśuddham te buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: You have taken up a pure buddha-field.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvamakṣobhyānāgate'dhvani atikrānte hyekasmin gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeya'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyāṃ diśi /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam akṣobhya anāgata idhvani atikrānte hi ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya anupraviṣṭe dvitīye purastimāyām diśi
translated: In the future, Akshobhya, after one asaṃkhyeya eon equal to the sands of the Ganges has passed, and you have entered the second, in the eastern direction,

analyzed: atas sahasrime buddhakṣetrebhiratiḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: from here, in the thousandth buddha-field, there will be a world system named Abhirati.

original: evaṃrūpayā guṇavyūhayā saṃpannā yathā tvayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpayā guṇa vyūhayā saṃpannā yathā tvayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have accomplished such a form of the array of qualities as you have made aspirations.

analyzed: tatra tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There you will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evamevākṣobhyo nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: evam eva akṣobhyaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be called Akshobhya, a Tathagata, up to a Buddha, a Bhagavan.

original: akṣobhya āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tatsarvatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ skandhadhātvāyatanaparigṛhītā ye ca sattvāḥ sattvasaṃgraheṇa saṃgṛhītāste sarve maitracittā bhavantvavairacittā akaluṣacittāste evaṃrūpaṃ kāyasukhaṃ saṃvedayeyuḥ tadyathāpi nāma daśabhūmisthitasya bodhisattvasya padmasamādhiṃ samāpannasya yenāśayaprahāṇaviśuddhirbhavati /
analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat sarvatra lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ skandha dhātu āyatana parigṛhītāḥ ye ca sattvāḥ sattva saṃgraheṇa saṃgṛhītāḥ te sarve maitra cittāḥ bhavantu avaira cittāḥ akaluṣa cittāḥ te evaṃrūpam kāya sukham saṃvedayeyuḥ tat yathā api nāma daśa bhūmi sthitasya bodhisattvasya padma samādhim samāpannasya yena āśaya prahāṇa viśuddhiḥ bhavati
translated: Akshobhya said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, then in all the world systems, the beings included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and those beings included in the category of beings, may all of them have loving minds, non-hostile minds, and unpolluted minds. May they experience such a form of bodily bliss, just as a Bodhisattva dwelling on the tenth stage experiences when absorbed in the lotus samadhi, by which there is purity of abandonment according to one's intention.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa sattvāḥ kāyacaitasikena sukhena samārpitā bhavantu /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa sattvāḥ kāya caitasikena sukhena samārpitāḥ bhavantu
translated: May beings be endowed with such a form of mental and physical bliss.

original: yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandeta tadā sarvapṛthivī svarṇāvabhāsā bhavatu /
analyzed: yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandeta tadā sarva pṛthivī svarṇa avabhāsā bhavatu
translated: When I pay homage to the Blessed One's feet with the five points of my body, may the entire earth then appear golden.

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā ca tasmin samaye sarvasattvā evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitā yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā ca tasmin samaye sarva sattvāḥ evaṃrūpeṇa sukhena samarpitāḥ yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And when that noble one bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, at that time all beings were endowed with such happiness as they had wished for.

analyzed: tadā dharaṇī sarvā svarṇa avabhāsā dṛśyate
translated: Then the entire earth appeared to be shining with gold.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara mate akṣobhya
translated: Rise, O best of minds, O Akṣobhya,

analyzed: cakra saṃsthita kara tala pravara cakra
translated: Established in the wheel, with palms like the best of wheels.

analyzed: sthāpitā bahu tṛṣṇā karuṇa citte
translated: Many cravings are established in the mind of compassion.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam śubha mati jagati śāstā
translated: You will become the teacher in the world, O good-minded one.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo daśamaṃ rājaputraṃ himaṇiṃ nāmāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ daśamam rāja putram himaṇim nāma āmantrayate sma
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Sāgaramegha addressed the tenth prince named Himaṇi:

original: peyālaṃ himaṇī rājaputra evaṃrūpaṃ praṇidhānamakārṣīt tadyathākṣobhyena kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam himaṇiḥ rāja putraḥ evaṃrūpam praṇidhānam akārṣīt tat yathā akṣobhyena kṛtam
translated: The prince Himaṇi made a similar aspiration as Akṣobhya had made.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan nevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tatsarvasattvā buddhālaṃbanamanaskāraṃ pratilabhantu /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavat na evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat sarva sattvāḥ buddha ālaṃbana manaskāram pratilabhantu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then may all beings obtain the mental attention focused on the Buddha.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca uraga sāra candana gandhaḥ haste prādurbhavatu
translated: And may the fragrance of uragasāra sandalwood appear in the hands of all.

original: te ca sarve taṃ gandhaṃ buddhavigraheṣu pariṇāmayantu /
analyzed: te ca sarve tam gandham buddha vigraheṣu pariṇāmayantu
translated: And may they all transform that fragrance into the forms of Buddhas.

analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, son of noble family!

analyzed: udāram te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have made a vast aspiration.

original: yacca tvayā sarvasattvā uragasāracandanahastā sthāpitā buddhamanaskāraścāśayenotpāditaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca tvayā sarva sattvāḥ uraga sāra candana hastā sthāpitā buddha manaskāraḥ ca āśayena utpāditaḥ
translated: And since you have established all beings with hands of uragasāra sandalwood and have given rise to the mental activity of the Buddha with a pure intention,

analyzed: tena tvam kula putra gandhahastiḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: therefore, son of noble family, you should be called Gandhahastin.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ gandhahaste'tikrāntānāṃ gaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ avaśiṣṭe dvitīye nadīgaṅgāvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'kṣobhye tathāgate'rhati samyaksaṃbuddhe parinirvṛte saddharme'ntarhite saptame dviase tvaṃ gandhahaste tatra lokadhātāvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam gandha hasta itikrāntānām gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye nadī gaṅgā vālikā sama isaṃkhyeya ikṣobhye tathāgateḥ hati samyaksaṃbuddhe parinirvṛte saddharme antarhite saptame tvam gandha haste tatra lokadhātau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: Gandhahastin, after innumerable eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River have passed, in the second remaining innumerable eon equal to the sands of the Ganges River, in the Akṣobhya Tathāgata, Arhat, Samyaksaṃbuddha, after the parinirvāṇa of the true Dharma has disappeared, in the seventh two-part eon, Gandhahastin, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that world system.

original: suvarṇapuṣpo nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: suvarṇapuṣpaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be called Suvarṇapuṣpa, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, up to the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: gandhahastirapyāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tadyadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandeyaṃ tadā sarvasminnārāme campakapuṣpavarṣaṃ pravarṣatu /
analyzed: gandhahastiḥ api āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandeyam tadā sarvasmin ārāme campaka puṣpa varṣam pravarṣatu
translated: Gandhahastin also said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then when I pay homage to the Blessed One's feet with my five limbs, may a rain of champaka flowers fall in the entire park.

original: yadā khalu kulaputra gandhahastirbodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvasminnārāme campakapuṣpavarṣamabhiprāvarṣat
analyzed: yadā khalu kula putra gandhahastiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvasmin ārāme campaka puṣpa varṣam abhiprāvarṣat
translated: Then, noble son, when the bodhisattva Gandhahastin paid homage to the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha with his five limbs, a rain of champaka flowers fell in the entire park.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha pravara guṇa sugandha cittā
translated: Rise, you of supreme qualities, with a fragrant mind,

analyzed: varṣitaḥ imi vara campaka puṣpāḥ
translated: This rain of excellent champaka flowers has fallen.

analyzed: darśaya śubha patha vara praṇītam
translated: Show the excellent and sublime path of goodness,

analyzed: sthāpaya bahujagam abhaye pāre
translated: And establish the many beings on the other shore beyond fear.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇa ekādaśamaṃ rājaputraṃ siṃhaṃ nāmāmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ekādaśamam rāja putram siṃham nāma āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrareņu addressed the eleventh prince named Simha:

analyzed: peyālam yathā gandhahastinā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The same as before, up to when the aspiration was made by Gandhahastin.

analyzed: ratnagarbhāya tathāgatāya ratna mayam dhvajam niryātitam
translated: The jeweled banner was offered to the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, Excellent, excellent, good man!

analyzed: ratnaketuḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: You should be called Ratnaketu.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ ratnaketo'nāgate'dhvani atikrānte gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'vaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye tatrābhiratyāṃ lokadhātau parinirvṛte svarṇapuṣpe tathāgate tasya ca saddharme'ntarhite trayāṇāṃ antarakalpānāmatyayena tadbuddhakṣetraṃ jayasomaṃ nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam ratnaketo nāgata idhvani atikrānte gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya iva śiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye tatra abhiratyām lokadhātau parinirvṛte svarṇapuṣpe tathāgate tasya ca saddharme antarhite trayāṇām antara kalpānām atyayena tat buddhakṣetram jayasomam nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future, after an innumerable eon equal to the sands of the Ganges has passed, in the second innumerable eon equal to the sands of the Ganges that remains, in the Abhirati world system, when the Tathagata Suvarnapuspa has passed into parinirvana and his true Dharma has disappeared, after the passing of three intermediate kalpas, that buddha-field will be called Jayasoma.

original: tatra tvamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase nāgavinarditeśvaraghoṣo nāma bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: tatra tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase nāgavinarditeśvaraghoṣaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: There you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and you will be called Nagavinarditesvaraghoṣa, up to being a buddha, a bhagavat.

original: evaṃrūpaṃ te buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati buddhakṣetre guṇavyūhena yathākṣobhyasya tathāgatasya /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam te buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati buddhakṣetre guṇa vyūhena yathā akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya
translated: Your buddha-field will be like this, with the array of qualities of a buddha-field as in the buddha-field of the Tathagata Akshobhya.

original: ratnaketurāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpāśā paripūryeta tadyadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pādau vande tadā sarvasattvā evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ratnaketuḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpa āśā paripūryeta tat yadā aham bhagavataḥ pādau vande tadā sarva sattvāḥ evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: Ratnaketu said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this wish of mine is to be fulfilled, then when I bow at the feet of the Blessed One, may all beings attain such mindfulness.

original: yathā bodhisattvā ye mahābodhiṃ saṃprasthitāḥ sarvasattvānāmarthāya karuṇāyamānāḥ saṃbodhau prasthitā na nivarteyuḥ /
analyzed: yathā bodhisattvāḥ ye mahā bodhim saṃprasthitāḥ sarva sattvānām arthāya karuṇāyamānāḥ saṃbodhau prasthitāḥ na nivarteyuḥ
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas who have set out for great enlightenment, out of compassion for all beings, have set out for complete enlightenment and do not turn back,

original: evameva kulaputra ratnaketurbodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau vanditvā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra ratnaketuḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau vanditvā
translated: in the same way, noble sir, the bodhisattva Ratnaketu, having bowed at the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha,

original: evameva sattvā evaṃrūpāṃ smṛtiṃ pratilabdhavanto yaduta karuṇācittāḥ sarvasattvāḥ sthāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva sattvāḥ evaṃrūpām smṛtim pratilabdhavantaḥ yat uta karuṇā cittāḥ sarva sattvāḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: in the same way, beings have attained such mindfulness, namely, all beings have been established with minds of compassion.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato ratnaketuṃ bodhisattvamāha
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ratnaketum bodhisattvam āha
translated: Then, noble sir, the Tathagata Ratnagarbha said to the bodhisattva Ratnaketu,

analyzed: uttiṣṭha dhairya sumate parama rūpa
translated: Rise up, O resolute one of good mind, of supreme form,

analyzed: pratijñā
translated: for the sake of beings, you have made a vow of great firmness.

analyzed: sthāpayasi bahu jana viraja citte
translated: You establish many people with stainless minds,

analyzed: bhaviṣyase nara varaḥ pravara buddhaḥ
translated: you will become the best of men, the supreme Buddha.

analyzed: evam peyālam
translated: Thus it is to be continued.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ caturaśītibhiḥ koṭṭarāja sahasraiḥ pṛthak pṛthak viśiṣṭam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And all the eighty-four thousand minor kings made separate excellent vows.

analyzed: pṛthak pṛthaḥ ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: And they each accepted the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field.

translated: And all were prophesied by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: anyonyeṣu lokadhātuṣu eka kāle bodhim prāpsyanti
translated: In other worlds, they will attain enlightenment at the same time.
