analyzed: evam eva tribhiḥ prāṇa koṭibhiḥ pṛthak pṛthak praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In the same way, three koṭis of people each made separate vows.

analyzed: pṛthak pṛthaḥ ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ ca parigṛhītāḥ
translated: And they each accepted the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field.

original: sarve ca ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarve ca ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all were prophesied by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evameva yūyamapyekakāle'nyonyeṣu lokadhātuṣvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyadhve //🔽atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyāśītiputrā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya bhrātaraḥ /
analyzed: evam eva yūyam api ekakālenyonyeṣu lokadhātuṣu anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyadhve  atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya aśīti putrāḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya bhrātaraḥ
translated: In the same way, you will all at the same time attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in other worlds.🔽Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu had eighty sons, brothers of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: teṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ samudreśvarabhuviḥ nāma māṇavaḥ
translated: The eldest was a young brahmin named Samudresvarabhuvi.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaḥ samudreśvarabhuviṃ māṇavaṃ āmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ samudra īśvara bhuvim māṇavam āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed the maṇḍala holder Samudreśvarabhuvi:

original: pratigṛhāṇa tvaṃ māṇava pariśuddhāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ /🔽samudreśvarabhuvirmāṇavāha tvaṃ tāvattāta prathamataraṃ siṃhanādaṃ nadasva /
analyzed: pratigṛhāṇa tvam māṇava pariśuddhām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām  samudreśvara bhuviḥ māṇava āha tvam tāvat tāta prathamataram siṃhanādam nadasva
translated: Maṇḍala holder, accept the pure qualities of the Buddha-field.🔽Samudreśvarabhuvi, you, son, should first roar the lion's roar.

original: samudrareṇurāha tvaṃ tāvat putra praṇidhānaṃ kuruṣva /
analyzed: samudrareṇuḥ āha   tvam tāvat putra praṇidhānam kuruṣva
translated: Samudrarenu said, You, son, should first make a vow.

analyzed: paścāt aham praṇidhānam kariṣye
translated: Then I will make a vow.

original: sa āha kiṃ tāvat pariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pratigṛhṇāmyutāhosvidapariśuddhaṃ / /
analyzed: saḥ āha kim tāvat pariśuddham buddhakṣetram pratigṛhṇāmi uta āhosvit apariśuddham
translated: He said, Should I accept a pure Buddha-field or an impure one?

original: agrapurohita āha ye mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatā bodhisattvāste kliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇanti /
analyzed: agra purohitaḥ āha ye mahā karuṇā samanvāgatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ te kliṣṭam buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇanti
translated: The chief priest said, Those bodhisattvas who are endowed with great compassion accept a defiled Buddha-field.

analyzed: kliṣṭa āśayām viparīta dṛṣṭikām sattvān vaineyān pratigṛhṇanti
translated: They accept to guide beings with defiled intentions and inverted views.

analyzed: yathā punar tvam māṇava svam jāniṣe
translated: As you, Maṇḍala holder, know for yourself.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudreśvarabhuvirmāṇavako yena ratnagarbhas tathāgatastenopasamakrāmadupasaṃkramya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ sthitvaivamāha evamahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimākāṅkṣāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudreśvara bhuviḥ māṇavakaḥ yena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasamakrāmat upasaṃkramya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sthitvā evam āha evam aham bhadanta bhagavan anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: Then, noble sir, the boy Ocean-Master-of-Wealth went to the Tathāgata Ratna-Garbha. Having approached him, he stood in front of the Tathāgata Ratna-Garbha and said this: “Thus, reverend Lord, I desire the highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām pravarām bodhim spṛśeyam
translated: In an age of beings eighty thousand years old, I will attain the supreme enlightenment.

original: yathaitarhi bhagavan sattvā mandarāgā mandadveṣā mandamohā udvignāśayāḥ saṃsāre bhayadoṣadarśinastathā tatra buddhakṣetre sattvā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yathā etarhi bhagavan sattvāḥ manda rāgāḥ manda dveṣāḥ manda mohāḥ udvigna āśayāḥ saṃsāre bhaya doṣa darśinaḥ tathā tatra buddhakṣetre sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Just as now, reverend Lord, beings are of little desire, of little hatred, of little delusion, of anxious disposition, seeing the danger in the round of rebirths, in the same way, in that Buddha-field, beings will be like that.

analyzed: yatra aham abhisaṃbuddhā iyam
translated: Where I will attain supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: te ca mama antike pravrajeyuḥ
translated: And they will go forth under me.

analyzed: tribhiḥ ca yānaiḥ aham sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: And I will teach the Dharma to beings by means of the three vehicles.

original: yadi bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tad vyākarotu māṃ bhagavānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yadi bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat vyākarotu mām bhagavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If, reverend Lord, this kind of hope is fulfilled, then may the Lord prophesy to me the highest complete enlightenment.”

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavānāgate'dhvani atikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye utpalasantīraṇe kalpe cāturdvīpikā baliṣṭhā nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇava anāgata idhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya inupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye utpala santīraṇe kalpe cāturdvīpikā baliṣṭhā nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, You will become a Buddha in the future, after an incalculable aeon has passed, when the second incalculable aeon has almost ended, in the aeon called Utpalasantirana. The world will be called Balistha.

analyzed: imam buddhakṣetram aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām bodhim abhiprapsyasi
translated: In this Buddha-field, when the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years, you will attain enlightenment.

original: ratnakūṭo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: ratnakūṭaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will become the Tathagata called Ratnakūṭa, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: sa āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadiha sarvatrārāme lohitamuktiḥ pravarṣatu /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat iha sarvatra ārāme lohita muktiḥ pravarṣatu
translated: He said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then let a rain of red pearls fall everywhere in this pleasure grove,

analyzed: sarva vṛkṣebhyaḥ ca pañcāṅgikam tūryam niścaratu
translated: and let the sound of the five-part music resound from all the trees.

original: yadā ca kulaputra samudreśvarabhuvirmāṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatrārāme lohitamuktimayavarṣaṃ
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra samudreśvara bhuviḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra ārāme lohita mukti maya varṣam
translated: Then, noble sir, when the young brahmin Samudradatta bowed his head to the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, a rain of red pearls fell everywhere in the pleasure grove,

analyzed: sarva vṛkṣebhyaḥ ca pañcāṅgikam tūryam niścaritam
translated: and the sound of the five-part music resounded from all the trees.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha akṣaya prajñā koṣā
translated: Rise, O you of supreme strength, O inexhaustible treasury of wisdom,
Compassionate towards beings, wishing for their welfare, with a loving mind,

analyzed: abhiprāya tubhya paripūryatu śuddha
translated: May your intention be fulfilled, O pure one,

analyzed: sattvāna arthakaru bheṣyasi buddha loke
translated: You will be one who benefits beings, a Buddha in the world.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ ca brāhmaṇasya putraḥ saṃbhavaḥ nāma
translated: The second son of the brāhmaṇa, named Sambhava,

analyzed: saḥ evam vadati yathā samudreśvara bhuviḥ
translated: said the same as Samudreśvarabhuvi.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha tvamapi māṇavotpalasantīraṇe kalpo'syāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ lokadhātau baliṣṭhe buddhakṣetre vardhamānāśītivarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ vairocanakusumo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha tvam api māṇavotpalasantīraṇe cāturdvīpikāyām lokadhātau baliṣṭhe buddhakṣetre vardhamāna aśīti varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām vairocanakusumaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said, You too, young brahmin, in the eon called Utpalasantiraṇa, in this world system of four continents, in the powerful Buddha-field, among the people who live for eighty thousand years, will become the Tathāgata named Vairocana-kusuma, up to being the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: peyālaṃ / tṛtīyastvāha dvivarṣasahasrasya jyotigandho nāma bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: peyālam tṛtīyaḥ tu āha dvi varṣa sahasrasya jyotigandhaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The rest is the same. The third one said, For two thousand years, I will be named Jyotigandha, up to being the Blessed One, the Buddha.

analyzed: vyākaraṇam peyālam
translated: The prediction is the same as before.

original: evaṃ sumanastathāgataḥ śailarājā saṃvṛtalocano brahmottaro jambūcchāyaḥ pūrṇamuttaro ratnaśailaḥ samudragarbho nārāyaṇaḥ śikhī kanakamunirmunīndraḥ kauṇḍinyaḥ siṃhavikramo jñānadhvajo buddhaśravo'parājito vikasitojjayo hiteṣī prajñāvabhāso mahendraḥ śāntaprajñākaro nando nyagrodharājaḥ kanakalocanaḥ sahitaḥ sūryanandiḥ ratnaśikhī sumetro brahmaḥ sundo brahmarṣabhaḥ praṇādo dharmacandraḥ arthadarśī yaśonandī yaśottaraḥ abhirūpaḥ sugandhaścaturaḥ pravaralocanaḥ sunijastaḥ sārthavrataḥ sumanoratho varaprajñaḥ kanakadhvajaḥ sunetro devaśuddhaḥ śuddhodanaḥ sudarśanaḥ virūḍhadhvajo virūpākṣo brahmasvaraḥ śrīsaṃbhavaḥ śrīmahāvirajo maṇibhadraḥ mārīciḥ śākyamunirghoṣeśvaraḥ satyasaṃbhavaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ saṃbhavapuṣpaḥ sukusumaḥ akṣobhyaḥ sūryagarbho ratīśvaro nāgadanto vajraprabhāsaḥ kīrtirājā vyāghraraśmiḥ sanetyajñānasaṃbhavaḥ gandhasvaraḥ sālendraḥ nārāyaṇagataḥ jyotigarbhaḥ yastu tatra kulaputra sarvapaścimakaḥ purohitaputraḥ vigatabhyasaṃtāpo nāma /
analyzed: evam sumanaḥ tathāgataḥ śaila rājā saṃvṛta locanaḥ brahmottaraḥ jambūcchāyaḥ pūrṇamuttaraḥ ratnaśailaḥ samudragarbhaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ śikhī kanakamuniḥ munīndraḥ kauṇḍinyaḥ siṃhavikramaḥ jñānadhvajaḥ buddha śrava uparājitaḥ vikasita ujjayaḥ hita iṣī prajñāvabhāsaḥ mahendraḥ śānta prajñākaraḥ nandaḥ nyagrodha rājaḥ kanakalocanaḥ sahitaḥ sūryanandiḥ ratnaśikhī sumetraḥ brahmaḥ sundaḥ brahmarṣabhaḥ praṇādaḥ d
translated: Thus, the Tathagata Sumanas, the King of Mountains, the One with Covered Eyes, the Supreme Brahma, the Shade of the Rose Apple Tree, the Completely Supreme, the Jewel Mountain, the Womb of the Ocean, Narayana, the One with the Crest, the Sage of Gold, the Lord of Sages, Koundinya, the One with the Courage of a Lion, the Banner of Wisdom, the Buddha's Renown, the Unconquered, the Blooming, the Victorious, the Benefactor, the Light of Wisdom, the Great Indra, the One who Brings Peace and Wisdom, the Happy One, the King of the Nyagrodha Tree, the Golden-Eyed, the Accompanied, the Sun's Delight, the Jewel-Crested, the Good Friend, the Brahma, the Beautiful, the Brahma Bull, the Proclaimer, the Dharma Moon, the One who Sees the Meaning, the Joy of Fame, the Supreme Fame, the Handsome, the Fragrant, the Four, the Supreme Eyes, the Well-Born, the One with the Vow of a Caravan Leader, the One with Good Wishes, the One with Excellent Wisdom, the Golden Banner, the Well-Eyed, the Pure God, the Pure Nourishment, the Well-Seen, the One with the Banner of Firmness, the Disfigured-Eyed, the Brahma-Voiced, the One Arisen from Glory, the Glorious Great Dustless, the Jewel-Blessed, the Marici, the Sage of the Shakyas, the Lord of Sounds, the One Arisen from Truth, the Best,

analyzed: sa ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purutas sthitvā āha
translated: He stood in front of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and said:

original: ime bhadanta bhagavannekonāśītirmāṇavakāḥ sarve vyākṛtā utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe vardhamānadvaye'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: ime bhadanta bhagavan ekonāśītiḥ māṇavakāḥ sarve vyākṛtāḥ utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe vardhamāna dvayena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: Venerable Blessed One, these seventy-nine young men are all prophesied to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the second Bhadrakalpa, in the Utpalāsaṃbhava eon.

analyzed: utpādayāmi aham bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Blessed One, I too generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: kṣīyamāṇe bhadanta bhagavannutpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe sarvapaścimako'haṃ varāgrabodhiṃ spṛśeyaṃ /
analyzed: kṣīyamāṇe bhadanta bhagavan utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe sarva paścima koham vara agra bodhim spṛśeyam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, in the Utpalāsaṃbhava eon, when it is coming to an end, may I, as the very last, touch the supreme enlightenment.

original: yāntakaṃ teṣāmekonāśītīnāṃ buddhānāmāyuḥpramāṇaṃ tāntakaṃ mamaikasya bodhiprāptasya bhavet /
analyzed: yā antakam teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām āyuḥ pramāṇam tā antakam mama ekasya bodhi prāptasya bhavet
translated: May my lifespan as the one who has attained enlightenment be equal to the lifespan of those seventy-nine Buddhas.

original: yāntakāśca teṣāṃ vaineyā bhaveyustāntakā mamaikasya bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yāntakāḥ ca teṣām vaineyāḥ bhaveyuḥ tāntakāḥ mama ekasya bhaveyuḥ
translated: May my disciples be equal to the disciples of those [Buddhas].

original: yathā ca te tribhiryānairdharmaṃ deśayeyuḥ /🔽yathā ca teṣāṃ śrāvakasaṅgho bhavet /
analyzed: yathā ca te tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayeyuḥ  yathā ca teṣām śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: May I teach the Dharma with the three vehicles as they do.🔽May I have an assembly of disciples as they do.

analyzed: tāntakaḥ mama bodhi prāptasya eka śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet
translated: May my assembly of disciples who have attained enlightenment be equal to the assembly of disciples of those [Buddhas].

original: ye ca teṣāmekonāśītīnāṃ buddhānāmutpannānāṃ sattvāstasminnutpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe manuṣyalābhaṃ pratigṛhṇīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām utpannānām sattvāḥ tasmin utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe manuṣya lābham pratigṛhṇīyuḥ
translated: And those beings who, in that Utpalāsaṃbhava eon, will obtain a human birth when those seventy-nine buddhas have appeared,

original: kṣīyamāṇe kalpe'hamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvāṃstān sattvāṃstribhiryānairniyatāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: kṣīyamāṇe kalpe iham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvān tān sattvān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ niyatām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: when the eon is coming to an end, I will attain supreme perfect enlightenment and establish all those beings in the three vehicles.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadvyākuruṣva māṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tat vyākuruṣva mām bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of aspiration of mine is to be fulfilled, then, Venerable Blessed One, prophesy to me about supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato vigatabhayasaṃtāpasya sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ vigata bhaya saṃtāpasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave his approval to Vigatabhayatrāsa:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: Good, good, good man!

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntānām sattvānām kāruṇika hita karaḥ ca utpannaḥ
translated: You have arisen out of compassion and for the benefit of beings who are beyond number.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavakānāgate'dhvanyatikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye tatrotpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe kṣīyamāṇe sarvapaścimakastvamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka anāgata idhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya inupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye tatra utpalasaṃtīraṇe kalpe kṣīyamāṇe sarva paścimakaḥ tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: You, young man, in the future, after one incalculable eon has passed, having entered the second incalculable eon, when the Utpala-saṃtīraṇa eon is ending, you will be the very last to attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: viagatarajasamudgatābhyudgatarājā nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: viagatarajasamudgatābhyudgatarājā nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the Tathāgata named Vigatara-ja-saṃudgata-abhyudgata-rāja, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

analyzed: yathā ca teṣām ekonāśītīnām buddhānām ardha kalpam āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And just as the lifespan of those eighty-one Buddhas will be half an eon,

analyzed: evam tava eva ekasya āyuḥ ardha kalpam bhaviṣyati
translated: so your lifespan will be half an eon.

original: yāvat sarve te tvatpraṇidhānāḥ saṃpatsyante yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat sarve te tvad praṇidhānāḥ saṃpatsyante yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And all your aspirations will be fulfilled, just as you have made them.

original: sa āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandāmi tadā sarvatrāsmin buddhakṣetre nīlakusumāḥ pravarṣantu paramasugandhā /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandāmi tadā sarvatra asmin buddhakṣetre nīla kusumāḥ pravarṣantu parama sugandhā
translated: He said, If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, then when I pay homage to the Blessed One's feet with the five points of my body, may blue flowers rain down everywhere in this Buddha-field, with the most excellent fragrance.

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ gandhamāghrāyeyuḥ teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ dhātavaḥ prasannā aviruddhā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam gandham āghrāyeyuḥ teṣām sarveṣām dhātavaḥ prasannāḥ a viruddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all the beings who would smell that fragrance would have all their elements clear and unobstructed.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca sarva vyādhyaḥ praśāmyeyuḥ
translated: And all their illnesses would be pacified.

original: yadā ca kulaputra vigatabhayasaṃtāpo māṇavo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra tasmin buddhakṣetre nīlakusumavṛṣṭiḥ
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra vigata bhaya saṃtāpaḥ māṇavaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau vandati tadā sarvatra tasmin buddhakṣetre nīla kusuma vṛṣṭiḥ
translated: And when, son of good family, the young man, free from fear and distress, bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with the five limbs, then in all that buddha-field a rain of blue flowers fell.

original: ye ca sattvāstaṃ gandhaṃ ghrātavantasteṣāṃ sarve dhātavaḥ samā aviruddhāḥ saṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tam gandham ghrātavantaḥ teṣām sarve dhātavaḥ samāḥ a viruddhāḥ saṃsthitāḥ
translated: And all the beings who smelled that fragrance had all their elements balanced and unobstructed.

original: sarve ca tatra sattvā arogā alpābādhāśca saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra sattvāḥ arogāḥ alpa ābādhāḥ ca saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: And all the beings there became free from disease and had little illness.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathāgata Ratna-garbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha karuṇa vrata dānta cittā
translated: Rise up, you whose mind is disciplined by the vow of compassion,

analyzed: pūjayiṣyasi bahava loka nāthān
translated: you will worship many lords of the world.

analyzed: chetsyasi dṛḍhām śaṭha kleśa bandhanām
translated: You will cut the strong bonds of the afflictions of deceit,

analyzed: bhaviṣyase śubha vara prajña kośaḥ
translated: and you will become a treasure of excellent and sublime wisdom.

original: tasya ca kulaputra brāhmaṇasya trayaḥ koṭyo'ntavāsināmārāmadvāre niṣaṇṇāste āgatāṃ sattvāṃstriśaraṇagamane sthāpayanti /
analyzed: tasya ca kula putra brāhmaṇasya trayaḥ koṭyontavāsinām ārāma dvāre niṣaṇṇāḥ te āgatām sattvān triśaraṇa gamane sthāpayanti
translated: And, son of good family, that brahmin had three koṭis of residents in his hermitage sitting at the gate, who established the beings who came there in going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

analyzed: bodhāya ca samādāpayanti
translated: and they inspire others to aspire to enlightenment.

analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tām śiṣyān āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the brahmin Samudrarenu addressed his disciples:

original: utpādayatha bho māṇavakā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: utpādayatha bho māṇavakāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: You young brahmins, arouse the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: gṛhṇatha buddhakṣetra guṇām yādṛśān ākāṅkṣatha
translated: Take up the qualities of a buddha-field as you wish.

analyzed: kuruta bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānam yādṛśam eva ākāṅkṣatha
translated: Make a vow in the presence of the Blessed One as you wish.

analyzed: tatra jyotikṣabhakaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ
translated: There was a young brahmin named Jyotiskaṃbha.

original: sa āha kīdṛśena mārgeṇa kīdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa kīdṛśyā caryayā kīdṛśyā saṃṛtyā bodhirlabhyate / /
analyzed: saḥ āha kīdṛśena mārgeṇa kīdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa kīdṛśyā caryayā kīdṛśyā saṃṛtyā bodhiḥ labhyate
translated: He asked, By what kind of path, by what kind of accumulation, by what kind of practice, by what kind of attainment is enlightenment obtained?

original: purohita āha catvāra ime māṇavakā bodhimārgapratipannena bodhisattvenākṣayakośāḥ samudānayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: purohitaḥ āha catvāraḥ ime māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga pratipannena bodhisattvena akṣaya kośāḥ samudānayitavyāḥ
translated: The priest said, Young brahmins, these four inexhaustible treasuries should be accumulated by a bodhisattva who has entered the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: akṣayaḥ puṇya saṃbhāraḥ  akṣayaḥ jñāna saṃbhāraḥ
translated: The inexhaustible accumulation of merit,🔽the inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom,

analyzed: akṣayaḥ prajñā saṃbhāraḥ
translated: the inexhaustible accumulation of insight,

analyzed: akṣayaḥ sarva dharna samudānayana saṃbhāraḥ
translated: and the inexhaustible accumulation of gathering all dharmas.

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kulaputra mārgaḥ
translated: Such is the path, son of good family.

original: uktaṃ caivaṃ māṇava tathāgatena saṃbhāraviśuddhisaṅgraho nāma saṃsārottaraṇadharmadvāraṃ /
analyzed: uktam ca evam māṇava tathāgatena saṃbhāraviśuddhisaṅgrahaḥ nāma saṃsāra uttaraṇa dharma dvāram
translated: And thus, young man, the Tathāgata has taught the Dharma door called The Collection of Pure Provisions for Crossing Over Saṃsāra.

analyzed: dāna saṃbhāram bodhisattvāḥ ye parityajanti
translated: The bodhisattvas who give up the provisions of generosity

original: sa ca vaineyasattvaparipācanāya saṃvartate /🔽śīlasaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāṃ praṇidhānapūryai saṃvartate /
analyzed: sa ca vaineya sattva paripācanāya saṃvartate  śīla saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām praṇidhāna pūryai saṃvartate
translated: lead to the ripening of beings to be trained.🔽The bodhisattvas' provisions of morality lead to the fulfillment of their vows.

analyzed: kṣānti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana paripūryai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of patience lead to the perfection of the major and minor marks.

analyzed: vīrya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kāma karaṇāya saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of effort lead to the accomplishment of all desires.

analyzed: dhyāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām ājāneya citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of meditation lead to the state of mind of those who are well-bred.

analyzed: prajñā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kleśa parijñāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of wisdom lead to the thorough knowledge of all afflictions.

analyzed: śruta saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām asaṅga pratibhāna tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of learning lead to unobstructed eloquence.

analyzed: puṇya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva sattva upajīvya tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of merit lead to being supported by all beings.

analyzed: jñāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām asaṃśaya jñāna tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The bodhisattvas' provisions of wisdom lead to the knowledge free from doubt.

analyzed: śamatha saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām karmaṇā citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of tranquility of the bodhisattvas leads to the purification of action and mind.

original: vipaśyanāsaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāṃ vigatakathaṃkathāyai saṃvartate /🔽maitrīsaṃbhāro bodhisattvānāmapratihatacittatāyai saṃvartate /
analyzed: vipaśyanā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vigata kathaṃkathāyai saṃvartate  maitrī saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām apratihata citta tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of insight of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of doubt.🔽The accumulation of loving-kindness of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of a hostile mind.

analyzed: karuṇā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vaineya ākheda tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of compassion of the bodhisattvas leads to the absence of weariness with regard to those to be trained.

analyzed: muditā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dharma ārāma rati ramaṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of joy of the bodhisattvas leads to delight in the pleasure of the Dharma.

analyzed: upekṣā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām anunaya pratigha prahāṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of equanimity of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of attachment and aversion.

analyzed: dharma śravaṇa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām nivaraṇa prahāṇāya saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of listening to the Dharma of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of obscurations.

analyzed: naiṣkramya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva parigraha avasaraṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of renunciation of the bodhisattvas leads to the abandonment of all possessions.

analyzed: araṇya vāsa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kṛta kuśala mūla karma a vipraṇāśa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of dwelling in the forest of the bodhisattvas leads to the non-destruction of wholesome roots and actions.

analyzed: kuśala vṛddhi bhāvana tā saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kuśala tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the cultivation of the increase of wholesomeness of the bodhisattvas leads to all that is wholesome.

analyzed: smṛti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dhāraṇī pratilābha tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of mindfulness of bodhisattvas leads to the attainment of dhāraṇīs.

analyzed: mati saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām bodhi prabhedana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of understanding of bodhisattvas leads to the discernment of enlightenment.

analyzed: dhṛti saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām artha gati anubudhyana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of firmness of bodhisattvas leads to the realization of the meaning and purpose.

analyzed: smṛti upasthāna saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kāya vedanā citta dharma pratyavekṣaṇa tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the foundations of mindfulness of bodhisattvas leads to the investigation of body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.

analyzed: samyak prahāṇa saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kuśala dharma bhāvanā paripūraṇāya saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of right efforts of bodhisattvas leads to the fulfillment of the cultivation of all wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: ṛddhipāda saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām kāya citta laghu tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the bases of spiritual power of bodhisattvas leads to lightness of body and mind.

analyzed: indriya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām saṃvara paripūryai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the faculties of bodhisattvas leads to the fulfillment of restraint.

analyzed: bala saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām sarva kleśa avamardana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the powers of bodhisattvas leads to the subjugation of all afflictions.

analyzed: bodhyaṅga saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām dharma svabhāva avabodhana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The accumulation of the factors of awakening of bodhisattvas leads to the realization of the nature of dharmas.

analyzed: ṣaṣ parāyaṇīya saṃbhāraḥ bodhisattvānām vaineya sattva pariśodhana tāyai saṃvartate
translated: The six perfections, which are the requisites for the bodhisattvas, lead to the purification of the beings to be trained.

analyzed: ayam māṇavakāḥ saṃbhāraviśuddhimukhasaṃgrahaḥ nāma saṃsāra uttaraṇa dharma dvāram
translated: This, young brahmins, is the Dharma door for crossing over saṃsāra, called the collection of the requisites for purification.

analyzed: saḥ āha dāna saṃbhāraḥ bhagavatā mahā bhoga mahā parivāra tāya a yuktaḥ
translated: He said, The Blessed One has declared that the requisite of generosity leads to great wealth and a large retinue.

analyzed: śīlam svarga upapattaye
translated: Morality leads to rebirth in heaven.

analyzed: śrutam mahā prajña tāyai
translated: Learning leads to great wisdom.

analyzed: śraddhā jīva bhāvanā bhagavatā svaṃsāra uttaraṇa artham nirdiṣṭā
translated: The Blessed One has taught that faith and livelihood are for crossing over saṃsāra.

original: purohitā āha ye māṇavāḥ saṃsārābhiratā dānaṃ dadanti /
analyzed: purohitāḥ āha ye māṇavāḥ saṃsāra abhiratāḥ dānam dadanti
translated: The priests said, Young brahmins, those who delight in saṃsāra and give gifts,

analyzed: evam etat yathā uktam
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: ye māṇavaka kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā bodhimārgapratipannāstairdānaṃ damacittatayā dātavyaṃ /
analyzed: ye māṇavaka kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā bodhi mārga pratipannāḥ taiḥ dānam dama citta tayā dātavyam
translated: Young brahmins, those sons or daughters of good family who have entered the path to enlightenment should give gifts with a tamed mind.

analyzed: śīlam śamatha citta tayā rakṣitavyam  śrutam akaluṣa citta tayā paryeṣitavyam
translated: They should guard morality with a mind of tranquility.🔽They should seek learning with an untroubled mind.

analyzed: bhāvanā mahā karuṇā citta tāyai bhāvayitavyā
translated: They should cultivate meditation with a mind of great compassion.

analyzed: pariśeṣāḥ dharmāḥ prajñā jñāna upāya saṃbhāra samudānaya tāyai paryeṣṭavyāḥ
translated: The remaining dharmas should be sought for the sake of gathering the requisites of wisdom, knowledge, and skillful means.

analyzed: ayam māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ
translated: This, young man, is the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: īdṛśena saṃbhāreṇa bodhiḥ labhyate iti  īdṛśī bhāvanā
translated: Enlightenment is attained by such a collection.🔽Such is meditation.

analyzed: īdṛśī smṛtiḥ
translated: Such is mindfulness.

analyzed: īdṛśī māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga caryā
translated: Such, young man, is the practice of the path to enlightenment.

original: janayata māṇavakā bodhau chandaṃ /🔽śuddho māṇavakā bodhimārga āśayena praṇidhānaṃ kartavyaṃ paripūryate /
analyzed: janayata māṇavakāḥ bodhau chandam  śuddhaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ āśayena praṇidhānam kartavyam paripūryate
translated: Young man, generate the aspiration for enlightenment.🔽Young man, the path to enlightenment should be made pure by aspiration and fulfilled by vow.

analyzed: prasannaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ āśaya viśuddhyā
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is clear by the purity of aspiration.

analyzed: ṛjukāḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārga a śaṭhya viśuddhi kleśa pravāhaṇa tayā
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is straightforward by the purity of non-deception and the removal of afflictions.

analyzed: yogakṣemaḥ māṇavakāḥ bodhi mārgaḥ anuttara nirvāṇa paryavasānaḥ
translated: Young man, the path to enlightenment is secure by the ultimate nirvana.

analyzed: kuruta praṇidhānam
translated: Make the vow.

analyzed: gṛhṇata buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham pariśuddham apariśuddham vā yathā abhipretā
translated: Take the pure or impure Buddha-field adornment as you wish.

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotikṣabhako māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyāgrato dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāha /🔽utpādayāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotikṣabhakaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya agratas dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya āha 🔽utpādayāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Then, noble sir, the young brahmin Jyotiska, in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, placed his right knee on the ground and said:

original: asmiṃ kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre maṇḍarāgāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ maṇḍadveṣāṇāṃ maṇḍamohānāṃ askhalitāluḍitacittānāṃ avairacittānāṃ īrṣyāmātsaryacittavivarjitānāṃ mithyādṛṣṭiparivarjitacittānāṃ samyagdṛṣṭivyavasthitacittānāṃ kuśalacittānāṃ kuśalaparyeṣṭicittānāṃ apāyapathavivarjitacittānāṃ triḥsvargapathodyuktacittānāṃ tribhiḥ puṇyakriyāvastubhiḥ samudānītakuśalamūlānāṃ triṣu yāneṣu prayuktacittānāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ /
analyzed: asmin kliṣṭe buddhakṣetre maṇḍa rāgāṇām sattvānām maṇḍa dveṣāṇām maṇḍa mohānām a skhalita a luḍita cittānām a vaira cittānām īrṣyā mātsarya citta vivarjitānām mithyā dṛṣṭi parivarjita cittānām samyak dṛṣṭi vyavasthita cittānām kuśala cittānām kuśala paryeṣṭi cittānām apāya patha vivarjita cittānām tris svarga patha udyukta cittānām tribhiḥ puṇya kriyā vastubhiḥ samudānīta kuśala mūlānām triṣu yāneṣu prayukta cit
translated: In this defiled buddha-field, for beings with strong attachment, strong aversion, and strong delusion, for those with unsteady and agitated minds, those with hostile minds, those who have abandoned the mind of envy and stinginess, those who have abandoned the mind of wrong views, those whose minds are established in right views, those with wholesome minds, those with minds seeking wholesome things, those who have abandoned the mind of the path to the lower realms, those whose minds are dedicated to the three heavenly paths, those who have generated wholesome roots through the three bases of meritorious action, those whose minds are engaged in the three vehicles, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadā me ubhayoḥ pāṇyorhastināgāḥ prādurbhavantu /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tadā me ubhayoḥ pāṇyoḥ hasti nāgāḥ prādurbhavantu
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of wish of mine is to be fulfilled, then may elephants appear in both my hands.

original: sahapravyāhṛte vākye bhagavato'nubhāvena ubhayoḥ pāṇyorhastināgāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sarvaśvetāḥ saptāṅgasupratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: saha pravyāhṛte vākye bhagavataḥ unubhāvena ubhayoḥ pāṇyoḥ hasti nāgāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sarva śvetāḥ sapta aṅga su pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: As soon as he spoke these words, by the Blessed One's power, elephants appeared in both his hands, all white, well-established with seven limbs.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā āha gacchata yūyam gagana talam
translated: Having seen them, he said, Go to the sky.

original: sarvāvantamidaṃ buddhakṣetramaṣṭāṅgopetena varṣeṇa paramasugandhena sarvasattvānito buddhakṣetrāt prabodhayata /
analyzed: sarvāvantam idam buddhakṣetram aṣṭa aṅga upetena varṣeṇa parama sugandhena sarva sattvān itas buddhakṣetrāt prabodhayata
translated: With the eight qualities of rain, and with the most excellent and fragrant rain, awaken all beings from this Buddha-field.

original: yeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ kāye tato bindu nipate ye vā gandhamājighreyusteṣāṃ pañcanīvaraṇāḥ prahīyantu /
analyzed: yeṣām sattvānām kāye tatas bindu nipate ye vā gandham ājighreyuḥ teṣām pañca nīvaraṇāḥ prahīyantu
translated: For those beings whose bodies are sprinkled with those drops, or who smell that fragrance, may the five hindrances be removed.

analyzed: tat yathā kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam prahīyatu
translated: Namely, may the hindrance of sensual desire be removed.

analyzed: vyāpādaḥ tyānam iddha auddhatya kaukṛtya vicikitsā nīvaraṇam prahīyatu
translated: May the hindrances of ill-will, sloth and torpor, restlessness and remorse, and doubt be removed.

original: sahapravyāhṛte vākye nāgā uparyantarīkṣe evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchanti /
analyzed: saha pravyāhṛte vākye nāgāḥ upari antarīkṣe evaṃrūpeṇa javena gacchanti
translated: As soon as the words were spoken, the elephants went with such speed in the sky above,

original: tadyathāpi nāma balavān puruṣaḥ prasāritāṃ bāhu saṃkocayet saṃkocitaṃ bāhu prasārayet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma balavān puruṣaḥ prasāritām bāhu saṃkocayet saṃkocitam bāhu prasārayet
translated: just as a strong man might stretch out or draw in his arm.

original: evameva te hastināgāḥ kṛtakāryā yathā pūrvoktaṃ vivarttitvā tasyāgrataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva te hasti nāgāḥ kṛta kāryāḥ yathā pūrva uktam vivarttitvā tasya agratas sthitāḥ
translated: In the same way, those elephants, having accomplished their task, returned as described before and stood in front of him.

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotikṣabho māṇavakaḥ paramaprītimanāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotikṣabhaḥ māṇavakaḥ parama prīti manāḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, the young brahmin Jyotiska, with the utmost joy,

original: taṃ ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ kulaputrānāgate'dhvani anupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye ratnaprabhāse kalpe ratnasañcayaṃ nāma buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tam ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha  bhaviṣyasi tvam kula putra anāgata idhvani anupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā samesaṃkhyeye ratnaprabhāse kalpe ratnasañcayam nāma buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, You will become a Buddha in the future, in the second incalculable eon after the end of the second incalculable eon, in the kalpa called Ratnaprabhasa, in the Buddha-field called Ratnasamcaya.

original: asmiṃ cāturdvīpike ratnacchatrābhyudgataraśmirbhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: asmin cāturdvīpike ratna chatra abhyudgata raśmiḥ bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: And in this four-continent world, you will become the Tathagata called Ratnachchatrodbhadrashmi, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: atha kulaputra jyotikṣabho bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipapāta /
analyzed: atha kula putra jyotikṣabhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā nipapāta
translated: Then, noble son, the Bodhisattva Jyotiska, with his five limbs, bowed his head to the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha vigata rajā śuddha sattvā
translated: Rise up, you who are free from dust, you who are pure in mind,

analyzed: vyākṛta bahu sattva koṭīḥ sā
translated: you have been prophesied to be the one who will liberate many millions of beings.

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi vara śuddha mārgaḥ bodhaye
translated: You will become the supreme pure path to enlightenment,

analyzed: bhaviṣyasi vara jinaḥ sattva nāyakaḥ
translated: you will become the supreme Victor, the leader of beings.

original: peyālaṃ / sahasro māṇavakānāṃ trayaḥ koṭyo māṇavakānāṃ yairasmin buddhakṣetre'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: peyālam sahasraḥ māṇavakānām trayaḥ koṭyaḥ māṇavakānām yaiḥ asmin buddhakṣetre anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The same is repeated for a thousand young brahmins and three koṭis of young brahmins who made the aspiration for supreme perfect enlightenment in this Buddha-field.

original: sarve ca te ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena vyākṛtāḥ
translated: And all of them were prophesied by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

original: yāvadvipaśyī śikhī viśvabhuvaḥ paścimā buddhā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vipaśyī śikhī viśvabhuvaḥ paścimāḥ buddhāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Up to Vipashyin, Shikhi, and Vishvabhu, the last of the Buddhas.

analyzed: sarve māṇavakāḥ vyākṛtāḥ
translated: All the young brahmins were prophesied.

original: tatra sahasravedapāṭhakānāṃ brāhmaṇānāṃ yasteṣāṃ jyeṣṭhaḥ gurusaṃmato vāyuviṣṇurnāma /
analyzed: tatra sahasra veda pāṭhakānām brāhmaṇānām yaḥ teṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ guru saṃmataḥ vāyuviṣṇuḥ nāma
translated: Among them, the eldest and most revered of the thousand Vedic reciters was a brahmin named Vayu-Vishnu.

original: sa āha ahaṃ punaḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ spṛśyeyaṃ /
analyzed: saḥ āha aham punar pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre in uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim spṛśyeyam
translated: He said, I, on the other hand, will attain supreme perfect enlightenment in a Buddha-field with five degenerations.

original: tīvrarāgānāṃ tīvradveṣāṇāṃ tīvramohānāṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tīvra rāgānām tīvra dveṣāṇām tīvra mohānām sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: I will teach the Dharma to beings with intense desire, intense hatred, and intense delusion.

analyzed: jyotipālaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ
translated: There was a young brahmin named Jyotipala.

original: sa āha kimarthavaśaṃ samanupaśyamāno'yaṃ bho upādhyāya vāyuviṣṇuḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhāti / /
analyzed: saḥ āha kim artha vaśam samanupaśyamānaḥ iyam bho upādhyāya vāyu viṣṇuḥ pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhāti
translated: He said, Seeing what benefit does this teacher Vayu-Vishnu aspire to a Buddha-field with five degenerations?

original: purohita āha sakalamahākaruṇāsamanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre bodhimanuprāpnoti /
analyzed: purohitaḥ āha sakala mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre bodhim anuprāpnoti
translated: The priest said, A bodhisattva endowed with great compassion attains enlightenment in a Buddha-field with five degenerations.

analyzed: atrāṇānām aparāyaṇānām kleśaiḥ upadrutānām dṛṣṭi vyasana prāptānām sattvānām artha karaḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes one who benefits beings without protection, without refuge, afflicted by afflictions, and fallen into the calamity of wrong views.

analyzed: trāṇam parāyaṇam bhavati
translated: It becomes a refuge and a final support.

analyzed: janma samudrāt ca sattvān uttārayati
translated: It delivers beings from the ocean of birth.

analyzed: samyak dṛṣṭyām ca sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: And it establishes beings in right view.

analyzed: nirvāṇa amṛta rasena sattvān saṃtarpayati
translated: It satisfies beings with the nectar of nirvana.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahākaruṇā dṛśyata ye pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhanti /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahā karuṇā dṛśyata ye pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre praṇidadhanti
translated: This is the great compassion of the bodhisattva, which is seen in those who make aspirations for a buddha field with five degenerations.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vāyuviṣṇo atikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāmavaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye purastimāyāṃ diśāyāṃ buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāni buddhakṣetrāṇyatikramitvā tatra kaṣāyadhvaja nāma lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam vāyuviṣṇo atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā sama isaṃkhyeye purastimāyām diśāyām buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramitvā tatra kaṣāyadhvaja nāma lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, O Vayu-Vishnu, after infinite eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River have passed, in the second infinite eon remaining, in the eastern direction, having surpassed buddha fields as numerous as the particles of dust in a buddha field, there will be a world system named Kshaya-dhvaja.

analyzed: tatra tvam sat puruṣa anutarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: There, O good man, you will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: śālendrarājo nāma tathāgato bhavisyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: śālendrarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhavisyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will become the Tathagata named Shali-Indra-Raja, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: vāyuviṣṇurāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yadāhaṃ bhagavataḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vande tadā me bhagavān chatapuṇyalakṣaṇālaṅkṛtāvubhau caraṇau mūrdhni sthāpayatu /
analyzed: vāyu viṣṇuḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yadā aham bhagavataḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vande tadā me bhagavān śata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtau ubhau caraṇau mūrdhni sthāpayatu
translated: Vāyuviṣṇu said, “If, Venerable Blessed One, this wish of mine is to be fulfilled, then when I bow my head to the feet of the Blessed One with the five-part prostration, may the Blessed One place both of his feet, adorned with the marks of a hundred merits, on my head.”

original: yadā kulaputra vāyuviṣṇurmāṇavo bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta tadā ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ ubhau caraṇau vāyuviṣṇorbodhisattvasya mūrdhni sthāpayitvāha
analyzed: yadā kula putra vāyuviṣṇuḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirasā nipapāta tadā ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ubhau caraṇau vāyuviṣṇoḥ bodhisattvasya mūrdhni sthāpayitvā āha
translated: When the young man Vāyuviṣṇu bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, at that time the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha placed both of his feet on the head of the bodhisattva Vāyuviṣṇu and said:

analyzed: uttiṣṭha karuṇa āśaya tīkṣṇa prajña
translated: “Rise up, one of compassionate resolve, sharp wisdom,

analyzed: carāhi caryā vara bodhi kāraṇāt
translated: Practice the conduct for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: chindāhi
translated: Cut the bonds of afflictions firmly held by the wise,

analyzed: bheṣyasi buddha hita anukampī
translated: You will become a buddha, benevolent and compassionate.”

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotipālo māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthvyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāha utpādayāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotipālaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthvyām pratiṣṭhāpya āha  utpādayāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Then, noble sir, the young brahmin Jyotipāla placed his right knee on the ground before the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and said, “Venerable Blessed One, I generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: asmin buddhakṣetre rāgadveṣamohasabhāgacittānāmavyavasthitakuśalākuśalāśayānāṃ sattvānāṃ catvāriṃśadvarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ'
analyzed: asmin buddhakṣetre rāga dveṣa moha sa bhāga cittānām avyavasthita kuśala akuśala āśayānām sattvānām catvāriṃśat varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: In this Buddha-field, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment in an age when the lifespan of beings is forty thousand years, for the sake of beings whose minds are dominated by passion, aversion, and delusion, who are unstable in their intentions regarding what is wholesome and unwholesome.'

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha 'atikrāntānāṃ ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ avaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahā nāmāyaṃ lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahā nāma ayam lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, 'After innumerable eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River, in the second eon that remains, this world system will be called Saha.

analyzed: kena kāreṇena saha iti ucyate
translated: Why is it called Saha?

original: ' sahāste sattvā rāgasya sahāste dveṣasya sahāste mohasya sahāste kleśabandhanānāṃ /
analyzed: saha āste sattvāḥ rāgasya saha āste dveṣasya saha āste mohasya saha āste kleśa bandhanānām
translated: Because beings there endure passion, aversion, and delusion, and endure the bonds of afflictions.

analyzed: tena kāreṇena sā lokadhātuḥ sahā iti ucyate
translated: For this reason, that world system is called Saha.

original: tatra sahāyāṃ lokadhātau bhadrako nāma bhaviṣyati mahākalpaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sahāyām lokadhātau bhadrakaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati mahā kalpaḥ
translated: In that Saha world system, there will be a great eon called Bhadra.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena ucyate bhadrakaḥ iti
translated: For what reason is it called Bhadra?

original: bhadrake mahākalpe rāgadveṣamohacaritānāṃ sattvānāṃ sahasraṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmutpatsyate /
analyzed: bhadrake mahākalpe rāga dveṣa moha caritānām sattvānām sahasram mahā kāruṇikānām buddhānām bhagavatām utpatsyate
translated: In the Bhadra great eon, a thousand Buddhas, Blessed Ones, will appear, for the sake of beings whose conduct is dominated by passion, aversion, and delusion, who are greatly compassionate.

original: tvamapi satpuruṣānupraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe catvāriṃśadvarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ sarvaprathamamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: tvam api sat puruṣa anupraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe catvāriṃśat varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām sarva prathamam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: You, too, will enter the good eon and, when the lifespan of beings is forty thousand years, you will first of all attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: krakutsando nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavāṃstribhiryānairdharmaṃ deśayiṣyasi /🔽gaṇanātikrāntān sattvān saṃsāranadyāmuhyamānānuttārayiṣyasi /
analyzed: krakutsandaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayiṣyasi  gaṇanā atikrāntān sattvān saṃsāra nadyām uhyamānān uttārayiṣyasi
translated: You will be the Tathagata named Krakucchanda, up to the Blessed One, the Teacher of the Dharma with the three vehicles.

analyzed: nirvāṇa pāre ca sthāpayiṣyasi
translated: You will deliver more than can be counted of beings who are drowning in the river of saṃsāra, and establish them on the other shore of nirvāṇa.'

original: atha khalu kulaputra jyotipālo bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte'tikramya tasthau /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra jyotipālaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānta atikramya tasthau
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Jyotipāla bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha with the five points of his body, and after circumambulating him, he stood to one side.

original: atha khalu kulaputra dvitīyastumbururnāma māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra dvitīyaḥ tumburuḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then, noble sir, the second young brahmin named Tuṃburu sat in front of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha.

original: bhaviṣyāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan krakutsandasya tathāgatasyānusaṃdhau triṃsadvarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ buddho loke /
analyzed: bhaviṣyāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan krakutsandasya tathāgatasya anusaṃdhau triṃsat varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām buddhaḥ loke
translated: 'Reverend Blessed One, I will become a Buddha in the world in the continuation of the teachings of the Tathāgata Krakucchanda, when the lifespan of beings is thirty thousand years.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavakātikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'vaśiṣṭe dvitīye nadigaṅgāvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye sahe buddhakṣetre'nupraviṣṭe bhadrakalpe krakutsandasya tathāgatasyānusaṃdhau triṃśadvarṣasāhasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ kanakamunirnāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddho vighuṣṭaśabdo lokasya /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka atikrāntaḥ eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya iva śiṣṭe dvitīye nadi gaṅgā vālikā same saṃkhyeye sahe buddhakṣetre nupraviṣṭe bhadra kalpe krakutsandasya tathāgatasya anusaṃdhau triṃśat varṣa sāhasrikāyām prajāyām kanakamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vighuṣṭa śabdaḥ lokasya
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, You will become a Tathagata named Kanakamuni in the world system Saha, in the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is thirty thousand years, after the Tathagata Krakucchanda, in the remaining second incalculably long eon, when one incalculably long eon remains, O young man.

original: sa bhagavataḥ sakāśādvyākaraṇaṃ śrutvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyābhimukhamāsthāt /
analyzed: sa bhagavataḥ sakāśāt vyākaraṇam śrutvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya abhimukham āsthāt
translated: Having heard the prophecy from the Blessed One, he bowed his head at the feet of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, circumambulated him, and stood in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha.

analyzed: puṣpaiḥ bhagavataḥ kāyam avakiramāṇaḥ prañjali bhūtaḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ tuṣṭhāva
translated: Scattering flowers on the body of the Blessed One, with palms joined he praised the Blessed One with these verses:

analyzed: su sahita su mudita su madhura vacanā
translated: Well-accompanied, well-pleased, with sweet words,

analyzed: askhalita a luḍita akaluṣa vimalā
translated: Unswerving, undeluded, stainless, pure,

analyzed: abhiśaya atiyati atimati matimā
translated: Overwhelming, surpassing, surpassing, intelligent,

analyzed: ṛṣi vara jvala tuma muni vara vṛṣabhī
translated: O best of sages, you shine, O best of sages, O bull!

analyzed: bahu tuma guṇa dada guṇa śata bharitā
translated: You possess many qualities, you are filled with hundreds of virtues,

analyzed: sukha kara muni vara naram anu namitā
translated: You bring happiness, O best of sages, you are bowed to by humans and gods.

original: na hi anyu sattva vidyati tvayi samu tṛbhave
analyzed: na hi anyu sattva vidyati tvayi samu tṛbhave
translated: There is no other being like you in the three worlds,

analyzed: tvayi adyi bahu sattva bodhi mārgi vyākṛtā
translated: Many beings have been prophesied by you today to attain the path of enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kulaputra viśvagupto nāma māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ saptaratnamayaṃ pīṭhaṃ sthāpayitvā śatasahasramūlyena prajñapanena
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra viśvaguptaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sapta ratna mayam pīṭham sthāpayitvā śata sahasra mūlyena prajñapanena
translated: Then, noble sir, a young brahmin named Vishvagupta, in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, set up a throne made of the seven precious substances, with a canopy worth a hundred thousand,

original: tatra pīṭhe suvarṇapātraṃ sthāpayitvā saptaratnaparipūrṇasuvarṇamayaṃ bhṛṅgāraṃ saptaratnamayā yaṣṭirbuddhapramukhe bhikṣusaṅghe niyojitavān
analyzed: tatra pīṭhe suvarṇa pātram sthāpayitvā sapta ratna paripūrṇa suvarṇa mayam bhṛṅgāram sapta ratna mayā yaṣṭiḥ buddha pramukhe bhikṣu saṅghe niyojitavān
translated: and on that throne, having placed a golden vessel, filled with the seven precious substances, a golden water pot, and seven precious staffs, he dedicated it to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: sa āha bhaviṣyāmyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavannanāgate'dhvanyatikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'vaśiṣṭe dvitīye tasmiṃśca bhadrakalpe tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno hīyamāne āyuṣi utpanne kaliyuganimitte tīvrarāgadveṣamohamānerṣyāmātsaryaparyutthitānāṃ sattvānāṃ mithyādṛṣṭyakalyāṇamitrasanniśritānāṃ sattvānāmakuśalamūlaparyutthitacittānāṃ kuśalamūlaparihīṇacittānāṃ samyagdṛṣṭivivarjitacittānāṃ mithyājīvākuśalacittānāṃ /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhaviṣyāmi aham bhadanta bhagavan anāgata idhvani atikrāntaḥ eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya iva śiṣṭe dvitīye tasmin ca bhadra kalpe tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ hīyamāne āyuṣi utpanne kali yuga nimitte tīvra rāga dveṣa moha māna īrṣyā mātsarya paryutthitānām sattvānām mithyādṛṣṭi akalyāṇa mitra sanniśritānām sattvānām akuśala mūla paryutthita cittānām kuśala mūla parihīṇa cittānām
translated: He said, Venerable Blessed One, in the future, after one incalculably long eon has passed and a second one is remaining, in that Fortunate Eon, when the lifespan is decreasing, when the signs of the Kali Yuga have arisen, for beings afflicted by intense passion, hatred, delusion, pride, jealousy, and stinginess, for beings who rely on wrong views and unwholesome friends, for beings whose minds are afflicted by the roots of non-virtue and lack the roots of virtue, whose minds are devoid of right views and have wrong livelihood and non-virtue,

original: parinirvṛte kanakamunau tathāgate saddharme'ntarhite'ndhe loke'nāyake viṃśativarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ ahamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ
analyzed: parinirvṛte kanakamunau tathāgate saddharma antarhita indhe loka ināyake viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: when the Tathagata Kanakamuni has passed into parinirvana and the true Dharma has disappeared, in a world without a guide, among beings with a lifespan of twenty thousand years, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tasya kulaputra viśvaguptasya brāhmaṇasya ratnagarbhastathāgata āha sādhu sādhu brāhmaṇa mahāvidvān jñānasamanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya kula putra viśvaguptasya brāhmaṇasya ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha sādhu sādhu brāhmaṇa mahā vidvān jñāna samanvāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said to the Brahmin Vishvagupta, Excellent, excellent, Brahmin! You are greatly learned and endowed with wisdom.

original: tvaṃ satpuruṣotpanne kaliyuganimitte yāvadviṃśativarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāmandhe loke'nāyake praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tvam sat puruṣa utpanne kali yuga nimitte yāvat viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām andhe lokenāyake praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You, good man, have made a vow when the signs of the Kali Yuga arise and the lifespan of beings is twenty thousand years, in a world without a leader, in the dark age.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa vidvagañjakaruṇāśrayo nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa vidvas añja karuṇāśrayaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: Therefore, good man, you should be named Vidvan-ganja-karuna-ashraya.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vidvagañjakaruṇāśrayānāgate'dhvanyatikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmavaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahāyāṃ lokadhātau anupraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe viṃśativarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ kāśyapo nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vidvas añja karuṇāśraya anāgata idhvani atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye sahāyām lokadhātau anupraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe viṃśati varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām kāśyapaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: In the future, when one Ganges river-bed of eons has passed and only two remain, in the Saha world system, during the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is twenty thousand years, you will become the Tathagata named Kashyapa, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vidvagañjakaruṇāśrayo bodhisattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte'sthāt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vidvas añja karuṇāśrayaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte sthāt
translated: Then, noble son, the Bodhisattva Vidvan-ganja-karuna-ashraya bowed his head to the five points of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha's feet and stood to one side.

analyzed: ratnagarbham tathāgatam puṣpa mālya gandha cūrṇaiḥ avakirati

analyzed: ābhiḥ ca gāthābhiḥ abhistavamānaḥ

analyzed: nara vara hita kara rati kara janaka
translated: O best of men, benefactor, giver of joy, producer of joy,

analyzed: smita mukha pramudita su madhura vacanā
translated: With a smiling face, full of joy, with very sweet speech,

analyzed: sthāna jñāna kuśala hita karā
translated: Skilled in knowing the stages, benefactor, bearer of the ten powers, supreme,

analyzed: jñāna dhyāna vimokṣa pāramitā namaḥ astu te sugate
translated: O possessor of the perfection of knowledge, meditation, and liberation, homage to you, O Sugata!

analyzed: vikasita vadanā
translated: Having practiced many austerities, with a blooming face,

analyzed: atulāya vyākṛtā
translated: The incomparable enlightenment was prophesied for you.

analyzed: tvayā bahu bodhisattvana yutā
translated: By you, many millions of bodhisattvas

analyzed: vandāma te nara varā sugatāḥ iti
translated: We pay homage to you, O best of men, O Sugata.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇaścaturthaṃ vimalavaiśāyanaṃ māṇavakaṃ saṃcodayāṃ āsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ caturtham vimalavaiśāyanam māṇavakam saṃcodayān āsa
translated: Then, noble son, the brahmin Samudrareṇu exhorted the fourth young brahmin Vimala Vaiśāyanī.

original: atha khalu kulaputra vimalavaiśāyano māṇavako ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ sthitvāha evamevāhamasmin bhadrake kalpe bodhimākāṅkṣāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra vimalavaiśāyanaḥ māṇavakaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sthitvā āha evam eva aham asmin bhadrake kalpe bodhim ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: Then, noble son, the young brahmin Vimala Vaiśāyanī, standing before the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, said, In the same way, I desire enlightenment in this fortunate eon.

analyzed: na ca kevalam evaṃrūpam kali yuge
translated: And not only in such a dark age,
