analyzed: anarthikāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ na śakyam tad kālam kenacid bodhi caryām niṣpādayitum
translated: Just as when the Tathagata Kashyapa attained parinirvana, in the age of humans with a lifespan of ten thousand years, for beings whose intentions were exhausted by giving and discipline, who were devoid of the seven riches, who had the notion of a teacher towards evil friends, who were not interested in the three bases of meritorious action, who were devoid of the three good conducts, who were devoted to the three bad conducts, whose minds were agitated by the darkness of afflictions, who were not interested in the three vehicles, it was not possible for anyone at that time to accomplish the conduct leading to enlightenment.

analyzed: kim punar varṣasahasrikāyām
translated: How much less so in the age of humans with a lifespan of one thousand years?

analyzed: yāvat te sattvāḥ varṣa śata āyuṣkāḥ bhavanti
translated: As long as those beings have a lifespan of one hundred years,

analyzed: tad kālam sattvānām kuśala mūlasya na asti nāma
translated: at that time there is no mention of the roots of virtue for beings.

analyzed: kim punar kuśala mūla caryā
translated: How much less so the practice of the roots of virtue?

original: tāvat pañcakaṣāye loke hāyamānā daśavarṣāyuṣkā bhavanti /
analyzed: tāvat pañca kaṣāye loke hāyamānāḥ daśa varṣa āyuṣkāḥ bhavanti
translated: As long as in the world of five corruptions, while declining, they become ten years in lifespan,

original: śastrāntarakalpe pratyupasthite tatkālamahaṃ devebhyo'vatīrya sattvān paritrāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: śastra antara kalpe pratyupasthite tad kālam aham devebhyaḥ avatīrya sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: when the intermediate eon of warfare is imminent, at that time I will descend from the gods and protect beings.

analyzed: akuśalam riñcitvā kuśale niyojayeyam
translated: Having abandoned unwholesome actions, I will engage in wholesome actions.

analyzed: yāvat daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Up to establishing beings in the ten wholesome courses of action.

analyzed: kleśān ca sattvānām kuśalebhiḥ karma pathebhiḥ pariśodhayeyam
translated: And I will purify the afflictions of beings through the wholesome courses of action.

analyzed: pañca kaṣāyam ca parihāyeyam
translated: And I will abandon the five degenerations.

analyzed: yāvat aśīti varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: And when the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: manda rāga dveṣa mohānām avidyā īrṣyā matsariṇām sattvānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: I will teach the Dharma to beings with weak desire, hatred, and delusion, to those without ignorance, envy, or stinginess.

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu saṃniyojayeyam
translated: And I will connect them to the three vehicles.

original: yadi me bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta vyākarotu māṃ bhadanta bhagavannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yadi me bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta vyākarotu mām bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If, Blessed One, this kind of aspiration is fulfilled, may the Blessed One, O Venerable One, prophesy my unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yadāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ na lapsyāmi /
analyzed: yadā aham bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpam vyākaraṇam na lapsyāmi
translated: If, O Venerable One, I do not obtain such a prophecy,

original: na śrāvakabhūmiṃ prārthayāmi na ca pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ yena yānena śīghraṃ saṃsārādvimucyāmi /
analyzed: na śrāvaka bhūmim prārthayāmi na ca pratyekabuddha bhūmim yena yānena śīghram saṃsārāt vimucyāmi
translated: I will not aspire to the stage of a disciple or the stage of a solitary buddha, by which vehicle I will quickly be liberated from saṃsāra.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha catvārīmāni brāhmaṇa bodhisattvānāṃ kuśīdavastūni /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha catvāri imāni brāhmaṇa bodhisattvānām kuśīda vastūni
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnagarbha said, Brahmin, these four are the things that cause laziness for bodhisattvas.

original: yaiḥ kuśīdavastubhiḥ samanvāgatā ekatyā bodhisattvā dīrghasaṃsāralābhino dṛṣṭiprapāte saṃsāracārake duḥkhānyanubhavanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ kuśīda vastubhiḥ samanvāgatāḥ ekatyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ dīrgha saṃsāra lābhinaḥ dṛṣṭi prapāte saṃsāra cārake duḥkhāni anubhavanti
translated: By these things that cause laziness, some bodhisattvas attain the long path of cyclic existence, experience suffering in the abyss of views and the cycle of rebirth,

analyzed: na ca kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāpnuvanti
translated: and do not quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: katamāni catvāri
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: iha ekatyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ hīna ācāraḥ bhavati
translated: Here, some bodhisattva has inferior conduct,

analyzed: hīna sahāyaḥ  hīna parityāgaḥ
translated: inferior companions,🔽inferior renunciation,

analyzed: hīna praṇidhiḥ
translated: and inferior aspiration.

analyzed: katham ca bodhisattvaḥ hīna ācāraḥ bhavati
translated: And how does a bodhisattva have inferior conduct?

analyzed: iha ekatyaḥ duḥśīlaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, some are of bad character,

analyzed: kāya vāc manasā ca asaṃvṛta cārī bhavati
translated: and conduct themselves with body, speech, and mind in an unrestrained manner.

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ sārdham saṃsarga cārī bhavati
translated: They conduct themselves in association with those of the Śrāvaka and Pratyekabuddha vehicles,

original: na ca sarvaparityāgī na sarvatraparityāgī bhavati /
analyzed: na ca sarva parityāgī na sarvatra parityāgī bhavati
translated: and are not givers of everything, not givers of everything everywhere.

analyzed: deva manuṣya śrī sukha abhilāṣī dānam dadāti
translated: Desiring the glory and happiness of gods and humans, they give gifts.

original: na cādhyāśayena buddhakṣetraguṇavyuhān pratigṛhṇāti vaineyamanavekṣya praṇidhānaṃ pratigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na ca adhyāśayena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyuhān pratigṛhṇāti vaineyam an avekṣya praṇidhānam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: And with a superior intention, he does not accept the adornments of a Buddha-field, but makes a vow without regard for those to be trained.

original: ebhiścaturbhirdharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kuśīdo bodhisattvaḥ ciraṃ saṃsāracārake duḥkhamanubhavati /
analyzed: ebhiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kuśīdaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ciram saṃsāra cārake duḥkham anubhavati
translated: Endowed with these four dharmas, the lazy bodhisattva experiences suffering for a long time in the cycle of existence,

analyzed: na ca kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāpnoti
translated: and does not quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: The bodhisattva endowed with four dharmas quickly attains supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: katamaiḥ caturbhiḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: śīlavān bhavati kāya vāc manaḥ saṃvṛta cārī
translated: He is virtuous, practicing restraint in body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: mahāyāna saṃprasthitaiḥ sārdham saṃsarga cārī bhavati
translated: He practices association with those who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: sarvaparityāgī sarvatraparityāgī sattvānāṃ duḥkhaparimocanārthaṃ karuṇācittotpādaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sarva parityāgī sarvatra parityāgī sattvānām duḥkha parimocana artham karuṇā citta utpādam dadāti
translated: He gives up everything, gives up everywhere, out of compassion for beings, in order to liberate them from suffering.

analyzed: adhyāśayena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān vaineyam avekṣya praṇidhānam pratigṛhṇāti
translated: With a superior intention, he accepts the adornments of a Buddha-field and makes a vow, considering those to be trained.

analyzed: ebhiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃsaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses these four qualities quickly awakens to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ime dharmāḥ bodhisattva mārgasya upastambha karāḥ
translated: These four qualities support the bodhisattva path.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: pāramitāsu abhiyogaḥ  sattvānām saṃgraha vastu utsargaḥ
translated: Zeal in the perfections,🔽abandoning the means of gathering beings,

analyzed: brahmavihāra abhiniṣpādana tā
translated: accomplishing the divine abodes,

analyzed: abhijñā vikrīḍanā tā
translated: and delighting in the superknowledges.

analyzed: caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ bodhisattvena atṛpta vihāriṇā bhavitavyam
translated: A bodhisattva should dwell with four qualities of insatiable practice.

original: dānātṛptatayā dharmaśravaṇātṛptatayā bhāvanātṛptatayā sattvebhyaḥ saṅgrahavastvatṛptatayā viharatavyaṃ /
analyzed: dāna atṛpta tayā dharma śravaṇa atṛpta tayā bhāvanā atṛpta tayā sattvebhyaḥ saṅgraha vastu atṛpta tayā viharatavyam
translated: One should dwell with insatiable generosity, insatiable listening to the Dharma, insatiable meditation, and insatiable gathering of beings with the means of gathering.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ime bodhisattvena akṣayāḥ nidhayaḥ paripūrayitavyāḥ
translated: These four inexhaustible treasures should be fulfilled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: śraddhā bodhisattvena akṣayaḥ nidhiḥ paripūrayitavyaḥ
translated: Faith is an inexhaustible treasure to be fulfilled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: dharma deśanā pariṇāmanā daridra sattva parigrahaḥ ca akṣayaḥ nidhiḥ paripūrayitavyaḥ
translated: Teaching the Dharma, dedication, and embracing poor beings are inexhaustible treasures to be fulfilled.

analyzed: catasraḥ imāḥ bodhisattva pariśuddhiḥ
translated: These are the four purities of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: katamāḥ catasraḥ
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: nairātmya tayā śīla pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of morality through selflessness.

analyzed: niḥsattva tayā samādhi pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of concentration through absence of living beings.

analyzed: nirjīva tayā prajñā pariśuddhiḥ
translated: Purity of wisdom through absence of a person.

analyzed: niṣpudgala tayā vimukti pariśuddhiḥ vimukti jñāna darśana tayā ca
translated: Purity of liberation through absence of an individual, and purity of the knowledge and vision of liberation.

analyzed: catvāraḥ dharmāḥ bodhisattvena paripūrayitavyāḥ
translated: Four dharmas should be fulfilled by the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: yaiḥ bodhisattvāḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyanti
translated: By which the Bodhisattvas quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: ākāśa cakram pravartayanti
translated: They set in motion the wheel of space.

original: acintyacakramatulyacakraṃ anabhilāpyacakraṃ nairyāṇikacakraṃ nairvedhikacakraṃ apravṛtticakraṃ pravartayanti /
analyzed: acintya cakram atulya cakram anabhilāpya cakram nairyāṇika cakram nairvedhika cakram apravṛtti cakram pravartayanti
translated: They set in motion the inconceivable wheel, the incomparable wheel, the inexpressible wheel, the wheel of going forth, the penetrating wheel, the wheel of non-arising.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ vimalavaiśāyanānāgate'dhvanyatikrānta ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'cirapraviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe praśānte pañcakaṣāye kāle vardhamāne āyuṣi aśītivarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam vimala vaiśāyana anāgata idhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye cira praviṣṭe bhadrake kalpe praśānte pañca kaṣāye kāle vardhamāne āyuṣi aśīti varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In the future, O Vimalavaiśāyāna, after one asaṃkhyeya eon equal to the sands of the Ganges has passed, in the auspicious eon that has not yet begun, at a time when the five degenerations have subsided and lifespans are increasing, in an age when the lifespan is eighty thousand years, you will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: maitreyo nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be called the Tathāgata Maitreya, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: atha vimalavaiśāyano brāhmaṇo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvaikānte sthitvā puṣpamālyacurṇairbhagavataḥ pūjodyukto gāthābhirabhiṣṭauti /
analyzed: atha vimalavaiśāyanaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā ekānte sthitvā puṣpa mālya curṇaiḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā udyuktaḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭauti
translated: Then the Brahmin Vimalvaisya, having bowed down at the feet of Tathagata Ratnagarbha with the five points of his body, stood to one side, and being eager to worship the Blessed One with flowers, garlands and powders, he praised him with these verses:

original: bhava nātha lalāṭaviśālā rucirorṇā himavarṇā🔽kanakagirikūṭā sadṛśāstu manāthā /
analyzed: bhava nātha lalāṭa viśālā rucira ūrṇā hima varṇā  sadṛśā astu manāthā
translated: O Lord, your forehead is broad, with a beautiful curl, white like snow,🔽Resembling the peak of a golden mountain, I am without a protector.

original: kaste na nayu muni vṛṣabhā lokapradīpā guṇaśatabharitā kālo'yaṃ me uktaṃ bhavahi buddhajage //
analyzed: kaḥ te na muni vṛṣabhāḥ loka pradīpāḥ guṇa śata bharitā me uktam
translated: Who will be your disciple, O Sage, O Bull among Men, O Lamp of the World, filled with hundreds of virtues? This is my time, O Blessed One, speak to the world of Buddhas.

original: sarve samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena purohitena sahasraṃ vedapāṭhakānāṃ bodhau samādāpitāṃ /
analyzed: sarve samudrareṇunā brāhmaṇena purohitena sahasram vedapāṭhakānām bodhau samādāpitām
translated: All of them were inspired for enlightenment by Samudrarenu, the royal priest, together with a thousand reciters of the Vedas.

original: yathā krakutsandaḥ kanakamuniḥ kāśyapo maitreyo vyākṛta evaṃ siṃhaḥ pradyotaḥ yāvaddvirūnaṃ sahasraṃ vedapāṭhakānāṃ māṇavakānāṃ sarve'smin bhadrake kalpe'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ kṛtavantaḥ /
analyzed: yathā krakutsandaḥ kanakamuniḥ kāśyapaḥ maitreyaḥ vyākṛtaḥ evam siṃhaḥ pradyotaḥ yāvat dvis ūnam sahasram vedapāṭhakānām māṇavakānām sarvesmin bhadrake kalpena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam kṛtavantaḥ
translated: Just as Krakutsanda, Kanakamuni, Kashyapa, and Maitreya were prophesied, so were the lion, the radiant one, and the rest of the thousand reciters of the Vedas, all of whom in this auspicious eon made aspirations for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sarve ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatenāsminneva bhadrake kalpe'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyavasthāpitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena asmin eva bhadrake kalpena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyavasthāpitāḥ
translated: All of them were established in the highest perfect enlightenment by the Tathagata Ratnagarbha in this very auspicious eon.

analyzed: yaḥ teṣām sarva kanyasaḥ purohitena saṃcoditaḥ
translated: The youngest of them was urged by the priest:

analyzed: kim bho mahā bala vega dhārī dīrgham nirīkṣase
translated: Why, O mighty one of powerful speed, do you look so long?

analyzed: utpādayasva sattveṣu mahā karuṇām
translated: Arouse great compassion for beings.

analyzed: imābhiḥ ca gāthābhiḥ vijñāpayati
translated: And he made this request with these verses:

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ jarā vyādhi mṛtyubhiḥ bhayā
translated: Those beings who are frightened by old age, sickness, and death,

analyzed: tṛṣṇā nadī patitā
translated: Have fallen into the river of craving,

analyzed: prakṣiptāḥ bhava cārake pratibhayam
translated: Thrown into the terrifying prison of existence,

analyzed: skandhe niviṣṭāḥ narāḥ
translated: Men are attached to the aggregates.

analyzed: pītvā kleśa viṣam paraspara vadham
translated: Having drunk the poison of afflictions, killing each other,

analyzed: duḥkha arṇave saṃsthitā
translated: They remain in the ocean of suffering.

analyzed: mohe andhe praṇaṣṭa mārge
translated: In the blind darkness of delusion, lost on the path,

analyzed: aśubha saṃsāra yantre bhraman
translated: Wandering in the inauspicious machine of samsara,

analyzed: duḥkhena jālita bhūta sarvatribhaveya
translated: Everywhere in the three worlds, burned by suffering,

analyzed: mithyāya dṛṣṭi sthitāḥ
translated: They remain in false views.

analyzed: sarvaprāṇa bhramanti pañcagati
translated: All beings wander in the five destinies,

original: bhiścakraṃ yathā vartate /🔽dharmā cakṣu vihīna pañcagati
analyzed: bhis cakram yathā vartate  dharmā cakṣu vihīna pañcagati
translated: Like a wheel in motion.🔽I remember the beings in the five destinies,

analyzed: bhiratrāṇa sattvān smarī
translated: Who lack the eye of Dharma and are without protection.

analyzed: bhāve jahitvā kaṅkṣavimati
translated: Having abandoned wisdom and meditation, with doubt and uncertainty,

analyzed: bodhāya candam jane
translated: Generate the aspiration for enlightenment.

analyzed: tṛṣṇā śoka nudaḥ bhavāhi
translated: Be the dispeller of craving and sorrow for the world,

analyzed: bandhuḥ bhava
translated: Be a friend to beings.

analyzed: kleśa bandhana mokṣaṇa artham
translated: For the sake of liberating the world from the bondage of afflictions,

analyzed: bodhāya cittam name
translated: Bow your mind to enlightenment.

analyzed: dharma cakṣuḥ vihīna moha vigata
translated: Devoid of the eye of Dharma, overcome with delusion,

analyzed: mārgam ca śreṣṭa dada
translated: Give the supreme path.

analyzed: saṃsāra bhava cārakeṣu jvalitām
translated: In the burning of the cycle of existence and becoming,

analyzed: dharma rasena tarpayā
translated: Satisfy with the nectar of Dharma.

analyzed: tvam śīghram upasaṃkramya hita kara
translated: You, the benefactor, quickly approach

analyzed: pādāḥ nipatyam mune
translated: And fall at the feet of the Sage.

analyzed: sarvā bho praṇidhi praśastra su dṛḍha
translated: All your aspirations are praised, well-established,

analyzed: buddhaḥ bhava nāyakaḥ
translated: Become a Buddha, a leader.

analyzed: sattva śvāsa karaḥ bhavāhi jagataḥ
translated: Be a comfort to beings, to the world,

analyzed: sattva arṇavāḥ uddhare
translated: Lift up the ocean of beings.

analyzed: mokṣa mārga praṇītaḥ indriya bala
translated: The excellent path of liberation, the powers of the senses,

analyzed: bodhyaṅga dātā bhavet
translated: May you be the giver of the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: dharma varṣam utsṛja dharma jaladam
translated: Release the rain of Dharma, the cloud of Dharma water,

analyzed: duḥkham śamet
translated: May the suffering of beings be pacified.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahābalavegadhārī māṇavaka āha
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahā bala vega dhārī māṇavakaḥ āha
translated: And that young man Mahābala-vegadhārin said:

analyzed: na aham bho upādhyāya saṃsāra abhirāmām śrīm ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: I do not, Venerable Preceptor, desire the glory of delighting in saṃsāra.

analyzed: na ca punar śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna abhilāśī
translated: And I do not aspire to the Śrāvaka or Pratyekabuddha vehicles.

analyzed: anuttara yānam ākāṅkṣāmi
translated: I aspire to the unsurpassed vehicle.

analyzed: muhūrtam bho upādhyāya pratīkṣāhi
translated: For a moment, teacher, wait.

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva yathā aham siṃha nādam nadāmi
translated: Listen as I roar the lion's roar.

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇastato'bhiniṣkramya svakāṃ pañcabrāhmaṇadārakānupasthāyakānāmantrayitvovāca bho dārakā utpādayatānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tatas abhiniṣkramya svakām pañca brāhmaṇa dārakān upasthāyakān āmantrayitvā uvāca bho dārakāḥ utpādayata anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu, having gone forth, addressed his five young brahmin attendants, saying, Young men, generate the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: te api āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: nāsmākaṃ kiñcid asti yad vayaṃ buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayāmaḥ /
analyzed: na asmākam kiñcid asti yat vayam buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayāmaḥ
translated: We have nothing to offer to the Buddha and the community of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: kathaṃ ca vayamanavaruptakuśalamūlā bodhicittamutpādayāmaḥ /🔽atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohitaḥ prathamaḥ karabhujo nāmopasthāyakaḥ tasya saptaratnamayaṃ karṇavibhūṣaṇaṃ datvā /🔽dvitīyaḥ sthālabhujo nāmopasthāyakaḥ tasya dvitīyaṃ saptaratnamayaṃ karṇaveṭhakaṃ datvā /
analyzed: katham ca vayam anavarupta kuśala mūlāḥ bodhi cittam utpādayāmaḥ  atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ prathamaḥ karabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam karṇa vibhūṣaṇam da tvā  dvitīyaḥ sthālabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya dvitīyam sapta ratna mayam karṇa veṭhakam da tvā
translated: How can we, whose wholesome roots are not yet planted, generate the mind set on enlightenment?🔽Then, noble sir, the brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, gave his first attendant, named Karabhuj, an earring made of the seven precious substances,🔽his second attendant, named Sthalabhuj, an earring made of the seven precious substances,

original: tṛtīyaḥ jalabhujo nāmopasthāyakastasya saptaratnamayaṃ pīṭhaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ jalabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam pīṭham dadāti
translated: and his third attendant, named Jalabhuj, a seat made of the seven precious substances.

original: ceturthaḥ vegabhujo nāmopasthāyakastasya saptaratnamayaṃ daṇḍaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: vegabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sapta ratna mayam daṇḍam dadāti
translated: The fourth attendant, named Vegabhuja, gave him a staff made of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: pañcamaḥ sārabhujaḥ nāma upasthāyakaḥ tasya sarva sauvarṇa bhṛṅgāram da tvā uvāca
translated: The fifth attendant, named Sarabhuja, gave him a golden water pot and said:

original: gacchata yūyaṃ māṇavakā imāni vastūni buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayitvānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayatha /
analyzed: gacchata yūyam māṇavakāḥ imāni vastūni buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayitvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayatha
translated: Go, young men, and offer these things to the Buddha and the assembly of monks, and generate the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: atha te pañcopasthāyakā gatvā bhagavatsakāśaṃ tāni vastuni yathā nikṣiptāni buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṅghasya niryātayitvaivamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te pañca upasthāyakāḥ gatvā bhagavat sakāśam tāni vastuni yathā nikṣiptāni buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṅghasya niryātayitvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those five attendants went to the Blessed One, offered those things as they had been placed to the Buddha and the assembly of monks, and said:

analyzed: vyākarotu asmākam bhagavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May the Blessed One prophesy our unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tasmin ca bhadrake kalpe vayema anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyamahi
translated: And in that auspicious eon, may we attain unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: peyālaṃ / vyākṛtāḥ kulaputra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena karabhujo māṇavako bodhāya bhadrakalpe dṛḍhasvaro nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: peyālam vyākṛtāḥ kula putra ratnagarbheṇa tathāgatena karabhujaḥ māṇavakaḥ bodhāya bhadra kalpe dṛḍhasvaraḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: Peyaṃ. The young man Karabhuja was prophesied by the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha to attain perfect enlightenment in the auspicious eon as the Tathāgata named Dṛḍhasvara.

analyzed: sthālabhujaḥ tad antare sukhendriyamatiḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: In the interval, there will be a Tathāgata named Sukhendramatī in Sthālabhuja.

analyzed: tasya anantare jalabhujaḥ sārthavādiḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: Immediately after him, there will be a Tathāgata named Sārthavādi in Jalabhuja.

original: tasyānusaṃdheḥ vegabhujaḥ priyaprasanno nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya anusaṃdheḥ vegabhujaḥ priyaprasannaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: Immediately after him, there will be a Tathāgata named Priyaprasanna in Vegabhuja.

original: tasyānusaṃdheḥ sārabhujo nāma māṇavako haripatracūḍo nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: tasya anusaṃdheḥ sārabhujaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ haripatracūḍaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgataḥ
translated: Immediately after him, there will be a Tathāgata named Haripatracuḍa in Sārabhuja, a young brahmin.

original: samanantaravyākṛtāste pañcabhadrakalpikā māṇavakāḥ purohitaḥ punarapi mahābalavegadhāriṇamāha mahābalavegadhārī gṛhṇāhi buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān /
analyzed: samanantara vyākṛtāḥ te pañcabhadra kalpikāḥ māṇavakāḥ purohitaḥ punar api mahā bala vega dhāriṇam āha mahā bala vega dhārī gṛhṇāhi buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān
translated: As soon as those five young men of the Bhadrakalpa were prophesied, the family priest again said to Mahābalavegadhārin, Mahābalavegadhārin, take up the adornments of the qualities of a Buddha-field.

analyzed: karohi praṇidhānam bhagavataḥ sakāśāt yādṛśam ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Make a vow in the presence of the Blessed One, as you desire.

analyzed: nimantrayāhi sarva sattvān dharma rasena
translated: Invite all beings with the nectar of the Dharma.

analyzed: carāhi ca dṛḍha vīryeṇa svakam bodhi cārikām
translated: Practice with firm vigor your own course of conduct for enlightenment.

analyzed: mā bhūyas dīrgham nirīkṣasva
translated: Do not look too far ahead.

analyzed: bāhunā ca gṛhītvā bhagavatā ntikam upanītaḥ
translated: And taking him by the arm, he was brought into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: sa ca kulaputra mahābalavegadhārī māṇavako bhagavataḥ purato niṣaṇṇaścāha kiyadbahavo bhagavannanāgate'dhvani munibhāskarā asmin bhadrakalpe
analyzed: sa ca kula putra mahābalavegadhārī māṇavakaḥ bhagavataḥ puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ ca āha kiyat bahavaḥ bhagavan anāgatedhvani muni bhāskarāḥ asmin bhadra kalpe
translated: And that young man, the bearer of great strength and speed, sitting in front of the Blessed One, said, How many sages will appear in the future, in this fortunate eon, Blessed One?

original: ratnagarbhastathāgata āha tasmin māṇavaka bhadrake kalpe caturuttaraṃ sahasraṃ munibhāskarāṇāṃ udayaḥ /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ āha tasmin māṇavaka bhadrake kalpe catur uttaram sahasram muni bhāskarāṇām udayaḥ
translated: The Tathagata Ratnagarbha said, Young man, in that fortunate eon, there will be an arising of one thousand and four sages.

original: māṇavaka āha yāvatteṣāṃ bhadanta bhagavan bhadrake mahākalpe nirvṛtānāṃ jinasūryāṇāṃ paścimako sārabhujo nāma māṇavako'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate haripatracūḍo nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgata /
analyzed: māṇavakaḥ āha  yāvat teṣām bhadanta bhagavan bhadrake mahākalpe nirvṛtānām jina sūryāṇām paścimakaḥ sārabhujaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate haripatracūḍaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati tathāgata
translated: The young man said, Venerable Blessed One, after the passing away of those sages, the suns of the victors, in that fortunate great eon, the last one will be a young man named Sārabhūja, who will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and become the Tathāgata named Haripatracuḍa.

analyzed: tāvat ciram aham bodhisattva cārikām cariṣyāmi vividha vrata tapa caryā dāna dama saṃyama śruta vīrya kṣānti sauratya puṇya prajñā saṃbhāram samudānayamānaḥ
translated: For that long, I will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, accumulating the requisites of various vows, austerities, giving, self-restraint, restraint, learning, diligence, patience, and merit and wisdom.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca bhadrakalpikānāmacirābhisaṃbuddhānāṃ prathamaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ dadyāṃ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca bhadrakalpikānām acira abhisaṃbuddhānām prathamam piṇḍapātam dadyām
translated: And I will offer the first alms to all those who will attain enlightenment in the fortunate eon.

analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca śarīra pūjām kuryām
translated: I would make offerings to the bodies of those who have passed into parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: teṣām ca saddharma dhārakaḥ bhaveyam
translated: I would be a holder of their true Dharma.

original: śīlavirahitān sattvān śīlasaṃpadi samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: śīla virahitān sattvān śīla saṃpadi samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I would inspire, introduce, and establish beings who lack morality in the perfection of morality.

original: dṛṣṭivirahitān saṅkaṭaprāptān sattvān samyakdṛṣṭyāṃ samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi virahitān saṅkaṭa prāptān sattvān samyakdṛṣṭyām samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I would inspire, introduce, and establish beings who lack right view and have fallen into difficult situations in right view.

analyzed: evam āśaya virahitān samyak āśaye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: In the same way, I would establish those who lack intention in the right intention.

analyzed: evam ācāra virahitā anācāre pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: In the same way, I would establish those who lack conduct in conduct.

analyzed: nānāvidhānām sattvānām kuśala caryām nidarśayeyam
translated: I would show the wholesome conduct of various beings.

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmacirāstāṅgate saddharme punarahaṃ saddharmanetrī saddharmaparigrahaṃ saddharmasyotpādaṃ saddharmapradīpaṃ loke jvālayeyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām acira asta aṅgate saddharme punar aham saddharma netrī saddharma parigraham saddharmasya utpādam saddharma pradīpam loke jvālayeyam
translated: And when the true Dharma of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, has disappeared, I would light the lamp of the true Dharma, the acceptance of the true Dharma, the arising of the true Dharma, the light of the true Dharma in the world.

original: śastrāntarakalpakālasamaye sattvān prāṇātipātavairamaṇyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ yāvat samyagdṛṣṭyāṃ /
analyzed: śastra antara kalpa kāla samaye sattvān prāṇa atipāta vaira maṇyām pratiṣṭhāpayeyam yāvat samyagdṛṣṭyām
translated: During the time of the intermediate eon of weapons, I would establish beings in abstention from killing and so on up to right view.

analyzed: daśā kuśala karma pathebhyaḥ sattvān kumārgāt uddhṛtya samyakpathe sthāpayeyam
translated: I would rescue beings from the ten unwholesome courses of action and establish them in the right path.

analyzed: duṣcarita andhakāram ca nāśayeyam
translated: I would destroy the darkness of bad conduct.

analyzed: su carita ālokam ca nidarśayeyam
translated: I would show the light of good conduct.

analyzed: kalpa kaṣāyam yāvat ca āyuḥ dṛṣṭi kleśa kaṣāyam ca loke nāśayeyam
translated: I would destroy the defilements of the world, up to the defilements of the aeon of destruction and the defilements of views and afflictions.

original: durbhikṣāntarakalpakālasamaye'haṃ sattvāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ niyojayeyaṃ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: durbhikṣa antara kalpa kāla samaya iham sattvām dāna pāramitāyām niyojayeyam yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam
translated: At the time of the aeon of famine, I would engage beings in the perfection of generosity and inspire them up to the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: ṣaṣ pāramitāsu aham sattvān niyojayamānaḥ sarva durbhikṣa andhakāra kali kaluṣa raṇa vaira vigraha vivādam śamayeyam
translated: Engaging beings in the six perfections, I would pacify all famines, darkness, quarrels, defilements, battles, enmities, disputes, and arguments.

analyzed: sattvānām santatau kleśa analam śamayeyam
translated: I would extinguish the fire of afflictions in the continuum of beings.

analyzed: roga antara kalpa kāla samaye ca aham sattvām ṣaṣ pārāyaṇīyeṣu samādāpayeyam
translated: At the time of the aeon of disease, I would inspire beings to take the six perfections.

original: caturṣu saṅgrahavastuṣu niyojayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /🔽rogāndhakāraṃ ca sattvānāṃ vidhvaṃsayeyaṃ /
analyzed: caturṣu saṅgraha vastuṣu niyojayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam  roga andhakāram ca sattvānām vidhvaṃsayeyam
translated: I would engage and establish them in the four means of gathering disciples.🔽I would destroy the darkness of disease for beings.

analyzed: yāvat sattvānām santatau kleśam praśamayeyam
translated: Up to pacifying the afflictions in the continuum of beings.

original: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrakalpe sattvānevaṃrūpairvyasanaiḥ parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre bhadra kalpe sattvān evaṃrūpaiḥ vyasanaiḥ parimocayeyam
translated: I would liberate beings in the Sahā buddha-field in the Fortunate Eon from such calamities.

original: yadā caturuttaraṃ sahasraṃ buddhā bhagavanto bhadrake mahākalpe utpannā nirvṛtāśca bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yadā catur uttaram sahasram buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhadrake mahā kalpe utpannāḥ nirvṛtāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: When the four thousand and one Buddhas, Blessed Ones, have arisen and passed into nirvāṇa in the Fortunate Eon,

original: sarveṇa sarvaṃ ca saddharmanetrī antarhitā bhavet /
analyzed: sarveṇa sarvam ca saddharmanetrī antarhitā bhavet
translated: and the entire path of the true Dharma has disappeared,

analyzed: tatas paścāt aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then I would awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yāvāṃścaturuttarasahasrāṇāṃ bhadrakalpikānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmāyurbhavet tāntakam mama bodhiprāptasya dīrghamāyurbhavet /
analyzed: yāvān catur uttara sahasrāṇām bhadra kalpikānām buddhānām bhagavatām āyuḥ bhavet tāntakam mama bodhi prāptasya dīrgham āyuḥ bhavet
translated: And my lifespan would be as long as the lifespans of the four thousand and one Buddhas, Blessed Ones, of the Fortunate Eon, when I attain enlightenment.

original: yāvāṃśca teṣāṃ śrāvakasaṅgho bhavet tāvān mamaikasya śrāvakasaṅghaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yāvān ca teṣām śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhavet tāvān mama ekasya śrāvaka saṅghaḥ syāt
translated: My assembly of disciples would be as numerous as the assemblies of disciples of all of them combined.

original: yāvataśca te kalpaiścaturuttaraṃ buddhasahasraṃ sattvān viniyet tāvataḥ sattvān ahaṃ vinayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvataḥ ca te kalpaiḥ catur uttaram buddha sahasram sattvān viniyet tāvataḥ sattvān aham vinayeyam
translated: And I would guide as many beings as those four thousand and one Buddhas guide in the eons.

original: ye ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śrāvakaśikṣāyāṃ skhaleyurdṛṣṭiprapāte vā prapateyurbuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśe'gauravacittāḥ praduṣṭacittā
analyzed: ye ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śrāvaka śikṣāyām skhaleyuḥ dṛṣṭi prapāte vā prapateyuḥ buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśe gaurava cittāḥ praduṣṭa cittāḥ
translated: And those who would stumble in the training of the disciples of those Buddha-Bhagavans, or fall into the abyss of wrong views, or have disrespectful thoughts towards the Buddha-Bhagavans, or have defiled thoughts,

analyzed: dharme saṅghe ca skhalita cittāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: or have thoughts of stumbling towards the Dharma and the Sangha,

original: rāgacittā āryāpavādāḥ ānantaryakārāśca bhaveyurbodhiprāptaścāhaṃ sarvān saṃsārapaṅkāduddhareyaṃ /
analyzed: rāga cittāḥ ārya apavādāḥ ānantarya kārāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham sarvān saṃsāra paṅkāt uddhareyam
translated: or have thoughts of passion, or slander noble ones, or commit the acts of immediate retribution, may I, upon attaining enlightenment, deliver all of them from the mire of cyclic existence.

analyzed: abhayapure ca nirvāṇa nagare prāveśayeyam
translated: And may I cause them to enter the city of fearlessness, the city of nirvana.

original: yāvan mama parinirvṛtasya saddharmakṣayo na bhavet tāvad bhadrakamahākalpe'kṣayo bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat mama parinirvṛtasya saddharma kṣayaḥ na bhavet tāvat bhadraka mahā kalpa ikṣayaḥ bhaveyam
translated: As long as there is no disappearance of the true Dharma after my parinirvana, for that long may I be inexhaustible in the auspicious great kalpa.

analyzed: niṣṭhite mama saddharme niṣṭhite bhadra kalpe
translated: When my true Dharma has disappeared, and the auspicious kalpa has ended,

original: ye mama dhātavo janmaśarīraḥ te'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāstathāgatavigrahāḥ saṃtiṣṭheran dvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtagātrāḥ /
analyzed: ye mama dhātavaḥ janma śarīraḥ te prameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ saṃtiṣṭheran dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛta gātrāḥ
translated: may my relics, my birth body, remain as immeasurable and countless Tathagata forms adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

analyzed: ekaikam lakṣaṇam aśītibhiḥ anuvyañjanaiḥ samalaṅkṛtam bhavet
translated: May each mark be adorned with the eighty minor characteristics.

original: te ca tathāgatavigrahā daśasu dikṣvaprameyebhyo'saṃkhyeyebhyaḥ śūnyebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo gatvā ekaiko buddhavigraho'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāṃ tribhiryānaiḥ sattvān samādāpayet niveśayet pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: te ca tathāgata vigrahāḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyebhyaḥ asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ śūnyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ gatvā ekaikaḥ buddha vigraha uprameya asaṃkhyeyām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ sattvān samādāpayet niveśayet pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: And those Tathāgata-forms, going to immeasurable and incalculable empty Buddha-fields in the ten directions, each single Buddha-form would inspire, establish, and settle immeasurable and incalculable beings in the three vehicles.

original: yatra buddhakṣetre'ntarakalpe na nāśo bhavet tatra tathāgatavigrahaḥ sattvān paritrāyedyathā pūrvoktaṃ tathā paścāccintāmaṇiḥ prādurbhavet /
analyzed: yatra buddhakṣetre intara kalpe na nāśaḥ bhavet tatra tathāgata vigrahaḥ sattvān paritrāyet yathā pūrva uktam tathā paścāt cintāmaṇiḥ prādurbhavet
translated: In the Buddha-field where there would be no destruction in an intermediate kalpa, there the Tathāgata-form would protect beings as previously stated, and afterwards a wish-fulfilling jewel would appear.

original: yeśu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvā ratnavirahitā bhaveyuḥ teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā ratnavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣānnidhayaśca saṃdarśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ ratna virahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvā ratna vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣāt nidhayaḥ ca saṃdarśayeyuḥ
translated: In those Buddha-fields where beings would be devoid of jewels, going to those Buddha-fields, they would rain down a shower of jewels and reveal treasure troves.

original: yeṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ kuśalakriyāvirahitā bhaveyuḥ vyādhibhīḥ kliṣṭāsteṣu buddhakṣetresu gośīrṣoragasārakālānusārī gandhavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ kuśala kriyā virahitāḥ bhaveyuḥ vyādhi bhīḥ kliṣṭāḥ teṣu buddhakṣetresu gośīrṣa uraga sāra kāla anusārī gandha vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣeyuḥ
translated: And in those Buddha-fields where beings would be devoid of wholesome actions and afflicted by the fear of disease, in those Buddha-fields a rain of perfume from the head of a cow, from the ocean, and from the agaru tree would fall.

original: sā ca gandhavṛṣṭiḥ sattvānāṃ kleśavyādhīrdṛṣṭivyādhīḥ kāyavyādhīśca praśamayet /
analyzed: sā ca gandha vṛṣṭiḥ sattvānām kleśa vyādhīḥ dṛṣṭi vyādhīḥ kāya vyādhīḥ ca praśamayet
translated: And that rain of perfume would pacify the afflictions, the diseases of views, and the diseases of the body of beings.

original: tataste sattvāḥ puṇyakriyāvastuṣvabhiyuktā bhaveyuḥ svargaparāyaṇā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatas te sattvāḥ puṇya kriyā vastuṣu abhiyuktāḥ bhaveyuḥ svarga parāyaṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Then those beings would be devoted to the bases of meritorious action and would be intent on heaven.

original: evaṃrūpamahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpam aham bhadanta bhagavan bodhi cārikām caramāṇaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: In this way, Venerable Blessed One, while practicing the conduct for enlightenment, I would protect beings.

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham evaṃrūpam buddha kāryam kuryām
translated: And having attained enlightenment, I would perform such a Buddha's work.

analyzed: parinirvṛtaḥ ca aham eva ananta aparyantebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ sattvān paritrāyeyam
translated: And after my parinirvāṇa, I would protect beings from the infinite and boundless Buddha-fields.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannaivaṃrūpā āśā paripūryetā na ca sattvānāṃ bhaiṣajyabhūto bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan na evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryetā na ca sattvānām bhaiṣajya bhūtaḥ bhaveyam
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, and I am not to become a medicine for beings,

original: visaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyurye daśasu dikṣvanatāparyanteṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: visaṃvāditāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaveyuḥ ye daśasu dikṣu anatā paryanteṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti sattvānām dharmam deśayanti
translated: then the Blessed Buddhas who reside, uphold, and live on in the infinite and boundless world systems in the ten directions, teaching the Dharma to beings, would be deceived by me.

analyzed: mā me bhagavān vyākuryāt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: May the Blessed One not prophesy me for supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ye'pi te saṃpratipannāṃ bhagavan bahuprāṇakoṭyo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ sattvāstān ahaṃ buddhān bhagavato virādhayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye api te saṃpratipannām bhagavan bahu prāṇa koṭyaḥ unuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ sattvāḥ tān aham buddhān bhagavataḥ virādhayeyam
translated: “Blessed One, I would rather not be able to please the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and those many millions of beings who have been prophesied by the Blessed One to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: mā ca ārādhayeyam
translated: I would rather not please them.

original: mā ca me bhūyo bodhihetoḥ saṃsāre saṃsāramāṇasya buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdaḥ kuśalaśabdaḥ kuśalakarmakriyāśabdaḥ śrotrapatheṣu nipatet /
analyzed: mā ca me bhūyas bodhi hetoḥ saṃsāre saṃsāramāṇasya buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ kuśala śabdaḥ kuśala karma kriyā śabdaḥ śrotra patheṣu nipatet
translated: And I would rather not hear the words ‘Buddha,’ ‘Dharma,’ and ‘Saṅgha,’ or the words ‘wholesome action’ and ‘wholesome practice,’ in my ears while I am wandering in cyclic existence for the sake of enlightenment.

analyzed: nityam aham avīci paryāpannaḥ bhaveyam
translated: I would rather always be in the Avīci hell.

analyzed: yadi me bhagavat na evaṃrūpā āśā paripuryeta
translated: Blessed One, if my wish is not fulfilled in this way,

analyzed: atha ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ mahā bala vega dhāriṇaḥ māṇavakasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha gave the young man Mahābalavegadhārin the approval:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: “Good, good! Good man,

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ satpuruṣa sattvānāṃ bhaiṣajyabhūtaḥ duḥkhebhyaśca parimocakastena tvaṃ satpuruṣa bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalo nāma bhavasva /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam sat puruṣa sattvānām bhaiṣajya bhūtaḥ duḥkhebhyaḥ ca parimocakaḥ tena tvam sat puruṣa bhaiṣajya rāja jyotiḥ vimalaḥ nāma bhavasva
translated: you will become medicine for beings and a liberator from suffering. Therefore, good man, you should be called Bhaiṣajyarāja Jyotirvibhāsa.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalānāgate'dhvanyekasmin gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'tikrānte'nupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye bhadrake kalpe caturuttarasya buddhasahasrasyācirābhisaṃbuddhānāṃ piṇḍapātaṃ dāsyasi yāvadyathā svayaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam bhaiṣajya rājajyotiḥ vimala anāgata idhvani ekasmin gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya iti krānta anupraviṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye bhadrake kalpe catur uttarasya buddha sahasrasya acira abhisaṃbuddhānām piṇḍapātam dāsyasi yāvat yathā svayam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You will be the one to give alms to the thousand Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, beginning with Vipaśyin, and to the thousand Buddhas of the Excellent Eon, beginning with Krakucchanda, in the future, when one Ganges river's worth of eons has passed, and you have entered the second Ganges river's worth of eons, and the eon is named 'Pure Light of the King of Medicines.' You will give alms to them, just as you have made a vow yourself.

original: nirvṛtasya ca haripatracūḍabhadrasya tathāgatasya saddharme'ntarhite'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: nirvṛtasya ca haripatracūḍabhadrasya tathāgatasya saddharmentarhitena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: And when the Tathāgata Haripattracūḍabhadra has passed into Nirvāṇa, and the True Dharma has disappeared, you will attain the highest complete enlightenment.

original: rocaśca nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyasi yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: rocaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: You will be the Tathāgata named Roca, up to the Blessed One, the Buddha.

analyzed: ardha kalpam ca te āyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Your lifespan will be half an eon.

original: yāvacca tasya caturuttarasya buddhasahasrasya bhadrakalpikānāṃ śrāvakasaṅgho bhaviṣyati tāvacca tavaikasya śrāvakasaṅgho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yāvat ca tasya catur uttarasya buddha sahasrasya bhadra kalpikānām śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhaviṣyati tāvat ca tava ekasya śrāvaka saṅghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Your assembly of disciples will be as numerous as the assembly of disciples of the thousand Buddhas of the Fortunate Eon, beginning with Vipaśyin, and the thousand Buddhas of the Excellent Eon, beginning with Krakucchanda.

analyzed: tāvataḥ ca sattvān vinayiṣyasi
translated: You will guide that many beings.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca saddharmāntardhānaṃ bhadrakasya mahākalpasya kalpakṣayo na bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca saddharma antardhānam bhadrakasya mahā kalpasya kalpa kṣayaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: And after his parinirvāṇa, the disappearance of the true Dharma will not occur during the destruction of the eon of the Fortunate Great Eon.

analyzed: etāvantaḥ ca buddha vigrahāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be this many Buddha images.

original: yāvacchūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gandhavṛṣṭiḥ sattvānāṃ kleśavyādhirdṛṣṭivyādhīḥ kāyavyādhīśca śamayiṣyati /
analyzed: yāvat śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gandha vṛṣṭiḥ sattvānām kleśa vyādhiḥ dṛṣṭi vyādhīḥ kāya vyādhīḥ ca śamayiṣyati
translated: As long as there are empty Buddha-fields, the rain of perfume will pacify the afflictions, the afflictions of views, and the afflictions of the body of beings.

original: triṣu caiva puṇyakriyāvastuṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti svargaparāyaṇāṃśca /🔽atha khalu kulaputra bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalo bodhisattva āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā me bhagavān satapuṇyalakṣaṇālaṅkṛtena pāṇinā mūrdhānāṃ sparśatu /
analyzed: triṣu ca eva puṇya kriyā vastuṣu sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti svarga parāyaṇān ca  atha khalu kula putra bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā me bhagavān sata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtena pāṇinā mūrdhānām sparśatu
translated: And they will establish beings in the three meritorious activities, and those devoted to heaven.🔽Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-rāja-jyoti-viśuddha said, If, reverend Lord, this kind of hope of mine is to be fulfilled, then may the Lord touch the top of my head with his hand adorned with the marks of a hundred merits.

original: atha khalu kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgataḥ śatapuṇyalakṣaṇālaṅkṛtena pāṇinā bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalasya bodhisattvasya mūrdhānaṃ parimārjayitvā tasthau /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ śata puṇya lakṣaṇa alaṅkṛtena pāṇinā bhaiṣajyarājajyotiḥ vimalasya bodhisattvasya mūrdhānam parimārjayitvā tasthau
translated: Then, noble sir, the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha, having touched the top of the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-rāja-jyoti-viśuddha's head with his hand adorned with the marks of a hundred merits, remained there.

original: atha khalu kulaputra bhaiṣajyarājajyotirvimalo bodhisattvastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditacitto ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditavaikānte'tikramya sthitaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra bhaiṣajya rājajyotiḥ vimalaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramudita cittaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditavan ekānta atikramya sthitam
translated: Then, noble sir, the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajyarāja, pure as the moon, delighted, elated, and overjoyed, bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha, touching them with his forehead, and stood to one side.

analyzed: samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇaḥ divyena kauśika vastreṇa ācchādayitvā uvāca
translated: The brahmin Sāgara-rendu covered him with divine silk garments and said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: Excellent, excellent, good man!

analyzed: śobhanam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: You have made an excellent vow.

analyzed: na bhūyas tvayā mama upasthānam kartavyam
translated: You should not serve me any more.

analyzed: yathā sukham eva viharasva
translated: Live happily!

original: atha khalu kulaputra samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasyaitadabhavat mayā bahavaḥ prāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya etat abhavat mayā bahavaḥ prāṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni
translated: Then, noble sir, this occurred to the brahmin Sāgara-rendu: I have inspired many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of living beings to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: yathedaṃ sarvāvantaṃ parṣadaṃ paśyāmi sarvaiścemairmahāsattvairudārodārāṇi praṇidhānāni kṛtāni prasannāni ca buddhakṣetrāṇi parigṛhītāni sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunānyairbodhisattvaiḥ kaliyugaṃ parivarjitaṃ /
analyzed: yathā idam sarvāvantam parṣadam paśyāmi sarvaiḥ ca imaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ udāra udārāṇi praṇidhānāni kṛtāni prasannāni ca buddhakṣetrāṇi parigṛhītāni sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunā anyaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ kali yugam parivarjitam
translated: I see this entire assembly and all these great beings have made vast and lofty aspirations, and have chosen pure buddha-fields, except for Vayu and Vishnu. Other bodhisattvas have avoided the Kali Yuga.

original: mayāpi kaliyugakāle vartamāne sattvā dharmarasena tarpayitavyā /
analyzed: mayā api kali yuga kāle vartamāne sattvā dharma rasena tarpayitavyā
translated: But I will satisfy beings with the nectar of the Dharma during the time of the Kali Yuga.

analyzed: dṛdhaḥ ca vyavasāyaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: I must make my resolve firm.

original: tathārūpeṇa ca mayā praṇidhānena siṃhanādo naditavyaḥ /
analyzed: tathārūpeṇa ca mayā praṇidhānena siṃhanādaḥ naditavyaḥ
translated: I must roar the lion's roar with such an aspiration,

analyzed: yathā iyam sarvā bodhisattva parṣad āścarya prāptā bhavet
translated: so that this entire assembly of bodhisattvas will be amazed.

original: sarvāvatī ceyaṃ parṣā sadevagandharvamāṇuṣāsuraśca loko'yaṃ māṃ prāñjalībhūto namasyeta pūjāṃ ca kuryād /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca iyam parṣā sa deva gandharva māṇuṣa asuraḥ ca lokaḥ yam mām prāñjalībhūtaḥ namasyeta pūjām ca kuryāt
translated: And may this entire assembly, with the world of gods, gandharvas, humans, and asuras, join their palms in respect and bow to me, and make offerings to me.

original: ayaṃ ca me buddho bhagavān sādhukāramanuprayacchet vyākuryāt /
analyzed: ayam ca me buddhaḥ bhagavān sādhukāram anuprayacchet vyākuryāt
translated: And may this Buddha Bhagavan give his approval and proclaim my prediction.

original: tathā ye ca daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti te'pi buddhā bhagavanto mama siṃhanādaṃ nadataḥ sādhukāraṃ pradadyuḥ /
analyzed: tathā ye ca daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti sattvānām dharmam deśayanti te api buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama siṃhanādam nadataḥ sādhukāram pradadyuḥ
translated: And likewise, may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are present, living, and remaining in the ten directions, teaching the Dharma for the sake of beings, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, applaud my lion's roar.

analyzed: vyākuryuḥ ca anutarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And may they prophesy my unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: dūtāṃśca preṣayeyuryat sarvāvatīyaṃ parṣat śṛṇuyāt tāṃśca dūtān paśyet /
analyzed: dūtān ca preṣayeyuḥ yat sarvāvatī iyam parṣad śṛṇuyāt tān ca dūtān paśyet
translated: And may they send messengers so that this entire assembly may hear and see those messengers.

original: ye'pi ca tasyāṃ paścātkāle mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatā bodhisattvāste'pyevaṃrūpaṃ kliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ mahākaliyugakāle bodhiṃ praṇidhānena pratigṛhṇīyurdharmadurbhikṣakāntāre kleśaughairuhyamānān sattvān paritrāyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye api ca tasyām paścātkāle mahā karuṇā samanvāgatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ te api evaṃrūpam kliṣṭam buddhakṣetram mahā kali yuga kāle bodhim praṇidhānena pratigṛhṇīyuḥ dharma durbhikṣa kāntāre kleśa oghaiḥ uhyamānān sattvān paritrāyeyuḥ
translated: And those Bodhisattvas who in the future will be endowed with great compassion, they too will, with such a form, in a time of great strife, take up by aspiration a Buddha-field that is afflicted, and will rescue beings who are being carried away by the flood of afflictions in a wilderness of famine and distress.

analyzed: buddha kāryam ca kuryuḥ
translated: And they will perform the work of a Buddha.

analyzed: sattvānām dharmam deśayeyuḥ
translated: And they will teach the Dharma to beings.

translated: Beings make aspirations according to their intentions and accept the adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-fields. I have given predictions right there.

original: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha mamāpi bhadanta bhagavan hṛdayaṃ kaṃpati tadyathāpi kiṃśukapatraṃ paramadīnamānaso'haṃ sarvaśarīraṃ ca me āyāsitaṃ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha mama api bhadanta bhagavan hṛdayam kaṃpati tat yathā api kiṃśuka patram parama dīna mānasaḥ ham sarva śarīram ca me āyāsitam
translated: The Brahmin said, Venerable Blessed One, my heart is trembling like a kiṃśuka leaf. I am extremely distressed and my whole body is agitated.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ karuṇāspadabhūtā bodhisattvaistatkālamutsṛṣṭā mahākaliyugāndhakāraprakṣiptāḥ sarvaparivarjitāḥ /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ karuṇā āspada bhūtāḥ bodhisattvaiḥ tad kālam utsṛṣṭāḥ mahā kali yuga andhakāra prakṣiptāḥ sarva parivarjitāḥ
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, beings who are the objects of compassion of the bodhisattvas are abandoned by them at that time, cast into the darkness of the great Kali Yuga, and completely rejected,

original: ahamapi bhadanta bhagavannanāgate'dhvani atikrānte ekagaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye'vaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye tasmiṃśca bhadrake mahākalpe daśavarṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ kālaṃ pratīkṣamāṇāstāvacciramahaṃ saṃsāre na parikhidyeyaṃ bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇa /
analyzed: aham api bhadanta bhagavan anāgata idhvani atikrānte eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeya iva śiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā same saṃkhyeye tasmin ca bhadrake mahā kalpe daśa varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām kālam pratīkṣamāṇāḥ tāvat ciram aham saṃsāre na parikhidyeyam bodhi cārikām caramāṇa
translated: I too, Venerable Blessed One, in the future, after one incalculably long eon has passed, with two incalculably long eons remaining, in that auspicious great eon, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred years, while waiting for the time, may I not become weary for a long time in the world, practicing the conduct for enlightenment.

analyzed: utsahāyi ca aham samādhāna balena cira pācanayā an vaineyān pratigṛhṇāmi
translated: And I will encourage with the power of concentration, and for a long time I will accept those to be trained.

analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ caramāṇaḥ vaineyān pratigṛhṇāmi
translated: Practicing the six perfections, I will accept those to be trained.

original: śrutaṃ ca mayā bhagavataḥ sakāśād vastunimittaṃ parityāgeyaṃ dānapāramitā /
analyzed: śrutam ca mayā bhagavataḥ sakāśāt vastu nimittam parityāgā iyam dāna pāramitā
translated: And I have heard from the Blessed One that giving up possessions is the perfection of generosity.

original: tathārūpamahaṃ dānapāramitāṃ cariṣyāmi yathā janmāntareṣvaprameyāḥ sattvā yācanakā āgamiṣyanti teṣāṃ tathārūpāṃ parityāgaṃ parityajeyaṃ /
analyzed: tathārūpam aham dāna pāramitām cariṣyāmi yathā janmāntareṣu aprameyāḥ sattvāḥ yācanakāḥ āgamiṣyanti teṣām tathārūpām parityāgam parityajeyam
translated: I will practice the perfection of generosity in such a way that in future lives, countless beings will come as beggars, and I will give up such a form of renunciation to them.

original: tadyathānnapānakhādyabhojyapeyalehyavastraśayyāsanāśrayapratiśrayamālyagandhavilepanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyadānaṃ chatradhvajapatākādhanadhānyahastyaśvarathasuvarṇarūpyahiraṇyamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravāḍarajatajātarūpadakṣiṇāvartasarvāmahamevaṃ parityāgaṃ paramaprāsādakāruṇyamānasaḥ sattvānāṃ datvāphalābhikāṅkṣī sattvaparipācanārthaṃ vaineyasattvānugrahārthaṃ tyāgasaṃbhāraṃ parityajeyaṃ ye ca punaḥ sattvā atityāgayācanakā āgatvā yācayeran tadyathā dāsadāsīgrāmanagararājyabhāryāputraduhitṛhastaparityāgapādaparityāgakarṇanāsānayanajihvā
analyzed: tat yathā anna pāna khādya bhojya peya lehya vastra śayyā āsana āśraya pratiśraya mālya gandha vilepana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya dānam chatra dhvaja patākā dhana dhānya hasti aśva ratha suvarṇa rūpya hiraṇya maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa rajata jātarūpa dakṣiṇāvarta sarvām aham evam parityāgam parama prāsāda kāruṇya mānasaḥ sattvānām da tvā a phala abhikāṅkṣī sattva paripācana artham vaineya sattva anugraha artham tyāga saṃbhāram
translated: I will give to beings, with a mind of supreme faith and compassion, food, drink, edibles, tastables, drinkables, clothes, bedding, seats, shelter, garlands, fragrances, ointments, medicines for illness, and all other requisites, as well as parasols, banners, flags, wealth, grain, elephants, horses, chariots, gold, silver, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystals, coral, silver-colored gold, right-spiraling conches, and all other precious substances. Having given all this, I will not expect any fruits in return, but will do so solely for the sake of ripening beings and benefiting those to be trained. I will give up all these things as a collection of generosity. To those beings who come and ask for excessive gifts, such as male and female servants, villages and towns, kingdoms, wives, sons, daughters, hands, feet, ears, nose, tongue,

analyzed: carma rudhira asthi kāya jīvita śiraḥ parityāgam
translated: skin, blood, bones, body, life, and head, I will give them all without hesitation.🔽I will give up all these things as a collection of generosity.

original: evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ paramaprasannaḥ kāruṇyamānasaḥ aphalābhikāṅkṣī sattvānāṃ dānaṃ dadyāṃ vaineyānukaṃpārthaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ parama prasannaḥ kāruṇya mānasaḥ a phala abhikāṅkṣī sattvānām dānam dadyām vaineya anukaṃpā artham
translated: With such a form of generosity, being supremely delighted, with a compassionate mind, not desiring any fruits, I would give gifts to sentient beings out of compassion for those to be trained.

analyzed: tathārūpāyām aham dāna pāramitāyām cariṣyāmi
translated: I will practice that kind of perfection of generosity.

original: yanna kadācit pūrvaṃ kenacit sattvena evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ parityaktāḥ syurna ca punaḥ paścāt kaścid bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ parityājet /
analyzed: yat na kadācid pūrvam kenacid sattvena evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ parityaktāḥ syuḥ na ca punar paścāt kaścid bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caramāṇaḥ evaṃrūpāḥ parityāgāḥ parityājet
translated: So that no sentient being has ever given up such forms of generosity before, and no future Bodhisattva practicing the conduct for highest enlightenment will give up such forms of generosity.

original: yadahaṃ teṣu janmāntareṣu aprameyāsaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣvanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ dānapāramitāyāṃ careyaṃ
analyzed: yat aham teṣu janmāntareṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caramāṇaḥ dāna pāramitāyām careyam
translated: So that in those immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, while practicing the conduct for highest enlightenment, I will practice the perfection of generosity.

original: yadahaṃ mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatānāṃ paścimakānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ parityāganetrīguṇān sthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yat aham mahā karuṇā samanvāgatānām paścimakānām bodhisattvānām parityāga netrī guṇān sthāpayeyam
translated: So that I will establish the quality of generosity for the last Bodhisattvas who are endowed with great compassion.

analyzed: yā raṇi kleśānām iyam śīla pāramitā
translated: The pacification of afflictions is the perfection of morality.

original: tathāhamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caramāṇo vividhaśīlavratanirantaraduṣkaracārikāṃ careyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caramāṇaḥ vividha śīla vrata nirantara duṣkara cārikām careyam
translated: Thus, practicing the conduct for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, I would practice the various difficult conducts of moral discipline and vows,

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as stated before.

analyzed: yā viṣayeṣu akṣaṇya natā ātma pratyavekṣaṇā iyam kṣānti pāramitā
translated: That which is the non-abandonment of objects, the self-examination, this is the perfection of patience.

analyzed: tathārūpam aham kṣāntim bhāvayamānaḥ
translated: Thus, cultivating that kind of patience,

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as stated before.

original: yā vivekatā sarvasaṃskṛtā bhāvanā udyujyanā sarvāsaṃskṛtaśāntamanuttaracaryayā avivartanā iyaṃ vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: yā viveka tā sarva saṃskṛtā bhāvanā sarva asaṃskṛta śāntam anuttara caryayā a vivartanā iyam vīrya pāramitā
translated: That which is the detachment, the cultivation of all conditioned things, the exertion, the non-turning away from the unsurpassed conduct of the peace of all unconditioned things, this is the perfection of effort.

original: yā sarvasaṃskāreṣu viparyāsaprahāṇāya śūnyatā samudācāraḥ iyaṃ dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: yā sarva saṃskāreṣu viparyāsa prahāṇāya śūnyatā samudācāraḥ iyam dhyāna pāramitā
translated: That which is the practice of emptiness for the abandonment of misconceptions regarding all conditioned things, this is the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: yā prakṛti anutpattika dharma kṣāntiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: That which is the natural acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, this is the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: yā aprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu dṛḍha utsāha bala vega caryā
translated: That which is the conduct of firm enthusiasm, strength, and speed for immeasurable and innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas,

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as stated before.

original: na kaścid bodhisattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ evaṃ dṛḍhotsāhabalavegena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cīrṇaḥ syāṃ /
analyzed: na kaścid bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caramāṇaḥ evam dṛḍha utsāha bala vegena prajñāpāramitāyām cīrṇaḥ syām
translated: No bodhisattva practicing the conduct for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment would have practiced the perfection of wisdom with such firm enthusiasm, strength, and speed.

original: na ca punaḥ paścāt kaścid bodhisattvo'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caramāṇaḥ evaṃ dṛḍhotsāhabalavegena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caret /
analyzed: na ca punar paścāt kaścid bodhisattvaḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caramāṇaḥ evam dṛḍha utsāha bala vegena prajñāpāramitāyām caret
translated: And no future bodhisattva, practicing the conduct for the highest complete enlightenment, would practice the perfection of wisdom with such firm enthusiasm, strength, and speed.

analyzed: tathā aham careyam
translated: I would practice like that.

analyzed: paścimakānām bodhisattvānām mahā karuṇā samanvāgatānām netrī guṇam sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish the guiding principle for future bodhisattvas endowed with great compassion.

analyzed: prathama citta utpādena aham paścimakānām bodhisattvānām mahā karuṇām nivartayeyam
translated: With the first production of the mind, I would turn away the great compassion of future bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yāvat anuttara parinirvāṇena bodhisattvāḥ ca āścarya prāptāḥ bhaveyuḥ iti artham aham tyāgasya āmanyana tā careyam
translated: Up to the unsurpassed complete nirvana, bodhisattvas would attain wonder. For this purpose, I would practice the non-apprehension of generosity.

original: śīlāniśrayatā kṣāntyāmanyanatā vīrye'nāyūhanatā dhyāneṣvapratiṣṭhitatā prajñāyāmadvayatāṃ careyaṃ /
analyzed: śīla a niśraya tā kṣāntyām anyana tā vīryena a yūhana tā dhyāneṣu a pratiṣṭhita tā prajñāyām advaya tām careyam
translated: I would practice the non-reliance on morality, the non-apprehension in patience, the non-accumulation in vigor, the non-abiding in the concentrations, and the non-duality in wisdom.

original: aphalākāṅkṣī āryasaptadhanavirahitānāṃ sattvānāṃ sarvaśūnyabuddhakṣetrojjhitānāmānantaryakārakānāṃ saddharmapratikṣepakānāmāryāparvādakānāṃ mithyādṛṣṭikānāmakuśalamūlasamavadhānasaṅkaṭaprāptānāṃ kumārge vihanyamānānāṃ sattvānāmarthāyāhaṃ pāramitāstīvrabalavegotsāhena careyaṃ /
analyzed: a phala ākāṅkṣī ārya sapta dhana virahitānām sattvānām sarva śūnya buddhakṣetra ujjhitānām ānantarya kārakānām saddharma pratikṣepakānām ārya aparvādakānām mithyādṛṣṭikānām akuśala mūla samavadhāna saṅkaṭa prāptānām kumārge vihanyamānānām sattvānām arthāya aham pāramitāḥ tīvra bala vega utsāhena careyam
translated: For the sake of those beings who are devoid of the seven noble riches, who are abandoned in all the empty buddha-fields, who commit the five acts of immediate retribution, who reject the true Dharma, who revile the noble ones, who have wrong views, who have fallen into the danger of the roots of unwholesome action, who are being harmed on bad paths, I shall practice the perfections with intense strength, speed, and enthusiasm.

original: ekaikasya sattvasyārthe cāhaṃ kuśalamūlabījasaṃtatyāḥ pratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ daśamahākalpān avīcinarake duḥkhāṃ vedanāmutsaheyaṃ /
analyzed: ekaikasya sattvasya arthe ca aham kuśala mūla bīja saṃtatyāḥ pratiṣṭhāpana artham daśa mahā kalpān avīci narake duḥkhām vedanām utsaheyam
translated: For the sake of each and every being, in order to establish the continuity of the seeds of wholesome roots, I shall endure the painful feelings in the Avīci hell for ten great eons.

original: evaṃ tiryakpreteṣu yakṣadaridreṣu manuṣyadaridreṣu duḥkhāṃ vedanāmutsaheyaṃ /
analyzed: evam tiryak preteṣu yakṣa daridreṣu manuṣya daridreṣu duḥkhām vedanām utsaheyam
translated: In the same way, I shall endure the painful feelings among animals, hungry ghosts, Yakṣas, and human paupers.

original: yathā caikasattvasya santatyāṃ kuśalamūlabījaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ tathā sarvasattvānāṃ evaṃrūpāṃ riktamuṣṭisadṛśasantānāṃ vaineyāṃ pratigṛhṇīyaṃ
analyzed: yathā ca eka sattvasya santatyām kuśala mūla bījam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam tathā sarva sattvānām evaṃrūpām rikta muṣṭi sadṛśa santānām vaineyām pratigṛhṇīyam
translated: Just as I shall establish the seeds of wholesome roots in the continuum of one being, in the same way I shall accept such disciples whose continua are like an empty fist, for all beings.

analyzed: yāvat kalpa paryantena aham anārthakaḥ divya sukha upapattibhiḥ
translated: Until the end of time, I shall not be without purpose, with rebirths in divine and blissful states.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā eka jāti pratibaddha tuṣita bhavana kālāpa rikṣī caramabhavikaḥ bodhi abhisaṃbodhana artham
translated: Except for one who is bound by only one more birth, who is in the Tushita heaven, whose last existence is not yet exhausted, and who is about to attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tāvacciramahaṃ saṃsāre buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsitvā ekaikasya ca buddhasyāhaṃ buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃ vividhāṃ pūjāṃ kuryāṃ /
analyzed: tāvat ciram aham saṃsāre buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsitvā ekaikasya ca buddhasya aham buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samām vividhām pūjām kuryām
translated: For that long, I will serve the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the world systems as numerous as the atoms in a Buddha-field, and I will make various offerings to each Buddha as numerous as the atoms in a Buddha-field.

original: ekaikasya ca buddhasya sakāśādbuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān guṇān adhigaccheyaṃ /
analyzed: ekaikasya ca buddhasya sakāśāt buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān guṇān adhigaccheyam
translated: And I will attain qualities from each Buddha as numerous as the atoms in a Buddha-field.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān ca sattvān bodhau samādāpayeyam
translated: And I will inspire beings as numerous as the atoms in a Buddha-field to attain enlightenment.

original: evaṃ pratyekabuddhayānikānāmevaṃ śrāvakayānikānāṃ yathābhiprāyāṃśca sattvān tathāhaṃ samādāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam pratyekabuddha yānikānām evam śrāvaka yānikānām yathā abhiprāyān ca sattvān tathā aham samādāpayeyam
translated: In the same way, I will inspire those in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and those in the Śrāvaka Vehicle to attain their respective goals, according to their aspirations.

original: asati buddhotpāde loka ṛṣivratenāhaṃ sattvāṃ daśakuśalakarmapatheṣu niyojayeyaṃ samādhāvabhijñāsu ca niyojayeyaṃ /
analyzed: asati buddha utpāde loke ṛṣi vratena aham sattvām daśa kuśala karma patheṣu niyojayeyam samādhau abhijñāsu ca niyojayeyam
translated: When there is no appearance of a Buddha in the world, I will engage beings in the ten wholesome actions and in the meditative absorptions and higher knowledges, by the vow of a sage.

analyzed: dṛṣṭi vyasana maheśvara bhaktām maheśvara rūpeṇa aham sattvān kuśaleṣu niyojayeyam
translated: I will engage beings who are devoted to the great lord and are attached to wrong views in virtue, by taking on the form of the great lord.

original: nārāyaṇabhaktāṃścandrasūryabhaktāṃ yāvadbrahmabhaktān brahmarūpeṇāhaṃ sattvān kuśaladharmeṣu niyojayeyaṃ /
analyzed: nārāyaṇa bhaktān candra sūrya bhaktām yāvat brahma bhaktān brahma rūpeṇa aham sattvān kuśala dharmeṣu niyojayeyam
translated: I will engage beings who are devoted to Nārāyaṇa, the moon, the sun, and Brahmā in wholesome dharmas, taking on the form of Brahmā.

analyzed: evam garuḍa rūpeṇa garuḍa pakṣiṇaḥ kuśala caryāsu niyojayeyam
translated: In the same way, I will engage birds who are devoted to Garuḍa in wholesome conduct, taking on the form of Garuḍa.

analyzed: yāvat śakra rūpeṇa  bubhūkṣitān sattvān sva māṃsa rudhireṇa saṃtarpayeyam
translated: Up to taking on the form of Śakra.🔽I will satisfy hungry beings with my own flesh and blood.

original: vyasanagatāṃśca sattvāṃ svakena kāyena jīvitena ca paritrāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: vyasana gatān ca sattvām svakena kāyena jīvitena ca paritrāyeyam
translated: I will protect beings who are in distress with my own body and life.

original: tāvacciramahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan dagdhasantānānāṃ kuśalamūlaparihīnānāmarthāyātibalavegena cārikāṃ caraṃ /
analyzed: tāvat ciram aham bhadanta bhagavan dagdha santānānām kuśala mūla parihīnānām arthāya ati bala vegena cārikām caran
translated: For so long, Venerable Blessed One, I will practice with great strength and speed for the sake of those with burnt continuums and lacking in wholesome roots.

original: tāvacciraṃ cāhaṃ saṃsāre sattvahetorvividhacaṇḍaghoradāruṇāṃ duḥkhāṃ praticcheyaṃ /
analyzed: tāvat ciram ca aham saṃsāre sattva hetoḥ vividha caṇḍa ghora dāruṇām duḥkhām praticcheyam
translated: For so long, I will endure various violent, terrible, and harsh sufferings in cyclic existence for the sake of beings.

original: yāvadatikrāntānekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ nirgatānām avaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvāikāsame'saṃkhyeye'nupraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe yadā jyotipālo māṇavako'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyati krakutsando nāma tathāgato bhaviṣyati tadāhaṃ tasmin samaye āryeṇa prajñācakṣuṣā daśasu dikṣu sahasrabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāsu lokadhātuṣu pravartitadhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ tiṣṭhato yāpayato buddhān bhagavataḥ paśyeyaṃ ye mayā dagdhasantānā akuśalamūlasamādhānāḥ saptadhanavirahitāḥ sarvaiḥ śūnyairbuddhakṣetrairujjhitā ānantaryakārakāḥ saddharmapratikṣepakā āryāpavādakā yāvatkumārge vihanyantaḥ mayā saṅkaṭaprāptāḥ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /

analyzed: sarvaiḥ avarupta kuśala mūlaiḥ sattvaiḥ parivarjitam  sa lavaṇā ca pṛthivī bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be devoid of all beings who have not planted the roots of virtue.🔽The earth will be salty.

analyzed: pāṣāṇa śarkara pāṃśu śīlā parvata utkūlā ca dharaṇī bhaviṣyati
translated: The earth will be full of stones, pebbles, sand, and mountains.

analyzed: paruṣa daṃśa maśaka āśīviṣa caṇḍa mṛga pakṣibhiḥ ākīrṇā bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be infested with biting insects, mosquitoes, poisonous snakes, and ferocious animals and birds.

analyzed: viṣama kāla kaluṣāḥ vāyavaḥ vā asyanti
translated: The winds will blow unseasonably and turbulently.

analyzed: viṣama kāla virasa lavaṇa vimiśrāḥ aśani varṣā patiṣyanti
translated: Unseasonable rains of salt and poison will fall.

original: tathārūpāḥ pṛthivyāṃ śaṣpauṣadhitṛṇavṛkṣā patrapuṣpaphalā dhānyarasāḥ sattvānāmannapānabhogaparibhogaviṣamāḥ kaluṣaparuṣarukṣaviṣasaṃsṛṣṭā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: tathārūpāḥ pṛthivyām patra puṣpa phalāḥ dhānya rasāḥ sattvānām anna pāna bhoga paribhoga viṣamāḥ kaluṣa paruṣa rukṣa viṣa saṃsṛṣṭāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The grass, herbs, trees, leaves, flowers, fruits, and grains on the earth will become unwholesome, polluted, harsh, dry, and mixed with poison for the enjoyment of beings' food, drink, and pleasures.

original: te sattvāḥ paribhaktyā bhūyasyā mātrayā rukṣā duṣṭāścaṇḍā raudrāḥ paruṣāḥ kadaryāḥ paribhāṣakā anyonyāgauravā bhītena cittenāghātacittā vadhakacittā
analyzed: te sattvāḥ paribhaktyā bhūyasyā mātrayā rukṣāḥ duṣṭāḥ caṇḍāḥ raudrāḥ paruṣāḥ kadaryāḥ paribhāṣakāḥ anyonya a gauravāḥ bhītena cittena āghāta cittāḥ vadhaka cittā
translated: Those beings, by partaking of them, will become even more harsh, wicked, violent, cruel, rough, stingy, abusive, disrespectful to each other, fearful, hostile, and murderous in mind.

original: māṃsabhojanarudhirāhārā mṛgacarmaprāvaraṇāḥ praharaṇādhiṣṭhānāḥ prāṇivadhodyuktā rūpakulavaṃśaiśvaryaśāstralipyaśvārohaṇadhanurgrahāyudhaparivārā mātsaryadarpitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: māṃsa bhojana rudhira āhārāḥ mṛga carma prāvaraṇāḥ praharaṇa adhiṣṭhānāḥ prāṇi vadha udyuktāḥ rūpa kula vaṃśa aiśvarya śāstra lipi aśva ārohaṇa dhanuḥ graha āyudha parivārāḥ mātsarya darpitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will subsist on meat, blood, and animal skins, be devoted to weapons, eager to kill living beings, and will be proud of their appearance, family lineage, wealth, learning, writing, horsemanship, archery, and military equipment. They will be stingy and arrogant.

analyzed: vividha lūha tapa vrata abhiyuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti lokāḥ
translated: The people will be devoted to various harsh austerities and vows.

original: tatkālamahaṃ tuṣitabhavanādavatīrya viśiṣṭe cakravartikulavaṃśe īśvare rājakule agramahiṣyāḥ kukṣau vaineyasattvakuśalamūlaparipācanārthaṃ garbhavāsamupagṛhṇīyāṃ /
analyzed: tad kālam aham tuṣita bhavanāt avatīrya viśiṣṭe cakravarti kula vaṃśe īśvare rāja kule agramahiṣyāḥ kukṣau vaineya sattva kuśala mūla paripācana artham garbha vāsam upagṛhṇīyām
translated: At that time, I would descend from the Tusita heaven and enter the womb of the chief queen in the family of a powerful universal monarch, in order to ripen the wholesome roots of beings to be trained.

original: sarvāvantaṃ tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre udāreṇāvabhāsena sphureyaṃ /
analyzed: sarvāvantam tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre udāreṇa avabhāsena sphureyam
translated: At that time, the entire Sahā buddha-field would be filled with a vast radiance.

original: ūrdhvaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyanto'haṃ heṣṭhaṃ yāvat kāñcanacakraparyantamudāreṇāvabhāsena sphureyaṃ /
analyzed: ūrdhvam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryanta ūham heṣṭham yāvat kāñcana cakra paryantam udāreṇa avabhāsena sphureyam
translated: From above, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, and from below, up to the golden wheel, it would be filled with a vast radiance.

original: ye ca tasmin samaye sattvā sahe buddhakṣetre pratyājātā narakeṣu vā tiryagyonau vā yamaloke vā devamanuṣye vā te sarve tamavabhāsaṃ paśyeyuḥ spṛśeyuḥ saṃjāneyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin samaye sattva a sahe buddhakṣetre pratyājātāḥ narakeṣu vā tiryagyonau vā yama loke vā deva manuṣye vā te sarve tam avabhāsam paśyeyuḥ spṛśeyuḥ saṃjāneyuḥ
translated: At that time, all the beings born in the Sahā buddha-field, in the hells, as animals, in the realm of Yama, or as gods and humans, would see that light, touch it, and understand it.

original: teṣāṃ saṃsāre vimṛśatāṃ duḥkhodvignānāṃ nirvāṇābhilāṣamantaśaḥ kleśaśamacittānyutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām saṃsāre vimṛśatām duḥkha udvignānām nirvāṇa abhilāṣam antaśas kleśa śama cittāni utpādayeyuḥ
translated: For those who reflect on saṃsāra, being distressed by suffering, desiring nirvāṇa, they would generate thoughts of pacifying the afflictions.

analyzed: idam prathamam agra mārga bījam avaropayeyam
translated: This would be the first planting of the seed of the supreme path.

original: yadāhaṃ sarvadharmanayavipaścitaṃ sarvasamādhinirdeśamekadharmamukhamaparāntakalpanirdeśena samāhitacitto daśamāsāṃ mātuḥ kukṣau nivaseyaṃ /
analyzed: yadā aham sarva dharma naya vipaścitam sarva samādhi nirdeśam eka dharma mukham apara anta kalpa nirdeśena samāhita cittaḥ daśa māsām mātuḥ kukṣau nivaseyam
translated: When I, having become skilled in the path of all dharmas, having entered the concentration of the teaching of all samādhis, having concentrated my mind for the teaching of the future eon, would dwell in my mother's womb for ten months,

original: yāvāṃścāhaṃ prāpte buddhatve sattvāṃ parikhinnāṃ saṃsāre parimocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvān ca aham prāpte buddhatve sattvām parikhinnām saṃsāre parimocayeyam
translated: and as long as I would liberate beings who are weary in saṃsāra after attaining buddhahood,

original: te sattvā mātuḥ kukṣigataṃ daśamāsāṃ maṇigarbhasaṃdarśanasamāhitacittaṃ paryaṅkena niṣaṇṇaṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: te sattvāḥ mātuḥ kukṣi gatam daśa māsām maṇi garbha saṃdarśana samāhita cittam paryaṅkena niṣaṇṇam paśyeyuḥ
translated: those beings would see me sitting cross-legged in my mother's womb for ten months, my mind concentrated on the teaching of Maṇigarbha.

original: nirgate ca daśamāse sarvapuṇyasaṃcayenāhaṃ samādhinā sarvāvantaṃ sahabuddhakṣetraṃ ṣaḍvikāraṃ dharaṇīṃ cālayeyaṃ /
analyzed: nirgate ca daśa māse sarva puṇya saṃcayena aham samādhinā sarvāvantam saha buddhakṣetram ṣaṣ vikāram dharaṇīm cālayeyam
translated: And when ten months had passed, by the concentration of the accumulation of all merit, I would shake the entire Sahā buddha-field, the earth, in six ways.

original: ūrdhvaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyantaṃ heṣṭimena ca yāvat kāñcanacakraparyantaṃ ṣaḍvikāreṇa cālayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ūrdhvam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryantam heṣṭimena ca yāvat kāñcana cakra paryantam ṣaṣ vikāreṇa cālayeyam
translated: Upward to the end of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and downward to the end of the golden wheel, I would shake it in six ways.

original: ye ca tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre sattvāḥ pratyājātā narakeṣu vā yāvan manuṣyeṣu vā tān prabodhayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre sattvāḥ pratyājātāḥ narakeṣu vā yāvat manuṣyeṣu vā tān prabodhayeyam
