translated: And the beings who are reborn in the Sahā buddha-field at that time, in the hells up to among humans, I would awaken them.

analyzed: yadā aham mātuḥ dakṣiṇe kukṣau abhiniṣkrameyam
translated: When I would emerge from my mother's right side,

original: punarapi ca sarvāvantaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetramudāreṇāvabhāsena aphureyaṃ /
analyzed: punar api ca sarvāvantam saham buddhakṣetram udāreṇa avabhāsena aphureyam
translated: Again, may the entire Sahā buddha realm be illuminated with a great light.

original: tadāpi tasmin samaye sarvān sahe buddhakṣetre sattvān saṃcodayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tadā api tasmin samaye sarvān sahe buddhakṣetre sattvān saṃcodayeyam
translated: At that time, may I inspire all beings in the Sahā buddha realm.

analyzed: an avarupta kuśala mūlānām sattvānām santāne nirvāṇa bījam prakṣipeyam
translated: For beings who have not planted the roots of virtue, may I plant the seed of nirvāṇa in their continuum.

analyzed: avaropita nirvāṇa bīja santatīnām sattvānām samādhi aṅkuram avaropayeyam
translated: For beings whose continuum has the seed of nirvāṇa planted, may I plant the sprout of meditative concentration.

original: yadā cāhaṃ caraṇatalena dharaṇīṃ spṛśeyaṃ sarvāvatī tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre ṣaḍvikāraṃ dharaṇīṃ cālayeyaṃ prakaṃpayeyaṃ kṣobhayeyaṃ yāvat kāñcanacakraparyantena /
analyzed: yadā ca aham caraṇa talena dharaṇīm spṛśeyam sarvāvatī tasmin samaye sahe buddhakṣetre ṣaṣ vikāram dharaṇīm cālayeyam prakaṃpayeyam kṣobhayeyam yāvat kāñcana cakra paryantena
translated: When I touch the ground with the sole of my foot, may the entire Sahā buddha realm shake, quake, and tremble in six ways, up to the edge of the iron ring.

original: tadāhaṃ tasmin samaye sattvān jalaniśritāṃ kṣitiniśritāṃ khaniśritāṃ caturyoniparyāpannāṃ pañcagatisaṃniśritāṃ tān sarvān ahaṃ pratibodhayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tadā aham tasmin samaye sattvān jala niśritām kṣiti niśritām kha niśritām catur yoni paryāpannām pañca gati saṃniśritām tān sarvān aham pratibodhayeyam
translated: At that time, may I awaken all beings who rely on water, earth, or space, who are included in the four modes of birth, and who rely on the five destinies.

analyzed: yeṣām santāne sattvānām anutpannam samādhāna aṅkuram ropayeyam
translated: For those beings whose continuum has not yet produced the sprout of meditative concentration, may I plant it.

analyzed: dṛḍha samādhāna aṅkurām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ a vaivartikām sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the three vehicles, with roots of merit firm and unretreating.

original: sahajātamātrasya ca me yāvadeva tasmin sahe buddhakṣetre mahābrahmāṇo vā mārā vā śakrā vā candrā vā sūryā vā lokapālā vā mahānāgarājā vāsurendrā vā aupapādukā vā maharddhikā vā yakṣarākṣasanāgāsurā vā sarve mama pūjākarmaṇe upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ /
analyzed: sahajāta mātrasya ca me yāvat eva tasmin sahe buddhakṣetre mahābrahmāṇaḥ vā mārāḥ vā śakrāḥ vā candrāḥ vā sūryāḥ vā lokapālāḥ vā mahā nāga rājāḥ vā asura indrāḥ vā aupapādukāḥ vā maharddhikāḥ vā yakṣa rākṣasa nāga asurāḥ vā sarve mama pūjā karmaṇe upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ
translated: As soon as I am born, may all the great Brahmas, Maras, Shakra, Chandras, Suryas, Lokapalas, great Naga kings, Asura lords, spontaneously born ones with great spiritual powers, Yakshas, Rakshasas, Nagas, and Asuras in that Sahaloka world system come to me to make offerings.

analyzed: sahajāta mātraḥ ca aham sapta padāni prakrāmeyam
translated: As soon as I am born, I would take seven steps.

original: sarvapuṇyasamuccayenāhaṃ samādhinā tathārūpaṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ yattatsarvāvatī sā parṣattribhiryānaiḥ prasādaṃ pratilaṃbhayet /
analyzed: sarva puṇya samuccayena aham samādhinā tathārūpam dharmam deśayeyam yat tat sarvāvatī sā parṣad tribhiḥ yānaiḥ prasādam pratilaṃbhayet
translated: With the samadhi called Accumulating All Merits, I would teach the Dharma in such a way that the entire assembly would attain faith through the three vehicles.

original: ye ca tatra parṣadi sattvāḥ śrāvakayānikā bhaveyuste caramabhavikā mama vaineyā bhavikā /
analyzed: ye ca tatra parṣadi sattvāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ bhaveyuḥ te caramabhavikā mama vaineyā bhavikā
translated: Those beings in the assembly who are followers of the Shravakayana and are in their last existence would become my disciples.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ pratyekabuddhayānikā bhaveyuste vairocanakusumāṃ kṣāntiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ bhaveyuḥ te vairocana kusumām kṣāntim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: Those beings who are followers of the Pratyekabuddhayana would attain the acceptance of the radiance of Vairocana.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā anuttaramahāyānikā bhaveyuste sarve vajradharasamudrasaṃkopitaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheran /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ anuttara mahāyānikāḥ bhaveyuḥ te sarve vajradhara samudra saṃkopitam samādhim pratilabheran
translated: And those beings there who are followers of the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, they all would attain the samadhi that is like the ocean of vajra-holders.

original: tena ca samādhinā tisrā bhūmīḥ samatikrāmeyuḥ /
analyzed: tena ca samādhinā tisraḥ bhūmīḥ samatikrāmeyuḥ
translated: And by that samadhi, they would transcend the three stages.

original: yadahaṃ snāpanamiccheyaṃ ye ca tatra mahānāgarājāno viśiṣṭatarā bhaveyuḥ te māṃ snāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yat aham snāpanam iccheyam ye ca tatra mahā nāga rājānaḥ viśiṣṭatarāḥ bhaveyuḥ te mām snāpayeyuḥ
translated: When I desire to bathe, and those great naga kings who are more distinguished than I would bathe me.

original: ye ca sattvā māṃ snāpayamānaṃ paśyeyuste sarve tribhiryānairevaṃrūpān guṇānadhigaccheyuḥ yathā proktaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mām snāpayamānam paśyeyuḥ te sarve tribhiḥ yānaiḥ evaṃrūpān guṇān adhigaccheyuḥ yathā proktam
translated: And those beings who see me bathing, they all would attain such qualities through the three vehicles as have been described.

original: ye ca māṃ sattvā rathamabhirohantaṃ samanupaśyeyurvistareṇa kumārakrīḍavividhaśilpasthānakarmasthānāsanāni ca dadarśa śikṣāpanayogyaṃ stryagāre pañca kāmaguṇaratikrīḍārdharātrāvudvignaniṣkramaṇālaṅkāravibhūṣaṇacchoraṇaṃ lohitavastrābhīkṣṇaṃ kāṣāyavastraparyeṣaṇabodhivṛkṣopasaṃkramaṇaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca mām sattvāḥ ratham abhirohantam samanupaśyeyuḥ vistareṇa kumāra krīḍa vividha śilpasthāna karmasthāna āsanāni ca dadarśa śikṣāpana yogyam strī agāre pañca kāma guṇa rati krīḍā ardharātrau udvigna niṣkramaṇa alaṅkāra vibhūṣaṇa choraṇam lohita vastra abhīkṣṇam kāṣāya vastra paryeṣaṇa bodhivṛkṣa upasaṃkramaṇam
translated: And those beings who see me ascending the chariot, and in detail the various sports of a prince, the places of various crafts and occupations, and the seats suitable for training, in the harem I saw the enjoyment and play with the five sense objects, the departure at midnight with anxiety, the discarding of ornaments and decorations, the constant search for red garments and ochre robes, and the approach to the Bodhi tree.

analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mām upasaṃkrāmantam paśyeyuḥ
translated: And those beings who see me approaching.

original: teṣāṃ cāhaṃ sattvānāṃ sarvapuṇyasamuccayena samādhinā tathārūpaṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ yathā te sattvāstribhiryānaistīvracchandā udyujyeyuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca aham sattvānām sarva puṇya samuccayena samādhinā tathārūpam dharmam deśayeyam yathā te sattvāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ tīvra chandāḥ udyujyeyuḥ
translated: And for those beings, I would teach the Dharma in such a way with the samādhi of the accumulation of all merits that those beings would be inspired with intense zeal for the three vehicles.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ pratyekabuddhayānikāste sarve vairocanakusumāṃ kṣāntiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ te sarve vairocana kusumām kṣāntim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And those beings there who are in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, they would all attain the acceptance that is like a blazing torch.

original: yaiśca mahāyānabījaṃ prakṣiptaṃ bhavet te sarve vajradharasamudrasaṃkopitaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabheyustena ca samādhinā tisro bhūmiratikrāmeyuḥ
analyzed: yaiḥ ca mahāyāna bījam prakṣiptam bhavet te sarve vajradhara samudra saṃkopitam samādhim pratilabheyuḥ tena ca samādhinā tisraḥ bhūmiḥ atikrāmeyuḥ
translated: And those who have planted the seed of the Great Vehicle, they would all attain the samādhi called the ocean-like vajra-holder, and by that samādhi they would transcend the three realms.

original: svayaṃ cāhaṃ tṛṇasaṃstaraṇaṃ gṛhṇīyāṃ bodhivṛkṣamūlavajrāsane prajñapayeyaṃ niṣīdeyaṃ paryaṅkamābadhvā ṛjukena kāyena /
analyzed: svayam ca aham tṛṇa saṃstaraṇam gṛhṇīyām bodhivṛkṣa mūla vajrāsane prajñapayeyam niṣīdeyam paryaṅkam ābadhvā ṛjukena kāyena
translated: And I myself would take up a straw mat and arrange it on the adamantine seat at the foot of the Bodhi tree, and I would sit there with my legs crossed, my body straight.

analyzed: tathārūpam aham āsphānakam dhyānam dhyāyeyam
translated: I would meditate on that kind of meditation that is not distracted.

analyzed: āśvāsa praśvāsāḥ vyupaśameyam
translated: My inhalation and exhalation would cease.

analyzed: eka vāram divasena dhyānāt vyuttiṣṭheyam
translated: I would arise from meditation once a day.

analyzed: vyutthāya ca aham ardha tilaka phalam āhāram āhareyam
translated: And having arisen, I would eat a meal of half a sesame seed and half a rice grain.

analyzed: ardham pratigrāhakasya anuprayaccheyam
translated: I would give half to the one who receives it.

analyzed: tāvat ciram ca aham evaṃrūpām duṣkara cārikām careyam
translated: I would practice such a difficult practice for that long.

original: yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyantena sarve devā ye sahe buddhakṣetre paryāpannāsta upasaṃkrāmeyurmama ca pūjāṃ kurvāṇāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryantena sarve devāḥ ye sahe buddhakṣetre paryāpannāḥ te upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ mama ca pūjām kurvāṇāḥ
translated: Until all the gods who have come to the Sahā buddha-field, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, would come to me and make offerings to me.

analyzed: sarve me sākṣiṇaḥ syuḥ duṣkara caryāyām
translated: They would all be witnesses to my difficult practice.

original: yaiśca tatra śrāvakayāne bījamavaruptaṃ syātteṣāṃ bhadanta bhagavan kleśavyupaśamāya santāne bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tatra śrāvaka yāne bījam avaruptam syāt teṣām bhadanta bhagavan kleśa vyupaśamāya santāne bhaveyam
translated: And, Blessed One, I would be for those who have planted the seed of the Śrāvaka Vehicle in their continuum for the sake of the pacification of afflictions.

analyzed: caramabhavikāḥ ca mama vaineyāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those in their final existence would be my disciples.

analyzed: ye pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Those who are in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, up to as stated before.

analyzed: evam nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga preta piśāca kumbhāṇḍāḥ pañca abhijñāḥ ṛṣayaḥ upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ mama pūjā karmaṇe
translated: In the same way, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, pretas, piśācas, and kumbhāṇḍas, and sages with the five superknowledges would come to me to make offerings.

analyzed: sarve ca me sākṣiṇaḥ bhaveyuḥ duṣkara caryāyām
translated: And they would all be witnesses to my difficult practice.

analyzed: ye ca śrāvaka yānikāḥ yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: And those who are in the Śrāvaka Vehicle, up to as stated before.

original: ye ca tatra cāturdvīpikāyāmanyatīrthikā lūhatapo vrataduṣkaracārikāṃ caranti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra cāturdvīpikāyām anya tīrthikāḥ lūha tapaḥ vrata duṣkara cārikām caranti
translated: And those in other tīrthika groups in that four-continent world who practice a difficult practice of austerities and vows.

analyzed: teṣām ca amānuṣāḥ ārocayeyuḥ
translated: And non-humans would inform them.

analyzed: na yūyam duṣkara kārakā
translated: You are not performing difficult deeds.

original: yathāsmin pradeśe caramabhaviko bodhisattvo duṣkaracārikāṃ carati /
analyzed: yathā asmin pradeśe caramabhavikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ duṣkara cārikām carati
translated: As the bodhisattva in his final existence is performing difficult deeds in this region.

original: tathārūpaṃ dhyāyati hṛdaye manaskāraṃ badhnāti praśrabdhakāyasaṃskāraḥ praśrabdhavāksaṃskāraḥ praśāntāścāsya praśvāsāśvāsāḥ /
analyzed: tathārūpam dhyāyati hṛdaye manaskāram badhnāti praśrabdha kāya saṃskāraḥ praśrabdha vāc saṃskāraḥ praśāntāḥ ca asya praśvāsa āśvāsāḥ
translated: He meditates in such a way, fixing his attention in his heart. His bodily activities are relaxed, his verbal activities are relaxed, and his exhalations and inhalations are calm.

analyzed: dine dine ca ekām velām dhyānāt vyutthitvā ardha tilaka phalam āhāram āharati
translated: And every day, having arisen from meditation at one time, he takes as food half a sesame seed and half a rice grain.

original: sā duṣkaracaryā maharddhikā sā mahāphalā mahāvistārā /
analyzed: sā duṣkara caryā maharddhikā sā mahā phalā mahā vistārā
translated: That difficult practice is very powerful, has great fruit, is very extensive.

analyzed: na cireṇa asau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Before long, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: saced na śraddhadhvam gacchata svayam paśyata
translated: If you do not believe, go and see for yourself.

original: te ca tāṃ duṣkaracaryāmutsṛjya mama duṣkaracaryāṃ dṛṣṭvā yeṣāṃ śrāvakayānasantānabījāṅkuraṃ pratiṣṭhitaṃ syāt /
analyzed: te ca tām duṣkara caryām utsṛjya mama duṣkara caryām dṛṣṭvā yeṣām śrāvaka yāna santāna bīja aṅkuram pratiṣṭhitam syāt
translated: And they, having abandoned that difficult practice, seeing my difficult practice, for those in whom the seed-sprout of the Śrāvaka-yāna has been established,

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: up to as previously stated.

original: ye manuṣyarājā vā bhaṭṭā vā naigamajānapadā gṛhasthapravrajitā gṛhāgārasaṃpannāste'pi mama duṣkaracaryāmupasaṃkrāmeyuryāvacchrāvakayānikā yathā pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: ye manuṣya rājāḥ vā bhaṭṭāḥ vā naigama jānapadāḥ gṛhastha pravrajitāḥ gṛhāgāra saṃpannāḥ te api mama duṣkara caryām upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ yāvat śrāvaka yānikā yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Those human kings, lords, city-dwellers, country-dwellers, householders, renunciants, endowed with houses and abodes, who approach my practice of austerities, up to those of the Śrāvakayāna as stated before,

analyzed: yaḥ ca mātṛgrāmaḥ mama darśanayā upasaṃkramet
translated: and any woman who approaches me to see me,

original: sa tasya paścimako mātṛgrāmapratilābho bhaved iti /
analyzed: sa tasya paścimakaḥ mātṛgrāma pratilābhaḥ bhavet iti
translated: that will be her last experience of being a woman.

analyzed: ye śrāvaka yānikāḥ yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Those of the Śrāvakayāna as stated before.

original: ye mṛgapakṣiṇo duṣkaraṃ caramāṇaṃ niṣaṇṇaṃ paśyeyussa teṣāṃ paścimakastiryagyonipratilābho bhaved iti /
analyzed: ye mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ duṣkaram caramāṇam niṣaṇṇam paśyeyuḥ sa teṣām paścimakaḥ tiryagyoni pratilābhaḥ bhavet iti
translated: Those animals and birds who see me sitting and practicing austerities, that will be their last experience of an animal birth.

original: yaiśca mṛgapakṣibhiḥ śrāvakayāne bījānyavaropitāni tenaikajātipratibaddhā mama caiva vaineyā bhaveyurye pratyekabuddhayānā yāvad yathā pūrvoktaṃ
analyzed: yaiḥ ca mṛga pakṣibhiḥ śrāvaka yāne bījāni avaropitāni tena eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ mama ca eva vaineyāḥ bhaveyuḥ ye pratyekabuddha yānāḥ yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: And by those animals and birds in whom seeds have been sown in the Śrāvakayāna, they will be bound to one more birth and will become my disciples. Those of the Pratyekabuddha-yāna up to as stated before,

analyzed: evaṃvidhāḥ kṣudrakāḥ tiryagyonikāḥ vaktavyā
translated: such small animals of the animal realm should be spoken of in this way.🔽Those who approach me to see me, that will be their last experience of the animal realm.

original: evaṃ pretā vaktavyāstāvacciraṃ cāhamevaṃrūpāṃ duṣkaracaryāṃ careyaṃ ekaparyaṅkena yāvad bahusattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi duṣkaracaryāyāṃ sākṣibhūtā bhaveyuḥ āścaryaprāptāśca /
analyzed: evam pretāḥ vaktavyāḥ tāvat ciram ca aham evaṃrūpām duṣkara caryām careyam eka paryaṅkena yāvat bahu sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi duṣkara caryāyām sākṣi bhūtāḥ bhaveyuḥ āścarya prāptāḥ ca
translated: In the same way, I would speak to the pretas, and for so long I would practice such austerities, with a single cross-legged posture, until many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings would become witnesses to my austerities, and would be amazed.

analyzed: teṣām ca santāne prameya asaṃkhyeyānām mokṣa bījām praropayeyam
translated: And I would plant the seeds of liberation in the mindstreams of those innumerable beings.

original: tathārūpāmahaṃ duṣkaracaryāṃ careyaṃ yathā na pūrvaṃ kenacit sattvasaṃkhyātena anyatīrthikena vā śrāvakayānikena vā pratyekabuddhayānikena vā anuttaramahāyānikena vā evaṃ duṣkaracaryācīrṇapūrvaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathārūpām aham duṣkara caryām careyam yathā na pūrvam kenacid sattva saṃkhyātena anya tīrthikena vā śrāvaka yānikena vā pratyekabuddha yānikena vā anuttara mahā yānikena vā evam duṣkara caryā cīrṇa pūrvaḥ syāt
translated: I would practice such austerities as no other being, no other tīrthika, no one in the Śrāvakayāna or Pratyekabuddhayāna, or in the unsurpassed Mahāyāna, has ever practiced before.

original: na ca punaḥ paścāt kaścit sattvasaṃkhyātaścaret anyatīrthikā vā evaṃrūpāṃ duṣkaracārikāṃ śaktāṃścarantu yathāhaṃ careyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca punar paścāt kaścid sattva saṃkhyātaḥ caret anya tīrthikāḥ vā evaṃrūpām duṣkara cārikām śaktān carantu yathā aham careyam
translated: And no other being, no other tīrthika, will ever be able to practice such austerities in the future, as I am practicing now.

original: aprāptāyāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau tadāhaṃ puruṣakāraṃ kuryāṃ sabalakāyaṃ māraṃ parājayeyaṃ /
analyzed: aprāptāyām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau tadā aham puruṣakāram kuryām sa balakāyam māram parājayeyam
translated: Before attaining unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, I would perform manly deeds and defeat Māra and his army.

analyzed: sa avaśeṣa karma phalam ca adhiṣṭhiheyam
translated: And I would destroy the remaining fruits of karma.

analyzed: kleśa māram jineyam
translated: I will conquer the demon of the afflictions.

analyzed: anuttarām ca samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: And I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: tat aham eka sattvasya santāneḥ ha tvam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I will establish the state of arhatship in the mind-stream of one being.

original: tathā dvitīyasya tathā tṛtīyasya tathā caturthasya dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā dvitīyasya tathā tṛtīyasya tathā caturthasya dharmam deśayeyam
translated: And I will teach the Dharma in the same way to a second, to a third, and to a fourth,

analyzed: santāne ca arha tvam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: and I will establish the state of arhatship in their mind-streams.

analyzed: ekaikasya sattvasya artham aham śata sahasraśas prātihāryāṇi darśayeyam
translated: For the sake of each being, I will display hundreds of thousands of miracles.

analyzed: tasya ca santāne samyak dṛṣṭim pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: And I will establish right view in their mind-streams.

analyzed: bahuni ca dharma artha vyañjana sahasrāṇi bhāṣayeyam
translated: And I will speak many thousands of Dharma teachings and words.

analyzed: yathā śaktyā ca phale pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: And I will establish them in the fruits according to their abilities.

original: vajramayāṃśca sattvānāṃ santāne kleśaparvatāṃ jñānavajreṇa bhindyāṃ triyānena vyavasthānena dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: vajra mayān ca sattvānām santāne kleśa parvatām jñāna vajreṇa bhindyām triyānena vyavasthānena dharmam deśayeyam
translated: And I will shatter with the vajra of wisdom the mountain of afflictions in the mind-streams of beings with the vajra. I will teach the Dharma with the arrangement of the three vehicles.

original: ekasattvasyārthāyāhaṃ bahuyojanaśatāni padbhyāṃ gaccheyaṃ dharmadeśanārthamabhayapade pratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ /
analyzed: eka sattvasya arthāya aham bahu yojana śatāni padbhyām gaccheyam dharma deśanā artham abhaya pade pratiṣṭhāpanā artham
translated: For the sake of one being, I will go on foot many hundreds of yojanas to teach the Dharma and establish them in the state of fearlessness.

analyzed: apratiṣedhaḥ ca me śāsane bhavet pravrajyāyāḥ
translated: And in my teaching, there will be no prohibition against going forth.

original: durbalasya muṣṭasmṛteḥ vibhrāntacittasya mukharapragalbhacittasya praduṣṭacittasya duḥprajñacittasya bahukleśākulacittasya mātṛgrāmasya mama śāsane pravrajyopasaṃpadbhavet /
analyzed: durbalasya muṣṭa smṛteḥ vibhrānta cittasya mukhara pragalbha cittasya praduṣṭa cittasya duḥprajña cittasya bahu kleśa ākula cittasya mātṛgrāmasya mama śāsane pravrajyā upasaṃpad bhavet
translated: If a woman with weak memory, a distracted mind, a talkative and bold mind, a corrupted mind, a mind of poor wisdom, a mind troubled by many afflictions, were to go forth and be fully ordained in my teaching,

analyzed: catasraḥ ca me parṣāḥ syuḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upasikāḥ
translated: and if I were to have four assemblies of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers,

original: bahujanaprabhūtaṃ me śāsanaṃ bhavet devānāṃ satyadarśanaṃ yakṣāṇāṃ nāgānāmasurāṇāmāryāṣṭāṅgasamanvāgata upoṣadhavāsaḥ /
analyzed: bahu jana prabhūtam me śāsanam bhavet devānām satya darśanam yakṣāṇām nāgānām asurāṇām ārya aṣṭāṅga samanvāgataḥ upoṣadha vāsaḥ
translated: and if my teaching were to be abundant with many people, and if gods, yakshas, nagas, asuras were to see the truth, and if there were to be the observance of the noble eightfold fast,

analyzed: yāvat tiryagyoni gatānām api brahmacarya āvāsaḥ bhavet
translated: and if even those born as animals were to observe celibacy,

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me bhadanta bhagavan ye sattvā mama praduṣṭacittā vadhakacittāḥ śastreṇa vāgninā vā śaktyā va vividhena vā praharaṇenopasaṃkrāmeyuḥ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me bhadanta bhagavan ye sattvāḥ mama praduṣṭa cittāḥ vadhaka cittāḥ śastreṇa vā agninā vā śaktyā vā vividhena vā praharaṇena upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ
translated: and if, Blessed One, after I attain enlightenment, any beings with a malicious mind, a mind to kill, were to approach me with a weapon, fire, a spear, or various kinds of weapons,

analyzed: rukṣaiḥ paruṣaiḥ vacanaiḥ ākrośeyuḥ paribhāṣeyuḥ diś vidikṣu vāyaśaḥśabdam cāreyuḥ
translated: and if they were to revile me with harsh and cruel words, abuse me, and spread my bad reputation in all directions,

analyzed: viṣa saṃsṛṣṭam vā āhāra pānam upanāmayeyuḥ
translated: and if they were to offer me food and drink mixed with poison,

analyzed: evaṃrūpām karma phalān a parikṣīṇān adhiṣṭhihitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: Having thus established the ripening of karma, may I attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yathā bodhiprāptasya me sattvāḥ pūrvaṃ vaireṇa vadhakopakaraṇaprayogena paruṣavacanavividhapraharaṇaviṣānnapānasaṃsṛṣṭenopasaṃkrāmeyuḥ rudhiraṃ ca me utpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: yathā bodhi prāptasya me sattvāḥ pūrvam vaireṇa vadhaka upakaraṇa prayogena paruṣa vacana vividha praharaṇa viṣa anna pāna saṃsṛṣṭena upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ rudhiram ca me utpādayeyuḥ
translated: As I attain enlightenment, may beings who previously approached me with hostility, with weapons, with harsh words, with various weapons, with poisoned food and drink, and caused me to bleed,

original: teṣāṃ sattvānāmahaṃ śīlaśrutasamādhimahākaruṇābhāvitena brahmasvaraghoṣadundubhinarditena svareṇa tathārūpaṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām sattvānām aham śīla śruta samādhi mahā karuṇā bhāvitena brahma svara ghoṣa dundubhi narditena svareṇa tathārūpam dharmam deśayeyam
translated: may I teach them the Dharma with a voice that is cultivated by morality, learning, concentration, and great compassion, with a voice that resounds like the drum of Brahmā.

original: yatteṣāṃ cittāni prasādayeyaṃ kuśale ca niyojayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yat teṣām cittāni prasādayeyam kuśale ca niyojayeyam
translated: May I delight their minds and engage them in virtue.

analyzed: yathā te sattvāḥ karma āvaraṇam deśayeyuḥ
translated: May those beings confess their karmic obscurations.

analyzed: āpatyām saṃvaram āpadyeyuḥ
translated: May they undertake restraint.

original: na ca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ svarge mokṣaphale vairāgye āśravakṣaye vā āvaraṇakarma bhaved iti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām sattvānām svarge mokṣa phale vairāgye āśrava kṣaye vā āvaraṇa karma bhavet iti
translated: May they not have karmic obscurations for attaining heaven, liberation, dispassion, or the destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: mama ca atra aparikṣīṇa karma phala kṣīṇa vyantīkṛtam bhavet
translated: And may my karmic fruits be exhausted and completely destroyed here.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me bhadanta bhagavan yāvanto mama romakūpā bhaveyustāvanto divasaṃ buddhavigrahānnirmiṇuyāṃ dvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtānaśītibhiranuvyañjanaistāṃścāhaṃ buddhavigrahān śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me bhadanta bhagavan yāvantaḥ mama romakūpāḥ bhaveyuḥ tāvantaḥ divasam buddha vigrahān nirmiṇuyām dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtān aśītibhiḥ anuvyañjanaiḥ tān ca aham buddha vigrahān śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyam
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, when I have attained awakening, may I create as many buddha-forms as there are pores in my body, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man and the eighty minor characteristics, and send them to empty buddha-fields.

analyzed: a śūnyeṣu ca preṣayeyam
translated: And may I send them to non-empty ones as well.

analyzed: pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu preṣayeyam
translated: And may I send them to buddha-fields with the five degenerations.

original: ye cāpi teṣu buddhakṣetreṣvānantaryakārakāḥ sattvā bhaveyuḥ saddharmapratikṣepakāḥ āryāpavādakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānakāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ānantarya kārakāḥ sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ saddharma pratikṣepakāḥ ārya apavādakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhānakāḥ
translated: And may those beings in those buddha-fields who have committed the crimes with immediate retribution, who have rejected the true Dharma, who have reviled the noble ones, up to those who have formed roots of nonvirtue,

original: ye'pi tatra sattvāḥ śrāvakayānasaṃprasthitāḥ pratyekabuddhayānasaṃprasthitā mahāyānasaṃprasthitāḥ śikṣāyāṃ kalmāṣakāriṇaḥ chidracāriṇaḥ mūlāpattimāpannāḥ dagdhasantānāḥ śubhamārgapraṇaṣṭāḥ saṃsārāṭavīsaṃprasthitāḥ kumārgavihanyamānā mahāsaṅkaṭaprāptāḥ /
analyzed: ye api tatra sattvāḥ śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitāḥ pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitāḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ śikṣāyām kalmāṣa kāriṇaḥ chidra cāriṇaḥ mūla āpattim āpannāḥ dagdha santānāḥ śubha mārga praṇaṣṭāḥ saṃsāra aṭavī saṃprasthitāḥ ku mārga vihanyamānāḥ mahā saṅkaṭa prāptāḥ
translated: and those beings there who have set out in the vehicle of the hearers, who have set out in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, who have set out in the Great Vehicle, who have transgressed the training, who have practiced with a hole, who have incurred a root downfall, whose continuums are burned, who have lost the path of virtue, who have set out on the wilderness path of cyclic existence, who are hindered by bad paths, who have reached great danger,

original: tathārūpāḥ sattvāḥ sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrādeko buddhavigraha ekadivase sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: tathārūpāḥ sattvāḥ sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāt ekaḥ buddha vigrahaḥ eka divase sattvānām dharmam deśayet
translated: In the same way, may such beings, in the form of a single Buddha, teach the Dharma to many hundred thousand quintillions of beings in a single day.

original: ye sattvā maheśvarabhaktikāsteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ maheśvararūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ maheśvara bhaktikāḥ teṣām sattvānām maheśvara rūpeṇa dharmam deśayeyam
translated: For those beings who are devoted to Maheśvara, may I teach the Dharma in the form of Maheśvara.

original: sahe ca buddhakṣetre mama varṇaṃ bhāṣayeyustatra ca sattvānāṃ praṇidhānamudyojayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sahe ca buddhakṣetre mama varṇam bhāṣayeyuḥ tatra ca sattvānām praṇidhānam udyojayeyam
translated: And may they speak of my praise in the Sahā Buddha-field, and may I encourage the aspiration of beings there.

original: te ca sattvā mama varṇaṃ śrutvā mamaiva buddhakṣetre praṇidhānaṃ kurvīran /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ mama varṇam śrutvā mama eva buddhakṣetre praṇidhānam kurvīran
translated: And may those beings, having heard my praise, make the aspiration for my very own Buddha-field.

analyzed: upapattim ca ākāṅkṣeyuḥ
translated: And may they desire rebirth.

original: yādyahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ maraṇakālasamaye purataḥ na tiṣṭheyaṃ dharmaṃ na deśayeyaṃ cittaṃ na saṃprasādayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yādi aham bhadanta bhagavan teṣām sattvānām maraṇa kāla samaye puratas na tiṣṭheyam dharmam na deśayeyam cittam na saṃprasādayeyam
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, I do not stand before those beings at the time of their death, do not teach the Dharma, and do not gladden their minds,

analyzed: mā ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: may I not attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yadi me sattvāḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā durgatīṣūpapadyeyurna ca mama buddhakṣetre manuṣyapratilābhaṃ labheyuḥ /
analyzed: yadi me sattvāḥ kālam kṛtvā durgatīṣu upapadyeyuḥ na ca mama buddhakṣetre manuṣya pratilābham labheyuḥ
translated: If, after those beings have died, they are reborn in lower realms, and do not obtain human birth in my Buddha-field,

original: sarve mama dharmā saṃmoṣaṃ gaccheyurmā ca me pratibhāyeyurmā cāhaṃ śakyaṃ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ niṣpādayituṃ /
analyzed: sarve mama dharmāḥ saṃmoṣam gaccheyuḥ mā ca me pratibhāyeyuḥ mā ca aham śakyam sakalam buddha kāryam niṣpādayitum
translated: All my dharmas would be lost and not remembered by me, and I would not be able to accomplish the entire task of a Buddha.

original: ye sattvā nārāyaṇabhaktikā yāvatte sattvāḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā durgatiṃ prapateyustanmā cāhaṃ śakyaṃ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ niṣpādayituṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ nārāyaṇa bhaktikāḥ yāvat te sattvāḥ kālam kṛtvā durgatim prapateyuḥ tat mā ca aham śakyam sakalam buddha kāryam niṣpādayitum
translated: If those beings who are devoted to Nārāyaṇa, up to those beings who have died and fallen into bad rebirths, I would not be able to accomplish the entire task of a Buddha.

original: bodhiprāptasya ca me sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu sattvā ānantaryakārakā yāvat kumārge vihanyamānā mahāsaṅkaṭaprāptāḥ sattvāḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra
analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca me sarva buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat ku mārge vihanyamānāḥ mahā saṅkaṭa prāptāḥ sattvāḥ kālam kṛtvā mama buddhakṣetra
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, in all my Buddha-fields, those beings who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who are obstructed by the wrong path, those beings who have met with great danger, having died

original: idaṃ teṣāṃ nimittaṃ pāṃśuvarṇāste sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: idam teṣām nimittam pāṃśu varṇāḥ te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: This is a sign for them: those beings will have the color of dust.

original: piśācamukhī muṣṭasmṛtayo durgandhā duḥśīlā alpāyuṣkā vividharogopahatā vividhapariṣkāraparihīṇāśca te sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: piśācamukhī muṣṭa smṛtayaḥ durgandhāḥ duḥśīlāḥ alpa āyuṣkāḥ vividha roga upahatāḥ vividha pariṣkāra parihīṇāḥ ca te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have the face of a piśāca, be of limited mindfulness, have a bad smell, be of bad conduct, have a short lifespan, be afflicted by various diseases, and be deprived of various necessities.

original: teṣām sattvānāmarthe'haṃ yāvattasmin samaye sahe lokadhātau cāturdvīpikā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sattvānām artha īham yāvat tasmin samaye sahe lokadhātau cāturdvīpikāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: For the sake of those beings, I would become a Cāturdvīpaka in the Sahā world-system at that time.

original: sarvatra ca cāturdvīpikāyāṃ saṃtuṣitabhavanāvataraṇaṃ māturgarbhe cāhaṃ jātumupadarśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca cāturdvīpikāyām saṃtuṣita bhavana avataraṇam mātuḥ garbhe ca aham jātum upadarśayeyam
translated: And everywhere in the four continents, I would manifest descending from the Tuṣita heaven, entering my mother's womb, and being born.

analyzed: vistareṇa kumāra krīḍā śilpa karmasthāna duṣkara caryā māra dharṣaṇa bodhi abhisaṃbudhyana dharma cakra pravartanam
translated: In detail, I would show the youthful sports, the arts, the occupations, the difficult deeds, the practice of austerities, the conquest of Māra, the enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of Dharma,

analyzed: sarvatra ca cāturdvīpikāsu sakalam buddha kāryam upadarśayeyam
translated: and everywhere in the four continents, I would show the entire work of a Buddha.

analyzed: parinirvāṇam yāvat śarīra vibhāgam upadarśayeyam
translated: And I would show the parinirvāṇa, the division of the relics.

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham eka pada vyāhareṇa dharmam deśayeyam
translated: And having attained enlightenment, I would teach the Dharma with a single utterance.

original: ye sattvāḥ śrāvakayānikāste śrāvakayānakathāpiṭakaṃ dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ te śrāvaka yāna kathā piṭakam dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those beings who are followers of the Śrāvakayāna would understand the Dharma taught as the basket of scriptures of the Śrāvakayāna.

original: ye sattvāḥ pratyekabuddhavaineyāste pratyekabuddhayānakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyurye sattvā anuttaramahāyānikāste'nuttaramahāyānakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ pratyekabuddha vaineyāḥ te pratyekabuddha yāna kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ ye sattvāḥ anuttara mahāyānikāḥ tena uttara mahāyāna kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those beings who are to be guided by the Pratyekabuddhayāna would understand the Dharma taught as the discourse of the Pratyekabuddhayāna. Those beings who are followers of the unsurpassed Mahāyāna would understand the Dharma taught as the discourse of the unsurpassed Mahāyāna.

original: ye sattvāḥ saṃbhāravirahitāste dānakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyurye sattvāḥ puṇyavirahitāḥ sukhasvargābhilāṣināste śīlakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ saṃbhāra virahitāḥ te dāna kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ ye sattvāḥ puṇya virahitāḥ sukha svarga abhilāṣināḥ te śīla kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those beings who are devoid of the accumulations should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on generosity. Those beings who are devoid of merit, but desire happiness and heaven, should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on morality.

original: ye parasparabhītakaluṣacittāḥ praduṣṭacittāste maitryāvyāhārakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /🔽prāṇātipātikāḥ karuṇādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye paraspara bhīta kaluṣa cittāḥ praduṣṭa cittāḥ te maitryā avyāhāra kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ  prāṇa atipātikāḥ karuṇā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who are fearful of each other, with minds full of defilements and malice, should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on the expression of loving-kindness.🔽Those who kill should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on the Dharma of compassion.

original: ya īrṣyāmātsaryābhibhūtāste muditāvyāhārakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /🔽ye rūpārūpyamadamattacittāste upekṣāvyāhārakathādharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye īrṣyā mātsarya abhibhūtāḥ te muditā vyāhāra kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ  ye rūpa ārūpya mada matta cittāḥ te upekṣā vyāhāra kathā dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who are overcome by envy and stinginess should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on the expression of sympathetic joy.🔽Those whose minds are intoxicated by the pride of form and formlessness should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on the expression of equanimity.

analyzed: ye kāma rāga mada matta cittāḥ aśubha vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those whose minds are intoxicated by the pride of passion and desire should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on foulness.

original: ye ca sattvā mahāyānikauddhatyavyākulacittopagatāste ānāpānasmṛtivyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mahāyānika auddhatya vyākula citta upagatāḥ te āna apāna smṛti vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those beings who are followers of the Great Vehicle, but whose minds are agitated and distracted, should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: ye duḥprajñā vā pradīpapratītyasamutpādavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: ye duḥprajñāḥ vā pradīpa pratītyasamutpāda vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who are of little wisdom should understand the Dharma taught as the discourse on dependent origination and the lamp.

analyzed: ye ilpa śruta vādinaḥ te saṃpramoṣa śruta dhāraṇī vipraṇāśa vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who are of little learning should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on non-forgetfulness and retention of what is heard, which is not lost.

analyzed: kudṛṣṭi saṅkaṭa prāptāḥ śūnyatā vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who have fallen into the narrowness of wrong views should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on emptiness.

original: vitarkasamudācāropahatā animittavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitāmājānīyurapraṇihitāpariśuddhopahatā apraṇihitavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: vitarka samudācāra upahatāḥ animitta vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitām ājānīyuḥ apraṇihita apariśuddha upahatāḥ apraṇihita vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those who are afflicted by the occurrence of discursive thoughts should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the signless. Those who are afflicted by the impurity of non-resolve and non-purification should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the wishless.

original: āśayāpariśūddhāḥ pariśuddhāśayavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /🔽vyavakīrṇasamudācāropahatā bodhicittāsaṃpramoṣavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /🔽kṣamaprayogoṣmopahatā akṛtrimavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /
analyzed: āśaya a pariśūddhāḥ pariśuddha āśaya vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ  vyavakīrṇa samudācāra upahatāḥ bodhi citta a saṃpramoṣa vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ  kṣama prayoga ūṣma upahatāḥ akṛtrima vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ
translated: Those whose intention is impure should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the pure intention.🔽Those who are afflicted by the occurrence of confusion should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the non-forgetting of the mind of enlightenment.🔽Those who are afflicted by the heat of the practice of patience should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the unfabricated.

original: adhyāśayapraśrabdhopahatā aniśritavyāhāreṇa dharmaṃ deśitamājānīyuḥ /🔽kliṣṭacittāḥ peyālaṃ kalpacittavyāhāreṇa /
analyzed: adhyāśaya praśrabdha upahatāḥ a niśrita vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ  kliṣṭa cittāḥ peyālam kalpa citta vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those who are afflicted by the relaxation of superior intention should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on non-dependence.🔽Those with afflicted minds should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on the mind of the kalpa.

analyzed: kuśala saṃpramoṣa cittā vairocana vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with forgetful wholesome minds should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on Vairocana.

analyzed: māra karma udyuktāḥ śūnyatā vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those who are diligent in the deeds of Mara should understand the teaching as expressed in the discourse on emptiness.

analyzed: para vadhe saṃpratipannāḥ abhyudgata vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those intent on killing others with the speech of the exalted.

analyzed: vividha kleśa upahata cittāḥ vigata vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with minds afflicted by various afflictions with the speech of the departed.

analyzed: viṣama mārga saṃpratipannāḥ āvarta vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those on the wrong path with the speech of the returner.

analyzed: mahāyāna kautuhala cittā vivarta vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with curiosity about the Great Vehicle with the speech of the non-returner.

analyzed: saṃsāra udvignānām bodhisattvānām rati vyāhāreṇa  kuśala bhūmi jñāna avagatāḥ amūḍha vyāhāreṇa
translated: For bodhisattvas distressed by samsara with the speech of delight.🔽Those who have understood the knowledge of the stages of virtue with the speech of the non-deluded.

analyzed: paraspara asaṃtuṣṭa kuśala mūlānām śruta vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with roots of virtue who are not content with each other with the speech of the learned.

analyzed: paraspara asama cittānām apratihata raśmi vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with different minds with the speech of the unobstructed radiance.

analyzed: viṣama karma saṃpratipannānām kriyā avatāraṇa vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those engaged in wrong actions with the speech of the descent into action.

analyzed: parṣad bhaya upagatānām siṃhaketu vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those who have come to the assembly with the speech of the lion banner.

analyzed: catur māra abhibhūta cittānām śūra vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with minds overcome by the four maras with the speech of the hero.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra anavabhāsa gatānām sattvānām prabhā vyūha vyāhāreṇa
translated: Beings in the Buddha-fields without illumination with the speech of the array of power.

analyzed: anunaya pratighānām śaila uccaya vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those with attachment and aversion with the speech of the mountain peak.

analyzed: buddha dharma ālokana abhibhūtānām dhvaja agra keyūra vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those overcome by the light of the Buddha's Dharma with the speech of the banner top ornament.

analyzed: mahā prajñā virahitānām ulkā pāta vyāhāreṇa
translated: Those devoid of great wisdom with the speech of the falling meteor.

analyzed: moha andhakāra gatānām bhāskara pradīpa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are in the darkness of delusion, with the discourse of the sun-lamp.

analyzed: kṣaya anirukti prayuktānām guṇa ākara vyāhāreṇa  phena piṇḍa upama ātma abhikāṅkṣiṇām nārāyaṇa vyāhāreṇa  cala acala buddhīnām sāra anugata vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are engaged in the teaching of impermanence, with the discourse of the mine of qualities.🔽For those who desire a self that is like a lump of foam, with the discourse of Narayana.🔽For those with wavering and unstable minds, with the discourse of following the essence.

analyzed: avalokita mūrdhānām merudhvaja vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those with heads that are looked down upon, with the discourse of Merudhvaja.

analyzed: pūrva pratijñā utsṛṣṭānām sāravatī vyāhāreṇa  cyuta abhijñānām vajra pada vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have abandoned their previous vows, with the discourse of the firm essence.🔽For those who have lost their higher knowledge, with the discourse of the vajra words.

analyzed: bodhimaṇḍa abhikāṅkṣiṇām vajramaṇḍa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who desire the seat of enlightenment, with the discourse of the vajra circle.

analyzed: sarva dharma jugupsitānām vajra upama vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who despise all phenomena, with the discourse of the vajra-like.

analyzed: sattva caritam a prajānatām cāritravati vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who do not understand the conduct of beings, with the discourse of virtuous conduct.

analyzed: indriya para apara anabhijñānām prajñā pradīpa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who do not know the higher and lower faculties, with the discourse of the lamp of wisdom.

analyzed: paraspara rutam a prajānatām ruta praveśa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who do not understand each other's language, with the discourse of entering the language.

analyzed: dharmakāyam a pratilabdhānām saddharmakāya vibhāvana vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have not attained the Dharma body, with the discourse of manifesting the true Dharma body.

analyzed: tathāgata darśana virahitānām animiṣa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are devoid of seeing the Tathagata, with the discourse of the unblinking eye.

analyzed: sarva ālaṃbana vigopitānām araṇya vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have concealed all objects, with the discourse of the wilderness.

analyzed: dharmacakra pravartana abhikāṅkṣiṇām cakra vimala vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who desire to turn the wheel of the Dharma, with the recitation of the stainless wheel.

analyzed: ahetu vidyā saṃprasthitānām vidyā pratītya anuloma vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have set out in non-causal knowledge, with the recitation that accords with the attainment of knowledge.

analyzed: eka buddhakṣetra śāśvata dṛṣṭīnām sukṛta vicaya vyāhāreṇa  lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana anavarupta bījānām alaṅkāravatī vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have the view of the permanence of the one Buddha field, with the recitation of the well-examined good.🔽For those who have not sown the seeds of the major and minor marks, with the recitation of the one who is adorned.

analyzed: vācā ruta prabheda asamarthānām nirhāravati vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are unable to distinguish the beautiful speech, with the recitation of the one who has attained.

analyzed: sarvajña jñāna abhikāṅkṣiṇām dharmadhātu avikopana vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who desire the knowledge of omniscience, with the recitation of the non-disturbance of the dharma realm.

analyzed: pratyutpanna āvartana dharmāṇām dṛḍha vyāhāreṇa  dharmadhātum a prajānatām abhijñā vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those whose nature is to return to the present, with the recitation of firmness.🔽For those who do not understand the dharma realm, with the recitation of the superknowledges.

analyzed: prajñā utsṛṣṭānām acyuta vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have abandoned wisdom, with the recitation of the unfallen.

analyzed: mārga vigopitānām avikāra vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are hidden by the path, with the recitation of the unchanging.

analyzed: ākāśa sama jñāna abhikāṅkṣiṇām niṣkiñcana vyāhāreṇa  pāramitā paripūrṇānām pariśuddha pratiṣṭhā vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who desire the knowledge that is like space, with the recitation of the desireless.🔽For those who have not fulfilled the perfections, with the recitation of the pure abode.

analyzed: a paripūrṇa a saṃgraha vastūnām su saṃgṛhīta vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have not fulfilled the means of gathering, with the recitation of the well-gathered.

analyzed: brahmavihāra vimārgitānām sama prayoga vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who seek the brahma abodes, with the recitation of the equal application.

analyzed: bodhi pakṣa ratna aparipūrṇānām avyavasthita niryāṇa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those whose jewels of the factors of awakening are incomplete, with the discourse on the unfixed liberation.

analyzed: su bhāṣita jñānām pramuṣṭa cittānām sāgara mudrā vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who know good speech but have lost their minds, with the discourse on the ocean seal.

analyzed: anutpattika dharma kṣānti kautūhala cittānām niścita vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those whose minds are curious about the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, with the discourse on certainty.

analyzed: yathā śruta dharma pramuṣṭa cittānām a saṃpramoṣa vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those whose minds have forgotten the Dharma as it was heard, with the discourse on non-forgetfulness.

analyzed: paraspara subhāṣita asaṃtuṣṭānām vitimira vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are not content with each other's good speech, with the discourse on the absence of darkness.

analyzed: triratna a pratilabdha prasādānām puṇya utsada vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have not attained faith in the Three Jewels, with the discourse on the abundance of merit.

analyzed: dharma mukha pravarṣaṇa asaṃtuṣṭānām dharma megha vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are not content with the rain of Dharma teachings, with the discourse on the Dharma cloud.

analyzed: triratna uccheda dṛṣṭīnām ratnavyūha vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have the view that the Three Jewels will be cut off, with the discourse on the array of jewels.

analyzed: jñāna ardita karma abhiyuktānām anupama vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are diligent in actions that are difficult to know, with the incomparable discourse.

analyzed: sarva saṃyojana bandhana gatānām gagana mukha vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who are bound by all fetters and bonds, with the discourse on the sky gate.

analyzed: sarva dharma ananya cittānām jñānamudrā vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those whose minds are not different regarding all dharmas, with the discourse on the seal of knowledge.

analyzed: tathāgata guṇa a paripūrṇānām loka vidyā saṃmukhībhāva vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have not fulfilled the qualities of the Tathāgata, with the discourse on the manifestation of worldly knowledge.

analyzed: viniścita prātihārya vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those who have not done good deeds for the Buddhas of the past, with the discourse on the determined miracle.

analyzed: eka dharma mukha aparāntaka kalpa anirdiṣṭānām sarva dharma naya vyāhāreṇa  sarva sutrānta aviniścitānām dharma svabhāva samatā viniścita vyāhāreṇa
translated: the Dharma gateways that are taught for eons in the future through the expression of all the principles of the Dharma;🔽the ascertainment of all the sūtras through the expression of the ascertainment of the equality of the nature of phenomena;

analyzed: ṣaṣ pārāyaṇīya dharma parivarjitānām sarva dharma naya vyāhāreṇa
translated: the abandonment of the six dharmas that are to be rejected through the expression of all the principles of the Dharma;

analyzed: vimokṣa citta āśaya anabhiyuktānām vikriḍita abhijñā vyāhāreṇa
translated: the play of the higher cognitions for those who are not diligent in the intention and aspiration for liberation;

analyzed: tathāgata guhya anupraveśa vimarśitānām apara praṇeya vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of not being led by others for those who reflect on entering the secrets of the Tathāgatas;

analyzed: bodhisattva caryā an abhiyuktānām jñāna āgama vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of the attainment of knowledge for those who are not diligent in the conduct of the bodhisattvas;

analyzed: jñāti kāma saṃdarśikānām sarvatra anugata vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of being present everywhere for those who demonstrate desire for relatives;

analyzed: sa avaśeṣa bodhisattva cārikānām abhiṣeka vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of consecration for those who have not completed the conduct of the bodhisattvas;

analyzed: daśa tathāgata bala a paripūrṇānām anavamarda vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of being invincible for those who have not perfected the ten powers of the Tathāgata;

analyzed: catur vaiśāradya a pratilabdhānām a paryādīnava vyāhāreṇa  āveṇika buddha dharma a pratilabdhānām asaṃhārya vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of being without danger for those who have not attained the four forms of fearlessness;🔽the expression of being unassailable for those who have not attained the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha;

analyzed: amogha śravaṇa darśanānām praṇidhāna vyāhāreṇa
translated: the expression of aspiration for those who have not attained the unimpeded eloquence of the Dharma;🔽the expression of the accumulation of merit for those who have not attained the unimpeded eloquence of the Dharma;🔽the expression of the accumulation of wisdom for those who have not attained the unimpeded eloquence of the Dharma;

analyzed: sarva buddha dharma saṃmukha anubodhāya śrota āvilānām vimala samudra vyāhāreṇa
translated: For the direct realization of all the Buddha-dharmas, for the listeners, through the discourse of the stainless ocean.

analyzed: sa avaśeṣa sarvajña jñānānām su vibuddha vyāhāreṇa
translated: For those with remaining ignorance, through the discourse of well-awakened knowledge.

analyzed: aprāpta sarva tathāgata kārya abhiprāyānām aparyanta niṣṭhā vyāhāreṇa dharmam deśitam ājānīyuḥ iti
translated: For those who have not yet attained the intention of the activities of all Tathagatas, through the discourse of the endless culmination, they should understand the Dharma to be taught.

original: ye bodhisattvā aśaṭhā amāyāvino ṛjukā ṛjuka jātīyāśca teṣāṃ caturaśītidharmamukhasahasrāṇi caturaśītisamādhimukhasahasrāṇi pañcasaptatidhāraṇīmukhasahasrāṇi aprameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ ekapadavyāhāreṇa ime guṇāḥ santāne pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ a śaṭhāḥ a māyāvinaḥ ṛjukāḥ ṛjuka jātīyāḥ ca teṣām caturaśīti dharma mukha sahasrāṇi caturaśīti samādhi mukha sahasrāṇi pañca saptati dhāraṇī mukha sahasrāṇi aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām eka pada vyāhāreṇa ime guṇāḥ santāne pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: For those bodhisattvas who are without deceit, without pretense, straightforward, and of straightforward lineage, I would establish in their continuums, through the utterance of a single word, these qualities: eighty-four thousand dharma doors, eighty-four thousand doors of concentration, seventy-five thousand doors of retention, for innumerable, countless beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: yena bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ mahā saṃnāha saṃnaddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: By which the bodhisattva mahasattvas would be armored in the great armor.

analyzed: acintya praṇidhāna viśeṣa abhyudgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ acintya jñāna darśana bodhisat guṇa alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They would be exalted by inconceivable special vows. They would be adorned with the good qualities of inconceivable knowledge and insight.

analyzed: tat yathā kāya alaṅkṛtāḥ lakṣaṇa anuvyañjanaiḥ
translated: Just as the body is adorned with the major and minor marks,

analyzed: vāc alaṅkṛtāḥ bhaveyuḥ yathā abhiprāyāḥ
translated: they would be adorned with speech according to their intentions.

analyzed: sattvāḥ su bhāṣitena saṃtoṣayeyuḥ  śruta alaṅkṛtāḥ samādhya vacana tayā
translated: Beings should be satisfied with good speech.🔽Adorned with learning, due to the attainment of concentration.

analyzed: smṛtyā alaṅkṛtāḥ dhāraṇya saṃpramoṣa tayā  manaḥ ulaṅkṛtāḥ nirvṛtyā alaṅkṛtāḥ ku gati avabudhyana tayā
translated: Adorned with mindfulness, due to the non-forgetfulness of retention.🔽Adorned with the mind, adorned with liberation, due to understanding the right path.

analyzed: āśayā alaṅkṛtāḥ dṛḍha pratijñātayā  prayoga alaṅkṛtāḥ pratijñā uttāraṇa tayā
translated: Adorned with aspiration, due to firm vows.🔽Adorned with practice, due to fulfilling one's vows.

analyzed: adhyāśaya alaṅkṛtāḥ bhūmyāḥ bhūmi saṃkramaṇa tayā
translated: Adorned with superior intention, due to progressing from stage to stage.

analyzed: dāna alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva vastu parityāga tayā
translated: Adorned with generosity, due to relinquishing all things.

analyzed: śīla alaṅkṛtāḥ su śruta āvita vimala tayā  kṣānti alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva sattva apratihata citta tayā
translated: Adorned with morality, due to the purity of well-practiced precepts.🔽Adorned with patience, due to having a mind that is not obstructed by any being.

analyzed: vīrya alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva saṃbhāra upacita tayā
translated: Adorned with effort, due to accumulating all provisions.

analyzed: dhyāna alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva samāpatti vikrīḍita abhijñāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Adorned with meditation, they should delight in all meditative absorptions and higher knowledges.

analyzed: prajñā alaṅkṛtāḥ kleśa vāsana parijñāvinaḥ  maitryā alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva sattvasya trāya anugatāḥ  karuṇā alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva sattva a parityāga sthitā
translated: Adorned with wisdom, they should know the latent tendencies of afflictions.🔽Adorned with loving-kindness, they should be devoted to the protection of all beings.🔽Adorned with compassion, they should abide without abandoning any being.

analyzed: mudita alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva dharma akathaṃkathā prāptā
translated: Adorned with joy, they should attain the state of having no doubts about any teaching.

analyzed: upekṣā alaṅkṛtāḥ unnāma avanāma dvaya vigatāḥ
translated: They are adorned with equanimity, free from the two extremes of exaltation and disparagement.

analyzed: abhijñā alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva vikrīḍita abhijñāḥ
translated: They are adorned with the higher knowledges, having mastered all the supernormal powers.

analyzed: puṇya alaṅkṛtā akṣaya bhoga ratna pāṇi tā pratilabdhā
translated: They are adorned with merit, having attained inexhaustible wealth and the boon of the jewel in their hands.

analyzed: jñāna alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva sattva citta carita abhijñā
translated: They are adorned with knowledge, having mastered the thoughts and actions of all beings.

analyzed: buddhyā alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva sattva kauśalya dharma vibodhayitāraḥ
translated: They are adorned with wisdom, having awakened to the skillful means of the Dharma for all beings.

analyzed: āloka alaṅkṛtāḥ prajñācakṣuḥ ālokam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: They are adorned with light, having attained the light of the eye of wisdom.

analyzed: pratisaṃvid alaṅkṛtāḥ artha dharma nirukti pratibhāna pratisaṃvid pratilabdhāḥ bhaveyuḥ vaiśāradya alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva māra para pravādin abhibhūtā
translated: They are adorned with the analytical knowledges, having attained the analytical knowledges of meaning, Dharma, language, and eloquence. They are adorned with fearlessness, having overcome all demons and opponents.

analyzed: guṇa alaṅkṛtā buddhānām guṇa anuprāptā
translated: They are adorned with virtues, having attained the virtues of the Buddhas.

original: dharmālaṅkṛtāḥ satatasamitamasaṅgapratibhānena sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyuḥ /🔽ālokālaṅkṛtāḥ sarvabuddhadharmāvabhāsagatāḥ /
analyzed: dharma alaṅkṛtāḥ satata samitam asaṅga pratibhānena sattvānām dharmam deśayeyuḥ  āloka alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva buddha dharma avabhāsa gatāḥ
translated: They are adorned with the Dharma, always and continuously teaching the Dharma to beings with unobstructed eloquence.🔽They are adorned with light, having attained the illumination of all the Buddha-Dharmas.

analyzed: prabhā alaṅkṛtāḥ sarva buddhakṣetra avabhāsa gatā
translated: They are adorned with radiance, having attained the illumination of all Buddha-fields.

analyzed: ādarśana prātihārya alaṅkṛtā akṣuṇa vyākaraṇā
translated: They are adorned with the miraculous power of reflection, having uninterrupted predictions.

analyzed: anuśāsanī prātihārya alaṅkṛtā yathāvat anuśāsanī pradāyakā
translated: Adorned with the miracle of instruction, they are givers of proper instruction.

analyzed: ṛddhi prātihārya alaṅkṛtāḥ catur ṛddhipāda parama pāramitā prāptāḥ
translated: Adorned with the miracle of psychic power, they have attained the supreme perfection of the four bases of psychic power.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna alaṅkṛtāḥ tathāgata guhya anupraviṣṭā
translated: Adorned with the consecration of all Tathāgatas, they have penetrated the secrets of the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: dharma aiśvarya alaṅkṛtāḥ apara adhīna jñāna pratilabdhāḥ
translated: Adorned with sovereignty over the Dharma, they have attained knowledge that is not dependent on others.

analyzed: sarva kuśala dharma pratipatti sāra alaṅkṛtāḥ yathāvādi tathākāri sarvatas nava marditāḥ bhaveyuḥ iti
translated: Adorned with the essence of the practice of all wholesome dharmas, they are invincible in every way.

original: apramāṇāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ sattvānāmekapadavyāhāreṇāhaṃ mahatā kuśalaviśodhanasaṃnicayena saṃtarpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: apramāṇa asaṃkhyeyānām mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām sattvānām eka pada vyāhāreṇa aham mahatā kuśala viśodhana saṃnicayena saṃtarpayeyam
translated: With a single utterance, I would satisfy countless beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle with a great accumulation of purified wholesome actions.

analyzed: tatas te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarva dharmeṣu apara pratyaya jñānam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: Then those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas would attain knowledge that is not dependent on others regarding all dharmas.

analyzed: mahatā ca dharma avabhāsena samanvāgatāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They would be endowed with a great illumination of the Dharma.

analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ iti
translated: And they would quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: ye'pi te bhadanta bhagavan sattvā bhaveyuranyeṣu lokadhātuṣvānantaryakārakā yāvanmūlāpattisāparādhikā dagdhasantānāḥ śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vā anuttaramahāyānikā vā praṇidhānavaśena mama buddhakṣetre pratyājāyeyuḥ /🔽akuśalamūlasamavadhānā rukṣāḥ pāpecchāḥ krūrakhaṭuṅkasantānā viparītabuddhaya āgṛhītasantānāḥ teṣāṃ cāhaṃ caturaśītiścittarutasahasrāṃ deśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye api te bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat mūla āpatti sa aparādhikāḥ dagdha santānāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā anuttara mahā yānikāḥ vā praṇidhāna vaśena mama buddhakṣetre pratyājāyeyuḥ  akuśala mūla samavadhānāḥ rukṣāḥ pāpa icchāḥ krūra khaṭuṅka santānāḥ viparīta buddhayaḥ āgṛhīta santānāḥ teṣām ca aham caturaśītiḥ citta ruta sahasrām deśayeyuḥ
translated: Those beings, Venerable Blessed One, who in other world systems may have committed the acts of immediate retribution, up to those who have committed root downfalls, whose mind-streams are burned, whether they are followers of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, or the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, may be reborn in my Buddha field through the power of their vows.🔽They will be entangled with the roots of non-virtue, rough, with evil desires, their mind-streams cruel and agitated, their minds distorted, their mind-streams seized. For them, I will teach the eighty-four thousand mental states and the eighty-four thousand dharmas.

original: yāvat kuśīdacittānāṃ sattvānāmahaṃ caturaśītidharmaskandhasahasrāṇi vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat kuśīdacittānām sattvānām aham caturaśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi vistareṇa deśayeyam
translated: For those beings with lazy minds, I will extensively teach the eighty-four thousand heaps of Dharma.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā anuttaramahāyānikā bhaveyuḥ teṣāṃ cāhaṃ vistareṇa ṣaṭpāramitādharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ anuttara mahāyānikāḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām ca aham vistareṇa ṣaṣ pāramitā dharmam deśayeyam
translated: Those beings there who are followers of the unsurpassed Great Vehicle, for them I will extensively teach the Dharma of the six perfections.

original: dānapāramitāṃ vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāṃ vistareṇa deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitām vistareṇa deśayeyam yāvat prajñāpāramitām vistareṇa deśayeyam
translated: I will extensively teach the perfection of generosity, up to I will extensively teach the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye ca punastatra sattvāḥ śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca punar tatra sattvāḥ śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those beings there who would be in the Śrāvakayāna or Pratyekabuddhayāna,

analyzed: an avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: who would not have planted the roots of virtue,

analyzed: śāstāra abhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: who would desire a teacher,

analyzed: tān ca aham triśaraṇa gamanena vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the threefold refuge.

original: paścāt pāramitāsu niyojayeyaṃ /🔽vihiṃsāratānāṃ prānātipātavairamaṇyāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /🔽viṣamalobhābhibhūtānāmadattādānavairamaṇyāṃ vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: paścāt pāramitāsu niyojayeyam  vihiṃsā ratānām prāna atipāta vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam  viṣama lobha abhibhūtānām adatta ādāna vairamaṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: Afterwards I would engage them in the perfections.🔽I would establish those who delight in violence in refraining from killing.🔽I would establish those overwhelmed by unjust greed in refraining from taking what is not given.

analyzed: adharma rāga raktām kāma mithyā ācāra vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam  paraspara paruṣa vacana bhāṣiṇaḥ mṛṣāvāda vairamaṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish those passionate with unrighteous lust in refraining from sexual misconduct.🔽I would establish those who speak harsh words to each other in refraining from false speech.

analyzed: unmatta abhiratān surā maireya madya pramāda vaira maṇyām vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish those who delight in intoxication in refraining from intoxicating drinks.

original: yeṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ sarvapañcadoṣā bhaveyustāṃ pañcadoṣavairamaṇyopāsakasaṃvare vyavasthāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yeṣām ca sattvānām sarva pañca doṣāḥ bhaveyuḥ tām pañca doṣa vaira maṇya upāsaka saṃvare vyavasthāpayeyam
translated: And those beings who would have all five faults, I would establish them in the lay follower's restraint with the five precepts.

original: ye sattvā anabhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu tāṃścāhaṃ rātriṃdivasamaṣṭāṅge śīle pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ an abhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu tān ca aham rātriṃdivasam aṣṭa aṅge śīle pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Those beings who are not devoted to wholesome dharmas, I would establish them in the eightfold noble path of the noble ones day and night.

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ parītta kuśala mūla abhirata cittāḥ tān ca api aham su ākhyāte dharma vinaye upaśleṣayeyam
translated: Those beings who delight in the roots of virtue that are limited, I would also bring them into the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

analyzed: pravrajyā saṃvare daśa śikṣā pade brahmacarye sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the ten precepts of the vow of going forth and in celibacy.

original: ye sattvāḥ kuśalān dharmān paryeṣṭukāmāstānapyahaṃ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu samādāpya sakale brahmacaryavāse pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ kuśalān dharmān paryeṣṭu kāmāḥ tān api aham kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu samādāpya sakale brahmacarya vāse pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Those beings who desire to seek wholesome dharmas, I would also inspire them in wholesome dharmas and establish them in the complete abode of celibacy.

original: evaṃrūpānāmānantaryakārakānāṃ yāvad āgṛhītasantānānāṃ sattvānāmarthe cāhaṃ bahuvividhanānārthapadavyañjanaprātihāryairdharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpānām ānantarya kārakānām yāvat āgṛhīta santānānām sattvānām arthe ca aham bahu vividha nānā artha pada vyañjana prātihāryaiḥ dharmam deśayeyam
translated: For the sake of such beings as those who have committed the acts with immediate result, up to those whose minds are seized, I would teach the Dharma with various kinds of wonderful words, phrases, and letters.

analyzed: anitya duḥkha anātma śūnya skandha dhātu āyatanāni darśayeyam
translated: I would show them the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self.

original: kuśale kṣeme śive śānte'bhayapure nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: kuśale kṣeme śive śānta ibhaya pure nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in the wholesome, the secure, the auspicious, the peaceful, the city of fearlessness, and in nirvana.

original: evamahaṃ caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam aham caturṇām parṣadām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: In this way, I would teach the Dharma to the four assemblies of monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers.

original: ye ca vādārthino bhaveyusteṣāṃ ahaṃ dharmavādaśāstraṃ prakāśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca vāda arthinaḥ bhaveyuḥ teṣām aham dharma vāda śāstram prakāśayeyam
translated: I would reveal the treatise on the Dharma of debate to those who would seek it.

original: ye ca nābhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu teṣāṃ cāhaṃ vaiyāvṛtyakarmāṇi nirdiśeyam /
analyzed: ye ca na abhiratāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu teṣām ca aham vaiyāvṛtya karmāṇi nirdiśeyam
translated: I would point out the duties of service to those who are not devoted to wholesome dharmas.

analyzed: svādhyāya abhiratānām eka aṃśena śūnyatām dhyāna vimukti gāminām nirdeśayeyam
translated: I would teach emptiness, concentration, and liberation by a single statement to those devoted to recitation.

analyzed: ekaikasya sattvasya arthāya aham bahu yojana śata sahasrāṇi pradbhyām gaccheyam
translated: I would go on foot for many hundreds of thousands of yojanas for the sake of each and every being.

analyzed: bahu vividha nānā prakāra artha pada vyañjana upāya prātihāryaiḥ akhedam utsaheyam
translated: I would be tireless in using various kinds of words, phrases, and letters, and various kinds of skillful means and wonders.

analyzed: yāvat nirvāṇe sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish them in nirvana.

analyzed: yāvat samādhāna balena aham pañcama bhāgam āyuḥ saṃskārāṇām avasṛjeyam
translated: I would give up one-fifth of my lifespan through the power of concentration.

analyzed: parinirvāṇa kāla samaye ca aham svayam eva sva śarīra sarṣapa phala pramāṇa mātram bhindeyam
translated: At the time of my parinirvana, I would myself break my body into pieces the size of mustard seeds.

original: sattvānāṃ kāruṇyārthe cāhaṃ paścāt parinirvāpayeyaṃ /🔽parinirvṛtasya ca me varṣasahasraṃ saddharmastiṣṭhet /
analyzed: sattvānām kāruṇya arthe ca aham paścāt parinirvāpayeyam  parinirvṛtasya ca me varṣa sahasram saddharmaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for the sake of compassion for beings, I would then attain parinirvana.🔽And for one thousand years after my parinirvana, the true Dharma would remain.

analyzed: pañca punar varṣa śatāni saddharma pratirūpakaḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: And for five hundred years, a counterfeit of the true Dharma would remain.

original: ye ca sattvā mama parinirvṛtasya śarīreṣu pūjautsukyamāpadyeyū ratnairyāvadvādyairantaśa ekabuddhanāmaikavandanā ekapradakṣinīkaraṇena ekāñjalikarmaṇā ekapuṣpeṇa pūjāṃ kurvīran /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mama parinirvṛtasya śarīreṣu pūjā autsukyam āpadyeyuḥ ratnaiḥ yāvat vādyaiḥ antaśas eka buddha nāma eka vandanāḥ eka pradakṣinīkaraṇena eka añjali karmaṇā eka puṣpeṇa pūjām kurvīran
translated: And those beings who, after my parinirvāṇa, would be eager to worship my relics with jewels up to musical instruments, even by offering a single Buddha name, a single prostration, a single circumambulation, a single act of añjali, or worshipping with a single flower,

analyzed: sarve bhaveyuḥ yathā abhiprāyāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ
translated: may all of them become irreversible as intended by the three vehicles.

original: ye ca sattvā mama parinirvṛtasya śāsane'ntaśa ekaśikṣāpadamapi gṛhṇīyuryathoktaṃ samādāya varteyuryāvaccatuṣpadagāthāṃ paryavāpnuyurvācayeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ mama parinirvṛtasya śāsanā intaśas eka śikṣā padam api gṛhṇīyuḥ yathā uktam samādāya varteyuḥ yāvat catuṣpada gāthām paryavāpnuyuḥ vācayeyuḥ
translated: And those beings who, in my parinirvāṇa, would take up even a single precept in the teaching, and practice as instructed, up to those who would master or recite a four-line verse,

analyzed: pareṣām ca deśayeyuḥ
translated: and would teach it to others,

original: ye'pi śṛṇuyuścittaṃ vā prasādayeyurdharmabhāṇakasya vā pūjāṃ kuryurantaśa ekapuṣpeṇāpi ekavandanenāpi /
analyzed: ye api śṛṇuyuḥ cittam vā prasādayeyuḥ dharma bhāṇakasya vā pūjām kuryuḥ antaśas eka puṣpeṇa api eka vandanena api
translated: and those who would hear it and rejoice in their minds, or make offerings to the Dharma teacher, even with a single flower or a single prostration,

analyzed: sarve bhaveyuḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ yathā abhiprāyā
translated: may all of them become irreversible by the three vehicles as intended.

original: yāvat saddharme'ntarhite saddharmolkāyāṃ nirvāpitāyāṃ dharmadhvaje patite te ca mama janmaśarīramavatareyuryāvat kāñcanacakre tiṣṭheyuryasmin kāle sahe buddhakṣetre ratnadurbhikṣaṃ bhavet tasmin samaye ketumatirnāma maṇivaiḍuryamayaṃ agninirbhāsaṃ tiṣṭhet /
analyzed: yāvat saddharme antarhite saddharma ulkāyām nirvāpitāyām dharma dhvaje patite te ca mama janma śarīram avatareyuḥ yāvat kāñcana cakre tiṣṭheyuḥ yasmin kāle sahe buddhakṣetre ratna durbhikṣam bhavet tasmin samaye ketumatiḥ nāma maṇi vaiḍurya mayam agni nirbhāsam tiṣṭhet
translated: When the true Dharma has disappeared, when the torch of the true Dharma has been extinguished, when the Dharma banner has fallen, may they descend into my birth body and remain on the golden wheel until that time when there is a famine of jewels in the Buddha-field of Saha. At that time, a jewel called Ketumatī, made of beryl and shining like fire, will appear.

original: tacca tato'bhyudgamyorddhvaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavane sthitvā vividhāṃ puṣpavṛṣṭiṃ pravarṣet /🔽māndāravamahāmāndāravapārijātakamañjuṣakamahāmañjuṣakarocamahārocamānapūrṇācandravimalāśatapatrasahasrapatraśatasahasrapatrasamantaprabhāsamantagandhāsurucirasadāphalāhṛdayanayanābhiramyājyotiprabhājyotirasānantavarṇānantagandhānantaprabhānāṃ evaṃrūpānāṃ puṣpavarṣaṃ abhipravarṣet /
analyzed: tat ca tatas abhyudgamya ūrddhvam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavane sthitvā vividhām puṣpa vṛṣṭim pravarṣet 🔽māndārava mahāmāndārava pārijātaka mañjuṣaka mahāmañjuṣaka roca mahārocamāna pūrṇā candra vimalā śatapatra sahasrapatra śatasahasrapatra samantaprabhā samantagandhā surucira sadāphalā hṛdayanayanā abhiramyā jyotiprabhā jyotirasā anantavarṇā anantagandhā anantaprabhānām evaṃrūpānām puṣpa varṣam abhipravarṣet
translated: And having risen from there, it will remain above, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, and will rain down various flower showers.🔽It will rain down showers of flowers such as māndārava, mahāmāndārava, pārijātaka, mañjuṣaka, mahāmañjuṣaka, rocam, mahārocam, pūrṇacandra, vimalā, śatapatra, sahasrapatra, śatasahasrapatra, samantaprabhāsa, samantagandhā, surucira, sadāphala, hṛdayanayanābhirāma, jyotīprabhā, jyotīrasa, anantavarṇa, anantagandhā, and ananta-prabhā.

original: tataśca puṣpavarṣādvividhā śabdā niścareyustadyathā buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabda upāsakasaṃvaraśabda āryāṣṭāṅgasamanvāgatopoṣadhopavāsaśabdo daśapravrajyāśikṣāpadasaṃvaraśabdo dānaśabdaḥ śīlaśabdaḥ sakalabrahmacaryaparipūrṇopasaṃpadāśabdo vaiyāvṛttiśabdo'dhyayanaśabdaḥ pratisaṃlayanaśabdaḥ yoniśomanasikāraśabdo'śubhaśabdo ānāpānasmṛtiśabdo naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanaśabda ākiñcanyāyatanaśabdo vijñānānantyāyatanaśabda ākāśānantyāyatanaśabdo'bhibhavāyatanaśabdaḥ kṛtsnāyatanaśabdaḥ śamathavipaśyanāśabdaḥ śūnyatāpraṇihitaśabdo'nimittaśabdaḥ pratītyasamutpādaśabdaḥ sakalaśrāvakapiṭakaśabdaśca niścaret /
analyzed: tatas ca puṣpa varṣāt vividhā śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ tat yathā buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ upāsaka saṃvara śabdaḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga samanvāgata upoṣadha upavāsa śabdaḥ daśa pravrajyā śikṣā pada saṃvara śabdaḥ dāna śabdaḥ śīla śabdaḥ sakala brahmacarya paripūrṇa upasaṃpadā śabdaḥ vaiyāvṛtti śabda adhyayana śabdaḥ pratisaṃlayana śabdaḥ yoni śomanasikāra śabda ūśubha śabdaḥ āna apāna smṛti śabdaḥ na eva s
translated: And from that rain of flowers, various sounds would come forth, namely the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the lay devotee's precepts, the sound of the eightfold noble path, the sound of the fasting vow, the sound of the ten precepts of going forth, the sound of giving, the sound of morality, the sound of the complete fulfillment of the pure life, the sound of ordination, the sound of service, the sound of study, the sound of seclusion, the sound of proper attention, the sound of impurity, the sound of mindfulness of breathing, the sound of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, the sound of the sphere of nothingness, the sound of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sound of the sphere of infinite space, the sound of the sphere of mastery, the sound of the sphere of totality, the sound of tranquility and insight, the sound of emptiness, the sound of wishlessness, the sound of signlessness, the sound of dependent origination, and the sound of the entire Śrāvaka Canon would come forth.

analyzed: sakala pratyekabuddha yānapiṭaka śabdaḥ niścaret
translated: The sound of the entire Pratyekabuddha Vehicle Canon would come forth.

analyzed: sakala mahāyāna kathā ṣaṣ pāramitā śabdaḥ te puṣpāḥ avakireyuḥ
translated: The sound of the six perfections, the entire Mahāyāna discourse, would rain down flowers.

original: sarve ca rūpāvacarā devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ svakasvakāni pūrvakṛtāni kuśalamūlānyanusmareyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca rūpāvacarāḥ devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ svaka svakāni pūrva kṛtāni kuśala mūlāni anusmareyuḥ
translated: And all the gods in the form realm would hear it and remember their own past roots of virtue.

original: sarvakuśaleṣu dharmeṣu mahāsattvā ajugupsanīyāste tato'vatareyuḥ sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyāṃ daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu niyojayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
analyzed: sarva kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu mahāsattvāḥ a jugupsanīyāḥ te tatas avatareyuḥ sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyām daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu niyojayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
translated: Those great beings would be irreproachable in all wholesome dharmas. They would descend from there and in the Sahā world realm they would engage and establish all humans in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: evameva sarve kāmāvacarā devāḥ śṛṇuyusteṣāṃ ca tṛṣṇāsaṃyojanaratikrīḍāsaumanasyābhiratāṃścittacaitasikāṃ sarvān praśrambhayeyuḥ /
analyzed: evam eva sarve kāmāvacarāḥ devāḥ śṛṇuyuḥ teṣām ca tṛṣṇā saṃyojana rati krīḍā saumanasya abhiratān citta caitasikām sarvān praśrambhayeyuḥ
translated: In the same way, all the gods in the desire realm would hear it, and for them it would completely pacify all the mental and emotional states of attachment, clinging, pleasure, play, and delight.

analyzed: te sarve svakāni pūrva kṛtāni kuśala mūlāni anusmareyuḥ
translated: They would all remember their own past roots of virtue.

original: te ca devalokādavatīrya sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyāṃ daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca deva lokāt avatīrya sarve sahe lokadhātau manuṣyām daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu samādāpayeyuḥ pratiṣṭhāpayeyuḥ
translated: And having descended from the god realms, they would engage and establish all humans in the Sahā world realm in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: te ca puṣpā ākāśe vividhā ratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca puṣpāḥ ākāśe vividhāḥ ratnāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: And those flowers would appear in the sky as various jewels.

analyzed: tat yathā bhadanta bhagavan rūpya hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa rajata jātarūpa aśmagarbha dakṣiṇāvartāḥ
translated: For example, Blessed One, silver, gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, silver, natural gold, onyx, and right-spiraling conches.

original: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpāṃ ratnavṛṣṭiṃ abhipravarṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve sahe buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpām ratna vṛṣṭim abhipravarṣeyuḥ
translated: May all such jewel rains fall in this Sahā world system.

original: sarve ca sahe buddhakṣetre kalikalahavivādadurbhikṣarogaparacakraparuṣavāgrukṣaviṣaṃ sarveṇa sarvaṃ praśameyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca sahe buddhakṣetre kali kalaha vivāda durbhikṣa roga para cakra paruṣa vāc rukṣa viṣam sarveṇa sarvam praśameyuḥ
translated: May all quarrels, disputes, wars, famines, diseases, invasions, harsh words, and poisons in this Sahā world system be completely pacified.

original: kṣemārogyā akalahābandhanavigrahāḥ subhikṣāḥ sarve sahe buddhakṣetre saṃsthiheyuḥ /
analyzed: kṣema ārogyāḥ a kalaha a bandhana vigrahāḥ subhikṣāḥ sarve sahe buddhakṣetre saṃsthiheyuḥ
translated: May this Sahā world system be secure, healthy, free from conflict, without imprisonment or warfare, and abundant.
