original: yāni ca sattvāni tāni ratnāni paśyeyuḥ spṛśyeyuḥ upabhogakarma vā kurvīran te sarve tribhiryānairavaivartyā bhaveyuste ca punaradho yāvat kāñcanacakre sthiheyurevameva bhadanta bhagavan śastrāntarakalpakāle samaye punasta indranīlamaṇiratnāḥ saṃsthiheyurūrdhvaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyante /
analyzed: yāni ca sattvāni tāni ratnāni paśyeyuḥ spṛśyeyuḥ upabhoga karma vā kurvīran te sarve tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartyāḥ bhaveyuḥ te ca punar adhas yāvat kāñcana cakre sthiheyuḥ evam eva bhadanta bhagavan śastra antara kalpa kāle samaye punar te indranīla maṇi ratnāḥ saṃsthiheyuḥ ūrdhvam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryante
translated: May all beings who see, touch, or use those jewels become irreversible from the three vehicles. Moreover, may they remain below, on the golden wheel, in the same way, Blessed One, during the intermediate eon of weapons, may those sapphire jewels remain above, up to the realm of the Akaniṣṭha gods.

analyzed: sthitvā vividhām puṣpa vṛṣṭim abhipravarṣeyuḥ
translated: Having remained there, they would rain down various flowers.

original: tadyathā māndāravamahāmāndāravapāriyātrā yāvadevānantaprabhāstasmācca puṣpavarṣādvividhā manojñāḥ śabdā niścareyustadyathā buddhaśabdo dharmaśabdaḥ saṅghaśabdo yāvatpūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: tat yathā māndārava mahāmāndārava pāriyātrāḥ yāvat eva ananta prabhāḥ tasmāt ca puṣpa varṣāt vividhāḥ manojñāḥ śabdāḥ niścareyuḥ tat yathā buddha śabdaḥ dharma śabdaḥ saṅgha śabdaḥ yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: Namely, the coral tree, great coral tree, and endless light flowers. And from that rain of flowers, various delightful sounds would emerge, namely the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, up to what was said before.

original: te punaḥ śarīrā adho yāvat kāñcanacakre sthiheyuḥ /
analyzed: te punar śarīrāḥ adhas yāvat kāñcana cakre sthiheyuḥ
translated: And those bodies would remain below up to the golden wheel.

original: evaṃ tasmiṃ samaye durbhikṣāntarakalpakāle punaste śarīrā ūrdhvamudgaccheyuryāvadakaniṣṭhabhavanaparyantaṃ puṣpavṛṣṭiryāvat pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: evam tasmin samaye durbhikṣa antara kalpa kāle punar te śarīrāḥ ūrdhvam udgaccheyuḥ yāvat akaniṣṭha bhavana paryantam puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: Thus, at that time, during the famine-interval eon, those bodies would rise up again up to the end of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and a rain of flowers would fall, up to what was said before.

analyzed: yāvat roga antara kalpam yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to the disease-interval eon, as was said before.

original: yathā bhadrake mahākalpe mama parinirvṛtasya śarīrāstṛkāryaṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: yathā bhadrake mahā kalpe mama parinirvṛtasya śarīra āstṛ kāryam kuryuḥ
translated: As in the Bhadrakalpa, after my parinirvāṇa, they would perform the duties of my relics.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntān vaineyām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartikān sthāpayeyam
translated: I would establish beyond count those to be trained in the three vehicles as irreversible.

original: evaṃ pañcabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairmahākalpe vartamānairmama śarīrāḥ sattvān vineyustribhiryānairavaivartikāṃ sthāpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: evam pañca buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ mahākalpe vartamānaiḥ mama śarīrāḥ sattvān vineyuḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartikām sthāpayeyuḥ
translated: In this way, for as many great eons as there are atoms in the five buddha fields, they would guide beings with their bodies, establishing them in the three vehicles and irreversibility.

original: yadā paścāt sahasragaṅgānadīvālikāsamairasaṃkhyeyairatikrāntairdaśasu dikṣvaprameyairasaṃkhyeyairanyonyebhyo lokadhātubhyaste buddhā bhagavanta utpadyeyurye mayā bodhisattvabhūtenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau caryāṃ caratā prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ syuḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: yadā paścāt sahasra gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ anyonyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ utpadyeyuḥ ye mayā bodhisattva bhūtena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau caryām caratā prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ syuḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: When later, after passing through asaṃkhyeyas equal to the sands of the Ganges river, in the ten directions, in immeasurable and countless other world systems, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, would arise, who were first inspired and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by me when I was a bodhisattva practicing the conduct for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: mayā ca ṣaṭpāramitāsu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: mayā ca ṣaṣ pāramitāsu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ syuḥ
translated: and who were caused to take up, settle down in, and become established in the six perfections by me,

original: bodhiprāptaścāhamapi sattvānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyaṃ niveśayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham api sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpayeyam niveśayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: and I, having attained enlightenment, would inspire beings for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, settle them in it, and establish them in it.

original: ye ca punaḥ parinirvṛtasya śarīravikurvaṇenāpi sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayeyuste'pi paścāt sahasragaṅgānadīvālikāsamairasaṃkhyeyairvartamānairasaṃkhyeyairatikrāntairdaśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhā mama varṇaṃ bhāṣyayeyuḥ śrāvayeyurghoṣaṃ codīrayeyuryacciraṃ bhadrako nāma kalpo babhūva /
analyzed: ye ca punar parinirvṛtasya śarīra vikurvaṇena api sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ te api paścāt sahasra gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ vartamānaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ mama varṇam bhāṣyayeyuḥ śrāvayeyuḥ ghoṣam ca udīrayeyuḥ yat ciram bhadrakaḥ nāma kalpaḥ babhūva
translated: And those beings who, even by the transformation of the body after his parinirvāṇa, would arouse the mind for supreme perfect enlightenment, they too, later, after countless eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, in countless eons that have passed, in immeasurable and countless world systems in the ten directions, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas would attain supreme perfect enlightenment, would speak my praises, would proclaim them, and would utter a cry, saying, 'For a long time, there was an eon named Bhadra.

original: tasmiṃśca bhadrake mahākalpe'nupraviṣṭe caturthe jinabhāskara evaṃnāmā tathāgato babhūva /
analyzed: tasmin ca bhadrake mahā kalpe anupraviṣṭe caturthe jinabhāskaraḥ evaṃnāmā tathāgataḥ babhūva
translated: And in that Bhadra, the great eon, when the fourth sun appeared, there was a Tathāgata named Jina-Bhāskara.

original: yena vayaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: yena vayam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: By whom we were first inspired, established, and settled in supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: dagdhasantānā akuśalasamavadhānagatā ānantaryakārakā yāvanmithyādṛṣṭikāstena vayaṃ ṣaṭpāramitāsu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: dagdha santānāḥ akuśala samavadhāna gatāḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat mithyādṛṣṭikāḥ tena vayam ṣaṣ pāramitāsu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: With our continuums burned, engaged in non-virtue, committing immediate [acts], up to having wrong views, he inspired us, established us, and settled us in the six perfections.

original: yena vayametarhi sarvajñāḥ sarvākāradhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayāmaḥ /
analyzed: yena vayam etarhi sarvajñāḥ sarva ākāra dhārmikam dharma cakram pravartayāmaḥ
translated: By which we now, being omniscient, turn the Dharma wheel with all its aspects and teachings.

original: nirvarte tu gaticakre bahusattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrān svarge mokṣaphale ca pratiṣṭhāpayāmaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: nirvarte tu gati cakre bahu sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrān svarge mokṣa phale ca pratiṣṭhāpayāmaḥ syuḥ
translated: When the wheel of rebirth is turning, we establish many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings in the fruit of heaven and liberation.

original: ye ca sattvā bodhyarthikāsteṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ sakāśe mama varṇakīrtiyaśaśca śṛṇuyuste taṃ tathāgataṃ pṛccheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ bodhi arthikāḥ teṣām tathāgatānām sakāśe mama varṇa kīrti yaśaḥ ca śṛṇuyuḥ te tam tathāgatam pṛccheyuḥ
translated: And those beings who aspire to enlightenment, hearing my praise, fame, and glory in the presence of those Tathagatas, would ask that Tathagata:

original: kamarthavaśaṃ sampaśyamānaḥ sa bhagavāṃstathāgata evaṃ pañcakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāne'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: kam artha vaśam sampaśyamānaḥ sa bhagavān tathāgataḥ evam pañca kaṣāye kali yuge vartamānena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: What purpose did the Blessed One, the Tathagata, see, that he attained supreme perfect enlightenment in this degenerate age of five degenerations?

original: te ca tathāgatāsteṣāṃ bodhyarthikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā imaṃ mama mahākaruṇāsamanvāgataṃ prathamacittotpādaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhaṃ praṇidhānapūrvayogaṃ ca bhāṣeyuste ca bodhyarthikāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā āścaryaprāptā bhaveyuste'pyudārādhimuktikā bhaveyuste'pyevaṃrūpāṃ mahākaruṇāṃ sattveṣūtpādayeyurevaṃrūpaṃ ca praṇidhānaṃ kurvīran /
analyzed: te ca tathāgatāḥ teṣām bodhyarthikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā imam mama mahā karuṇā samanvāgatam prathama citta utpādam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūham praṇidhāna pūrva yogam ca bhāṣeyuḥ te ca bodhyarthikāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā āścarya prāptāḥ bhaveyuḥ te api udāra adhimuktikāḥ bhaveyuḥ te api evaṃrūpām mahā karuṇām sattveṣu utpādayeyuḥ evaṃrūpam ca praṇidhānam kurvīran
translated: And those Tathāgatas would explain to those sons and daughters of good family who are intent on enlightenment this my first production of the thought of enlightenment endowed with great compassion, the array of qualities of the Buddha-field, and the former practice of vows. And those sons and daughters of good family who are intent on enlightenment would be astonished, and they would have lofty aspirations, and they would produce such great compassion for beings and make such vows.

original: evaṃrūpe tīvrapañcakaṣāye kleśakaṣāye kaliyuge buddhakṣetre ānantaryakārakāṃ yāvadakuśalasamavadhānāṃ vaineyāṃ pratigṛhṇīyuste ca buddhā bhagavantastān mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatāṃ bodhyarthikāṃ kulaputrān vā kuladuhitṝn vā evaṃrūpeṇa vyākareṇana vyākuryuryathābhiprāyāṃ taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhirvā tīvrapañcakaṣāye kleśe kaliyuge praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpe tīvra pañca kaṣāye kleśa kaṣāye kali yuge buddhakṣetre ānantarya kārakām yāvat akuśala sama vadhānām vaineyām pratigṛhṇīyuḥ te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tān mahā karuṇā samanvāgatām bodhyarthikām kula putrān vā kula duhitṝn vā evaṃrūpeṇa vyākareṇana vyākuryuḥ yathā abhiprāyām taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā tīvra pañca kaṣāye kleśe kali yuge praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In such a world, in a buddha-field with the five degenerations and the degeneration of afflictions in the Kaliyuga, they would accept disciples who commit the crimes with immediate retribution up to those with unwholesome associations. And those Buddha-Bhagavans, endowed with great compassion, would give predictions to those sons or daughters of good family who are seeking enlightenment, with such a prediction as they had wished for, as those sons or daughters of good family had made aspirations for the five degenerations and the degeneration of afflictions in the Kaliyuga.

original: apare buddhā bhagavanto mama śarīravivartanebhiḥ pūrvayogaiḥ sattvānāṃ bodhyarthikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā vistareṇa bhāṣayeyuḥ /
analyzed: apare buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ mama śarīra vivartanebhiḥ pūrva yogaiḥ sattvānām bodhyarthikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā vistareṇa bhāṣayeyuḥ
translated: Other Buddha-Bhagavans would teach in detail the former lives and bodily transformations of those sons or daughters of good family who are seeking enlightenment, for the sake of sentient beings.

analyzed: evam ciram evaṃnāmā jina sūryaḥ babhūva
translated: Thus, one named so-and-so became a Jina-sun.

original: parinirvṛtasya śarīrebhirevaṃ ciramevaṃrūpaṇāṃ duḥkhitānāṃ sattvānāmarthāya evaṃrūpāṇi vividhāni prātihāryāṇi vividhā ca nānāprakārā vikurvaṇākṛtāstasya śarīravikurvaṇābhirvayaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃcoditāḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya śarīrebhiḥ evam ciram evaṃrūpaṇām duḥkhitānām sattvānām arthāya evaṃrūpāṇi vividhāni prātihāryāṇi vividhā ca nānā prakārā vikurvaṇā kṛtāḥ tasya śarīra vikurvaṇābhiḥ vayam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃcoditāḥ
translated: “After his parinirvāṇa, for the sake of suffering beings, he performed various miracles and various kinds of transformations with his body for a long time in this way. We were first inspired towards supreme perfect enlightenment by those transformations of his body.

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vayaṃ kuśalamūlasamavadhānān prathamacittotpādādidaṃ pāramitāsu codyogaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vayam kuśala mūla samavadhānān prathama citta utpādāt idam pāramitāsu ca udyogaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: We exerted ourselves in the perfections from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to now, due to the connection with the roots of goodness.

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam vistareṇa
translated: Up to as previously stated in detail.

original: atha khalu samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohito ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ sadevagandharvamānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ imāṃ mahākaruṇāsamanvāgatāṃ pañcaśatāni praṇidhānāni kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha khalu samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas sa deva gandharva mānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ imām mahā karuṇā samanvāgatām pañca śatāni praṇidhānāni kṛtavān
translated: Then the brāhmaṇa Samudrarenu, the chief priest, in the presence of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, together with the devas, Gandharvas, and human beings, made five hundred aspirations endowed with great compassion.

original: sa evamāha yadi me bhadanta bhagavannevaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā cāhamanāgate'dhvani bhadarake kalpe tīvrakleṣe raṇakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāṇe'ndhaloke'nāyake'pariṇāyake dṛṣṭivyasanāndhakāraprakṣipte loke ānantaryakārakānāṃ yāvat pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: saḥ evam āha yadi me bhadanta bhagavan evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta tathā ca aham anāgata idhvani bhadarake kalpe tīvra kleṣe raṇa kaṣāye kali yuge vartamāṇa indha loka nāyake pariṇāyake dṛṣṭi vyasana andhakāra prakṣipte loke ānantarya kārakānām yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: He said this: If, Venerable Blessed One, such a hope of mine is fulfilled, then in the future, in the Bhadrakalpa, when fierce afflictions, quarrels, and defilements are rampant, in the Kali Yuga, in the blind world without a guide or leader, in the world plunged into the darkness of the calamity of wrong views, may I be for those who commit the immediate offenses, up to as previously stated,

original: yadi cāhaṃ śaktaḥ sakalamevaṃ buddhakāryaṃ niṣpādayituṃ yathā ca me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadi ca aham śaktaḥ sakalam evam buddha kāryam niṣpādayitum yathā ca me praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: He said this: If, Venerable Blessed One, this kind of hope of mine is fulfilled, then in the future, in the Bhadrakalpa, when afflictions are intense, when the world is in a state of conflict and corruption, when the Kali Yuga is in progress, in a world that is blind, without a guide, without a leader, a world plunged into the darkness of the calamity of wrong views, I will accomplish the entire Buddha-work, just as I have made the vow, if I am able to do so.

analyzed: na ca visarāmi bodhau praṇidhānam
translated: And I will not abandon the vow for enlightenment.

analyzed: na ca anya kṣetre kuśala mūlam pariṇāmayāmi
translated: And I will not dedicate the roots of virtue to any other realm.

analyzed: evam eva bhadanta bhagavan vyavasāyam
translated: In the same way, Venerable Blessed One, I will strive.

original: na ca punarahaṃ anena kuśalamulena pratyekabuddhayānaṃ prārthayāmi /
analyzed: na ca punar aham anena kuśala mulena pratyekabuddha yānam prārthayāmi
translated: And I do not seek the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle with this root of virtue.

original: na ca śrāvakayānaṃ prārthayāmi /🔽na devamanuṣyaloke rājatvaṃ prārthayāmi /
analyzed: na ca śrāvaka yānam prārthayāmi  na deva manuṣya loke rāja tvam prārthayāmi
translated: I do not seek the Śrāvaka Vehicle.🔽I do not seek kingship in the world of gods and humans.

analyzed: na deva manuṣya loke aiśvaryam prārthayāmi
translated: I do not seek sovereignty in the world of gods and humans.

analyzed: na pañca kāmaguṇa paribhoga artham
translated: Not for the enjoyment of the five sense pleasures.

analyzed: na deva upapattim prārthayāmi
translated: I do not seek rebirth as a god.

analyzed: na gandharva asura yakṣa rākṣasa nāga garūḍa upapattim prāthayāmi
translated: I do not aspire for rebirth as a gandharva, asura, yaksha, rakshasa, naga, or garuda.

analyzed: na ca atra kuśala mūlam pariṇāmayāmi
translated: I do not dedicate the roots of virtue here.

original: yacca bhagavān evamāha dānaṃ mahābhogatāyai saṃvartate /
analyzed: yat ca bhagavān evam āha dānam mahā bhoga tāyai saṃvartate
translated: And the Blessed One has said that giving leads to great wealth,

original: śīlaṃ svargopapattaye śrutaṃ mahāprajñatāyai bhāvanā visaṃyogāya /
analyzed: śīlam svarga upapattaye śrutam mahā prajña tāyai bhāvanā visaṃyogāya
translated: morality to rebirth in heaven, learning to great wisdom, and meditation to liberation.

analyzed: uktam ca etat punar bhagavatā
translated: And this has been said by the Blessed One again:

original: ṛdhyati āśayo'bhiprāyaḥ kuśalamūlapariṇāmanā puṇyavataḥ sattvasya /🔽yacca mayā bhadanta bhagavan dānamayaṃ vā śīlamayaṃ vā śrutamayaṃ vā bhāvanāmayaṃ vā puṇyamārjitaṃ syāt /
analyzed: ṛdhyati āśayaḥ abhiprāyaḥ kuśala mūla pariṇāmanā puṇyavataḥ sattvasya  yat ca mayā bhadanta bhagavan dāna mayam vā śīla mayam vā śruta mayam vā bhāvanā mayam vā puṇyam ārjitam syāt
translated: The intention and aspiration of a virtuous being are fulfilled.

original: yadi naivaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tadahaṃ tatsarvaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ nairayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ pariṇāmayāmi /
analyzed: yadi na evaṃrūpā āśā paripūryeta yathā me praṇidhānam kṛtam tat aham tat sarvam kuśala mūlam nairayikānām sattvānām pariṇāmayāmi
translated: Venerable Blessed One, if whatever merit I have accumulated through giving, morality, learning, or meditation is not fulfilled in the way I have made my aspiration, then I dedicate all those roots of virtue to the beings in the hells.

original: ye sattvāḥ pracaṇḍamaṇḍaghore'vīcau narake duḥkhānyanubhavanti te cānena kuśalamūlena tato vyuttiṣṭhantu /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ narake duḥkhāni anubhavanti te ca anena kuśala mūlena tatas vyuttiṣṭhantu
translated: May those beings who experience suffering in the extremely terrible Avici hell be freed from there by this root of virtue.

analyzed: iha ca buddhakṣetre manuṣya pratilābham pratilabhantu
translated: May they attain human birth in this Buddha-field.

analyzed: tathāgata praveditam ca dharma vinayam ārāgayeyuḥ
translated: May they take delight in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: agra tve ca parinirvāyeyuḥ
translated: And may they attain final Nirvāṇa in the highest way.

original: yacca teṣāṃ sattvānāmaparikṣīṇakarmaphalaṃ syāttadahametarhi kālaṃ kṛtvāvicau mahānarake upapadyeyaṃ /
analyzed: yat ca teṣām sattvānām aparikṣīṇa karma phalam syāt tat aham etarhi kālam kṛtvā avicau mahānarake upapadyeyam
translated: And if there is any remaining result of karma for those beings, may I, after my death, be reborn in the Avīci great hell.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samādhya gamaṇīyāḥ ca me kāyāḥ prādurbhaveyuḥ
translated: May my bodies appear as numerous as the atoms in a Buddha-field.

original: ekaikaśca me kāyaḥ sumeruparvatarājapramāṇo mahān saṃbhavet /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca me kāyaḥ sumeru parvatarāja pramāṇaḥ mahān saṃbhavet
translated: And may each of my bodies be very large, the size of the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru.

original: ekaikaśca me kāya evaṃrūpāḥ suduḥkhā vedanā jānīyādyathaitarhi eṣa ekaḥ śarīraḥ suduḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ saṃjānāti /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca me kāyaḥ evaṃrūpāḥ su duḥkhāḥ vedanāḥ jānīyāt yathā etarhi eṣaḥ ekaḥ śarīraḥ su duḥkhām vedanām saṃjānāti
translated: And may each of my bodies experience such extremely painful feelings as this one body of mine now experiences extremely painful feelings.

original: ekaikaśca me ātmabhāvo buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃ tīvrāṃ caṇḍāṃ kharāṃ nairayikāṃ kāraṇāṃ anubhaveyurye caitarhi buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvā ānantaryakārakā yāvadavīciparāyaṇāni karmāṇi samudānītāni syuryacca yāvadbuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu mahākalpeṣvatikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatvānantaryakarmāṇi kṣipeyuḥ samutthāpayeyurvā /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca me ātma bhāvaḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samām tīvrām caṇḍām kharām nairayikām kāraṇām anubhaveyuḥ ye ca etarhi buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat avīci parāyaṇāni karmāṇi samudānītāni syuḥ yat ca yāvat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu mahā kalpeṣu atikrānteṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: And may each of my bodies experience the intense, fierce, and harsh sufferings of the hells, equal to the number of atoms in a buddha-field, for the sake of all those beings in the ten directions who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who have accumulated actions leading to the Avīci hell, and for the sake of all those beings in the ten directions who, after the passage of as many great kalpas as there are atoms in a buddha-field, will go to other buddha-fields in the ten directions equal to the number of atoms in a buddha-field and commit the acts of immediate retribution or instigate them.

analyzed: sarveṣām arthāya aham tat karma avīcau mahā narake sthitaḥ unubhaveyam
translated: For the sake of all, may I experience that karma in the great Avīci hell.

analyzed: mā ca me sattvāḥ narakeṣu upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And may no beings be reborn in the hells.

original: sarve ca te sattvā buddhā bhagavanta ārāgayeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ ārāgayeyuḥ
translated: And may all those beings delight in the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: saṃsārāt ca uttārayeyuḥ  nirvāṇa nagaram praveśayeyuḥ
translated: And may they be liberated from saṃsāra.🔽And may they enter the city of nirvāṇa.

analyzed: tadā aham etat cireṇa narakāt parimucyeyam
translated: And may I be liberated from the hells after a long time.

original: yāvaddaśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvaistathārūpaṃ karmasamutthāpitaṃ ākṣiptaṃ niyatavedanīyaṃ pratāpane narake upapadyitavyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvaiḥ tathārūpam karma samutthāpitam ākṣiptam niyata vedanīyam pratāpane narake upapadyitavyam
translated: As long as beings in other buddha-fields equal to the atoms in the ten directions have accumulated and projected such karma that is to be experienced for a definite time, and are to be reborn in the Pratapana hell,

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as explained before.

original: evaṃ santāpane mahāraurave saṅghāte kālasūtre saṃjīvane /
analyzed: evam santāpane mahāraurave saṅghāte kālasūtre saṃjīvane
translated: Similarly, in the Santarpana, Mahāraurava, Saṃghata, Kālasūtra, and Saṃjīva hells,

analyzed: evam nānāvidhā tiryagyoniḥ vācyāḥ  evam yama loke vaktavyaḥ
translated: and in the various animal realms, it should be said.🔽Similarly, in the realm of the Yāma gods, it should be said.

analyzed: evam yakṣa dāridre vaktavyam
translated: Similarly, in the poverty of the Yakṣas, it should be said.

analyzed: evam kumbhāṇḍa piśāca asura garuḍāḥ vācyāḥ
translated: Similarly, the Kumbhāṇḍas, Piśācas, Asuras, and Garuḍas should be mentioned.

original: yadā buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvairevaṃrūpaṃ karmākṣiptaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadā buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvaiḥ evaṃrūpam karma ākṣiptam syāt
translated: When beings in other world systems equal to the atoms in the ten directions have accumulated such karma,

original: ye ca manuṣyāndhabadhirā ajihvākā ahastakā apādakāḥ smṛtipramuṣṭacittairutpādyitavyaṃ aśucibhakṣayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ye ca manuṣya andha badhirāḥ a jihvākāḥ a hastakāḥ a pādakāḥ smṛti pramuṣṭa cittaiḥ utpādyitavyam aśuci bhakṣayitavyam
translated: and humans who are blind, deaf, tongueless, handless, footless, with lost memory and confused minds, should be born and eat impure things,

analyzed: peyālam yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as explained before.

analyzed: punar evam aham avīcau mahā narake upapadyeyam
translated: Again, I would be reborn in the great Avīci hell,🔽and so on.

original: yāvacciraṃ saṃsāre dhātvāyatanaskandhaṃ pratigṛhṇīyustāvacciramahaṃ evaṃrūpāṃ vividhe narakatiryakpreteṣu yakṣāsurarākṣaseṣu yāvan manuṣyaduḥkhopapattibhirevaṃ
analyzed: yāvat ciram saṃsāre dhātu āyatana skandham pratigṛhṇīyuḥ tāvat ciram aham evaṃrūpām vividhe naraka tiryak preteṣu yakṣa asura rākṣaseṣu yāvat manuṣya duḥkha upapattibhiḥ evam
translated: For as long as they take up the realms, bases, and aggregates in cyclic existence, for that long I will take up such forms in various hells, animal realms, and ghost realms, as well as among yakshas, asuras, rakshasas, and up to human births, with such suffering.

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: As stated before.

original: yadi me evaṃrūpā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āśā na paripūryeta /
analyzed: yadi me evaṃrūpā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā na paripūryeta
translated: If my hope for such unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is not fulfilled,

original: atha khalu ca punarme evaṃrūpānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryeta yāvat pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu ca punar me evaṃrūpā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryeta yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: then if my hope for such unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is fulfilled, as stated before,

analyzed: sākṣībhūtāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhavantu
translated: may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, be my witnesses.

original: ye daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantastiṣṭhanti yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti te mama buddhā bhagavantaḥ sākṣībhūtā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti te mama buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sākṣībhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: May the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide, live, and teach the Dharma in other immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions, be my witnesses.

analyzed: jñāna bhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be my witnesses of knowledge.

analyzed: vyākarotu me bhadanta bhagavan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Venerable Blessed One, please prophesy my unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bhadrake kalpe bhaveyamahaṃ viṃśottaravarṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasampanno yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: bhadrake kalpe bhaveyam aham viṃśa uttara varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: In the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred and twenty years, may I become a Tathagata, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Bhagavat.

original: śakto'hamevaṃrūpaṃ buddhakāryamabhiniṣpādayituṃ yā me pratijñā kṛtāḥ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ ham evaṃrūpam buddha kāryam abhiniṣpādayitum yāḥ me pratijñā kṛtāḥ
translated: I am able to accomplish such a Buddha's work as I have vowed.

original: atha tāvadeva sarvāvatī parṣā sadevagandharvamānuṣāsuraśca lokaḥ kṣitigaganasthitāḥ /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva sarvāvatī parṣā sa deva gandharva mānuṣa asuraḥ ca lokaḥ kṣiti gagana sthitāḥ
translated: Then at that very moment, the entire assembly, the world with its gods, gandharvas, humans, and asuras, standing on the ground and in the sky,

original: sthāpayitvā tathāgataṃ te sarve'śrūṇi pravartayamānāḥ pañcamaṇḍalena pādau vanditvāhuḥ /
analyzed: sthāpayitvā tathāgatam te sarva īśrūṇi pravartayamānāḥ pañca maṇḍalena pādau vanditvā āhuḥ
translated: except for the Tathagata, all of them shed tears, bowed at his feet with their five limbs, and said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā kāruṇika
translated: Excellent, excellent, O Greatly Compassionate One!

analyzed: gaṃbhīrā te smṛtiḥ gaṃbhīreṣu sattveṣu mahā karuṇā utpannā
translated: Your mindfulness is profound, and great compassion has arisen for profound beings.

analyzed: gaṃbhīram ca mahā praṇidhānam kṛtam

original: sarvataśca sa eko mahākaruṇāsamanvāgato mahābodhisattvo yaḥ sarvāvatīṃ tāṃ parṣadamabhibhūya kliṣṭaṃ pañcakaṣāyaṃ kleśaraṇikaliyugaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarva ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasantānā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: sarvatas ca saḥ ekaḥ mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ yaḥ sarvāvatīm tām parṣadam abhibhūya kliṣṭam pañca kaṣāyam kleśa raṇi kali yugam buddhakṣetram sarve ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha santānāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: And that one great Bodhisattva endowed with great compassion, who surpasses the entire assembly, has taken up as his disciples all those beings in the defiled five-degenerate world, the Buddha-field with its afflictions, quarrels, and Kali-age, including even those who have committed the acts of immediate retribution and those whose mind-streams are burned by the roots of non-virtue.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣat sadevagandharvamāṇuṣāsuraśca lokastaṃ ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamapahāya tasya mahākāruṇikasya paścimakasya pūjāyodyuktāḥ pañcamaṇḍalena ca vanditvā prāñjalībhūtāḥ sthitāstasya varṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣad sa deva gandharva māṇuṣa asuraḥ ca lokaḥ tam ratnagarbham tathāgatam apahāya tasya mahā kāruṇikasya paścimakasya pūjāya udyuktāḥ pañca maṇḍalena ca vanditvā prāñjalībhūtāḥ sthitāḥ tasya varṇam bhāṣate
translated: And the entire assembly, with the world including gods, Gandharvas, humans, and Asuras, having abandoned the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, are devoted to making offerings to that greatly compassionate one, the last one. They have bowed down with the five limbs and stand with palms joined, speaking his praises.

original: sa ca mahāsattvastasya bhagavato ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣaṇṇo vyākaraṇaṃ śṛṇvānaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mahāsattvaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ vyākaraṇam śṛṇvānaḥ
translated: And that great being, seated in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, listens to the prophecy.

original: yadā ca sa mahāsattvastasya bhagavataḥ purato dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ nikṣiptavāṃstadā sa bhagavāṃstathārūpaṃ smitaṃ prādurakārṣidyathā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaścalitāḥ puṣpavarṣaṃ cābhipravarṣitaṃ /
analyzed: yadā ca sa mahāsattvaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ puratas dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām nikṣiptavān tadā sa bhagavān tathārūpam smitam prādurakārṣit yathā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ calitāḥ puṣpa varṣam ca abhipravarṣitam
translated: And when that great being placed his right knee on the ground in front of that Blessed One, then that Blessed One manifested a smile such that worlds equal to the atoms in the buddha-fields in the ten directions trembled, and a rain of flowers fell.

original: sarvatra ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prabodhanārthaṃ mahākaruṇābodhisattvapraṇidhānacaryānidarśanārthaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamebhyo digbhyo buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ sannipatanārthaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ samādhānamukhanirdeśacaryāvaiśāradyadharmaparyāyāṃ bhāṣaṇārthaṃ tena tathāgatena evaṃrūpāṇi prātihāryāṇi darśitāni /
analyzed: sarvatra ca teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prabodhana artham mahā karuṇā bodhisattva praṇidhāna caryā nidarśana artham bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samebhyaḥ digbhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ sannipatana artham bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām samādhāna mukha nirdeśa caryā vaiśāradya dharma paryāyām bhāṣaṇa artham tena tathāgatena evaṃrūpāṇi prātihāryāṇi darśitāni
translated: In all those buddha-fields, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, in order to awaken, in order to demonstrate the practice of the vow of great compassion of the bodhisattvas, in order to assemble bodhisattva mahāsattvas from buddha-fields equal to the atoms in the buddha-fields in all directions, and in order to teach the Dharma discourse called the Fearless Practice of the Gate of Concentration of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas, that Tathāgata manifested such miracles.

original: tau ca kulaputra dvau bodhisattvau taṃ ratnacandraṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchate sma /
analyzed: tau ca kula putra dvau bodhisattvau tam ratnacandram tathāgatam paripṛcchate sma
translated: Those two bodhisattvas asked that Tathāgata Ratnacandra:🔽

original: kiyaccirotpāditaṃ bhadanta bhagavāṃstena mahākāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhicittaṃ /
analyzed: kiyat cira utpāditam bhadanta bhagavān tena mahā kāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhi cittam
translated: Those two bodhisattvas asked that Tathāgata Ratnacandra, Bhagavat, how long ago did that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika first give rise to the mind of enlightenment?

analyzed: kiyat ciram bodhicārikām cīrṇavān
translated: For how long has he practiced the conduct of enlightenment?

original: yena pañcakaṣāye loke tīvrakleśaraṇe kaliyuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhīta ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasantānāḥ sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ / /
analyzed: yena pañca kaṣāye loke tīvra kleśa raṇe kali yuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhītaḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha santānāḥ sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: By whom have the beings who are to be guided in the degenerate age, when the world is defiled by the five degenerations and afflicted by strong afflictions, been accepted as his own, including those who commit the crimes with immediate retribution up to those whose continuums are burned by the roots of non-virtue, been accepted as his own?

original: ratnacandrastathāgata āha sāṃprataṃ kulaputra tena mahākāruṇikena prathamacittamutpāditaṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: ratnacandraḥ tathāgataḥ āha sāṃpratam kula putra tena mahā kāruṇikena prathama cittam utpāditam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnacandra said, Noble sons, it is just now that the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika first gave rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: gacchata kulaputra yūyaṃ tat santīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
analyzed: gacchata kula putra yūyam tat santi īraṇam buddhakṣetram tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: Go, noble sons, to that Buddha-field of Santīraṇa, to see, pay homage to, and serve the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: tam ca samādhāna mukha nirdeśam caryā vaiśāradya dharmaparyāyam śroṣyatha
translated: You will hear that Dharma teaching called The Teaching of the Entrance to Meditative Absorption and the Fearlessness of Practice.

original: taṃ ca mahākāruṇikaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ madvacanān pṛcchatha /
analyzed: tam ca mahā kāruṇikam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam mad vacanān pṛcchatha
translated: You should ask that bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika on my behalf:

analyzed: evam ca vadatha
translated: 'Speak thus:

analyzed: ratnacandraḥ tathāgataḥ tvām sat puruṣam pṛcchati
translated: The Tathāgata Ratnaśikhin asks about the good man.

analyzed: idam ca candra roca vimalam puṣpam preṣitavān
translated: And he has sent this moon-like pure flower.

analyzed: sādhukāraḥ ca anupradatta
translated: And he has given his approval.

original: evaṃ ca prathamacittotpādena tvaṃ satpuruṣa mahākāruṇikavyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi śabdenāpūritāni /
analyzed: evam ca prathama citta utpādena tvam sat puruṣa mahā kāruṇika vyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāsu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi śabdena āpūritāni
translated: Thus, good man, with the first production of the thought, you have filled with sound the buddha-fields in the ten directions, as many as the atoms in all the buddha-fields, through the utterance of great compassion.

original: tena tvayā sarvatra mahākāruṇika nāma pratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: tena tvayā sarvatra mahā kāruṇika nāma pratilabdham
translated: Therefore, everywhere you have obtained the name Mahākāruṇika.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu bhūyaḥ paścimakānāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa praṇidhānanetrīdhvajamucchrayaṇaṃ
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu bhūyas paścimakānām mahā kāruṇikānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa praṇidhāna netrī dhvajam ucchrayaṇam
translated: Therefore, good man, it is good if you again raise the banner of the vow of the future Mahākāruṇikas, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, through the utterance of great compassion.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa bhūyo buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān anāgatānasaṃkhyeyān kalpān buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān daśadiśi lokadhātuṣu yaśaḥkīrtiśabdenāpūraya
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa bhūyas buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān anāgatān asaṃkhyeyān kalpān buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān daśa diśi lokadhātuṣu yaśaḥ kīrti śabdena āpūraya
translated: Therefore, good man, you will fill the ten directions of the world systems with your fame, renown, and glory for as many future asaṃkhyeya kalpas as there are atoms in a buddha-field.

original: yena tvayā bahvasaṃkhyeyasattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni niveśitāni pratiṣṭhāpitāni bhagavataḥ sakāśamupanītāni /
analyzed: yena tvayā bahu asaṃkhyeya sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni niveśitāni pratiṣṭhāpitāni bhagavataḥ sakāśam upanītāni
translated: Because you have inspired, introduced, and established many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of asaṃkhyeyas of beings in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and brought them into the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: a vaivartikāni sthāpitāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: You have established them as irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhaviṣyanti kecid tatra praṇidhānena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām parigṛhīṣyanti
translated: Some of them will there, by means of their vow, take up the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field.

analyzed: ye paścāt vyākaraṇam lapsyante
translated: Those who will later receive their prophecy.

original: ye tvayā bodhau samādāpitāḥ sarve te paścād yāvad buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāsaṃkhyeyakalpairdaśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhatvaṃ prāpya dharmacakraṃ pravartayitvā tvāṃ ārabhya varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyante /
analyzed: ye tvayā bodhau samādāpitāḥ sarve te paścāt yāvat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sama asaṃkhyeya kalpaiḥ daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddha tvam prāpya dharmacakram pravartayitvā tvām ārabhya varṇam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: All those whom you have inspired towards enlightenment, after innumerable eons equal to the atoms in a buddha-field, will attain buddhahood in buddha-fields equal to the atoms in a buddha-field in the ten directions, and having set the wheel of the Dharma in motion, will speak praise of you, beginning with you.

original: anena tṛtīyena kāraṇena te sādhu satpuruṣa /
analyzed: anena tṛtīyena kāraṇena te sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: For this third reason, you are a good man.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena dvānavatibodhisattvakoṭya ekakaṇṭhena vadanti /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena dvānavati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ eka kaṇṭhena vadanti
translated: Then at that time, 2.9 billion bodhisattvas spoke with one voice,

original: vayamapi bhadanta bhagavan santīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ gacchemaḥ tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntikaṃ darśanāya vandanāya
analyzed: vayam api bhadanta bhagavan santīraṇam buddhakṣetram gacchemaḥ tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antikam darśanāya vandanāya
translated: We too, Venerable Blessed One, will go to the Buddha-field of Santirana to see the Tathagata Arhat Samyaksambuddha Ratnagarbha, to pay homage to him,

analyzed: tam ca sat puruṣam darśanāya vandanāya
translated: and to see that good man, to pay homage to him,

analyzed: yasya tathāgatena tribhiḥ aṅgaiḥ sādhukāraḥ preṣita
translated: to whom the Tathagata has sent the sahadharma with three limbs,

analyzed: imam ca candra roca vimalam puṣpam preṣitam
translated: and has sent this moon-like pure flower.

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnacandrastathāgata āha gacchata kulaputrā yasyaitarhi kālaṃ manyadhve /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnacandraḥ tathāgataḥ āha gacchata kula putrāḥ yasya etarhi kālam manyadhve
translated: And that Tathagata Ratnacandra said, Go, sons of good family, if you think the time is right.

original: tatra ca ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt samādhānamukhanirdeśaṃ caryāvaiśāradyadharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyadhve /
analyzed: tatra ca ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt samādhāna mukha nirdeśam caryā vaiśāradya dharmaparyāyam śroṣyadhve
translated: And there, in the presence of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, you will hear the Dharma discourse called 'The Teaching on the Door of Concentration and the Fearlessness of Conduct.'

original: atha tau dvau kulaputrau ratnaketuścandraketuśca ratnacandrasya tathāgatasya sakāśāccandrarocavimalaṃ puṣpaṃ gṛhītvā sārdhaṃ dvānavatibhirbodhisattvakoṭībhī ratnavicayāyāṃ lokadhātau saṃprasthitau /
analyzed: atha tau dvau kula putrau ratnaketuḥ candraketuḥ ca ratnacandrasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt candra roca vimalam puṣpam gṛhītvā sārdham dvānavatibhiḥ bodhisattva koṭībhiḥ ratnavicayāyām lokadhātau saṃprasthitau
translated: Then those two sons of good family, Ratnaketu and Candraketu, took the moon-shining pure flowers from the presence of the Tathagata Ratnacandra, and together with ninety-two koṭis of bodhisattvas, set out for the Ratnaviśuddhā world system.

original: tadyathāpi nāma vidyutā evameva tato bodhisattvaparṣād ratnavicaye buddhakṣetre'ntarhitau /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma vidyutā evam eva tatas bodhisattva parṣāt ratnavicaye buddhakṣetre intarhitau
translated: Just as by lightning, so did those two bodhisattvas disappear from that assembly and arrive in the Buddha-field Ratnaviśuddhā.

original: iha saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre jambūvanodyāne ca sthitau /
analyzed: iha saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre jambu vana udyāne ca sthitau
translated: They stood in the Jetavana grove in this Buddha-field Saṃtuṣita.

original: yena ratnagarbhastathāgatastenopasaṃkrāme taṃ upetya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā vividhābhirbodhisattvavikurvaṇābhiḥ pūjāṃ kṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyāgrato brāhmaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvāvatīṃ ca bodhisattvaparṣāṃ prāñjalībhūtāṃ varṇaṃ bhāṣamāṇāṃ tayorbodhisattvayoretadabhavad ayaṃ sa mahākaruṇāsamanvāgato yasya ratnacandreṇa tathāgateneme candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ /
analyzed: yena ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāme tam upetya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā vividhābhiḥ bodhisattva vikurvaṇābhiḥ pūjām kṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya agratas brāhmaṇam dṛṣṭvā sarvāvatīm ca bodhisattva parṣām prāñjalībhūtām varṇam bhāṣamāṇām tayoḥ bodhisattvayoḥ etat abhavat ayam sa mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ yasya ratnacandreṇa tathāgatena ime candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ
translated: He approached the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, bowed his head at the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha's feet, made offerings with various bodhisattva transformations, and saw the brāhmaṇa in front of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha. The entire assembly of bodhisattvas was full of praise with palms joined. Those two bodhisattvas thought, This is the one endowed with great compassion, to whom the Tathāgata Ratnacandra has sent these cintāmaṇi flowers.

original: atha tau dvau bodhisattvau bhagavataḥ sakāśāt parivartitvā brāhmaṇasya puṣpaṃ upanāmayitvā etadavocatāṃ imaṃ te satpuruṣa ratnacandreṇa tathāgatena candrarocavimalaṃ puṣpaṃ preṣitaṃ /
analyzed: atha tau dvau bodhisattvau bhagavataḥ sakāśāt parivartitvā brāhmaṇasya puṣpam upanāmayitvā etat avocatām imam te sat puruṣa ratnacandreṇa tathāgatena candra roca vimalam puṣpam preṣitam
translated: Then those two bodhisattvas turned from the Blessed One, brought the flower to the brāhmaṇa, and said, Good man, this cintāmaṇi flower has been sent to you by the Tathāgata Ratnacandra.

analyzed: sādhukāraḥ ca te sat puruṣaḥ preṣitaḥ
translated: And the word 'good' has been sent to you, good man.

analyzed: yāvat yathā uktam pūrvam
translated: As was said before.

original: peyālaṃ / aprameyāsaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ pūrvāyāṃ diśāyāṃ buddhakṣetrebhyo bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ santīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ saṃprāptāḥ /
analyzed: peyālam aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ pūrvāyām diśāyām buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ santi iraṇam buddhakṣetram saṃprāptāḥ
translated: The same should be said in detail about the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have arrived in the Buddha-field of Sāha, having come from the innumerable, immeasurable Buddha-fields in the eastern direction.

analyzed: candra roca vimala puṣpām gṛhītvā brāhmaṇasya puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ
translated: Having taken the moon-like pure flowers, they sent the flowers to the brahmin.

analyzed: tribhiḥ ca aṅgaiḥ sādhukāraḥ
translated: And they sent their approval with three limbs,

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as stated before.

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśāyāmito buddhakṣetrāt saptanavatibuddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrānatikramitvā tatra niryūhavijṛṃbhito nāma lokadhātustatra niryūhavijṛṃbhite buddhakṣetre siṃhavijṛṃbhiteśvararājā nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati yāpayati śuddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇāyām diśāyām itas buddhakṣetrāt saptanavati buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrān atikramitvā tatra niryūhavijṛṃbhitaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra niryūhavijṛṃbhite buddhakṣetre siṃhavijṛṃbhiteśvara rājā nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati yāpayati śuddhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām śuddhām mahāyāna kathām dharmam deśayati sma
translated: In the same way, in the southern direction, beyond ninety-seven hundred thousand koṭis of Buddha-fields from this Buddha-field, there is a world-system named Nirbhāsaprabha, and in that Nirbhāsaprabha Buddha-field, there dwells, abides, and exists a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Siṃhavijṛmbhitīśvararāja, teaching the Dharma to pure bodhisattva mahāsattvas with a pure Mahāyāna discourse.

analyzed: tasmin ca parṣadi dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau
translated: And in that assembly there were two bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: eko jñānavajraketurnāma dvitīyaḥ siṃhavajraketustau dvau bodhisattvau siṃhavijṛṃbhiteśvararājaṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchataḥ sma ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya mahataśca puṣpavarṣasya /
analyzed: ekaḥ jñānavajraketuḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ siṃhavajraketuḥ tau dvau bodhisattvau siṃhavijṛṃbhiteśvararājam tathāgatam paripṛcchataḥ sma kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya mahataḥ ca puṣpa varṣasya
translated: One was named Jñānavajraketu, the second was named Siṃhavajraketu. Those two bodhisattvas asked the Tathāgata Siṃhavijṛmbhitīśvararāja, What is the cause, Bhadanta Sugata, what is the condition for the great earthquake and the great rain of flowers to appear in the world?

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: peyālaṃ / yāvad aprameyāsaṃkhyeyā dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśyanyebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo'prameyāsaṃkhyeyā bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāḥ saṃtīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetramanuprāptāḥ /
analyzed: peyālam yāvat aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ dakṣiṇasyām diśi anyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ uprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāḥ saṃtīraṇam buddhakṣetram anuprāptāḥ
translated: The same up to immeasurable, countless bodhisattvas, many hundred thousand koṭi-niyutas, from other buddha-fields in the southern direction, arrived in the buddha-field of Saṃtīraṇa.

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena paścimāyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrādekonanavatibuddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrabuddhakṣetrānatikramitvā tatra jayāvatirnāma
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena paścimāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt ekona navati buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasra buddhakṣetrān atikramitvā tatra jayāvatiḥ nāma
translated: At that time, in the western direction, having passed beyond ninety-nine hundred thousand koṭi-niyuta-śatasahasra buddha-fields from this buddha-field, there was a buddha-field named Jayāvati.

analyzed: tatra jitendriyaviśālanetraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: There, the Tathāgata named Jiteṃdriya-viśālanetra was dwelling and maintaining himself.

analyzed: caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He taught the Dharma to the four assemblies through the three vehicles.

original: tatra bhadravairocano nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ siṃhavijṛṃbhitakāyaśca nāma dvitīyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastau dvau satpuruṣau jitendriyaviśālanetraṃ tathāgatametamarthaṃ paripṛcchataḥ kuto'yaṃ mahāpṛthivīcālaprādurbhāvo /
analyzed: tatra bhadravairocanaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ siṃhavijṛṃbhitakāyaḥ ca nāma dvitīyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tau dvau sat puruṣau jita indriya viśālanetram tathāgatam etam artham paripṛcchataḥ kutas yam mahā pṛthivīcāla prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: There, two good men, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Bhadraviṣṇu and the second bodhisattva mahāsattva named Siṃhavijṛmbhitakāya, asked this Tathāgata Jiteṃdriya-Viśālanetra about this matter: From where did this great earthquake occur?

analyzed: mahātaḥ ca puṣpa vṛṣṭi pravarṣaṇasya
translated: And the great rain of flowers fell.

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenottarasyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrādbuddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyatikramya tatra jamburnāma lokadhātustatra lokeśvararāja nāma tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavān śuddhānāṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena uttarasyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi atikramya tatra jambuḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra lokeśvararāja nāma tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān śuddhānām mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām śuddhām mahāyāna kathām dharmam deśayati sma
translated: At that time, in the northern direction, beyond a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of buddha-fields, there was a world-system named Jambū, and in that world-system there was a Tathāgata named Lokīśvara-rāja, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One, who was teaching the pure Mahāyāna discourse on the Dharma to bodhisattvas who had set out in the Mahāyāna and were pure.

analyzed: tatra dvau bodhisattvau
translated: There were two bodhisattvas there.

analyzed: ekocalasthāvaraḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ prajñādharaḥ nāma
translated: One was named Acala-sthāvara, the second was named Prajñādhara.

original: tau lokeśvararājaṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchataḥ sma ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvasya /
analyzed: tau lokeśvara rājam tathāgatam paripṛcchataḥ sma kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvasya
translated: They asked the Tathāgata Lokeśvararāja, What is the cause, Bhadanta Sugata, what is the condition for the great earthquake appearing in the world,

analyzed: mahatyāḥ ca puspavṛṣṭeḥ
translated: and for the great rain of flowers?

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenādho diśīto buddhakṣetrādaṣṭānavatibuddhakṣetranayutānatikramya tatra vigatatamo'ndhakārā nāma lokadhātustatra vigatabhayaparyutthānaghoṣo nāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena adhas diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt aṣṭānavati buddhakṣetra nayutān atikramya tatra vigatatamondhakārāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra vigatabhayaparyutthānaghoṣaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: At that time, from the lower direction, beyond ninety-eight nayutas of buddha-fields, there was a world-system named Vigatatamaandhakarā. In that place, there was a Tathāgata named Vigatabhayamahaghosa. He abided and remained.

analyzed: caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He taught the Dharma to the four assemblies through the three vehicles.

original: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvāveko'rajavairocano nāma dvitīyaḥ svargavairocano nāma /
analyzed: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau ekaḥ urajavairocanaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ svargavairocanaḥ nāma
translated: In that buddha-field, there were two bodhisattva mahāsattvas. One was named Arajavairocana, the second was named Svargavairocana.

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenopariṣṭhāyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrāddve śatasahasre buddhakṣetrāṇāmatikramitvā tatra saṃkusumitā nāma lokadhātustatra saṃkusumite buddhakṣetre prasphulitakusumavairocano nāma tathāgata yāvad buddho bhagavāṃstiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena upariṣṭhāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt dve śata sahasre buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramitvā tatra saṃkusumitā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra saṃkusumite buddhakṣetre prasphulitakusumavairocanaḥ nāma tathāgata yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: At that time, in the upper direction, beyond two hundred thousand buddha-fields from this buddha-field, there was a world-system named Saṃkusumitā. In that buddha-field Saṃkusumitā, there was a tathāgata named Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana, up to a buddha, a bhagavat, who abides and lives.

analyzed: caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He was teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies with the three vehicles.

original: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau prativasata /
analyzed: tatra buddhakṣetre dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau prativasata
translated: In that buddha-field, there were two bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling.

original: ekaḥ svaviṣayasaṃkopitaviṣayo nāma dvitīyo dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopito nāma bodhisattvastau dvau satpuruṣau prasphulitakusumavairocanaṃ tathāgataṃ pṛṣṭavantau /
analyzed: ekaḥ sva viṣaya saṃkopita viṣayaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopitaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ tau dvau sat puruṣau prasphulitakusumavairocanam tathāgatam pṛṣṭavantau
translated: One was named Sva-viṣaya-saṃko-pita-viṣaya, and the second was named Dhāraṇī-saṃpraharṣaṇa-vikopita. Those two good men asked the Tathāgata Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana:

original: ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya mahatyāśca puṣpavṛṣṭeḥ / /
analyzed: kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya loke prādurbhāvāya mahatyāḥ ca puṣpa vṛṣṭeḥ
translated: What is the cause, Bhadanta Bhagavat, what is the condition for the great earthquake and the great rain of flowers to appear in the world?

original: prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgata āha asti kulaputrādho diśīto buddhakṣetrāt dve śatasahasre buddhakṣetrāṇāmatikramya tatra saṃtīraṇo nāma lokadhātustatra ratnagarbho nāma tathāgato yāvadbuddho bhagavāṃstiṣṭhati dharmaṃ ca deśayati sma /
analyzed: prasphulita kusuma vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ āha asti kula putra adhas diśi itas buddhakṣetrāt dve śata sahasre buddhakṣetrāṇām atikramya tatra saṃtīraṇaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra ratnagarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān tiṣṭhati dharmam ca deśayati sma
translated: The Tathāgata Prasbulitakusumavairocana said, “Noble sir, below this buddha-field, past two hundred thousand buddha-fields, there is a world-realm called Saṃtīraṇa, where the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, dwells, lives, and resides, teaching the Dharma.

analyzed: bahu sattva koṭyaḥ vyākaroti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bodhisattva viṣaya kṣetra sandarśana praṇidhāna viṣaya vyūha samādhi viṣaya dhāraṇī mukha niryūham dharmaparyāyam bhāṣamāṇa
translated: He is teaching the Dharma, expounding the Dharma discourse called The Array of the Domain of the Bodhisattvas, the Display of the Domain of the Vows, the Domain of the Meditative Absorptions, and the Emanations of the Gateways of the Dhāraṇīs, to many millions of beings, and is prophesying their unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ekaśca tatra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sa evaṃrūpaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: ekaḥ ca tatra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saḥ evaṃrūpam praṇidhānam kṛtavān
translated: There, a certain bodhisattva mahāsattva of great compassion made such a vow:

analyzed: mahā karuṇā paribhāvitā vācā bhāṣitā
translated: He spoke with words imbued with great compassion:

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇa nirdeśam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: The prediction and teaching of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

analyzed: yathārūpā praṇidhāna netrī udbhāvitā yathā bahu bodhisattva koṭībhiḥ buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: The vow that was made in such a way, the vow for a buddha-field that was made by many millions of bodhisattvas,

analyzed: buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ vaineya sattvāḥ ca parigṛhītāḥ
translated: He has taken up a buddha-field with its adornments and the beings to be trained.

original: sa caiko mahākaruṇāsamanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ sarvāvatiṃ parṣadamabhibhūya kliṣṭaṃ pañcakaṣāyaṃ kleśāraṇikaliyugaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: sa ca ekaḥ mahā karuṇā samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarvāvatim parṣadam abhibhūya kliṣṭam pañca kaṣāyam kleśa araṇi kali yugam buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: And that one bodhisattva endowed with great compassion, outshining the entire assembly, has taken up a buddha-field afflicted with the five degenerations, an age of strife with its afflictions and troubles.

original: sarve cānantaryakārakā yāvad akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasaṃtānā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha saṃtānāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: And he has taken up as his disciples all those who commit the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those whose mind-streams are burned by the roots of non-virtue.

original: sarvāvatīrca sā parṣā sadevagandharvāsuramānuṣaśca loko ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pūjāmapahāya tasya mahākāruṇikasya pūjākarmaṇe udyuktāḥ pañcamaṇḍalena vanditvā prāñjalibhūtāḥ sthitvā varṇaṃ bhāṣante sma /
analyzed: sarvāvatīḥ ca sā parṣā sa deva gandharva asura mānuṣaḥ ca lokaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pūjām apahāya tasya mahā kāruṇikasya pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ pañca maṇḍalena vanditvā prāñjali bhūtāḥ sthitvā varṇam bhāṣante sma
translated: And the entire assembly, with the world of gods, gandharvas, asuras, and humans, abandoning the worship of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, were devoted to the worship of that greatly compassionate one. They bowed down with their five limbs, stood with palms joined, and spoke words of praise.

original: sa ca mahāsattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣaṇṇo vyākaraṇaṃ śṛṇvānaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mahāsattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaḥ vyākaraṇam śṛṇvānaḥ
translated: And that great being, seated in front of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha, was listening to the prophecy.

original: yadā ca tena mahāsattvena tasya bhagavataḥ purato dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ nikṣiptaṃ tadā tena bhagavatā tathārūpaṃ smitaṃ prāviṣkṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadā ca tena mahāsattvena tasya bhagavataḥ puratas dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām nikṣiptam tadā tena bhagavatā tathārūpam smitam prāviṣkṛtam
translated: And when that great being placed his right knee on the ground in front of that Blessed One, then that Blessed One emitted a smile of that kind.

original: yadā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu mahāpṛthivī ṣaḍvikāraṃ calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kaṃpitā yāvat puṣpavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā /
analyzed: yadā daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu mahā pṛthivī ṣaṣ vikāram calitā pracalitā saṃpracalitā kaṃpitā yāvat puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā
translated: When the great earth shook, trembled, and quaked in six ways in the buddha-fields as numerous as the atoms in ten buddha-fields, and a rain of flowers fell,

original: sarvebhyaśca tebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prabodhanārthaṃ /
analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ ca tebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prabodhana artham
translated: and all those bodhisattva mahāsattvas from the buddha-fields in the ten directions assembled in that buddha-field in order to awaken,

analyzed: mahā kāruṇyā bodhisattva praṇidhāna caryā nidarśana artham
translated: out of great compassion, to demonstrate the practice of the bodhisattva vow,

original: bodhisattvā mahāsattvā buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamebhyo lokadhātubhyo daśabhyo digbhyastatra buddhakṣetre sannipatanārthaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ tatra buddhakṣetre sannipatana artham
translated: and the bodhisattva mahāsattvas from the world systems as numerous as the atoms in ten buddha-fields assembled in that buddha-field,

original: bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ samādhānamukhanirdeśacaryāvaiśāradyaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣaṇārthaṃ tena tathāgatenaivaṃrūpāṇi prātihāryāṇi darśitāni
analyzed: bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām samādhāna mukha nirdeśa caryā vaiśāradyam dharmaparyāyam bhāṣaṇa artham tena tathāgatena evaṃrūpāṇi prātihāryāṇi darśitāni
translated: In order to teach the Dharma discourse called The Fearless Practice of the Gate of Concentration of the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, that Tathagata displayed such miracles.

original: tau ca kulaputra dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau svaviṣayasaṃkopitaviṣayaśca dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopitaśca taṃ prasphulitakusumavairocanaṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchataḥ sma /
analyzed: tau ca kula putra dvau bodhisattvau mahāsattvau sva viṣaya saṃkopita viṣayaḥ ca dhāraṇī saṃpraharṣaṇa vikopitaḥ ca tam prasphulitakusumavairocanam tathāgatam paripṛcchataḥ sma
translated: And those two Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, the one with the limited sphere of influence and the one with the agitated sphere of influence, asked that Tathagata Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana:

original: kiyaccirotpāditaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃstena mahākāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhāya cittaṃ /
analyzed: kiyat cira utpāditam bhadanta bhagavan tena mahā kāruṇikena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhāya cittam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, how long ago did that Bodhisattva Mahasattva Mahakarunika generate the mind of enlightenment?

original: kiyacciraṃ vā sa mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhicārikāṃ cīrṇaṃ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram vā sa mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhi cārikām cīrṇam
translated: For how long has that Bodhisattva Mahasattva Mahakarunika practiced the conduct for enlightenment?

original: yena pañcakaṣāye loke tīvrakleśaraṇike kaliyuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhīta ānantaryakārakā yāvad akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasaṃtānā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ / /
analyzed: yena pañca kaṣāye loke tīvra kleśa raṇike kali yuge vartamāne kālaḥ parigṛhītaḥ ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha saṃtānāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: By whom the age of five degenerations in the world, with intense afflictions and troubles, was accepted during the Kali Yuga, and the killers of their mothers, fathers, and Arhats, and those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who have accumulated the roots of non-virtue and have burned their continuums, were accepted as disciples.

original: prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgata āha saṃprati kulaputra tena mahākāruṇikena prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaṃ /
analyzed: prasphulitakusumavairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ āha saṃprati kula putra tena mahā kāruṇikena prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: The Tathāgata Prasbulitakusumavairocana said, “Noble sons, it is now time for the Greatly Compassionate One to first generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: gacchata kulaputrā yūyaṃ santīraṇaṃ lokadhātuṃ tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya taṃ ca samādhānamukhanirdeśaṃ caryāvaiśāradyaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: gacchata kula putrāḥ yūyam santīraṇam lokadhātum tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya tam ca samādhāna mukha nirdeśam caryā vaiśāradyam dharmaparyāyam śravaṇāya
translated: Go, noble sons, to the world system called Sāntirana to see, pay homage to, and serve the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and to listen to the Dharma discourse called ‘The Teaching on the Door of Concentration and the Fearlessness of Conduct.’

original: taṃ ca mahākāruṇikaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ mama vacanena pṛcchatha evaṃ ca vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: tam ca mahā kāruṇikam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam mama vacanena pṛcchatha evam ca vaktavyaḥ
translated: And ask the bodhisattva mahāsattva Greatly Compassionate on my behalf, saying:

original: prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgatstvāṃ satpuruṣa pṛcchate candrarocavimalaṃ puṣpaṃ preṣitaṃ sādhukāraścānupradattaḥ /
analyzed: prasphulita kusuma vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ tvām sat puruṣa pṛcchate candra roca vimalam puṣpam preṣitam sādhukāraḥ ca anupradattaḥ
translated: ‘The Tathāgata Prasbulitakusumavairocana asks about you, good man, and sends you the moon-bright immaculate flower, and gives his approval.

original: evaṃ ca tvayā satpuruṣa prathamacittotpādena mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā lokadhātavaḥ śabdenāpūritāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca tvayā sat puruṣa prathama citta utpādena mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ śabdena āpūritāḥ
translated: And thus, good man, by your first generation of the mind of enlightenment and the utterance of great compassion, the world systems as numerous as the atoms in ten directions have been filled with sound.

original: mahākaruṇāśabdaśca pratilabdhastena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śabdaḥ ca pratilabdhaḥ tena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu bhūyas
translated: You have attained the word 'great compassion.' Therefore, good man, it is good that you should do so.

original: paścimakānāṃ mahākaruṇāmahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa praṇidhānanetrīdhvajāmucchrepayasi /
analyzed: paścimakānām mahā karuṇā mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa praṇidhāna netrī dhvajām ucchrepayasi
translated: You raise the banner of the vow of great compassion for the bodhisattvas and mahasattvas of the future who have set out in the great vehicle, by speaking of great compassion.

original: tena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu bhūyastvaṃ satpuruṣa buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāgatā asaṃkhyeyakalpabuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā daśadiśa lokadhātavo yaśaḥkīrtiśabdenāpūritāstena tvaṃ satpuruṣa bahvasaṃkhyeyasattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: tena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu bhūyas tvam sat puruṣa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān āgatāḥ asaṃkhyeya kalpa buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ daśa diśaḥ lokadhātavaḥ yaśaḥ kīrti śabdena āpūritāḥ tena tvam sat puruṣa bahu asaṃkhyeya sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Therefore, good man, it is good that you should do so. Good man, the worlds in the ten directions, as many as there are atoms in a buddha-field, which are beyond incalculable buddha-fields, have been filled with your fame and renown. Therefore, good man, you have inspired, settled, and established many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of incalculable beings in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ sakāśam upanītā
translated: You have brought them into the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: a vaivartikāḥ ca sthāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And you have established them as irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: kaiścittatraiva bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānena buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ parigṛhītā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ svakaruṇāraśmibhirācchāditā /
analyzed: kaiścid tatra eva bhagavataḥ sakāśe praṇidhānena buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ sva karuṇā raśmibhiḥ ācchāditā
translated: Some there, by their vows in the presence of the Blessed One, have taken up the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field and have covered their disciples with the rays of their compassion.

original: ye tvayānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā na ca vyākaraṇapratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: ye tvayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ na ca vyākaraṇa pratilabdham
translated: Those whom you have inspired toward supreme perfect enlightenment, but who have not yet attained the prophecy,

analyzed: te api paścāt vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante
translated: they too will later receive the prophecy.

original: sarve te paścādyāvadbuddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairasaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairdaśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣvanyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhatvaṃ prāpya dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayitvā tvāmevārabhya varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te paścāt yāvat buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhatvam prāpya dhārmikam dharmacakram pravartayitvā tvām eva ārabhya varṇam bhāṣiṣyanti
translated: All of them, later, after as many asaṃkhyeya kalpas as there are atoms in a buddha-field, in the ten directions, in as many other world systems as there are atoms in a buddha-field, having attained buddhahood and set in motion the wheel of the Dharma, will speak praise, beginning with you.

original: etena tṛtīyena kāraṇena tvaṃ satpuruṣa sādhu /
analyzed: etena tṛtīyena kāraṇena tvam sat puruṣa sādhu
translated: For this third reason, good man, you are good.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bahubodhisattvakoṭya evamūcurvayamapi bhadanta bhagavaṃstatra saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre gacchema /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bahu bodhisattva koṭyaḥ evam ūcuḥ vayam api bhadanta bhagavan tatra saṃtīraṇe buddhakṣetre gacchema
translated: Then at that time many millions of bodhisattvas said, We too, Venerable Blessed One, will go to that buddha-field of scrutiny.

original: tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: tasya ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: to see the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Ratnagarbha,

original: taṃ ca satpuruṣaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: tam ca sat puruṣam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: and to see that good man, to pay homage to him, and to attend on him.

analyzed: yasya tathāgatena tribhiḥ aṅgaiḥ
translated: The Tathāgata has sent you the approval of three aspects.

original: ime ca candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ /🔽sa ca kulaputra prasphulitakusumavairocanastathāgatastānāha gacchata yūyaṃ kulaputrā yasyaitarhi kālaṃ manyadhve /
analyzed: ime ca candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ  sa ca kula putra prasphulitakusumavairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ tān āha gacchata yūyam kula putrāḥ yasya etarhi kālam manyadhve
translated: And these moon-like, shining, stainless flowers have been sent.🔽And that good man, the Tathāgata Prasfultakusumavairocana, said, 'Go, noble ones, to the Sahā world realm, to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.'

original: tatra yūyaṃ kulaputrā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt samavadhānamukhanirdeśacaryāvaiśāradyaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyatha /
analyzed: tatra yūyam kula putrāḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt samavadhāna mukha nirdeśa caryā vaiśāradyam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyatha
translated: And he said, 'There, noble ones, you will hear from the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha the Dharma teaching called The Fearless Door of the Assembly of Practices.

original: atha khalu kulaputra tau dvau bodhisattvau svaviṣayasaṃkopitaviṣayaśca dhāraṇīsaṃpraharṣaṇavikopitaśca tasya prasphulitakusumavairocanasya tathāgatasya sakāśāccandrarocavimalāṃ puṣpāṃ gṛhītvā bahubodhisattvakoṭībhiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃkusumitādbuddhakṣetrāt prasthāpitā iha buddhakṣetra ekakṣaṇena saṃprāptā jambūvanodyāne tasthuryena ca ratnagarbhastathāgatastenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra tau dvau bodhisattvau sva viṣaya saṃkopita viṣayaḥ ca dhāraṇī saṃpraharṣaṇa vikopitaḥ ca tasya prasphulitakusumavairocanasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt candraroca vimalām puṣpām gṛhītvā bahu bodhisattva koṭībhiḥ sārdham saṃkusumitāt buddhakṣetrāt prasthāpitāḥ iha buddhakṣetre eka kṣaṇena saṃprāptāḥ jambu vana udyāne tasthuḥ yena ca ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: “Then, noble sir, those two bodhisattvas, having taken the flowers of the coral tree, which are radiant and stainless, from the Tathāgata Splendor of the Coral Tree, together with many millions of bodhisattvas, departed from the buddhafield of the Buddha Blossoms and went to this buddhafield. In an instant they arrived in the Jeta Grove, where they stood in the presence of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha.

original: tena khalu punaḥsamayena sarvāvantaṃ saṃtīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ evaṃrūpaṃ paripūrṇaṃ mahāyānikairbodhisattvaiḥ pratyekabuddhayānikaiḥ śrāvakayānikaiḥ kulaputrairdevairyāvan mahoragaistadyathāpi nāma ikṣuvanaṃ vā naḍavanaṃ vā tilavanaṃ vā śālivanaṃ vā saṃpannaṃ sphuṭaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarvāvantam saṃtīraṇam buddhakṣetram evaṃrūpam paripūrṇam mahā yānikaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ śrāvaka yānikaiḥ kula putraiḥ devaiḥ yāvat mahā uragaiḥ tat yathā api nāma ikṣu vanam vā naḍa vanam vā tila vanam vā śāli vanam vā saṃpannam sphuṭam bhavet
translated: At that time, the entire buddhafield of Sāgara­dhara­cakra­varti­rāja was filled with bodhisattvas of the Great Vehicle, with followers of the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, with followers of the vehicle of the hearers, with noble sons, and with gods, up to great serpents, just like a thicket of sugarcane, a thicket of bamboo, a thicket of reeds, or a field of rice—dense and full.

original: evameva tasmin samaye saṃtīraṇaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paripūrṇaṃ sphuṭaṃ mahāyānikaiḥ kulaputrairyāvan mahoragaiste ca bodhisattvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā vividhasamādhānabalena bodhisattvavikurvaṇena pūjāṃ kṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ brāhmaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvāvatyaśca tāḥ parṣāḥ prāñjalibhūtāḥ sthitvā varṇaṃ bhāṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva tasmin samaye saṃtīraṇam buddhakṣetram paripūrṇam sphuṭam mahāyānikaiḥ kula putraiḥ yāvat mahoragaiḥ te ca bodhisattvāḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā vividha samādhāna balena bodhisattva vikurvaṇena pūjām kṛtvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas brāhmaṇam dṛṣṭvā sarvāvatyaḥ ca tāḥ parṣāḥ prāñjali bhūtāḥ sthitvā varṇam bhāṣamāṇāḥ
translated: In the same way, at that time, the Buddha-field of Sāṃbāyana was completely filled and crowded with noble sons of the Mahāyāna, up to great serpents. And those Bodhisattvas, having bowed their heads at the feet of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha, having made offerings through the power of various meditative absorptions and the transformations of Bodhisattvas, having seen the brāhmaṇa in front of the Tathāgata Ratna-garbha, and with all those assemblies standing with palms joined, speaking praise,

original: teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāmetadabhavat ayaṃ mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yasya prasphulitakusumavairocanena tathāgatena ime candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpā visarjitās /
analyzed: teṣām bodhisattvānām etat abhavat ayam mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yasya prasphulitakusumavairocanena tathāgatena ime candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ visarjitāḥ
translated: those Bodhisattvas thought, This is the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva of great compassion, to whom the Tathāgata Prasfulita-kusuma-vairocana has sent these moon-shining pure flowers.

original: te ca bodhisattvā bhagavataḥ sakāśāt parāvṛtya tasya brāhmaṇasya te candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpā upanāmayitvāhuḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ bhagavataḥ sakāśāt parāvṛtya tasya brāhmaṇasya te candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ upanāmayitvā āhuḥ
translated: And those Bodhisattvas, having turned away from the Blessed One, offered those moon-shining pure flowers to that brāhmaṇa, and said:

original: ime te satpuruṣa prasphulitakusumavairocanena tathāgatena candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ /
analyzed: ime te sat puruṣa prasphulitakusumavairocanena tathāgatena candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ
translated: These are the flowers of the moon-shining purity sent by the Tathagata Prasbulitakusuma-Vairocana.

analyzed: sādhukāraḥ ca te sat puruṣa anupradattaḥ
translated: And the good man has been given the word 'good'.

analyzed: yāvat pūrva uktam tribhiḥ aṅgaiḥ sādhukāram niveditam iti
translated: As far as it was said before, the word 'good' was conveyed with the three limbs.

original: yāni ca tāni puṣpāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pravarṣitāni /
analyzed: yāni ca tāni puṣpāṇi śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pravarṣitāni
translated: And those flowers that were rained down in the empty Buddha-fields,

analyzed: vividhaḥ ca kuśala śabdaiḥ tāvat buddhakṣetrāṇi āpūritāni
translated: And the various wholesome sounds filled the Buddha-fields.

original: tadyathā buddhaśabdena dharmaśabdena saṅghaśabdenāvabhāsaśabdena pāramitāśabdena balaśabdena vaiśāradyaśabdena abhijñāśabdenānabhisaṃskāraśabdenānutpādaśabdenānirodhaśabdena śāntaśabdenopaśāntaśabdena praśāntaśabdena mahāmaitrīśabdena mahākaruṇāśabdena /
analyzed: tat yathā buddha śabdena dharma śabdena saṅgha śabdena avabhāsa śabdena pāramitā śabdena bala śabdena vaiśāradya śabdena abhijñā śabdena an abhisaṃskāra śabdena anutpāda śabdena anirodha śabdena śānta śabdena upaśānta śabdena praśānta śabdena mahā maitrī śabdena mahā karuṇā śabdena
translated: Namely, with the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Sangha, the sound of illumination, the sound of the perfections, the sound of strength, the sound of fearlessness, the sound of the superknowledges, the sound of non-conditioning, the sound of non-arising, the sound of non-cessation, the sound of peace, the sound of tranquility, the sound of calm, the sound of great friendliness, the sound of great compassion.

original: yaddaśasu diśāsu teṣu śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tenāvabhāsenāvabhāsitāstatra ye kecit sattvā manuṣyā vāmanuṣyāste sarve ye kecit sattvā yamasadṛśāḥ kecidudakasadṛśāḥ kecicchikharasadṛśāḥ kecidbrahmasadṛśāḥ kecicchakrasadṛśāḥ kecit puṣpasadṛśāḥ kecidgaruḍasadṛśāḥ kecit siṃhasadṛśāḥ kecit sūryasadṛśāḥ keciccandrasadṛśāḥ kecit tārakasadṛśāḥ kecidgṛdhrasadṛśāḥ śṛgālakāyāḥ saṃdṛśyante /
