analyzed: yat daśasu diśāsu teṣu śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu tena avabhāsena avabhāsitāḥ tatra ye kecid sattvāḥ manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ te sarve ye kecid sattvāḥ yama sadṛśāḥ kecid udaka sadṛśāḥ kecid śikhara sadṛśāḥ kecid brahma sadṛśāḥ kecid śakra sadṛśāḥ kecid puṣpa sadṛśāḥ kecid garuḍa sadṛśāḥ kecid siṃha sadṛśāḥ kecid sūrya sadṛśāḥ kecid candra sadṛśāḥ kecid tāraka sadṛśāḥ kecid gṛdhra sadṛśāḥ śṛg
translated: In the ten directions, in those empty buddha-fields, all those beings, whether human or non-human, who are like Yama, like water, like peaks, like Brahma, like Shakra, like flowers, like Garuda, like lions, like the sun, like the moon, like stars, like vultures, or who appear with the bodies of jackals, all of them, whatever beings there are, are seen.

original: yathārūpeṇa kuśalapakṣamanaskāreṇa te sattvāḥ sanniṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: yathārūpeṇa kuśala pakṣa manaskāreṇa te sattvāḥ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: In whatever form those beings are seated to listen to the Dharma, with a mental application to the side of virtue,

analyzed: tathārūpeṇa kāyena saṃdṛśyante
translated: in that very form their bodies are seen.

original: tathārūpāśca kulaputra tatra sattvāḥ svakaṃ kāyaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: tathārūpāḥ ca kula putra tatra sattvāḥ svakam kāyam paśyanti
translated: Noble sir, the beings there see their own bodies in that very form.

original: tathārūpāśca te sattvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya kāyaṃ samanupaśyanti /
analyzed: tathārūpāḥ ca te sattvāḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya kāyam samanupaśyanti
translated: And those beings see the body of the Tathagata Ratnagarbha in that very form.

original: sa ca kulaputra samudrareṇurbrāhmaṇo'grapurohito ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ purataḥ sahasrapatre saptaratnamayapadmakeśare niṣaṇṇaṃ samanupaśyati
analyzed: sa ca kula putra samudrareṇuḥ brāhmaṇa ugra purohitaḥ ratnagarbham tathāgatam puratas sahasra patre sapta ratna maya padma keśare niṣaṇṇam samanupaśyati
translated: And that brahmin Samudrarenu, the chief priest, saw the Tathagata Ratnagarbha seated in front of him on a lotus with a thousand petals made of the seven precious substances.

original: sarve cātra kulaputra sattvā niṣaṇṇā vā sthitvā vā kṣitau vā ambare vā ekaikaḥ sattvo ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgatamevaṃ paśyanti /🔽agrato ratnagarbhastathāgato niṣaṇṇo'haṃ sarvacetasā samanvāharanti /
analyzed: sarve ca atra kula putra sattvāḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ vā sthitvā vā kṣitau vā ambare vā ekaikaḥ sattvaḥ ratnagarbham tathāgatam evam paśyanti  agratas ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ niṣaṇṇa ūham sarva cetasā samanvāharanti
translated: And all the beings there, O son of noble family, whether sitting or standing, on the ground or in the sky, each being saw the Tathagata Ratnagarbha in front of them.

analyzed: mām ekam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: They all thought, The Tathagata Ratnagarbha is seated in front of me, and he is teaching the Dharma with all his heart, addressing me alone.

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇorbrāhmaṇasya sādhukāramanupradattaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samudrareṇoḥ brāhmaṇasya sādhukāram anupradattaḥ
translated: And that Tathagata Ratnagarbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, gave his approval to the brahmin Samudrarenu, saying:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā kāruṇika mahā brāhmaṇa
translated: Well done, well done, O greatly compassionate great brahmin!

original: gaṇanātikrāntānāṃ sattvānāṃ tvaṃ asi kāruṇikahitakaraḥ prabhāsakaro loke saṃdṛśyase /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntānām sattvānām tvam asi kāruṇika hita karaḥ prabhāsa karaḥ loke saṃdṛśyase
translated: You are the compassionate benefactor who has gone beyond counting, and you are seen in the world as the one who illuminates.

original: tadyathāpi nāma brāhmaṇa saṃpannaṃ puṣpakṣetraṃ nānāvarṇaṃ nānāgandhaṃ nānāsparśaṃ nānāpatraṃ nānādaṇḍaṃ nānāmūlaṃ nānābhaiṣajyopakaraṇasthānaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma brāhmaṇa saṃpannam puṣpa kṣetram nānā varṇam nānā gandham nānā sparśam nānā patram nānā daṇḍam nānā mūlam nānā bhaiṣajya upakaraṇa sthānam
translated: Just as, Brahmin, a well-grown flower garden has various colors, various scents, various textures, various leaves, various stalks, various roots, and is a place for various medicinal implements,

original: kecidatra puṣpā yojanaśataṃ pramāṇena varṇena gandhena tapanti virocanti /
analyzed: kecid atra puṣpāḥ yojana śatam pramāṇena varṇena gandhena tapanti virocanti
translated: some of the flowers here shine and glow with a hundred yojanas of color and scent,

analyzed: kecid dvi yojana śatam kecid tri yojana śatam
translated: some with two hundred yojanas, some with three hundred yojanas.

analyzed: peyālam
translated: The rest is the same.

original: kecidatra puṣpā yāvat sarvacāturdvīpikāṃ lokadhātuṃ varṇena gandhena tapanti virocanti /
analyzed: kecid atra puṣpāḥ yāvat sarva cāturdvīpikām lokadhātum varṇena gandhena tapanti virocanti
translated: Some of the flowers here shine and glow with the color and scent of the entire four-continent world-system.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāścakṣurhīnāste puṣpagandhaṃ ghrātvā cakṣuṃsi pratilabhante /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ cakṣuḥ hīnāḥ te puṣpa gandham ghrātvā cakṣuṃsi pratilabhante
translated: And the beings there who are blind, having smelled the flower's scent, regain their eyesight.

original: badhirāḥ śrotrāṇi pratilabhante /🔽yāvat sarvāṅgavihīnāḥ sarvāṅgāni pratilabhante /
analyzed: badhirāḥ śrotrāṇi pratilabhante  yāvat sarva aṅga vihīnāḥ sarva aṅgāni pratilabhante
translated: The deaf regain their hearing.🔽The rest is the same.

original: ye ca tatra sattvāścaturuttararogaśatopadrutāste taṃ gandhaṃ ghrātvā sarvarogebhyaḥ parimucyeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ catur uttara roga śata upadrutāḥ te tam gandham ghrātvā sarva rogebhyaḥ parimucyeyuḥ
translated: And the beings there who are afflicted by the hundred and four diseases, having smelled that scent, are freed from all diseases.

original: ye ca tatra sattvā mattonmattaparamattāḥ suptacittā vikṣiptacittāḥ smṛtipraṇaṣṭāsteṣāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ gandhamāghrātvā sarve smṛtiṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ matta unmatta paramattāḥ supta cittāḥ vikṣipta cittāḥ smṛti praṇaṣṭāḥ teṣām puṣpāṇām gandham āghrātvā sarve smṛtim pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And those beings there who are intoxicated, drunk, or extremely intoxicated, with minds asleep or distracted, or who have lost their mindfulness, upon smelling the fragrance of those flowers, all regain their mindfulness.

original: evaṃ ca tatra madhye puṣpakṣetre puṇḍarīkamutpannaṃ /
analyzed: evam ca tatra madhye puṣpa kṣetre puṇḍarīkam utpannam
translated: Thus, in the middle of that flower field, a lotus arose,

original: dṛḍhasāraṃ vajramayaṃ vaidūryadaṇḍaṃ śatakomalaṃ kanakapatramaśmagarbhakiṃśukaṃ lohitamuktikeśaraṃ /
analyzed: dṛḍha sāram vajra mayam vaidūrya daṇḍam śata komalam kanaka patram aśmagarbha kiṃśukam lohita mukti keśaram
translated: firm and solid, made of vajra, with a stem of beryl, a hundred thousand petals of gold, a pericarp of emerald, and filaments of red pearls.

analyzed: caturaśītiḥ yojana sahasrāṇi ucca tvena yojana śata sahasram vistāreṇa
translated: It was eighty-four thousand yojanas high and one hundred thousand yojanas wide.

original: tacca puṇḍarīkaṃ daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamāllokadhātuṃ varṇena gandhena sphuritvā virocate /
analyzed: tat ca puṇḍarīkam daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān lokadhātum varṇena gandhena sphuritvā virocate
translated: And that lotus, with its color and fragrance, pervaded and shone forth in worlds equal to the atoms in the buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: ye ca brāhmaṇa teṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvā dhātuviruddhāḥ kāyā vyādhyupahatā aṅgavihīnā vā mattapramattonmattāḥ suptasmṛtipraṇaṣṭā vikṣiptacittāsteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tasya puṇḍarīkasyāvabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvā gandhaṃ ghrātvā sarvavyādhayaḥ praśamaṃ gaccheyuḥ smṛtiṃ ca pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca brāhmaṇa teṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ sameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ dhātu viruddhāḥ kāyāḥ vyādhi upahatāḥ aṅga vihīnāḥ vā matta pramatta unmattāḥ supta smṛti praṇaṣṭāḥ vikṣipta cittāḥ teṣām sattvānām tasya puṇḍarīkasya avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā gandham ghrātvā sarva vyādhayaḥ praśamam gaccheyuḥ smṛtim ca pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And, Brahmin, for those beings in the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the particles in Buddha-fields, who have bodies afflicted by disease, lacking limbs, intoxicated, heedless, insane, asleep, their mindfulness lost, their minds scattered, when those beings see the light of that lotus and smell its fragrance, may all their diseases be pacified and may they regain mindfulness.

original: ye ca tatra buddhakṣetreṣu sattvā mṛtā acirakālagatā avikṣiptaśarīrāsteṣāṃ kuṇapebhyaḥ tasya puṇḍarīkasya raśmayo nipatitvā gandhena vā spṛṣṭvā punaste kuṇapā jīvitendriyaṃ pratilabheyuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ mṛtāḥ acira kāla gatāḥ a vikṣipta śarīrāḥ teṣām kuṇapebhyaḥ tasya puṇḍarīkasya raśmayaḥ nipatitvā gandhena vā spṛṣṭvā punar te kuṇapāḥ jīvita indriyam pratilabheyuḥ
translated: And for those beings in those Buddha-fields who have died and passed away not long ago, with their bodies not yet decayed, when the light rays of that lotus fall on their corpses and touch them with its fragrance, may they regain the life faculty.

original: punaścottiṣṭheyurmitrasālohitāṃśca dṛṣṭvā te sarve udyānaṃ praviśya pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ samarpitāḥ samaṅgībhūtā vihareyusye ca punastataścyaveyusteṣu dve brahmavihāra upapadyeyuḥ /
analyzed: punar ca uttiṣṭheyuḥ mitra sālohitān ca dṛṣṭvā te sarve udyānam praviśya pañcabhiḥ kāma guṇaiḥ samarpitāḥ samaṅgībhūtāḥ vihareyuḥ ye ca punar tatas cyaveyuḥ teṣu dve brahmavihāre upapadyeyuḥ
translated: And may they rise up again, and seeing their friends and loved ones, may they all enter the pleasure garden and, endowed and provided with the five sense pleasures, enjoy themselves. And if they should pass away from there, may they be reborn in the two divine abodes.

analyzed: ye ca tatra cira sthāyinaḥ bhaveyuḥ aparītta āyuṣkā
translated: And those who would remain there for a long time, with limited lifespans,

analyzed: na ca tatra cyūtvā anyatra upapadyeyuḥ
translated: and not die there and be reborn elsewhere,

analyzed: yathā brāhmaṇāḥ tam puṣpa kṣetram evam ayam mahāyāna sannipātaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: just as those Brahmins in the flower field, this great assembly of the Mahayana should be seen.

original: yathā sūryodgamanakāle pratyupasthite te puṣpā visaritā prasphulitā bhavanti tapanti virocanti kecidyojanaśatamuccatvena kecid yāvad yojanasahasramuccatvena /
analyzed: yathā sūrya udgamana kāle pratyupasthite te puṣpāḥ visaritā prasphulitāḥ bhavanti tapanti virocanti kecid yojana śatam ucca tvena kecid yāvat yojana sahasram ucca tvena
translated: Just as when the time for the rising of the sun is near, those flowers spread out and bloom, shining, warming, and illuminating, some up to a hundred yojanas in height, some up to a thousand yojanas in height,

analyzed: bahunām sattvānām vividha rogāḥ praśamanti
translated: and various illnesses of many beings are cured,

original: evameva satpuruṣāḥ tathāgato buddhasūryo loka udapādi /
analyzed: evam eva sat puruṣāḥ tathāgataḥ buddha sūryaḥ loke udapādi
translated: in the same way, O good men, the Tathagata, the Buddha-sun, has arisen in the world.

original: yathā te puṣpāḥ sūryoditasya asya raśmibhirvikasitā bhāsanti tapanti virocanti /
analyzed: yathā te puṣpāḥ sūrya uditasya asya raśmibhiḥ vikasitāḥ bhāsanti tapanti virocanti
translated: Just as those flowers, when the sun has risen, are opened by its rays, shining, warming, and illuminating,

analyzed: vividha roga upahatānām sattvānām roga upaśamaḥ bhavati
translated: and the illnesses of beings afflicted with various illnesses are cured,

original: evamevāhaṃ satpuruṣa loka utpannaḥ sattvāṃ kāruṇyaraśmibhiḥ chādayitvā vikasitvā bhūyaḥ sattvāṃstriṣu puṇyakriyāvastuṣu niyojayāmi /
analyzed: evam eva aham sat puruṣa loke utpannaḥ sattvām kāruṇya raśmibhiḥ chādayitvā vikasitvā bhūyas sattvān triṣu puṇya kriyā vastuṣu niyojayāmi
translated: in the same way, O good men, I have arisen in the world, covering beings with the rays of compassion, opening them up, and further engaging beings in the three bases of meritorious action.

original: tvayāpyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā mama ca sakāśamupanītāstaiśca sattvairmama sakāśe svakasvakāni praṇidhānāni kṛtāni buddhakṣetrāṇi ca parigṛhītāni /
analyzed: tvayā api aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveṣitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ mama ca sakāśam upanītāḥ taiḥ ca sattvaiḥ mama sakāśe svaka svakāni praṇidhānāni kṛtāni buddhakṣetrāṇi ca parigṛhītāni
translated: You have also inspired, introduced, and established innumerable beings in unsurpassed and perfect awakening, and brought them to me. Those beings have made their own individual aspirations in my presence and accepted buddha-fields.

analyzed: kecid pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ kecid apariśuddhāḥ
translated: Some have accepted pure buddha-fields, some impure ones.

analyzed: tathā ca evam mayā vyākṛtāḥ
translated: And I have prophesied accordingly.

original: yaiḥ satpuruṣairmama sakāśāt pariśuddhā buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāstaiḥ śuddhāśayāḥ suvineyā avaruptakuśalamūlā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītā /
analyzed: yaiḥ sat puruṣaiḥ mama sakāśāt pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ taiḥ śuddha āśayāḥ su vineyāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Those good men who have accepted pure buddha-fields have accepted beings with pure intentions, who are well-disciplined, who have planted the roots of virtue, and who are to be trained.

analyzed: na te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ucyante
translated: Those are not called bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

analyzed: na ca teṣām mahāpuruṣa kāryam
translated: They do not have the work of great men.

analyzed: na ca teṣām mahā karuṇā citta caitasikeṣu pravartate
translated: And their great compassion does not operate in their thoughts and mental states.

original: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ sarvasattvānāṃ karuṇārthāyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ paryeṣante /
analyzed: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ sarva sattvānām karuṇā arthāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim paryeṣante
translated: And those bodhisattvas do not seek unsurpassed and perfect awakening for the sake of compassion for all beings.

analyzed: ye api te pariśuddham buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇanti
translated: And those who accept a pure buddha-field

analyzed: utsṛṣṭa kṛpāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas who abandon compassion.

analyzed: ye śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ parivarjitam buddhakṣetram ākāṅkṣanti
translated: Those who desire a buddha-field devoid of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: na ca te bodhisattvāḥ kuśala jñāna āśaya bhūtā
translated: Those bodhisattvas are not born from the intention of skillful knowledge.

original: yeṣāmevaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ yathā vayaṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhavarjitā akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatairmātṛgrāmairvivarjite narakatiryagyoniyamalokavivarjite buddhakṣetre'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyurmahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhaparivarjitāṃ śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yeṣām evam praṇidhānam kṛtam yathā vayam śrāvaka pratyekabuddha varjitāḥ akuśala mūla samavadhāna gataiḥ mātṛgrāmaiḥ vivarjite naraka tiryagyoni yama loka vivarjite buddhakṣetre anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyuḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām bodhisattvānām śrāvaka pratyekabuddha parivarjitām śuddhām mahāyāna kathām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: Those who have made the vow thus: May we attain supreme perfect enlightenment in a buddha-field devoid of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, devoid of women, hell-dwellers, animals, and hungry ghosts, and may we teach the pure Dharma of the Great Vehicle, devoid of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, to bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: bodhi prāptaḥ ca aham dīrgha āyuṣkaḥ bhaveyam cira sthāyī
translated: And when I attain enlightenment, may I have a long life, enduring for a long time.

original: bahūni kalpāni śūddhāśayānāṃ suvinītānāṃ kuśalamūlasamavadhānagatānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: bahūni kalpāni śūddha āśayānām su vinītānām kuśala mūla samavadhāna gatānām dharmam deśayeyam
translated: For many eons, may I teach the Dharma to those of pure intention, well-disciplined, and endowed with the roots of virtue.

analyzed: tena te bodhisattvāḥ na kuśala jñāna āśaya saṃbhūtā
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattvas are not born from the intention of skillful knowledge.

analyzed: na mahāsattvāḥ iti ucyate
translated: They are not called great beings.

original: sa ca kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato bāhuṃ prasārayitvā pañcabhiraṅgulībhirnānāvarṇā anekavarṇā anekaśatasahasravarṇā raśmayaḥ prāmuñcan /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ bāhum prasārayitvā pañcabhiḥ aṅgulībhiḥ nānā varṇāḥ aneka varṇāḥ aneka śata sahasra varṇāḥ raśmayaḥ prāmuñcan
translated: And that Ratnagarbha Tathagata extended his arm with five fingers, and emitted rays of various colors, of many colors, of many hundreds of thousands of colors.

original: te gatvā raśmayo'prameyāsaṃkhyeyā purimāyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrān avabhāsayitvā /
analyzed: te gatvā raśmayā uprameyā asaṃkhyeyā purimāyām diśi itas buddhakṣetrān avabhāsayitvā
translated: Those rays went and illuminated immeasurable and countless buddha-fields in the eastern direction.

analyzed: tatra aṅguṣṭhāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: There was a world system named Aṅguṣṭhamātra.

original: tatrāṅguṣṭhāyāṃ lokadhātau daśavarṣāyuṣkā manuṣyā durvarṇā drohoḍimakā akuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā aṅguṣṭhamātramuccatvena /
analyzed: tatra aṅguṣṭhāyām lokadhātau daśa varṣa āyuṣkāḥ manuṣyāḥ durvarṇāḥ droha uḍimakāḥ akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ aṅguṣṭha mātram ucca tvena
translated: In that Aṅguṣṭhamātra world system, humans had a lifespan of ten years, were ugly, quarrelsome, engaged in unwholesome roots, and were only one aṅgula in height.

analyzed: tatra jyotīrasaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: There was a Tathāgata named Jyotirasa, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: sa ca kaliyugapramāṇānāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ hastapramāṇena hastamekaṃ tathāgata ūrdhvatvena hastaśca /
analyzed: sa ca kali yuga pramāṇānām manuṣyāṇām hasta pramāṇena hastam ekam tathāgataḥ ūrdhva tvena hastaḥ ca
translated: And that Tathāgata, for humans of the measure of the Kali age, was one handspan in height according to the measure of the hand, and the Tathāgata was one handspan in height.

analyzed: aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām puruṣānām pramāṇena sapta aṅguṣṭhāni
translated: For humans of the measure of an aṅgula, he was seven aṅgulas in size.

original: sa ca tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyati yāpayati caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ tribhiryānairdharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: sa ca tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyati yāpayati caturṇām parṣadām tribhiḥ yānaiḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: And that Tathāgata abided, sustained, and caused to endure, teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies with the three vehicles.

original: atha khalu kulaputra tacca buddhakṣetraṃ tāṃśca manuṣyāṃstaṃ ca tathāgataṃ sarvāvatī ca sā parṣādrākṣīt /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putra tat ca buddhakṣetram tān ca manuṣyān tam ca tathāgatam sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā adrākṣīt
translated: Then, noble sir, that buddha-field, those human beings, and that Tathagata were seen by the entire assembly.

original: ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha āha anena jyotīrasena tathāgatenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairatikrāntaiḥ prathamacittamutpāditamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasyāgrato /
analyzed: ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ āha anena jyotīrasena tathāgatena aprameya asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ prathama cittam utpāditam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya agratas
translated: The Tathagata Ratna-garbha, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, said, 'By the Tathagata Jyotis-omugha, after immeasurable and incalculable kalpas had passed, the thought of supreme and perfect enlightenment was first generated in the presence of the Tathagata Ratna-chchhaya-abhyudgata-avabhasa.

analyzed: bahu prāṇa koṭī nayutāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni niveśitāni pratiṣṭhāpitāni
translated: Many thousands of millions of living beings were inspired, introduced, and established in supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: yathābhiprāyāṃ sattvaistasya tathāgatasya purataḥ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yathā abhiprāyām sattvaiḥ tasya tathāgatasya puratas praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In the presence of that Tathagata, living beings made vows according to their aspirations.

original: kecidbuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ pariśuddhāḥ kecidapariśuddhāḥ pañcakaṣāyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: kecid buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ parigṛhītāḥ pariśuddhāḥ kecid apariśuddhāḥ pañca kaṣāyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ
translated: Some accepted the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field, some pure, some impure, some with the five degenerations.

original: tatra ca tena mahāsattvenāhaṃ samādāpito niveśitaścānuttarāyāṃ samyaksabodhau /
analyzed: tatra ca tena mahāsattvena aham samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ ca anuttarāyām samyaksabodhau
translated: And there, by that great being, I was inspired and introduced to supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: tatra ca mayā ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya purato'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhapraṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ
analyzed: tatra ca mayā ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsasya tathāgatasya puratonuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In the presence of the Tathāgata Ratnacchatrābhyudgatāvabhāsa, I made the vow to create the array of qualities in a buddha field in the time of the five degenerations for the sake of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: sa ca me tathāgataḥ sādhukāramadāsīt vyākṛtaścāhamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sa ca me tathāgataḥ sādhukāram adāsīt vyākṛtaḥ ca aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: That Tathāgata applauded me and I was prophesied to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: yo'sāvasmākaṃ bodhāya samādāyakaḥ kalyāṇamitro'tīva satpuruṣastīvrapañcakaṣāye kaliyuge vartamāne kāle pratikliṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ asmākam bodhāya samādāyakaḥ kalyāṇa mitraḥ tīvra pañca kaṣāye kali yuge vartamāne kāle pratikliṣṭam buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: That good friend who inspired us to awakening, that extremely virtuous person, in the time of the fierce five degenerations and the age of strife, took up a buddha field that was difficult to purify.

original: ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā dagdhasantānāḥ saṃsārāṭavīkāntārasaṅkaṭaprāptā vaineyasattva praṇidhānaḥ parigṛhītastasya satpuruṣasya daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyebhyo'nyonyalokadhātubhyastiṣṭhanto yāpayanto buddhā bhagavantaḥ sādhukāraṃ pradattavantaḥ preṣitavanto /
analyzed: ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ dagdha santānāḥ saṃsāra aṭavī kāntāra saṅkaṭa prāptāḥ vaineya sattva praṇidhānaḥ parigṛhītaḥ tasya sat puruṣasya daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ nyonya lokadhātubhyaḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ yāpayantaḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sādhukāram pradattavantaḥ preṣitavantaḥ
translated: He took up as disciples beings who had committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who had fallen into the roots of nonvirtue, whose continuums were burned, who had reached the dangerous wilderness of saṃsāra. The virtuous person took up the vow to guide those beings. The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who were dwelling and maintaining themselves in immeasurable and countless other world systems in the ten directions, gave their approval and sent him forth.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā vairocana saumyaḥ nāma kṛtam
translated: He was given the name Mahākaruṇāvairocanasaumya.

original: sa ca mahākaruṇāvairocanasaumyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'smākaṃ kalyāṇamitro hitakara etarhyacirābhisaṃbuddho'ṅguṣṭhavatyāṃ lokadhātau aṅguṣṭhapramāṇānāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ madhye /
analyzed: sa ca mahā karuṇā vairocana saumyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ usmākam kalyāṇa mitraḥ hita karaḥ etarhi acira abhisaṃbuddha uṅguṣṭhavatyām lokadhātau aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām puruṣāṇām madhye
translated: And that Bodhisattva Mahasattva Mahakaruna-Vairocana-Saumya, our spiritual friend and benefactor, has just now attained enlightenment in the world system Anguṣṭhavatī, among people of the size of a thumb.

original: teṣāṃ evāṅguṣṭhapramāṇānāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ hastapramāṇena hastapramāṇakaḥ sa tathāgato daśavarṣāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ dhārmikaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartitavān /
analyzed: teṣām eva aṅguṣṭha pramāṇānām puruṣāṇām hasta pramāṇena hasta pramāṇakaḥ sa tathāgataḥ daśa varṣa āyuṣkāyām prajāyām dhārmikam dharma cakram pravartitavān
translated: In that world system, the Tathagata, who is the size of a thumb, has a height of one handspan, and he has turned the wheel of Dharma for people with a lifespan of ten years.

original: tasyāpi bodhiprāptasya daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyebhyo lokadhātubhyastiṣṭhadbhiryāpayadbhistaistairbuddhairbhagavadbhirdūtāḥ preṣitāḥ pūjanārthāya /
analyzed: tasya api bodhi prāptasya daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ tiṣṭhadbhiḥ yāpayadbhiḥ taiḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ dūtāḥ preṣitāḥ pūjana arthāya
translated: When he attained enlightenment, messengers were sent from immeasurable and countless world systems in the ten directions by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who were dwelling and maintaining themselves, for the purpose of worship.

original: ye tena prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye tena prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: They were the ones whom he first inspired, established, and made firm in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ye tena prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāstairbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ pūrvakṛtajñatāmanusmaraṇamāṇaistasya tathāgatasya puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ /
analyzed: ye tena prathamam dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ pūrva kṛtajña tām anusmaraṇa māṇaiḥ tasya tathāgatasya puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ
translated: Those whom he first inspired to take up the perfections, from the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom, and established in them, by those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, remembering his past kindness, flowers were sent to that Tathāgata.

original: paśya brāhmaṇa yathā te buddhā bhagavataḥ sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dīrgheṇāyuṣā pariśuddhāśayānāṃ sukhavihāriṇāṃ sattvānāṃ buddhakāryaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: paśya brāhmaṇa yathā te buddhāḥ bhagavataḥ sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu dīrgheṇa āyuṣā pariśuddha āśayānām sukha vihāriṇām sattvānām buddha kāryam kurvanti
translated: See, Brahmin, how those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, in all the Buddha-fields, with a long lifespan, purify their intentions and dwell in bliss, performing the Buddha's work for beings.

original: sa ca jyotīrasastathāgata evaṃ pratikruṣṭe pañcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre buddhatvaṃ prāptavān /
analyzed: sa ca jyotīrasaḥ tathāgataḥ evam pratikruṣṭe pañca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre buddha tvam prāptavān
translated: And that Jyotirāsa Tathāgata attained Buddhahood in such a despicable, five-degenerate Buddha-field.

original: ānantaryakārakānāṃ yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatānāṃ sattvānāmevālpakenāyuṣā bahvatirekaṃ buddhakāryaṃ karoti /
analyzed: ānantarya kārakānām yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatānām sattvānām eva alpakena āyuṣā bahu atirekam buddha kāryam karoti
translated: He performs the Buddha's work for beings who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who have the roots of virtue cut off, with a very short lifespan, for a very long time.

analyzed: an ujjhitvā śrāvakām pratyekabuddhān ca dharmam deśayari
translated: Without abandoning the Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas, he teaches the Dharma.

original: evameva tvayā satpuruṣa sarvāmimāṃ bodhisattvaparṣāmabhibhūya viśiṣṭataraṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva tvayā sat puruṣa sarvām imām bodhisattva parṣām abhibhūya viśiṣṭataram praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: In the same way, Good Man, you, having surpassed this entire assembly of Bodhisattvas, have made a superior vow.

original: pratikruṣṭe buddhakṣetre pañcakaṣāye vartamāne ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /🔽ye ca te mahāsattvā yaiḥ pariśuddhā buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītā narakatiryagyoniparivarjitāḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhaparivarjitāḥ śuddhāśayāḥ suvinītā avaruptakuśalamūlāḥ sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītā ime sattvāḥ puṣpopamā ucyante /
analyzed: pratikruṣṭe buddhakṣetre pañca kaṣāye vartamāne ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ vaineyāḥ sattvāḥ parigṛhītāḥ  ye ca te mahāsattvāḥ yaiḥ pariśuddhāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ parigṛhītāḥ naraka tiryagyoni parivarjitāḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddha parivarjitāḥ śuddha āśayāḥ su vinītāḥ avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ ime sattvāḥ puṣpa upamāḥ ucyante
translated: They have taken on the task of guiding beings who commit the crimes with immediate retribution and who are bound to the unwholesome roots, in a buddha-field that is inferior and afflicted by the five degenerations.🔽Those great beings who have taken on the task of guiding beings who have pure intentions, who are well-trained, who have planted the roots of virtue, and who have been reborn in buddha-fields that are free from the realms of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, and free from śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, are said to be like flowers.

original: na te mahāsattvāḥ puṇḍarīkopamā ye suvinītānāmavaruptakuśalamūlānāṃ madhye buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: na te mahāsattvāḥ puṇḍarīka upamāḥ ye su vinītānām avarupta kuśala mūlānām madhye buddha kāryam kariṣyanti
translated: Those great beings who will accomplish the buddha-work among those who are well-trained and have planted the roots of virtue, in buddha-fields that are free from the realms of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, and free from śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, are said to be like lotuses.

analyzed: catvāri brāhmaṇa bodhi attvānām kuśīda vastūni
translated: Brahmin, there are four things that cause bodhisattvas to be lazy.

analyzed: katamāni catvāri  pariśuddha buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam  pariśuddha āśayānām sattvānām buddha kārya praṇidhānam
translated: What are the four?🔽Vowing for a pure buddha-field.🔽Vowing to accomplish the buddha-work for beings with pure intentions.

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna kathā bodhi prāptasya deśanā praṇidhānam
translated: Vowing to teach the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and to teach the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, after attaining enlightenment.

analyzed: bodhi prāptasya dīrgha āyuṣka tā praṇidhānam
translated: The vow for a long life upon attaining enlightenment.

analyzed: imāni catvāri bodhisattvānām kuśīda vastūni
translated: These are the four grounds for laziness of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: yena bodhisattvāḥ puṣpa upamāḥ iti ucyante
translated: By which bodhisattvas are said to be like flowers.

analyzed: na puṇḍarīka upamāḥ na mahāsattvāḥ iti ucyante
translated: Not like lotuses, not said to be great beings.

original: tadyathāpi nāma brāhmaṇa imān mahābodhisattvaparṣāṃ sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunā yenāpariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ kleśākulāḥ sattvā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītā ekatyo bhadrakalpikāḥ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma brāhmaṇaḥ imān mahā bodhisattva parṣām sthāpayitvā vāyuviṣṇunā yena apariśuddham buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam kleśa ākulāḥ sattvāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ ekatyaḥ bhadra kalpikāḥ kula putrāḥ
translated: Just as, Brahmin, except for this great assembly of bodhisattvas, Vayu and Vishnu have taken up a buddha-field that is impure, beings afflicted by defilements to be guided have been taken up, some good sons of the Fortunate Eon.

analyzed: catvāri imāni bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ārabdha vīrya vastūni
translated: These are the four grounds for the great bodhisattvas' exertion.

analyzed: katamāni catvāri  a pariśuddha buddhakṣetra praṇidhānam
translated: What are the four?🔽The vow for an impure buddha-field.

analyzed: a pariśuddha āśayānām sattvānām buddha kārya praṇidhānam
translated: The vow for the activity of a buddha for beings with impure intentions.

analyzed: bodhi prāptasya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna kathā deśana praṇidhānam
translated: The vow to teach the discourse of the vehicle of hearers and solitary realizers upon attaining enlightenment.

analyzed: madhyamāyā pratipadā bodhi prāptasya na ati dīrgha tāna alpa āyuṣka tā praṇidhānam
translated: The vow for a life that is not too long or too short upon attaining enlightenment through the middle way.

analyzed: imāni catvāri bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ārabdha vīrya vastūni
translated: These are the four bases of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, of those who have begun effort.

analyzed: yena te bodhisattvāḥ puṇḍarīka upamāḥ iti ucyante
translated: By which those bodhisattvas are said to be like white lotuses.

analyzed: na puṣpa upamāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ iti ucyante
translated: They are not said to be like flowers, those bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: tadyathāpi tvaṃ brāhmaṇaitarhi aprameyānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ madhye kuśalavyākaraṇakṣetraṃ tathāgatasyāgrataḥ karuṇāpuṇḍarīkamutpannaṃ praṇidhānaviśeṣeṇa /
analyzed: tat yathā api tvam brāhmaṇa etarhi aprameyānām asaṃkhyeyānām bodhisattvānām madhye kuśala vyākaraṇa kṣetram tathāgatasya agratas karuṇā puṇḍarīkam utpannam praṇidhāna viśeṣeṇa
translated: Just as now, Brahmin, you have arisen in the presence of the Tathagata as a white lotus of compassion among the immeasurable, countless bodhisattvas, as a field for the prediction of virtue, by means of a special vow.

original: yadā tvayā ānantaryakārakā yāvadakuśalamūlasamavadhānagatā vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāstīvraṃ pañcakaṣāyaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhītaṃ /
analyzed: yadā tvayā ānantarya kārakāḥ yāvat akuśala mūla samavadhāna gatāḥ vaineyāḥ parigṛhītāḥ tīvram pañca kaṣāyam buddhakṣetram parigṛhītam
translated: When you have taken as disciples those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, up to those who have come together with the roots of non-virtue, and have taken up a buddha-field with the five degenerations,

original: mahākaruṇāvyāhāreṇa tvaṃ satpuruṣa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamairbuddhairbhagavadbhiḥ sādhukāro datto /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā vyāhāreṇa tvam sat puruṣa daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ sādhukāraḥ dattaḥ
translated: you, good man, have been given the approval by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, equal to the atoms in the buddha-fields in the ten directions, with the utterance of great compassion.

analyzed: dūtāḥ ca preṣitā
translated: And messengers have been sent.

analyzed: mahā kāruṇikaḥ ca te nāma kṛtam
translated: And the name Greatly Compassionate One has been given to you.

analyzed: sarvā ca iyam parṣad tava eva pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ
translated: And this entire assembly is devoted to the performance of worship for you alone.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ mahākāruṇikānāgate'dhvanyatikrāntānāmekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ kalpānāṃ parīttāvaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgānadīvālikāsame'saṃkhyeye /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam mahā kāruṇika anāgata idhvani atikrāntānām eka gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām asaṃkhyeyānām kalpānām parītta avaśiṣṭe dvitīye gaṅgā nadī vālikā sama isaṃkhyeye
translated: You will become a great compassionate one in the future, after countless eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River, with only a little remaining in the second countless eon equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: tasmineva sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrake kalpe viṃśottaravarṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ /
analyzed: tasmin eva sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrake kalpe viṃśa uttara varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām
translated: In that very Sahā buddha-field, in the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred and twenty years,

original: jarāmaraṇādyadhike buddhakṣetre'ndhaloke'nāyake'kuśalamūlasamavadhānagate kumārge vihanyamānānāṃ mahāsaṅkaṭaprāptānāṃ sattvānāmānantaryakārakānāmāryāpavādakānāṃ saddharmapratikṣepakānāṃ mūlāpattisamāpannānāṃ yāvadyathā pūrvoktaṃ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇa ādi adhike buddhakṣetra indha loka nāyake kuśala mūla samavadhāna gate kumārge vihanyamānānām mahā saṅkaṭa prāptānām sattvānām ānantarya kārakānām ārya apavādakānām saddharma pratikṣepakānām mūla āpatti samāpannānām yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: in a buddha-field afflicted by old age, death, and so on, in a world of the blind, without a leader, when beings are engaged in unwholesome roots, when they are obstructed on a bad path, when they have reached a great calamity, when they commit heinous acts, when they slander the noble ones, when they reject the true Dharma, when they commit root downfalls, and so on, as previously stated,

original: ākīrṇe loke tathāgato bhaviṣyasi vidyācaraṇasaṃpanno yāvadbuddho bhagavān /
analyzed: ākīrṇe loke tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: you will become a Tathāgata in a crowded world, perfected in knowledge and conduct, up to a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: vivartitagaticakraḥ pravartitadharmacakraḥ vivartitavaśavartimārakleśamāraśca anantāparyantāni daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi śabdenāpūrayitvā /
analyzed: vivartita gati cakraḥ pravartita dharma cakraḥ vivartita vaśavarti māra kleśa māraḥ ca ananta aparyantāni daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi śabdena āpūrayitvā
translated: Having turned back the wheel of existence, having set in motion the wheel of Dharma, having turned back the Māra of sense desires and the Māra of defilements, having filled the endless and limitless buddha-fields in the ten directions with sound,

analyzed: mahāśrāvaka sannipātaḥ ca te bhaviṣyanti yat uta ardhatrayodaśaiḥ bhikṣu śataiḥ
translated: You will have a great assembly of disciples, namely, one hundred and fifty monks.

analyzed: anupūrveṇa pañcacatvāriṃśatibhiḥ varṣaiḥ evaṃrūpam sakalam buddha kāryam paripūrayiṣyasi
translated: In due course, in forty-five years, you will fulfill all the activities of a Buddha,

analyzed: yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: just as you have made the aspiration.

original: yathā tasmin samaye'yaṃ rājāmṛtaśuddho'mitāyurnāmāprameyaiḥ kalpaiḥ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: yathā tasmin samaye iyam rājā amṛtaśuddhā umitāyuḥ nāma aprameyaiḥ kalpaiḥ sakalam buddha kāryam kariṣyati
translated: Just as at that time this King Amṛtaśuddha will become known as Amitāyus and for immeasurable eons will accomplish all the activities of a Buddha,

original: evameva tvaṃ mahākāruṇika tatra sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrake mahākalpe viṃśottaravarṣaśatāyāṃ prajāyāṃ pañcacatvāriṃśatibhirvarṣairevaṃrūpaṃ sakalaṃ mahābuddhakāryaṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: evam eva tvam mahā kāruṇika tatra sahe buddhakṣetre bhadrake mahā kalpe viṃśa uttara varṣa śatāyām prajāyām pañcacatvāriṃśatibhiḥ varṣaiḥ evaṃrūpam sakalam mahābuddha kāryam kariṣyasi
translated: in the same way, O Greatly Compassionate One, in that Sahā Buddha-field, in the Bhadrakalpa, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred and twenty years, in forty-five years you will accomplish all the activities of a great Buddha.

analyzed: śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will become the Tathāgata named Śākyamuni.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca te satpuruṣānuttaraparinirvāṇenādhikaṃ varṣasahasraṃ saddharmaḥ sthāsyate /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca te sat puruṣa anuttara parinirvāṇena adhikam varṣa sahasram saddharmaḥ sthāsyate
translated: And after your parinirvāṇa, O Good Man, for more than a thousand years your true Dharma will remain, through the unsurpassed parinirvāṇa.

original: saddharme cāntarhite tava satpuruṣa te'pi dhātavaḥ janmaśarīre evaṃrūpaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: saddharme ca antarhite tava sat puruṣa te api dhātavaḥ janma śarīre evaṃrūpam buddha kāryam kariṣyanti
translated: And when the true Dharma has disappeared, O Good Man, your relics in the birth body will accomplish the activities of a Buddha in this way.

analyzed: yathā svayam praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: As you yourself made the vow.

analyzed: evam ciram sattvān vinayiṣyasi
translated: In this way, you will train beings for a long time.

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: As stated before.

analyzed: tad kāle kaitapure brāhmaṇaḥ āsīt
translated: At that time, in the city of Kaitapura, there was a brahmin.

original: sa evamāha teṣu teṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu tava satpuruṣa bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇasyāhaṃ nityopasthāyaka upakaraṇamaitryānukūlaḥ sahāyako bhūtvā tvāmupasthiheyaṃ /
analyzed: saḥ evam āha teṣu teṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu kalpeṣu tava sat puruṣa bodhi cārikām caramāṇasya aham nitya upasthāyakaḥ upakaraṇa maitryā anukūlaḥ sahāyakaḥ bhūtvā tvām upasthiheyam
translated: He said, In those immeasurable and incalculable eons, O good man, while you were practicing the conduct for enlightenment, I will always attend upon you, be a helpful companion with loving-kindness and favorable equipment, and serve you.

analyzed: caramabhavikasya aham tava pitā bhaveyam
translated: In your final existence, I will be your father.

analyzed: bodhi prāptasya ca te sat puruṣa agra dānapatiḥ bhaveyam
translated: And, O good man, when you attain enlightenment, I will be your foremost patron.

original: tvaṃ ca māṃ vyākuryā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tvam ca mām vyākuryāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And you should prophesy me for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: aparā ca tatra vinītabuddhiḥ nāma samudra devatā
translated: And there was another, a sea goddess named Vinītabuddhi.

original: taṃ saṃjñāvikaraṇabhīṣmājīvikaṃ śabdāpayitvāha sādhu sādhu satpuruṣa yastvaṃ mama sahāyako bhaviṣyasi anuttaracaryāya /

analyzed: yāvat ca tvam mama aprameya asaṃkhyeya janmāntara nayuta sahasreṣu upasaṃkrameḥ vastu yācanā arthāya
translated: For as many immeasurable and countless thousands of lives as you have come to me in the past to request things,

analyzed: tadā aham prasanna cittaḥ dadyām
translated: I will joyfully give them to you.

analyzed: mā ca tvam apuṇya bhāgī bhaveḥ

translated: Moreover, noble son, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika said to the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, Venerable Blessed One, if, while practicing the conduct for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for those many immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of kalpas, beggars should stand before me and ask for food with gentle words, or with human words, or with insulting words, or with clear words,

original: sacedahaṃ bhadanta bhagavan yācanakasyāntike ekacittakṣaṇamapi roṣaṃ utpādayeyaṃ /

analyzed: visaṃvāditāḥ me bhaveyuḥ yeprameya asaṃkhyeyeṣu daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyanti yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: then I would be deceiving the Blessed Buddhas who are present, remain, and live in other world systems in the ten directions, in the immeasurable and countless world systems.

analyzed: mā ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam

original: ye kecin mahākāruṇika tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane raktakāṣāyaprāvṛtāḥ sarve te avaivartikā vyākṛtāstribhiryānaiḥ /

original: ye'pi kecin mūlāpattisamāpannā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā vā pūrvameva te tena tathāgatena śāstṛsaṃjñākuśalamūlavipākena tribhiryānairavaivartikā vyākṛtāḥ /

translated: “Those bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who have fallen into root downfalls, even they, by the ripening of the roots of merit of the notion of teacher toward that Tathāgata in the past, have been predicted to the three vehicles without turning back.

original: punaraparaṃ kulaputra sa mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purata āha eṣaiva me bhadanta bhagavan praṇidhiryāvadevāhamanuttarāyāṃ bodhicaryāyāṃ caramāṇo yān sattvānahaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ niyojayeyaṃ samādāpayeyaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyāmantaśo vālāgrakoṭīpramāṇamātramapi kuśalamūle niyojayeyaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putra sa mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas āha eṣa eva me bhadanta bhagavan praṇidhiḥ yāvat eva aham anuttarāyām bodhi caryāyām caramāṇaḥ yān sattvān aham dāna pāramitāyām niyojayeyam samādāpayeyam pratiṣṭhāpayeyam yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām antaśas vāla agra koṭī pramāṇa mātram api kuśala mūle niyojayeyam
translated: “Moreover, noble sir, that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākaruṇika said to the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, ‘Reverend Lord, this is my vow: As long as I am practicing the conduct for the highest enlightenment, I will engage those beings in the perfection of generosity, I will encourage them, I will establish them, and I will engage them in the perfection of wisdom, even to the extent of just a fraction of the edge of a hair.

original: yāvadbodhiparyantena caryāṃ caramāṇo na tān sattvāṃstribhiryānairavaivartikabhūmau sthāpayeyamantaśa ekasattvamapi /

translated: As long as I am practicing the conduct up to the end of enlightenment, I will not establish those beings in the three vehicles on the stage of irreversibility, not even one being.

original: visaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyuḥ ye daśasu dikṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /

translated: May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not cause all sentient beings to attain the highest enlightenment, having first established them in the ten wholesome courses of action.🔽May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not cause all sentient beings to attain the highest enlightenment, having first established them in the four meditations, the four immeasurable aspirations, and the four formless absorptions.

original: mā cāhamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ /🔽anuttarajñānapratilabdhaścāhaṃ bhadanta bhagavan ye me sattvāḥ śāsane raktakāṣāyaprāvṛtā bhaveyuḥ /

translated: May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not become visible to all sentient beings.🔽May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not become an unsurpassed field of merit for the three worlds.🔽May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not become a great light for the three worlds.🔽May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not become a great refuge for the three worlds.🔽May I not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment if I do not become a protector for the three worlds.

original: sacedahaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃstān sattvāṃstribhiryānairavaivartikāṃ na vyākuryāmantaśa ekasattvamapi riṃceyurvisaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyuryāvan mā cāhamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyaṃ /
analyzed: saced aham bhadanta bhagavan tān sattvān tribhiḥ yānaiḥ avaivartikām na vyākuryām antaśas eka sattvam api riṃceyuḥ visaṃvāditāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaveyuḥ yāvat mā ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ paraspara viruddha vaira bahulāḥ paraspara yuddha saṃgrāma gatāḥ vā devāḥ vā yakṣāḥ vā rākṣasāḥ vā nāgāḥ vā asurāḥ vā garuḍāḥ vā kinnarāḥ vā mahoragāḥ vā kuṃbhāṇḍāḥ vā piśācāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā saṃgrāma gatāḥ kāṣāyam anusmareyuḥ
translated: If any beings, whether gods, yakshas, rakshasas, nagas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, kumbhandas, pisachas, humans, or others, who are engaged in mutual conflict, hostility, or warfare, should recollect the saffron robes,

original: te sattvāḥ karuṇācittā mṛducittā avairacittāḥ karmaṇyacittā bhaveyurye sattvāḥ saṃgrāme vā vivāde vā yuddhe vā kalahe vā kāṣāyakhaṇḍakaṃ rakṣārthaṃ pūjanārthaṃ gauravārthaṃ hareyuste sattvāḥ sadā aparājitā bhaveyuraskhalitā aviheṭhitā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te sattvāḥ karuṇā cittāḥ mṛdu cittāḥ avaira cittāḥ karmaṇi acittāḥ bhaveyuḥ ye sattvāḥ saṃgrāme vā vivāde vā yuddhe vā kalahe vā kāṣāya khaṇḍakam rakṣā artham pūjana artham gaurava artham hareyuḥ te sattvāḥ sadā aparājitāḥ bhaveyuḥ a skhalitāḥ a viheṭhitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: those beings would become compassionate, gentle, free from enmity, and pliable in mind. If beings, for the sake of protection, worship, or respect, were to carry a piece of saffron cloth to a battle, dispute, fight, or quarrel, those beings would always be invincible, unerring, and unharmed.

original: svastinā tataḥ saṃgrāmādvā yuddhādvā kalahādvā vivādādvā parimucyeyuḥ /
analyzed: svastinā tatas saṃgrāmāt vā yuddhāt vā kalahāt vā vivādāt vā parimucyeyuḥ
translated: They would safely escape from that battle, fight, quarrel, or dispute.

original: yadi me bhadanta bhagavannebhiḥ pañcabhirāryaguṇai raktaṃ kāṣāyaṃ na samanvāgataṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadi me bhadanta bhagavan ebhiḥ pañcabhiḥ ārya guṇaiḥ raktam kāṣāyam na samanvāgatam bhavet
translated: If, Venerable Blessed One, this saffron robe dyed with the five noble qualities were not endowed with me,

original: visaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyurye daśasu dikṣu /
analyzed: visaṃvāditāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaveyuḥ ye daśasu dikṣu
translated: the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the ten directions would be deceived by me.

analyzed: yāvan
translated: Up to:

original: mā cāhaṃ śaktaḥ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ pariniṣpādayituṃ /
analyzed: mā ca aham śaktaḥ sakalam buddha kāryam pariniṣpādayitum
translated: And I am not able to accomplish all the Buddha's work.

original: dharmā me saṃmoṣaṃ gaccheyurmā cāhaṃ śaktaḥ anyatīrthikāṃ parigṛhītuṃ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ me saṃmoṣam gaccheyuḥ mā ca aham śaktaḥ anya tīrthikām parigṛhītum
translated: May my Dharma not be forgotten, and may I not be able to embrace other non-Buddhist teachings.

original: ye ca bhadanta bhagavan mamābhisaṃbuddhasya yāvat parinirvṛtasya vā namaskāraṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca bhadanta bhagavat mama abhisaṃbuddhasya yāvat parinirvṛtasya vā namaskāram kariṣyanti
translated: And, Venerable Blessed One, those who will pay homage to me, whether I am fully enlightened or in parinirvāṇa,

analyzed: namaḥ śākyamunaye tathāgatāya iti vācam bhāṣiṣyante
translated: and utter the words 'Homage to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,'

analyzed: teṣām sarva karma āvaraṇa kṣayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: for them all karmic obscurations will be destroyed.

analyzed: ante ca anuttareṇa buddha parinirvāṇena parinirvāsyanti iti
translated: And in the end, they will attain parinirvāṇa through the unsurpassed Buddha parinirvāṇa.

original: sa ca punaḥ kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato dakṣiṇaṃ bāhuṃ prasārayitvā karatalena mahākāruṇikasya bodhisattvasya śiraḥ parimārjayitvāha sādhu sādhu satpuruṣa /
analyzed: sa ca punar kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇam bāhum prasārayitvā kara talena mahā kāruṇikasya bodhisattvasya śiraḥ parimārjayitvā āha sādhu sādhu sat puruṣa
translated: And, Noble Son, that Tathāgata Ratnagarbha, extending his right arm, stroked the head of the Bodhisattva Mahākāruṇika with his palm and said, Excellent, excellent, good man!

analyzed: kalyāṇam te praṇidhānam bhadraka prativimarśa
translated: Your aspiration is wholesome, your reflection is auspicious.

original: evameva te satpuruṣa pañcabhirāryaguṇai raktakāṣāyaṃ sattvānāmupajīvyaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam eva te sat puruṣa pañcabhiḥ ārya guṇaiḥ rakta kāṣāyam sattvānām upajīvyam bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, good man, the five noble qualities will be the red robes for beings to rely on.

original: sa bho punaḥ kulaputra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena vyākareṇena sādhukāraprāmodya prasādena tathāgatapuṇyadīrghāṅguliparicchāditena dakṣiṇena mṛdutaruṇakaratalasaṃsparśeṇa kumārabhūtaḥ saṃvṛto viṃśadvarṣasadṛśo jātipramāṇena /
analyzed: sa bho punar kula putra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena vyākareṇena sādhukāra prāmodya prasādena tathāgata puṇya dīrgha aṅguli paricchāditena dakṣiṇena mṛdu taruṇa kara tala saṃsparśeṇa kumāra bhūtaḥ saṃvṛtaḥ viṃśat varṣa sadṛśaḥ jāti pramāṇena
translated: Moreover, noble sir, that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika, by that prophecy, by the joy and faith of the exclamation Excellent! by the covering of the Tathāgata's long fingers, and by the touch of his soft and tender palm, became a youth, appearing like a twenty-year-old in age.

original: punarapi kulaputra sarvāvatī sā parṣā sadevagandharvamānuṣā prāñjalibhūtā tasthau /
analyzed: punar api kula putra sarvāvatī sā parṣā sa deva gandharva mānuṣā prāñjali bhūtā tasthau
translated: Again, noble sir, the entire assembly, together with the gods, Gandharvas, and humans, stood with palms joined,

original: mahākāruṇikasya pūjākarmaṇe udyuktāḥ puṣpairvādyairmahākāruṇikasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pūjāṃ kṛtvā vicitravarṇaiḥ ślokaistuṣṭāva //
analyzed: mahā kāruṇikasya pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ puṣpaiḥ vādyaiḥ mahā kāruṇikasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pūjām kṛtvā vicitra varṇaiḥ ślokaiḥ tuṣṭāva
translated: and were dedicated to the performance of worship for the Greatly Compassionate One. Having made offerings to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Mahākāruṇika with flowers and music, they praised him with verses of various colors.

analyzed: iti śrī karuṇāpuṇḍarīke mahāyāna sūtre bodhisattva vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ caturthaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the fourth chapter in the Mahāyāna sūtra The White Lotus of Compassion, called The Prophecy to the Bodhisattvas.

original: parāyaṇaṃ / sattvānāṃ duḥkhapramocanārthaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tathā te āśā paripūryatu vyākarotu ca bhagavānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: parāyaṇam sattvānām duḥkha pramocana artham praṇidhānam kṛtam tathā te āśā paripūryatu vyākarotu ca bhagavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: For the sake of liberating beings from suffering, he made a vow. May that aspiration of his be fulfilled. May the Blessed One prophesy his unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: dānaparivartaḥ nāma pañcamaḥ
translated: Chapter 5: The Chapter on Generosity

original: sa ca punaḥ kulaputra mahākāruṇiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañcamaṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya purato niṣasāda ratnagarbhaṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchat samādhānamukhanirdeśasaṃbhāraviśuddhimukho dharmaparyāyo bodhisattvānāṃ mārgo bhagavatā nirdiṣṭaḥ /🔽kiyatā bhadanta bhagavan samādhānamukhanirdeśasaṃbhāraviśuddhimukho dharmaparyāyo bodhisattvānāṃ mārgo bhagavatā nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca punar kula putra mahā kāruṇikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya pañca maṇḍalena pādau śirasā vanditvā ratnagarbhasya tathāgatasya puratas niṣasāda ratnagarbham tathāgatam paripṛcchat samādhāna mukha nirdeśa saṃbhāra viśuddhi mukhaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ bodhisattvānām mārgaḥ bhagavatā nirdiṣṭaḥ  kiyatā bhadanta bhagavan samādhāna mukha nirdeśa saṃbhāra viśuddhi mukhaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ bodhisattvānām mārgaḥ bhagavatā nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: Moreover, that great compassionate bodhisattva mahāsattva, having bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha with the five points, sat down in front of the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha and asked the Tathāgata Ratnagarbha: The Tathāgata has taught the path of bodhisattvas as the Dharma discourse on the gateway to the concentration that teaches the means of purifying the accumulations.🔽How much, Venerable Blessed One, has the Tathāgata taught the path of bodhisattvas as the Dharma discourse on the gateway to the concentration that teaches the means of purifying the accumulations?

original: kiyatā bhadanta bhagavan samādhānamukhanirdeśasaṃbhāraviśuddhimukho dharmaparyāyaḥ paripūrṇo bhavati /
analyzed: kiyatā bhadanta bhagavan samādhāna mukha nirdeśa saṃbhāra viśuddhi mukhaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ paripūrṇaḥ bhavati
translated: How much, Venerable Blessed One, is the Dharma discourse on the gateway to the concentration that teaches the means of purifying the accumulations fulfilled?

original: kiyadrūpeṇa vā bhadanta bhagavan saṃbhāreṇa samanvāgataḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛḍhapratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: kiyat rūpeṇa vā bhadanta bhagavan saṃbhāreṇa samanvāgataḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛḍha pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: In what kind of accumulation, Venerable Blessed One, is a son of good family or a daughter of good family firmly established?

analyzed: kiyat rūpeṇa samādhāna mukha nirdeśana alaṅkṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: By what kind of form is one adorned with the ornament of the teaching of the door of concentration?

original: sa bhoḥ punaḥ kulaputra ratnagarbhastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho mahākāruṇikaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat sādhu sādhu mahākāruṇika bhadrakaḥ praśnaḥ kalyāṇaṃ te pratibhānaṃ /
analyzed: sa bhoḥ punar kula putra ratnagarbhaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ mahā kāruṇikam bodhisattvam etat avocat sādhu sādhu mahā kāruṇika bhadrakaḥ praśnaḥ kalyāṇam te pratibhānam
translated: Again, O son of noble family, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Ratnagarbha said this to the Bodhisattva Mahakarunika: Excellent, excellent, Mahakarunika! The question is good, your inspiration is wholesome.

original: bhūyasyā mātrayā tvaṃ mahākāruṇikāprameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ hitakaro bahukaraścotpanno /
analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā tvam mahā kāruṇika aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām hita karaḥ bahu karaḥ ca utpannaḥ
translated: You, Mahakarunika, have arisen as one who benefits and assists immeasurable and incalculable Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas even more.

original: yatra hi nāma tvaṃ mahākāruṇika tathāgatamidamevaṃrūpaṃ praśnaṃ paripraṣṭavyaṃ manyase /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tvam mahā kāruṇika tathāgatam idam evaṃrūpam praśnam paripraṣṭavyam manyase
translated: In that you, Mahakarunika, think to ask the Tathagata such a question.

original: tena hi mahākāruṇika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru ca /
analyzed: tena hi mahā kāruṇika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru ca
translated: Therefore, Mahakarunika, listen well and thoroughly keep in mind.

original: mahāyānasaṃprasthitānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ asti mahākāruṇika śūraṃgamo nāma samādhiryatra samādhau sthito bodhisattvaḥ sarvasamādhiṣvanupraviṣṭo bhavati
analyzed: mahāyāna saṃprasthitānām kula putrāṇām asti mahā kāruṇika śūraṃgamaḥ nāma samādhiḥ yatra samādhau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva samādhiṣu anupraviṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: For those sons of noble family who have set out in the Great Vehicle, there is, Mahakarunika, a samadhi called the Hero's Fortress, in which samadhi, if a Bodhisattva abides, he enters into all samadhis.

original: asti ratnamudro nāma samādhiryena sarvasamādhayo mudritā bhavanti /
analyzed: asti ratnamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ yena sarva samādhayaḥ mudritāḥ bhavanti
translated: There is a samadhi called the Jewel Seal, by which all samadhis are sealed.

original: asti siṃhavikrīḍito nāma samādhiryatra sthitaḥ sarvasamādhibhirvikrīḍati /🔽sucandro nāma samādhiḥ sarvasamādhīnavabhāsayati /
analyzed: asti siṃhavikrīḍitaḥ nāma samādhiḥ yatra sthitaḥ sarva samādhibhiḥ vikrīḍati  sucandraḥ nāma samādhiḥ sarva samādhīn avabhāsayati
translated: There is the concentration called “lion’s play,” standing in which one plays with all concentrations.🔽There is the concentration called “good moon,” which illuminates all concentrations.

analyzed: candra dhvaja ketuḥ samādhiḥ sarva samādhīnām dhvajam dhārayati
translated: There is the concentration called “moon-banner-victory banner,” which holds the victory banner of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma udgataḥ samādhiḥ sarva samādhayaḥ antargacchanti
translated: There is the concentration called “all-dharma-rising,” in which all concentrations enter.

original: vilokitamudro nāma samādhiḥ sarvasamādhīnāṃ murdhānaṃ vyavalokayati /
analyzed: vilokitamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ sarva samādhīnām murdhānam vyavalokayati
translated: There is the concentration called “looking-at-the-seal,” which looks at the head of all concentrations.

analyzed: dharmadhātu vigata samādhau sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sarva dharmadhātu viniścayāya gacchati
translated: Standing in the concentration called “gone to the dharma realm,” the bodhisattva goes to the ascertainment of all dharma realms.

original: niyatadhvajaketau samādhau sthitaḥ sarvasamādhīnāṃ dhvajaṃ dhārayati /
analyzed: niyata dhvaja ketau samādhau sthitaḥ sarva samādhīnām dhvajam dhārayati
translated: Standing in the concentration called “fixed banner victory banner,” he holds the banner of all concentrations.

analyzed: vajre samādhau sthitaḥ sarva samādhīn nirbhinatti
translated: Standing in the “vajra” concentration, he breaks through all concentrations.

analyzed: dharma praveśa mudre samādhau sthitaḥ sarva dharmān mudrayati
translated: Standing in the “seal of entering the dharma” concentration, he seals all dharmas.

original: samādhirājasupratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu rājatvena pratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: samādhirājasupratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu rājatvena pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: Standing in the “well-established king of concentrations” concentration, he becomes established as the king of all concentrations.

analyzed: raśmi muktena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu raśmayaḥ avasaranti
translated: By means of the Rasmukta concentration, light rays enter all concentrations.

analyzed: bala vīryeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu bala vīrya tām kārayati
translated: By means of the Bala-viriya concentration, he causes strength and heroism in all concentrations.

original: samudgatena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣūdgacchati /🔽niruktinirdeśena samādhinā sarvasamādhivacanapraveśāṃ praviśati /
analyzed: samudgatena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu udgacchati  nirukti nirdeśena samādhinā sarva samādhi vacana praveśām praviśati
translated: By means of the Samudgata concentration, he ascends in all concentrations.🔽By means of the Nirukti-nirdesa concentration, he enters the verbal expressions of all concentrations.

analyzed: adhivacana praveśena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām nāmadheyāni anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Adhivacana-praveśa concentration, he penetrates the names of all concentrations.

analyzed: diś vilokena samādhinā sarva samādhīn avalokayati
translated: By means of the Dig-vilokana concentration, he surveys all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma prabhedena samādhinā sarva dharma prabheda tām anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Sarva-dharma-prabheda concentration, he penetrates the distinctions of all dharmas.

analyzed: dhāraṇī mudreṇa samādhinā sarva samādhīnām mudrān dhārayati
translated: By means of the Dharani-mudra concentration, he holds the seals of all concentrations.

analyzed: sarva dharma viviktena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu viveka dharmatām anupraviśati
translated: By means of the Sarva-dharma-vivikta concentration, he penetrates the dharma of seclusion in all concentrations.

analyzed: asaṃpramoṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ na muṣyanti
translated: By means of the Asampramoșa concentration, all concentrations are not lost.

analyzed: sarva dharma acalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu acala tāyai saṃtiṣṭhate
translated: By means of the Sarva-dharma-acala concentration, he abides unshakably in all concentrations.

original: sarvadharmasamavasaraṇasāgaramudre samādhau sarvasamādhayaḥ saṃgrahaṃ samavasaraṇaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: sarva dharma samavasaraṇa sāgara mudre samādhau sarva samādhayaḥ saṃgraham samavasaraṇam gacchanti
translated: In the ocean seal samādhi, which is the convergence of all dharmas, all samādhis are included and converge.

analyzed: sarva dharma āmanyane samādhau sarva samādhayaḥ udaya vyaya āmanyana tām gacchanti
translated: In the samādhi of non-discrimination of all dharmas, all samādhis are seen to arise and cease.

analyzed: ākāśa spharaṇena samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ ākāśe sphuranti
translated: In the space-pervading samādhi, all samādhis shine in space.

analyzed: sarva dharma ācchedanena samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ an upacchedam gacchanti
translated: In the samādhi of cutting off all dharmas, all samādhis are uninterrupted.

analyzed: vajra maṇḍalena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām maṇḍalam dhārayati
translated: In the vajra-circle samādhi, the circle of all samādhis is held.

analyzed: sarva dharma eka rasena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām rasam dhārayati
translated: In the samādhi of the single taste of all dharmas, the taste of all samādhis is held.

analyzed: raṇam samādhinā sarva upakaraṇa kleśām jahāti
translated: In the samādhi of abandoning strife, all the afflictions of striving are abandoned.

analyzed: sarva dharma anutpādena samādhinā sarva dharma anutpāda anirodham darśayati
translated: In the samādhi of the non-arising of all dharmas, the non-arising and non-cessation of all dharmas is shown.

original: vairocanena samādhinā sarvasamādhīn bhāvayati tapati virocati /
analyzed: vairocanena samādhinā sarva samādhīn bhāvayati tapati virocati
translated: In the Vairocana samādhi, all samādhis are cultivated, burn brightly, and shine.

analyzed: sarva dharma anirodhena samādhinā sarva samādhīn vibhajati
translated: In the samādhi of the non-cessation of all dharmas, all samādhis are distinguished.

original: animiṣeṇa samādhinā sarvasamādhayo na kadācit samādhidharmā eṣante /
analyzed: animiṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ na kadācid samādhi dharmāḥ eṣante
translated: By the unwavering samādhi, all samādhis are never sought after as dharmas of samādhi.

original: aniketena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu na kadācid dharmasthitiṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: aniketena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu na kadācid dharma sthitim samanupaśyati
translated: By the homeless samādhi, one never sees the stability of dharmas in any of the samādhis.

analyzed: gagana kalpena samādhinā sarva samādhīn gagana svabhāva asāra tvāya samanupaśyati
translated: By the space-like samādhi, one sees all samādhis as having the nature of space and being insubstantial.

original: niścittena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu cittacaitasikā dharmāḥ prahīyante /
analyzed: niścittena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu citta caitasikāḥ dharmāḥ prahīyante
translated: By the no-mind samādhi, the dharmas of mind and mental factors are abandoned in all samādhis.

analyzed: rūpa aparyantena samādhinā rūpam avabhāsayati
translated: By the infinite form samādhi, one illuminates form.

analyzed: vimala pradīpena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām pradīpam karoti
translated: By the stainless lamp samādhi, one illuminates all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma aparyantena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu aparyanta jñānam darśayati
translated: By the infinite all dharmas samādhi, one displays infinite knowledge in all samādhis.

analyzed: vidyut unmiṣeṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu aparyantam jñānam darśayati
translated: By the lightning flash samādhi, one displays infinite knowledge in all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva prabhaṃkareṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu prabhaṃkara mukham upadarśayati
translated: By the all-light-maker samādhi, one displays the face that emits light in all samādhis.

analyzed: dhātu paryantena samādhinā sarva samādhīn a paryanta vijñāpanāya upadarśayati
translated: By the element-limit samādhi, one displays the knowledge of the limitless in all samādhis.

analyzed: samādhi śuddha sāreṇa samādhinā śūnyatām samādhi dharmeṣu anuprāpnoti
translated: With the samādhi of pure essence, he attains emptiness in the dharmas of samādhi.

analyzed: meru citreṇa samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu ṛktatām saṃdarśayati
translated: With the Meru-like samādhi, he shows the emptiness of all dharmas.

analyzed: vimala prabhena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām malam apakarṣayati
translated: With the stainless light samādhi, he removes the stains of all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma asaṃprabhedena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām vyupakṛṣṭa tām saṃdarśayati
translated: With the samādhi of the non-differentiation of all dharmas, he shows the sublimity of all samādhis.

analyzed: rati kareṇa samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ratim pratilabhate
translated: With the delight-producing samādhi, he attains delight in all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma svabhāva vikrīḍitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu rūpa anupalabdhim darśayati
translated: With the samādhi of playfully mastering the nature of all dharmas, he shows the non-apprehension of form in all samādhis.

analyzed: vidyut vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu alakṣaṇa tvam darśayati
translated: With the lightning flash samādhi, he shows the signlessness of all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma a nikṣepa virajena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām virajam jñānam upadarśayati
translated: With the stainless samādhi of the non-rejection of all dharmas, he shows the stainless knowledge of all samādhis.

original: akṣayavatena samādhinā sarvasamādhīnāṃ na kṣayaṃ nākṣayaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: akṣayavatena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām na kṣayam na akṣayam darśayati
translated: With the inexhaustible samādhi, he shows the non-exhaustion and non-non-exhaustion of all samādhis.

analyzed: sarva dharma acintya śuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmām pratibhāsa upamām darśayati
translated: With the samādhi of the inconceivable purity of all dharmas, he shows all dharmas to be like reflections.

analyzed: tejovatā samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu jñānam jvālayati
translated: With the radiant concentration, he illuminates the knowledge in all concentrations.

analyzed: kṣaya apagatena samādhinā sarva samādhīn a kṣaya an upagatām darśayati
translated: With the concentration of the destruction and removal, he shows the destruction and removal of all concentrations.

original: aniñjitena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu neñjati na vepati na prapañcayati /
analyzed: an iñjitena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu na iñjati na vepati na prapañcayati
translated: With the unshakable concentration, he does not shake, tremble, or elaborate in all dharmas.

original: vivardhanena samādhinā sarvasamādhisamāpattiṣu vivardhamānāṃ jñeyaṃ samanupaśyati /🔽sūryapradīpena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu raśmimukhānyavakirati /
analyzed: vivardhanena samādhinā sarva samādhi samāpattiṣu vivardhamānām jñeyam samanupaśyati  sūrya pradīpena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu raśmi mukhāni avakirati
translated: With the increasing concentration, he sees the knowable as increasing in all concentrations and attainments.🔽With the sun-lamp concentration, he scatters the light rays in all concentrations.

analyzed: candravimalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ālokam karoti
translated: With the moon-pure concentration, he illuminates all concentrations.

original: śuddhapratibhāsena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu catasraḥ pratisaṃvidāḥ pratilabhate /
analyzed: śuddha pratibhāsena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu catasraḥ pratisaṃvidāḥ pratilabhate
translated: With the pure radiance concentration, he attains the four analytical knowledges in all concentrations.

original: kārākāreṇa samādhinā kāravihārakriyāṃ karoti jñānaketuṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: kāra ākāreṇa samādhinā kāra vihāra kriyām karoti jñāna ketum samanupaśyati
translated: With the action-form concentration, he performs the action of dwelling in action and sees the sign of knowledge.

original: vajropamena samādhinā sarvadharmānnirvedhīkaroti yasya vedhamapi na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: vajra upamena samādhinā sarva dharmān nirvedhīkaroti yasya vedham api na samanupaśyati
translated: With the vajra-like concentration, he penetrates all dharmas and does not even see that penetration.

original: cittasthitena samādhinā cittaṃ na calati na vedhati na pratibhāsati na vighātamāpadyate /
analyzed: citta sthitena samādhinā cittam na calati na vedhati na pratibhāsati na vighātam āpadyate
translated: By the concentration of mental stability, the mind does not move, does not waver, does not shine, does not come to destruction.

analyzed: na ca asya evam bhavati cittam etat iti
translated: And it does not occur to him that this is the mind.

analyzed: samanta ālokena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ālokam samanupaśyati
translated: By the concentration of universal light, he sees the light in all concentrations.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhitena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu su pratiṣṭhita tve pratiṣṭhati
translated: By the concentration of well-established, he is established in the well-established state in all concentrations.

original: ratnakūṭena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu ratnakūṭa iva saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: ratnakūṭena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu ratnakūṭaḥ iva saṃdṛśyate
translated: By the concentration of the jewel-peak, he is seen as a jewel-peak in all concentrations.

analyzed: vara dharma mudreṇa samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ mudritāḥ bhavanti
translated: By the concentration of the excellent Dharma seal, all concentrations are sealed.

analyzed: dharma samatayā na kaṃcid dharmam samatā nirmuktam samanupaśyati
translated: By the equality of dharmas, he does not see any dharma apart from equality.

original: ratiṃ jahena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu ratiṃ jahāti /🔽dharmolkena samādhinā sarvadharmeṣvasamārakṛtāṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: ratim samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu ratim jahāti  dharma ulkena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu a sa māra kṛtām pratilabhate
translated: By the concentration of abandoning delight, he abandons delight in all dharmas.🔽By the concentration of the Dharma torch, he attains non-attachment in all dharmas.

analyzed: akṣara apagatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu eka akṣaram api na upalabhate
translated: By the concentration of the absence of syllables, he does not perceive even a single syllable in all dharmas.

analyzed: ālaṃbana chedena samādhinā sarva ālaṃbanām vyupacchinatti
translated: By the concentration of cutting off the objective support, he cuts off all objective supports.

analyzed: avikāreṇa samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām vikāram na upalabhate
translated: With the unchangeable samādhi one does not perceive any change in any dharma.

original: prakṛtiviśuddhena samādhinā sarvadharmāṇāmupakāraṃ nopalabhate /🔽aniketacareṇa samādhinā sarvadharmeṣu niketaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: prakṛti viśuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām upakāram na upalabhate  aniketa careṇa samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu niketam na upalabhate
translated: With the naturally pure samādhi one does not perceive any benefit in any dharma.🔽With the samādhi that does not dwell anywhere one does not perceive any dwelling in any dharma.

analyzed: timira apagatena samādhinā sarva samādhi caraṇam na samanupaśyati
translated: With the samādhi that is free from darkness one does not see the practice of any samādhi.

analyzed: tamaḥ viṣayam samatikrāmati
translated: One transcends the realm of darkness.

analyzed: sarva guṇa saṃcaya gatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu sannicayam jahāti
translated: With the samādhi that goes to the accumulation of all qualities one abandons the accumulation in all dharmas.

analyzed: sthita niścittena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu cittam iti na upalabhate
translated: With the samādhi of a stable mind one does not perceive a mind in any dharma.

analyzed: bodhyaṅga gatena samādhinā sarva dharmām budhyati
translated: With the samādhi that goes to the factors of enlightenment one awakens to all dharmas.

analyzed: smṛti vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asaṃkhyeya pratibhānam pratilabhate
translated: With the samādhi of the destruction of memory one attains immeasurable eloquence in all dharmas.

analyzed: tad kara jñāna viśuddhena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asama asama tām pratilabhate
translated: With the samādhi that is purified by the knowledge of doing that one attains equality in all dharmas.

analyzed: jñānaketu samādhinā sarva traidhātukam atikrāmati
translated: With the samādhi of the banner of knowledge one transcends the entire three realms.

analyzed: jñāna upaccheda samādhinā sarva dharma vyavacchedam samanupaśyati  jñāna vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharma vikaraṇa tām anuprāpnoti
translated: By the concentration of the severance of knowledge, one sees the severance of all dharmas.🔽By the concentration of the destruction of knowledge, one attains the destruction of all dharmas.

analyzed: niradhiṣṭhānena samādhinā sarva dharmām anāśraya bhūtām samanupaśyati
translated: By the concentration of the baseless, one sees all dharmas as having no basis.

analyzed: eka vyūhena samādhinā na kaṃcid dharma dvayam samanupaśyati
translated: By the concentration of the single array, one does not see any duality of dharmas.

analyzed: ākāra nirhāravatā samādhinā sarva dharmāṇām an ākāra nirhāram samanupaśyati
translated: By the concentration of the accomplishment of forms, one sees the accomplishment of forms in all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva adhikāra sarva bhava tala vikaraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu nirvedha jñānam praviśati
translated: By the concentration of the destruction of all bases and all worldly planes, one penetrates the knowledge of penetration in all dharmas.

analyzed: yasya anupraveśāt na kaṃcid pratilabhate  saṅketa ruta praveśena samādhinā sarva ruta saṅketeṣu anupraviśati
translated: By penetrating which, one does not attain anything.🔽By the concentration of entering into conventional sounds, one penetrates all conventional sounds.

analyzed: ghoṣa vāgbhiḥ akṣara vimuktena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu akṣara vimuktim samanupaśyati
translated: By the concentration of being liberated from syllables through speech and sounds, one sees the liberation from syllables in all dharmas.

original: jñānolkāmatā samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu tena bhāsati tapati virocati /
analyzed: jñāna ulkāmatā samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu tena bhāsati tapati virocati
translated: By the concentration of the desire for the torch of knowledge, one shines, burns, and radiates in all concentrations.

analyzed: vara jñāna lakṣaṇa vijṛṃbhitena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu apariśuddham lakṣaṇam darśayati
translated: With the samadhi called Manifesting the Characteristics of Supreme Knowledge, he shows the unpurified characteristics in all dharmas.

analyzed: anabhijñā lakṣaṇavatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu an abhilakṣaṇa artham samanupaśyati
translated: With the samadhi called Having the Characteristics of Non-Knowledge, he sees the meaning of the uncharacterized in all dharmas.

analyzed: sarva ākāra vara upatena samādhinā sarva dharma samādhiṣu sarva ākāra vara upetaḥ bhavati
translated: With the samadhi called Endowed with All Aspects and Excellences, he becomes endowed with all aspects and excellences in all samadhis and dharmas.

analyzed: sarva duḥkha su jahena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu a niśriyam samanupaśyati
translated: With the samadhi called All Suffering Easily Abandoned, he sees all dharmas as having no basis.

analyzed: akṣaya kāraṇena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu akṣayam na samanupaśyati
translated: With the samadhi called Inexhaustible Cause, he does not see any exhaustion in all dharmas.

analyzed: dhāraṇa padena samādhinā sarva samādhīm sarva dharmān ca dhārayati
translated: With the samadhi called Retention Point, he retains all samadhis and dharmas.

original: samyaktvamithyātvaṃ na samanupaśyati /🔽nirodhavidhapraśamena samādhinā sarvadharmānurodhavirodhāṃ na samanupaśyati /🔽vimalaprabhāsena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu saṃskṛtavimalaṃ na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: samyaktva mithyātvam na samanupaśyati  nirodha vidha praśamena samādhinā sarva dharma anurodha virodhām na samanupaśyati  vimala prabhāsena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu saṃskṛta vimalam na samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see rightness and wrongness.🔽With the samadhi called Cessation, Destruction, and Pacification, he does not see any contradiction or non-contradiction in all dharmas.🔽With the samadhi called Radiant Pure Light, he does not see any impurity in all samadhis and conditioned things.

analyzed: sāra anugatena samādhinā sarva dharmeṣu asāram na upalabhate
translated: With the samadhi called Following the Essence, he does not perceive any insubstantiality in all dharmas.

analyzed: pūrṇa candra vimalena samādhinā sarva samādhiṣu guṇa paripūrṇaḥ bhavati
translated: By the concentration of the pure full moon, one becomes replete with the qualities of all concentrations.
