analyzed: rudanti deva gaṇāḥ tatas ham ātmānam dagapālāt parvatāt pātayāmāsa
translated: The hosts of gods wept. Then I threw myself from Mount Dagapala.

analyzed: praṇidhāna vaśena mama parvata pramāṇam ātmabhāvaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: By the power of the vow, my body became the size of a mountain.

analyzed: yojana śatam vistāreṇa yojanam ucca tvena
translated: It was a hundred yojanas in width and a yojana in height.

analyzed: yāvat manuṣya mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ ārabdhāḥ mānsa rudhiram bhakṣayitum
translated: As far as humans, deer, and birds were concerned, they started to eat the flesh and blood.

original: mama ca kulaputra sa kāyaḥ sattvaiḥ paribhujyamānaḥ pratidinaṃ vardhate /
analyzed: mama ca kula putra sa kāyaḥ sattvaiḥ paribhujyamānaḥ pratidinam vardhate
translated: And, noble sir, my body, being consumed by beings, grew larger day by day.

analyzed: yojana śata sahasram vistāreṇa saṃvṛttaḥ yojana sahasram ucca tvena
translated: It became a hundred thousand yojanas in width and a thousand yojanas in height.

original: sarvatra mānuṣaśirāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sakeśakarṇanayanānāsauṣṭhadāntāḥ sajihvā anekamukhaśatasahasrāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra mānuṣa śirāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sa keśa karṇa nayana anāsa oṣṭha dāntāḥ sa jihvāḥ aneka mukha śata sahasrāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ
translated: Everywhere, human heads appeared, with hair, ears, eyes, noses, lips, teeth, and tongues. Many hundreds of thousands of mouths appeared.

analyzed: te ca mukhāḥ manuṣya śabdena ghoṣayanti
translated: And those mouths proclaimed in human voices:

analyzed: bhoḥ sattvāḥ bho gṛhṇatha yena artham
translated: Hey, beings! Hey, take whatever you want!

analyzed: mānsam paribhuñjatha
translated: Eat the flesh!

analyzed: rudhiram pivatha
translated: Drink the blood!

analyzed: nayanām gṛhṇatha
translated: Take the eyes!

analyzed: karṇa nāsām keśa oṣṭha danta jihvām gṛhṇatha
translated: Take the ears, noses, lips, teeth, and tongues!

original: yasyārthaṃ yenārthaṃ yāvadarthaṃ saṃtarpitaśarīrāḥ paripurṇābhiprāyā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayatha /
analyzed: yasya artham yena artham yāvadartham saṃtarpita śarīrāḥ paripurṇa abhiprāyāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayatha
translated: For whatever purpose, for whatever reason, to whatever extent, satisfy your bodies and fulfill your intentions, and arouse the mind of supreme perfect awakening.

analyzed: śrāvaka yānena vā pratyekabuddha yānena vā
translated: Or in the vehicle of the hearers, or in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

analyzed: ayam yuṣmākam upabhoga paribhogaḥ na kṣīyate
translated: This enjoyment and use of yours will not be exhausted.

analyzed: na ca yuṣmākam śraddhā deyam bhaviṣyati
translated: And it will not be a gift of faith for you.

analyzed: mā vaḥ kṣipram eva jīvita kṣayaḥ bhavatu
translated: May your life not be quickly exhausted.

original: ye ca tatra vijñāḥ sattvāste kecicchrāvakayāne cittamutpādayanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra vijñāḥ sattvāḥ te kecid śrāvaka yāne cittam utpādayanti
translated: And those wise beings there, some arouse the mind for the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

analyzed: kecid pratyekabuddha yāne
translated: some for the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

analyzed: kecid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayanti
translated: some arouse the mind for supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: kecid punar deva manuṣya upapattau cittāni utpādayanti
translated: and some arouse the mind for rebirth as a god or human.

analyzed: mānsam bhakṣayanti
translated: They eat the flesh,

analyzed: rudhiram pivanti
translated: drink the blood,

analyzed: kecid nayanāni gṛhṇanti  kecid karṇau
translated: some take the eyes,🔽some the ears,

analyzed: kecid na āsām  kecid oṣṭhau
translated: some the nose,🔽some the lips,

analyzed: kecid dāntām gṛhṇanti
translated: some take the teeth,

analyzed: gṛhitvā prakramanti
translated: and having taken them, they depart.

analyzed: praṇidhāna vaśena ca anyonyam prādurbhavati
translated: And by the power of their vow, it appears to each other.

analyzed: mānsam na ca apacayam bhavati
translated: The flesh does not diminish,

analyzed: na parikṣayam gacchati
translated: it does not go to complete exhaustion.

original: yāvaddaśavarṣasahasrāṇi sarvajambūdvīpakā manuṣyā yakṣamṛgapakṣiṇo'pi svaśarīreṇa saṃtarpayāmāsa /
analyzed: yāvat daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi sarva jambūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ yakṣa mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ api sva śarīreṇa saṃtarpayāmāsa
translated: For ten thousand years, all the humans of Jambudvīpa, the yakṣas, deer, and birds were satisfied with his own body.

analyzed: taiḥ ca daśabhiḥ varṣa sahasraiḥ gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni mayā netrāṇi parityaktāni
translated: With those ten thousand years, I gave up eyes equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

analyzed: catur samudra udaka pramāṇam mayā rudhiram parityaktam
translated: I gave up blood equal to the water of the four oceans.

original: sumerusahasrapramāṇaṃ mayā mānsaṃ parityaktaṃ /🔽cakravāḍaparvatapramāṇā mayā jihvā parityaktā /
analyzed: sumeru sahasra pramāṇam mayā mānsam parityaktam  cakravāḍa parvata pramāṇā mayā jihvā parityaktā
translated: I gave up flesh equal to a thousand Mount Merus.🔽I gave up tongues equal to the Cakravāḍa mountains.

analyzed: yugandhara meru pramāṇāḥ mayā karṇāḥ parityaktāḥ
translated: I gave up ears equal to the Yugandhara and Meru mountains.

analyzed: vipula asumeru pramāṇāḥ mayā nāsāḥ parityaktāḥ
translated: I gave up noses equal to vast Mount Merus.

analyzed: imam gṛdhrakūṭa parvata pramāṇāḥ mayā dāntāḥ parityaktāḥ
translated: I gave up teeth equal to this Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa.

original: kṛtsnaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ prajñāpanapramāṇaṃ me tatra svacarma parityaktaṃ /
analyzed: kṛtsnam saham buddhakṣetram prajñāpana pramāṇam me tatra sva carma parityaktam
translated: I gave up my own skin, which covered the entire Sahā Buddha-field.

original: paśya kulaputra daśavarṣasahasrāṇi evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāparimāṇāḥ svaśarīraparityāgāḥ parityaktā ekajīvitena /
analyzed: paśya kula putra daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi evam aprameya asaṃkhyeya aparimāṇāḥ sva śarīra parityāgāḥ parityaktāḥ eka jīvitena
translated: See, son of noble family, for ten thousand years, in this way, immeasurable, countless, and limitless self-sacrifices were given up for one life.

analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeya aparimāṇāḥ sattvāḥ saṃtarpitāḥ
translated: In this way, immeasurable, countless, and limitless beings were satisfied.

analyzed: ekacitta kṣaṇam api me vipratisāraḥ na utpannaḥ
translated: Not even a single moment of regret arose in me.

original: evaṃ ca me tatra praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evam ca me tatra praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And I made this vow there:

analyzed: yadi aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: If I am to fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect awakening,

analyzed: iyam me āśā paripūryatu
translated: may this wish of mine be fulfilled.

analyzed: yathā mayā eka dvīpe sva śarīreṇa sarva sattvāḥ saṃtarpitāḥ
translated: Just as in one continent I satisfied all beings with my own body,

original: evameva gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā varṣasahasrā asminnarajamerujugupsite buddhakṣetre sarvadvīpeṣvevaṃrūpo mamātmabhāvaḥ prādurabhavat /
analyzed: evam eva gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ varṣa sahasrāḥ asmin araja meru jugupsite buddhakṣetre sarva dvīpeṣu evaṃrūpaḥ mama ātmabhāvaḥ prādurabhavat
translated: in the same way, for as many thousands of years as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, in this Buddha-field of Meru, which is free from dust and is despised, in all the continents, such a form of my body appeared.

original: yathaikadvīpe daśavarṣasahasrāṇi evaṃ sarvadvīpeṣu sattvāṃ svamānsarudhiracarmanayanakarṇanāsauṣṭhajihvākeśaiḥ saṃtarpayitvā triṣu yāneṣu samādāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yathā eka dvīpe daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi evam sarva dvīpeṣu sattvām sva mānsa rudhira carma nayana karṇa nāsā oṣṭha jihvā keśaiḥ saṃtarpayitvā triṣu yāneṣu samādāpayeyam
translated: Just as in one continent for ten thousand years, in the same way in all the continents, I satisfied beings with my own flesh, blood, skin, eyes, ears, nose, lips, tongue, hair, and after encouraging them in the three vehicles,

original: manuṣyāṃ yakṣarākṣasāṃ sarvatiryagyonikān ye kecin mānsarudhirabhojanāhārāḥ pṛthagyakṣā yāvadantaśaḥ yāmalaukikāḥ tāṃścāhaṃ saṃtarpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: manuṣyām yakṣa rākṣasām sarva tiryagyonikān ye kecid mānsa rudhira bhojana āhārāḥ pṛthak yakṣāḥ yāvat antaśas yāmalaukikāḥ tān ca aham saṃtarpayeyam
translated: I satisfied humans, Yakshas, Rakshasas, and all beings of the animal realm, and separately the Yakshas, and so on, up to the beings of the Yama world who eat flesh and blood.

original: yathā cāhamekasmin buddhakṣetre svaśarīreṇa sarvasattvāṃ saṃtarpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yathā ca aham ekasmin buddhakṣetre sva śarīreṇa sarva sattvām saṃtarpayeyam
translated: And just as I satisfied all beings with my own body in one Buddha-field,

original: evameva samantaddaśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu svamānsarudhiracarmanayanāṃ yāvajjihvābhirevaṃrūpeṇātmabhāvena gaṅgānadīvālikāsamān mahākalpān teṣu teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu svakāyajīvitena sattvāṃ saṃtarpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva samantat daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sva mān sa rudhira carma nayanām yāvat jihvābhiḥ evaṃrūpeṇa ātmabhāvena gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān mahā kalpān teṣu teṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sva kāya jīvitena sattvām saṃtarpayeyam
translated: In the same way, in all the buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, with my own flesh, blood, skin, eyes, and even my tongue, for as many great kalpas as there are sands in the Ganges, in those buddha-fields, I would satisfy beings with my own body and life.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam ātma bhāvam pratilabhya
translated: Having attained such a body,

original: visaṃvāditā me buddhā bhagavanto bhaveyurye daśasu dikṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pravartitadharmacakrāḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti /
analyzed: visaṃvāditāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaveyuḥ ye daśasu dikṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pravartita dharma cakrāḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: may the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have set the wheel of Dharma in motion in the buddha-fields in the ten directions, be deceived by me.

analyzed: mā aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: May I not attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: mā cāhaṃ saṃsāre saṃsaramāṇo buddhaśabdaṃ śṛṇuyāṃ mā ca dharmaśabdaṃ mā saṅghaśabdaṃ mā pāramitāśabdaṃ mā mārabalaparāśayaśabdaṃ mā vaiśāradyaśabdaṃ yāvat kuśalaśabdamapi saṃsāre mā śṛṇuyāṃ /
analyzed: mā ca aham saṃsāre saṃsaramāṇaḥ buddha śabdam śṛṇuyām mā ca dharma śabdam mā saṅgha śabdam mā pāramitā śabdam mā māra bala para āśaya śabdam mā vaiśāradya śabdam yāvat kuśala śabdam api saṃsāre mā śṛṇuyām
translated: And while wandering in saṃsāra, may I not hear the word 'Buddha,' may I not hear the word 'Dharma,' may I not hear the word 'Saṅgha,' may I not hear the words 'perfections,' may I not hear the words 'overcoming the power of Māra,' may I not hear the words 'fearlessness,' up to may I not hear the word 'wholesome' in saṃsāra.

analyzed: nityam ca avīcau narake saṃbhaveyam
translated: And may I always be reborn in the Avīci hell.

original: yadi me evaṃrūpaḥ svaśarīraparityāgaḥ sattvasaṃtarpaṇārthe na saṃpadyata /
analyzed: yadi me evaṃrūpaḥ sva śarīra parityāgaḥ sattva saṃtarpaṇa arthe na saṃpadyata
translated: If this kind of giving up of my own body for the satisfaction of beings does not succeed,

original: naivaṃrūpaṃ ca me praṇidhānaṃ paripūri syādyathā me āśā cintitā /
analyzed: na evaṃrūpam ca me praṇidhānam paripūri syāt yathā me āśā cintitā
translated: and if this kind of fulfillment of my vow does not happen as I wish and think,

original: ye'pi cemasmiṃ buddhakṣetre sarvatra dvīpeṣvekaikasmiṃ dvīpa evaṃrūpā ātmabhāvāḥ parityaktāḥ sattvāṃśca mānsarudhireṇa saṃtarpitā /
analyzed: ye api ca imasmin buddhakṣetre sarvatra dvīpeṣu ekaikasmin dvīpe evaṃrūpāḥ ātmabhāvāḥ parityaktāḥ sattvān ca mā sa rudhireṇa saṃtarpitā
translated: then, in this Buddha-field and in each of the continents, I will give up my body in this way and satisfy beings with my flesh and blood.

original: evaṃ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣvanyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvā evaṃrūpeṇātmabhāvena svamānsarudhireṇa santarpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāḥ evaṃrūpeṇa ātmabhāvena sva mānsa rudhireṇa santarpitāḥ
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in other Buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, I will satisfy beings with my own body, flesh, and blood.

original: paśya kulaputra tathāgatasya dānapāramitā ātmabhāvaparityāgaṃ ya mayānuprabandhena tatkālaṃ netrāḥ parityaktāḥ teṣāṃ punarayaṃ jambūdvīpe yāvattrāyastriṃśaddevaparyantapramāṇe rāśirbhavet /
analyzed: paśya kula putra tathāgatasya dāna pāramitā ātma bhāva parityāgam mayā anu prabandhena tad kālam netrāḥ parityaktāḥ teṣām punar ayam jambūdvīpe yāvat trāyastriṃśat deva paryanta pramāṇe rāśiḥ bhavet
translated: See, son of noble family, the Tathagata's perfection of generosity in giving up his own body, which I have continuously given up my eyes at that time. If they were collected, they would form a heap in this Jambudvipa up to the Trayastrimsa heaven.

analyzed: ayam kula putra tathāgatasya saṃkṣiptena ātma parityāga dāna pāramitā
translated: This, son of noble family, is the Tathagata's brief perfection of generosity in giving up his own body.

original: punaraparaṃ kulaputra tataḥ paścādaprameyānāṃ kalpānāmatyayena ayaṃ buddhakṣetraścandravidyuto nāma babhūva /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putra tatas paścāt aprameyānām kalpānām atyayena ayam buddhakṣetraḥ candravidyutaḥ nāma babhūva
translated: Moreover, noble sir, after the passing of immeasurable eons, this buddha-field became known as Moon-Lightning.

analyzed: tam api pañca kaṣāyam babhūva
translated: It too became defiled by the five degenerations.

original: ahaṃ cāsmiṃ jambudvīpe rājā babhūva pradīpapradyoto nāma balavāṃścakravartī /
analyzed: aham ca asmin jambudvīpe rājā babhūva pradīpapradyotaḥ nāma balavān cakravartī
translated: And I was the king of this Jambudvīpa, named Lamp-Light, a powerful universal monarch.

original: evaṃ ca mayā sarvajaṃbūdvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ kuśaleṣu niyojitā /
analyzed: evam ca mayā sarva jaṃbūdvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ kuśaleṣu niyojitā
translated: And I thus directed all the beings of Jambudvīpa to wholesome actions.

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: As was said before.

analyzed: paścāt aham udyāna bhūmim niryātaḥ sva bhūmi darśanāya
translated: Later, I went out to the pleasure grove to see my own land.

analyzed: tatra ca aham puruṣam adrākṣam
translated: And there I saw a man.

original: paścādbāhuṃ gāḍhabandhanaṃ badhyamānaṃ dṛṣṭvā mayāmātyāḥ pṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: paścāt bāhum gāḍha bandhanam badhyamānam dṛṣṭvā mayā amātyāḥ pṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Seeing his arm bound tightly behind him, I asked my ministers,

analyzed: kim anena puruṣeṇa kṛtam
translated: 'What has this man done?'

analyzed: amātyāḥ mām pratyūcuḥ
translated: My ministers replied to me,

analyzed: ayam puruṣaḥ devasya sāparādhikaḥ
translated: 'Your Majesty, this man has offended against you.

original: yadetasya puruṣasya saṃvatsare śaṣpaṃ dhānyaṃ cotpadyate tato devasya ṣaṭkāṃśo deyaḥ /
analyzed: yat etasya puruṣasya saṃvatsare śaṣpam dhānyam ca utpadyate tatas devasya ṣaṭka aṃśaḥ deyaḥ
translated: For when this man's grass and grain ripen in a year, a sixth part of it must be given to Your Majesty.'

original: yathānye kuṭumbino dadantyāyadvāraṃ ye devasya nagaragrāmajanapadakarvaṭeṣu prativasanti karmāntena jīvikāṃ kalpayanti /
analyzed: yathā anye kuṭumbinaḥ dadanti āya dvāram ye devasya nagara grāma janapada karvaṭeṣu prativasanti karmāntena jīvikām kalpayanti
translated: Just as other householders give access to the city, village, country, and market towns where the god resides, and make a living through their work.

analyzed: tam ca eṣa puruṣaḥ na dadāti
translated: But this man does not give that.

analyzed: tān aham etat avocam utsṛjate etam puruṣam
translated: I said to them, 'Release this man.

analyzed: mā kasyacid balāt dhana dhānyam gṛhṇīta
translated: Do not take anyone's wealth or grain by force.'

analyzed: te kathayanti
translated: They said,

analyzed: deva na kaścid su prasanna cittaḥ dadāti
translated: 'Your Majesty, no one gives with a joyful mind.

original: yaddevasya divasedivase'nnapānabhojanaparibhogo devīnāṃ devasya cāntaḥpuradevasya putrāṇāṃ duhitṛṇāṃ upabhogaparibhogaḥ sarvaṃ tatparaḥ sakāśāduddhriyate
analyzed: yat devasya divasedivasenna pāna bhojana paribhogaḥ devīnām devasya ca antaḥpura devasya putrāṇām duhitṛṇām upabhoga paribhogaḥ sarvam tat paraḥ sakāśāt uddhriyate
translated: Your daily enjoyment of food, drink, and sustenance, and the enjoyment and use of the queens, Your Majesty's inner quarters, sons, and daughters, all that is taken away.

analyzed: na ca kaścid prasannaḥ prayacchati
translated: And no one gives with joy.'

analyzed: tat ca aham parama durmanāḥ cintayāmi
translated: And I, extremely unhappy, thought,

analyzed: kasya aham imam sarvam jambūdvīpam rājya aiśvaryam dadyām
translated: 'To whom can I give this entire kingdom and sovereignty over Jambudvipa?'

analyzed: mama pañca putra śatāni babhūvuḥ tān ca bodhau samādāpayitvā
translated: I had five hundred sons. Having inspired them towards enlightenment,

original: imaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ pañcabhāgaśatāni kṛtvā putrāṇāṃ pradattaṃ /
analyzed: imam jambūdvīpam pañca bhāga śatāni kṛtvā putrāṇām pradattam
translated: I divided this Jambudvipa into five hundred parts and gave it to my sons.

original: ahaṃ ca tapovanaṃ gatvā riṣipravrajyena brahmacaryaṃ cacāra /
analyzed: aham ca tapovanam gatvā riṣi pravrajyena brahmacaryam cacāra
translated: I went to a hermitage and practiced celibacy as an ascetic.

original: vanakhaṇḍe uḍumbaramūle dakṣiṇasya mahāsamudrasya nātidūre navamūlaphalāhāro viharāmi dhyāyī anupūrveṇa pañcābhijñaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: vanakhaṇḍe uḍumbara mūle dakṣiṇasya mahā samudrasya na atidūre nava mūla phala āhāraḥ viharāmi dhyāyī anupūrveṇa pañca abhijñaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: In a forest grove, at the root of a fig tree, not too far from the great southern ocean, I lived on fresh roots and fruits, meditating, and eventually attained the five higher knowledges.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena pañcaśatā jambūdvīpakānāṃ vāṇijānāṃ mahāsamudramavatīrṇāstaistataḥ prabhūto ratnaskandha āsāditaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena pañcaśatāḥ jambūdvīpakānām vāṇijānām mahā samudram avatīrṇāḥ taiḥ tatas prabhūtaḥ ratna skandhaḥ āsāditaḥ
translated: At that time, five hundred merchants from Jambudvīpa had set out to sea. They obtained a great quantity of jewels there.

original: tatra ca candro nāma sārthavāhaḥ tena bhāgyavatā vijñapuruṣeṇa cintāmaṇiḥ samāsāditaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca candraḥ nāma sārthavāhaḥ tena bhāgyavatā vijña puruṣeṇa cintāmaṇiḥ samāsāditaḥ
translated: Among them was a caravan leader named Candra, a fortunate and wise man who obtained a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sa tato ratnadvīpādvipulaṃ ratnadhanaskandhaṃ taṃ ca cintāmaṇiṃ gṛhītvā saṃprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tatas ratna dvīpāt vipulam ratna dhana skandham tam ca cintāmaṇim gṛhītvā saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: He left that Jewel Island, taking with him that vast collection of precious jewels and the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: tataḥ kṣubhitaḥ samudro nāgā ākulā rudanti devatā yāstatra nivāsinyastatra cāśvasto nāma riṣirbodhisattvaḥ pūrvapraṇidhānena tatropapannaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṣubhitaḥ samudraḥ nāgāḥ ākulāḥ rudanti devatāḥ yāḥ tatra nivāsinyaḥ tatra ca āśvastaḥ nāma riṣiḥ bodhisattvaḥ pūrva praṇidhānena tatra upapannaḥ
translated: Then the ocean became agitated, the nāgas were disturbed and wept, and the deities who lived there were also distressed. There was a sage named Aśvasta, a bodhisattva who had been reborn there due to a previous vow.

original: tena mahāsattvena sa sārthaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa ca mahāsamudrāduttāritastasya ca sārthavāhasyānyataro duṣṭarākṣasaḥ pratyarthiko'vatāraprekṣī vivaragaveṣī pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhaḥ /
analyzed: tena mahāsattvena sa sārthaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa ca mahā samudrāt uttāritaḥ tasya ca sārthavāhasya anyataraḥ duṣṭa rākṣasaḥ pratyarthikaḥ uvatāra prekṣī vivara gaveṣī pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhaḥ
translated: That great being safely and securely delivered that caravan from the great ocean, and a certain wicked demon, an adversary of that caravan leader, seeking an opportunity, looking for a weakness, followed close behind.

analyzed: tena sapta divasāni parama kaluṣā vāta vṛṣṭiḥ avasṛtā
translated: For seven days he sent down a very stormy rain.

original: yataste vaṇijaḥ praṇaṣṭamārgā paramabhītāduccasvareṇa krandanti rudanti paridevanti /
analyzed: yatas te vaṇijaḥ praṇaṣṭa mārgā parama bhītāt ucca svareṇa krandanti rudanti paridevanti
translated: Thereby the merchants lost their way and were extremely frightened. They cried out in loud voices, wept, and lamented.

analyzed: devatām āyācanti śiva varuṇām yāvat mātā pitaram ākrandanti priya putrām
translated: They implored the gods, Śiva, Varuṇa, up to their mothers and fathers, and cried out for their beloved sons.

original: yāvadaśroṣīdahaṃ divyena śrotreṇa yāvattatrāgatvā vaṇijaḥ samāśvāsitāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat aśroṣīt aham divyena śrotreṇa yāvat tatra āgatvā vaṇijaḥ samāśvāsitāḥ
translated: Up to when I heard with my divine ear, up to when I went there and comforted the merchants.

analyzed: samāgatā uham
translated: I have come together.

analyzed: mā bhāyatha
translated: Do not be afraid.

analyzed: aham yuṣmākam mārgām upadarśayiṣyāmi
translated: I will show you the way.

analyzed: yāvat jambūdvīpam svastinā kṣemeṇa ca prāpsyatha
translated: Up to you will safely and securely reach Jambudvīpa.

original: tadāhaṃ paṭṭaṃ tailena mrakṣayitvā svahastaṃ veṣṭya agninā prajvālya satyavacanamakarot yadi mayā ṣaṭtriṃśadvarṣā caturbhirbrāhmairvihārairvanakhaṇḍanivāsināṃ sattvānāmarthāya hitāya navamūlaphalāhāreṇa caturaśītīnāṃ nāgayakṣasahasrāṇāṃ cittasantatiḥ paripācitā avaivartikāśca sthāpitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau tena satyena satyavacanena kuśalamūlaparipākena jvalatu me hastaṃ /
analyzed: tadā aham paṭṭam tailena mrakṣayitvā sva hastam veṣṭya agninā prajvālya satya vacanam akarot yadi mayā ṣaṭtriṃśat varṣā caturbhiḥ brāhmaiḥ vihāraiḥ vanakhaṇḍa nivāsinām sattvānām arthāya hitāya nava mūla phala āhāreṇa caturaśītīnām nāga yakṣa sahasrāṇām citta santatiḥ paripācitā a vaivartikāḥ ca sthāpitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau tena satyena satya vacanena kuśala mūla paripākena jvalatu me hastam
translated: Then I smeared a cloth with oil, wrapped it around my hand, set it on fire, and made this true statement: 'If it is true that for thirty-six years I have benefited and brought peace to the beings living in the forest groves through the four divine abodes, and if it is true that I have ripened the mind-streams of eighty-four thousand nāgas and yakṣas with the food of nine roots and fruits, and established them irreversibly in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, by that truth, by that true statement, by that ripening of wholesome roots, may my hand burn.'

original: labhantu mārgaṃ vaṇijaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa jambūdvīpaṃ prāpayantu /
analyzed: labhantu mārgam vaṇijaḥ svastinā kṣemeṇa jambūdvīpam prāpayantu
translated: May the merchants find a path and safely reach Jambudvīpa.'

analyzed: yāvat sapta rātri divasāḥ sva hastam jvālitavān
translated: And so for seven nights and days he burned his hand.

original: te vaṇijo jambūdvīpe sthāpitāstatra mayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: te vaṇijaḥ jambūdvīpe sthāpitāḥ tatra mayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And those merchants were established in Jambudvīpa. There I made this aspiration:

analyzed: yadā jambūdvīpam ratna parihīṇam bhavet
translated: 'When Jambudvīpa is devoid of jewels,

analyzed: tat yadā aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: then when I fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: tadā iyam me āśā paripūryatu
translated: may this wish of mine be fulfilled.'

original: sārthavāho bhaveyaṃ jambudvīpe saptavārāṃ cintāmaṇimānayitvā vividhaṃ ratnavarṣaṃ abhipravarṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: sārthavāhaḥ bhaveyam jambudvīpe sapta vārām cintāmaṇim ānayitvā vividham ratna varṣam abhipravarṣayeyam
translated: I would become a caravan leader in Jambudvīpa, bringing the wish-fulfilling gem seven times and causing a rain of various jewels to fall.

original: yāvat sarvadvīpeṣvasmin buddhakṣetre evameva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu ratnaṃ pravarṣayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat sarva dvīpeṣu asmin buddhakṣetre evam eva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu śūnyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu ratnam pravarṣayeyam
translated: In the same way, in all the continents in this buddha-field, and in the ten directions in buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges that are empty and have the five degenerations, I would cause a rain of jewels to fall.

analyzed: yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: As stated before.

original: evaṃ ca me āśā paripūrṇā gaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāṃ mahākalpānāmantareṇa sārthavāho'bhūvan /
analyzed: evam ca me āśā paripūrṇā gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām mahā kalpānām antareṇa
translated: In this way, my wish was fulfilled for as many great kalpas as the sands of the Ganges. In the meantime, I became a caravan leader.

original: gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ratnāni pravarṣitāni /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu ratnāni pravarṣitāni
translated: For as many buddha-fields as the sands of the Ganges that are empty and have the five degenerations, I caused a rain of jewels to fall.

analyzed: ekaika dvīpe sapta vārām vividham ratna varṣam pravarṣitam
translated: In each continent, I caused a rain of various jewels to fall seven times.

original: evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvā ratnaiḥ paripurṇābhiprāyāḥ kṛtāstriṣu ca yāneṣu niyojitāḥ /
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ ratnaiḥ paripurṇa abhiprāyāḥ kṛtāḥ triṣu ca yāneṣu niyojitāḥ
translated: In this way, the aspirations of immeasurable and countless beings were fulfilled, and they were established in the three vehicles.

analyzed: paśya kula putra tathāgatasya ratna parityāga lakṣaṇam vipāka kuśala mūlam
translated: See, son of noble family, the Tathāgata's characteristic of the ripening of the roots of virtue from the generosity of jewels.

analyzed: punar aparam kula putra aprameyāṇām kalpānām atyayena antareṇa ayam buddhakṣetraḥ timiram nāma abhūt
translated: Moreover, O son of noble family, after an immeasurable number of eons had passed, this Buddha-field became known as Darkness.

original: saṃtoṣaṇe kalpe vartamāne pañcakaṣāye pañcavarṣasahasrikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ praṇidhānenāhamasmin jambūdvīpe sūryamālagandho nāma brāhmaṇo'bhūvan vedapāṭhakaḥ
analyzed: saṃtoṣaṇe kalpe vartamāne pañca kaṣāye pañca varṣa sahasrikāyām prajāyām praṇidhānena aham asmin jambūdvīpe sūryamālagandhaḥ nāma veda pāṭhakaḥ
translated: In the Santorṣaṇa eon, during the five corruptions, when the lifespan of beings was five thousand years, I was born in this Jambudvīpa as a brahmin named Sūryamāla-gandha, a reciter of the Vedas.

original: tatkālaṃ ca sattvā bhūyasā śāśvatadṛṣṭayo'bhūvan savairaparākramāḥ sakalahādhiṣṭhānāḥ /
analyzed: tad kālam ca sattvāḥ bhūyasā śāśvata dṛṣṭayaḥ bhūvan sa vaira parākramāḥ sa kalaha adhiṣṭhānāḥ
translated: At that time, beings mostly had the view of eternalism, were full of enmity and violence, and were the basis of quarrels.

original: teṣāṃ cāhaṃ mahābalavegaparākrameṇa sattvānāṃ śatrubhūtaṃ skandhaprayogena dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: teṣām ca aham mahā bala vega parākrameṇa sattvānām śatru bhūtam skandha prayogena dharmam deśayāmi
translated: With great strength, speed, and courage, I became an enemy to those beings and taught the Dharma through the practice of the aggregates.

analyzed: śūnya grāma āyatana pratyavekṣaṇa a pratyaya samanubaddham sa utpāda vyayam āna apāna smṛti manaskāram darśayāmi
translated: I showed them the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, which is connected with the observation of the empty villages and sense-fields, with the understanding of arising and cessation.

analyzed: tena uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau citta utpādana kuśala mūla pariṇāmana abhiyojitāḥ
translated: They were engaged in the generation of the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and the dedication of wholesome roots.

analyzed: svayam eva ca aham pañca abhijñaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: I myself became one who possesses the five higher knowledges.

original: tena ca samayenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvā mamāvavādānuśāsanena pañcābhijñāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: tena ca samayena aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ mama avavāda anuśāsanena pañca abhijñāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: At that time, through my instructions, immeasurable and countless beings attained the five higher knowledges.

original: evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ kalahavigrahavairānavasṛjya vanakhaṇḍamāśṛtya vanakhaṇḍe mūlaphalāhārā dhyāyantaścaturbhirbrāhmairvihārai rātridivasamatināmitavantaḥ
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ kalaha vigraha vairān avasṛjya vanakhaṇḍam āśṛtya vanakhaṇḍe mūla phala āhārāḥ dhyāyantaḥ caturbhiḥ brāhmaiḥ vihāraiḥ rātri divasam atināmitavantaḥ
translated: In the same way, immeasurable and countless beings, having abandoned quarrels, disputes, and enmities, took refuge in forest groves, and living on roots and fruits, meditated in the four divine abodes, spending their days and nights in this way.

original: tataḥ kṣīyamāṇe kalpe yadā tairdakṣiṇīyaiḥ kṛtsnaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ sphuṭamabhūt /
analyzed: tatas kṣīyamāṇe kalpe yadā taiḥ dakṣiṇīyaiḥ kṛtsnam jambūdvīpam sphuṭam abhūt
translated: Then, as the eon was coming to an end, when the entire Jambudvīpa was filled with those worthy of offerings,

analyzed: te ca kali kala haraṇa vaira vigraha vivādāḥ praśāntāḥ
translated: and those quarrels, disputes, enmities, conflicts, and debates were pacified,

analyzed: akāla vāta varṣāḥ praśamitāḥ
translated: and untimely winds and rains were stopped,

analyzed: praṇītāḥ ojavatī pṛthivī saṃniśritāḥ śaṣpāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: and the grass grew on the earth, rich in sap and strength,

analyzed: kevalam vividha roga upahatāḥ babhūvuḥ kalpa doṣeṇa
translated: only afflicted by various diseases due to the faults of the eon.

analyzed: tadā aham evam cintayāmi
translated: Then I thought like this:

original: yadyahaṃ sattvānāṃ vyādhiṃ na śaktaḥ śamayituṃ /
analyzed: yadi aham sattvānām vyādhim na śaktaḥ śamayitum
translated: If I am not able to pacify the disease of beings,

analyzed: tasya mama etat abhavat
translated: this occurred to me:

original: yannūnamahaṃ śakraṃ mahābrāhmaṇaṃ lokapālānanye ca devarṣayo vā nāgarṣayo vā śakrarṣayo vā manuṣyarṣayaśca sannipātayeyaṃ /
analyzed: yat nūnam aham śakram mahābrāhmaṇam lokapālān anye ca deva ṛṣayaḥ vā nāga ṛṣayaḥ vā śakra ṛṣayaḥ vā manuṣya ṛṣayaḥ ca sannipātayeyam
translated: I should gather together Śakra, the great brāhmaṇa, the world guardians, and other celestial sages, nāga sages, Śakra sages, and human sages.

analyzed: bhaiṣajya upakaraṇa śāstram sattvānām hita artham upadarśayeyam
translated: For the benefit of beings, I should demonstrate the science of medical treatments.

original: tadāhamṛddhyā gatvā śakrabrahmāṇalokapāladevarṣīṇāṃ nāgarṣīṇāṃ śakrarṣīṇāṃ manuṣyarṣīṇāṃ ārocayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tadā aham ṛddhyā gatvā śakra brahmāṇa lokapāla deva ṛṣīṇām nāga ṛṣīṇām śakra ṛṣīṇām manuṣya ṛṣīṇām ārocayeyam
translated: Having gone there with my psychic powers, I should inform Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians, celestial sages, nāga sages, Śakra sages, and human sages.

analyzed: ekaviḍapatiḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: There is a mountain named Ekavīrādhipati.

original: tatra saṃnipātayitvā viḍacarakamūrdhani nāma sthānaṃ bhūtasaṃnivāraṇapratiśaraṇaṃ rakṣāvātapittaśleṣmasaṃprasādanaśāstraṃ nirdeśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra saṃnipātayitvā viḍacaraka mūrdhani nāma sthānam bhūta saṃnivāraṇa pratiśaraṇam rakṣā vāta pitta śleṣma saṃprasādana śāstram nirdeśayeyam
translated: Having gathered them there, on the peak of Ekavīrādhipati, I should teach the science of pacifying the elements, protecting against harm, and balancing wind, bile, and phlegm.

analyzed: peyālam aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām vyādhi praśamanam kṛtam
translated: The same is repeated, with the alleviation of the illnesses of immeasurable and countless beings.

original: tatra mahāpraṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ yathā mayaikadivase'prameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāṃ prajñāvabhāsaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatra mahā praṇidhānam kṛtam yathā mayā eka divase prameya asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām prajñā avabhāsaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: There, I made a great vow: Just as I have illuminated the wisdom of immeasurable and countless beings in one day,

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu niyojitā
translated: and established them in the three vehicles,

analyzed: apāya pathāḥ pithitāḥ
translated: closing off the paths to the lower realms,

analyzed: svarga patha pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: and establishing them in the path to heaven,

analyzed: vividhāḥ ca vyādhayaḥ praśamitāḥ parimocittāḥ ca
translated: Various diseases were cured and relieved.

analyzed: evam aprameyānām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām prajñā ālokaḥ dattaḥ
translated: Thus, the light of wisdom was given to immeasurable and countless beings.

analyzed: saukhyā iva sthāpitāḥ
translated: They were established in happiness.

original: tadanena kulaputra kuśalamūlavipākena iyaṃ me praṇidhānāśā paripūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: tat anena kula putra kuśala mūla vipākena iyam me praṇidhāna āśā paripūrṇāḥ
translated: By the ripening of this root of virtue, O son of noble family, my aspiration and hope were fulfilled.

analyzed: yadā ca mayā eka divase prameyānām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām apāya pathāḥ nirodhitāḥ
translated: And when on one day I closed the lower realms for immeasurable and countless beings,

analyzed: svarga pathe ca pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: and established them on the path to heaven,

original: glānapratyayopakaraṇārthaṃ devarṣiyakṣasaṅghāḥ sannipātitāḥ sattvānāmarthāya viḍacarakamūrdhani devaloke prakāśite sattvānāmārogyakauśalyamevameva timire buddhakṣetre sarvadvīpeṣu caivaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: glāna pratyaya upakaraṇa artham deva ṛṣi yakṣa saṅghāḥ sannipātitāḥ sattvānām arthāya viḍa caraka mūrdhani deva loke prakāśite sattvānām ārogya kauśalyam evam eva timire buddhakṣetre sarva dvīpeṣu ca evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: for the sake of sick beings, assemblies of devas, sages, and yakshas were gathered together. For the sake of beings, in the heaven above the abode of the gods, the various branches of knowledge were revealed. For the sake of beings, in the same way, in the Buddha-field of darkness, and in all the continents, such human effort was made.

analyzed: sattvāḥ ca svarga pathe pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: And beings were established on the path to heaven.

original: devanāgayakṣamanuṣyā ṛṣayaḥ sannipātitā yaissattvānāmarthāya vividhā vidyāsthānāḥ prakāśitāḥ /
analyzed: deva nāga yakṣa manuṣyāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sannipātitāḥ yaiḥ sattvānām arthāya vividhāḥ vidyā sthānāḥ prakāśitāḥ
translated: Devas, nagas, yakshas, humans, and sages were gathered together. For the sake of beings, the various branches of knowledge were revealed by them.

original: yathena timire buddhakṣetre evameva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣvevaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: timire buddhakṣetre evam eva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Just as in the dark buddha field, so too in the ten directions in buddha fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, with five degenerations, such an effort was made.

analyzed: sattvāḥ ca triṣu yāneṣu niyojitāḥ
translated: And beings were engaged in the three vehicles.

analyzed: svarga pathe ca pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: And they were established on the path to heaven.

analyzed: vividhāḥ ca vidyā sthānāḥ loke prakāśitāḥ
translated: And various branches of knowledge were revealed in the world.

analyzed: sattvā vyādhitaḥ parimocitā
translated: And beings were freed from disease.

original: anuttarā ca me kulaputraivaṃrūpā āśā paripūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: anuttarā ca me kula putra evaṃrūpā āśā paripūrṇāḥ
translated: And, noble son, my such-and-such hope was fulfilled.

original: api tatra timire buddhakṣetre sarvadvīpeṣvevaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛto yathā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: api tatra timire buddhakṣetre sarva dvīpeṣu evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ yathā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Even there, in the dark buddha field, in all the continents, such an effort was made as the vow was made.

original: apyanuttareṇa jñānena daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣvaikaikasmin buddhakṣetre sarvadvīpeṣvevaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛto /
analyzed: api anuttareṇa jñānena daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu a ekaikasmin buddhakṣetre sarva dvīpeṣu evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: And with unsurpassed knowledge, in the ten directions in buddha fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, empty and with five degenerations, in each buddha field, in all the continents, such an effort was made.

analyzed: yathā me pūrva praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: As my former vow was made.

analyzed: paśya kula putra prajñā viśeṣam bodhi caryāyām
translated: See, noble son, the excellence of wisdom in the conduct for enlightenment.

original: ayaṃ ca tathāgatasya trayāṇāṃ sucaritānāṃ kuśalamūlabījaṃ /
analyzed: ayam ca tathāgatasya trayāṇām su caritānām kuśala mūla bījam
translated: And this is the seed of the root of the three good conducts of the Tathāgata.

original: tathā pratyavarakālasamaye'saṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairadhikatarairantareṇedaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ vicitadoṣaṃ nāmābhūt /
analyzed: tathā pratyavara kāla samaye saṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ adhikataraiḥ antareṇa idam buddhakṣetram vicita doṣam nāma abhūt
translated: Thus, in the future, after innumerable and more than innumerable eons, this Buddha-field will be called Vici-dosa.

analyzed: saṃśrayase mahā kalpe vartamāne tat api pañcakaṣāyam
translated: In the great eon called Saṃśraya, it will also be five-impurity.

original: purimāyāṃ diśyanupañcāśāyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ vaḍaṃ nāma jambūdvīpamabhūt /
analyzed: purimāyām diśi anupañcāśāyām cāturdvīpikāyām vaḍam nāma jambūdvīpam abhūt
translated: In the east, in the direction of the four continents, there will be a Jambudvīpa called Vada.

analyzed: tatra api aham sattva paripācana artham upapannaḥ
translated: There also, for the sake of ripening beings, I will be reborn.

original: caturdvīpeśvaraḥ cakravartī rājā ambaro nāma babhūva /
analyzed: catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ cakravartī rājā ambaraḥ nāma babhūva
translated: I will be the lord of the four continents, a wheel-turning king named Ambara.

original: tatra ca mayā sattvā daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāstriṣu yāneṣu samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca mayā sattvāḥ daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ triṣu yāneṣu samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And there, for the sake of ripening beings, I will establish them in the ten wholesome courses of action, and in the three vehicles.

analyzed: sarvaṃdadaḥ ca babhūva sarvatra dāyī
translated: I will be a giver of everything, a giver to all.

original: tatra ca me yācanakā āgatvā vividhāni ratnāni yācanti /
analyzed: tatra ca me yācanakāḥ āgatvā vividhāni ratnāni yācanti
translated: And there, when beggars come to me and ask for various jewels,

original: tadyathā hiraṇyasuvarṇaṃ yāvaccendranīlamahānīlajyotīrasadakaprasādakāni yācanakānāṃ tāvatprabhūtāni ratnāni labhyante /
analyzed: tat yathā hiraṇya suvarṇam yāvat ca indranīla mahānīla jyotīra sadaka prasādakāni yācanakānām tāvat prabhūtāni ratnāni labhyante
translated: Just as gold, silver, and even sapphires, great sapphires, and radiant jewels are obtained in abundance for the petitioners,

analyzed: tadā aham amātyām pṛṣṭavān
translated: I asked my ministers,

analyzed: kutas eṣām ratnānām prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: From where do these jewels originate?

analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said,

analyzed: nāga rājānaḥ nidhīḥ nidarśayanti
translated: The nāga kings reveal the treasures.

analyzed: nidhīnām loke prādurbhāvāt ratnānām prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance of treasures in the world causes the appearance of jewels.

original: na kevalaṃ tāttakā nirdeśayanti yāttakā devasya yācanakāḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam tāttakāḥ nirdeśayanti yāttakāḥ devasya yācanakāḥ
translated: Not only do they reveal as many as the king's petitioners.

analyzed: tadā aham praṇidhānam akarot
translated: Then I made a vow,

original: yadyahaṃ pañcakaṣāye loke vartamāne tīvrakleśāraṇe kaliyuge vartamāne varṣaśatāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhyeyaṃ
analyzed: yadi aham pañca kaṣāye loke vartamāne tīvra kleśa araṇe kali yuge vartamāne varṣa śata āyuṣkāyām prajāyām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya iyam
translated: If I were to attain supreme perfect enlightenment in this world afflicted by the five degenerations, in an age of strife with intense afflictions, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred years,

analyzed: tat iyam me āśā paripūryatu
translated: may this aspiration of mine be fulfilled.

original: yadahamasmin buddhakṣetre nidhidarśako nāma nāgarājā bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: yat aham asmin buddhakṣetre nidhidarśakaḥ nāma nāga rājā bhaveyam
translated: May I become a nāga king named Nidhidarśaka in this buddha field,

original: sarvatra cāsmiṃ vijitaghoṣe buddhakṣetre sarvadvīpeṣu ca ekaikasmin dvīpe saptajanmāni parigṛhṇīyāṃ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca asmin vijitaghoṣe buddhakṣetre sarva dvīpeṣu ca ekaikasmin dvīpe sapta janmāni parigṛhṇīyām
translated: and may I take seven rebirths in each of the continents of this entire buddha field of Vijitāvin.

original: ekaikasmiṃśca janmani nidhikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi darśayeyaṃ prayaccheyaṃ ca nānāratnaparipūrṇāni /
analyzed: ekaikasmin ca janmani nidhi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi darśayeyam prayaccheyam ca nānā ratna paripūrṇāni
translated: And in each birth, I would reveal and give hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of treasures filled with various jewels.

analyzed: tat yathā hiraṇya suvarṇam yāvat indranīla mahānīla jyotīrasa daka prasādāḥ ca
translated: Namely, gold, silver, up to sapphires, mahānīla, jyotirasa, and dakaprasāda.

original: ekaikaśca nidhiyojanasahasrāṇi gatvā vistareṇa paripūrṇamapi ratnaṃ sattvānāṃ nidarśayeyaṃ prayacchayeyaṃ ca /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca nidhi yojana sahasrāṇi gatvā vistareṇa paripūrṇam api ratnam sattvānām nidarśayeyam prayacchayeyam ca
translated: And each treasure, extending over a thousand yojanas, I would show and give to beings the full jewel.

analyzed: yat asmin buddhakṣetre evaṃrūpam śūra bhāvam kuryām
translated: So that I would perform such heroism in this Buddha-field.

original: evameva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ekaikasmin kṣetre sarvatra dvīpe saptajanmāni pratigṛhṇīyāṃ /
analyzed: evam eva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu lokadhātuṣu ekaikasmin kṣetre sarvatra dvīpe sapta janmāni pratigṛhṇīyām
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in Buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, in world systems with five degenerations, in each field, everywhere on the continents, I would take seven births,

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as previously described.

original: yadā ca me kulaputraivaṃrūpaṃ praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tadā gaganatale devakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairantarīkṣāt puṣpavṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā sādhukāraścānupradattaḥ
analyzed: yadā ca me kula putra evaṃrūpam praṇidhānam kṛtam tadā gagana tale deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ antarīkṣāt puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ pravarṣitā sādhukāraḥ ca anupradattaḥ
translated: And when, son of noble family, I made such a vow, then from the sky, from the sky, hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas rained down a rain of flowers and gave their approval:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu sarvaṃdada
translated: Excellent, excellent, Sarvanīvaraṇaviskambhin!

original: ṛdhiṣyati te evaṃrūpā āśā yathā te praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: ṛdhiṣyati te evaṃrūpā āśā yathā te praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Your wish will be fulfilled, just as you have made the aspiration.

original: aśroṣīn mahājanakāyaḥ rājño'mbarasya devairgaganatalagataiḥ sarvaṃdada iti nāma kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: aśroṣīt mahā jana kāyaḥ rājñā umbarasya devaiḥ gagana tala gataiḥ sarvaṃdadaḥ iti nāma kṛtam
translated: The great assembly heard that King Ambara had been given the name Sarva-dada by the gods in the sky.

analyzed: śrutvā ca eṣam etat abhavat
translated: And having heard this, they thought:

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam duṣkara parityāgam dānam yācemaḥ
translated: Let us ask for a difficult gift to be given.

original: yadi parityakṣyati tadā sarvaṃdada iti nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadi parityakṣyati tadā sarvaṃdadaḥ iti nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: If he gives it up, then he will be called Sarva-dada.

original: tataste sarvā ārabdhā rājño'mbarasyāntaḥpurikāṃ yācituṃ /🔽devīmagramahiṣīṃ putraduhitṝṇāṃ yācituṃ /
analyzed: tatas te sarvāḥ ārabdhāḥ rājñā umbarasya antaḥpurikām yācitum  devīm agramahiṣīm putra duhitṝṇām yācitum
translated: Then they all began to ask for the women of King Ambara's harem.🔽They asked for his chief queen, his sons and daughters.

analyzed: tadā rājā ambaraḥ prayacchati prasanna cittaḥ teṣām etat abhavat
translated: At that time, King Ambara gave them away with a joyful mind. They thought:

original: na cedaṃ duṣkaraṃ yo bhāryāṃ parityajati /
analyzed: na ca idam duṣkaram yaḥ bhāryām parityajati
translated: This is not difficult, to give up one's wife.

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam rājñā umbarasya aṅga pratyaṅgāni yācamaḥ
translated: Let us ask King Ambara for his major and minor body parts.

analyzed: tat yadi dāsyati sarvaṃdadaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he gives them, he will be Sarva-dada.

original: atha na dāsyati na sarvaṃdado bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: atha na dāsyati na sarvaṃdadaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: But if he does not give them, he will not be Sarva-dada.

original: tatastasyāgrataḥ tatra jyotīraso nāma māṇavako rājño'mbarasyāgrataḥ sthitvā /
analyzed: tatas tasya agratas tatra jyotīrasaḥ nāma māṇavakaḥ rājñā umbarasya agratas sthitvā
translated: Then in front of him, there was a young brahmin named Jyotiska, who stood in front of King Ambara and said:

analyzed: sarvaṃdada rājyam dadasva iti prārthitavān
translated: He requested, Give me everything, give me a kingdom.

original: śrutvā ca rājñāmbareṇa paramaprītimanasā svayameva brāhmaṇaṃ snāpayitvā paṭṭaṃ badhvā rājābhiṣekenābhiṣicya rājatve pratiṣṭhāpayitvā sarvaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ niryātayitvā /
analyzed: śrutvā ca rājñā ambareṇa parama prīti manasā svayam eva brāhmaṇam snāpayitvā paṭṭam badhvā rāja abhiṣekena abhiṣicya rāja tve pratiṣṭhāpayitvā sarvam jambūdvīpam niryātayitvā
translated: Hearing this, King Ambara, with a supremely joyful mind, himself bathed the brahmin, tied a turban on his head, consecrated him as king with royal anointment, established him as king, gave him the entire Jambudvipa,

analyzed: praṇidhānam akarot
translated: and made a vow:

analyzed: aham sarva jambūdvīpa parityāgena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: I shall attain supreme perfect enlightenment by giving away the entire Jambudvipa.

analyzed: yadi iyam me āśā paripūryati
translated: If my wish is fulfilled,

original: yo'yaṃ mamaitarhi sarvajambūdvīpe rājā pratiṣṭhāpito vartatvasya jambūdvīpe ājñā /
analyzed: yaḥ iyam mama etarhi sarva jambūdvīpe rājā pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ vartatu asya jambūdvīpe ājñā
translated: may this king whom I have now established in all of Jambudvipa rule over this Jambudvipa.

analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ ca bhavatu
translated: May he have a long life.

analyzed: rājā cakravartī cira sthāyī  yadā ca aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: May he be a wheel-turning king, may he live long.🔽And when I attain supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: yadā yuvarāja tvena vyākuryām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: when I prophesy him as the next Buddha in the lineage of Buddhas,

original: roco nāma brāhmaṇastena me ubhau pādau yācitau /
analyzed: rocaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ tena me ubhau pādau yācitau
translated: a brahmin named Rocha will ask me for both my feet.

original: tasya mayā svayameva prasannacittena tīkṣṇaṃ śastraṃ gṛhītvā svapādau chitvā pradattau /
analyzed: tasya mayā svayam eva prasanna cittena tīkṣṇam śastram gṛhītvā sva pādau chitvā pradattau
translated: I myself, with a joyful mind, took a sharp weapon, cut off my own feet, and gave them.

analyzed: praṇidhānam ca akarot
translated: And I made a vow:

analyzed: labheya aham anuttarām śīla pādām
translated: May I obtain the unsurpassed feet of morality.

original: tatra drāṣṭāvo nāma brāhmaṇastena me ubhe netre yācite /
analyzed: tatra drāṣṭāvaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ tena me ubhe netre yācite
translated: There was a Brahmin named Drāṣṭāva. He asked me for both eyes.

original: tasya ca mayā ubhe netre utpādya datte /
analyzed: tasya ca mayā ubhe netre utpādya datte
translated: And I, having produced two eyes for him, gave them to him.

analyzed: peyālam
translated: The same applies here.

analyzed: anuttaram pañcacakṣuḥ pratilabhāya praṇidhānam kṛtavān
translated: I made a vow to obtain the unsurpassed five eyes.

original: na cireṇa saracchighoṣo nāma brāhmaṇastena me ubhau karṇau yācitau /
analyzed: na cireṇa sarat śighoṣaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ tena me ubhau karṇau yācitau
translated: Not long after, there was a Brahmin named Saracchighosha. He asked me for both ears.

original: svayameva tasya mayā karṇau chitvā dattau /
analyzed: svayam eva tasya mayā karṇau chitvā dattau
translated: I myself cut off his ears and gave them to him.

analyzed: anuttara śrotā pratilābhāya ca praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And I made a vow to obtain the unsurpassed ability to hear.

analyzed: saṃjīvanaḥ ca nāma ājīvikaḥ bhūt
translated: There was also a life-maintainer named Saṃjīvana.

analyzed: tena me puruṣa nimittam puruṣa indriyam yācitam
translated: He asked me for a male organ, a male characteristic.

analyzed: svayam eva ca mayā chitvā dattaḥ
translated: And I myself cut it off and gave it to him.

analyzed: anuttara vasti guhya tā lakṣaṇa pratilābhāya ca praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And I made a vow to obtain the unsurpassed characteristic of having the male organ hidden in a sheath.

analyzed: apareṇa ca me māṃsa rudhiram yācitam
translated: And later, he asked me for flesh and blood.

analyzed: svayam eva ca mayā dattam
translated: And I myself gave it to him.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa tā lakṣaṇa pratilābhāya ca me praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: I made a vow to attain the characteristic of a golden complexion.

original: aparaśca kṣīraso nāma parivrājakastena ca me ubhau hastau yācitau /
analyzed: aparaḥ ca kṣīrasaḥ nāma parivrājakaḥ tena ca me ubhau hastau yācitau
translated: There was also a wandering ascetic named Kṣīraso, and he asked for both my hands.

original: svayameva ca mayā dakṣiṇena hastena vāmaṃ hastaṃ chitvā dakṣiṇaṃ chedāpayitvā datto /
analyzed: svayam eva ca mayā dakṣiṇena hastena vāmam hastam chitvā dakṣiṇam chedāpayitvā dattaḥ
translated: I myself cut off my right hand with my left hand and had my right hand cut off and given to him.

analyzed: anuttara śraddhā hasta pratilābhāya ca praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: I made a vow to attain the unsurpassed hand of faith.

original: yadā cāṅgapratyaṅgāni chinnāni tadā ca mayā rudhiramrakṣitena kāyena praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yadā ca aṅga pratyaṅgāni chinnāni tadā ca mayā rudhira mrakṣitena kāyena praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: When my major and minor body parts were cut off, I made a vow with my body covered in blood.

original: yadi me'nena parityāgenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryeta /
analyzed: yadi menena parityāgena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryeta
translated: If my hope for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is fulfilled by this sacrifice,

analyzed: avaśyam aham asya kāyasya pratigrāhakam pratilabheyam
translated: I must certainly obtain a recipient for this body.

analyzed: te api akṛpakāḥ anāryāḥ akṛtajñāḥ sattvāḥ koṭṭa rājāna umātyāḥ ca āhuḥ
translated: Those uncompassionate, ignoble, ungrateful beings, the petty kings and ministers, said:

analyzed: ayam durbuddhiḥ alpa medhāḥ sarva aṅga vikartitaḥ sarva rājya aiśvarya paribhraṣṭaḥ
translated: This one is of poor understanding and little wisdom, his entire body is mutilated, he has fallen from all royal power and wealth.

analyzed: kim bhūyaḥ unena mānsapeśinā prayojanam
translated: What use is there for him with this piece of flesh?

original: te māṃ gṛhītvā bahirnagaraśmaśānabhūmau choritvā prakāntāḥ /
analyzed: te mām gṛhītvā bahis nagara śmaśāna bhūmau choritvā prakāntāḥ
translated: They took me and abandoned me outside the city, in the cremation ground.

analyzed: tatra daṃśa maśakāḥ āgatvā rudhiram pibanti
translated: There, mosquitoes and gadflies came and drank my blood.

analyzed: kurkura śṛgāla gṛdhrāḥ āgatvā mānsam bhakṣayanti
translated: Dogs, jackals, and vultures came and ate my flesh.

original: tatra cāhaṃ prasannacittaḥ praṇidhānamakarot /🔽yadā ca mayā sarvarājyaiśvaryaṃ parityaktaṃ /
analyzed: tatra ca aham prasanna cittaḥ praṇidhānam akarot  yadā ca mayā sarva rājya aiśvaryam parityaktam
translated: And there, with a clear mind, I made a vow:🔽When I abandoned the entire kingdom and sovereignty,

original: sarvaśarīraṃ caivāṅgapratyaṅgāni parityajatā /🔽ekakṣaṇamapi na vipratisārikṛtaṃ cittaṃ /
analyzed: sarva śarīram ca eva aṅga pratyaṅgāni parityajatā  eka kṣaṇam api na vipratisāri kṛtam cittam
translated: and when I abandoned the entire body, with its limbs and appendages,🔽not for a single moment did I have any regret.

original: na ca me roṣa utpāditastena me āśā paripūryatu /
analyzed: na ca me roṣaḥ utpāditaḥ tena me āśā paripūryatu
translated: And I did not give rise to anger. May my hopes be fulfilled by that.

original: ayaṃ me kāyo mānsaparvataḥ saṃtiṣṭhatāṃ /🔽ye kecit sattvā mānsāhārā rudhirapānāste māṃsaṃ bhakṣayantu rudhiraṃ pibeyantu /
analyzed: ayam me kāyaḥ mānsaparvataḥ saṃtiṣṭhatām  ye kecid sattvāḥ mānsa āhārāḥ rudhira pānāḥ te māṃsam bhakṣayantu rudhiram pibeyantu
translated: May this body of mine remain as a mountain of flesh.🔽May any beings who eat flesh and drink blood eat my flesh and drink my blood.

original: yāvacca me sattvā māṃsaṃ bhakṣayeyū rudhiraṃ ca pibeyustāvan me praṇidhānavaśena śarīraṃ vardhatu /
analyzed: yāvat ca me sattvāḥ māṃsam bhakṣayeyuḥ rudhiram ca pibeyuḥ tāvat me praṇidhāna vaśena śarīram vardhatu
translated: For as long as beings eat my flesh and drink my blood, for that long may my body increase by the power of my vow.

original: anupūrveṇa yāvadyojanaśatasahasramuccatvena kāyaḥ saṃvardhatu pañcayojanasahasraṃ vistāreṇa /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa yāvat yojana śata sahasram ucca tvena kāyaḥ saṃvardhatu pañca yojana sahasram vistāreṇa
translated: In due course, may my body increase in height to a hundred thousand leagues, and in breadth to five thousand leagues.

original: tatra mayā varṣasahasraṃ svamānsarudhireṇa sattvāḥ saṃtarpitā /
analyzed: tatra mayā varṣa sahasram svamān sa rudhireṇa sattvāḥ saṃtarpitā
translated: There I satisfied beings for a thousand years with my own flesh and blood.

original: yāvabhyaśca mayā jihvāḥ parityaktā yā mṛgapakṣibhiḥ paribhaktāḥ praṇidhānavaśena cānyonyāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ teṣāṃ ayaṃ gṛdhrakūṭaparvatapramāṇo rāśiḥ syānnityaṃ cānuttarāprabhūtājihvatālakṣaṇapratilābhāya me praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yāvabhyaḥ ca mayā jihvāḥ parityaktāḥ yāḥ mṛga pakṣibhiḥ paribhaktāḥ praṇidhāna vaśena ca anyonyāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ teṣām ayam gṛdhrakūṭa parvata pramāṇaḥ rāśiḥ syāt nityam ca anuttara aprabhūta ajihva tā lakṣaṇa pratilābhāya me praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And as many tongues as I gave up, which were eaten by animals and birds, through the power of my vow, others appeared. The heap of them would be the size of Vulture Peak Mountain. I always made the vow to attain the mark of the unsurpassed many tongues.

original: tatrāhaṃ cyutvā rūḍhavaḍe jambūdvīpe pūrvapraṇidhānena nāgeṣūpapanno nidhisaṃdarśano nāma nāgarājā babhūva /
analyzed: tatra aham cyutvā rūḍhavaḍe jambūdvīpe pūrva praṇidhānena nāgeṣu upapannaḥ nidhisaṃdarśanaḥ nāma nāga rājā babhūva
translated: Having passed away from there, through a previous vow I was reborn among the nāgas in the Jambūdvīpa called Rūḍhavāḍa, and became the nāga king named Nidhisandarśana.

original: yāmeva rātriṃ nāgeṣūpapannastāmeva rātriṃ nidhikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi nidhānānāṃ saṃdarśitāni svayameva ghoṣaṃ cārayāmi /
analyzed: yām eva rātrim nāgeṣu upapannaḥ tām eva rātrim nidhi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi nidhānānām saṃdarśitāni svayam eva ghoṣam cārayāmi
translated: On the very night I was reborn among the nāgas, on that very night I revealed a hundred thousand koṭi niyutas of treasures, and I myself proclaimed:

original: bhoḥ sattvā asmin pradeśe nidhiḥ prādurbhūtaḥ /
analyzed: bhoḥ sattvāḥ asmin pradeśe nidhiḥ prādurbhūtaḥ
translated: Hey beings! In this place a treasure has appeared!

analyzed: nānā ratna paripūrṇaḥ tat yathā hiraṇya suvarṇaḥ yāvat daka prasādakam
translated: Filled with various jewels, such as gold and silver, up to water and mirrors.

analyzed: yūyam gṛhṇadhvam
translated: You should take it!

original: gṛhītvā bhoḥ sattvā daśakuśalān karmapathān samādāya vartadhvaṃ /
analyzed: gṛhītvā bhoḥ sattvāḥ daśa kuśalān karma pathān samādāya vartadhvam
translated: Take up, O beings, the ten wholesome courses of action and abide by them.

analyzed: anuttarāyām ca samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayata
translated: Generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: śrāvaka yānena vā pratyekabuddha yānena vā cittam utpādayatha
translated: Generate the mind of the Śrāvaka Vehicle or the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

analyzed: gacchatha gṛhṇatha ratnāni yāvadartham
translated: Go and take as many jewels as you need.

original: tatra ca rūḍhavaḍe jambūdvīpe saptanāgajanmaparivartena saptasaptavarṣakoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣvaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā nidhayo nirdarśitāśca pradattāśca
analyzed: tatra ca rūḍhavaḍe jambūdvīpe sapta nāga janma parivartena sapta sapta varṣa koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ nidhayaḥ nirdarśitāḥ ca pradattāḥ ca
translated: There, in the Jambudvīpa called Rūḍhavāḍa, for seven hundred thousand times ten million billion years, immeasurable and incalculable treasures were revealed and given away, through seven rebirths as a nāga.

analyzed: evam ca tatra aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ tribhiḥ yānaiḥ niveśitā
translated: In that way, immeasurable and incalculable beings were established in the three vehicles there.

analyzed: daśasu kuśaleṣu karma pathesu niveśitā
translated: They were established in the ten wholesome courses of action.

analyzed: nānāvidhaiḥ ca ratnaiḥ saṃtarpitā
translated: They were satisfied with various kinds of jewels.

analyzed: anuttara dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇa pratilābhāya praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: They made aspirations to attain the unsurpassed thirty-two marks.

original: evaṃ dvitīye dvīpe saptabhirnāgajanmaparivartairevaṃrūpaṃ puruṣakāraṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: evam dvitīye dvīpe saptabhiḥ nāga janma parivartaiḥ evaṃrūpam puruṣakāram kṛtavān
translated: In the same way, on the second continent, through seven rebirths as a nāga, he performed such deeds.

original: evaṃ tritīye yāvatsarvatra vijitadoṣāyāṃ lokadhātau sarveṣu dvīpeṣu evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: evam tritīye yāvat sarvatra vijita doṣāyām lokadhātau sarveṣu dvīpeṣu evaṃrūpaḥ puruṣakāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: In the same way, in the third [world system], up to everywhere in the world system of Patient Endurance, in all the continents, this kind of manly effort was made.

original: evameva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsamesu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu /
analyzed: evam eva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā samesu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in the empty world systems with five impurities, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: ekaikasmin dvīpe evaṃrūpāḥ saptanāgajanmaparivarteṣu mayā yāvat saptasaptavarṣakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairevamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyā nidhayaḥ sattvānāṃ
analyzed: ekaikasmin dvīpe evaṃrūpāḥ sapta nāga janma parivarteṣu mayā yāvat sapta sapta varṣa koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ nidhayaḥ sattvānām
translated: in each continent, in seven rebirths as a nāga, up to seven hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of years, in this way, immeasurable and countless treasures were given to beings,

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: up to as previously stated.

analyzed: paśya kula putra tathāgatasya bodhi cārikām
translated: Son of noble family, behold the practice of enlightenment of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: yathā tathāgataḥ tīvreṇa bala vīryeṇa dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇa paryeṣaṇa bodhi caryām cīrṇavān
translated: As the Tathāgata, with intense strength and vigor, practiced the conduct of enlightenment seeking the thirty-two marks,

original: yathātra pūrve na ye bodhisattvā evaṃrūpāṃ tīvrabalavīryeṇa bodhicārikāṃ cīrṇavantaḥ /
analyzed: yathā atra pūrve na ye bodhisattvāḥ evaṃrūpām tīvra bala vīryeṇa bodhi cārikām cīrṇavantaḥ
translated: as in the past no bodhisattvas practiced the conduct of enlightenment with such intense strength and vigor,

analyzed: na kaścid etarhi
translated: and none are doing so now,

original: na ca punaḥ kaścit paścādbhaviṣyati bodhisattvo ya evaṃ tīvreṇodyogabalavegenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cārikāṃ caret /
analyzed: na ca punar kaścid paścāt bhaviṣyati bodhisattvaḥ yaḥ evam tīvreṇa udyoga bala vegena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cārikām caret
translated: and none will do so in the future with such intense exertion and strength in striving for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā tān aṣṭau yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Except for those eight, as previously mentioned.

original: tadā cāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ kalpānāmatyayena pratyavarakālasamayenedaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pravāḍodupānirnāma babhūva /
analyzed: tadā ca asaṃkhyeyānām kalpānām atyayena pratyavara kāla samayena idam buddhakṣetram pravāḍodupāniḥ nāma babhūva
translated: Then, after an incalculably long time, in the final age, this Buddha-field became known as Pravāḍodupāni.

original: śūnye pañcakaṣāye utpale mahākalpe vartamāne'syāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāmahaṃ śakro'bhūvan savirocano nāma /
analyzed: śūnye pañca kaṣāye utpale mahā kalpe vartamāne syām cāturdvīpikāyām aham śakraḥ bhūvan savirocanaḥ nāma
translated: In the empty five-defiled world, during the great eon called Utpalā, I became Śakra in this four-continent world, named Savirocana.

analyzed: apaśyam aham asmin jambūdvīpe sattvānām akuśala paryeṣṭi caryām
translated: I saw that in this Jambūdvīpa, beings were engaged in the pursuit of unwholesome actions.

original: dṛṣṭvā cāhaṃ paramabhīṣaṇakaṃ yakṣarūpamātmānamabhinirmāyāsmiṃ jambūdvīpe'vatīrya manuṣyāṇāṃ purataḥ pratyasthāṃ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca aham param abhīṣaṇakam yakṣa rūpam ātmānam abhinirmāya asmin jambūdvīpe iva tīrya manuṣyāṇām puratas pratyasthām
translated: And having seen that, I manifested myself in a very frightening form of a yakṣa, and having descended into this Jambūdvīpa, I stood before the humans.

original: te ca māṃ dṛṣṭvā bhītā māṃ pṛcchanti /
analyzed: te ca mām dṛṣṭvā bhītāḥ mām pṛcchanti
translated: And they, having seen me, were frightened and asked me,

analyzed: kena te prayojanam
translated: What do you need?

analyzed: vayam te tat dāsyāmaḥ  mayā uktam
translated: We will give it to you.🔽I said,

analyzed: āhāreṇa me prayojanam te āhuḥ
translated: I need food. They said,

analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ te āhāraḥ
translated: What kind of food?

analyzed: mayā uktam
translated: I said,

analyzed: manuṣyān mārayitvā bhakṣayāmi
translated: I eat by killing humans and consuming them.

original: tāṃścāhaṃ na khādayāmi ye manuṣyā yāvajjīvaṃ prāṇātipātādviratā /
analyzed: tān ca aham na khādayāmi ye manuṣyāḥ yāvajjīvam prāṇātipātāt viratā
translated: And I do not eat those humans who, for as long as they live, abstain from killing,

analyzed: yāvat mithyādṛṣṭyāḥ prativiratā
translated: up to abstaining from wrong view.

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayanti pratyekabuddhayānena vā śrāvakayānena vā cittānyutpādayanti tānapyahaṃ na khādayāmi /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayanti pratyekabuddha yānena vā śrāvaka yānena vā cittāni utpādayanti tān api aham na khādayāmi
translated: They generate the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or they generate the mind for the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle or the Śrāvaka Vehicle. I do not eat them.

original: tatra ca me sattvā nirmitakāḥ paribhūktāyāṃ dṛṣṭvā te sattvā bhayena yāvajjīvaṃ prāṇātipātātprativiratā adattādānādyāvan mithyādṛṣṭeḥ prativiratāḥ
analyzed: tatra ca me sattvāḥ nirmitakāḥ dṛṣṭvā te sattvāḥ bhayena yāvajjīvam prāṇa atipātāt prativiratāḥ adatta ādānāt yāvat mithyādṛṣṭeḥ prativiratāḥ
translated: There, when those beings see the magically created beings being devoured, they, out of fear, abstain from killing living beings for the rest of their lives, and they abstain from taking what is not given, and so on up to abstaining from wrong views.

analyzed: kaiścid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam
translated: Some generate the mind of awakening for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: kaiścid pratyekabuddha yāne kaiścid śrāvaka yāne cittam utpāditam
translated: Some generate the mind for the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and some generate the mind for the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: sarve cāturdvīpikāḥ sattvā daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu triṣu ca yāneṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāstatra mayā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: sarve cāturdvīpikāḥ sattvāḥ daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu triṣu ca yāneṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ tatra mayā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And all the beings in the four continents are established in the ten wholesome courses of action and in the three vehicles. I made a vow there:

analyzed: yadi me in uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āśā paripūryeta
translated: If my aspiration for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is fulfilled,

analyzed: tat idam me praṇidhāna paripūrṇam bhavet
translated: then may this vow of mine be fulfilled.

original: yathā ca me cāturdvīpikāḥ sattvāḥ kuśale mārge niyojitā /
analyzed: yathā ca me cāturdvīpikāḥ sattvāḥ kuśale mārge niyojitā
translated: And just as I have established the beings in the four continents in the wholesome path,

original: evameva sarvatrāsmiṃ buddhakṣetre sarvacāturdvīpikeṣu sattvāḥ evaṃrūpeṇa bhayena māṃ paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: evam eva sarvatra asmin buddhakṣetre sarva cāturdvīpikeṣu sattvāḥ evaṃrūpeṇa bhayena mām paśyeyuḥ
translated: In the same way, may all beings in this entire buddha field, in all the four continents, see me with such fear.

analyzed: daśasu ca eva kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: I will establish them in the ten wholesome paths of action.

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu niyojayeyam
translated: I will engage them in the three vehicles.

original: evameva samantāddaśasu dikṣu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvāṃ daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva samantāt daśasu dikṣu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sattvām daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in the empty buddha fields with the five degenerations, I will establish beings in the ten wholesome paths of action.

analyzed: triṣu ca yāneṣu niyojayeyam
translated: I will engage them in the three vehicles.

original: evameva me kulaputra āśā praṇidhiśca paripūrṇaḥ sarvatra pravāḍodupānāyāṃ lokadhātau manuṣyā yakṣarūpeṇa vinītāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu /
analyzed: evam eva me kula putraḥ āśā praṇidhiḥ ca paripūrṇaḥ sarvatra pravāḍa udupānāyām lokadhātau manuṣyāḥ yakṣa rūpeṇa vinītāḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu
translated: In this way, O son of noble family, my hope and aspiration have been fulfilled. In the entire world system of Patient Endurance, humans have been disciplined by me in the form of a yaksha in wholesome dharmas.

original: evameva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu śūnyeṣu pañcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yakṣarūpeṇa mayā manuṣyāḥ kuśalamārgacaryāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
analyzed: evam eva daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu śūnyeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yakṣa rūpeṇa mayā manuṣyāḥ kuśala mārga caryāyām pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in buddha fields with the five degenerations equal to the sands of the Ganges river, humans have been established by me in the practice of the path of virtue in the form of a yaksha.

original: yathā ca mayā bahavaḥ sattvā bhayāt kuśalacaryāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca mayā bahavaḥ sattvāḥ bhayāt kuśala caryāyām pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And just as I have established many beings in the practice of virtue out of fear,

original: tena karmāvaśeṣeṇa mamaitarhi bodhivṛkṣamūle vajrāsane niṣaṇṇasya bodhimabhisaṃbodhukāmasya māraḥ pāpīyāṃ mahāsainyenopasaṃkrānto bodhau vyākṣepakaraṇārthaṃ
analyzed: tena karma avaśeṣeṇa mama etarhi bodhivṛkṣa mūle vajrāsane niṣaṇṇasya bodhim abhisaṃbodhu kāmasya māraḥ pāpīyām mahā sainyena upasaṃkrāntaḥ bodhau vyākṣepa karaṇa artham
translated: By that remaining karma, now when I was sitting at the foot of the Bodhi tree on the adamantine seat, desiring to fully awaken to enlightenment, the evil one Māra approached with a great army in order to create obstacles to my enlightenment.

analyzed: ayam me kula putra saṃkṣiptena dāna pāramitā
translated: This, noble sir, is my brief perfection of generosity.

original: bodhicaryāṃ caramāṇasya labdhā cāhaṃ gaṃbhīrāṃ kṣāntiṃ gaṃbhīrāṃ dhāraṇīṃ gaṃbhīrāṃ samādhiṃ pañcalaukikābhijñāḥ pratilabdhāḥ /
analyzed: bodhi caryām caramāṇasya labdhā ca aham gaṃbhīrām kṣāntim gaṃbhīrām dhāraṇīm gaṃbhīrām samādhim pañca laukika abhijñāḥ pratilabdhāḥ
translated: While practicing the conduct of enlightenment, I attained the profound patience, the profound dhāraṇī, the profound samādhi, and the five superknowledges of a worldly being.

analyzed: evaṃrūpam mahā puruṣakāram kṛtavān
translated: I performed such great deeds.

original: evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: In this way, I inspired, introduced, and established immeasurable and incalculable beings in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ pratyekabuddha yāne
translated: In this way, I inspired, introduced, and established immeasurable and incalculable beings in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ śrāvakayāne samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ sattvāḥ śrāvaka yāne samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: In this way, I inspired, introduced, and established immeasurable and incalculable beings in the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā yāvantaḥ mayā bodhisattva caryāyām caramāṇena
translated: Except for as many as I inspired while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ paryupāsitāḥ
translated: I have attended upon as many Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as there are atoms in a Buddha-field.

original: ekaikasya buddhasyāntike sāgarodakabindupramāṇā mayā guṇāḥ parigṛhītāḥ /🔽gaṇanātikrāntānāṃ pratyekabuddhānāṃ mayā pūja kṛtā /
analyzed: ekaikasya buddhasya antike sāgara udaka bindu pramāṇāḥ mayā guṇāḥ parigṛhītāḥ  gaṇanā atikrāntānām pratyekabuddhānām mayā kṛtā
translated: In the presence of each Buddha, I have accepted as many qualities as there are drops in the ocean.🔽I have made offerings to as many Pratyekabuddhas as are beyond counting.

analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntānām tathāgata śrāvakānām pūjā kṛtā
translated: I have made offerings to as many disciples of the Tathagata as are beyond counting.

analyzed: evam mātā pitṝṇām pañca abhijñānām ṛṣīṇām pūjā kṛtā
translated: In the same way, I have made offerings to mothers, fathers, and sages with the five superknowledges.

original: mayā ca kṛpayā pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇena svamāṃsarudhireṇa sattvāḥ saṃtarpitā /
analyzed: mayā ca kṛpayā pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caramāṇena sva māṃsa rudhireṇa sattvāḥ saṃtarpitā
translated: And when I was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva out of compassion, I satisfied beings with my own flesh and blood.

analyzed: idānīm api dharmeṇa saṃtarpitāḥ
translated: Now, I have satisfied them with the Dharma as well.

original: iti śrīkaruṇāpuṇḍarīke mahāyānasūtre dānaparivarto nāma pañcamaḥ // //
analyzed: iti śrī karuṇāpuṇḍarīke mahāyāna sūtre dānaparivartaḥ nāma pañcamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter, named The Chapter on Generosity, in the Mahāyāna Sūtra The White Lotus of Compassion.

original: yathāhaṃ kulaputra buddhacakṣuṣā paśyāmi daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamān buddhān bhagavataḥ parinirvṛtān /
analyzed: yathā aham kula putra buddha cakṣuṣā paśyāmi daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samān buddhān bhagavataḥ parinirvṛtān
translated: Son of noble family, as I see with the eye of a Buddha, in the ten directions, as many Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as there are atoms in a Buddha-field have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: ye mayā prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Those whom I first inspired, established, and made firm in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ye mayā dānapāramitāyāṃ prathamaṃ samādāpitā yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā dāna pāramitāyām prathamam samādāpitāḥ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Those whom I first inspired to the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom, and established, settled, and confirmed in them,

original: evamevaitarhi pūrvasyāṃ diśi aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāste buddhā bhagavantaḥ pravartitadhārmikadharmacakrāḥ tiṣṭhanto yāpayanto dharmaṃ deśayanto'drakṣaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva etarhi pūrvasyām diśi aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pravartita dhārmika dharma cakrāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ yāpayantaḥ dharmam deśayantaḥ udrakṣam
translated: in the same way, now in the eastern direction, I see those immeasurable, countless Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have set in motion the wheel of the Dharma, who abide, who endure, who teach the Dharma,

original: ye mayā prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: those whom I first inspired to generate the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment, and established, settled, and confirmed in it,

analyzed: evam yāvat ṣaṭsu pāramitāṣu vaktavyam
translated: and likewise up to the six perfections, it should be said.

analyzed: evam dikṣu vaktavyam
translated: And likewise in the southern, western, northern, lower, and upper directions, it should be said.

original: paśyāmyahaṃ kulaputra purime digbhāge ito buddhakṣetrādekanavatibuddhakṣetraśatasahasrāṇyatikramya saṃpuṣpite lokadhātau vimalatejaguṇarājo nāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmaṃ ca deśayati /
analyzed: paśyāmi aham kula putra purime digbhāge itas buddhakṣetrāt ekanavati buddhakṣetra śata sahasrāṇi atikramya saṃpuṣpite lokadhātau vimalatejaguṇarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmam ca deśayati
translated: Noble son, I see in the eastern direction, beyond nine hundred thousand buddha-fields from this buddha-field, in the 'Bloomed Flowers' world system, the Tathagata named Vimalatejorajaguna, who abides, sustains, and teaches the Dharma.

original: mayā sa bhagavān pūrvaṃ prathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaḥ samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ /
analyzed: mayā sa bhagavān pūrvam prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditaḥ samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ
translated: By me, that Blessed One was first inspired to generate the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment, was encouraged, established, and confirmed.

original: mayā dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ prathamaṃ samādāpitāḥ / peyālaṃ /
analyzed: mayā dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām prathamam samādāpitāḥ peyālam
translated: By me, they were first encouraged in the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom. The same should be said.

original: purimāyāṃ diśi abhiratye buddhakṣetre akṣobhyo nāma tathāgato /
analyzed: purimāyām diśi abhiratye buddhakṣetre akṣobhyaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the eastern direction, in the Buddha-field of Abhirati, the Tathagata Akshobhya.

analyzed: jambūnade buddhakṣetre sūryagarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Jambunada, the Tathagata named Suryagarbha.

analyzed: ratīśvare buddhakṣetre ratīśvaraghoṣajyotiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Ratishvara, the Tathagata named Ratishvaragho-shujyoti.

original: sūryapratiṣṭhite buddhakṣetre jñānabhāskaro nāma tathāgataḥ /🔽jayavaiśraye buddhakṣetre nāganinardito nāma tathāgataḥ /🔽saṃjīvane buddhakṣetre vajrakīrtirnāma tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: sūryapratiṣṭhite buddhakṣetre jñānabhāskaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  jayavaiśraye buddhakṣetre nāganinarditaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  saṃjīvane buddhakṣetre vajrakīrtiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Suryaprasthita, the Tathagata named Jnanabhaskara.🔽In the Buddha-field of Jayavaishravana, the Tathagata named Naganirdita.🔽In the Buddha-field of Sanjivana, the Tathagata named Vajra-kirti.

analyzed: svaraje buddhakṣetre vyāghraraśmiḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Svaraja, the Tathagata named Vyag-hra-rasmi.

analyzed: aratīye buddhakṣetre sūryagarbhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Arati, the Tathagata named Suryagarbha.

analyzed: vairaprabhe buddhakṣetre kīrtiśvararājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Vaipra-bha, the Tathagata named Kirti-shvara-raja.

analyzed: meruprabhe buddhakṣetre acintyarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Meru-prabha, the Tathagata named Acintya-raja;

analyzed: saṃvare buddhakṣetre jyotiśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Samvara, the Tathagata named Jyotish-prabha;

analyzed: kusumaprabhe buddhakṣetre prabhāketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Kusuma-prabha, the Tathagata named Prabha-ketu;

analyzed: kṣamottare buddhakṣetre meru svara sandarśana meruḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Kshama-uttama, the Tathagata named Meru-svara-sanda-र्शन-मेरु;

analyzed: dharaṇāvatyām buddhakṣetre jñānabimbaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Dharana-vati, the Tathagata named Jñana-bimba;

analyzed: kusumavicitre buddhakṣetre vimalanetraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field Kusuma-vicitra, the Tathagata named Vimalanetra;

original: etāṃ pūrvaṃgamāṃ kṛtvā kulaputra purimāyāṃ diśyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavatastiṣṭhato yāpayato dharmaṃ deśayato buddhacakṣuṣā paśyāmi
analyzed: etām pūrvaṃgamām kṛtvā kula putra purimāyām diśi aprameya asaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ yāpayataḥ dharmam deśayataḥ buddha cakṣuṣā paśyāmi
translated: Having made these foremost, O son of noble family, I see with my Buddha-eye innumerable and countless Buddhas, Blessed Ones, dwelling and maintaining themselves and teaching the Dharma in the eastern direction,
