original: ye'nutpāditabodhicittāḥ pūrve'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitā mayā ca prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ samādāpitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: yena utpādita bodhi cittāḥ pūrven uttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāḥ mayā ca prathamam dāna pāramitāyām yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām samādāpitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: who have not yet generated the mind of enlightenment, but who were previously inspired by me to the highest complete enlightenment, and who were first inspired and established by me in the perfection of giving up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: mayā ca prathamaṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśamupanītā yatra taiḥ sarvaprathamaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabdhaṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: mayā ca prathamam tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśam upanītāḥ yatra taiḥ sarva prathamam vyākaraṇam pratilabdham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And I first brought them to the presence of the Blessed Buddhas, who were abiding and living there, and by whom they first received the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha tasyāṃ velāyāṃ saṃpuṣpitāyāṃ lokadhātau tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasyāsanaṃ prakaṃpitaṃ /
analyzed: atha tasyām velāyām saṃpuṣpitāyām lokadhātau tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasya āsanam prakaṃpitam
translated: Then at that time, in the world system called Adorned with Flowers, the seat of the Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja shook.

original: ye tatra bodhisattvāste tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasyāsanaṃ prakaṃpitaṃ dṛṣṭvā tameva tathāgataṃ pṛṣṭavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye tatra bodhisattvāḥ te tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasya āsanam prakaṃpitam dṛṣṭvā tam eva tathāgatam pṛṣṭavantaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattvas there, seeing the seat of that Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja shaking, asked that very Tathagata:

original: ko bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadi idamadṛṣṭapūrvaṃ bhagavata āsanaṃ prakaṃpitam /iti /
analyzed: kaḥ bhadanta bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yadi idam adṛṣṭa pūrvam bhagavataḥ āsanam prakaṃpitam iti
translated: What is the cause, Bhadanta Bhagavat, what is the reason that this previously unseen seat of the Blessed One is shaking?

original: sa tathāgatastānavocat asti kulaputrāḥ paścime digbhāge ito buddhakṣetrādekonanavatibuddhakṣetrānatikramya tatra sahā nāma lokadhātustatra śākyamunirnāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: sa tathāgataḥ tān avocat asti kula putrāḥ paścime digbhāge itas buddhakṣetrāt ekonanavati buddhakṣetrān atikramya tatra sahā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: That Tathagata said to them: Sons of good family, in the western direction, beyond ninety-nine Buddha-fields from here, there is a world system called Saha, where a Tathagata named Shakyamuni resides, remains, and lives.

original: sa etarhi caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ pūrvayogamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: saḥ etarhi caturṇām parṣadām pūrva yogam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: He is now teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies, beginning with his past connections.

original: tena tathāgatena pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūtenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādapitāḥ /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena pūrvam bodhisattva bhūtena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādapitāḥ
translated: Those who were inspired by that Tathāgata in the past when he was a bodhisattva to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: yena me prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpannam
translated: by whom my first thought of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment arose,

original: tena tathāgatenāhaṃ prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpito yāvatprajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena aham prathamam dāna pāramitāyām samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: by that Tathāgata I was first inspired, established, and confirmed in the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tena tathāgatena pūrvabodhisattvacaryāṃ caratāhaṃ prathamaṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sakāśamupanīto /
analyzed: tena tathāgatena pūrva bodhisattva caryām caratā aham prathamam tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām buddhānām bhagavatām sakāśam upanītaḥ
translated: By that Tathāgata who previously practiced the conduct of a bodhisattva, I was first brought into the presence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide and live,

original: yatra me prathamaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabdhamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yatra me prathamam vyākaraṇam pratilabdham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: where I first obtained the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sa ca me śākyamunistathāgataḥ kalyāṇamitraḥ sahe lokadhātau tiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: sa ca me śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ kalyāṇa mitraḥ sahe lokadhātau tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: And that good friend, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, abides and lives in the Sahā world system.

original: sa evaṃ caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ imaṃ pūrvayogamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: saḥ evam caturṇām parṣadām imam pūrva yogam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: He is teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies, beginning with this past connection.

analyzed: tena tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena mama asanam kaṃpate
translated: By the empowerment of that Tathāgata, my seat is shaking.

original: ko yuṣmākaṃ kulaputrotsahate madvacanāt sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ gantuṃ śākyamunestathāgatasyārogyakauśalyaṃ paripṛcchanāya / /
analyzed: kaḥ yuṣmākam kula putra utsahate mad vacanāt saham buddhakṣetram gantum śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya ārogya kauśalyam paripṛcchanāya
translated: Who among you, noble sons, is willing to go to the Sahā world on my behalf to inquire about the well-being of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni?

analyzed: tatas te bodhisattvāḥ vimala guṇa teja rājānam tathāgatam āhuḥ
translated: Then those bodhisattvas said to the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja:

original: ya iha bhadanta bhagavan saṃpuṣpite buddhakṣetre ṛddhimantaḥ sarvabodhisattvaguṇapāramitāprāptāste'dya pūrvāhnasamaye mahāntamavabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvānyasmādbuddhakṣetrādvikurvyābhyāgatastenāyaṃ muhūrtaṃ pṛthivīcālaḥ puṣpavṛṣṭiśca /
analyzed: ye iha bhadanta bhagavan saṃpuṣpite buddhakṣetre ṛddhimantaḥ sarva bodhisattva guṇa pāramitā prāptāḥ te idya pūrvāhna samaye mahāntam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā anyasmāt buddhakṣetrāt vikurvya abhyāgataḥ tena ayam muhūrtam pṛthivīcālaḥ puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ ca
translated: Bhagavān, those who have attained the perfections of all bodhisattva qualities and have miraculous powers in this blossoming buddha-field, having seen a great light in the early morning, have come here by manifesting from another buddha-field. This is why there was an earthquake and a rain of flowers for a moment.

analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ āhuḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas said:

original: vayamapi bhadanta bhagavan gamiṣyāmastaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ taṃ śākyamuniṃ vandanāya paryupasanāya taṃ ca sarvajñatākāradhāraṇīmukhapraveśaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: vayam api bhadanta bhagavan gamiṣyāmaḥ tam saham buddhakṣetram tam śākyamunim vandanāya paryupasanāya tam ca sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśam dharmaparyāyam śravaṇāya
translated: Bhagavān, we too will go to that Sahā buddha-field to pay homage to that Śākyamuni and to attend on him, and to hear the Dharma discourse called 'The Entry into the Retention of the Characteristics of Omniscience'.

analyzed: te bahu bodhisattva śata sahasrāḥ svena ṛddhi anubhāvena tatas buddhakṣetrāt saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: And those many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas, by their own miraculous power, set out from that buddha-field.

analyzed: te na avagacchanti kva gantavyam
translated: They do not know where to go.

analyzed: te api āhuḥ
translated: They also said:

original: tāmapi vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan diśaṃ na jānīmo yatra sahā lokadhātuḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: tām api vayam bhadanta bhagavan diśam na jānīmaḥ yatra sahā lokadhātuḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we do not know that direction where the Sahā world system, the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, is located.

original: tataḥ sa vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgato bāhuṃ prasārya pañcabhyo'ṅgulibhyo vividhānyarciṃṣi pramumoca /
analyzed: tatas sa vimala guṇa teja rājaḥ tathāgataḥ bāhum prasārya pañcabhyaḥ aṅgulibhyaḥ vividhāni arciṃṣi pramumoca
translated: Then the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja extended his arm and emitted various flames from his five fingers.

analyzed: tatas tad arciṣaḥ ekona navati buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi avabhāsitavān
translated: Then those flames illuminated ninety-nine thousand Buddha-fields.

analyzed: yāvat ca imam saham buddhakṣetram avabhāsitavān
translated: And they illuminated this Sahā Buddha-field.

original: yataste bodhisattvāḥ paśyanti sarvāvadimaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sphuṭaṃ bodhisattvairgaganatale ca devanāgayakṣāsuraiḥ sphuṭaṃ /
analyzed: yatas te bodhisattvāḥ paśyanti sarvāvat imam saham buddhakṣetram sphuṭam bodhisattvaiḥ gagana tale ca deva nāga yakṣa asuraiḥ sphuṭam
translated: There the Bodhisattvas saw the entire Sahā Buddha-field filled with Bodhisattvas, and the sky filled with gods, Nāgas, Yakṣas, and Asuras.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaste bodhisattvāstaṃ vimalaguṇatejarājānaṃ tathāgatamevamāhuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar te bodhisattvāḥ tam vimala guṇa teja rājānam tathāgatam evam āhuḥ
translated: And having seen that, those Bodhisattvas said to the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja:

original: paśyāmo vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarvāvantaṃ sphuṭaṃ /
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ vayam bhadanta bhagavan saham buddhakṣetram sarvāvantam sphuṭam
translated: Venerable Blessed One, we see the entire Sahā Buddha-field filled.

original: nāsti tatrāvakāśo'ntaśo daṇḍanikṣepaṇamātramapi yanna sphuṭaṃ bodhisattvaiḥ /
analyzed: na asti daṇḍa nikṣepaṇa mātram api yat na sphuṭam bodhisattvaiḥ
translated: There is no opportunity there, not even for the mere placement of a staff, where the bodhisattvas are not clearly present.

original: paśyāmaḥ śākyamunistathāgato'smān nirīkṣate dharmaṃ ca deśayati /
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ asmān nirīkṣate dharmam ca deśayati
translated: We see the Tathagata Shakyamuni looking at us and teaching the Dharma.

original: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgatasteṣāṃ bodhisattvānāmevamāha samantacakṣuḥ kulaputrāḥ śākyamunistathāgato /
analyzed: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ tathāgataḥ teṣām bodhisattvānām evam āha samantacakṣuḥ kula putrāḥ śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: And that Tathagata Vimalagunatejaraja tells those bodhisattvas, 'O sons of noble family, the Tathagata Shakyamuni has all-seeing eyes.

original: ye kecit kulaputrāḥ sahe lokadhātau sattvā bhūmisthitā vā antarīkṣasthitā vā tataścaikaikaḥ sattva evaṃ saṃjānāti /
analyzed: ye kecid kula putrāḥ sahe lokadhātau sattvāḥ bhūmi sthitāḥ vā antarīkṣa sthitāḥ vā tatas ca ekaikaḥ sattvaḥ evam saṃjānāti
translated: O sons of noble family, whatever beings there are in the Saha world system, whether on the ground or in the sky, each and every one of those beings thinks thus:

original: maṃ śākyamunistathāgataḥ sarvacetasā nirīkṣate mamaikamārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: mam śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ sarva cetasā nirīkṣate mama ekam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni looks at me with all his heart and teaches the Dharma with me alone in mind.

original: sarvavarṇaṃśca sa kulaputra śākyamunistathāgato dharmaṃ deśayati ekavarṇasthānaṃ /
analyzed: sarva varṇan ca sa kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati eka varṇa sthānam
translated: And that son of noble family, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, teaches the Dharma with all colors, in a place of one color.

original: ye ca tatra kulaputra sattvā brāhmabhaktāste śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ brahmāṇaṃ samanupaśyanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra kula putra sattvāḥ brāhma bhaktāḥ te śākyamunim tathāgatam brahmāṇam samanupaśyanti
translated: And those beings there, O son of noble family, who are devoted to Brahma, they see the Tathagata Shakyamuni as Brahma.

analyzed: mahābrahma pati vyāhāreṇa dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: They listen to the Dharma with the speech of the great lord of Brahma.🔽Up to those who are devoted to Mara...

analyzed: yāvat ye mārabhaktikā
translated: As long as there are those devoted to Māra,

analyzed: ye sūryabhaktikā
translated: Those who are devoted to the sun,

analyzed: ye candra bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to the moon,

analyzed: ye vaiśravaṇabhaktikā  ye virūḍhaka bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to Vaisravana,🔽those who are devoted to Virudhaka,
those who are devoted to Virupaksha,

analyzed: ye dhṛtarāṣṭra bhaktikā
translated: those who are devoted to Dhritarashtra,

original: ye maheśvarabhaktikāste sattvā maheśvararūpavarṇasaṃsthānavacanavyāhāreṇa śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ paśyanti dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye maheśvara bhaktikāḥ te sattvāḥ maheśvara rūpa varṇa saṃsthāna vacana vyāhāreṇa śākyamunim tathāgatam paśyanti dharmam ca śṛṇvanti
translated: those beings who see the Tathagata Shakyamuni and hear the Dharma in the form, color, appearance, speech and expression of Mahesvara,

original: yāvaccaturaśītistatra sattvānāṃ varṇasaṃsthānabhaktirūpavyāhārasahasrāṇi te tathā caiva śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ paśyanti dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvanti
analyzed: yāvat caturaśītiḥ tatra sattvānām varṇa saṃsthāna bhakti rūpa vyāhāra sahasrāṇi te tathā ca eva śākyamunim tathāgatam paśyanti dharmam ca śṛṇvanti
translated: up to the eighty-four thousand different forms, colors, appearances, and expressions of beings there, they see the Tathagata Shakyamuni in the same way and hear the Dharma.

original: tasyāṃ ca parṣadi rahagarjito nāma bodhisattvo dvitīyaśca jyotiraśmirnāma bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām ca parṣadi rahagarjitaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ dvitīyaḥ ca jyotiraśmiḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: And in that assembly there were two bodhisattvas named Rahu-garjita and Jyoti-rasmi.

analyzed: atha vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ tathāgataḥ tān bodhisattvān āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the Tathagata Vimalaguṇatejarāja addressed those bodhisattvas:

original: gacchatha yūyaṃ kulaputrāḥ sahe lokadhātau śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ madvacanādārogyakauśalyaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ paripṛcchatha /
analyzed: gacchatha yūyam kula putrāḥ sahe lokadhātau śākyamunim tathāgatam mad vacanāt ārogya kauśalyam sukha sparśa vihāra tām paripṛcchatha
translated: Go, noble sons, to the Sahā world system and inquire about the well-being, health, ease, and comfort of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni on my behalf.

analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ āhuḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas said:

original: sarvāvantaṃ bhadanta bhagavan sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sakṣitigaganaṃ bodhisattvaiḥ sphuṭaṃ samanupaśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: sarvāvantam bhadanta bhagavan saham buddhakṣetram sa kṣiti gaganam bodhisattvaiḥ sphuṭam samanupaśyāmaḥ
translated: Reverend Blessed One, we see the entire Sahā buddha field, with its earth and space, filled with bodhisattvas.

original: na cātraikasattvasyāpyavakāśo'sti kṣitau gagane vā yatra vayaṃ pratitiṣṭhemaḥ /
analyzed: na ca atra eka sattvasya api avakāśaḥ usti kṣitau gagane vā yatra vayam pratitiṣṭhemaḥ
translated: And there is not even space for a single being on the earth or in the sky where we could stand.

original: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgata āha mā kulaputrā evaṃ vadatha /
analyzed: sa ca vimala guṇa teja rājaḥ tathāgataḥ āha mā kula putrāḥ evam vadatha
translated: And that Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejorāja said, Do not speak thus, O sons of good family.

analyzed: na asti sahe buddhakṣetra ivakāśaḥ
translated: There is space in the Sahā buddha field.

analyzed: vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgata ucintyaiḥ buddha guṇaiḥ
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni has vast space, with inconceivable buddha qualities.

analyzed: pūrva praṇidhānena vistīrṇā tathāgatasya kṛpā śāsana avatāra praveśā
translated: The Tathāgata's compassion, teaching, and entry are vast due to his previous vows.

analyzed: triśaraṇa gamanam
translated: The threefold refuge.

analyzed: triyāna dharma deśanām ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: He teaches the Dharma beginning with the threefold teaching of the Dharma of the three vehicles.

analyzed: trividham ca śikṣā saṃvaram deśayati
translated: He teaches the threefold restraint of training.

analyzed: trīṇi ca vimokṣa dvārāṇi upadarśayati
translated: He shows the three doors of liberation.

analyzed: tribhyaḥ upāyebhyaḥ sattvān uddharati
translated: He delivers beings from the three lower realms.

analyzed: tisṛṣu ca śiveṣu patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: He establishes them in the three auspicious paths.

original: ekasmiṃ samaye kulaputra śākyamunistathāgato'cirābhisaṃbuddho vaineyasattvāvekṣayā madhye śailaparvate indrākṣasya yakṣasya bhavane sālaguhāyāṃ
analyzed: ekasmin samaye kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgata ucira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ vaineya sattva avekṣayā madhye śaila parvate indrākṣasya yakṣasya bhavane sālaguhāyām
translated: At one time, O son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, not long after his enlightenment, out of consideration for the beings to be trained, in the middle of the Śailapर्वata, in the abode of the Yakṣa Indrākṣa, in the Sāla cave,

analyzed: sapta aham eka paryaṅkena atināmayati
translated: At one time, O son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, not long after his enlightenment, in order to see the beings to be trained, spent seven days in the Śāla cave, the abode of the yakṣa Indrākṣa, in the middle of the Śailapर्वata mountain, in a single cross-legged posture.

analyzed: vimukti prīti sukham pratisaṃvedayati
translated: He experienced the bliss of joy in liberation.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā tathāgatakāyena sphuṭā /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā tathāgata kāyena sphuṭā
translated: The entire Śāla cave was filled with the Tathāgata's body.

analyzed: na asti tatra avakāśaḥ untaśas catur aṅgula pramāṇam yat tathāgata kāyena na sphuṭam
translated: There was not even space for the tip of a needle that was not filled with the Tathāgata's body.

original: tasya ca saptāhasyātyayena daśabhir diśābhirdvādaśanayutā bodhisattvānāṃ tatra sahe lokadhātau yastasya parvatasyābhimukhaṃ sthitvā śākyamunestathāgatasya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tasya ca saptāhasya atyayena daśabhiḥ diśābhiḥ dvādaśa nayutāḥ bodhisattvānām tatra sahe lokadhātau yaḥ tasya parvatasya abhimukham sthitvā śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And when those seven days had passed, from the ten directions, twelve nayutas of bodhisattvas came to that Sahā world system, facing that mountain, in order to pay homage to and attend on the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, in order to hear the Dharma.

original: sa ca kulaputra śākyamunistathāgatastatra parśadi ridhyabhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskṛtavān /
analyzed: sa ca kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tatra parśadi ridhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
translated: And that Tathāgata Śākyamuni, O son of noble family, performed a miracle in that assembly.

original: sā ca sālaguhā evaṃ vistīrṇā caivaṃ vipulā ca prādurbhūtā /
analyzed: sā ca sālaguhā evam vistīrṇā ca evam vipulā ca prādurbhūtā
translated: And that Śāla cave appeared to be so vast and so large.

original: yadā te dvādaśanayutā bodhisattvānāṃ tatra sālaguhāyāṃ praviṣṭā vistīrṇāvakāśaṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: yadā te dvādaśa nayutāḥ bodhisattvānām tatra sāla guhāyām praviṣṭāḥ vistīrṇa avakāśam paśyanti sma
translated: When those twelve nayutas of bodhisattvas entered the Sāla Cave, they saw that it had become spacious.

original: ekaikaśca bodhisattvastatra tathāgatasya vividhabodhisattvavikurvaṇena pūjāṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ tatra tathāgatasya vividha bodhisattva vikurvaṇena pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Each bodhisattva there made offerings to the Tathāgata with various bodhisattva transformations.

original: ekaiko bodhisattvastatra saptaratnamayāsanaṃ nirmitavān yatropaviṣṭā dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti sma /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tatra sapta ratna maya āsanam nirmitavān yatra upaviṣṭāḥ dharmam śṛṇvanti sma
translated: Each bodhisattva created a seat made of the seven precious substances, where they sat and listened to the Dharma.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ kula putra sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni is like that, vast and spacious.

original: te ca bodhisattvāstasya śākyamunestathāgatasya sakāśāddharmaṃ śrutvā śākyamunestathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā triṣkṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ tasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya sakāśāt dharmam śrutvā śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya pādau śirasā vanditvā triṣkṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas, having heard the Dharma from the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, bowed their heads at the feet of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, circumambulated him three times, and departed for their own buddha-fields.

original: aciraprakāntānāṃ ca teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ sālaguhā yathā paurvāṇāṃ saṃsthitā /
analyzed: acira prakāntānām ca teṣām bodhisattvānām sālaguhā yathā paurvāṇām saṃsthitā
translated: Soon after they left, the Sāla Cave returned to its former state.

analyzed: tatra caturdvīpikāyām kauśikaḥ nāma śakraḥ āyuḥ parīkṣīṇaḥ tiryagyoni upapatti bhaya bhītaḥ
translated: There, in the four continents, there was a Śakra named Kauśika, whose lifespan was exhausted and who was afraid of being reborn in the animal realm.

original: sa caturaśītibhistrayastriṃśaddevasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ yena sālaguhā yena ca bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: sa caturaśītibhiḥ trayastriṃśat deva sahasraiḥ sārdham yena sālaguhā yena ca bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati
translated: He, together with 84,000 gods from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, approached the Sāla Cave where the Blessed One was.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya sāmantake indrākṣasya sālaguhā bhavane sthitaḥ
translated: Having approached, he stood in the vicinity of the Sāla Cave abode of Indra's Eye.

analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ anubhāvena etat abhavat
translated: By the power of the Blessed One, this thought occurred to him:

analyzed: yat nūnam vayam pañcaśikham gandharva putram adhyeṣemaḥ
translated: Let us now request Pañcaśikha, the Gandharva son,

original: sa ca pañcaśikho madhureṇa svareṇa bhagavantamabhimukhaṃ staviṣyati /
analyzed: sa ca pañcaśikhaḥ madhureṇa svareṇa bhagavantam abhimukham staviṣyati
translated: and he, Pañcaśikha, with a sweet voice, will praise the Blessed One face to face.

analyzed: tadā bhagavān dhyāna samādhibhyaḥ vyutthāsyati
translated: Then the Blessed One will emerge from his meditative absorption.

analyzed: tatas śakraḥ pañcaśikham gandharva putram adhīṣṭhavān
translated: Then Śakra requested Pañcaśikha, the Gandharva son.

original: atha pañcaśikho vīṇāṃ manojñena gītavāditena bhagavato'nubhāvena pañcabhiḥ stavaśatairbhagavato varṇamabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha pañcaśikhaḥ vīṇām manojñena gīta vāditena bhagavataḥ unubhāvena pañcabhiḥ stava śataiḥ bhagavataḥ varṇam abhāṣata
translated: Then Pañcaśikha, with his sweet-sounding lute and melodious singing, praised the Blessed One with five hundred hymns by the power of the Blessed One.

original: yadā ca kulaputra pañcaśikha ārabdho bhagavato'bhistavanāya tataḥ sa śākyamunirbhagavān sughoṣavairocanaketuṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpannastena samādhinā ye sahe lokadhātau maharddhikayakṣarākṣasā vāsurā vā garuḍā vā kinnarā vā mahoragā vā gandharvā vā sarve kāmāvacarā devā sarve rūpāvacarā devaputrāstatra sannipātā babhūvurye ca svarabhaktikāste svaraṃ śrutvā prasīdanti /
analyzed: yadā ca kula putra pañcaśikhaḥ ārabdhaḥ tatas sa śākyamuniḥ bhagavān sughoṣa vairocana ketum nāma samādhim samāpannaḥ tena samādhinā ye sahe lokadhātau maharddhika yakṣa rākṣasāḥ vā asurāḥ vā garuḍāḥ vā kinnarāḥ vā mahoragāḥ vā gandharvāḥ vā sarve kāmāvacarāḥ sarve rūpāvacarāḥ deva putrāḥ tatra sannipātāḥ babhūvuḥ ye ca svarabhaktikāḥ te svaram śrutvā prasīdanti
translated: And when, son of good family, Pañcaśikha began to praise the Blessed One, then that Blessed One Śākyamuni entered the samādhi called The Banner of the Sound of the Dharma. By that samādhi, all the powerful yakṣas, rākṣasas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and gandharvas of the Sahā world system, all the gods of the desire realm, and all the sons of gods of the form realm gathered there. Those who were devoted to sound, upon hearing the sound, were pleased.

original: ye varṇayaśobhaktikāste bhagavato varṇaṃ śrutvā tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśe tīvrapremaprasādagurugauravacitrīkārajātāḥ prasīdanti /
analyzed: ye varṇa yaśaḥ bhaktikāḥ te bhagavataḥ varṇam śrutvā tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśe tīvra prema prasāda guru gaurava citrīkāra jātāḥ prasīdanti
translated: Those who were devoted to the praise and fame of the Blessed One, upon hearing the praise of the Blessed One, generated intense love, faith, reverence, and respect towards that Blessed One and were pleased.

original: ye veṇuvādyabhaktikāste veṇuvādyaṃ śrutvā prasīdanti /🔽tataḥ śākyamunirbhagavāṃstataḥ samādhervyutthāya sālaguhāyā dvāraṃ darśāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: ye veṇu vādya bhaktikāḥ te veṇu vādyam śrutvā prasīdanti  tatas śākyamuniḥ bhagavān tatas samādheḥ vyutthāya sālaguhāyāḥ dvāram darśāpayāmāsa
translated: Those who were devoted to the sound of the flute, upon hearing the sound of the flute, were pleased.🔽Then the Blessed Śākyamuni, having arisen from that samādhi, showed the door of the Sāla cave.

analyzed: śakraḥ ca upasaṃkrāntaḥ bhagavantam pṛṣṭavān
translated: And Śakra approached and asked the Blessed One:

analyzed: bhagavam kutra upaviśāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, where should we sit?

original: sa śākyamunistathāgata uvāca niṣīdadhvaṃ yakṣā yāvattasthuḥ samāgatāḥ /
analyzed: sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ uvāca niṣīdadhvam yakṣāḥ yāvat tasthuḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni said, Yakshas, sit down. Those who have gathered, remain standing.

original: tataḥ sālaguhā evaṃ vistīrṇā saṃsthitā yathā dvādaśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamā yakṣāstatra guhāyāṃ praviṣṭā /
analyzed: tatas sāla guhā evam vistīrṇā saṃsthitā yathā dvādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ yakṣāḥ tatra guhāyām praviṣṭā
translated: Then the cave of the sala tree became so vast that it could accommodate the yakshas equal to the sands of twelve Ganges rivers who entered the cave.

original: niṣaṇṇāyāśca tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ sa śākyamunistathāgatastathārūpāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavāṃ /
analyzed: niṣaṇṇāyāḥ ca tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tathārūpām dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: And when the assembly was seated, the Tathagata Shakyamuni gave a Dharma discourse of such a kind

original: yathā ye tasmin parṣadi śrāvakayānikā niṣaṇṇāste śrāvakayānakathāṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: yathā ye tasmin parṣadi śrāvaka yānikāḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ te śrāvaka yāna kathām śṛṇvanti
translated: that those in the assembly who were followers of the Shravakayana heard a discourse on the Shravakayana.

analyzed: nava navati koṭyaḥ tatra śrotāpatti phalam prāptāḥ
translated: There, nine hundred and ninety million attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ye ca tatra parṣadi anuttarasamyaksaṃbuddhayānikāste śuddhāṃ mahāyānakathāṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra parṣadi anuttara samyaksaṃbuddha yānikāḥ te śuddhām mahāyāna kathām śṛṇvanti
translated: And those in the assembly who were followers of the unsurpassed, perfect Buddha heard a discourse on the pure Mahayana.

original: tatra ca pañcaśikhagandharvapūrvaṃgamā aṣṭādaśanayutā avaivartikāḥ saṃsthitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatra ca pañcaśikha gandharva pūrvaṃgamāḥ aṣṭādaśa nayutāḥ a vaivartikāḥ saṃsthitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And there, with the gandharva Panchashikha at their head, one hundred and eight nayutas became irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽And those who had not previously generated the mind in the three vehicles

analyzed: yaiḥ ca tatra an utpāditam triṣu yāneṣu cittam
translated: And those who have not generated the mind in the three vehicles,

original: tatra kaścidanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaṃ /🔽keścittatra pratyekabuddhayāne cittamutpāditaṃ /
analyzed: tatra kaścid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam  keścid tatra pratyekabuddha yāne cittam utpāditam
translated: Some generated the mind of awakening to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.🔽Some generated the mind of awakening to the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: kaścid śrāvaka yāne cittam utpāditam
translated: Some generated the mind of awakening to the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: sa ca tatra kauśikaḥ śakro bhayātparimukto /
analyzed: sa ca tatra kauśikaḥ śakraḥ bhayāt parimuktaḥ
translated: And that Kauśika Śakra was freed from fear.

analyzed: varṣa sahasram ca āyuḥ vivṛddham
translated: His lifespan increased for a thousand years.

analyzed: a vaivartikaḥ ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau babhūva
translated: And he became irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

analyzed: tat evam vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ kula putra sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus, noble son, that Tathāgata Śākyamuni has a vast opportunity.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇam ca asya tathāgatasya svara maṇḍalam
translated: And the sphere of sound of that Tathāgata is vast.

original: na śakyaṃ kenacittasya tathāgatasya svaramaṇḍalasya paryantamudgṛhītuṃ vā gaṇāyituṃ vā /
analyzed: na śakyam kenacid tasya tathāgatasya svara maṇḍalasya paryantam udgṛhītum vā gaṇāyitum vā
translated: No one is able to grasp or count the limit of the sphere of sound of that Tathāgata.

analyzed: vistīrṇam tasya tathāgatasya upāya kauśalyam sattva paripākaḥ ca
translated: The skillful means and ripening of beings of that Tathāgata are vast.

analyzed: na śakyam tasya tathāgatasya upāya kauśalyam paryantam udgṛhītum
translated: It is not possible to grasp the limit of the skillful means of that Tathāgata.

analyzed: vistīrṇa kāyaḥ ca kula putra tathāgataḥ
translated: Noble son, the body of that Tathāgata is vast.

analyzed: na śākyam kenacid tasya mūrdhānam avalokayitum
translated: No one is able to see the crown of his head.

analyzed: kāyasya vā paryantam adhigantum
translated: or to reach the end of the body.

original: yāvantaśca sattvā etarhi tatra sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitā yadi te sattvāḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya kukṣau praviśeyuste sarve tatra vicareyuste ca sattvāstasya tathāgatasyaikaromamukhe praviśeyuḥ niṣkrameyuśca /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca sattvāḥ etarhi tatra sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitāḥ yadi te sattvāḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya kukṣau praviśeyuḥ te sarve tatra vicareyuḥ te ca sattvāḥ tasya tathāgatasya eka roma mukhe praviśeyuḥ niṣkrameyuḥ ca
translated: And all the beings who have now assembled in that Sahā Buddha-field, if those beings were to enter the womb of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, they would all move about there, and those beings would enter and emerge from a single pore of that Tathāgata.

original: te ekaromamukhāttasya tathāgatasya na śaktāḥ paryantamudgṛhītuṃ ūnatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vāntaśo divyenāpi cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: te eka roma mukhāt tasya tathāgatasya na śaktāḥ paryantam udgṛhītum ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā antaśas divyena api cakṣuṣā
translated: They would not be able to grasp the end or the fullness or the lack of fullness of that Tathāgata's body even with a divine eye.

analyzed: tat evam vistīrṇa kāyaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has such an extensive body.

analyzed: punar aparam kula putra vistīrṇa buddhakṣetraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Moreover, O son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has an extensive Buddha-field.

original: yāvantaśca daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālikasamā buddhakṣetrā evaṃ paripūrṇā bhaveyuḥ sattvaistadyathāpi nāmaitarhi sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sarve te sattvā etarhi sahe buddhakṣetre viśeyuḥ sarve te tatra vicareyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālika samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ evam paripūrṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ sattvaiḥ tat yathā api nāma etarhi saham buddhakṣetram sarve te sattvāḥ etarhi sahe buddhakṣetre viśeyuḥ sarve te tatra vicareyuḥ
translated: And all the Buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges in the ten directions, if they were to become completely filled with beings as they are now in the Sahā Buddha-field, all those beings would enter the Sahā Buddha-field now, and they would all move about there.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathaiva tasya tathāgatasya pūrvaṃ prathamacittotpādenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: tathā eva tasya tathāgatasya pūrvam prathama citta utpādena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam babhūva
translated: In the same way, the aspiration of that Tathāgata was made in the past, when he first generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu kula putra ekam gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ
translated: Son of noble family, let alone one world system with as many buddha fields as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: sacetkulaputra yāvaddaśasu dikṣu sahasraṃ gaṅgānadīvālikāsamā buddhakṣetrā evaṃ vistīrṇāḥ tadyathaitarhi sahabuddhakṣetraṃ paripūrṇaṃ sattvaiḥ te sarve etarhi sahe lokadhātau praviśeyuste sarve tatra vicareyurevaṃrūpaṃ tasya tathāgatasya pūrvaṃ prathamacittotpāditānuttarajñānapratilābhāya praṇidhānaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: saced kula putra yāvat daśasu dikṣu sahasram gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ buddhakṣetrāḥ evam vistīrṇāḥ tat yathā etarhi saha buddhakṣetram paripūrṇam sattvaiḥ te sarve etarhi sahe lokadhātau praviśeyuḥ te sarve tatra vicareyuḥ evaṃrūpam tasya tathāgatasya pūrvam prathama citta utpādita anuttara jñāna pratilābhāya praṇidhānam babhūva
translated: If, son of noble family, up to ten directions with a thousand buddha fields as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River were as vast as the present buddha field, and if all those beings were to enter the present Sahā world system, and if all of them were to move about there, then the aspiration of that Tathāgata was made in the past, when he first generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening, in order to attain that knowledge.

analyzed: evam vistīrṇa buddhakṣetraḥ sa kula putra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has a buddha field that is as vast as that.

original: ebhiścaturdharmairviśiṣṭataraḥ sa śākyamunistathāgato yathāvadgṛhṇīta yūyaṃ kulaputrā imāṃ candrarocavimalāṃ puṣpāṃ /
analyzed: ebhiḥ catur dharmaiḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ yathāvat gṛhṇīta yūyam kula putrāḥ imām candra roca vimalām puṣpām
translated: You sons of noble family should accept these flowers of the moon's radiance and purity, which are superior to those four dharmas, just as they are.

original: gacchatha paścimāṃ diśaṃ yathā svayaṃ dṛṣṭvā sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: gacchatha paścimām diśam yathā svayam dṛṣṭvā saham buddhakṣetram
translated: Go to the western direction, as you have seen the Sahā Buddha-field yourself.

original: mama vacanena taṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ ārogyakauśalyaṃ pṛcchata /
analyzed: mama vacanena tam śākyamunim tathāgatam ārogya kauśalyam pṛcchata
translated: In my words, ask the Tathāgata Śākyamuni about his health.

original: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājastathāgataścandrarocavimalāṃ puṣpāṃ gṛhītvā raharājasya bodhisattvasya jyotiraśmeśca bodhisattvasya datvāha gacchata kulaputrau mamarddhibalādhānena sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ /
analyzed: sa ca vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ tathāgataḥ candra roca vimalām puṣpām gṛhītvā raharājasya bodhisattvasya jyotiraśmeḥ ca bodhisattvasya da tvā āha gacchata kula putrau mama ṛddhi bala ādhānena sahām lokadhātum
translated: And the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja, having taken the candra-roca-vimala flowers, gave them to the bodhisattvas Rāhuraja and Jyotirasmi, saying, Go, O sons of noble family, by the power of my supernormal abilities and strength to the Sahā world-system.

analyzed: tatra ca viṃśatiḥ prāṇi sahasrāṇi āhuḥ
translated: And twenty thousand beings said,

original: vayamapi bhadanta bhagavan gacchemaḥ tathāgatānubhāvena sahaṃ lokadhātuṃ tasya śākyamunestathāgatasya darśanāye vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: vayam api bhadanta bhagavan gacchemaḥ tathāgata anubhāvena saham lokadhātum tasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya darśanāye vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: We too, O Blessed One, will go by the power of the Tathāgata to the Sahā world-system to see that Tathāgata Śākyamuni, to pay homage to him and to serve him.

analyzed: vimala guṇa teja rājaḥ tathāgataḥ āha gacchata kula putrāḥ yathā abhiprāyāḥ
translated: The Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja said, Go, O sons of noble family, as you wish.

original: tau ca dvau bodhisattvau raharājaśca jyotiraśmiśca sārdhaṃ viṃśatibhirbodhisattvasahasraistasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasya riddhibalena tataḥ saṃpuṣpitāyā lokadhātoḥ saṃprasthitā ekacittakṣaṇenedaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetramanuprāptā gṛdhrakūṭe parvate pratyasthātaḥ /
analyzed: tau ca dvau bodhisattvau raharājaḥ ca jyotiraśmiḥ ca sārdham viṃśatibhiḥ bodhisattva sahasraiḥ tasya vimalaguṇatejarājasya tathāgatasya riddhi balena tatas saṃpuṣpitāyāḥ lokadhātoḥ saṃprasthitāḥ ekacitta kṣaṇena idam saham buddhakṣetram anuprāptāḥ gṛdhrakūṭe parvate pratyasthātaḥ
translated: And those two bodhisattvas, Rahā and Jyotirāśmi, together with twenty thousand bodhisattvas, by the power of the miraculous abilities of the Tathāgata Vimalaguṇatejarāja, departed from that Puṣpāvatī world realm in an instant and arrived in this Sahā Buddha field, and stood on Vulture Peak Mountain.

analyzed: te yena bhagavām śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena añjalim praṇamya āhuḥ
translated: They bowed to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, with palms joined and said:

original: asti bhagavan purastime digbhāge ekonanavatibuddhakṣetrasahasrāṇyatikramya tatra saṃpuṣpito nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: asti bhagavan purastime digbhāge ekona navati buddhakṣetra sahasrāṇi atikramya tatra saṃpuṣpitaḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: Blessed One, to the east, past ninety-nine thousand buddha-fields, there is a world realm called Puṣpāvatī.

analyzed: tatra vimalaguṇatejarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In it dwells a Tathāgata named Vimalaguṇatejarāja.

original: sa ca punastathāgato bodhisattvagaṇaparivārastathāgatasya guṇavarṇakīrtayamāna evamāha śākyamunirnāma tathāgataḥ sahe buddhakṣetre tiṣṭhati yāpayati /
analyzed: sa ca punar tathāgataḥ bodhisattva gaṇa parivāraḥ tathāgatasya guṇa varṇa kīrtayamānaḥ evam āha śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ sahe buddhakṣetre tiṣṭhati yāpayati
translated: And that Tathāgata, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, while praising the qualities of the Tathāgata, said: 'The Tathāgata named Śākyamuni dwells and remains in the Sahā Buddha-field.'

original: tena ca tathāgatena pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūtena bodhisattvacārikāṃ caramāṇenāhaṃ sarvaprathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitastasya ca vacanena mayānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpāditaṃ tena tathāgatenāhaṃ prathamaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ niveśito /
analyzed: tena ca tathāgatena pūrvam bodhisattva bhūtena bodhisattva cārikām caramāṇena aham sarva prathamam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ tasya ca vacanena mayā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditam tena tathāgatena aham prathamam dāna pāramitāyām niveśitaḥ
translated: And by that Tathāgata, when he was previously a bodhisattva practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, I was first inspired, introduced, and established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. And by his words, I generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. By that Tathāgata, I was first introduced to the perfection of generosity.

analyzed: yāvat pūrva uktam
translated: Up to what was said before.

analyzed: evam ebhiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: In this way, that Śākyamuni Tathāgata is distinguished by these four dharmas.

original: yathā teneme candrarocavimalā puṣpāḥ preṣitā ārogyakauśalyaṃ ca pṛcchati /
analyzed: yathā tena ime puṣpāḥ preṣitāḥ ārogya kauśalyam ca pṛcchati
translated: As by him, these moon-like, beautiful, and pure flowers are sent, and he inquires about your well-being.

analyzed: evam abhiratyā buddhakṣetrāt akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya āsanam kaṃpati
translated: In the same way, in the Abhirati Buddha-field, the seat of the Akṣobhya Tathāgata shakes.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ sannipattitaste cāpi dṛṣṭvākṣobhyasya tathāgatasyāsanaṃ kaṃpitaṃ paripṛcchanti sma /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ sannipattitaḥ te ca api dṛṣṭvā akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya āsanam kaṃpitam paripṛcchanti sma
translated: And the bodhisattvas who have assembled there, having seen the seat of the Akṣobhya Tathāgata shaking, ask about it.

analyzed: peyālam yathā pūrva uktam
translated: The same as what was said before.

analyzed: sarveṣām evam vaktavyam
translated: It should be said for all of them in the same way.

original: tena ca samayenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ purimāyāṃ diśi tathāgatadūtā bodhisattvā imaṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ sahacandrarocavimalaiḥ puṣpaiḥ saṃprāptāḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya paripṛcchanāya pūjanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: tena ca samayena aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ purimāyām diśi tathāgata dūtāḥ bodhisattvāḥ imam saham buddhakṣetram saha candra roca vimalaiḥ puṣpaiḥ saṃprāptāḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya paripṛcchanāya pūjanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: At that time, immeasurable and innumerable messengers of the Tathagatas from the east, bodhisattvas, arrived at this Sahā buddha-field with saṃpūrṇa, candra, rocana, and vimalā flowers to ask questions, make offerings, pay homage, attend, and listen to the Dharma of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

original: samanantaraparivāsito bhagavataḥ purimāyāṃ diśi buddhakṣetranāma parikīrtanaṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ /

original: paśyāmyahaṃ kulaputra dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśīto buddhakṣetrādekagaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni buddhakṣetrāṇyatikramya tatra sarvaśokāpagato nāma lokadhātustatrāśokaśrīrnāma tathāgatastiṣṭhati dhriyati yāpayati /

translated: Noble son, I see in the south, beyond buddha-fields equal to the sands of the Ganges, a world system called Sarvaśokāpagata, where the Tathāgata Aśokashrī resides, is present, and lives.

original: mayā sa bhagavān sarvaprathamaṃ pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacārikāṃ caramāṇenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpito /

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam

analyzed: suvidite buddhakṣetre manojñaghoṣasvaravinarditaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: In the Buddha-field of Suvidita, the Tathāgata named Mano-jña-ghosa-svara-vinardir.

analyzed: peyālam yathā pūrva uktam

original: mayā sa bhagavān pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūtena bodhisattvacaryāṃ caramāṇena sarvaprathamamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpito /

translated: Again, the Blessed One Shakyamuni said, Noble son, I see, beyond ninety-eight koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of Buddha-fields to the northeast of here, the Buddha-field called Vijaya.

analyzed: vigatasaṃtāpaḥ bhavavaiśravaṇasālarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ

translated: At one time, O son of noble family, that Śākyamuni Tathāgata, not long after his enlightenment, out of consideration for beings to be trained, dwelt in the cave of the Sāla tree in the abode of the Yakṣa Indrākṣa in the middle of the uneven Śaila-Indra mountain.

analyzed: sapta aham eka paryaṅkena atināmayati sma
translated: For seven days he passed the time in one cross-legged posture,
experiencing the bliss of joy in liberation.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā sphuṭā tathāgatakāyena /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā sālaguhā sphuṭā tathāgata kāyena
translated: The entire Sāla cave was filled with the Tathāgata's body.

analyzed: na asti tatra avakāśaḥ untaśas catur aṅgula pramāṇam yat na tathāgata kāyena sphuṭam
translated: There was not even a space of four inches there that was not filled with the Tathāgata's body.

original: tasya ca saptāhasyātyayena daśabhyo digbhyaḥ dvādaśanayutā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ sahe lokadhātau saṃprāptāstasya śākyamunestathāgatasya vandanāya /
analyzed: tasya ca saptāhasya atyayena daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ dvādaśa nayutāḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām sahe lokadhātau saṃprāptāḥ tasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya vandanāya
translated: And at the end of those seven days, from the ten directions, twelve nayutas of bodhisattvas, great beings, arrived in the Sahā world system to pay homage to that Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

analyzed: yāvat imaiḥ caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ yathā anye tathāgatā
translated: The Shakyamuni Tathagata is superior to other Tathagatas in these four dharmas.

original: gṛhṇīdhvaṃ yūyaṃ kulaputrā imāṃ candrarocavimalāṃ puṣpāṃ /
analyzed: gṛhṇīdhvam yūyam kula putrāḥ imām candra roca vimalām puṣpām
translated: You, sons of good family, take these moon-shining pure flowers.

analyzed: gṛhītvā gacchata dakṣiṇa paścimām diśam
translated: Having taken them, go to the southwest direction.

original: yathā svayaṃ dṛṣṭvā taṃ sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: yathā svayam dṛṣṭvā tam saham buddhakṣetram
translated: As you have seen the Sahā Buddha-field with your own eyes.

analyzed: mama vacanāt tasya śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya ārogya kauśalyam pṛcchata
translated: In my words, ask the Shakyamuni Tathāgata about his health.

original: sa ca vigatasaṃtāpodbhavavaiśravaṇasālarājastathāgataḥ candrarocavimalān puṣpāṃ gṛhītvā vigopaśikharasya bodhisattvasya dadāti saṃrocanabuddhasya ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya /
analyzed: sa ca vigatasaṃtāpodbhavavaiśravaṇasālarājaḥ tathāgataḥ candra roca vimalān puṣpām gṛhītvā vigopaśikharasya bodhisattvasya dadāti saṃrocana buddhasya ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: And the Tathagata Vighushtanirjitavighustaśikhin, having taken the moon-shining pure flowers, gives them to the Bodhisattva Vigataśoka and the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Saṃrocana.

original: evaṃ cāha gacchata kulaputrau mamarddhibalādhānena sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ /
analyzed: evam ca āha gacchata kula putrau mama ṛddhi bala ādhānena saham buddhakṣetram
translated: He says, 'Go, sons of good family, to the Sahā Buddha-field by the power of my supernormal knowledge and strength.'

analyzed: tatra viṃśati prāṇa sahasrāṇi āhuḥ
translated: Thus twenty thousand beings said:

original: vayamapi bhagavan gamiṣyāmastathāgatasyānubhāvena sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: vayam api bhagavan gamiṣyāmaḥ tathāgatasya anubhāvena saham buddhakṣetram śākyamunim tathāgatam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: We too, Blessed One, will go to the Sahā world realm by the Tathāgata's power to see, venerate, and serve the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

analyzed: tathāgataḥ āha gacchata kula putrāḥ yathā abhiprāyāḥ
translated: The Tathāgata said, Go, sons of noble family, as you wish.

original: tatastau dvau bodhisattvau sārdhaṃ viṃśatibhirbodhisattvasahasraistasya tathāgatasya riddhyanubhāvena tato virajādbuddhakṣetrātsaṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tau dvau bodhisattvau sārdham viṃśatibhiḥ bodhisattva sahasraiḥ tasya tathāgatasya riddhi anubhāvena tatas virajāt buddhakṣetrāt saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Then those two bodhisattvas, together with twenty thousand bodhisattvas, departed from that Vimalā buddha realm by the power of the Tathāgata's supernormal knowledge.

analyzed: eka kṣaṇena iha buddhakṣetre anuprāptāḥ gṛdhrakūṭe parvate pratyasthuḥ
translated: In one instant, they arrived in this buddha realm and stood on Vulture Peak Mountain.

analyzed: ekānta sthitāḥ ca yena śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena añjalim praṇamya āhuḥ
translated: Standing to one side, they bowed to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni with palms joined and said:

analyzed: asti bhadanta bhagavan uttara pūrvāyām diśi
translated: Venerable Blessed One, in the northeast direction,

analyzed: yathā pūrva uktam
translated: as stated before,

analyzed: tena tathāgatena ime candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ preṣitā
translated: the Tathāgata sent these candra-roca-vimala flowers.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca ārogya kauśalyam pṛcchati
translated: He inquires about your health and well-being.

analyzed: evam mārabhavanavidhvaṃsanasya tathāgatasya āsanam kaṃpitam
translated: In the same way, the seat of the Tathāgata who destroys the abode of Māra shook.

original: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ sannipatitāste cāpi dṛṣṭvā taṃ mārabhavanavidhvaṃsanaṃ tathāgatasyāsanaṃ kaṃpitaṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchanti /
analyzed: ye ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ te ca api dṛṣṭvā tam māra bhavana vidhvaṃsanam tathāgatasya āsanam kaṃpitam tathāgatam paripṛcchanti
translated: And those bodhisattvas who had assembled there, seeing the destruction of Mara's abode and the shaking of the Tathagata's seat, asked the Tathagata.

analyzed: yāvat yathā pūrva uktam
translated: Up to as previously stated.

original: evaṃ sālendrarājā vikramaraśmiḥ padmottaraḥ candano merurājaḥ sāgaraḥ sārajyotirjñānavikramastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: evam sāla indra rājā vikramaraśmiḥ padmottaraḥ candanaḥ meru rājaḥ sāgaraḥ sāra jyotiḥ jñāna vikramaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus the Tathagatas Salendraraja, Vikramarasmi, Padmottama, Chandana, Meruraja, Sagara, Sarajyotirjnana, and Vikramatathagata,

original: yāvattena ca samayenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyā uttarapurimāyāṃ diśi tathāgatāste bodhisattvāḥ sahacandrarocavimalapuṣpairiha sahe buddhakṣetre saṃprāptāḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya pṛcchanāya pūjanāya vandanāya dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: yāvat tena ca samayena aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ uttara purimāyām diśi tathāgatāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ saha candra roca vimala puṣpaiḥ iha sahe buddhakṣetre saṃprāptāḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya pṛcchanāya pūjanāya vandanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: at that time, immeasurable and innumerable Tathagatas from the northern direction, together with the bodhisattvas, arrived in this Sahalokadhātu with moon-like and stainless flowers, to ask questions, make offerings, pay homage, and listen to the Dharma of the Tathagata Shakyamuni.

original: tāvadeva śākyamunistathāgata ṛddhyanubhāvena sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ ye sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitāsteṣāṃ ekaikasya sattvasya yojanapramāṇamātramātmabhāvaḥ
analyzed: tāvat eva śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ ṛddhi anubhāvena sarveṣām sattvānām ye sahe buddhakṣetre sannipatitāḥ teṣām ekaikasya sattvasya yojana pramāṇa mātram ātma bhāvaḥ
translated: At that very moment, by the Tathagata Shakyamuni's miraculous power, the bodies of all beings who had assembled in the Sahalokadhātu became one yojana in size,

original: sarvāvantaṃ ca sahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ evaṃrūpaiḥ sattvaiḥ sphuṭaṃ /
analyzed: sarvāvantam ca saham buddhakṣetram evaṃrūpaiḥ sattvaiḥ sphuṭam
translated: and the entire Sahalokadhātu was filled with such beings.

original: na kaścidbuddhakṣetre kṣitau vā gagane vāvakāśo yaḥ sattvairasphuṭo'ntaśo'ñjanaśalākāpradeśamātramapi yaḥ sattvebhyo na sphuṭo'bhūt /
analyzed: na kaścid buddhakṣetre kṣitau vā gagane vā avakāśaḥ yaḥ sattvaiḥ a sphuṭa untaśa ūñjana śalākā pradeśa mātram api yaḥ sattvebhyaḥ na
translated: There was no space in the Buddha-field, on the earth or in the sky, that was not filled with beings, not even a space the size of the point of an awl.

original: sarve ca te sattvāḥ śūnyamākāśaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ śūnyam ākāśam paśyanti
translated: All those beings saw the sky as empty.

analyzed: na ca parasparam paśyanti
translated: But they did not see each other.

analyzed: na ca eṣām parvata sumeru cakravāḍa mahā cakravāḍa parvatāḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: Nor did mountains, Sumeru, Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains appear to their eyes.

original: na lokāntarikā divyā vimānā ūrddhaṃ yāvadadho kāñcanacakraṃ tatorddhaṃ pṛthivī cakṣuṣo nābhāsamāgacchanti /
analyzed: na loka āntarikāḥ divyāḥ vimānāḥ ūrddham yāvat adhas kāñcana cakram tatas ūrddham pṛthivī cakṣuṣaḥ nābhāsam āgacchanti
translated: Nor did the spaces between worlds, the celestial palaces, above up to below the golden wheel, and the earth below appear to their eyes,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā tathāgatam śākyamunim
translated: except for the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

analyzed: te tathāgatam paśyanti
translated: They saw the Tathāgata.

original: tatra ca bhagavān ākāśasphuraṇaṃ dharmāvacchedapraśrabdhisamādhiṃ samāpanno /
analyzed: tatra ca bhagavān ākāśa sphuraṇam dharma avaccheda praśrabdhi samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: And there the Blessed One entered the sky-touching Dharma-cutting-off-of-afflictions-relaxation-concentration.

original: yataste candrarocavimalāḥ puṣpāḥ sarvaromamukhesu bhagavataḥ praviśanti /
analyzed: yatas te candra roca vimalāḥ puṣpāḥ sarva roma mukhesu bhagavataḥ praviśanti
translated: From which those moon-shining-pure flowers entered through all the pores of the Blessed One's body.

original: sarve ca te sattvāḥ paśyanti sahe lokadhātāvantargatā vigatāḥ sarvasattvānāṃ cittacaitasikeṣu manasikārarūpasaṃdarśanatāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ paśyanti sahe lokadhātau antargatāḥ vigatāḥ sarva sattvānām citta caitasikeṣu manasikāra rūpa saṃdarśana tāḥ
translated: And all those beings saw themselves inside the Sahā world realm, free from all thoughts and mental processes, and saw forms in their minds.

original: te caiva bhagavato romamukhe nirīkṣante sma /
analyzed: te ca eva bhagavataḥ roma mukhe nirīkṣante sma
translated: And they looked into the Bhagavān’s mouth.

original: tatra codyānamadrākṣuḥ /🔽nānāratnavṛkṣaṃ nānāpatraṃ nānāpuṣpaṃ nānāphalākīrṇāṃ nānāvastraṃ nānācchatradhvajapatākākeyūramuktikāhārālaṅkṛtāṃstāṃ vṛkṣāṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: tatra ca udyānam adrākṣuḥ  nānā ratna vṛkṣam nānā patram nānā puṣpam nānā phala ākīrṇām nānā vastram nānā chatra dhvaja patākā keyūra muktikā hāra alaṅkṛtān tām vṛkṣām paśyanti
translated: And they saw a pleasure grove there.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sukhāvatyām lokadhātau udyānām
translated: They saw trees with various jewels, various leaves, various flowers, and various fruits, and they saw the trees adorned with various garments, various parasols, various banners, various flags, various armlets, various pearl necklaces, and various ornaments, just like the pleasure groves in the world realm Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām sattvānām etat abhavat
translated: And all those beings thought,

analyzed: gacchāmaḥ vayam etat udyānam darśanāya
translated: “Let us go to see that pleasure grove.”

original: sarve ca te sattvā ye sahe lokadhātāvantargatāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ ye sahe lokadhātau antargatāḥ
translated: And all those beings who were inside the Sahā world realm,

analyzed: sthāpayitvā nairayikām yām alaukikām tairyagyonikām ārūpya avacarām
translated: except for those in the hells, those in the animal realm, those in the world of Yama, and those in the formless realm,

original: sarve pariśiṣṭāḥ sattvāstasya tathāgatasya romamukhebhyastathāgataśarīre praviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: sarve pariśiṣṭāḥ sattvāḥ tasya tathāgatasya roma mukhebhyaḥ tathāgata śarīre praviṣṭāḥ
translated: all the remaining beings entered the tathāgata’s body through the pores of the tathāgata’s skin.

analyzed: atha bhagavān tām ṛddhim pratiprasrambhayitvā vyutthitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew that miracle and arose.

analyzed: tatas te sattvāḥ anyonyam dṛṣṭvā āhuḥ
translated: Then those beings, seeing each other, said:

analyzed: kutra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Where is the Tathagata Shakyamuni?

original: maitreyo bodhisattva āha saṃprajānaṃ tataḥ sattvāḥ samanvāharata sarve vayaṃ tathāgatasya kukṣau sannipatitāḥ /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha saṃprajānam tatas sattvāḥ samanvāharata sarve vayam tathāgatasya kukṣau sannipatitāḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya said: Be aware, all of you! We have all assembled in the womb of the Tathagata.

original: tataste sattvāḥ sāntarabāhiraṃ tathāgatakāyaṃ dṛṣṭvā svayaṃ pratyakṣībhūtā yathā vayaṃ tathāgatasya kukṣāvantargatāḥ sannipatitāśca /
analyzed: tatas te sattvāḥ sa antara bāhiram tathāgata kāyam dṛṣṭvā svayam pratyakṣībhūtāḥ yathā vayam tathāgatasya kukṣau antargatāḥ sannipatitāḥ ca
translated: Then those beings, seeing the Tathagata's body inside and out, became directly visible to themselves, thinking: We have entered and assembled inside the Tathagata's womb.

analyzed: teṣām etat abhavat  kutas vayam tathāgatasya kukṣau praviṣṭāḥ
translated: They thought:🔽From where did we enter the Tathagata's womb?

analyzed: kena asmin praveśitāḥ
translated: By whom were we made to enter here?

original: tato maitreyaḥ sarvāvatī parṣadaṃ svareṇa vijñapayannuvāca śṛṇvantu bhavantastathāgatasyaivamṛddhivikurvaṇaprātihāryaṃ yadasmākaṃ hitakaraḥ śāstā dharmaṃ deśayati tadyuṣmābhiḥ sarvacetasā samanvāhartavyāḥ /
analyzed: tatas maitreyaḥ sarvāvatī parṣadam svareṇa vijñapayan uvāca śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ tathāgatasya evam ṛddhi vikurvaṇa prātihāryam yat asmākam hita karaḥ śāstā dharmam deśayati tat yuṣmābhiḥ sarva cetasā samanvāhartavyāḥ
translated: Then Maitreya, addressing the entire assembly with his voice, said: Listen, venerable sirs! This miracle of the Tathagata's supernatural power and transformation, which is beneficial to us, is the Teacher's teaching of the Dharma. You should pay attention to it with all your mind.

analyzed: tatas sarvāvatī parṣad prāñjalībhūtāḥ
translated: Then the entire assembly put their palms together.

analyzed: bhagavān ca sarva sukha caryā dharmam deśayati sma
translated: And the Blessed One taught the Dharma of all blissful conduct.

analyzed: tatra katarā sarva sukha caryā
translated: What is that all blissful conduct?

analyzed: yat uta saṃsāra paṅkāt uttāraṇam ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga iva tāraṇam sarvajña tā svayaṃbhū jñāna paripūrṇa tā
translated: Namely, deliverance from the mire of saṃsāra, introduction to the noble eightfold path, omniscience, and fulfillment of the self-arisen knowledge.

analyzed: tatra daśa prakārā dhyāna niveśa citta utpāda pariṇāmana tā
translated: There are ten kinds of transformation of the mind that is generated by the establishment of meditation.

analyzed: yat uta sarva sattvebhyaḥ mahā karuṇā citta adhiṣṭhānam
translated: Namely, the basis of the mind of great compassion for all beings.

analyzed: hita vastu saṃjanana tā
translated: The generation of beneficial things.

analyzed: a tīrṇa sattva uttāraṇa tayā mahā nāva samudānana tā
translated: The great ship for the sake of delivering beings who have not crossed over.

analyzed: amukta mocana tā āsanna aham asanta viparyāsa parimocana tayā
translated: The armor of liberating those who are not liberated, for the sake of liberating those who are attached to false views.

analyzed: mahā siṃhanāda anutrāsana sannāha nairātmya dharma pratyavekṣaṇa tayā
translated: The armor of terrifying with the great lion's roar, for the sake of contemplating the selfless dharmas.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu gamana san āha māyā svapna pratibhāsa upama sarva dharma avabudhyana tayā
translated: The armor of going to all world systems, for the sake of understanding all dharmas as being like an illusion, a dream, or a mirage.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātu avabhāsana alaṅkaraṇa sannāhaḥ śīla skandha adhiṣṭhāna pariśuddhyā
translated: The armor of adorning by illuminating all world systems, based on the purity of the aggregate of morality.

analyzed: daśa tathāgata bala pariniṣpādana sannāhaḥ sarva pāramitā paripūryā
translated: The armor of perfecting the ten powers of the Tathāgata, for the sake of fulfilling all the perfections.

analyzed: catur vaiśāradya pratilābha sannāham yathāvādi tathākāri tayā
translated: The armor of attaining the four forms of fearlessness, by acting in accordance with one's words.

analyzed: yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma niravaśeṣa pratilābha sannāham
translated: Up to the armor of attaining all the eighteen unique qualities of a Buddha without exception.

analyzed: bodhisattvānām yathāśruta dharma pratipattiḥ aprapañcana tā ca iyam daśa prakārā niveśa dharma mukha caryā
translated: This tenfold engagement in the Dharma gates of practice, as heard, is the armor of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: alakṣaṇā mukha parijñā gati caryāyā sarva dharma nairātmya manasikāra citta anutpāda anirodha asamayam avaivartika bhūmiḥ yatra saṃvarta vivarta anucchedam aśāśvatam avikṣiptam
translated: The stage of non-retrogression, where one contemplates the selflessness of all phenomena, the non-arising and non-cessation of the mind, and the time of neither annihilation nor permanence without distraction, is the practice of understanding the gate of signlessness.

original: imasya khalu punardharmaparyāyasya bhāṣyamāṇasyāśītikoṭīgaṅgānadīvālikāsamāḥ sattvāstathāgatasya kukṣigatā avaivartikā abhūvannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: imasya khalu punar dharmaparyāyasya bhāṣyamāṇasya aśīti koṭī gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ sattvāḥ tathāgatasya kukṣi gatāḥ a vaivartikāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Moreover, when this Dharma discourse was being taught, as many beings as there are grains of sand in 800 million Ganges Rivers, dwelling in the womb of the Tathagata, became irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: gaṇanātikrāntāśca tatra bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye nānāvidhadhāraṇīkṣāntipratilabdhā abhūn /
analyzed: gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ ca tatra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye nānāvidha dhāraṇī kṣānti pratilabdhāḥ
translated: And the bodhisattva mahasattvas there, beyond number, attained various kinds of dharanis and patience.

analyzed: sarve ca punar tathāgata śarīrāt roma mukhebhyaḥ niṣkrāntāḥ āścarya prāptā
translated: All of them, having emerged from the pores of the Tathagata's body, were filled with wonder.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā
translated: having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One,

analyzed: daśa diśaḥ prakāntāḥ
translated: they departed to the ten directions,

analyzed: svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu gatāḥ tathāgatasya svara maṇḍala kāya pramāṇa jñapana artham
translated: and went to their own buddha-fields in order to proclaim the extent of the Tathagata's voice and body.

original: tatra ye bodhisattvāḥ purimāṃ diśaṃ gacchanti aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye bodhisattvāḥ purimām diśam gacchanti aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ
translated: There, the bodhisattvas who go to the eastern direction in immeasurable and incalculable [numbers],

original: purimāyāṃ diśi yadbuddhakṣetrānatikrāmanti na ca śākyamunestathāgatasya svaramaṇḍalaṃ pratihanyate /
analyzed: purimāyām diśi yat buddhakṣetrān atikrāmanti na ca śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya svara maṇḍalam pratihanyate
translated: pass through buddha-fields in the eastern direction, and the voice of the Tathagata Shakyamuni is not obstructed.

original: evaṃ ca tatra svaraṃ śṛṇvanti vicitrapadārthavyañjanāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca tatra svaram śṛṇvanti vicitra padārtha vyañjanāḥ
translated: And they hear that voice there, with its various meanings and expressions,

analyzed: tat yathā śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya puratas niṣaṇṇaiḥ dharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: just as if they were sitting in front of the Tathagata Shakyamuni and heard the Dharma.

analyzed: evam eva asya dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: In the same way, they hear his Dharma.

original: api ca tatrāpi śākyamunestathāgatasya kāyasyonatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā na prajñāyate /
analyzed: api ca tatra api śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya kāyasya ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā na prajñāyate
translated: Moreover, there also, the decrease or fullness of the body of the Tathagata Shakyamuni is not known.

original: śākyamunestathāgatasya kāyaḥ sphuṭo dṛśyate bodhisattvaiḥ śrāvakaiścāprameyāsaṃkhyeyā bodhisattvāḥ śrāvakāścaikaromamukhe śākyamunestathāgatasya praviśanto niṣkrāmantaśca saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya kāyaḥ sphuṭaḥ dṛśyate bodhisattvaiḥ śrāvakaiḥ ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ śrāvakāḥ ca eka roma mukhe śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya praviśantaḥ niṣkrāmantaḥ ca saṃdṛśyante
translated: The body of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni is seen to be filled with bodhisattvas and śrāvakas. Innumerable and countless bodhisattvas and śrāvakas are seen entering and leaving through a single pore of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

analyzed: evam dvitīye roma mukhe
translated: In the same way, in the second pore,

analyzed: yāvat sarva roma mukhebhyaḥ praviśantaḥ niṣkrāmantaḥ ca saṃdṛśyante
translated: and so on, up to all the pores, they are seen entering and leaving.

analyzed: yāvat ca evam daśasu dikṣu vaktavyam
translated: And so it should be said for the ten directions.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā yāvadbhagavataḥ kāyāntargatāḥ sā bhagavataḥ kāyaromamukhebhyo niṣkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ triṣpradakṣiṇī kṛtvā bhagavato'bhimukhaṃ pratyavasthādbhagavantameva vicitrārthapadavyañjanarutavyāhāraiḥ stavamānāḥ /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā yāvat bhagavataḥ kāya antargatāḥ sā bhagavataḥ kāya roma mukhebhyaḥ niṣkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam triṣpradakṣiṇī kṛtvā bhagavataḥ abhimukham pratyavasthāt bhagavantam eva vicitra artha pada vyañjana ruta vyāhāraiḥ stavamānāḥ
translated: And the entire assembly, as far as it was contained within the body of the Blessed One, emerged from the pores of the Blessed One's body, bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and stood in front of the Blessed One, praising the Blessed One with various meanings, words, and sounds.

original: atha tāvaccaiva kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāśca devaputrā vicitrāṃ ca gandhamālyavilepanavṛṣṭiṃ pravarṣitā /
analyzed: atha tāvat ca eva kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ vicitrām ca gandha mālya vilepana vṛṣṭim pravarṣitā
translated: Then at that very moment, the gods of the desire realm and the form realm caused a rain of various fragrances, garlands, ointments, and powders to fall.

analyzed: divyāni ca tūryāṇi pravāditavantaḥ
translated: And they played divine musical instruments.

analyzed: divyāni ca chatra dhvaja patākā vastra duṣya ābharaṇāni bhagavataḥ pūjāya udyuktāḥ
translated: And they were dedicated to worshipping the Blessed One with divine parasols, banners, flags, clothing, incense, and ornaments.

original: tatra vaiśāradyasamuddhāraṇirnāma bodhisattvo yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat kiṃ nāmāyaṃ bhadanta bhagavan mahāvyākaraṇaṃ sūtrāntaḥ / /
analyzed: tatra vaiśāradyasamuddhāraṇiḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat kim nāma ayam bhadanta bhagavat mahā vyākaraṇam sūtrāntaḥ
translated: There, the bodhisattva named Vaiśāradyasamu­ddharaṇi bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, what is the name of this great prophecy sūtra?

analyzed: bhagavān āha sarvajña tā ākāra dhāraṇī mukha praveśaḥ nāma
translated: The Blessed One said, It is called 'The Entry into the Gate of the Dhāraṇī of the Form of Omniscience.'

analyzed: bahubuddhakam nāma
translated: It is called 'The Many Buddhas.'

analyzed: bahu sannipātam nāma
translated: It is called 'The Many Assemblies.'

analyzed: bodhisattva vyākaraṇam nāma  vaiśāradya mārga uttāraṇam nāma
translated: It is called 'The Prophecy of the Bodhisattvas.'🔽It is called 'The Rescue by the Path of Fearlessness.'

analyzed: samādhānakalpāvataraṇaḥ nāma
translated: It is called 'The Descent into the Kalpa of Concentration.'

analyzed: buddhakṣetrasandarśanaḥ nāma  sāgaropamaḥ nāma
translated: It is called 'The Display of the Buddha-field.'🔽It is called 'The Ocean-like.'

analyzed: gaṇanātikrāntaḥ nāma
translated: It is called 'Beyond Calculation.'

analyzed: karuṇāpūṇḍarīkaḥ nāma
translated: It is called 'The Lotus of Compassion.'

original: punarapyāha kiyantaṃ bhadanta bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar api āha kiyantam bhadanta bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: He said again, Blessed One, how much merit will a son or daughter of good family generate?

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyati udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati pareṣāṃ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati likhiṣyati likhāpayiṣyati antaśa ekagāthāmapi / /

translated: Whoever hears this Dharma discourse, takes it up, remembers it, recites it, explains it extensively to others, writes it, or even just a single verse,

analyzed: āha pūrvam ca mayā uktam iha puṇya skandham
translated: I have already spoken about the accumulation of merit here.

analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa idānīm kathayisyāmi
translated: I will now explain it concisely.

original: yaḥ kaścidimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyati udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati parebhyaśca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati antaśa ekagāthāmapi /

translated: Whoever hears this Dharma discourse, takes it up, remembers it, recites it, explains it extensively to others, or even just a single verse,

original: yaśca punaḥ paścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāmantaśo likhitvā dhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca punar paścimāyām pañcāśatyām antaśas likhitvā dhārayiṣyati
translated: and whoever, in the last five hundred years, writes it down and remembers it,

analyzed: sa bahutaram puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: will produce a much greater accumulation of merit.

original: na tvevaṃ ṣoḍaśamahākalpān ṣaṭpāramitācaramāṇasya bodhisattvasya puṇyaskandhaḥ /

translated: But it is not like that for a bodhisattva who practices the six perfections for sixteen great eons. The accumulation of merit is not like that.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhayapuranagarapraveśakaraṇārthaṃ mayā dharmaparyāyo bhāṣitaḥ /🔽kasya haste imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ parindāmi / /
analyzed: abhayapura nagara praveśa karaṇa artham mayā dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣitaḥ  kasya haste imam dharmaparyāyam parindāmi
translated: I have taught this Dharma discourse in order to cause the city of Abhayapura to be entered.🔽Into whose hands shall I entrust this Dharma discourse?

original: ko mamemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ paścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ rakṣiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ mama imam dharmaparyāyam paścimāyām pañcāśatyām rakṣiṣyati
translated: Who will protect this Dharma discourse of mine in the last five hundred years?

original: adharmabhūmiṣṭhānāṃ sattvānāṃ bhinnaśīlānāṃ ca bhikṣūṇāṃ karṇapuṭe prakāśayiṣyati /
analyzed: adharma bhūmiṣṭhānām sattvānām bhinnaśīlānām ca bhikṣūṇām karṇa puṭe prakāśayiṣyati
translated: It will be proclaimed in the ears of beings who are established in non-Dharma and of bhikṣus with broken morality.

analyzed: adharma rāga raktānām viṣama lobha abhibhūtānām mithyādharma paricitānām a paripakva cittām saṃvejayiṣyati
translated: It will inspire those whose minds are not ripe, who are filled with the passion of non-Dharma, who are overcome by the greed of inequality, and who are familiar with false Dharma.

original: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā bhagavataścetasā cittamājñāya /
analyzed: sarvāvatī ca sā parṣā bhagavataḥ cetasā cittam ājñāya
translated: And the entire assembly, understanding the mind of the Blessed One,

analyzed: tatra parṣadi merupuṇyaḥ nāma yakṣa riṣiḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: In that assembly, there was a yakṣa sage named Merupunya seated.

original: atha maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ merupuṇyaṃ yakṣariṣiṃ gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ sakāśamupanītavān /
analyzed: atha maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam meru puṇyam yakṣa riṣim gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ sakāśam upanītavān
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, taking that yakṣa sage Merupunya, brought him before the Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha udgṛhṇa tvaṃ maharṣa imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha udgṛhṇa tvam mahā ṛṣe imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: The Blessed One said, Great sage, you should uphold this Dharma discourse.

original: yāvatpaścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ deśāntaragatānāmavaivartikānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ karṇapuṭeṣu prakāśasva /
analyzed: yāvat paścimāyām pañcāśatyām deśa antara gatānām a vaivartikānām bodhisattvānām karṇa puṭeṣu prakāśasva
translated: And may it be proclaimed in the ears of the irreversible Bodhisattvas who have gone to other lands in the last fifty years.

original: adya cāvaivartikacittaṃ saṃjanayasvā hai vaṃ bhadanta bhagavaṃścaturaśītimahākalpā atikrāmantā yanmayā bhadanta bhagavan pūrvaṃ praṇidhānena yakṣariṣitvālabdhyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau bodhicārikāṃ caramāṇo gaṇanātikrāntāḥ sattvā mayā caturṣu brāhmavihāreṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: adya ca a vaivartika cittam saṃjanayasva hai vam bhadanta bhagavan caturaśīti mahā kalpāḥ yat mayā bhadanta bhagavan pūrvam praṇidhānena yakṣa riṣitvā a labdhyā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bodhi cārikām caramāṇaḥ gaṇanā atikrāntāḥ sattvāḥ mayā caturṣu brāhma vihāreṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And today, generate the irreversible mind, and so, venerable Blessed One, as eighty-four great kalpas pass, whatever, venerable Blessed One, I have previously vowed, having attained the state of a Yaksha Rishi, in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, practicing the conduct of enlightenment, I have established beings beyond count in the four Brahma abodes,

analyzed: a vaivartika bhūmau ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: and established them in the irreversible stage,

original: ahaṃ ca sattvānāṃ svayameva paripācayāmi yāvatpaścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ udgṛhīṣyati /
analyzed: aham ca sattvānām svayam eva paripācayāmi yāvat paścimāyām pañcāśatyām yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam udgṛhīṣyati
translated: and I myself will ripen beings until the last fifty years, whoever will uphold this Dharma discourse,

analyzed: yāvat yaḥ itas catuṣpadikām api gāthām dhārayiṣyati
translated: and will hold even a four-line verse from it.

original: idamavocadbhagavān āttamanāḥ sarvāvatī parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti //
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ sarvāvatī parṣad sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: This was spoken by the Blessed One. The entire assembly, the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: iti śrī karuṇāpuṇḍarīkam nāma mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Mahāyāna Sūtra called The White Lotus of Compassion.

analyzed: śubham astu
translated: May there be auspiciousness!

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetu teṣāṃ tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhavāḥ teṣām tathāgataḥ
translated: Those dharmas that arise from causes, the Tathāgata has declared the cause of those,

original: hevadatteṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādi mahāśramaṇaṃ //🔽śubhamastu sarvadāt //
analyzed: hevadatta iṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādi mahā śramaṇam  śubham astu sarva dāt
translated: And that which is the cessation of those, such is the teaching of the Great Ascetic.🔽May there be auspiciousness everywhere!

analyzed: śubham śubham śubham
translated: Auspicious! Auspicious! Auspicious!
